title: Location L‚Äôeclerc car hire carcassonne ABOID
text: Rented 4 cars from car hire in L‚Äôeclerc supermarket. Avoid - the cars are not well maintained and dirty. Then they try to blame each renter for damage that pre existed and fine you for not cleaning to their standards (which change each time). My car was returned cleaner than when I collected but after leaving the rental an ‚Äúextra‚Äù cleaning charge was taken. Pre existing damage that was hidden (internal) and not visible is then charged, despite photo evidence. They may be cheap but seem to have a policy of making up the rent charged by fines and charges for damage that are not evidenced. It‚Äôs a battle each time I‚Äôve rented - they are rude and do not listen, despite having a signed return report confirming no damage they are now trying to charge for ‚Äúdamage‚Äù post rental. Avoid them / the hassle is too much!

title: Disappointed
text:
It was a Poor experience. Please don‚Äôt create to much expectation, otherwise you will get disappointed. I think it‚Äôs to much expensive for the quality they present
.

title: Organization needs a lot of people at the same time inside
text:
Immaculate photographs very well accomplished. Congratulations to the artists.
Small space for so many people at the same time, a real disaster, should have entry quotas at the same time I could not appreciate the experience as I should.
I do not recommend visiting because it is not a large space. More control is needed on the number of simultaneous attendances.

title: Not satisfied
text: Poor tower. We had asked to do a tower of 1h yet towards the end he did a tower of 1h30 without us wanting it and asked us 135‚Ç¨ instead of 90‚Ç¨. This is not a serious service and I do not advise everyone, it is a tourist catch.

title: Terrible experience
text:
We took a ride from this tuk tuk operator from about half km from Lisbon City side of Belem Castle to Chiado about a 15 min trip. 3 people in our party on Sun 23rd at 5pm.
It wasn't a sightseeing tour just a taxi style trip snd we were told this was no problem. We asked the price before getting in and were told 15 euro. We specifically asked the guy who was coordinator of the tuk tuks at the stand was this for the trip or per head. We were told in no uncertain terms it was just 15 e for the trip. When we reached our accomodation the driver was paid 15 e whereupon he said " no it was15 e per person" we argued politely this was not the case and there had been no language barrier when negotiations were done prior to getting in. He was persistent and we ended up parting with 40.00 euro in total 5 e less than he wanted. I looked up advice re this form of transport after the incident and read that a tuk tuk should never cost more than a taxi ride. (We had got a taxi from airport a days earlier for 20 euro for a 20 min ride for 3. So this is the case) so it left us with a bad feeling and totallly disgusted at being taken in like this.
Lisbon is a beautiful welcoming city and the people are lovely. But this company shouldn't be in buisness if thus is how they operate by scamming visitors. I see they have 5 * reviews here but this was NOT our experience. Guys out to make a quick buck. Shameful. It was NOT our mistake , just taken advantage of.

title: An unhappy experience
text: The escorted sightseeing portion of the tour is fine. The Fado Dinner is not escorted and not suitable for anyone who is uncomfortable eating alone, or does not like loud and sometimes discordant music, or has dietary restrictions. You will not get your money‚Äôs worth and it will be a wasted evening.

title: Cancel and do not refund
text: I bought the credit card tour to Sintra. It was cancelled because they didn't add up to enough people. They never refunded my money.

title: No info, anti tourist attitude, despite being a ""museum""
text:
No information about how to access,, we tried to enter and were told we have to book an appointment, but not shown how to book,, everything in Portuguese and staff was not helpful at all. There is no one inside and we still cannot gain access. Absolutely ridiculous.
Anti tourist establishment, despite being a museum. Dumbfounded.

title: Good music, bad food and very expensive.
text: The live music was very good, however, the food was very expensive and of very poor quality in terms of its preparation. The green broth was the only saving grace, the salad, bland and soulless, the cod, dry. In short, I would not repeat.

title: we will not return
text:
Fado very good, but the food and service bad.
Very expensive for what it offers.
The product is very normal and not well prepared at all.
They offer a vegetarian menu (which would be nice if it were vegan) which also leaves something to be desired for the price.
Only the fado is good, as a restaurant, terrible.

title: Not recommended
text: Not very warm welcome. The Fado performance was too short. The menu is limited and should be translated into French. The dishes are expensive and 3 curls of ice cream thrown into a bowl for ‚Ç¨15 is excessive. The cod was as tasteless as the cake. Apart from the beautiful tablecloths and the (few) songs, this establishment is not worth the detour.

title: Terrible
text:
Reservation for 9.45 am. Menu delivered at 10.30 am. Customers gave up.
Lisbon has better, Casa Machado does not recommend it (even with a reservation)

title: Waiting on the plane without notice
text: Departure was over 3 hours late, arrival after 2 hours and 50 minutes, so no claim for compensation was possible. Because of the delay, we missed the train connection and had to stay in an expensive hotel, but that doesn't matter to Ryanair.

title: Paco, el estafador asturiano.
text: Paco el estafador sigue haciendo de las suyas, a nosotros nos encontr√≥ hablando espa√±ol en la c√°mara de comercio, junto a la playita, en Lisboa... no sab√≠amos nada y despu√©s de m√°s de una hora y para quitarnos de encima le dimos 50 ‚Ç¨.

title: Great disappointment
text: Unfortunately, we missed the fact that the Mega Parkour is only from 12. The Pequena Floresta is just disappointing. Even for our 8-year-old daughter no challenge. In addition, this short round may only be completed twice. We were through twice after 20 minutes. For children who are under 12 and have climbed before are definitely not a good choice. Better go somewhere else.

title: Experience did not deliver as advertised!!!
text: This tour started off well. Naky was communicative, on time, and he had microphones for everyone. There was a large group of beautiful black people eager for knowledge. But unfortunately, the tour didn‚Äôt deliver what was promised. In the first 2 hours, we moved 2 blocks. We stood for 20 minutes in the first stop as he explained the symbols on the bank. We stood in the 2nd place for 30 minutes where he read the declaration of the Catholic Church. We walked across the street to the black owned bar and there he held up pictures of modern day black people who were somehow connected to Portugal. He gave very little factual information and it was mostly his ideological opinions. And it was pricey. The tour was 40euros each, the African dinner another 40, which is extremely overpriced in Portugal and then there was an expectation of everyone ordering from the bar. Overall, it felt more like a scam of black Americans who are eager for knowledge about the African diaspora.

title: nul
text: non mais c est du foutage de gueule une queue pas possible dehors puis la queue √† l int√©rieur pour voir quoi 2 pi√®ces de 20m2 franchement ne perdez pas votre temps vu ext√©rieure c est suffisant

title: Not worth the money or time.
text: We pre-booked a ticket for the tower but still had to queue. We walked up to three different levels and each time had to stand around and wait for ages for people to come down the stairs in an empty room to then move up again. No boards with history/information to keep you interested. On the first level there was a balcony although there were so many people it was horrible. There was no access to the roof so when we got to the third level (empty room) we just had to wait to then go back down again. Possibly the worst attraction we have visited. Just appreciate it from the outside!!

title: A total waste of time
text: There is nothing beautiful to be seen inside apart from the terrace at the first floor. Then you will wait 15 to go up each floor and visit empty rooms. Then 15 more mins to go down. Definitely not worth the price of the ticket (6‚Ç¨ in feb 2023)

title: Ah Am√°lia experience
text: The price list information is incomplete. It has a discount for family of 3, but doesn‚Äôt specify that one of the person has to have under 17 years old. The staff was very unpleasant. The exhibition was cool but very expensive.

title: As this in the title I was approached in the telegram to come just see this page
text: They use bots to have visibility approached in Telegram to come see this page, in exchange pay 10 euros a shame until asks to be good the site but if it is someone from here using "bots" I do not recommend

title: Policia waiting for you
text: We are in Lisbon by car since we have been visiting the country for more than a week. Our welcome to Lisbon was a police man waiting for us at the begging of a road where only public transport can go, but GPS usually doesn‚Äôt say it. We did 10 mt on the taxi lane and he was waiting for transgressors to give a ticket of 60 Euros with no allowances. It took one hour and a half! Rules are rules, but street signals were poor and police stays there to make money. If they were there to direct the traffic properly, they would have stopped 10 mt before inviting foreign cars to take the right way. Such a poor and disappointing welcome for tourists.

title: Save your time and energy to visit more interesting places in the city
text:
We liked this area of the city the least. Dirty, hot, up and down hills, steps, stuffy, unsafe and really nothing to see. It‚Äôs difficult to get there by public transport, we took an Uber, the driver dropped us off somewhere below and said - I can‚Äôt go any further, and we have to walk 10 minutes uphill. Plus, the owner of one of the cafes practically refused us a cup of coffee, saying that we had to order food in order to receive a cup of coffee as a reward at the end.

The only nice place was Miradouro de Sao Jorge, but do you really need to torture yourself just because of a visit this viewpoint, there are other observation platforms in the city. My husband and I often travel to European cities and have seen many "old towns", but Alfama is the most terrible and dirty area of all the "old towns" and inconvenient in every way for tourists. Our only desire was to get out of there as quickly as possible

title: No Wow Factor, Dirty and Nothing Special
text:
Hmm - definitely not what we expected; a maze of cobbled, slippery streets, the same boring shops and the odd decent hostelry.

Santa Luzia Viewpoint is a tourist trap nightmare - rammed with tuk-tuks and cabs.

Really would give it all a miss; there are better cities.

title: Alfama Lisbon district
text:
Bewilderment! That's saying little, we've never seen such a dirty neighborhood, you lazarones
Clean, how do you pretend nothing happened, there really is everything between these streets even in more places human excrement
What a bunch of uncivilized

title: No thanks!
text: Alfama is a district in Lisbon with alleyways and cobbled streets and lots of steps and hills and it was like a maze, once your in it it‚Äôs hard to find your way back out and although I‚Äôm sure it would be beautiful during the day and there were aspects that were beautiful like the panoramic views at dusk but we went out later and it was more scary and intimidating than anything else and we couldn‚Äôt find a taxi so felt stranded and far from our hotel and the locals were not very helpful or friendly so we didn‚Äôt have the best experience to be honest. I would choose to spend more time in barrio alto than Alfama but that‚Äôs just me!

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time in Lisbon
text: Surprisingly boring‚Ä¶ attractions not worth the extremely hilly walk‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs run down but not in a cute quaint way. Other then looking at a few buildings it is defo not worth coming too. Food is same old same old‚Ä¶ nothing super tasty. Once you have see the view that‚Äôs it. Google it‚Ä¶ what you see is all there is too see üò≠. We stayed in the Evolution hotel near Cascais‚Ä¶ much better spot, hotel was amazing. It was warmer than expected which was great. The local beach was lovely. Portugal is great for a couple weekend away but there are so many better places in the world. We were sadly underwhelmed. If you love graffiti back ya bags, you‚Äôll love it ü´£ oh and people are super lovely and it feels very safe here.

title: did not impress
text: The area is famous for the fact that it is the only one that survived the earthquake in Lisbon, but there is nothing special to see there (except to walk through it to the Castle of St. George), we liked walking in the center of Lisbon much more...

title: Dirty
text: Very dirty, they offer you drugs everywhere, people smoking joint next to you at the Santa Lucia viewpoint to take a photo. I don't know how it can have such good comments...

title: Agradable pero muy ruidoso.
text: Agradable y extremadamente ruidoso. Nos quedamos en un apartamento Airbnb con mi esposo y todos los d√≠as sin excepci√≥n hab√≠a fiesta hasta m√°s all√° de la 1am. Si te gusta el ruido y la fiesta todo el tiempo lo recomiendo si quieres descansar no lo recomiendo. Por otro lado es pintoresco y antiguo, algunas zonas deterioradas y sucias otras en mejor estado.

title: Alfama, not all that.
text: Most of the buildings are run down and in need of repair, signage and maps are few and far between, the streets are cobbled which is quaint, but the streets are dirty. It's great to have historic areas where people live, but if you want tourists to spend money there, they need to be attractive. Lisbon is run down, and it's a real shame. Lots of steep climbs.

title: Dirty area
text: This looks like an awesome district but the area is filthy. Although last nite was Saturday party nite we cruise through the area after noon and I was personally disgusted with the filth. I took a few pick but it was way worse. Broke bottles, cig butts and lots of trash. Maybe after Sunday they clean up. Shame on the litterbugs too!

title: Overrated
text: Old and kinda interesting, but this part of town is way overrated. There are nicer places to see in Lisbon.

title: d√©√ßu
text:
tr√®s de√ßu du quartier alfama qui je trouve √† perdu de son charme.
beaucoup de sdf, d'attrapes touristes

title: Beware in hot weather!!!!
text: It was hot outside, 37 degrees C. The Airconditioning barely worked and everyone inside the train suffered. The staff didnt give a sh. They were hanging out in the only cooled room, the Snack Shop within the train. No cold drinks for free to lower the suffering. Eveyone had to buy water. We bought and drank 5 bottles during the 4 hours between Porto and Lisbon. Especially older people had a very hard time. To make it even worse, we arrived one hour late... only travel with this train, if the temperatures are below 30 C, its dangerous.

title: Train pictures are fake. Use Daytrip private transfer
text:
Train was scarily dirty for a Business Class ticket I don't even know where to start. I thought since I bought business Class, the section will be cleaned and nice like on the pictures. The pictures are no where the real thing. Upon arrival at Lisbon Train station, you'll be a bit lost as you've no idea where's the train, upstairs or downstairs with no clear sign. The place looks dirty and old. The lift which looks like WWII is broken so you've to use the escalator. When we board the train which has the similar boarding time on our tickets, I'm shocked at the condition of the train from the outside. It was so scruffy with windows that have collected dust and stains for years. Completely different from the pictures that are advertised.

When we reach the First Class section, the seats my god, you can see the stains clearly on the cushion, like someone has took a dump before. I wish I'd some cloth or linen to put on top before seating down. It was the most uncomfortable 3hr ride from Lisbon to Algarve. Upon reaching Tunes, the lift took a long time and is structure such a way you've to take 2 times to reach the other side if you've heavy luggage.

I booked my tickets from Tunes to Porto and canceled it the moment I reach hotel in Algarve. I booked a DAYTRIP private transfer, it takes about the same amount of time (shorter) and way way more comfortable and clean. Door to door.

title: Disappointing Experience
text:
Not at all as expected compared to other high speed rail.
We had 1st class round trip tickets from Lisbon to Porto.
In both directions the toilets were broken. The doors were jammed and did not lock as well, and the toilets were backed up and didn‚Äôt flush. The seats were ok but not as spacious as some described.
When we traveled on the Italian Frecciarossa we showed our ticket to the agent near the train and he said, ‚ÄúYou are here in first class‚Äù. He then took our bags and brought them into the train. There were no workers on the train except for a ticket agent and a beverage cart.
It seems that the train rarely get serviced.

The ride is not and smooth and quiet as the Frecciarossa and the Ice train.

Pros: It was on time and didn‚Äôt get lost. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Depeche mode night
text: We are in Lisbon to attend the Depeche Mode concert which is our second concert of the European tour, with the first in May last year at the Ziggo dome in Amsterdam. The band were brilliant on both occasions but the Lisbon arena is a very poor venue. We had golden circle tickets same as Amsterdam but a totally different experience, too many fans packed in the space and the bar area totally disorganised only the one bar with two serving areas , they only sold 1/2 pint beers and small glasses of wine , in the uk arenas and in Amsterdam the bar areas are multiple and well organised? To be honest the acoustics in Lisbon were good but the overall fan experience very poor, we will definitely revisit the Ziggo dome in Amsterdam but never this arena in Lisbon

title: Pausini in Concert -
text:
Our first time visiting this arena to see Laura Pausini. We had the balcony area tickets. The seating was a challenge, it was very tight and hard seat. If you have problems sitting for a long time, you will definitely not like this. For being a modern arena, we thought the seating would be comfortable, and for the price$$.
So beware of the seats, if you have knee and back problems, it will definitely not be a pleasant event for you.

title: Room too big for this show... only with binoculars
text: I went to see Ovo by Cirque do Soleil with my family. The 1 star is not for the show, which I practically didn't see, but rather for the blind greed of the organization. My tickets (‚Ç¨55 each) didn't allow me to see the artists bigger than ants (the fact that it was an insect show isn't a joke). It is a show with choreography, fine movements and facial expressions, which requires close proximity to be seen and appreciated. My children weren't interested. Our tickets were about 80-90m from the stage... the photo was taken from my seat üòï To see it with binoculars, it's better (and cheaper) to watch it on television.

title: Madonna.
text: We saw Madonna. 250eu a ticket. Left half way thru, terrible acoustics. Hardly heard her voice due to over load bass which echo'd around stadium, waste of money.

title: To avoid
text: No interest, sad and empty mall even on a Friday evening. The shops are the same as in France, the products seem to be of lower quality. Prices are more expensive than in France

title: Terrible
text: Beautiful new store! But there is no men's session! That's terrible! Do you think there is an audience??? Where is the inclusion????? Please think more

title: 1980's architecture
text: The huge building looks like a remnant of popular US television series from the 1980's. Impressive in style it is though outdated with a labyrinthic and dark interior. A large Aschan supermarket seemed to be the main attraction.

title: Don't go
text:
The Thai massage itself was well executed, but the overall experience was extremely disappointing due to the environment and serious concerns about professionalism.

The place is far from welcoming: there‚Äôs a strong, persistent smell of mold, with visible spots on the ceiling. It‚Äôs supposed to be a relaxing setting, but instead you‚Äôre in a closed, poorly ventilated space that feels uncomfortable and even unsafe.

Privacy is also lacking: the massages are done in open "boxes" inside a huge, dark garage, with background music playing like in a supermarket. The atmosphere is cold, impersonal, and very far from what you expect in a proper wellness center.

Most importantly ‚Äî and this is a serious issue ‚Äî the therapist touched my chest without informing me or asking for consent. Regardless of cultural norms, this kind of gesture should never happen without explicit permission, especially in a European context. It could be extremely upsetting for many people.

What‚Äôs even more concerning is that I noticed several previous reviews mentioning the same issues, particularly about the mold and poor conditions ‚Äî which means the management has been aware for a long time and hasn‚Äôt taken action.

In short: while the massage technique itself was okay, the overall conditions are unacceptable. I would strongly advise against going unless these serious problems are addressed.

title: Permanentemente FECHADO
text: This place has been closed for over two years. It‚Äôs a shame as it was the first shopping center in Lisboa. All stores have moved or CLOSED.

title: Luckily included in the Lisboa Card
text: Yet another panoramic point in Lisbon. It's a shame that you have to pay ‚Ç¨4.50 to access it. It's just not worth it. Without paying you can admire Lisbon from other panoramic points.

title: Lisboa card advantages/disadvantages
text: Usually a City cards worth their values because you can combine transports with museums free entrance.Lisboa card is different,transports are covered that's fine however not the main museums or castle(sao Jorge) are covered by Lisboa card.So Lisboa card is good just for the transport?it depends,I mean if you stay 4 days Lisboa card is ‚Ç¨48,daily ticket transport is ‚Ç¨6,80 so for 4 days total ‚Ç¨28 ish. Disappointed also about poor discounts Lisboa card offers for some monuments,i.e. Museo do Carmo ticket price is ‚Ç¨5,90 with Lisboa card is ‚Ç¨5... ridiculous!Museo Fado almost the same.So I recommend to manage your trip find two or three mains things to visit paying and buy a daily ticket transport.Furthermore I would suggest Lisboa tourism organisation to improve the Lisboa card, because comparing with others European City card, isn't worth at all and is a pity because the city is beautiful, stunning and would deserve to be visited without thinking about the prices.

title: Veja primeiro se acha que vale a pena ir!
text:
A exposi√ß√£o Sintra Mitos e Lendas na sua origem contava com imagens 3D e aparelhos do tipo telem√≥vel ligadas a auriculares para se ouvirem os v√°rios temas. Veio o COVID 19 e acabou-se o 3D e agora tem que encostar aparelho (tm) ao ouvido e andar sempre assim - passados 10 minutos j√° n√£o aguenta a posi√ß√£o. O pre√ßo esse ficou na mesma. A exposi√ß√£o, que num domingo √† tarde estava completamente vazia, n√£o merece a visita. √â constitu√≠da por 4 andares, e cada andar tem alguns quadros virtuais cujo texto explicativos se pode ouvir no aparelho. A qualidade daquilo que est√° exposto √© m√° e os aparelhos tamb√©m n√£o funcionam bem!
N√£o fa√ßa como n√≥s; Antes de ir ver a exposi√ß√£o, tente informar-se sobre o que √© realmente a exposi√ß√£o tem para ver e decida se mesmo assim tem interesse. N√≥s n√£o aconselhamos!

title: I do not recommend! We were left without the tour.
text: They didn't show up. We waited at the hotel for 1 hour and there was no contact. I tried calling and sending messages through the app and no one answered. Much later they informed that they were going to return the money and that ARC had problems with their car. Being left without information is the worst, without the tour it's horrible, I just hope they refund the amount. I do not recommend!

title: Centre in the centre
text:
It 'a shopping center in the center of Lisbon decidedly small and scarce
Few shops and not as quaint as you would expect from a shopping center located in the city center. Even the food court is international of little standard; here, however, some interesting proposals can be found.

title: It only gets worse year by year.
text:
Very bad, in the middle of the rain they turn off the sockets in the power supply area. The toilets are always full. It appears there is only one at the restaurant location and one at Starbucks.
Rude security guards and terrible center staff. He never has the patience to give information.
A place that I used a lot for work due to its location but I will have to change.
Increasingly a place for English to see.
I don't know what this administration thinks, but it certainly doesn't think about the Portuguese.

title: Expensive and disorganized
text: We had a friendly driver. The tour booking and execution seemed a bit disorganized, we tried communicating with the tour group prior to the departure day and asked a few times if they could please communicate with us via text message but ended up having to search for their number when the pickup was late. We also had a change in itinerary for something that happened last week resulting in the closure of one of the stops. We would have liked to be told so we could have potentially cancelled or been ready. Also, my friend mentioned the trip felt as if we paid for a very expensive Uber. We did like the ability to spend more time in CasCais. Overall not worth $95/per person.

title: Poor route guidance to the castles stuff.
text:
What poor signage to get there. Eventually too late so asked for money back answer was no.
So I say flare that shit and never get there again.

title: I guess you get what you pay for
text: Driver/guide arrived 1 hour later than the time scheduled at booking. The excuse was that it was raining but the rain was predicted so he should have accounted for the extra traffic, that he says happens when raining, and left earlier ! Guide had to be regularly asked to speak up as he couldn‚Äôt be heard in the back of the van. He regularly asked how long people wanted to stay somewhere but ignored our answers. He claimed to be following the rain schedule yet turned a 10 minute bathroom break into a 45 minute lecture ( when it wasn‚Äôt raining) in a less important location only to arrive at an important monument during the most torrential downpour. Because of his late start and the 45 minute bathroom break we arrived in Evora after 1:30 just leaving enough time for lunch and no free time ( also stores were all closed for afternoon break ). We proceeded on with the rest of the sites and when leaving for Lisbon I asked What time we would arrive at our hotel and if he could possibly drop us off first, he shrugged and said 6 PM in Lisbon but then stopped unexpectedly at another spot for ‚Äú 5 minutes‚Äù which apparently means 20 minutes. . We had commitments later and felt the least he could do would be to try to estimate the late arrival time. I will give him credit for his knowledge of the sites and no credit for his attitude, that‚Äôs why the tour gets 1 star instead of 0 stars.

title: Disappointment in Lisbon with cancellation of booked Tour to Sintra
text: Booked tour - Full day tour :Sintra, Pena Palace, Cabo da Roca, Cascais - approximately one month ago. Arrived in Lisbon late Sunday evening and received email early Monday morning advising that tour to Sintra, booked for 8.30am start on Tuesday morning, was cancelled. No reason for cancellation given and any options were not satisfactory as Tuesday was only day we could do tour. Very disappointing performance by the Tour Operator that books through TripAdvisor. A rating of 1 out of 5 was too high but system prohibits me scoring any lower.

title: Great places- not so good service
text:
The placea to visit were great, but the tour we took was a disaster!! They offered to pick up at our hotel, but then sent a message to pick us up in a location about 7 min away, that wasn‚Äôt that bad, but the guide arrived late, dressed not really professional, with a van that looked that it has seen better days, and with an apprentice that ate for the first part of the tour!!! Our guide tried real hard to be funny, and his accent was sometimes difficult to understand. But the funniest and worst part was when we got stranded in Cabo da Roca because the battery in our van died!! Our guide wasn‚Äôt sure of what to do, he did not have cables, and it took about an hour for some other people to help him to push the van and for us to get out of there.

That cut our trip short, as we just had 30 min in Cascais, since some people in our tour already had reservations for early dinner. We tried to make the most out of it and to take it on the light side, but we were disappointed for not spending more time in Cascais.
Overall the places are beautiful, but the experience with the tour operator was terrible, I believe the company is Around Lisbon. So if you are going to this tour, please find another tour operator.

title: Avoid!
text: We had Diogo as our tour guide. He tried very hard to give a thorough tour with historical info- but he talked too much and was really quite vague and hard to understand in English. Additionally, the first van from this company had mechanical issues. The second (replacement van) was older than the first- and had virtually NO a/c. I would NOT recommend this tour company

title: If you have lack of time to tour Lisbon- you can miss this. Do the Sintra and other tours.
text:
It was raining and to hit 4 towns on this tour is too rushed. Places like Batalha and Obidos that I wish would have longer time wasn‚Äôt possible. I didn‚Äôt really enjoy because it‚Äôs too rushed. 10-15 mins at Batalha and only 30 mins at Obidos.
Fatima was average and this was given more time.
Nazare had good beach restaurant food.

title: Cancellation unacceptable
text: Our trip was canceled one and a half hours before departure because the tour guide got sick. Cancellation is unacceptable as there should be back up tour guides. We could not find an alternative trip and wasted one day.

title: Disappointed
text:
Our tour guide was very knowledgeable in locations we were touring, but unfortunately due to the acoustics in the van my family was unable to hear him. We sat in the last row and had a difficult time. The vans should be updated and the driver should be equipped with a microphone so all guests can enjoy the experience.
In addition when we stopped in Sintra our tour leader didn‚Äôt offer many suggestions for our two hour stop. He only provided a restaurant which happened to have been very expensive.

title: The owner kicked us out
text: It was one of my favorite bars until yesterday, but I had the misfortune of meeting the owner. We were kicked out of the bar and shortly after that we saw another customer being attacked by security guards.

title: TERRIBLE experience
text: A TERRIBLE experience. Extremely unpleasant staff, starting with the girl who serves at the bar. The girl in question, in addition to being extremely rude and having an aggressive speech with customers, has no manners at all, and makes a point of seeking trouble. I don't know what a girl like that does in a customer service sector. The same security guard, a complete brute, and extremely violent. Unfortunately we were forced to report the situation to the police. If you are willing to be brutally attacked, for free and without reason, I recommend it, otherwise, there are MUCH BETTER options (price/ambience) very close by.

title: They do me no favor...
text:
Good afternoon.

I didn't like the service at the Tabak store. The employee (Portuguese), new girl (wore piercing ...) seemed to be doing me a great favor. There was an absolutely normal behavior on my part, as a customer, to ask for Euromillions. By the way, I didn‚Äôt even start any kind of conversation with her, and I wasn‚Äôt even interested.
I did not like the attitude, gives the Impression that customers are not welcome and this is exactly the opposite of what should be.
I got upset and I won't come back. You just lost (at least ...) a customer!!

I have said
A good afternoon
LC

title: Zero seriousness
text:
I took some time to value this business because I was so angry. And why? Because I was last year and they told me to make the hat that I wanted to tailor, what is my surprise when this year I go (ex-profess) and they tell me that summer hats are not made by them and that they will not make me and well I order two winter and I get one perfect and another clearly of one or two sizes more, claim and tell me that they do not have felt of (precisely) that color (what a chance) and that they can make me another of another color.
In the end I gave up because I don't think it's serious and I got paid back.
But the money I spend on going, the hotel and the inconvenience those who pay me?.
Draw conclusions, I will not return, zero seriousness

title: Horrible.
text:
Horrible, you don't realize anything, artistic scenes just because you do.

Absurdly poorly sized, I only saw heads and backs, it looked like the Metro at 6:00.

title: Medium
text:
Disappointed with the performance of the actors as well as the entire framework (or lack of it) on the part of the organization. Although it is a different experience with well-decorated space - the price is exorbitant!
Super confused, at the entrance could introduce a little the scenarios, where certain scenes will take place, etc...
Not to mention that the actors choose spectators for an ‚Äúexclusive‚Äù scene. The staff pays between 40 and 60 euros and only a few at the alleys have the right to watch part of the story.
Rooms and hallways full of spectators that prevented the normal movement of actors or that all people watch the selected scenes.

title: Overvalued
text:
Clearly overvalued. Overcrowded rooms, actors running from room to room and dozens of people in shallow hallways to meet each other to try to accompany or find the minimum conductor thread. Depending on the character you accompany, who has a "loop" of acting smaller or larger, can or can not perceive the least of what is going on.
After the initial confusion and stumbling out of the rooms and walking lost, I followed (which only in the end knew) the shaman. A confused and unconnected loop, which reveals nothing about the main story, finished the loop of this character, the play ends and I am referred to the final performance room, without knowing who those characters are, how and why they got there.
End.
I still bought the booklet to try some additional clarification.
Anyway, an immense frustration and a wasted night.
For those who can identify and accompany one of the main characters, it may be a different experience, is very devoted to chance.
The only positive point is the reconversion of the military hospital and the decorations.
A wasted night.

title: Bad and confused!
text: It's not worth the price. I found myself too confused and lost. Out of smoke and smell. I couldn‚Äôt identify the characters, even when the people and names were at the entrance, they could have paid that attention and explained or given in the pamphlet the faces and names, I couldn‚Äôt understand the story, and I just felt lost with so many people pushing and running after characters. The actors were a little aggressive because if necessary they would go against people and walk too fast. We didn‚Äôt all fit in the same room, which didn‚Äôt even allow everyone to watch the play. Besides me there was a lot of lost people that ended up messing up everything. I have attended several experiences of this kind and this one was undoubtedly the worst. I don't recommend it to older people because you have to run away from people. Small and tight spaces is quite dark with a lot of smoke. Not recommended for people with claustrophobia.

title: Not advisable to claustrophobics
text: Not recommended for those suffering from claustrophobia due to the narrow and poorly illuminated corridors. I stayed 2 hours standing by a wall of the entrance. I was sorry because it should be quite interesting

title: I do not recommend
text: I did not notice anything. There is not a word throughout the experience or at the end to clarify what happened. I don't understand the positive reviews, I don't understand the price. Basically I can't understand what just happened, I just know that I definitely don't recommend it.

title: A night of abuse!
text:
Unless you enjoy being pushed around, knocked over by rude patrons and actors save your money.
Afterwards when leaving I saw one of the patrons who was most aggressively shoving people and an actor who forcible pushed people out of a room leaving together.
We paid for VIP access which basically gets you an opportunity to wait inside instead of outside. You get a head start before the masses come stampeding in and something to drink. Your choice of drinks are water, coffee, and Heineken.

title: To avoid
text: There is no possible description for such a lack of respect for customers. There are many places in Lisbon to dance. Don't go to this one.

title: Poor service and non-existent reservation information
text: Terrible! Me, my husband and a couple friends, were blocked from entering, because we didn't have a reservation, by a doorman who barely opened the door and when nowhere is there information that it is necessary to make a reservation, through Google there is even the information that they do not accept reservations (as shown in the attached photo). I do not recommend!

title: To forget
text:
Have you forgotten that companies live for their customers?? And that these only return if they are well treated?
What a lack of sympathy.

title: Night space to report
text:
Bad site. Attitude of rude and arrogant doormen.
It is unacceptable to have an open space in Lisbon these days with this characteristic. I doubt the legality of this attitude. I think he should be reported.

title: Beautiful space, only the DJ ruins the house!!!
text:
We visited the space for the first time on the recommendation of some friends, and we loved everything, except the DJ, who doesn't seem to know what he's doing, it ruins the energy of the music.

We intend to come back but let's confirm first which DJ is the one on Friday, February 3rd, no thanks

title: Lisbon at its worst
text: Terrible. Discrimination. They use the reservation excuse to leave customers at the door. We were two couples in their 40s. Apparently they only enter after 50 and 60. It's for geriatrics.

title: Discrimination
text:
On December 9, 2023, I went to that night space with 4 other friends (Discoteca Primorosa de Alvalade located on Avenida Estados Unidos da Am√©rica, number 128 in Lisbon) in order to have fun and we were informed by the doorman, a very rude, that we could only enter with an advance reservation.
It turns out that nothing was mentioned at the entrance, and that the telephone number to make the reservation was disconnected.
People arrived and we asked outside that space if they had a reservation and they said no.
Because of this, I and the 4 people who accompanied me felt discriminated against. Because we were all dressed decently, with appropriate behavior.
I emphasize that we were not the only ones to be rejected by that space.
So I felt discriminated against.
I hope that this complaint of mine has at least one warning in that space I mentioned.

title: Worst space in Lisbon
text: The space is horrible and the service is second to none. The doorman is extremely rude and violent. I don't recommend it to anyone.

title: Lisbon's pseudo-exclusive kitch.
text: The immature and somewhat laughable objective of managing this space in Lisbon is to create a kind of false exclusivity to make it appear that it is a special, innovative or even beautiful place. In fact, the space itself has its charm precisely because it is a kind of "kitch capsule" of time, with music and clientele decor that was accidentally frozen in 1985 and thawed in 2023. Ladies who are half grandmothers and have their hair burnt because they are painted many times and gentlemen in blazers with whiskey veins on their noses. Completely absurd prices, popular fair music. I recommend visiting, for the fun and then not coming back.

title: I do not recommend
text:
Discriminatory entry.
And he stated that he only entered with reservation when this information was not evident anywhere

title: Rude
text: I've been to this place twice and the response was always the same. Reservation is required. Unbelievable. In 40 years it has never happened to me. It's an unbelievable lack of respect.

title: A lot of lack of common sense and vision.
text: I can't evaluate why they didn't let me enter a space where I've always entered since POP, passing the real "Primorosa de Alvalade" where there was always a bottle and ending up in Sarabanda. It's incredible how classy spaces deteriorate and become vulgar spaces with idiotic restrictions, especially for couples who just want to remember good times spent together.

title: Musica pessima por dj's que nao sabem o que fazem, por isso esta quase vazio!!!
text: espa√ßo muito bonito mas com os piores djs que j√° ouvi, tocam sem sentido estragam as musicas dos anos dourados. Nas ultimas 3 visitas que fiz ao espa√ßo com amigos desistimos de voltar, perdeu a magia que se vivia neste espa√ßo com o dj anterior e nota-se que antes era casa cheia e agora quase vazia. Uma pena!

title: Perigoso e violento
text:
Perigoso , caso de policia que foi chamada ao local , pediram-nos 200,00 por pessoa , aceitamos pagar , surpresos e muito pouco evolu√≠dos , n√£o nos trouxeram o MB, fecharam a Porta violentamente . Come√ßamos a filmar pois sentimos a nossa integridade f√≠sica em risco , o porteiro altamente violento arrancou o telem√≥vel da m√£o por 3 vezes e empurrou-nos , a policia teve que o ir buscar. ao interior. o caso sera conduzido segundo recomenda√ß√£o policial . Percebemos que a pol√≠cia tem sido recorrentemente chamada a esta casa.que Ja deu o que tinha a dar . Depois de uma semana de muito trabalho , jantamos no restaurante de um amigo no Chiado e a caminho de casa apeteceu-nos ir dan√ßar , infeliz ideia ter escolhido esta casa vizinha onde ja vou a tanto tempo . Sempre gostei imenso do staff todos uma simpatia e de uma educa√ß√£o extrema . Tchin tchin

title: Primorosa de Elite
text:
Infelizmente a faixa et√°ria permitida √© acima dos 50 anos. Fomos um grupo de amigos em festa de anivers√°rio. Est√°vamos bem vestidos, maquilhadas e um grupo de pessoas bonitas nos seus 30‚Äôs. √Ä entrada cheguei (40‚Äôs) com uma amiga e grupo vinha atr√°s. O porteiro perguntou se vinha com o grupo e respondi afirmativamente. ‚ÄúT√™m reserva?‚Äù ‚ÄúS√≥ com reserva.‚Äù
Fic√°mos um pouco para decidir onde ir de seguida e podemos confirmar o ‚Äútipo‚Äù de pessoas √†s quais nem perguntavam se tinham reserva. Parece-me mais um clube de elite do que um bar aberto ao p√∫blico.

title: Discrimina√ß√£o! P√©ssimo!
text: Lament√°vel a atitude dos porteiros, tratamento rude e discriminat√≥ria. √âramos 3 amigas com inten√ß√£o de ir beber um copo e conhecer o espa√ßo, informaram que n√£o t√≠nhamos reserva e por esse motivo n√£o poder√≠amos entrar. O grupo de seguida entrou sem qualquer reserva.

title: P√âSSIMA! M√Å EDUCA√á√ÉO! DISCRIMINAT√ìRIOS! RUDE E ARROGANTES!
text:
J√° sou cliente da Primorosa faz algum tempo, o espa√ßo era dos mais recomendava em Lisboa, pelo ambiente e tratamento ao cliente!

Hoje venho aqui dizer e denunciar a forma mal educada e rude que eu e os meus amigos fomos tratados pelos porteiros deste s√≠tio, impedindo de nos entrar dizendo que era preciso reserva, expliquei que era o meu anivers√°rio, mostrei o meu cart√£o de cidad√£o e tudo, mesmo assim barraram-nos a entrada! V√°rias pessoas entraram depois de n√≥s e fic√°mos a saber que o problema seria a nossa faixa et√°ria, espante-se que todo o meu grupo t√≠nhamos acima de 30, alguns 40!
