Eles trocaram ussos flakes of glass by flakes of plastic, or that seemed desnecess√°rio e piorou in experience. Or behavior rude do manager na maior parte do tempo tamb√©m n√£o ajudou, especially considering or time of date √†s 4 da manh√£. Definitely, n√£o √© um place where we would fly or recommend outros.

title: Sticky floors and toilets disgusting
text: Awful place. No decent beer. Sticky floors and toilets disgusting. The gents toilet was the worse that I've seen since the 70s. We sat outside but that area wasn't pleasant either. Drank up and departed rapidly. The Irish pub just down the road is a much better bet.

title: Theft
text: I was robbed inside this bar on Saturday, the staff were ignorant and did not provide any support and apart from the suspicious attitude of one of them when he said that they had stolen my bag.

title: Don‚Äôt bother if you‚Äôre in need of a drink
text:
Awful service. Waited over 40 mins for our cocktails. Shouldn‚Äôt ell cocktails if you don‚Äôt have even staff to make them.
Nothing British about this place.

title: Good place bad food
text:
The worst meal I've had in Lisbon.
The steak was too salty and the fries were pure oil.

title: Um desaforo
text:
No interior h√° 2 piscinas uma n√£o est√° em funcionamento mas n√£o existe qualquer indica√ß√£o no Booking.com ou √© dada por telefone‚Ä¶ a piscina grande tem apenas 2 locais de jatos sendo que as cascatas n√£o funcionam e mesmo ap√≥s indica√ß√£o nada foi feito. Posso dizer que quase nada funciona neste spa que para 50‚Ç¨00 dia fica muito baixo das expectativas.
O hammam tem um cheiro horr√≠vel e n√£o tem temperatura certa‚Ä¶ a sauna escapa.
Sobre a massagem mais tarde direi‚Ä¶ pois ao irei fazer logo

title: Terrible guide
text: The guide for this tour to Sintra on July 31st was rude and unfriendly. He was not fit to do a visit to the different monuments of Sintra

title: Sintra
text: My family and I were there on July 14 around 12pm. I would never write a review about a tour that I was not involved in. A tour guide from your organization yelled at my cousin, accusing her of cutting the line of his group. My cousin did not cut anyone and was simply waiting in line. Even if she had done, so there was no reason for him to talk to her like that he still needs to be professional as he is a guide talking to tourist. When I interfered, he got even worse and did a gesture with his hand telling me to shut up like I was an animal. Having seen that I will never use your organization for a tour. He also kept on challenging me to take a picture of him and his badge, which I didn‚Äôt. We noticed later that his group was over 40 people minimum. That is not our fault if it‚Äôs overpacked and disorganized on his end‚Ä¶. Shame on him!

title: Warning. Be careful because they can steal from you.
text:
I bought with this company a tour of the Roman Colosseum focused on children. My two children, my wife and I, were at the agreed time at the agreed site and NO one from the company appeared. Then when I wrote to them for more than half an hour they did NOT solve the issue or refund us a single euro.
Watch out for them. They're irresponsible.
Once you pay they don't answer for anything.
Thieves.

title: Cheap Tour Still Not Worth It
text: It‚Äôs a cheap tour with cheaper execution. This is a long day and you do not want to be traveling in this hot cramped bus across Portugal. The guides provide little direction as you do the walking and exploring yourself. They do make sure to sell you water on the bus, nothing included in the tour. The main palace is crowded and the visit is quite quick there. Honestly just take an Uber out to Sintra and walk to the top yourself, or there are plenty of taxis waiting to do that.

title: Never visited Pena palace due to traffic jam. Partial refund ridiculous. Not worth the money.
text: Due to traffic blockage, we were not able to visit Pena palace, and instead given a ridiculous amount of free time in Sintra, with visit to Regaleira being rushed. The refund was miniscule proportion of the entire ticket. It would have been much cheaper to just do the same trip to Cabo Roca and Sintra by public transport and do the self-guided trip, without missing out on a lot of content. The guides were enthusiastic and nice.

title: Disappointed!
text: Chaotic check-in process with no clear organization for dozens of tours starting at same time. Tour started with delay due to road issues on route to Cabo Roca (not sure how these weren't communicated to bus drivers ahead of time). Set us behind for the remainder of the day. Arrived late for Pena Palace timed ticket and had only 15 minutes to tour on our own. Lunch time was not adjusted/shortened and we arrived over 30 minutes late to our timed Quinta Regaleira ticket and were denied entrance. Had to stand in line and entered 1 hour after original ticket time. Taken straight to Initiation Well, then had only 15 minutes to tour remaining grounds, palace, etc. before needing to return to bus. Many hills and long walks - other guests on this tour were not prepared for this.

title: Disappointing experience. Wrong tour and no refund from Viator
text: We had booked the full tour with a guide in Italian, also confirmed on the tickets, but due to a mistake by Viator we were included in the group in English. We asked for reimbursement, but were denied claiming it was our fault. When asked for proof, they replied that the case is closed for them. Not serious.

title: Unreasonable lack of flexibility and communication
text:
I made a mistake and booked the tour for a Thursday, but wrote it down in my itenerary for Friday. With that said, I promptly arrived on site at 8:10, 20 minutes before the required meeting time. I spoke with one of the tour guides, who informed me of my mistake. She was so kind, and offered to see if there was anything she could do to help. It was the last full day of my trip, and I was absolutely devastated. I was looking forward to this tour. I felt like it would have been the highlight of my time here, but instead I was severely disappointed and struggling to hold back tears.

Adding to my frustration, I had paid over $100 for the tour, only to notice closer to the date that the same tour was now being offered for about half that price. The guide explained that since tickets to the site were pre-purchased, accommodating me without a reservation would be difficult‚Äîunless a no-show created an open spot. After everyone checked in, she contacted her supervisor to ask if I could take the place of a no-show. The request was immediately denied, with no exceptions considered.

This rigid policy felt completely unreasonable. Mistakes happen, and I had paid nearly double the current listed price. I‚Äôve since reached out multiple times to request at least a partial refund, especially since I never used the service, and have not received any response. I fully understand if the cost of pre-purchased entry tickets is non-refundable, but ignoring customer inquiries is simply unprofessional. Additionally, I would appreciate clarification on the significant price drop‚Äîfrom $115 to $50‚Äîas a refund of even $75‚Äì$80 would seem entirely fair under the circumstances.

I understand this is a business, but the lack of flexibility and communication in this case was deeply disappointing.

title: Disorganized and Disappointing Experience
text:
I do not recommend this company for many reasons. They show no responsibility and are very slow to respond ‚Äî I waited the whole day for a reply and got no help. It all started with a confusing meeting point between two identical fountains. We stood near the wrong one, and by the time we walked to the correct spot, the tour had already left ‚Äî they didn‚Äôt even wait five minutes. The guides refused to let us join at the next stop and told us to wait two hours instead.

The itinerary did not match what was promised. At Pena Palace, we expected some free time to explore the gardens, but the guide said we were leaving right away. I told him I‚Äôd stay, and he agreed ‚Äî but didn‚Äôt give me the entrance ticket I had already paid for. As a result, I couldn‚Äôt visit any other sites on the grounds.

This tour was a huge disappointment. Poor organization, lack of support, and false promises. Think twice before booking.

title: Go on your own!!! It is not advisable to pay for this tour.
text: One hour less tour because the guide returned us earlier. Poor explanations only along the way. There is no time to do anything, I recommend doing it on your own because the transfer is super easy to do and if it is worth staying longer in the places. Lack of organization on the part of the company and tickets were not purchased at the appointed time, which made the itinerary move and we could not know Regaleira.

title: Abysmal Customer Service and Awful Experience
text: We arrived at the meeting spot 5 minutes later than the scheduled departure time for reasons out of our control. The subway verde line was abruptly stopped due to a medical emergency and the subway service was halted indefinitely. We took a ride share but there was significant traffic and we could not arrive on time. The customer support line at Buendia Tours was rude and dismissive. They offered no remorse and suggested no recourse but harshly spoke to us on the phone that it is our fault and absolute no refunds of any kind. We are very upset and disappointed with this tour operator and would not recommend this company.

title: Clueless Head Office
text:
We did a Bruges walking tour and boat cruise with this company. The day before our tour while in transit we received an email saying we needed to have printed copies of our tickets. I replied and said we had etickets. They said NO, they needed to be printed. We could not print as we were in transit.

So we attended the tour with no printed tickets and no problem. No other person on the tour presented printed tickets.

The tour itself was excellent by our guide, Maria, but we didn‚Äôt need the extra stress when in the end the tour office had no clue.

title: Lazy
text: Guide was nice however they did not drop the group off at starting point as advertised. In fact it wasn‚Äôt even close. It took about 30-40 minutes to get back. So we did not get what we paid for as advertised. They could have easily found a way to drop us off near starting point at the very least. Do not recommend especially if you have mobility issues.

title: Don't book with them
text: Lousy agency don't hire her, arriving at the meeting point, they didn't answer our calls, the tour guides who were there didn't give us a solution, they made time pass, and we couldn't join the group I don't recommend anything

title: No good
text: We came and no one come to pick us. Sitting and waiting at the meeting point but no see anyone ‚Ä¶ even I don‚Äôt know who is my tour guild information and number and no group tourist

title: Misled and Disappointed
text:
We had a very frustrating experience with Buendia Tours. When we arrived for our tour, we were told by the guide that the Pena Palace and another key attraction were closed. Based on that, we were told we could cancel the tour and request a refund through the third-party platform we booked with.

Trusting the guide, we left‚Äîonly to later find out that no refund would be issued. We don‚Äôt know for sure whether the attractions were actually closed or not, but the whole situation felt suspicious and unprofessional. It seemed like the tour may have been overbooked, and we were simply the ones they chose to remove.

We feel completely let down and misled. This was not the experience we paid for, and we would not recommend this tour to anyone. Extremely disappointing.

title: A flop
text:
We had booked the trip through Viator 4 days in advance. The weather was superb and we were already looking forward to arriving at the pick-up point on time.
It was our last day of vacation and should be another highlight.
We quickly found our alleged guides, who unfortunately did not find us on the guest list (analog) despite booking code by mail and confirmation. A phone call with the office also revealed no further findings. The guides have already tried hard to find a solution. The bus was hopelessly booked up to last place, the tour in English was also booked up.
We had paid, had written confirmation, a reminder, but unfortunately no place. From the Buondia Tours office there was only a comment that there was probably a system error. Bad luck! We should contact Viator on our own. There was only one service number from America, after further research we found a service point in England.
We were quite served and depressed. I really wanted to go to Sintra. There was no assistance, or spontaneous alternative offers from the organizers.
The bus left and we were left behind. You can't do that!!!
We paid a lot of money for the tour. 98‚Ç¨/per person and no assurance at this time to receive a refund.
We then went by train to Sintra on our own and certainly spent a clear, nicer day and especially a cheaper day there. What we just didn't know was that you have to book time slots in Penapalast and Regaleira.
When we later reached the service point in England, they regretted the mistake and promised a quick return transaction. the money I have now received back 5 days later. Nevertheless, an unnecessary excitement and stress, during a really relaxed stay in Lisbon.

title: Waiting for I r a refund
text: I booked this trip because I reall6 wanted to see Pena Palace. I was disappointed when my first booking was cancelled and then further disappointed when my rebooked cancelled Pena Palace. I chose not to go and was very frustrated when I could not get an automatic refund and that n9ne of the Trip Avisor phone numbers worked. I finally made an online report. I trust I will get a refund hut I guess I have to 2ait 8 days.

title: No follow up
text: I was running 10 minutes late and I tried to advise provider with no success. When I arrived at the meeting spot there was noone there. I assumed they had already left but they hadn't even tried to contact me. Very disappointing.

title: Worst touring company.
text:
Worst company to do trip with . Please don‚Äôt go with them .

They don‚Äôt answer on phone and they sit in Spain and want to control trip in Lisabon. I had called 10 min ago and was there just 2 min past there time and they denied entry . Also they did not give any alternative.

title: Unpresentable, don't trust me.
text: Unpresentable. They confirmed the visit the afternoon before by email, I arrive at the meeting point on the day of the visit and no one appears. I had to demand the money back. They didn't give me explanations or options for anything. DON'T TRUST THESE PEOPLE.

title: Tour cancelled with no notification
text:
The tour was cancelled due to fires in Sintra. Understand that, but we were given no notice and showed up at the pickup spot. Waited and then called tour operator and they told us the tour had been cancelled for three days.
There were others waiting that also had not been notified. Very disappointing

title: Terrible organization
text:
I give them one star because I can't give zero.
It was a disaster, the marked link led to another site where I was waiting for more than 10 minutes without anyone arriving. I called the number they gave me in case they had had a problem and were late, but it turned out that they had already left and the meeting point was different. They told me to go buy a ticket at the Rossio station (which by the way, I already paid at the time because it was included) that they would see me there and I would write to them what time I would arrive, well that's what I did and they told me that I'm going to get lost half way. tour, when it was not my fault. I request a refund and they tell me that it cannot be when the fault is theirs since the map link WAS WRONG.
I have been on many tours and excursions and I have NEVER been treated like this, nor has the organization been so terrible. The minimum would be that if only 1 person is missing, they will try to contact them in case something has happened, just like I did with them, for that I have shared private data and have paid a lot of money.

title: Unprofessional
text:
I took an essential Lisbon excursion, with Elvira.
I took an excursion to be told the history of Portugal, not to be told the political and religious history of Spain‚Ä¶. I already know that one

title: Lovely locations, but health and safety poor
text: The tour itself was a surprise, as we thought it was a cruise to the locations, but it was a coach instead. The travel was not too bad, although the headphones and devices were awful sound quality. The locations we went to were superb and beautiful - we should have spent longer at the beach with the church and less time at the other location, in my view. Averio was stunning. However, the main issue was that my husband hurt himself quite badly at the start of the walking tour in Averio - his foot went down a broken drain and he cut his ankle and toe open badly. I asked the tour guide to stop, to help (if they had a first aid kit) and whether there was a pharmacy nearby and she abruptly said 'no' to each request. She didn't even look at his wounds or ask if he was ok. He was bleeding badly, so I had to run to find a pharmacy. I then caught up with the group and we tended to his wounds. We then caught up again with the group. Not once did the tour guide ask if he was ok - not once. This was really disappointing, as health and safety should be paramount on tours like this and tour guides should be prepared on what to do if someone gets hurt.

title: They left me to bring even me begging to go to meet them
text:
Bad experience! Never again!!!
Me and my 3-year-old daughter left our Airbnb which is 3.8Km from the meeting point at 7:30. While we were waiting for Uber that were all busy, we decided to start walking, we walked a lot, we lost. We tried to get a taxi, they were busy too. I called Buendia to inform her that I was going for a walk and couldn't get a taxi. It was 8:20 when I asked them to wait until 8:45 and he said the guide would only wait until 8:35 but it would be impossible. I ran like a crazy woman with my baby in the neck with pain in the knee. It was awful. When he was 500 meters from the meeting point, the agency's young man sent a message saying that they had already left and could do nothing else.
I asked to reschedule for another day or give me a partial refund. They said nothing would be possible anymore.
I lost 50‚Ç¨. It was awful. My baby only cried when I saw my despair running in this town where I don't know anyone, she was scared. How much humiliation and horrible treatment, and the money was worked out of my sweat.
For never again neither Viator nor Buendia. Never again.

title: Disappointed
text:
Advertised as English. We were in a group of mostly Spanish speakers. Guide did most of the tour in Spanish with very little English. Very disappointed. I would not have gone the tour if I knew it was mostly in Spanish.

Headset ran out of battery.

title: Ordinary
text: Bust dedicated to Francisco Marques de Sousa Viterbo, 19th century Portuguese historian, journalist, writer, archaeologist and general scholar. The work, carried out in 1950 by the sculptor Francisco dos Santos, is very simple in design, consisting of a marble pedestal on which the bronze bust of Dr. Sousa Viterbo is placed. The monument is located along the north side of the Jardim do Principe Real.

title: Terrible ride with no conditions
text: I booked a boat trip for my birthday where I was sold a sailboat with capacity for 4 people, but I came across a small sailing boat where we had to limit ourselves to the seat. And it's not what the website presents. I also questioned the state of the sea taking into account the time of year and was always told that if there were no conditions, the amount would be refunded or the tour would be rescheduled. However, even with very adverse conditions (very windy and very rough tides), they continued the tour. I found that the boat's skipper was unaware of the tide and wind forecast. Instead of enjoying a pleasant walk with friends and enjoying some tapas and a glass of wine, it was a terrible trip, in my opinion not worth doing. I was disappointed and will never trust this company again.

title: Don't worry
text: Extremely poor customer service but the flight was cheap. If they treat you bad don't worry they treat everyone like that. If you see your flight boarding and they said you're not gonna make that flight. It's ok many have been done like that. When you miss that flight don't worry if they're not available to get you on your way. Please don't worry it's not you many have been done that way. Just stay calm purchase another seat on another airline. The anger situation doesn't work. Trust me.

title: Never go back there again.
text: We went to the store that is close to the castle of S√£o Jorge and it was one of the worst experiences we had. We were looking at the ceramic pieces and more people came into the store, when the lady who works started yelling at us by bed us with pick pockets. My sister started crying, my friend took her passport to show it, the other one didn't understand, and I didn't react. People rushed out of the store, and we stayed. Observation, we were not close to the other people, we were looking at the ceramics all the time at the store. After the lady saw that we didn't go out, she came back and said ohh " I am sorry scare you guys" and she back in up saying that was not with us. Unfortunately, she left us traumatized. It was horrible!! we will never go back there and unfortunately; we did not take action in Portugal that should have been done.

title: Aperol Spritz overpriced
text: A beautiful interesting place full of life, has really a lot of charm. However, the price of ‚Ç¨9 for an Aperol Spritz filled with 8 ice cubes is totally overpriced. Even the nice one doesn't change anything.......

title: Bust
text: We were there on a local recommendation. Service was attentive, friendly. Fado performance was good. Eat a bust. Fish oily, tasteless. Spinach not seasoned. Overpriced for quality. Not recommended.

title: Bad food for a lot of money. Singing was moderate
text:
The food was downright bad. Woman of the house caused fear rather than a welcome feeling. Singing was mediocre.
Too bad about the money.

title: Find another address for food and fado
text: Beautiful music with good musicians and singers, only a pity about the particularly bad food. Everything was overcooked, too much dirty sauce and overcooked

title: Disappointing experience at Caf√© Luso
text:
We went to Caf√© Luso in Portugal as a company of 15 people. Although the music and the fantastic spectacle seemed to save the evening, our overall experience was overshadowed by the behavior of the meter.

We paid 25 euros per person, which included the spectacle and two glasses of wine. Although we asked for dry wine, the meter brought us sweets and, when we pointed out the mistake, he categorically refused to serve us. Insisted on drinking the sweet wine without giving any solution to our request.

The inappropriate behavior of the meter spoiled the atmosphere and left us a very negative impression. It is truly a shame that such a historic place with excellent music is degraded by such service. I would not recommend it to anyone who expects professionalism and good service.

title: To not return
text:
The menu that is on the site is not the current menu of the restaurant, which is misleading because it works with a menu per person or a la carte options with very little variety and little flexibility. The prices practiced are absurd - 15‚Ç¨ for a mini dessert? The green broth, 12‚Ç¨? The slice of corn bread and lingus described in the green broth is an aperitif toast with a thin roll of lingus. An anecdote...
Although the staff that served us was friendly qb, I did not like the environment. Stressed employees, rude to each other, worried about billing at all tables... the fado was nothing special. Not to come back.

title: Tourist trap
text: We appreciated the technical quality of the musical performance. For the rest, no, no and no again. No emotion although this is precisely what fado should convey, perhaps the enormous room does not lend itself to it. Canteen food for the price of a 4*, service let's say "inadequate". Truly feels like just one credit card among thousands of other credit cards.

title: A tourist trap
text: Our experience with that restaurant was really bad. The manager was grumpy and unfriendly and spoke to us in a humiliating manner because we didn‚Äôt cancel the previous reservation. The place was empty until some groups of tourists were brought in. It‚Äôs a tourist trap. The food was bad, it was our worst dinner in Portugal and it was overpriced. The musicians were okay, but the first singer, the lady was awful. With such amazing fado singers in Lisbon, her singing was really a shame. We couldn‚Äôt wait to get out of there. Never again !

title: Don‚Äôt go‚Ä¶.
text: Tourist trap‚Ä¶food horrible,,worst food in Lisbonne..show was just ok‚Ä¶waiters are aggressive and ask for a tip at the end‚Ä¶..

title: Overpriced
text:
To be honest, I didn't love this.
I really wanted to feel the authentic energy of a fado...but the experience was underwhelming and overpriced.
The food was pretty bland...and the steak looked grey.
The server tried his best but the whole experience felt cheesy.
Would not recommend.

title: Overpriced tourist trap, not worth it
text: The restaurant really was a tourist trap. We went there with a tour group and were served 3 foods and wine. The whole experience was quite poor, even though the music was good, we would not recommend overlooking the bad experience of food and staff just because music was good, there surely must be a better place where to enjoy it. We were served soup, chicken and a strange dessert, I had to ask for the staff to explain what they are serving, our table did not have the opportunity to choose what we ate, we were just served something. Soup was ok, but chicken was really bad, and dessert bad as well. There were around 150 people in total in the cafe and the whole place was understaffed. We had to ask multiple times for out wine to be refilled. Probably worst of all was the final coffee, which was not a real coffee, but served as one.

title: Brutal treatment, awful place
text: Nothing justifies a grumpy manager treating a family with two children and two elderly in ways I‚Äôve never experienced in my life. We experienced a brutal treatment, inhuman and absurd.

title: Rip Off for Tourists
text:
Designed purely as a tourist trap - with its main business being bringing in groups from cruise ships.
Service was strangely snooty and extremely overpriced. Referring to wine under ‚Ç¨50 a bottle as garbage. We took the recommendation and paid ‚Ç¨60 for a very average bottle that wasn‚Äôt even worth finishing.

Recommend to avoid as there are far better places to enjoy Fado without being ripped off.

title: Tourist trap/terrible food
text:
Tourist trap. The food and service was terrible and overpriced. The fado singers were great.
We waited 20 minutes to be given the menus after being seated and then another 20 minutes for wine to arrive. Avoid!!!

title: DESAGRADABLE!!!
text:
Fuimos recomendados a este lugar, para cenar y escuchar fado, y cu√°l es nuestra sorpresa!!!, fado si escuchamos, y alguna voz desagradable tambi√©n, y la comida qu√© decir?, nos ponen un men√∫ ya cerrado, cuando no lo ponen en la web, y la comida horrible!!!.
Sitio para turistas y nosotros pagamos el pato.

title: Mala comida, y artista desagradable
text:
Fuimos a este local recomendados, pero ha sido una decepci√≥n.
Fado en vivo, mientras cenabamos, con una comida muy pobre. El peor bacalao que he comido en mi vida, y decir eso en Lisboa, ya es preocupante.
Una de las artistas, fue especialmente desagradable con nuestra mesa, en d√≥nde estuvimos con pleno respeto con el espect√°culo, incluso insinuando que est√°bamos borrachos.
No recomendable, no vay√°is y no es un sitio barato...
Seguro que en Lisboa hay mejores sitios para ver fado en directo...

title: Antipathic worker
text: It was the first time I was there and it was the last. The Oculus officer who works there treats customers with contempt, zero sympathy. The other employees who work for it were friendly and helpful.

title: Purata Pier Rules
text: I found it very strange because I went to the pirate's pier a few weeks ago and didn't pay anything and yesterday they asked me for money for the entrance even though we just wanted to drink, I hope they try to normalize the bar's rules, thank you

title: The worst place
text: There is no one and the drinks are at the price of Pan Am but there is no one and it smells like detergent my worst experience in Lisbon 23 euros a vodka and a Sky frankly nullllllll

title: Yeah.
text: It was to be the highlight of the city trip - especially since the weather was not so great. - Unfortunately, the most interesting part (old building) was closed for renovation. I wish I had known before paying for the entrance...

title: Everything to improve
text: Absent organization: audioguide does not work with IPhone, no description of the works, dark exposure, ticket office far from the entrance and to retrieve the jackets in the locker you have to go outside and in December it is not pleasant .. in short, for 16 euros you can do better.

title: Poor service and thinnest exhibition
text: Poor service and thinnest exhibition. Very poor signage - and no directions to the other (old) part of the museum

title: Rip-off
text: When we visited the museum, we paid the full entry price but half of the museum was closed. Especially the paintings, for which we came, were not accessible. This was a pure rip-off. I felt cheated. Check on before hand. Ingmar De Langhe.

title: Don't go.
text: I went today. Most of the galleries are closed until September, but they still charge full price. The gardens are a building site. The entrance is not sign posted. No one could find it. The gardens are all steps. No consideration for disabled people or pushchairs. I asked for map of the outdoor sculptures as the modern art is closed inside, but they did not have map. It doesn't say that they are half closed on their website. Very disappointing.

title: Great museum , substandard cafeteria.
text: The museum was superb but the visit ruined by choosing to visit the cafeteria. The woman serving was rude and impatient and the food when it arrived was extremely poor. 3 slices of stale bread and a dollop of quince jelly was the accompaniment to 4 pieces of cheese ..... this after a 30 min wait in the queue. Her comments included "you wouldn't have visited if it wasn't raining" and "the queue has been solid since 10:30 this morning". I'm sorry you are having a bad day but it is not my problem. Very poor customer service and an extremely disappointing end to an inspiring visit.

title: I don't advise
text:
I didn't like it because the visit was a drought and the guide wasn't pleasant, but it could improve a lot and bring the Mona Lisa here.
And we had to eat on the bench, all wet, I don't recommend it and they don't even allow you to go to the bathroom.

title: Terrible lighting of special treasures exhibit - frustrating experience - please fix this!
text:
Great museum - been there many times - one of my favorites. But very poor lighting of the Treasures exhibit (with no consideration - not even properly lighting the catalogues! Or having a high quality online display - led to frustrating experience for my 70 year old eyes.

I give one star only to bring to the museum‚Äôs attention. Totally unnecessary for this world class museum

title: Pretty awful
text: Not worth bothering with, to be honest. It was disappointing and the staff were really unhelpful. Best to try another museum

title: Inte bra
text:
Enorma k√∂er till allt!
Om du har hela dagen p√• dig s√• kanske det kan vara n√•got f√∂r dig!. Litet museum

title: Wasted money!
text:
Dont buy at this shop - its a scam!
I bought "Cali Amnestia" for 15‚Ç¨. It doesnt look like picture on their site. Its total chemical - in my opinion its HHC.
HHC is made by CBD flowers sprayed with HHC chems.
I give it a try anyway, so I smoked a whole gram and nothing happened. Maybe I feel like 5-10% of be high. So disappointed!!!

title: Enganadores mentirosos
text: A loja utiliza de panfletos e outros m√©todos para atrair turistas desavisados e vende produtos que n√£o s√£o o que dizem, dizem que vende cannabis THC ( o que √© proibido no pa√≠s ) mais na verdade √© CBD.

title: Waste of time
text:
Product is total garbage, non functional. And/or staff lies.
Store appears to be a pop-up and will probably be gone soon. Hands out flyers to attract unsuspecting tourists. Do not recommend

title: TO FLEE !
text:
Very disappointing I do not recommend!!
Despite good music, the waiter (who wears a braid and an atypical style) was very aggressive for no reason!
We were with family and were extremely nice to his very disrespectful behavior, and especially after drinking for many tours, we were treated very poorly. If they have a problem with tourists, they will have to change business and location!!!!

title: Stellion crime
text:
On 20/07 - I requested the ride from R. Gomes Freire, 179; Lisbon to the airport Huberto Delgado; Lisbon - with the correct cost and debited on my card, from 9‚Ç¨ for a journey of approximately 5km.
1 hour later, I received an absurd charge of ‚Ç¨46.84 for the 45.68Km race of the same car and driver.
When reporting the error via e-mail on the same date, there was never a return and the phone on the official pages never complicates the call.
Don't hire the services, it's bullshit!!!

The practice of "company" ÃÅ is possible crime of stelion: * with the intention of obtaining for yourself or for a third unlawful enrichment, by error or deception about facts that cunningly provoked, determine another to the practice of acts that cause him, or cause another person, property damage.*

title: Dishonest short-changing of customers !
text: Establishment insists on short-changing customers, despite woman behind the bar being caught short-changing she has denied giving the wrong change and has insisted that the correct change was given and that the " till has dispensed the correct change automatically ! ". Unethical and dishonest practice.

title: Net
text:
Travel guide fine!
Not value for money in terms of drinks but the food was good.
Would have liked to taste more local drinks.

No manned ticket counter (even at the central station) we want to buy a day ticket, so we go on an automaton. When it comes to choosing the ticket, it's only in Portuguese. You get a ticket, but once you get on the tram, you get a bad surprise: not valid. Let's go. A bus, same. Anyway. We buy day tickets, but we don't know what they're for.

title: The worst public trasport company
text: The worst public trasport company in the world. Just forget about schedule, about the information on yellow boards on stops (never correct). Waiting time is twice as long as indicated in timetable. Site is always down or stupidly slow.

title: Rudeness
text: Drivers are very rude, they do not give information and if you try to talk to them while they are at the end of the line they throw you out

title: Carris at its worst (as usual)
text: The panels have information but drivers choose to do what they want. After we waited for the 753 (Pla√ßa Jos√© Fontana) in Amoreiras (with a waiting time of 6 minutes), arrived a 753 but whose final stop was the Amoreiras. Meanwhile, we picked up the 711 and asked the driver if it was normal that this had happened with the 753, to which the driver replied: ‚Äúthe information panels are useless.‚Äù Carris is always at her worst.

title: Subway okay, the rest is silence!
text: The subway is clean and fast. Buses should be avoided, they come when they want and are always crowded. No information at the stops. The trams create nostalgic feelings, but are also never punctual and always full. Unworthy of a cosmopolitan city.

title: Line 28
text:
We took out our card to go on the tram, specifically the 28th which was the one that takes us to our area.
The service is embarrassing, huge queues to catch it, we turned without being able to use the card.

AN EMBARRASSMENT OF SERVICE.
Unfortunately, a city with so many tourists is not trying to improve.

title: Treated shamefully.
text: What to say... I have never taken such public transport (buses and trams, the metro works normally). no information, most fanciful schedules, terminal stops at unscheduled stations, drivers who openly mock tourists and who say that in Portugal we must speak Portuguese or go to hell... (this is not in the text but gestures and tone are explicit). A special mention to the driver of bus line 28 registered AH12TB on 26/03 at 17.14 hours. A real shame, we are really the piggy tourists of paying... The number of tourists in Lisbon surely means they don't give a damn about being kind. A bad image of the country and its public service.

title: Poor service
text: Basically, the service provided was not provided. Haphazard and sloppy service, very poor information, services cancelled. Hopeless. I ended up going around town in a price gouging tuktuk. On the major reasons I visited Lisbon was to ride the trams. Very very disappointed

title: Very unpleasant staff
text:
Networks very well connected but very unpleasant staff.
No respect for strangers, let alone with a child in a stroller.
We took the bus, hateful driver, hateful tram driver and worse at the station a lady of the hateful staff and who disrespected us while we asked for help and a man at the agency Carris de Belem (Lx factory) very rude and racist, we asked him if he spoke English or French to facilitate our exchanges and he replied here we are in Portugal we speak Portuguese! To finally talk to us in English and French!
Frankly no respect and very limited

title: Poor always late
text: Bad service. Bad service. Transports are always delayed. We paid the pass to have this kind of unprofessional service.

title: Poor service - bus 750
text:
Bad service.
The 750 line is the only route for those who work and need to use the 2nd circular. Most stops do not have metro available. That is why it should be strengthened. I will find myself forced to buy a car and contruibuir for the transit because the bus never arrives at hours. It's not a 10-minute delay! Today I waited for the bus at 8:58, it was 9:45 when I had to pick up a Uber and give up, in order to be able to get to my workplace. In contrast, at the red cable station passed 4 buses to the martim moniz (location with metro). It is a huge lack of management, is one of the main reasons for the transit of the 2nd circular, there are no transportation. I pay the pass to have to take a taxi to get to work.
On the carris site between 8h58 and 9h42, there are supposed to be 5 buses, so there can be no excuse for failure or accident with the bus.

title: Endless wait for 751
text: always the same story, centuries in the point waiting for the bus to pass and beyond the delays the high prices on tickets/passes

title: Carris - 750 and others
text: A shit! Service that is worth nothing, always late, always full and without cleaning. I usually take the 750 and it's an absolute shame for this country.

title: Terrible.
text: We waited for the tram at the terminus, all the time one tram after another passed, at the turn of my family as well as others the controller charged us for the ticket, but the tram from there to an hour and a half later did not pass. I so called for information and told me that on that day they would not pass, but no one had warned. But they reassured us that we could reuse the ticket, but no, it is no longer usable, they just took the money.

title: Waiting time for all buses
text: The bus 706 , has a bad services, being sometimes half an hour to an hour waiting. Bad, no words. No words

title: Fucking G
text:
Unpleasant, even mean drivers, don't care about tourists.
The ‚Ç¨10.70 pass is a tourist trap that is almost impossible to make profitable, and it does not work on the CARRIS company bus between Sintra and Carcais. We had to add 5‚Ç¨ on top of the 22‚Ç¨ already paid, on top of that the driver openly made fun of us. Bunch of Mongols, no wonder you are POOR!!!!

title: Deplorable
text: They don't follow schedules, situations in which buses are full are daily, with people having to stay at the stop waiting for one to come that isn't there, therefore not being able to keep schedules if it depends on the quality of their service. Drivers are rude, many of them do not meet the minimum standards for someone who is serving the public. If it happens (as is quite common) that they do not have change, it is the passengers who are left without money, among countless other situations that those who frequently travel on Carris are forced to tolerate, because no matter how many complaints are made, the service does not change and the quality it only tends to decrease. The problem for this company is that it doesn't have competition, because if that were the case, they would realize how important it is to live up to what they commit to with their customers and the importance of loyalty.

title: Travel time
text: The timetables are not adhered to. We waited over an hour for the next bus and were not given any information. A disaster to say the least!!!

title: A must do but way too busy
text:
The authentic yellow trams are an indispensable part of the street scene of Lisbon.
However, in many places it takes a very long time (for E28 even hours...) to wait in line, only to be pushed into the tram until you can no longer move.
Getting on somewhere halfway through the old city is a utopia, the trams are overcrowded, making it impossible to get on somewhere.

The trams are beautiful and part of Lisbon, but better to look at than to wait to take a ride...

title: Ashamed
text: the behavior of the drivers, don't respond to hello, drive like savages even if the tram/bus is full, often aggressive, no effort with tourists, we travel a lot, rare to see that!

title: Just very bad management
text:
Unreliable times. SMS service not functioning. App unusable. A company very poorly managed.

I live in Lisbon for years and this is a review based on repeated poor customer experience

title: The worst public transport I know
text: Tickets are only available at about 5% of all stations, buses only stop when the driver feels like it, there is no timetable, entire lines stop running without any information. All in all, the worst transport system I have ever experienced in a big city

title: non-compliance with schedules
text:
My daughter arrives late for school every day. wait for buses more than 40 m and they don't run on time. then 2 pass in a row. the company must not even know that the drivers do not follow the schedule!
a disgrace of public service as usual.

title: Does not keep schedules

title: Sardines aren't just at the supermarkets
text: Riding on a bus from Belem to CIAS do sodre, people were backed in like sardines. No air-conditioning and no windows open, as a result two days later, I was sick with a fever. title: Incredibly rude staff and virtually no stock
text:
Been here several times in 2023 and 2022 - always very little stock and they're now filling the humidor with whisky to make the barren shelves look full.

Incredibly rude staff - the lady with the black short hair clearly despises her customers and was rude to us even though we just said "Hello, can we look in the humidor please". The younger member of staff was quite pleasant but the woman being rude and commenting from the sidelines was hugely disappointing and unprofessional.

I've visited countless cigar stores and this is by far and away the worst I've ever been to. Avoid and go somewhere that treats their customers with courtesy and respect.

title: AVOID. More condescending attitude than anything else.
text: We went into this shop because my husband is a cigar aficionado. We asked the woman who greeted us - blonde hair, arm in a sling - whether they sold cigars singly, instead of in a whole box. (They are of course in a climate-controlled area, and we could not see them up close.) She said yes, but "they are cohibas and they are VERY EXPENSIVE." The implication was that we could never afford them (we are middle-aged and were dressed decently, so it's not like we were college students looking for a cheap smoke). Mind you, my husband has 5 humidors and many cohibas. We were friends with a man who worked for JFK, and my husband has smoked cigars Castro himself gave to our friend. So the condescension and judgment were especially irritating. And it cost them a sale. We walked out. Avoid this place - it's more attitude than quality and certainly customer service.

title: Buyer beware
text: Find a great cigar shop in Lisbon to buy Cuban cigars. Only problem was my Siglo 5 cigars (3 tubes) all had plume. If you buy cigars from this establishment, caveat emptor. I would recommend opening all tubes or box of cigars you buy at this store to inspect unless you believe plume is a sign of good aging.

title: DISAPPOINTING. I DO NOT RECOMMEND
text:
It's disappointing. I usually buy every time I go to Lisbon, and I usually do it from the same origin. But this time for me it was a disappointment, because when I tried it it did not meet the quality conditions; both in grain and ground without aroma, its flavor is altered, strange in the body of the coffee,,,from what I deduce from other occasions bought there, it is not suitable for consumption, leaving an unpleasant taste at the end of the tasting.Da the feeling of being out of date... It gives me the feeling that one of two things have gone wrong or because it is so touristy they no longer take care of it.

I have sent an email to notify it and they have not paid any attention to me.

Unfortunately I will stop buying it at your establishment and given what has happened to me I do not recommend purchasing it there. I see that there are already some similar comments about it. I can say in response that they have given to other people, that I have the knowledge to know what coffee should be like...

title: Superficial or cheating?
text:
We entered with our celiac daughter and asked if they had something gluten-free, the person behind the counter offered us ovos moles, a typical treat, we again asked if it was safe and she insisted we do not know if out of ignorance or to sell six wafers filled with cream at 11 euros, the fact is that just bitten immediately noticed that something was wrong, reading the ingredients (written only in local language) there is wheat flour!
Ignorance or dishonesty, I don't know but I wouldn't recommend it.

title: This casino treats its customers terribly
text:
When I visited this casino yesterday, I played a game of Baccarat and placed a bet of ‚Ç¨10, not knowing that this did not meet the minimum bet requirement. The dealer inadvertently accepted my bet and only realized the mistake after I won the round. In most casinos, this oversight is usually acknowledged and the winnings are paid out. However, the way this situation was handled at Casino Lisbon was far from satisfactory.

After the dealer realized the mistake, he simply looked at the chips and returned them to me without even a basic apology. This was not only disappointing, but also came across as rude and unfair, which made me feel uneasy. When I subsequently spoke to the female manager in charge to resolve the issue, her unfriendly response was deeply disturbing. She insisted that I should have been aware of the minimum bet requirement and refused to pay my winnings that I deserved.

The situation was further exacerbated by the manager's cold apology and hasty departure. In order to document my experience, I tried to take a photo and share my feedback on Google. The manager noticed my actions and approached me to express her dissatisfaction with the photo. I deleted the photo immediately, but her subsequent surveillance was obvious.

Seeking clarification and resolution to the unfair treatment I had suffered, I went to the cash counter with the intention of filing a complaint. To my surprise, the manager and the lady from before turned out to be in cahoots. They approached me and initially threatened to involve the police, even though I had deleted the photos. It was a disturbing and threatening experience. The two then removed me from the casino, leaving me with a bad impression.

As a tourist, my visit to Casino Lisbon should have been a pleasant and memorable experience. However, losing my winnings due to a small mistake and the subsequent handling of the situation left me with a negative impression. I even felt that there may be an element of discrimination against Asian tourists. I can't help but wonder if I became an easy target for their behavior.

I think it is important that your company's management team is aware of this incident and take the necessary steps to ensure fair and respectful treatment of all tourists. I hope this experience can serve as an opportunity to improve customer service practices.

title: Focus on training certain people directly in contact with customers.
text: The person at reception orders us in a haughty tone to speak English when the CNI is presented, without making the slightest effort. Staff training to be reviewed. Fortunately there was his colleague who immediately took over. Bravo to her.

title: Don't go there for a drink...
text:
Large casino with a fairly large selection of machines. A bar on each floor, unfortunately although there is the choice between several bars, we were not lucky enough to come across a bartender worthy of the name... between the bartender on the ground floor, who when we asked him asks for a cocktail (Gin Tonic and Bloody Mary) thinks about it then tells us that it's better to go upstairs for that, once we get upstairs we come across a young man who straight away tells us he's new and alone, not knowing how to make our cocktails or even a Spritz‚Ä¶
It's about time that a casino of this size in a capital invested in cocktail training for its bartenders, that's a minimum...

As for the smoking room, everything is done to put you off your cigarette, in fact you will find yourself in a service staircase...

title: Mauvaise exp√©rience

text: P√©ssimo servi√ßo...empregadas sem qualquer forma√ß√£o ou aten√ß√£o para com o cliente. Desconhecem o programa que existe. Apresenta√ß√£o/Uniforme completamente desajustados. Sem brio! Para pagar a conta o cliente √© 'obrigado' a dirigir-se at√© √† caixa pois as empregadas est√£o entretidas √† conversa...muito mau! Tenham brio e pessoas formadas e com vontade de trabalhar!

title: Overpriced, over rated
text:
In hindsight should not have bothered. Glad I got the bus up otherwise would have been more disappointed having to trudge up there. Overpriced for what it is.

Some castle grounds, not much information associated with them. Seen better castles; some of the outer wall brickwork seem fairly modern. OK you get views of Lisbon on the ramparts but seen that in other areas of the city and the inner wall on the ramparts was quite low so didn't really want to hang around too much on them.

title: Unacceptable Staff Conduct and Poor Facilities
text:
Met with hostility by staff
Unclean facilities
Definitely unacceptable behaviour from staff. I would not visit again !!!!!!!

title: Place is ok but staff are rude.
text: The place is ok but the staff our rude. There are forcing g people w/ their rudeness to leave the place at 8:30pm. Well in fact the place will close at 9pm. Lots of people telling them it‚Äôs only 8:30pm but they don‚Äôt listen. They told us go & make complaint. The visitors office is already closed, so where can we file complaint of their rudeness.

title: Everything but a castle.
text:
We're just ramparts. Beautiful as they are, this is never a castle.
The view is not extraordinary, because above the roofs of the houses.
Paying 15 ‚Ç¨ for it is not reasonable.
I will not do it again even if I return to Lisbon.

title: You‚Äôre basically just paying for the view.
text: Visited here on my own whilst my husband was running the half marathon. Had a 40 min queue to get in an entrance was ‚Ç¨15. Once inside there is very poor to zero signage around the castle explaining what anything is. There were areas that were shut including the shop and this was not indicated when purchasing a ticket. In museum area this meant it was very crowded as there was no throughput out to shop so people were going against the flow. The views are fantastic over the city but that‚Äôs basically all you‚Äôre paying for as everything else is very poor. This is not suitable for anyone with mobility issues due to multiple and at times steep steps and I would be hesitant to bring young children too as ramparts could be dangerous.

title: Disappointment
text:
It‚Äôs not worth the entrance fee there‚Äôs nothing to see
The museum inside is fine but lacks commentary on the Andalusian period that saw the birth of the castle
The viewpoint was unavailable and the person who managed the access was unpleasant
It is sun military castle and therefore devoid of all charm

title: Skip it
text: Save your money and skip this tourist trap! We bought our tickets online and got there little late during the day. Tickets said the castle is open until 6pm. We entered at 5.20 and no one at the entrance said anything about closing time. We wandered a little and got to another entrance to the actual ‚Äúcastle‚Äù where a lady y the entrance told us the castle is closed. Time was 5.30pm and the ticket said castle closes at 6pm. When we asked her about that she said no it closes at 5.30pm!! We stood there and witnessed many other tourists being refused entry into the castle. We went back to the main entrance hoping to get a refund or another ticket for the following day. But the ticket office closes at 5pm! We were angry, disappointed and upset about the whole experience. Either go early or don‚Äôt go at all. You can see similar views from free scenic viewpoints throughout Lisbon. SKIP THIS PLACE!!!!!!

title: Just see it from the outside
text:
Included in the Lisbon Card. We did not find queue on Saturday morning.

There is nothing to see but the walls and towers from which you can observe the view... but after climbing the first tower it is uselessly repetitive to climb on all the others...
I expected it but I was still disappointed.

I recommend seeing it from the outside. If you hold the Lisbon Card, you are taking a quick tour inside.

title: Visit the tile museum instead of the castle
text: We walked all the way up to the castle only to find that the ticket office was on strike. We tried to buy a ticket online but it didn‚Äôt work.

title: Disappointing for the Award
text: Really expensive for what it is, if you do not have the Lisboa card or more than 25 years clearly it is not worth the 15 euros. Very disappointed.

title: Disappointment
text: For the price that costs the entrance I do not advise you to enter.The only good thing that has are the views. Inside the castle there is nothing.

title: A lot to pay for the views you can see elsewhere for free
text: This castle has fantastic views over the city. That‚Äôs about it. You can get those views from other places but this castle has a panorama that nowhere else does. Beyond the view there isn‚Äôt much more to recommend it and at ‚Ç¨15 per person it‚Äôs an expensive visit

title: Rude staff and ridiculous ticketing system!!
text: The neighborhood, sights around the castle, and the views of the city from the hill are all great, although it is confusing to find your way to the castle from below and there is virtually no signage. Unfortunately, the ticketing procedures are a disaster and the staff and guards are not the least bit helpful. After being told the wait would be 5-10 minutes, we stood in the main line that didn't move at all for more than 30 minutes. We left disappointed without entering, thanks to the ridiculous ticketing system and rude line management.

title: Disappointing castle with nice views
text:
The Lisboa Card is a must have in Lisbon. This also gives you "free" access to the castle and you can use the fastline. However, the Lisboa Card is so popular that you have to queue for hours in the "fast line" and there is no one in the normal queue (to buy a ticket from the castle)... be warned!

The Castelo de Sao Jorge is also a must visit in Lisbon. You can stroll around and enjoy the beautiful views, but that's all. The castle is just some walls that you can walk on here and there, and there is some garden where a peacock walks. And that's all.
Disappointing for us to have to wait so long and pay so much money for views that you can also see in other places in the city.

title: Unfriendly security
text:
Got the Lisboa Cards for the group. The queues moved for card holders with all the dynamism of costal erosion. The slowest I have ever experienced.
The large bald security guard really should think about whether hospitality was a wise career choice. He was obviously trained in customer relations by veterans of the Belgian Congo. He was the most aggressive rude entry person I have ever had the misfortune to encounter.
Once in the Castle was ok and the girls in the cafe were very nice and friendly.

title: Come Only if you have never been to Sintra's moorish castle
text: Rectangular square castle fortress with views of Lisbon. Plenty of peacocks on the grounds but hard to time videos for when they cuckold. If you've been to Sintra Moorish Castle, this castle is a pale competitor and can be skipped

title: Visit to the Castle
text:
We are 5 Spaniards and we got in line for the viewing of the dark room at 1:00 p.m. in Spanish.
They didn't let us in because there was only room for 2 more people, foreigners who didn't know the language had entered and they still let them in and not us because we were in queue order. They should prioritize people of the language being played and not simply throw them out for arriving 3 minutes later than some Germans.

title: Don‚Äôt bother and save yourself 15 euros, seriously overpriced
text: Massive disappointment with very little to do inside other than climb stairs and get a view and at 30 euros for 2 people go to Belem and see the monastery and much better sights for much less! Queues in march mean that this would be a nightmare in summer months

title: Not worth the money spent on the ticket
text:
Bare construction that there is going to be a castle with more than 2000 years, but the ticket is too expensive (15‚Ç¨ per person)
Well-kept garden with many peacocks roaming around freely

title: Good but too expensive for so little
text:
15‚Ç¨ for a view... (we have the same in Gra√ßa for 5‚Ç¨) and an abandoned castle, a museum with hundreds of potteries, and unfortunately zero explanations on the castle itself.

The surrounding area is nice, if you've done Gra√ßa before don't go there!

title: Long queues, little information, unfriendly staff
text:
Unfortunately, there is little to no information in the castle, just a few signs with directions. The view is beautiful, but I don't think it was worth the length of the queue, the extremely unfriendly treatment by the people working there and the cost of admission!! I am very disappointed.

By the way, the "archaeology" museum is a collection of shards with no description, the kind you've seen 1000 times before.

title: Not worth 15 euros ticket
text: Castle is just a standing structure with no information/ history provided tour the self guided tour. You can walk around and go on top of castle for some of the most amazing views of Lisbon. We were surprised to see a peacock galore on our way out. We did not find it worth visiting for 15 euros per person ticket.

title: 15 euros
text: 15 euros per person to see views of the city that you can see from any other viewpoint is a bad joke.

title: Not Great!!
text:
Expensive entry fee, no signage, very slippery, half closed off!

Great views of city but you can find these all over the city, don‚Äôt waste your money!!

title: Aggressive security guards
text: Security guard boss at the front gate refused to let my tired and heavily pregnant partner and her pregnant friend leave from the main gate, where we had arranged to get a taxi. We had to walk all the way round to another exit. I asked a female security guard thinking she might be more understanding, only to be aggressively told by the security guard that she worked for him, and 'he was the boss'. Honestly couldn't believe it. There were signs saying pregnant and disabled have priority to get in.

title: Too expensive
text:
Frankly, this is unacceptable.
15‚Ç¨ per person.
Just a beautiful view of the city of Lisbon.
The rest doesn't break three legs of a duck.
Not worth this exorbitant price at all.

title: HUGE SCAM
text: To make a walkway on the ramparts in an empty castle where there is absolutely nothing inside without any parts for 15‚Ç¨, I call that theft. This is scandalous and dishonest!

title: Disrespectful entrance guard
text: We were attacked by the guard because we wanted to have a little glimpse before buying the tickets, we were well behind the barrier so completely legitimate but he literally pushed us as if we were thieves! What a lack of respect!

title: It‚Äôs not Versailles here!
text:
It‚Äôs a fortified castle, so only walkways, empty courtyards etccccc 15 euros!
Yea!!!!!!!!! We are far from Versailles,,,, ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ oh it‚Äôs not Versailles here!!

title: Rip off!
text: 15 euros entrance fee for a viewing point?! I have no idea why so many visitors are willing to pay that when you can enjoy an almost equally beautiful view for free just a few meters away at the Miradouro da Graca. It would be better to spend the 15 euros on a snack and a beer in the caf√© there.

title: Not recommended
text: Disappointment. Nice view but I wouldn't have wasted the time and 15 euros for this. Tower of Ulysses with closed dark room although according to the timetable it should have been open. The guard, despite us pointing out that today is September 30th and it is 1pm, continued to say "It Is closed". The rest is an up and down between the rebuilt walls and not very faithfully. Not recommended.

title: To be avoided
text:
Extremely disappointing. 15 euros are excessive to visit four ruined walls. There is nothing to admire except the view, but I don't buy a ticket to admire the view. Here too a notable queue.
Having visited the S√® we decided to reach the castle on foot. I strongly advise against it, it's torture for the feet.

title: It's not worth it
text:
Entrance costs 15 euros, you have to queue for 40 minutes in the sun and there is practically nothing inside, it's not spectacular at all
The only thing is that at least you have a decent view of Baixa

title: Disappointing
text: Only the walls remain of the castle. ‚Ç¨15 is absolutely excessive. Not recommended, there are places in Lisbon that deserve more.

title: Terrible
text:
I definetely don t recommend this
It s not worth the money nor the effort to go up there
There is nothing to see there anyway just a view like almost every other muradouro

title: Q too long.
text: Queue too long. Nothing to show how long it would take to get to desk. So didn‚Äôt bother to join it. Will get to 100 characters.

title: To avoid!
text: A waste of time and money (15 euros each). The visits in English to the tower are endless and very few during the day. Spanish and Portuguese only. The staff is few and rude. The incomplete digital guides. Just a few walls and courtyards. It can't be called a castle

title: Expensive
text: 15‚Ç¨ for a 45 minutes visit. The viewpoint is wonderful, but that price is insane for what it offers. There is not much to do inside of the castle other than climbing steps. You have a lot of vantage points allover the city and for free.

title: D√©ception
text: Vue imprenable sur Lisbonne mais tr√®s cher (15 euros par personne) pour voir des ruines sans explications , sans commentaires, sans audio guides. Ce fut une grosse d√©ception. D‚Äôautres points de vue de Lisbonne sont √† d√©couvrir gratuitement .

title: UN ATTRAPE TOURISTE SUPER CHER
text:
Aucun interet pour 15 euros/personne √† part la vue qu on retrouve un peu partout ailleurs. une queue d√©mentiel car les gens ne savent pas ou aller √† Lisboa.
aucun am√©nagement historique, aucune explication sauf le tout petit mus√©e.
donc les gens font des photos des PAONS d√©cr√©pis. Oubliez ce lieu et traversser le fleuve en bateau pour vous retrouver sur l autre rive et admirer Lisbonne sans cohut decervel√©: ALMADA

title: Terrible - not wheelchair friendly as advised!
text:
We visiting the castle after checking it was wheelchair accessible.

Belive me it is NOT! Horrendous experience. Cobbles everywhere which wheelchair got stuck in. We didnt even go in, couldnt get up the wheelchair ramp!

Went to tourist information to asked them to call us a taxi, an extremely rude lady simply said NO we dont do that. I asked her for a number for a taxi and was told NO we dont give them put - made us feel like leppers.

Took 3/4 of an hour to get to the to the bottom of the hill where the taxi's were.

Horrible experience wont be going back to Portugal in a hurry. Very rude people everywhere making you feel like a nuicance.

title: It looked better from afar
text: I should have read more about the castle prior to our visit. Since it was never renovated after the great fire, there was nothing to see but walls and the view from atop. There are other places to get great views of the city and so many better places to spend one's time. But, apparently, my opinion differs from many others'.

title: Line was Insane
text: I purchased tickets ahead to avoid having to wait too long in line; however, when we got there, the line went all the way around the building...it was shockingly long. The people monitoring the line were very rude and not helpful at all. Not sure what the solution is for getting into the monastary without waiting too long. We ended up going into the church, which had a much shorter line and needed no ticket, but we just passed on the long, long line. It was very disappointing considering that I spent 20E on the tickets.

title: BAD experience
text: Don't buy your tickets online. You pay the money but don't receive te tickets. Buy your tickets at the entrance or stay away from this scamming attraction.

title: Juste pour la vue sur lisbonne
text:
Visite sympa mais on y va que pour la vue sur Lisbonne.

Les ramparts sont inaccessibles pour les familles avec jeunes enfants. Pas d explication si ce n est juste un pdf √† t√©l√©charger par qrcode.

A l heure actuelle, le ch√¢teau devrait innover avec des activit√©s familiales, enqu√™tes, point d informations, ...

title: Aucun inter√™t
text: Bond√©, entr√©e ch√®re pour ne faire que le tour des remparts √† √©viter. Pr√©f√©rez le monast√®re St Vincente, tr√®s int√©ressant et acc√®s au sommet le tout pour 5‚Ç¨

title: Poca historia y precio excesivamente alto. Lo √∫nico que hay por apreciar es la vista de Lisboa y los pavos reales. Sin e
text:
Poca historia y precio excesivamente alto.
Lo √∫nico que hay por apreciar es la vista de Lisboa y los pavos reales. Sin embargo, dicha vista puede ser apreciada tambi√©n por un mirador gratuitos a unos cuantos metros del castillo.

title: Trop cher pour ce que √ßa vaut.
text: Faisant partie des incontournables de Lisbonne selon plusieurs guides et sites internet touristiques, nous sommes all√© visiter le Castelo San Jorge lors de notre s√©jour. Et bien au final, m√™me si le ch√¢teau est joli et joui d'une tr√®s belle vue sur Lisbonne, 15 euros par personne pour la visite c'est clairement abusif. De plus ne fait partie des attractions visitables gratuitement avec la Lisboa Card, m√™me pas une petite r√©duction. Il y a beaucoup mieux √† faire.

title: Pickpocket in the Camara Obscura
text: I'm not talking about the Castelo itself which is well worth a visit. However, I want to warn everyone about the Camera Obscura. Watch out for pickpockets! The camera obscura is a perfect place to get your pocket picked, take it from someone who knows.

title: Con verlo desde fuera sobra.
text: Precio abusivo, puesto que lo √∫nico que tiene son las vistas hay sitios mejores con vistas sin pagar.

title: Very overpriced
text: Tickets cost us around ‚Ç¨15 each. The castle had amazing views. However, besides the exhibition, there were virtually no signs. We learnt barely anything about the castle and its history.

title: Not worth a visit - better to just admire it from outside
text: Very disappointing. There‚Äôs not much to see inside, better to just admire the walls and towers from the outside without paying for entrance. We also paid for a guided tour (the website says there are at least three daily tours), but the guide never showed up. Really not worth the time and money.

title: Prescindible
text:
Entrada cara para lo que es (15 euros por persona).
Realmente nos hemos sentido bastante estafados, ya que ha sido la entrada m√°s cara que hemos pagado. Tiene un buen mirador, pero no mejor que en cualquier otra parte. El castillo est√° reconstruido con bastante mal gusto, metiendo materiales que se notan a la legua que son sobrepuestos ah√≠. Lo mejor, los pavo reales. Si quieres, puedes prescindir de ello e invertir ese dinero en visitar otros monumentos de Lisboa.

title: Mirador caro con pavos reales
text: Me parece un precio realmente excesivo (15‚Ç¨) para un mirador con pavos reales ( preciosos, por cierto, lo mejor de la experiencia). La visita al castillo se basa en dar una vuelta por las murallas mirando las vistas de Lisboa, que son m√°s o menos las mismas que las del mirador que hay una calle m√°s abajo y admirar unos jardines que lejos de ser espectaculares como se esperar√≠a, son insulsos, aburridos y mal cuidados (vamos tres √°rboles mal plantados y un par de estatuas). No puedes pasear por el interior del castillo excepto en un par de salas. Me siento realmente estafada porque es con diferencia la entrada m√°s cara que he pagado y como ya he dicho antes es un mirador con pavos reales.

title: Cher pour ce que c‚Äôest
text:
Tr√®s beau point de vue, il n‚Äôy a pas de doute, cependant, √ßa s‚Äôarr√™te ici !
Le ch√¢teau n‚Äôa pas grand int√©r√™t, il y a peu voire pas d‚Äôexplications ni d‚Äôhistoire, et rien n‚Äôest adapt√© pour les personnes √† mobilit√© r√©duite ou les seniors.
En somme, les points de vue ne manquent pas √† Lisbonne, on peut se passer de celui-ci.

title: Lack of info
text:
I suppose I'm spoilt after seeing many uk castles
There is no signage explaining what the areas were probably used as.

Only thing it's worth is as a photo opportunity of the city
Very uneven and often dangerous pathways too

title: Risparmiate 15 euro(a persona!)
text:
Risparmiatevi 15 ‚Ç¨ a persona !Se potessi non indicherei neanche 1 stella! Pochi cartelli indicativi e incompleti. A parte le rovine delle mura del castello(niente di che...), visitate una collezione di reperti di varie epoche(ma niente di particolarmente interessante) e le rovine(poche) del quartiere fenicio,arabo e palazzo distrutto dal terremoto(visite guidate n varie lingue a determinati orari che ,assurdo che non siano indicate in biglietteria, trovate in loco, pertanto se perdete il turno , ciao ciao : niente visita).Per quanto concerne la Camera oscura per me √® stata proprio "oscura" in quanto non vi sono indicazioni per raggiungerla e poi alle 13 terminano le visite (sono arrivato alle 12,55...)ma, badate bene, per conoscere tale orario dovete arrivarci...insomma una a caccia al tesoro e, dire tesoro √® un eufemismo!
Forse per 15‚Ç¨ dovreste fare un po' di pi√π. Avrei dovuto seguire la guida del Touring Club(ottima: mi pare che noi italiani un po' ce ne intendiamo di arte, cultura etc.) che non gli dava neanche 1 stella! Per finire NON RIENTRA NELLA LISBOA CARD! Insomma una beffa!!!

title: Castelo de S. Jorge
text: It's underwhelming. I successfully skipped it on my previous visits to Lisbon as I suspected it to be boring. The views of the town are good though. Only for a medieval castles afficionado.

title: At the beginning of a century-long work
text:
The restoration of the cathedral is a work of the century. It is all the more wonderful that it has been started. It will enrich the world cultural heritage because it will not only repair the enormous damage, but will also reach back into the depths of prehistory. What one can see at present is modest. The old-fashioned collection of religious insignia and clothing is unworthy of a cathedral, but the planning sketches of the "project" hanging all around are so convincing that one leaves the church full of hope.
Gherardino

title: Horrible customer service
text: Stumbled upon this store while walking through Lisbon. I was admiring the antique wood built-ins and snapped a photo. A lady working there immediately ran towards me SCREAMING, verbally assaulting me, the other customers in the store looked horrified. I stood there confused, she then pointed saying NO PHOTOS THERES A SIGN‚Ä¶ again, stood there looking around. There was no sign in any language. I even apologized. Maybe someone took the sign down? Who knows, but I did not take a photo intentionally to break the rules. There‚Äôs a way to properly address customers and that was most certainly not it.

title: Do not use them
text: Would not recommend, they did not take us to all the places listed in the itinerary, when i inquired my dissatisfaction and asked for a partial refund due to not going to the main points of interest I was told "I should have told them my mother, who accompanied me on the tour was "disabled." No lie, their words. My mother and I have travelled the world together, shes in her 70s and walks slowly, not ill handicap or disabled. We have climbed towers, hills, fields, stairs all over Europe. I was appalled. Disgusting discrimination and horrible service, I immediately contacted my bank and explained this to them and got my money refunded.

title: Suggestions
text: Check out this review of Private Tour Sintra, Pena Palace, Quinta Regaleira, Cabo Roca, Cascais on Tripadvisor: https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g189158-d18926529-r886421091-Private_Tour_Sintra_Pena_Palace_Quinta_Regaleira_Cabo_Roca_Cascais-Lisbon_Lisbo.html

title: Beautiful Sites and would have been better if‚Ä¶.
text:
The tour would have been a better experience if there was more information about where we were going, how long we were staying and what to expect.

Due to the ticket slots, we had limited time at Sintra and it felt rushed. It didn‚Äôt help that the process for queuing and ticketing was confusing and disorganized ( not the tours fault of course!). We also expected an actual guided tour to accompany us rather than drop us off ( perhaps I didn‚Äôt read the fine print).

And it was a long day, and suggest tour guides ask and offer periodically rest room stops and beverages. We had a person in the group with limited mobility and the tour guide didn‚Äôt specify where the restrooms were and we we all left on our own to figure it out. We did see some beautiful sites and appreciated being driven as it would have been challenging to do this on our own. Overall, glad we had this experience but would only recommend if there were more improvements in the customer experience.

title: A fuir - accident - peur de notre vie
text:
A Fuir - Accident - Peur de la vie - Notre chauffeur Felipe s‚Äôest endormi au volant. La voiture a d√©vi√© dans la montagne - mon mari a r√©ussi √† attraper le volant avant le prochain virage et le ravin. (Route de montagne entre Cascais et Sintra). Aucune excuse de Celina et Felipe et aucune explication. Ces personnes n‚Äôont pas conscience de leur responsabilit√© en emmenant 8 personnes dans un minibus et la gravit√© de l‚Äôaccident qui aurait pu tuer 8 personnes. Venue visiter Lisbonne en couple, j‚Äôai cru que je ne reverrai jamais mes enfant.
Un autre chauffeur est venu prendre le relais mais la journ√©e √©tait g√¢ch√©e et nous avions la peur au ventre pour continuer.
Celina a refus√© tout d√©dommagement. Nous allons d√©noncer cette personne aupr√®s des autorit√©s pour √©viter que cela se reproduise.

title: Cemetery of Help
text:
Camps with displaced singeries.
Weeds among graves

Clearly poorly cared for and without respect for the deceased

title: Shameful cemetery
text: Unmaintained cemetery that mostly seems abandoned. To find tombs you need to take a catana to find the dead in the middle of the mangal. Shame and lack of respect for the dead and relatives.

title: Closed unfortunately
text:
Probably very nice but unfortunately it was closed now because they had a lot of damage because of the storm and they are now cleaning this up.
Didn't stand time on when it would open again.

title: PETS NOT ALLOWED
text: It is unfortunate that at this point a shopping center does not admit pets inside ... we talk about shopping area, not food that I can understand, Portugal is light years from Spain in that.

title: Lisbon is not dog frienly, despite what they can say
text:
We have not been able to go because pets are not allowed. We have a dog bichon maltes of 2 kg and we were told that we could not go with her, even in a transport bag.
It is not an easy city to travel with dog.
Nor do restaurants let you be inside. We had to eat with high temperatures on the terrace.
Some taxi driver said no with such a small dog.

title: Thieves
text: Shit experience, they charge me 31‚Ç¨ for a cut when it‚Äôs 16 the base without telling me before, thieves don‚Äôt go there it‚Äôs an embarrassing place

title: Full and messy
text:
Very crowded, disorganized, crowded stores, food court chaos
There is no map to identify stores and areas

title: No baby structure!
text:
A lack of respect for families. Such a big shopping center with almost no baby changing facilities.
We had to walk a lot with the baby to find one... and there was a long line.

title: Take care of your wallets, cell phones and purchases..I was stolen without realizing it.......
text:
Big mall with lots of good stores....but with disguised thieves...they stole my wallet from my bag without me noticing and I was very disappointed. It was sad.
Pay attention to your belongings... cell phone, wallet, documents, purchases...

title: Cachupa for urban bistros
text:
This week, in a "gathering" of friends, I went to this restaurant for the first time, hoping to eat a cachupa "the style".
We started with the starters - samosas and corn pastries. I confess that I had difficulty checking from a distance whether they were in the cup, but it was true, they were around 5 cm and the filling of the latter should not have been more than 1/2 teaspoon. Next came the famous braised Cachupa, WOW, on the plate I ate beans with two slices placed on the spot, one of chorizo and the other of black pudding, I was also lucky enough to find two small cubes of carrot, at the end the dessert was famous Kamoca, which saved the meal. At the end of the table they shouted "Hey, don't be boring, this is Bistro". UPS, maybe I have to set the GPS for another Cape Verdean restaurant for Cape Verdeans, but without a Bistro.
Otherwise, the space is interesting, and perhaps worth the experience.
