After an unkind hostess DE caisse, great disappointment: not much to learn, immersion / atmosphere well.
Lack DE presentation of objects placed behind a grid and not a pane of glass.
The ticket entitles you to a free ticket valid for 1 year the next day, super interesting for tourists ü´©.
So, visit not essential.

title: Too bad!
text: It is very unfortunate that the whole exhibition is in English, no audio guide in French... so for me difficult to understand, it goes too fast. Very disappointed!

title: meh...
text: I really *wanted* to love this museum, which I visited on a weekday in mid-March 2025, but it was a bust. The museum space was pleasant, but exhibits didn't convey much information. Unless you're scrambling to find an indoor activity on a hot summer afternoon, I wouldn't bother.

title: It is not worth wasting time or $ on site. Better watch it on YouTube, there should be better information.
text:
Very bad historical information. You should have a video about the fish that are considered cod tb not an informative without a word.
It is not worth buying for him or what they offer that is the Lisbon story center. Very bad.

title: Francophone, passez votre chemin
text:
Visite comprise dans le prix de la Lisboa Card. On tente... et on est d√©√ßu.
Tout est en portugais ou en anglais.
Le site reste beau et contemporain.
Aucune d√©gustation.

title: Toilettes maintenance
text: Filthy toilets with no hygiene. I think there is no regular checks of the condition of the toilettes and the work of the cleaners. Everyting else in the shopping center is high quality.

title: I avoid something to consume here
text:
Why not take pictures in Shopping? What do they have to hide?
Seguranca says it's not a public space? Blackboard at the entrance small you have to look!

title: A MEDIUM SHOPPING WITHOUT BIG BRANDS OR VARIETY
text: IF YOU'RE USED TO MALLS IN THE USA OR ANY CAPITAL OF LATIONAMERICA... DON'T GO... GOING TO THE PARK OF NATIONS SERVES...THE TRAIN STATION OF CALATRAVA IS BEAUTIFUL...BUT SHOPPING IS UNNECESSARY TO WASTE TIME

title: Espa√ßo crian√ßa
text: Muito triste, n√£o h√° uma zona de lazer onde crian√ßas se possam entreter e brincar, com a supervis√£o do pai enquanto a m√£e faz uma das coisas que mais gostas andar nas compras...

title: Source without water
text:
This fountain next to the arch at St. Mamede, was built by the year 1805, taking advantage of the water that passed through the top of the arch where it is inserted.
Consisting of two tubes and two independent stone containers below, there was no water when I passed through the place, nor did it seem to have recently, so it does not fulfill its function.
In addition, it is a fountain without decorative motifs, could only be useful, but uninteresting.

title: O pior restaurante do mundo
text:
Restaurante a precisar de ser visitado pela ASAE falta se limpeza entradas pessimas empregados e patroes perdidos.
Empregados a correr sala dessarrumada falta de higiene e organiza√ß√£o.
Filmado parece um filme comico.

title: Not very aesthetic and not functional
text: It is an ancient fountain (mentioned since the 13th century) but whose current appearance is probably due to subsequent interventions (such as the two central bronze mouths in the shape of a horse's head, created in the 20th century, in memory of those which in ancient times they must have existed anyway, given that it was once known as the horse fountain). Structurally it is very simple, being made up of a long limestone wall leaning against a building on the northern side of the square of the same name, from which the water should come out from three pairs of spouts: two lateral ones that throw directly into the manhole covers and a central one (the one with horse heads) which feeds a low basin. The water does not come out of any spout, although perhaps at least the power plants should work occasionally, given the presence of water in the tank.

title: Source without water
text:
It is a well-known spring, but not beautiful, which has no water and has no signs of having recently.
It was built between 1753 and 1754, has four tubes and is divided into two spaces: the first on the highest floor, with two tubes, intended for people, and the lower part with the remaining two tubes, with water that was the remains of the upper part, served as a drinking place for animals.
It is located in a corner of the Largo do Rato and can pass unnoticed easily.

title: It doesn't work and the context doesn't help
text: Eighteenth-century baroque fountain in a corner of the square, between rua do Salitre and rua da Escola. Quite imposing but with a not particularly elaborate structure: against a wall, above which a private garden seems to extend, it begins at the top with an apparently empty aedicule, under which is the display of the fountain whose cornice is decorated with three vases ; against the lower part of the exhibition there are two small semicircular basins which collect water from two spouts; this first sector of the fountain rests on a terrace equipped with a parapet and which is accessed via two lateral staircases; at pavement level, attached to the base of the parapet, there is a rectangular basin with rounded corners which collects water from two spouts above. The fountain, in addition to having a modest artistic level, is dry and non-functional and the tanks become a receptacle for rubbish. The surrounding context, then, certainly does not contribute to enhancing the fountain, given that we are in Largo do Rato, which is a complicated and very busy intersection of many roads.

title: Not worth the amount charged
text: I bought a hat for 107.5 euros. A very expensive price, but having said that the quality was great. I took great care with the hat, without putting it in my suitcase when traveling, but within a week it TORN. It's a shame I didn't return to Portugal in time to complain to the store. But a hat this good wouldn't tear like that. They also don't do tax refound which, given the price of the products, is unacceptable.

title: Terrible experience
text:
Terrible sales assistant at Rossio plaza.

She told us ‚Äúthe hats were expensive‚Äù not even knowing our budget. When we asked for the one to try on she didnt even help to find our size, just asked which one to give us as if we were supposed to know.

Do not recommend this place for a terrible service and non- professionalism. Lazy ladies.

title: A bad experience
text:
We have been greatly disappointed. Very little or not recommended place to go with children since there are practically no dishes for them on the menu
The service could be very improved as well as the food.
I wouldn't repeat it again.
The only good thing is the views.

title: Stolen phone
text: Nice place, the review is still negative because of the terrible experience we had last night, phone stolen from my friend, there was no policeman on the main avenue of Chiado. There's a real gang of muggers operating undisturbed for who knows when. Strange there are no other reports of this kind.

title: Service not provided, poor experience
text:
Booked the day of the experience and that went smoothly. Afterwards, waited for few hours for the business to open at 9 am so I could hear from them and discuss the plan. The experience was supposed to be custom for my family. No call/ message came through. I called the number and the guy just kept saying to wait for WhatsApp message. Kept saying to check if my WhatsApp is working and just insisted there has to be a problem at my end. When I told him that was not the case, and I was not having him tell me the issue was mine, he just hung up!! I then did not have the heart to call him again. I called trip advisor. They said someone should send me a message and I did indeed get a message. However, this person was now driving a tuk tuk and was too busy to set up a plan. He asked for few minutes. Some 40 mins later, I asked him to give an update and nothing happened. He did offer to pick us up from our hotel at 4 x the price of a regular taxi service in Lisbon (Bolt). I said we can just take the taxi as we have a baby too. We could then meet him at the historic center. No further response from him.
I intend to dispute the charge through my credit card company. However, the point is not the money. I paid a little over $42 for a half hour of tuk tuk.
We then just set out on our own and found an amazing guy who took us around for half that price and showed us around the major attractions on a 1 hour tour.
The point is just that this was a terrible experience and I do not recommend to any one else. You can easily go to historic area and negotiate the price that is suitable (50 euro for 1 h is easily doable). No point in and

title: Driver was a No-Show
text: Our driver did not show up at 1100. I received an email on the day of our tour, stating driver was available at 1000, to which I replied by email that we were agreeable to that earlier time and provided my mobile number as I do not have Whatsapp. My husband and I waited from 0950 through 1110 and no driver showed up nor notified us via email or phone. I tried to call the number listed on Trip Advisor three times and after listening to a recorded brief message in Portuguese, the phone call ended, so I could not speak to any representative.

title: Poor
text: We had to cancel due to terrible storm, our cruise couldn't dock. We were unable to get refund even though we requested. We couldn't complain to trip advisor as not able to contact them.

title: Didn‚Äôt bother to show up.
text: Waited 30 mins, they didn‚Äôt bother to show up. No message received. Much better to walk to centre of town & grab anyone available for cash.

title: Awful.
text: Dreadful! It was the only disappointing part of our whole 2 week trip to Portugal. Not Eduardo‚Äôs fault but the fault of the owner who is a pure scam artist. Beware! This company is a scam. We paid the ‚Ç¨20 for the initial 20 minutes understanding from the website that it was ‚Äòfully‚Äô customisable and that we could extend for as long as we wanted to pay. NO. Upon arrival we were told that as we had only paid for 20 minutes that is all we would get. I called the owner and stated that is not what is advertised. Basically he had another client that he wanted to give the business to and so we got dumped. Eduardo took us to ONE viewpoint which alone took 20 minutes, no return to our starting point and no Portuguese drink as advertised. I asked the owner for the money back but he refused. Also note that after the first 20 minutes you are charged ‚Ç¨20 for each we minutes thereafter which = ‚Ç¨60 for one hour - almost double or triple other companies. Total scam artists. I am so angry I will be writing bad reviews about them for a LONG time to spare other visitors the agony. Avoid this company!

title: Horrible
text:
2 r√©servations annul√©es (rembours√©es 48h apr√®s) dont une sans pr√©-avis et l autre 16h auparavant.
On avait reserv√© et venus de l Italie pour visiter Fatima.
On a d√ª prendre un taxi.
Evitez Viator surtout au Portugal.
Nous ne sommes pas les seuls

title: Not worth the hassle with this specific company
text: I couldn't locate the person. I tried asking other Tuk Tuk drivers and none knew who my driver was. I finally found someone who could have been my driver, but when I finished asking his name all he said was "You're my client?" And walked away. I'm not sure if that was my actual driver or not, but either way the experience of walking around with my heavy travel bag and being embarrassed that I not only couldn't find my driver, but had another one walk away and having me make the assumption that he was my driver and didn't want anything to do with me, embarrassed me, flustered me, and was making my Lisbon experience horrible. If it hadn't been for this other absolutely amazing person who also did Tuk Tuk tours (no correlation to this company) I would've been severely disappointed with my experience with my 1st visit to Lisbon. Would not recommend this specific tour company unless you want to walk around aimlessly searching for your driver. Also, as a side note, there was no language barrier to use as an excuse as Portuguese is my first language and English is my second. Therefore there was no way anything could've been "mixed up" in the translation process.

title: Church closed on the date dedicated to the Saint.
text: On the day dedicated to the Saint, I went to the Church and found the main door closed. I managed a side entrance and when trying to enter the temple I was stopped by a group of ladies, who, in a very unfriendly tone, without explaining reasons, prevented me from praying. Unfortunate.

title: Bad service
text:
Very poor service, not in line with the asking price.
The information indicated by the venue does not correspond to reality

title: Unfortunate and scabrosa situation at the bar/restaurant
text:
At the Cinemateca Bar/Restaurant, a historic institution, funded by the taxes of all of us, I was served a Tonic Gin that was basically made up of (big) ice stones.

After complaining about what happened, I was told that a fixed measure of gin was used, and that there was nothing that could be done. Having this in mind, I ordered the complaint book, which I received without a pen. When I asked for the pen to fill in my complaint, it was denied.

When I was denied my pen, I announced that I refused to pay for a Gin made up of ice stones, and I left, promising never to come back.

I write this complaint as a form of warning, for what this episode illustrates about Lisbon and the life it offers to the few Portuguese who still live and/or try to attend it.

The Cinemateca was an anchor of the city, a space for debate, where artists and intellectuals met. Where the classics of the history of cinema were made available to the population, and each visit was taught

Today is something completely different, permanently full of tourists, the bar/esplanade has become a place where maximizing profits prevails. This maximization of profits implies minimizing the well-being of the places that attend it, and the quality of what is served to them, as my example can illustrate.

This would already be bad enough, but it would become even worse because we are talking about an institution financed by the state, and by the taxes of all of us, taxes whose collection, for situations like these, becomes increasingly difficult to justify.

title: very hot room, uncomfortable for 3 hours of film
text: Yesterday I went to see the Oppenheimer film, which lasts 3 hours, the room was full, the seats are not the most comfortable and the room was hot like a sauna, very uncomfortable, it wasn't really a good experience, I just wanted the film ended as quickly as possible, but there it was 3 hours in the sauna, with lots of people using the boxes of popcorn to act like a fan, anyway

title: Take your money...
text: I do not recommend. For the price is not justified at all. It's the second time I'm going. The first time the film was delayed because there was a giant queue in the only rollot that existed inside the grounds to eat, and there were no big options nearby (it was below the April 25 bridge, in the climbing zone). I went again at 07/2025. The venue of the event was changed after the purchase of tickets, which I did not like. It was at the naval dock in Lisbon, there was a bad wind, I could only hear the carripana engine that gave the energy for the transmission of the film all the time. In addition, the bathroom was more than 100 meters away and there was no light or way to lock the door. The organization is always bad, save your money and watch the movie at home, where you will be 100% more comfortable and you will not have to walk 5 minutes to go to the bathroom. There are better outdoor cinema options that are not at this ridiculous price and with this bad organization.

title: Not worth the money
text: The idea of a cinema outside in a nice location is good but the way this has been setup is not good at all. The screen is way too small for a cinema feeling if you are sitting past row 5 and the chairs a pretty uncomfortable. The worst thing however is that the bar next to the location keeps playing loud music which you hear a lot. Overall this event should spend more money in the experience and less in marketing. For us it was definitely not worth the money.

title: Hugely Disappointed!
text: Having seen reviews and advertising online as the rooftop open cinema set amongst the traditional Lisbon city back drop I thought this would be an unique experience. It was definitely unique and for the wrong reasons, I arrived to a projector screen with the back drop of a side road and people parking cars dumped on the end of the patio for the ritz hotel. Hugely disappointed, don‚Äôt be fooled by the photos and locations you see online you won‚Äôt be getting that. Also to add don‚Äôt come hungry as the Que to order food and drinks takes 20 minutes as there‚Äôs one cashier taking orders and payments, ridiculous!

title: Falta de profissionalismo
text:
T√≠nhamos 2 bilhetes para dia 23, n√£o fomos informados do cancelamento, nem nos foi devolvido o dinheiro.
N√£o atendem os telefones e n√£o respondem ao email.
Nada profissionais.

title: No recommendation for Aveiro half-day tour
text: From four hours you spend 2 hours in the bus! No time to visit the beach or the place on the beach. The boat trip in Aveiro is amusing (good boatman), but there is no sign of Venice feeling. There is no time to visit Aveiro. We booked English, 3/4 was Spanish! The guide Christina, spoke monotonously on the bus all the time, asleep! The tour would have to last at least 2 hours longer and offer guides who have substantial say. Absolutely not a recommendation! Not worth the money!

title: Disorganized, Misleading, and Inconsiderate ‚Äì the Gray lines - A Tour to Avoid
text:
We booked the Grey Line Lisbon tour hoping for a comfortable, informative experience. What we got instead was confusion, poor planning, and complete disregard for guests‚Äô needs‚Äîespecially those with mobility issues.

The tour began poorly: we were picked up from our hotel and dropped off in a parking lot, where we waited over 45 minutes for the buses to arrive. There was mass confusion and almost no communication from the Grey Line staff.

Eventually, we boarded a packed bus and drove toward Pena Palace. We were told we‚Äôd be taken halfway up the mountain by bus‚Äîthis part was overcrowded and uncomfortable. Once dropped off, we were forced to walk a steep uphill section to the palace entrance. After reaching the top, we then waited 30 minutes in a tight, crowded space before being allowed inside.

The palace visit itself was just as disappointing. The guide, Mariza, gave very minimal information‚Äîfirst in Portuguese, then English‚Äîand once we got off the bus, she remained with the vehicle while we were left completely on our own to explore. She provided no history or explanation of the palace or its significance, which was a major letdown.

After the visit, I asked where the bus was to take us back down the mountain, as she had originally stated. She told me flatly that no bus would be coming and that instead, she would lead us on a ‚Äúshortcut‚Äù down the hill‚Äîclaiming it would only take six minutes. I asked again if my wife, who has a bad knee, could take a bus instead. She said no.

The walk down was steep, uneven cobblestone‚Äîtreacherous and painful for my wife, and very difficult for anyone with mobility concerns. The guide showed no empathy or flexibility, and we felt abandoned and misled.

To make matters worse, we had also been told that headphones would be provided so we could clearly hear the guide during the tour. These were never provided.

Overall, this felt more like a disorganized shuttle service than a guided tour. If you value your time, comfort, or accurate expectations‚Äîavoid this company. This was a stressful and unpleasant experience, and I would not recommend it to anyone, especially seniors or those with any physical limitations.

title: Terrible last minute cancellation by Cityrama tour operator
text:
No your staff on site
Last minute message ten minutes before schedule to depart that ‚Äòno bookings today‚Äô
Had to spend $$$ to get other transport last minute
Terrible service

title: Shit.
text:
The worst trick ever. We did not have time to visit the places. Quick hurts. We've only passed.
I made a complaint asking for a refund and I never got a response.
This company is only there to make money and doesn‚Äôt care about visitors.

title: Stay off the Lisbon Hop On Hop Off Bus
text:
Took the Gray Line Hop On Hop Off Bus Tour. Avoid.

The double deck busses are partly open on the upper level but are not air conditioned either upstairs or down.

The busses are too big to negotiate the inner core of Lisbon so the route mostly passes through the unprepossessing and graffiti strewn inner suburbs. These areas look any other southern European city. Street after street of mid rise apartment blocks with the occasional public park.

The highlight of the trip was to have been the monument to the discoveries of the early renaissance and the Belem Tower. Be aware that both these monuments are in semi industrial zones and bordered by busy railway lines that detract from any sense of history or grandeur. Also at the time of writing, June 2025, the Belem Tower is shrouded in scaffolding.

This bus tour is a waste of time and money. Avoid

title: Disappointing
text: Our guide was knowledgeable and energetic. However, the group included people speaking different languages, so much of the time was wasted. The boat wasn‚Äôt nice- more like a bus on the water. They stuffed us onto small chairs in the cabin where we couldn‚Äôt see anything. Nobody provided any narration of what we were looking at, as the guide didn‚Äôt join us on the boat.

title: Better to walk!
text: So disappointed with this tour. Was hoping to see all the great parts of Porto, instead we went through boring residential and industrial areas for almost 2 hours. Wanted to hop off at Wow but the bus hardly even stopped so we couldn‚Äôt get off. Hopped off at the next stop and walked to Vila Nova de Gaia which was fabulous. Commentary was on and off, even when changing seats. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend this tour and wasted 50 euro.

title: Two and a half hours of my life I‚Äôll never get back.
text:
Unless you are wanting an expensive siesta on a plastic seat avoid this Hop on Hop off bus tour!
This tour was so boring. The blue and green lines have been merged and it took two and a half hours instead of the one and a quarter on the brochure. There was no commentary at all for nearly thirty minutes while we went through some industrial area. During what should have been a straight run down the longest road to the coast was broken up by detours through ordinary housing areas. Just woeful.

title: To be avoided at all costs
text: Horrible! Buses do not pass at all stops. A terrible waste of time. And the drivers are in a hurry! There's no need to make any claims, everyone's passing the ball to each other!

title: DRIVERS ANTIPATHETIC BUSES
text:
Overall the sightseeing tour of the city of Porto was pretty good.

Bus drivers very unfriendly and unwilling to help.

title: Dissapointing and unnecessary attitude from bus driver.
text: Lovely tour but just very upset why did the bus driver not even stop properly and open the doors for us to get on at bus stop #9!! And we called for him to stop and open but just simply ignored us. Totally unnecessary. And no, the bus was not full, we could see many empty seats in both bottom and top platforms.

title: Rushed
text: I was quite disappointed with this tour. I had been looking forward to visiting Fatima for many months. I chose this tour as it was self-guided, however, I guess I naively assumed I would be provided with some written material and/or maps, which I wasn‚Äôt. Before we even arrived at Fatima, we stopped unexpectedly at an overpriced coffee/souvenir shop for 30-45 minutes, time that would have been better spent at Fatima. We arrived at Fatima at 1045 and were given a very brief overview before being left on our own and instructed to meet back at 1245. I visited on a Sunday and wanted to attend mass which started outdoors at 1100. Beware that the outdoor Sunday mass can last from 1 1/2 to 2 hours, almost the entire time that is allowed to explore. Since I wanted to attend mass, my time was very rushed and I didn‚Äôt get to see all that there was to see. When we met back at 1245, we were informed there was not enough time to visit the children‚Äôs village home. This was extremely disappointing as I was really looking forward to seeing it. I now understand that Sundays are busy, but perhaps there should be some mention in the tour description of this and that because of this the itinerary may not be fulfilled. I feel that my Fatima experience, although good, was not what it could have been with this company. I missed out on a lot and because of that I feel the tour operators failed me as a customer. I would not recommend this tour company if you want a fulfilling visit to Fatima.

title: Shocking Company
text:
Travelling with my elderly mother and my brother, we purchased the basic hop on/off tour. We had already independently been to Belem and just wanted to see a bit more on the other side (Blue Line) of where we were staying. Tickets were bought directly from the ticket office. We were offered no information as to where we should go, and it was chaos around the bus stops. Turns out that several different companies leave from the same place. You are hearded onto the busses, none too politely by completely disinterested staff. You then set off on what is supposed to be a SIGHTSEEING tour!!! Well, if you consider driving slowly through rundown areas on the equivalent of A-roads/motorways, then by all means, waste your money! The ONLY bit of actual sightseeing (and I use the term losely) was the Vasco Da Gama bridge.
The 'tour' took close to two hours until the bus broke down by the zoo! We were left to find our own way back or opt to wait 30-50 minutes for the next tour bus to pass.
This company is a horrendous tourist trap. Avoid like the plague! I expect the only reason they run this 'tour' is that it conveniently has its own stop by the cruise terminal.
A ¬£65 mistake which, regrettably left a bad taste after a super holiday in Lisbon.

title: Better go!
text:
We have already done hop-on/hop-of bus tours in some countries, but we are disappointed with Lisbon.
Today is a big football game and the buses stop running from 1pm and the orange line just doesn't run at all. We were not informed about this during the ticket run. No accommodating the employee when we brought it up... just a cheeky response and that was it. D.h. We paid 2 days, but only used 1 really. I think it's pretty outrageous! That's how you can make your money!

title: Celebration of 40th anniversary of marriage
text: Fizemos um passeio Orient line. In Vienna we did a Hop on Hop off tour, very good, we learned a lot about the city. This ride was awful, the driver walked very fast, broke abruptly, talked on the cell phone throughout the journey, the information on the phone, he placed manually, out of time or did not put or stopped abruptly, in the middle of the information. We were going to do other tours, other lines, but let's try the other company. Need to improve the driver, the bus is good, the speaker, but the driver is zero note

title: Bad experience
text:
Poor planning of the trip. List of activities and time not respected. Little time made available to see the individual things.
The very grumpy and above all rude guide.
I bought a ticket that included the shuttle that would take you to the place to take the actual bus. The shuttle never arrived and after asking for a refund they took me by bus to the center of Sintra and from there I was reunited with the rest of the group.
Experience in general that I would not recommend.

title: Horrible.
text: Horrible experience. The super unpleasant and rude driving. We bought tickets at a kiosk there then downtown for the same afternoon only to find out that the tickets were for the next day. In order not to refund our tickets, they took us by shuttle to where the bus is that we should have taken, treating ourselves differently from the other people who were already on the bus.

title: Over crowder. Oversold.
text:
Oversold. Way too crowded. Standing room only. Long wait time between busses. Few stops of interest.

I saw smaller speciality car options that I should of taken.

title: To avoid!!!
text:
1- had to start every 25 minutes. We left after 1 hour.
2-was to be a shuttle bus that was to take us to point 1 but since the bus was full they decided to start the tour without
Warn us and we left the bus at point 1
3- take a bus to continue the tour, which took about 5 minutes.
4- the bus was almost full we were sitting downstairs which we do not like and in addition we were separated.
5- very boring red line, no interest.
6- 1st and last time with Gray Line. I go continuous with the company Hop On Hop Off!!!

title: Nobody's home.
text: Worst quote tour we've done. No organization, suck comments. In short go to their competitors, but above all forget gray line

title: Bad experience
text: Incorrect and unprofessional.Excursion canceled the same morning of departure without being warned. You make up absurd excuses to justify the cancellation, little courtesy, we even had to argue to have the refund and 'our right.

title: Greyline Lisbon Hop On Hop Off is Horrible!
text: Taken many hop on hop off bus tours in many countries and this was by far the worst. I wrote the company to make sure that the bus went to Cascais, Lisbon. They wrote me back to say that I should be at the tour meeting place at 9am to go to Cascais. I got there at 8:45 am only to find that the tour left at 8:30 am! I then went on the Belem tour where the audio did not work for the first 15+ min. I got back for the Cascais tour only to find that the audio on the second bus did not work ever and the driver did not announce the stops. Because I missed the 1st tour to Cascais, when I new there would be no rain, when I got to Cascais it was raining so hard that I could not walk around the town. I was so disgusted with the tour bus company that I took the train back to Lisbon, so I wouldn't waste any more time with a company that has defective equipment and doesn't communicate accurately. I will not use Greyline again.

title: Boring
text:
Boring, nothing worth seeing on the Basic ride except Belen‚Äôs Tower and you can get there easier and cheaper.
Have used their services in other countries without a problem but this was awful. Avoid.

title: Never again
text: Don't waste your time,2 disable told we could stay on bus but got thrown off and told to get another bus back to port, was given wrong map when booking, not just us but everyone had wrong map

title: Disappointed with the service.
text: Bus times were not regular and given misinformation by the staff. Waited more than an hour for a bus in the middle of the afternoon, not leaving us long until the service stopped. The headphones didn‚Äôt work either.

title: A big disappointment
text: We went on Sunday March 30th. We have travelled all over the world and participated in many tours. This was the worst. I would not recommend this tour. The guide stayed on the bus at the Belem Tower, the Monument to the Discoveries and the Jeronimos Monastery. She did not tell us where we could buy tickets for the monastery. She took us around the palace and spoke in a monotonous voice. To me this would only be interesting if you had a good background in the history of the Portuguese Royal family. It would have been more fun and cheaper to take an Uber and walk to the first three places and purchased tickets to the Monastery on our own. We were very disappointed.

title: To flee
text: Very poor service: expensive, headphones that do not work on half the seats, stupid drivers, missed and limited hours (last bus at 5:30pm). If you visit Porto, you will spend 1-2 days in the Ribiera district which is visited on foot. For the rest, take the subway, bus, tram or limit taxis, you will save time and money

title: overpriced
text: The time was not well distributed over the different places and the entry for Batalha was not included (also there would not have been enough time to enter). The guide was really nice but he just gave information in the bus and did not accompany us in the places as well, which I think would have been nice in Fatima for more infermation

title: Company needs to sort out their equipment.
text:
We arrived at cruise terminal and delighted to see a stand to enable us to buy tickets for the Hop on Hop off bus tour of Lisbon. Queued for tickets and were directed to bus number 3052.
Joined another queue as people were purchasing tickets on the steps of the bus. We were not allowed on but had to wait in line even though we had tickets.
Sat upstairs and tried to connect to the commentary however the unit was so worn it was impossible to see the screen and pick the language. We had to wait until other passengers left so we could move into their seats.
The tour itself was ok, usual hop on hop off bus commentary and local music, but it gave us a feel for the place and an idea of places to visit.
A better way of loading passengers is needed and someone needs to check and replace faulty equipment. This is the start of the season - get your act together.

title: Unfortunate waste of money
text: Very disappointed. Paid for a 72 hour ticket and halfway through the second day was told our tickets were not valid. Drivers in general were rude and when I let one of them know that he did not stop long enough for us to even unplug the headphones to exit he just said he did not speak English. The stories were unclear and filled with company advertisements while many did not match our locations, nor did a few of the stops match where the map said we would be. We never were able to find the boat tour and could not catch the blue line because it ran so infrequently. While waiting at a stop for over 20 minutes for our bus, another company had 3 busses stop. Overall, it was an unfortunate waste of money.

title: Cascais with unexpected break
text:
Careful when you go to Cascais.

There is a schedule on some of the buses outside, but it is not transparent.

You should not get stuck on the bus during the Cascais tour and do the tour as a round trip without getting off, as is possible with other tours, e.g. restricted persons or in bad weather.
The bus stops at an unattractive parking lot for at least 30 minutes. You don't know anything about it, nothing in the papers, no announcement, nothing. After some waiting time asked the friendly bus driver and learned about it with hands and feet, but then it was too close to take advantage of the unexpected break.
At least 10 people on the bus felt the same way, 'waste of lifetime'.

Too bad the tour and also the other tours are good.

Beware, the Gray Line bus is also red and easy to mistake for the red line.

title: Disappointing
text: TIME & INFORMATION - Very disappointing...We were told the 32euro price was good for 48 hours instead of 24 (on brochure) and, all of the three routes in Lisbon. Over 45 minutes spent waiting for a red bus (while quoted "every 25 minutes"), while 3 hop on hop off yellow buses picked up their people in the town center. We had a small van/bus. While on the red route, much of our time was spent waiting at the various stops and the audio not working either.

title: Poor quality, bad driving. Quite scary.
text:
Purchased 2 tickets for the Red and the Green hop-on and hop-off bus tours, thinking it was a different company. Similar bus livery, several people were caught out trying to get on the wrong buses.

Commentary was almost non-existent, and what there was would suddenly stop to announce a stop and then not resume. Badly out of sync with location, with random announcements about a place with no indication of where it was e g. "The British Cemetery", various statues etc.

I was an aficionado of folk music and of Fado before this trip. I am now cured. It was over played through all journeys.

The quality of driving was abysmal, hurtling around narrow streets and sudden braking as a result - especially the green route. Incredibly uncomfortable and quite scary. I saw quite a few passengers reaching for their seatbelts.

Use the other company.

NB - didn't do the boat trip - this is about the Castle and Bel√®m routes only. Definitely avoid the Castle route if you're not in possession of valium.

title: Hop on Hop off Lisbon Sightseeing Gray Line 2024/2025 by Marques de Pombal!
text:
Blue-eyed we unfortunately bought two full-day tickets for one day from a lady who approached us at the Marques de Pombal! for all lines! (red, blue, green, grey)
Actually, we had to transfer several times on each bus, as it was hardly possible to find 2 working headphone ports in a bench next to each other.
At a price of Euro 64,- for two people that would probably be the minimum that should work! on a sightseeing tour! Unfortunately all buses obsolete, not working, cheaply equipped, and out of date for 2024!!!
With the red line we stood/waited a felt 20-30 minutes somewhere at the port! No idea why!? No info on that!
At the green Castle Line, very strenuous driver!! we all got wet unfortunately, because it was not possible to stay dry during a short downpour!
This day with Cityrama Gray Line was by far the worst in Lisbon!!

title: Bad service
text: It was a terrible service. The buses DO NOT follow the given time tables, they came more than 20 minutes late and also for example, in the Cascais line, it said it left Cascais at 11, but it didn‚Äôt. On the other than, they don‚Äôt follow the lines or the routes, again in the Cascais line (took it on the 9 am Saturday 12 of December) the bus didn‚Äôt stop at 6 or 7 stop, it just turned around and didn‚Äôt finish. Also, the ground staff are rude and even though you kindly ask questions? They just look at you like you are bothering them.

title: Dire end
text: I denounce that at the end of the Sintra excursion today, November 28, 2024 and after the end of the excursion the bus did NOT take us back to the Hotel M√°rquez De Pompal in Lisbon. The Lady Guide named Dorita took us off the bus on avenue away from our hotel and we had to walk back without knowing exactly where the hotel was. I consider that we pay for hotel pickup (which you did in the morning) and drop us off at the hotel upon returning from Sintra, which you did NOT. It is an unpleasant behavior for a tourist so it must be condemned and not repeated.

title: Horrible
text: The tour was in 4 languages so you got maybe one sentence about a place and then they moved on to another language. The 2 photo sites were pretty. The guide was monotone and so unengaged. At the monetary we weren't told how to get tickets and by the time we figured it out we had to leave. It turns out the church is free to enter but was under renovations which was also not shared with us at the time. The national Palace was not worth the time or money. All in all a very frustrating and unsatisfactory tour. I would avoid this tour.

title: Rubbish,thieves not worth the money
text:
This firm is rubbish I purchased the two day hop on hop off tick at the Cruise terminal from Gray line
The first part which due to traffic takes half an hour takes in nothing no sites to see
On reaching the change over point to get on to the purple line I asked the driver a question he turned out to be very difficult, ignorant and just said get of the bus.
The purple line bus was over half an hour late arriving at the change over point when we got to stop 7 we asked this driver when the next bus was he said one and a half hours. We duly turned up at the bus stop 15 mins early only to find the buses had stopped running,we had to get an Uber back to the Cruise terminal
There were no representatives available at the Cruise terminal the next day to take this up with.
On contacting Gray line they told me I should have downloaded the winter bus times (we were not informed of this)
On speaking to the normal red hop on hop off bus representatives they said that Gray line always have this problem and the reps do not turn up on day two
Do your self a favour and don‚Äôt use Gray line they are rubbish and refuse to reimburse me my bus ticket price and Uber cost
USE THE NORMAL RED HOP ON HOP OFF BUS

title: Blue Line rip off
text: The gray line blue line is a rip off, very little narration mostly music. Driver rude when I asked why there was no talking, just music he told me to write a complaint and blurted out a number. Apparently I was not the first to express a concern. Lesson learned don‚Äôt pay for the Blue line on Grayline.

title: Make Another Selection
text: The bus was never on schedule, we waited over 45 mins to board the first bus of the day only to go 2 miles and sit for another 20 minutes. Very unorganized, not reliable, and they waste a lot of your time just sitting on the bus in one location. There are several other tour buses in this city, try them, the red bus seems more frequent and organized... may have more buses or something.

title: Steer clear and never again
text:
steer clear....headphone narrating - hard to hear and understand.
hop on and off a joke. was a cruise port stop. wanted to go around once to get my bearings - also a joke. was dropped off 1/2 way and instructed to wait to catch the next bus for part 2 of the tour before they would take me back to port. caught taxi and went back to ship instead. it was a miserable way to spend
my 1 and only day in Lisbon and I am still angry about it. will never use greyline no matter what country or city we are in and i am telling all my friends.

title: Sightseeing with Gray Line not recommended!
text:
We've all done routes. Audio accompaniment was not satisfactory: little informative, there were several repetitions on the routes, the narratives were often aborted by the stops and many connections did not work.
We recommend switching to one of the other sight seeing companies!

title: inappropriate and impersonal
text:
The audio commentary of the bus, recorded with a robot voice, is almost always started late. In any case, the density of Old Port monuments does not leave enough time to describe them... I think this type of visit is not suitable for such a concentrated center. The rest of the way (75%) is full of empty space with a round trip to the port without any valorization of it. It really feels like a filling...
As for the boat tour, you will have to remember to take headphones and download an app to have information... Welcome to the world of robots!

title: Not recommended
text: Far too little time for the individual stations. That's how you just rush through everywhere. Less would be more. I'd rather delete 1-2 points and please more info on the bus. Not just explaining where we're going. It's not worth it that way.

title: Poor service in Porto
text: It was one of the worst experiences we had on tour buses. We bought tickets for 48h but in these 48h we used 4 times (in 3 days, since we activated the ticket on the first day at 14:00). The stops are insufficient for the historical or interesting sites to visit, we walked a lot from one place to another or because there were no stops in the areas of interest or the buses took a lot of time. Not to mention the changes to the routes that even the drivers themselves, street or store sellers could not inform. It was a disgrace and I feel out of the 50 and so euros that I paid for 2 tickets to visit the harbour, because I still had to use Uber a few times because the buses were late.

title: Don't
text: Poor value for the time and money. Use city transit instead. Translation headphones didn't work for the first 40 minute ride from the cruise pier to the central plaza. Waited 30 minutes more for the connecting bus to the western sites in the city. Lisbon traffic and narrow streets kill forward progress and timekeeping. If you are off a cruise ship consider alternative transportation. We rode $35x2 HopOnHopOff Red to our first site, then opted for city bus 714 and tram 15E for just $5 to get back, faster.

title: Really bad!!!
text: We booked 2x for 3 days+tickets for ocenarium and at the second day we came maybe 10 minutes before the bus needed to come and we ended up waiting another 45 minutes. No bus came, we called the central they were answering like they dont know and the bus driver also. Really bad experience. You pay that much money and get to wait that much.üëéüèªüëéüèª

title: Very dissapointing experience
text: We have bought 4 tickets for adults for 3 lines tour for 48 hours. Terrible scheduling , not on time buses. But the worst thing is the actual audio guide. They do not give any information about the city, monosylabus sentences about several lanmarks. Surely the city deserves some respect and have a lot to say for itself! the majority of time it is music in your headphones. Extremely dissapointed!!! The app which supposed to show you live busses location is inaccurate.

title: Boring, No info and Rude Drivers
text: We were really excited to arrive in Lisbon on our cruise as to us it was the highlight of the holiday. To make the most of Lisbon we decided to pay for the Grey line tour. After waiting around half an hour to depart we made our way through heavy traffic into Lisbon. Whilst making our way there was a number of close calls with large hanging branches on the open top bus. I know it's not directly the tour company's fault but just be really careful and watch out for the branches. One in particular went straight down the centre of the seats if it would have been a foot either way someone would have been hurt. After about 30mins we arrived at sort of a central hub. At no point were we given any instructions. As our bus had the correct line on it we assumed we were picking up other passengers for this route. However after about another 20mins a member of staff shout to us "get off the bus" by this time all the other buses had filled with other passengers. This was getting very frustrating without even seeing anything. When eventually the other bus set off we plugged in the headphones, the commentators were extremely boring, monotone and repeated the same information as we went around a round about. We arrived at stop 4 which looked like it had nice views so we decided to get off. We have a 5 and a 7 year old so my wife made her way Infront of me off the bus as we got to the bottom of the stairs the driver started to set off. I asked him to wait as I was coming down the stairs with my 5 year old, he began to shout and wave his arms, by this time I was angry and fed up of the tour, I shouted back and told him to calm down. When I got off I refused to get back on again, it was the biggest waste of ¬£65 I've ever known. We walked all the way back to the port which gave a much more better impression of Lisbon. I've been on a few open top tours in New York, London etc and this was by far the worst I've been on. Do yourself a favour and walk..

title: Bad service
text: Bad service, the buses take more than 1 hour to return to the points, with me 3 buses passed directly from the points leaving customers planted in the street waiting for a next... Cityrama Lisbon never again! I don't recommend to anyone... just awful

title: Terrible!
text:
Horrible. Bus overcrowded no seats, bus broke down would not refund ticket ! Do not bother. Waste of money.
Negative experience.

title: Do the research before you buy!
text: It‚Äôs not that the tour was bad, it‚Äôs that it was poorly communicated to tourists. The tour included Coimbra, home to the oldest university in Portugal and Fatima which is a religious city. Coimbra also happens to be the fourth largest city in Portugal and the old capita yet we only stopped there for less than 30 minutes. It was literally a toilet stop and that is an absolute shame as I‚Äôm sure this city has a lot more to offer. The bulk of time was spent on the moving bus but we definitely stayed longer at Fatima. That‚Äôs great if you‚Äôre into visiting religious sites but not so great if your goal is to visit cultural sites like Coimbra. The tour guide and the driver were excellent and very professional but I would advise to do some research well before purchasing this tour.

title: Terrible end to the tour
text: Was going to recommend but the end of the tour was so terrible, I give it a one. The driver stopped for literally two seconds at the major stop to get off and go to the Ribeira. There are no stop buttons on the top deck to request a stop, so you‚Äôd think they give people at least 20 seconds to get down the stairs. About 20 of us (from different groups) wanted to get off and had to ride all the way to stop one because he also skipped stop 13 entirely. Had to take an 8‚Ç¨ taxi to get back down to the river because he drove us all the way up to the top of the town again to batalha square. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

title: LISBON
text: We were very disappointed , half the plug in head phones were not working we had to all move chairs. The tour information was not very exciting .

title: NEVER USE THESE PEOPLE EVER EVER NOTHING BUT A RIP OFF
text:
We booked on this tour after departing our ship. Was sold it for a family of 5 for approx ‚Ç¨124 told where we would be taken and the sights we would see. All we actually saw were office blocks and lots and lots of traffic. We had to virtually sit on the floor because we got crammed on the bus. The earphones even though they were new did not work or it was just the sound system. Would not let us off. Driver did not understand English. And considering it‚Äôs a tourist area you would think there would be some sort off communication.

We tried to complain at the office where the terminal was and asked to fill out a form but have never heard back of them to this day. Had I read the reviews I would not have gone on such a poor poor expensive nominal bus journey. If I wanted to sit on the floor viewing traffic and more traffic I would do that at home for a fraction of the cost. So PLEASE BE AWARE BEFORE YOU HOP ON WITH THIS PARTICULAR COMPANY.

title: Not quite good enough
text:
First, I buy a ticket online and then have to go all the way through the city to exchange my receipt for a QR code.
Are we in the 21st century?

30% of the route went on other roads than advertised.

Only about half of the first floor of the bus is covered.

title: Disaster
text: Completely outdated, sound barely understandable, content of the text weak!!!, mostly just music, completely boring, fingers off, really not worth it; no service, just weak!!! Better explore the city differently; the worst hop on off tour ever!!!

title: BAD Ticketing policy by Company disappoints !!!!
text:
I had high hopes for this tour as I have done GrayLine HOHF in The US. Reserving and paying was easy. I expected an Email with tickets that would be down loaded and stored on my mobile. I was WRONG. I had to down load an app which gave me my reservation code, I presented it at the ticket office where they printed a flimsy paper receipt with a QR code.

We boarded a small bus easily but the roof wasn't retracted even in absence of rain, this restricted vision. The app easily allowed you to highlight the tour, however there was no notice prior to booking the tour that the route to Belem had 80% of the stops cancelled because of road closures on Sunday Due to the Lisbon Marathon. We did a shorter route first and planned the longer route to Belem in the afternoon even with the stop closures. Unfortunately I lost the flimsy paper ticket ( it was like a cheap corner store receipt). The attendant at the ticket office said Company policy was not to issue a replacement. I would have been more careful was I aware of this.
When I asked why, she pointed to the notice on the wall behind her regarding the policy with a curt apology and no further explanation. I know she was just doing her job the policy wasn't hers

This ticket issue should have been resolved easily with today's computer tech/apps where an electronic ticket is emailed to the purchaser thus lost tickets would not be an issue.

I'm very disappointed with this company. Take a bus tour with another company NOT Grayline.

title: Not worth the money
text: Very difficult to find stops .. no advance map or info‚Ä¶ headphones didn‚Äôt work in 5 of the 6 seats we were in. The one headphone that did work wouldn‚Äôt switch to English. Real waste of money.

title: Total waste of time and money
text:
Absolute waste of time and money, don't bother. We were in Lisbon for a day as part of a cruise, there is a desk in the terminal as you get off the ship, I only wanted the red route but was sold both blue and red routes as not much extra which I appreciate is my fault, but I thought if we get round the city quickly we can also use the blue route.
Spent 20 mins on the bus before departing, then headed through gridlock traffic to the start point, the entire journey took nearly 3 hours, the commentary was rubbish, we spent most of the journey crawling in traffic. It would have been much better off getting the local bus up to the monastery, Belem de nata and Belem tower and back again, as it was we only saw these on the drive by on the bus as if we'd of got off I was concerned about missing seeing places of interest around the main city centre. Which we did manage to do on foot in the afternoon we also had a quick ride on the 28 tram which is only a few euros. In future I will stick to public transport for getting around cities, google maps is great at showing suitable buses to get you from A to B and a fraction on the cost of the Hop on Hop off bus.
Unless you can't walk far don't bother.
Like previous people have mentioned there is no announcement of which stop you are at unless you can see from your seat it's a guess.
Needless to say all the people on our bus were complaining how rubbish it was.

title: Very slow and freshly thawed meat
text: Value for money, pathetic, thawed meat and very dry, after waiting 2 hours to eat. I don't recommend eating.

title: Lisbon Grey Linr
text: Numerous plugging points didn't work. My wife had no commentry at all. What commentry I got when poor. Also english is 6 not 4

title: Never again
text: Worst hop on hop off tour ever. Bus completely outdated, sound on headphones only with noise, eternal waiting times once you have gotten off and the highlight on the blue lines: the 3 main stops (vasco de gamma) without previous not approached. Niiiiieeee wieder

title: Total Timo
text:
Very bad service, stops are not marked, you can spend more than an hour waiting at the stop, and in the end leave without the bus coming
The outdated explanations
In short the worst tourist bus service we have had on our trips
Tip Don't hire him if you don't want to feel ripped off

title: Not worth it.
text: This gets you from A to B, that‚Äôs it. Routes seem complicated with much wasted time, maybe it‚Äôs the one way streets but‚Ä¶ The commentary is pathetic, 2 lines per stop. What would it take to vamp it up? No historical background. Just states what it is you‚Äôre seeing, not always well synchronized. Your drop off is not necessarily at the attraction, just sort of close. I have done this in many cities, and usually they are great, In my opinion, a waste of money in Lisbon.

title: Waste of time
text: Do not book this!!! Their earphones do not work and they do not care!!! Unless you want to go on a tour and learn nothing. Their customer service is rude and non existent.

title: Dont do Grayline for Lisbon city.
text: Poorly organised. Poor information. No service. No acceptance of responsibilty to customers. My headphone plug in didnt work. Bus stops poorly marked.The English commentary was condescending. Go with the other red bus group..more buses regularly.

title: Incomprehensible
text:
We saw the green line bus arrive earlier at the stop and then we were more than 1h waiting and none appeared... We gave up.
But you can see there was an unforeseen, we give the benefit of the doubt.

With the red line and Boat everything ok, except the audio that didn't work well.

With the paid ticket, with the QR code on the mobile phone, I was forced to go hand over the paper tickets to our friends who bought the tickets together with me, did not let them make the tour...
You don't understand why they're issuing a digital QR code and we can only use it on paper...

The tours are nice, but the experience with the tickets ruined everything.

title: Try another company
text:
I‚Äôve used this company in lots of cities before and this was by far the worst audio guide!
It‚Äôs basically just music playing - very little information or interesting facts given. If you were on the bus there was no announcement or information given as to which stop you were at‚Ä¶it was a complete guessing game.

title: bad tour badly organized
text:
The trip started in the worst way, we waited at the agreed time in the agreed place for pick up, but no one showed up. After calling for half an hour both the Company and our Hotel that had made our Reservation, we learned that the pick up point was somewhere else and luckily they managed to take us there. after that we waited for another hour that they defined the various groups with different destinations and let us get on the bus. they counted us and recounted several times, and we left. during the trip they explained that er logistical issues we would have to change buses, with a smaller one (actually we had to change it 2 times, and the 2nd was really small and we were compressed like sardines). Also the Guide during one of the stops lost 2 people that we had to wait.
Guide Recommendation to do less nice with guests and more professional.

title: Don't go!
text: Crowded bis with poor air conditioning. Our bilingual guide was limited in what she knew, and mumbled when speaking, so we couldn't tell the Spanish from the English. The lunch was mediocre, we could have done better picking our own restaurant. Sintra castle was crowded, I felt like a hamster being herded through a maze. To be dropped at our hotel after the tour, we spent an additional hour on the bus. Overall, the worst touristic experience in 60 years of travel.

title: Not worth it
text: Buses were way too far apart. Waited 35 minutes on the Red line whilst the competitors came and went every 10 minutes. Once on, the bus stopped at the next stop to inform us the audio was broken and we needed to change buses. This then took another 15 minutes & the audio on the next bus didn‚Äôt work either. I‚Äôd recommend you choose a different company that has frequent bus pickups & drop offs & working audio equipment.

title: Completely unhelpful
text: We bought tickets for all the family for the red line in Lisbon, we stopped at the second stop of the track meaning to get the bus at the same spot. We reached the stop, and found the bus there, we asked the staff if we could get in but we were told to wait ten minutes and then we could have. While waiting, another bus of the same company passed through, honking but didn‚Äôt stop and continued its way to other stops. So we asked again the staff when the bus would be leaving and the answer was: this bus is only meant to sell tickets you have to wait for another one and wasn‚Äôt able to inform us on the time of the arrival of the next bus, mind you they didn‚Äôt even notice the first bus stopping buy and honking. We had to wait for more than half an hour in total and wasted lots of time, all under august heat. The only solution they were able to provide us was to walk all the way back to the starting point of the tour and ask for a refund.

title: Very Bad Tour
text:
Do NOT take this tour!! We did the Red (Belem/Lisboa) tour. We have done many hop on hop off tours in other cities and enjoyed them‚Ä¶this was awful, a complete waste of time! With the rich history of both Lisbon and Portugal, there is plenty to talk about. There was really no significant information about the history of the city or Portugal. However the audio consisted largely of bad elevator music as we drove by apartment houses. When we did go by an actual point of interest almost no information was given other than the name of the POI and perhaps the year it was built. As an example, we came past a point on the river where it was stated many of the famous Portuguese explorers departed from‚Ä¶.wow, very interesting tell me more‚Ä¶which ones? Maybe some information about some of those explorers? Maybe an interesting anecdote from their adventures‚Ä¶.NO! Nothing more!

The only thing worse than one of these Lisbon tours is 2! (ie do not get the 2 tour ‚Äúdeal‚Äù !!)

title: Woeful
text:
Woeful no commentary, no explanation as to why no commentary spent 90 minutes not knowing anything about the region we were driving thru
Told the driver we had no idea what stop to get off and he muttered in Portuguese and threw his hands in the air
We went back to the office where we bought the tickets to be told we should have told the driver to flick the switch!
Surely that‚Äôs his job once he turns on the ignition
Don‚Äôt waste your precious time or money go to the competitor you won‚Äôt be disappointed
We paid a lot for what we could have done on a local bus

title: If you want to learn about Lisbon this is a complete waste of money .
text: Terrible tour . No information about the stops or what you could see at them. No commentary as we passed statues and palaces etc. Next to no commentary at all , just lots of music playing in the earphones and the only comments there were could have be been written by an 8 yr old . ‚Äò museums are a great way to learn new things‚Äô - what museum ??? would not recommend. Learnt nothing about Lisbon. Really disappointed.

title: Cityrama Gray Line Hop-on Hop-off -AVOID LIKE the PLAGUE
text:
If you want to meet the most unsmiling, unfriendly people in Portugal and need to call an Uber because the buses don‚Äôt run as advertised and you are stranded, then this is the tour for you!

We thought the hop-on, hop-off bus tour would be a great way to get an overview of Lisbon and see Cascais. The recorded audio tour sounds like it is being done by Robin Leach, is somewhat repetitive and not particularly full of information, but it is adequate. The buses are supposed to run by each stop approximately every 30 minutes. Unfortunately, the two times we ‚Äúhopped off‚Äù the buses on two different days, the bus never returned after an extended wait. We needed to call an Uber both times in order to get home.

This was a TERRIBLE experience and would avoid this tour.

title: Terrible customer service.
text: Bus was 20 minutes late. Poor signage on bus caused me and a few others to get on wrong bus. Audio guide was non functional so I wasted 2 hours driving around a city and not know what I was looking at. Asked for refund but was offered $3.00 off of the $30.00 ticket. Oh ...and the bus driver drove like a maniac through the entire tour. Even speeding 10 KM over speed limit in school zone- there was a RADAR speed sign. I do NOT recommend.

title: A Lisbon bus tour with not nice surprises
text:
We arrived in Lisbon by cruise ship. In the terminal at the exit were various providers for tours. The first Red Line offered a tour for 27‚Ç¨ per person. We assumed that the bus departed from various sights and did not want to get off. This tour should take two hours on request. It started a drive through the city, traffic jam, traffic lights, stops, it was bad.
After two hours, the bus stopped somewhere and we were told to get off, the journey had ended here. We told the employee we were going to the ship. We'd have to take the next bus to the ship.
Which was also true....after another two hours we arrived at our ship.
Good thing we drove early, otherwise we might have missed it.

title: Very disappointing tour
text:
I was very disappointed in the hop-on-hop-off tour by Gray Line I took yesterday for several reasons. Initially we were directed to the nearest stop to begin the tour which was approximately a half-length from the sales office. Porto is hilly so this treck was not an easy one. But what infuriated me was that we drove back and stopped at the sales office. Why the treck then?
Secondly, I found it impossible to determine which site the recorded narrative was describing as we drove past. This needs to be clearer.
And finally, our route map was not the route we took. There were only 3 downtown stops which did not facilitate our sightseeing. Frustrating!
I'll not book another Gray Line tour as my vacation time is valuable & they wasted my morning. Avoid them!

title: Wasted time - many problems.
text:
Internet booking led to problems due to a system change. Two stops were not served. Information about this was only available in the app - 20 people waited for over an hour in vain for the bus.
In summary, and after the problems were solved, there was hardly any time left for sightseeing.
In the buses, the audio devices in the open area were barely legible. The traditional continuous music in the audio guide was too loud.
You do have a 24-hour ticket - but the buses only run until around 6:30 p.m.
An email to one of the addresses provided was not answered.

title: Dreadful waste of money.
text:
Originally we had tickets for the Yellowbus line through our Travel Agent, but arrived in Porto to find they were no longer in business, despite all the bus stop signs still up. So bought another ticket for 48 hrs on the red bus which included the blue line across the river.
Audio commentary was scant - more music than commentary and often after we passed to POI. Buses infrequent and no communication from any of the drivers. Nobody told us that stops were closed and we had planned our visits around some of these spots near the port tasting areas. Would have cried if we hadn‚Äôt laughed as we sailed past our stops at a million miles and hour and ended up back at our starting point! Driver obviously wanted to get home!!
I do not recommend this company. It‚Äôs quicker and more efficient to walk and get your cardio fitness up!!

title: DO NOT BUY FROM THIS OR TRIPADVISOR AT ALL
text:
DO NOT BUY TRIPS FROM THIS SELLER OR TRIP ADVISOR.
i purchased this trip and it reads 2:30 for a meeting point.
i arrived at the designated place 2:20 and was told that the person left.....
15 minutes prior the time showed on the purchase, when escalated to trip advisor they say all party were agree to NOT REFUND THE MONEY.

its just an scam.... BE CAREFULL

title: Disappointment of my visit
text:
My disappointment regarding the guided tour that I recently followed in Porto at the end of May 2024. I understand that works may require changes to the route, but at no time was it made known to us that the route would be modified and that we would not be able to not seeing most of the interesting monuments that we expected.
Despite these changes, the price of the tour remained the same, which seems unfair to me given the reduced value of the experience.
I strongly recommend that you inform future participants of any route changes in advance and adjust prices accordingly. This would help manage expectations better and ensure higher customer satisfaction.

title: Bad audio content
text: The audio guide is bas. It is very limited and unspecific. For example, it gives a small bit of info on a building but does not describe it nor say where to look for it.

title: Use a different operator. Dreadful day!
text:
We bought a 1 day pass as we have limited time and have used this company in many cities before.

However, this was awful. No room on the bus, despite another almost empty bus not stopping at our stop. Very few of the jack points worked so we couldn't get the commentary. The bus was very old and partially broken ... and the driver was appalling ... driving dangerously fast and using his brakes very aggressively.
What a waste of 54 euro and our time. Use a different operator.

title: Unhelpful Grayline Staff...Use Another Company
text:
Rude and Unhelpful Grayline Staff. Try a different Company!
For a company dealing in tourism there was not one encounter that was good. Whoever we asked a question to the answer was the same... scan the QR code and you will get answers. It was clear that couldn't be bothered. Standing around doing NOTHING!

title: GRAY LINE HOP ON HOP OFF LISBON BUS - DO NOT USE GRAY LINE!
text: Our ship docked at around midday on 16 May and a lot of passengers bought tickets in the port terminal building for the Hop On Hop Off city tour, for a circular journey said to be 1.5-2hrs depending upon traffic. We were assured the bus we got on at around 12.30 was red line. Most of the headphones didn't work and those that did the volume was so low it was difficult to hear...we sat downstairs as I walk with a stick. An upstairs passenger came down to ask that the volume be increased and explained many had issues with headphones, requesting faulty bus be reported. Driver unable to change volume and said the company knew about the faults. We couldn't work out where we were headed, as route didn't seem to follow map given. Gave up on map and headset as narrative when I was able to hear it didn't seem to match where we were. After an HOUR touring the slums of Lisbon, dilapidated buildings covered in graffiti and any number of sad, homeless people in tents and doorways, we appeared to arrive at Stop Number 1! A further HOUR AND A BIT brought us to the river again but a long way from the ship and the red route seemed to go inland again, back to Stop Number 1. Many disgruntled passengers asked how we were to get back to the ship and were told to get off and walk if we were unhappy. At the next stop most of us got off and shared taxis back to the ship. Needless to say, the ticket office in the port was empty...having taken our money they weren't going to stay around to face the music. We were able to see that there are two different companies operating Hop On Hop Off tours. MY RECOMMENDATION WOULD BE - DO NOT USE GRAY LINE.

title: Don‚Äôt bother, not worth it. Do something else.
text: How could you make Lisbon boring!!! Audio really dull and not synchronised with tour.Oriente route not worth seeing. A wasted 2 hours

title: Don‚Äôt Red Bus in Lisbon
text: The worst Red bus city tour I have been on. These are usually excellent. The commentary was poor and not in alignment with the bus. The music in between the comments got on the nerves. The bus stopped at two of the stops for at least 15 minutes. The stops were not announced by number let alone at all. No wonder we got 2 days for the price of 1 ! Don‚Äôt let it stop you using the Red bus in other cities

title: Do not even think about it
text: The headphones don't even work, the drivers have no courtesy, they give a bad perception of the country. Supervision is urgent. At the main stop, lines are not respected

title: Bad line
text:
Long waiting times at stops.
These were not continuous or complete. Audio guide sometimes doesn't work.
It's better to take the red line. Things are probably better there.

title: Total waste of money.
text: This was the worst hop on hop off bus tours I‚Äôve ever experienced. There were a number of seats that you couldn‚Äôt plug in the audio ear piece. The seats where the commentary was working it was hopeless with a lot of music, couldn‚Äôt turn the volume up, not much information on the buildings or the area. Traffic was very heavy, the bus crawled along, we had no idea where we were. Total waste of money for 4 hours..

title: Unhappy for two 85 year old's
text:
It was very, very difficult to find the Get on/Get off stops.
My ticket included visit to Wine Cellar, impossible to find a person that knows where we should go to meet bus.
The bus trip was very poor compared to the Red bus, your driver was not able to answer our questions in English????

Will not recommend Gray line

title: Disappointing
text: Very disappointed with our visit. (Especially visiting the Burmester cellars) We visited Lisbon and loved it. It was monotonous, the information was very sporadic and more or less interesting. Ok if you like to take a bus ride around the city...For the Burmester cellars, it's a tourist trap, 10-15 minutes max of boring explanations and then straight to the tasting, no visit to the cellars! We didn't even use the 2nd day included

title: Full of promise, reality disappointing.
text: We bought a 2 line ticket, red and green lines over 48 hours. On the red line on the first day the driver missed 3 stops which meant that we had a 25 minute walk to get back to where we wanted to be. The next day on the green line we waited at stop 3 for 50 minutes for a bus to continue our journey then when a bus did turn up there was no room. The driver estimated that another would be along in 15 minutes but no guarantee that this would also be full. We were very disappointed.

title: Long wait
text:
We waited at the Castle stop for more than 30 minutes. Two buses arrived at once.
Enjoyment is below average. The regular bus runs much more often.

title: Avoid
text: We suggest to avoid. It‚Äôs (the hop on hop off model)worked well for us in other world-cities but the traffic is too heavy in Lisbon to allow the buses to be any way on time. We had to wait in full sun heat for well over half an hour for one (having narrowly missed one due to a very unhelpful staff member at the stop). The narration on tape is dreadful (long bouts of boring music interspersed with repetitive drivel about some of the sights - I don‚Äôt want to hear about the Hard Rock Cafe three times thanks). Many of the staff at stop #1 were varying unhelpful to down right rude. We eventually just got off and walked around.

title: Terrible service never again
text:
Reviews should be constructive, we used the Green and Red line bus. THEREFORE.
Improve the audio, the sound was limited to just about hearable, the content was insufficient , eg. advising we were at bus stop 13 after the bus had stopped, how about telling me before it arrives at the stop. No information on a potential sight till we had passed.
No relevant information in any leaflet about what could be seen at places listed at the stops.

Would we visit Lisbon again, Yes
Would we use you bus again, NEVER

title: Not a good service
text: Not worth the price we paid. Buses don‚Äôt run regular enough, the app does not correspond with the bus stops. Very confusing where to get the bus. Waited half an hour for a bus at stop 13 on purple line only to see it diverted away from us. No mention anywhere it wasn‚Äôt stopping at this stop! 4 adults, 2 young children, had to get an Uber back to hotel. Travelled to Oceanario through residential areas of Lisbon. No headphones or commentary, maybe because nothing to comment on!! Again long wait for bus to go back into town. Over 120 euros for 2 days, definitely not worth the money. Buses need to run more regularly. Never again!

title: Not Enjoyable
text:
Over crowded, had to stand almost the entire way and when we were finally seated only 1 of 5 of us had audio that worked properly. Surely you can do better.
A tightly packed ‚Ç¨23 bus ride with no audio just isn‚Äôt worth it.

title: Never again!
text: Waiting time of more than an hour in the blazing sun, an extremely unfriendly driver, but 4!!! empty buses at the last stop.

title: Too much waiting
text:
Few buses, timetable not respected, long waiting times. The application changes schedule every ten minutes.
Take the yellow! More frequencies

title: Deplorable company!
text:
A company to avoid because the plans are not correct, the schedules are inaccurate and are not respected
For example, we have been waiting for an hour for the bus, normally with a frequency of 8 p.m. to 30 minutes, and it is still not here!
And the competing company has more interesting circuits
Jyves

title: Experience not recommended
text: 48h Pass Lisbon, the welcome on the first day was not very friendly. The young woman was unpleasant. The stops are poorly indicated and in the event of a stop crowded by a tourist bus, the driver does not look to see if people want to get on. Passages on the blue line are random. The guides for Belem district excursions, Sintra Cascais very good.

title: Too much waiting time and rude staff
text:
This company are literally a waste of money and of your precious TIME!!

This Good Friday morning I bought the tickets for the family and quickly I regreted. When the first bus arrived (after waiting 30mins) was full and not enough space for us.
The sales lady in Restauradores Square told me to wait for the next one. We wait for more 40mins and no signal of the bus. Then, I went towards the sales lady (at that time was 2 girls of them there) to ask for the refund. They say no to me quest and they were very rude dealing with all the situation.
I think this is not a good way to deal with your clients but maybe because it's a big company, maybe it's the operating policy..

During the time waiting for the bus I observe that more people were in the same situation than my family, with tickets and waiting for the bus to pick them on the stop.
Hop on hop off is good on the theory because realistically, they don't make your vacations be fluid.

I recommend you to avoid buying Grayline hop on hop off tickets and look for better tours options..

title: Literal waste of time
text: This was a literal waste of time. Waited long to get on the bus which seemed to have no real schedule. The app didn‚Äôt work so you‚Äôre really left to wait and wonder where exactly each stop was (no real signage) and when to expect the bus. When we were finally on the bus, the tour recording was lacking and often announced the stop and attractions at that stop as the bus was pulling off! Too late at that point to get off. We wanted to get off at times but worried about how long we would be stuck at a particular stop so we just stayed on. We finally decided to just walk and take public transport to get around. Much better use of our time.

title: Yellow Bus is Much Better
text: Don't waste your time. We bought tickets then were refused entry to the bus, he gave us the wrong tickets and said we could buy more line but the bus had left already. Poor service and even if you have the right ticket it does not always scan correctly.

title: Bad experience
text:
Picked up a tour bus and paid for a ticket at the cruise terminal in Lisbon. Was not put off by road works.

Informed by the lady that the bus is every 30 minutes was not the case.

Ear plug inn's not working on a loop. Lady bus driver tried to reset and fix problem. Tour got on. Then we pulled in to transfer on to another packed tour bus. Informed issue with bus ok.

People who could not fit on stayed on the bus that we got off? Which followed behind us.

Got off at bus hub to be informed to get on another line to go back to the cruise terminal that we have to wait one and a half hours? Not 30 minutes as Informed.

Then, I got back on the same bus on the gray line bus stop 5 to walk back to the cruise terminal. NOT A NICE EXPERIENCE. Put me off.

title: Very bad experience
text: On Sunday, only one bus ran on the blue line all day. The information is sparse or only one sentence for some sights. In the evening, the bus ended at point 1 at 6 p.m.

title: Disappoint experience with Hop-on Hop-off Tour in Lisbon
text:
