Ik raad deze organisatie in Lissabon aan niemand aan. Ze voelen zich superior in hun business. Maar zijn dit allebehalve...
Jammer, men laat zich kennen voor 10 euro schadevergoeding...

title: Way too much waiting!
text: We bought a 24 hour hop on hop off pass with Greyline tours and did a whole lot of waiting for a bus to come - maybe once an hour. We‚Äôve done these types of tours before - example in Dublin - and buses came every 10-15 minutes; and it was easy to find a schedule of when the bus was to come. Not in this case at all. Don‚Äôt waste your money. I‚Äôm f you want to get to Gaia from central Porto, walk across the bridge or get a tuck tuck or Uber. The orange line was also boring as it takes you through mostly residential areas - just get to the port houses please. The blue line was ok as we got to see some interesting sites, especially the Sea Changes sculpture. Disappointing.

title: Blue route disaster
text: What a farce! Picked up the 1st bus as S√£o Bento at 10:00. An hour later we had looped back to the same point before finally heading across the river. Boring for us but more importantly, such as silly loop - would work loads better if the bus went over the bridge first, done that side and then went through the old town of Porto.

title: N√£o vale a pena
text: Compramos um pacote da lusanova que tinha este tour de uma manh√£, ficou 36euros por pessoa, foi dificil achar a informa√ß√£o do horario de saida, pois o hotel n√£o sabia, falava que era um tour por lisboa, e s√≥ passamos por alguns lugares e paramos na torre de bekem, monumento descobrimentos, museo coches ,uma andada em alfamas e no mosteiro de Jer√¥nimos, depois fomos literalnente deixados no meio da pra√ßa do rossio e cada um se vira para voltar para o hotel, sem explicacoes, muito caro pelo que foi oferecido, os yellow card s√£o melhores

title: Terrible service
text: Waiting over half an hour and no bus. When a bus did turn up it was full. Terrible service. Had to a taxi in the end. Avoid at all costs

title: Awful
text:
Don‚Äôt be duped by the girl sitting at the desk with all red photos‚Ä¶ this is NOT the sight seeing hop on hop off bus tours, this is cityrama and it is an old bus with headsets that don‚Äôt work and very poor guides.
A waste of money

title: Horr√≠vel ! Pessima ! Pesadelo ! Porcaria ! Lixo !
text: PESSIMA a pior empresa do MUNDO!!!! N√£o usem. Possuem s√≥ 2 √¥nibus funcionando (com sorte pois 1 sempre desaparece). A espera nos pontos s√£o infind√°veis! Fui pedir o dinheiro do segundo dia que n√£o usei , e n√£o tem mais ningu√©m para eu reclamar ou telefone para eu pedir o dineheiro de volta ! N√£o usem est√° empresa !!!!!!

title: Keinen Einbezug in die Stadt
text: Diesen Trail habe ich nicht gemacht. Daf√ºr die gleiche Art "Sherlock Holmes" in Regensburg. Dort bin ich einfach whallos herumgelaufen und habe virtuellen Dieben hergejagt, die Story war einfach nur dumm und vorhersehbar. Das schlimmste war, dass die Stadt nicht mit einbezogen wurde. Keine Fragen zu Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten, keine wissenswerte Fakten, nichts dergleichen.

title: DO NOT PURCHASE
text: Do not buy these passes! I have used City Sightseeing before in London and had a great experience. However, in Lisbon it was a completely different experience. We bought the 48hr tickets and were never able to use them. The app said there were no buses in transit for the entire day. I immediately contacted customer service and got a robot that said we would be back with you shortly. After not receiving a response, I sent an email instead of using their chat feature. It took a day to get a response and they said to just use the times listed and the bus would show up. Well, there goes over our 24 hours of our 48 hour tickets. They said they could not give us a refund. I told them that was not fair as the app was not working properly and they took so long to respond that it waisted such a significant portion of our tickets. They said I should have just waited for a bus or found one of their employees along the route. Such terrible customer service I had to file a complaint with my credit card company due to City Sightseeing incompetence. Just take public transportation, Uber, or walk, so much more efficient, easier, and better service.

title: Not fit for purpose
text:
So disappointed
Paid ‚Ç¨30 each x 4
No commentary
The driver was so unhelpful
Don‚Äôt use this service
Blue line is like an industrial tour and with no sound is utterly unacceptable
I feel we have paid and been cheated

title: Waste of time and money.
text: Don‚Äôt bother. We paid 33 EUR each for a 15 minute bus journey, then never found another bus stop to ‚Äòhop-on‚Äô again, despite spending hours walking around looking. Followed the map, tried several locations, saw buses and chased them to try find a bus stop, and when we found one, no bus for an hour. We wasted more time looking for poorly signed bus stops than anything else. Only plus point was we saw loads of Lisbon on foot chasing buses!!!

title: Cannot hear the audio
text:
This review is for CITYsightseeing not Lisbon Sightseeing, different companies. We chose Citysightseeing as it provided for 3 bus routes with one on a small bus that provided a tour of the smaller narrower streets of Lisbon.

This bus tour is mediocre at best.

We headed to the main stop and it was easy to find and locate. We rode the Blue line first as that was departing soon. The drive was fine BUT the audio was terrible. There is music playing constantly on all of the channels with audio voiceover when certain sites are being described. Whomever thought it was a good idea to have music playing in the background with an audio voice over of descriptions needs to have their hearing checked. The background music, which is a woman singing, results in the inability to hear or decipher what is being said. It is loud and when the audio portion is played the music does not stop. Maybe if it was muzak it would make sense, but someone signing (sometimes in the same language) with audio is being played makes zero sense. The music is as loud as the audio voice over.

The red line was perhaps moderately better as the voice over was a little louder but the music remained a distraction.

The green line was a huge disappointment. The audio did not work. The driver said he told the company but they had not fixed it. Why they would have a bus in operation without the audio portion working makes no sense. It was nice to drive around and see the skill of the driver navigating the narrow and curvy streets.

Overall, not worth the money. Do not do it.

title: No English audio-guide on uptown bus
text: Did the red line Belem first and the audio guide worked (they could have talked more and sung less) - then we went for the ¬´uptown line¬ª and the commentary in English was non-existent. The final bus-ride was then considered our most boring (2 hours) sightseeing experience ever.

title: worst we've had of this kind of bus tour
text: we've been on hop on hop off tours somewhat like this in other cities and have had good experiences. This is the worst of this kind of tour we've been on. They are there waiting passengers coming off cruise ships. First it took about an hour from the time we sat on the coach until we sat on our actual tour coach up in the center of the city. The narration was pretty scant. Lots of just uninteresting music. We bailed out at stop 13 and then walked back to see sites of interest. It was easy walk back to the cruise ship. I can't recommend this tour experience, but I understand that for someone else it might not be so bad. Interesting to have had music played through the radio system during much of the "tour"

title: Waste of money
text: The buses are regular but the audio guide was very poor in comparison to the city sight seeing tours in other Countries. It repeated the same thing multiple times, talked about things that were not around and missed what appeared to be important sights. The blue line in particular was a waste of time as it didn't really go to any places of importance and again the audio guide was useless and we didn't learn anything from it. I definitely would not recommend this in Lisbon.

title: Stifling hot bus
text: Horrible. 105 Fahrenheit in Lisbon and no a/c in the bus. Customers comfort doesn't even hit their radar screen. Audio "tour" was virtually non-existent, uninformative and sparse.

title: Bad experience
text:
It was a nightmare, a waste of time
No audio broadcast on the history of the city than music. I was disappointed I strongly advise against.

title: Not recommended
text: No air conditioning, audioguide hardly available (only music, little info). No sun protection upstairs. You're just stuck in traffic

title: Time wasting experience
text: I wish I could give less than one star. We've spent so much time sitting waiting at stops while they've sorted out ticket issues. We've Just spent 45 minutes at stop one. They don't seem to understand the premise of hop on hop off. We really regretted buying the tickets, they weren't cheap either! The price definitely didn't match the service. AVOID!;

title: Try Another Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Company
text:
The only good thing I can sayabout City Sightseeing bus tour is that our bus driver was amazing - navigating narrow streets and sharp turns.

Everything else was terrible. (1) The audio equipment is ancient. Had to change seats 6+ times to find audio that worked. (2) The audio narration was less than minimal. For 2 hours of seeing Lisbon, the narrator spoke 15-20 minutes tops. I didn't learn much. (3) The bus was ancient, too. Super bumpy and slow.

title: Don‚Äôt do it!
text:
This hop-on/hop-off bus is the worst!
Go with Grayline or Yellow bus:
Narration ports were broken. Wait times were ridiculously long. I saw several Grayline and Yellow buses come and go before one of the City sightseeing buses would come by.
Don‚Äôt waste your money or your time with this company.

title: Disappointed and left behind.
text:
So disappointed, put up with them driving to fast around the city and not seeing the points of interest, put up with broken headphone plugs.
But to be told the 1505 pick up spot is no. 2 in Cascais, where we were dropped off, then to be left behind as they did not go this was too much.
I rang them when I saw the bus was nearly back in Lisbon only to be told they sent me a message, that did not arrive, I had the app. on all day, and then told I had to wait another 3 hours for pick up did not sit well with me.

title: Worst hop on hop off in Lisbon
text: Was told buses are regular a bus will be 6 minutes. What a joke Lisbon sight seeing/Greyline is far better don‚Äôt waste your money or time.

title: Horrible.
text: Bad service, lack of information. We even had to resort to an uber at the end of an hour of waiting for the call followed in paregem nume 6 of the blue line. Not recumendo of all

title: try another bus company instead
text: Nog enough buses, had to wait a very long time at stops. Also buses did not respect timelines ( did not arrive on time). Audio guide had very limited information on the city, you ear more music then anything else. Suggest ‚ÄúGreyLine‚Äù bus company instead - many buses and more organized.

title: Awful, do not take this bus tour
text: Genuinely the worst tour bus experience I‚Äôve ever had in any city in the world. Doesn‚Äôt stick to any timetable, hardly any information shared via the talking guide, and what was shared was bare minimum. Left waiting over an hour at the palace, for us to get on to bring us back to the centre and our ticket was 1 minute expired so we weren‚Äôt allowed on and were stranded at the Palace in the heat, when we had timed it well, even accounting for a couple of minutes delay.

title: Definitely would not recommend
text: The recorded commentary was very poor indeed, especially on the blue line. The complete tour took about 1hr 45mins and the information about where we were and what we were passing was very scanty. Just a snippet here and there. I‚Äôve been on similar tours in other cities, where the commentary is almost non-stop. Furthermore, music playing through the headphones was continuous and it was very annoying. You had to keep the earphones in so as not to miss one of the infrequent pieces of information, which meant that there was no respite from the Portuguese music. The music was still playing in the background when there was information, which made it difficult to hear. The little green line bus goes up to the castle. There was no information about the castle and hardly anything on the way up and down. The red line gave a bit of information at most of the stops, but just a couple of sentences. Very disappointed with the experience and for 33‚Ç¨ I would have expected to have learnt more about Lisbon.

title: –ù–µ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é –∞–≤—Ç–æ–±—É—Å–Ω—ã–µ —ç–∫—Å–∫—É—Ä—Å–∏–∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–µ–π "City Sightseeing Lisboa"
text: Good day. We bought a tour from your company on a double-decker bus at the port. I was told that there is an audio guide in Ukrainian. But to my great regret, the guide does not work in Ukrainian. Also, the bus follows an unclear route, not indicated on the map issued when purchasing tickets. I will add that the audio guide suddenly turns on and off, and when the description of some object begins, it is not clear from which side of the street you need to look for this object in question. In general, my impressions of this incomprehensible train on the bus are very negative. I cannot recommend this to other people.

title: Learned Almost Nothing About Lisbon
text: Frankly disappointed with City Sightseeing in Lisbon. Generally do use this company's buses to get acquainted with a city. Learned almost nothing from the narrated Red Line tour. Generally had music in my earphones most of the tour. Useless. Lots of money for little value.

title: Abysmal
text: Paid a lot of money for day pass with oceanarium. Blue bus arrived an hour late so we missed our booked slot at oceanarium. Then no bus back for whatever time so had to pay for an uber back. Total waste of money as only seems to be one bus every hour. We never did get on any other route so a 15 minute journey cost us ¬£60

title: Avoid this transport company
text:
Very bad experience, they are thieves and incompetent.
Lack of seriousness, they left us on the side of the street without wanting to take us.
Run away from this company!!!!

title: Worst choice of bus Drop on Drop off
text:
Frankly disappointed! The music at the same time as the comments so we didn‚Äôt hear well then the comments not synchronized so we don‚Äôt understand everything
We had a lot of trouble finding a bus stop then after calling, we were asked to go to the website which is apparently up to date
Finally found, but waited 50 minutes in full sun while the bus must pass every 40 minutes so looked for the error.... asked on What‚Äôa app and I was confirmed that it arrived in 5‚Äô
Frankly expensive paid for poor service
This is the last time I use their company

title: No recommendation
text: The most wasted 29‚Ç¨ I ever invested. We went 30 minutes with blue line, stopped in nowhere to catch an uber for going back to the city. Then I wanted to try red line, waited 30 minutes on station 4 to catch a bus (while other companies passed two times). I left on 6 searching for a bus on 12, but I couldn‚Äôt find the station. Even the driver couldn‚Äôt help me. Then I catched an Uber again to go where I wanted. Sorry, but I can only give one star for that fail. Please use the historical tram. It is cheaper and you will see more in shorter time

title: If I could give zero I would
text:
Having used this company in other locations I thought I would be getting a good service but don‚Äôt be fooled. List of issues:
1. Stops are tucked away in hard to find locations.
2. Frequency of the buses is abysmal and not as stated in the advertising.
3. Interactive map online doesn‚Äôt match with the paper map they give you.
4. Audio is limited when you are on the bus, most of the time it played a woman singing.
5. Buses are packed.

In conclusion I wouldn‚Äôt waste your money on this service. There are far better ways of getting around the city. If you want to maximise your time instead of standing waiting for buses, don‚Äôt use city sightseeing in Lisbon.
Absolute joke and waste of money.

title: A disrespect to customers
text: A company bosta. The only proof of admission is a paper. If you miss it (which they themselves admit happens frequently) you will be without the ride. Bad care and after-sales policy. Don't buy with them. Take public transport or a bolt to go to places and save time and irritation

title: Why can‚Äôt they do better?
text:
We love hop on hop off busses. When you want to see a lot in a busy city quickly, they are ideal.
Why is it that City Sightseeing in Lisbon can‚Äôt even get the basics right - start the tours at the time you say, have the commentary working, run a decent queuing system. The irony is that the Gray Line company which operates from the same location with almost identical busses seems to manage all of this so much better. It sometimes seemed as though the service was being run for the employees rather than the customers.
PS - and the commentary when it does work is poor.
PPS - and why play that interminable music ALL the time, it‚Äôs irritating

title: Andreta Oliveira
text: The tickets was sold, the service as claimed by the staff member was not provided (the service was not provided at all at the end). The expenses was not reimbursed. Miserable attitude was demonstrated. The official claim through consumer protection agency will be submitted.

title: Expensive and not very premium.
text:
Mixed bag.
On the plus side the buses are frequent so you can get off and back on easily, and there was always a seat on the top. Good paper map given to you once you're on.
On the minus side the earphones usually don't work, the commentary is pretty poor anyway, the green line bus has zero suspension and hard plastic seats, the website is infuriating - the map is impossible to find and when you do you can't zoom or scroll without losing it again, and it's quite expensive - for ¬£35 each we could have had a taxi all day or taken a couple of ordinary buses to Belem etc for under ¬£10. Or the metro. So I feel a bit of a mug having done this, to be honest.
Finally, there seem to be two competitors, with almost identical red buses, fonts, coloured lines, but different numbering of stops. Which one's better? Who knows??

title: Avoid getting off the bus
text:
We took the bus to go around Lisbon, we could get off the bus and pick it up afterwards except the trap is when we wanted to get back on the bus there was no room.
We waited more than 1 hour and all buses were full. So we took an uber to the stop after "S. George's Castle", then a bus arrived but still no room on the bus and the driver announces that it is the last bus so we have to get back to the hotel by our own means.
Good adventurers that we are, we finished running and on the rain.
Knowing that we paid 33 ‚Ç¨ for a tour that we did not complete we were more than disappointed (even if they are tickets for 24 hours).
Despite this we went back to try to make the ticket profitable.
Be careful at the stops because you may not be able to get back on the bus.
Otherwise Lisbon is a beautiful city.

title: Not worth it - poorly run
text: Very disappointing. Very little information provided through the on-board audio, not timed to the location, with no reference to where the building is. Busses were infrequent, crowded. Blue loop is a waste of time - too far out and no sites. Paper map is not detailed enough to find stops, online map is not downloadable. Ended up using screen shots. Even on site map with detail the stops are not exactly where they show. Night tour didn‚Äôt pause anywhere with city light views. Walking tour was OK, but again, finding the exact location of the start took forever because of poor paper map. Tour guide was at the stop but didn‚Äôt immediately identify herself. Boat tour is difficult to find and not explained well in the ticket/email/website. Stops are again not clearly shown on any map. (We ended up skipping it but heard it was good).

title: Horrible
text:
Horrible!!!!! Misinformation and lies from the salesperson Misdirections to the pickup point. Waited almost 2 hours for a bus after finding out there were other bus companies that did not accept our tickets
Because of wait for bus, arrived at transfer point after other line shut down for day. Required to taxi back to starting point.
Narration was awful, no useful info was given. Just an awful experience. Ruined our day in Lisbon. Stay far away from this ripoff. I will be contacting the company to demand a refund and reimbursement for taxi fare

title: Terrible - do not bother
text:
This was so terrible. Audio didn't work properly, stop signs were marked with the wrong numbers, complete waste of ¬£33.

I have used hop on hop off buses all over the world, and this company was the absolute worst experience.

title: Not a good experience
text:
(April, 27 and 28, 2025)
Family of four with tickets for 48h here!

We started with the green line to go up and visit the Castle and it was ok so we decided to take the blue line after lunch and let the red one for the next day.

The blue line is a nightmare. Almost two hours into the modern neighborhoods and suburbs of Lisbon (which are clean and safe and ok if you‚Äôre looking for a mall but it‚Äôs not something we would have paid that much to see)!

Last but not least: the red line is ok if you‚Äôre going to take the boat. Otherwise, you will spend a lot time seeing neighborhoods and then in a highway. The points of interest in the Bel√©m area you‚Äôll see from a far!

Sad note: the sales were very friendly but we asked a driver for some info regarding the departures (we were waiting in their parking area for the red line) and he answered in a very blunt way.

I‚Äôd NOT recommend.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your money
text:
This was the worst City Sightseeing Hop-On Hop-Off experience we‚Äôve ever had. We chose the line that goes to the Aquarium (I don‚Äôt recall the line color) because it went through a part of town we had not seen. The audio didn‚Äôt work and the driver didn‚Äôt point anything out. So, we got off before the long drive to the Aquarium, walked to a different station and tried a second line color (city center area). The audio was scratchy, didn‚Äôt match with the landmarks and then it quit. When I pointed it out to the driver, he told me ‚Äúit‚Äôs fine‚Äù. The audio eventually restarted, but wasn‚Äôt any better so we got off this bus for after five stops . We decided the 3rd color line (the one to Belem) would be another waste of our time, so we didn‚Äôt attempt it.

The other red hop-on hop-off bus is run by Grayline and might be better. Or, try the yellow bus.

title: Stay out of the blue
text: Got off the cruise ship and was told only the blue route was available at our stop so on we got. 90 minutes of my life I won't get back later, after going through a dystopian nuclear fallout zone of the capital ending up at the aquarium we didn't want to see, we finally ended up in central Lisbon. It was then the rain came! 90 mins of sunshine while on the bottom back of the open top bus and rain when we finally get off! Stay out of the blue and in the red or green is the new Tiedos Rogeros line for cruise passengers wondering which way to turn.

title: Not Worth The Money
text:
As we had so much rain during our stay we thought we‚Äôd use one of the sightseeing bus, sadly we chose the wrong sightseeing tour
We paid ‚Ç¨34 per person which was a complete waste of money and a rip off
Staff were unfriendly and not very helpful the commentary on the bus was dreadful most of the time it played terribly music
We only did 2 of the tours the green route which was ok but the bus time table wasn‚Äôt regular with bus‚Äôs turning up every 25 to 45 minutes
We also did the blue route and was taken on a lovely drive through the housing estates of Lisbon and then the stop we wanted to get off at was closed but the driver didn‚Äôt let us know, really not helpful
My view is Lisbon isn‚Äôt big enough for this type of sightseeing tours and is a waste of money, be warned

title: Don‚Äôt waste your money.
text: Don‚Äôt waste your money. Pick a different Hop on Hop off. Drove around, didn‚Äôt know what we were looking at. No narration. Had to look at map to even figure out where we were if we could. Waste of time and money. Ridiculous.

title: Don‚Äôt book this!
text: So very disappointed in this tour. Timings for buses all over the place. Hardly any narrative at all and quite often repeated. Do not spend your money on this !

title: Skip this company not worth the money
text: Old broken seats, headsets don't work, very uncomfortable, terrible drivers, rude and information given incorrect, I would not recommend this company go with Greyline we found that company really well ran. Also, getting a refund back from this company was non-existent when I cancelled outside the 48-hour time frame

title: Blue line is very disappointing.
text:
Red line is fine. Blue line has little to offer. During the entire ride you will not get any explanation or comment, which is the intention with sightseeing.
Could be much better.

title: Disaster
text: An absolute naughtiness!! Waiting times of up to almost an hour!! Never again!! Wouldn't recommend it to anyone...

title: not recommended, try alternatives
text: We have been using Hop on hop off buses in all European cities. Always loving them and having the best experiences as you use them to move around but also to learn something....This one needs for sure improvements: the audio guide is practically not a guide. You just listen to music and the description is so poor, just a few minutes in an hour ride , also not at all synchronized. Many audio guides didn't work on the buses, and we needed to change seats to find the ones working propely. If the bus would be full, we might ended up with no guide at all... We have 2 free walking tours with our ticket. we only did the "from castle to Alfama" tour. Absolutely lost of time. We expected to discover Alfama. We did not. The tour guide seemed really bored, not liking her job... we have done free tours in other cities which were so nice. we have just passed from the Cathedral, and just walk down the hill reaching the beachfront road towards the main square (not Alfama). The only things we did see at Alfama and the tour guide had described were the Miradouro (view point) ,one strange tree, and one building. We took a walk by ourselves (not at all organized as we have thought that the tour will cover most of the area... ) and our walk was much better, we discovered Alfama indeed ,which is an amazing place...!! Overall we have paid for 48h ticket with 3 routes and 2 walking tours and 1 night tour. We ended up using it only for 1 day, 1 route, and 1 walking tour. We didn't want to use the service for any other routes or tour, as it was a lost of our time and money basically. Public buses are on time (you can buy the ticket from the driver) .Also, Bolt (instead of uber) is a very cheap and convenient way to use to go anywhere in Lisbon, and Free walking tours using Guru Walk is a great way to explore the city.

title: Fantastic if your idea of a fun day out is standing at bus stops
text:
Whilst the 3 routes offered do what they say on the side of the bus and provide sightseeing tours, the 'hop on hop off' bit is rather negatively impacted by not knowing when the next bus might come along. Trying to work out where the stops are proved frustrating and time consuming too. The only way to do the latter is, it seems, to get a leaflet which has a basic, not to scale, map showing approximate locations... and the only place we could find a leaflet was actually on the bus! As for bus times, we gave up and relied on hope and St Christopher.

The amount of time we spent waiting for buses to turn up impacted negatively on the amount of things we had time to do and see. In total we got on and off 7 times in 2 days, and spent around 3 hours waiting for buses.

What was more upsetting though was on our first day (we were in town for 3 days total) I spent a gnats under ¬£60 for 2x48hr passes, booked online on the official website. These passes compulsorily included an unwanted night tour that we couldn't get to, as it started on the opposite side of Lisbon to our accommodation, and 2 walking tours (didn't want those either, have you seen the hills in Lisbon?) . Because we could only get 2 day passes we spent the rest of our first day doing very little. It was only on day 2, when, having eventuality found a bus stop and a city-sightseeing bus, did we discover that due to a company policy change our 48 hr passes were in fact 72 hr passes. Shame that wasn't mentioned on the website, we could have used them in our first day too and maybe got to see a few more of the places we missed...

Rant over! But really, if you do book these tours (which I absolutely don't recommend) be prepared to do a lot of waiting around and ideally do your homework first and find out where the nearest bus stop is!

title: Do not use them and if you do do not lose your ticket or they will scream at you
text: I accidentally threw away my paper ticket and the bus driver screamed at me and made me cry and refused to let me on the bus. It was awful.

title: Worst city tour anywhere
text: Absolutely awful don't bother worst tour I have ever been on commentary was a joke so we're the parts of the city we went through. Driving along motorway looking at high rise blocks or by the harbour seeing derelict buildings pile of rubbish and rows of tents where the homeless live! Not a great experience of Lisbon not a good word to say about the whole trip waste of money

title: Awful
text: I wish I had read the reviews before booking this. It really is awful. We‚Äôve done many of these tours in other cities and they‚Äôve been great. This however was sitting on a bus in traffic with pretty much zero commentary. They don‚Äôt even announce the different stops along the way. They literally tell you about 3 things on the whole tour. We went in January, so off season and were constantly sat in heavy traffic, so it must be even worse in the summer. The green line was like an endurance test, we both felt sick so had to get off! A real waste of money. If you want to learn about Lisbon this is not the way to do it. We saw many people on tuk tuks, with live commentary by animated local guides, we should have done that instead.

title: If all you want is a ride around town..
text:
Essentially no narration or did not correspond to the location

Christmas music (Jan 12) in place of narration

Filthy bus

Nice ride outside is all is has going for it

title: Worst City Sightseeing Bus Experience
text:
My husband and I have taken many Hop on Hop off including City Sigtseeing company and have been very satisfied with the service, but this one from Lisbon Portugal was AWFUL!.
They gave us an explanation when selling it that had nothing to do with what they do.
We had a mid-morning Tour and we thought we would take it to get to know the City and get to the point of our meeting for the Tour and ended up getting off the Bus and running to find a Taxi that would take us to the desired point because the tour was not in the time explained and also throughout the journey they only played music and did not give ANY explanation of the City or the places we passed.
Luckily when we arrived at the Tour in the City it was formidable (Free walking tour) and we got to know and learn a lot about Lisbon.
My recommendation is :Do not take this City Sightseeing in Lisbon Portugal.You will waste your money and spend your time.It is a real disrespect for those who want to know this beautiful City.

title: Don't
text: We should have listened to the reviews. We have used the company before and enjoyed it. We waited 40 minutes at a stop with no sign. I chatted with the help desk who sent us a Google maps pin. We waited. We called the London office. The bus was coming in a further 45 minutes. A full 90 minutes after the advertised starting time. Absolutely no help, terrible service.

title: Disappointed in city sightseeing bus tour.
text: Disappointing city sightseeing bus tour. Been on these across the world and always try to use the same company. But some of the buses in Lisbon don‚Äôt have any decent narration and some of them the earphone connections don‚Äôt even work .

title: Hilariously bad. Don‚Äôt do it.
text:
This was so bad. We ended up jumping off the blue line after 40 minutes. We did this as we had spent the time listening to Christmas songs, getting no guided tour insight and driving along a motorway.

Genuinely think there was 5 ‚Äúguided tour insights‚Äù made in the 40 minutes- we were laughing so hard as it‚Äôs so bad; it was comical.

General vibe was like ‚Äúhere is the military museum: lots of military items in there‚Äù. And that was it!!!
It‚Äôs like one of the main tourist sites in the city and you reduce it to that. Then they ramp up the Christmas songs to fill the void.

Also you have no clue where you are in the city. So you end up on some weird public bus trip listening to some rubbish music.

A complete shambles and waste of money. Don‚Äôt do it. Lots of great small tours, personal guides. Use them.

title: Worst experience ever ‚Ä¶ waste of money / take UBER
text: The worst experience ever, we were announced in the morning that the service is interrupted from noon to 3 PM on red line .. and the time schedule has not bee respected at all. Basically, you should go for other companies like Yellow Bus or Lisbon Sightseeing which is much more regular.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your money with this one
text: Just don‚Äôt, trust the reviews. The worst hop on hop off in the world. Zero information, you are just riding around. Languages are not available like it says on the bus. No value for money

title: city-sightseeing to avoid
text:
Hello,

We took a tourist bus for the first time to visit Lisbon. The bus driver was on the phone for most of the blue circuit. She did not activate the comments at the right time when it was necessary.

For the red line, we did not have the end of comments. When we tried to take the red line, we waited for more than an hour. When the bus arrived, there were two buses. The late bus wouldn't pick us up and then it wanted to race with our bus..

title: Poor and unprofessional trip
text: Very little audio for a city with so much history and architecture, did not go on a sightseeing tour to listen to Christmas music , no reference to different buildings , size of streets , paving, statues of different people of importance , very little mention of the earthquake that devastated the city , need to go to Bath in UK and listen to audio there

title: Poor experience & very poor value for money.
text:
City Sightseeing Tours is a very poor service. The commentary provided is very limited often inaccurate & out of date. The route makes a number of loops that are very time consuming & unnecessary. The service seems more interested in delivering passengers back to the cruiser ships than providing a genuine tour of the city.

I also believe that it is very for value for money. The three routes are barely possible to undertake in one one day without time to ‚Äúhop on & hop off‚Äù & further view points of interest.

Also on the day of the tour - there had been a few issues resulting in all three of the trips being curtailed, doubling back on part of the routes. No mention was made of this before purchasing the tickets - yet the drivers were clearly aware. All in all a very poor experience.

title: Just DON'T with City Sightseeing
text:
Just DON'T.
City Sightseeing is the worst and the most disorganised sightseeing company I have ever seen.
Waiting forever for the buses, large parts of the itineraries cut off with all sorts of excuses.
Impossible to do their 3 routes in one day and yet they sell you the tickets as if that was feasible.
Headphone sockets not working, guides out of sync to where we were, outdated information given.
Just don't choose this operator. You may also regret it.

title: Expensive, fact-lite and slow way to travel
text: There was hardly any commentary at all which was the reason we used it. We were on it for about an hour and heard maybe 4 facts. Loads of the ear phone points were broken so it limited where you could sit. We waited a very long time for the bus to arrive.

title: Avoid this company - read the reviews, don‚Äôt waste your money.
text:
Purchased 2x 24hr single red line tickets at Restauradores, stop 2, Lisbon. Was not advised better option for 48 hours and 2 lines was only 4 Euro more.

No space upstairs, very poor visibility downstairs.

Eventually took up some seats upstairs when occupants left, however audio guide system did not work, so no information. Complete waste of time and money, use the tube, tram, bus, quicker and far cheaper, wish I had read the reviews before.

Have contacted customer service, but no refund offered, I will not be using this company again.

title: Such a terrible service
text: This is just a terrible service from waiting over an hour for a bus to drivers driving past us when we were waiting at a correct stop to a bus never showing up at all at one of the hop on stops. Please do yourself a favour and don‚Äôt go with these guys, yellow bus much better!

title: Horrible this scam
text:
Traveling regularly in capitals I often took the sightseeing sightseeing sightseeing sightseeing bus. I had never been disappointed so we took the tickets without being suspicious .. and without reading the reviews. What a monumental mistake!! We looked for the wrong stops and when we found them we waited 30 to 40 minutes .. we saw the buses of the other 2 companies pass 2 to 3 times. We climbed to the Castle San Jorge on foot and wanted to take the green bus in front to get back down. 2 passed in front of us complete.. we had to leave on foot after an hour wait.
And today we wanted to make the cruise that we had paid in the 47 euros.. it was mentioned every hour from 10:45 to 17:45.. arriving at the pontoon at 14:30 after having eaten with stone lance to be on time we learn that the only one to come is in 1 hour... no one had informed us while we had asked the driver that same morning..
I strongly advise against this company on the city of Lisbon!! To flee!!

title: Worst hop on hop off bus I've done
text:
Worse bus tour I've ever gotten (my best one was in Vienna)

I wish I had checked the reviews before purchasing this one.

- you cannot see the bus positions on the map, so you end up waiting a lot, especially because they're often late
- the audio tour is very poor and in many occasions they're triggered in the wrong place
- the blue line goes through several places that are not interesting, which could be a better experience with more audio
- there were stops without marks, like blue 4
- there were stops in the wrong position in the map, like red 12
- the walking tour guide was not very good, although very kind

I don't know how the other ones are, but I strongly suggest you do your research before choosing this one.

Also, I can see they responded reviews here saying the strive to improve, but in my exclusive there's still much room for improvement compared to other buses experiences.

title: VERY BAD
text:
BAD SERVICE. I would not recommend it to anyone there are other companies that do the same service and are very good.
Long waits (three buses of the other company before ours arrived).
It started to rain a lot we asked to close the bus and said no... you can see that it is the company's disposition. we got off just in time and watching the buses go by while it rained hard and only the city sightseeing buses were open and all the people were very wet ..
I assure you that the minibuses could be closed automatically.
I strongly advise against the company.
With earphones you listen to a lot of muzzles and little history, they do not warn about subsequent stops.
Money thrown away

title: Waste of Money
text: Total rip off. Completely disorganized. Unfriendly staff. Barely got any descriptions of anything on the route, mostly just played horrible music. I gave up listening after a while. Routes were too repetitive. Been on loads of hop on hop off tours before. This was the worst one ever. Will never use again. Spend your money elsewhere. Would love to hear from the company as you owe me a refund.

title: Insufficient
text: Wait, wait, wait ....... until a bus arrives. At the station again half an hour waiting for further journey. Never again!!!!!

title: abysmal is a scam if they charged 30 euros per person in the port of Lisbon to make the tour on the bus and then we
text: It's all a scam we were robbed of.money they charged us 30 euros per person and did not give the tour as they were protests and brought us back to the port and no one responded there was no one to claim.We will report feet have stolen our money they have no scruples ever again I do not recommend them happened.Today 26 October in the port of Lisbon we arrived on the cruise shipMSC Orchestra and that is not fair that they have taken our money this way.

title: No commentary
text: No commentary, not sure what‚Äôs the point of this tour. In reality, ‚Äútour‚Äù is not a right name for it. After doing similar experiences in other countries this one could definitely be improved.

title: DONT DO IT !!
text: Terrible experience. Ok, so the driver drove way too fast. The driver did not stop at most of the stops. The buses are old and very noisy. Bought tickets near stop 7 on the green line and buses drove right past. We walked to stop 12 which is not far away to caught it and hoping it stopped for us there, which it did. On this day it was overcast, and the roof was closed. Asked the driver to open it but he said he doesnt have a key for it. Ride was fast and stuffy. Complained to staff when we got off and she told us to contact head office which i did with no reply. Overall Very Unorganised. THE WORST EXPERIENCE IVE EVER HAD... DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY. JUST LOOK AT THE REVIEWS.

title: DO NOT HSE THIS COMPANY !
text:
Please do not waste your money on this bus tour. We were waiting up-to 2 hours at a time for busses to turn up and none arrived. We were waiting by the aquarium as bus stop 9 on the blue route in the pouring rain and the two other bus tour services had multiple busses pass and none from this company.

The yellow bus company seemed a lot more organised and were a lot more frequent.

We paid for the 48 hour ticket and really wish we didn‚Äôt waste our money on this. We resulted to walking a lot of places or even using a taxi service as the bus service was so poor and we didn‚Äôt want to waste time waiting for a bus to not turn up.

I have raised a complaint with customer service and they are useless and offer no help or compensation for the appalling service offered.

title: Fatal experience
text: At the Marquis de Pombal stop, the driver bus changed and it was a real disaster. The whole journey of accelerations and sharp turns until, getting off the stop Palacio Nacional de Ajuda, we had a small accident, we noticed a strong blow in the front wheel of the driver, hitting us against the front seat and a few meters, in the middle of the street had to stop for breakdown and come another bus to pick us up as it was full. You'd expect from the way you drove. Besides the bus took more people than seats there were, they were standing in the hallway and staircase, so it was good that nothing else happened.

title: The worst red bus I have ever been on
text: Do not book with this company. The buses are irregular (over 1 hour 15 min wait at the bus stop). From the terminus at Marques de Pombal the green bus was full (we were on it) and it sat not moving for 40 minutes. You cannot get around anywhere in the city using these buses they are useless. We had a 48 hour ticket but reverted to metro on the second day due the appalling service. Do not waste your money. The yellow bus company appeared to have many more buses and more frequent - use them not this terrible terrible terrible company that ruined a day of our holiday. City sightseeing you should be ashamed of this service.

title: Bus Problems
text:
I report that I had a recent bad experience (together with my family) at City Sightseeing Lisbon / Lisbon in September 2024; I explain myself, the bad experience was mainly in the following areas:
1- We had waiting time, while trucks of other companies (example BigBus) passed almost every 20 min, Including their similar of the green route, instead, with the trucks of City Sightseeing we had to wait more than 50 minutes between trucks for both routes of, on the green route had more than an hour, this greatly affected our visits that we had scheduled forcing us to reduce their time between each other
2- There was very little variety of information that they said in the audiotur, it was very scarce, they reported almost nothing, they repeated several times in several places the same data and it was not referring to the point that was passing the bus at the moment and they almost do not report the important things when the Bus passes close or are in sight and the few that he mentions did not even say which side they were referring to the bus
3- Also the music they put in the background audio became annoying, I know that the Fados is part of the culture of Portugal, but they have it on is very melancholy and it kept repeating itself.
4- They don‚Äôt report when the stop was coming, I had to be with the map / application at hand and checking every second to know when it is about to reach a stop, nor do they inform you what is relevant to visit at that stop, outside of what you can check on the page and in the application.
5- In the Lisbon app, it DOES NOT SHOW the location of the trucks in real time, just put the estimated stopping schedule.
6- Also sometimes, especially at the end of the day, they drove too fast to meet the schedule and that does not allow you to appreciate what you see on the road
I report that because of this bad experience in our first days of our vacation, they affected the decision on the NO use of City Sightseeing buses in the following cities we visited (London / Madrid)

title: Flee poor Lisbon who does not deserve this
text: We travel very often this morning it was lame üëé the circuit blue and red uninteresting .. the audiophones of very poor quality .. it sizzled unbearable .. more than half an hour waiting between two lines .. it is the first time we notice all these inconveniences .. sincerely to flee

title: AVOID AVOID AVOID
text:
I'll start by saying this company doesn't even deserve the one star and apologies for this long review. I hope no one else gets scammed by this company.

Myself and my partner were in Lisbon for 4 days at the end of September and chose to book a hop-on hop-off tour for Thursday 26th September. We had a plan for our day which included going to the Aquarium. We arrived at the beginning of the line, at Marques De Pombal, and planned on getting the blue line (since this went up to the Aquarium). We arrived here at 11:20am just as one of the blue line buses pulled away. We asked the ground operator when the next bus would be and he said 12:00. As this wouldn't be a long wait, we just hung around, not leaving the area. During this time there were 3 or 4 green and red line buses arriving and departing with passengers. At 12:15 there was still no sign of the blue line bus. The ground operator was dismissive when questions, stating the bus was late and didn't know when it would arrive. 12:30 the bus arrives.

As we booked our tickets (X2 adult tickets for ‚Ç¨64) online, the driver was evidently annoyed that we did this because he had to use his electronic handheld device. Eventually this was sorted and off we went. The commentary was atrocious and out of sync. Waste of time. Half way through the trip, heading towards the Aquarium, the bus pulled over and the driver instructed all passengers to get off and board the bus that was behind us. Zero explanation given. On the 2nd bus, the driver was on his own personal mobile phone, having a very loud phone conversation. No way we could hear any of the commentary. We got off at the Aquarium.

After our visit, we went to the City Sightseeing spot near Gare do Oriente. We just missed a blue line bus and waited for over an hour for a bus and eventually had to give up and get the metro back to our accommodation.

This whole experience was extremely disappointing and ruined our day. It put such a dampener on our short trip to Lisbon. We have been in touch with customer service looking for a refund, but they said "there was nothing they could do" and could only offer us a 20% refund (‚Ç¨12.80!!!). The dispute with the company is still continuing, 14 days later.

title: 3 hour Nightmare
text: Arrived Cruise Terminal September 12th ,having used them before our group chose City Sightseeing Red Bus. For first 25 minutes into tour everybody trying to connect earphones to commentary with no success, only staff member was driver and he was naturally busy driving .Eventually commentary began.The journey was up and down the busy city streets, minimal commentary, very little to inspire the tourist until we finally moved onto Rio Tejo riverside road.I have no idea what route we were on , a combination of red/blue route according to map and I guess we only got commentary for the part of the route the bus was programmed for. After 2.5 hours driver came upstairs and informed us in broken english(as we were all off the cruise boat and English/ American nationals) that he was taking us back to Cruise Terminal.We arrived back almost 3 hours after our 12:43 start , overexposed to the sun and desperate for the toilet, certainly in no mood to have a chat with the sole City Sightseeing staff at Terminal. The tour was a complete waste of money, Lisbon is properly an interesting city but we did not see it on this tour, very disappointing.

title: Just don't
text: Just don't. It ruined our day. First we waited 40 minutes and were then taken just one stop where the driver had a break for 15 minutes. Then the tour continued. The recorded commentary was very poor, uninformative and out of sequence. After about 20 minutes we 'hopped off' for the first and only time. After looking around, we found ourselves stranded at the top of a hill waiting for 90 minutes while the buses of other companies passed one after the other (we were not alone). No information online as to why this happened. Tried to contact the company by phone - one number went unanswered, another was unobtainable. No email address. Tried speaking to agents at two ticket kiosks and got given the runaround.

title: A classic tourist trap, take a Tuc Tuc instead and get the personal service.
text: If you want to spend your time and money on standing in queue and countless bus stops with several minutes waiting time almost each stop, go ahead. We experienced bad service on our trip as well. We got a print out ticket from our first driver. Without any further comment from the driver, we regarded this piece of paper as any other receipt (we got the booking confirmation by mail). When trying switching buses layer the same day, we suddenly got asked for this piece of paper. Without that, it wasn‚Äôt possible to continue our trip. There was no way to reprint the ticket our show the digital evidence of paying our 24-hours tickets. You make up your own mind - I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs good customer service in 2024.

title: bad experience
text:
We had a tour on the red line of CitySightseeing Lisboa in September.
The bus was old. We sat at the bottom, because too hot to seat in the sun on the top.
There was no ventilation in the bus. No windows at the back part! And no aircon!!
Apart from that, the sound system was not understandable!
Why the review is poor and not terrible? Because we also took the green line, and the conditions were better.

title: Why do City sighseeing allow this dreadful organisation to continue ?
text:
Avoud at all costs , fond someone else Truly DIRE , Every other city sighseeing trip arounf Europe have been great but this one?
We were picked up at the port and went on our way , bit concerned it was different to the map but we thought maybe roadwrks (NO, there weren't) the commentary dreadful as it was nearly just Fado music - the trip took around 4 or 5 hours , spent ages at bus stops and we didn't see any sights , just the outskirts of the city - loads of office blocks and apartments . Eventually the driver took us to a car park and went off , a guide came o ask us whywe were on the bus - its a circular trip and we need to get back to the ship , she did her best and got the driver back whod gone for a snack and a cigarette and eventually he took us back via the outskirts of the city - got the impression he was laughing ! My partner who has a bad back suffered and did very little for the next two stops of our cruise

title: Waste of money
text: Waste of money. Was charged 32 euros against advertised price of 27 euros. Waited an hour at stop 5 for a green line bus only to be told bus was full and we should only get on this at stop 1. 2 alternative operator buses passed in time we waited. Told to walk to alternative stop 30 minutes away. Buses not as frequent as advertised, poor signage for blue line around cruise area and last buses all at 5 pm and limited commentary. In 6 hours only managed to complete part of red and blue lines and 2 stops on green line without any opportunity for sightseeing. You‚Äôd be better off walking and using metro and trams to get around the city.

title: Bad experience
text: We stayed more than half an hour waiting for a bus on blue line 12, the bus did not stop because another bus came behind and the other bus was from another company. There are very few buses from this company, which makes you not give to complete all routes, unless you spend the whole day on the bus. I do not recommend, money put out.

title: Shocking commentary. Give this tour a miss.
text:
Give this your company a miss.

This could have been very informative but the commentary was terrible. 90% of the commentary was crap music. There was no explanation about the city, people, history or anything. We went past so many interesting buildings and parks with no explanation.

title: Don't do it!
text: Hardly any buses and no way to find out, even one star is far too many. If you want to save time and nerves, book the Grey Line!

title: Extremely disappointing
text: My husband and I paid 64 euros for a day pass on the city sightseeing Hop on - Hop off bus. What a disaster. We were taken to bus stop 5 by the representative and waited for a bus. We wanted to try the green route first but only a small bus so no chance of getting on one. We couldn't get on the first red route bus and had to wait another 40 minutes for the next one. There were just a few seats but we managed to get on the back of the bus. There was only one plug in point to hear the information so only one of us could plug in. We heard music then it went off so no information was heard . We stayed on the bus to go round as if we got off we wouldn't have got back on again. We tried to get on another route but buses were always full. The agents were not interested. I asked for a refund but no chance of that. We finished up paying for a boat trip on the front which was lovely for half the price. We cannot recommend the bus at all, expensive less than 2 hours sat on a bus looking at buildings and not knowing anything about them as no information to be heard.

title: Absolutely no Recommendation !
text: We had to wait a total of 45 minutes at one station. During this time, two buses of the other line passed by, in which there were still enough seats. When our bus finally arrived, it was of course completely full. During the journey, terrible music plays and only at the stops is something briefly said. From other bus trips I know this differently, that you are also informed during the trip.

title: Don‚Äôt Even Consider This Tour
text:
Do not do this tour. Their service is not only spotty but if you hop off and expect to hop on another bus anytime soon expect to wait hours. The green bus to the castle is small due to the small streets it has to navigate but there need to be many more of them. I was sitting right behind our driver who while driving watched a video on her phone, ate and had a phone conversation the entire trip. Talk about distracted driving! This company is disorganized from top to bottom. I think we hopped off a total of 3 times from 2 buses due to the long wait in between. If we hopped off more would probably still be waiting by a sign in Lisbon.
Save your money, walk and take cabs or uber.

title: No!
text: To escape. Very few buses with totally random schedules. At the same stops, another company. Two buses from the other company pass... 50 min wait... (red line, the one we expected) the few comments are uninteresting, but fado with rotten sound floods your ears. End of shift at 17.30. Conclusion, a journey from the ferry station to Belem Cathedral for 34‚Ç¨. No more buses back 17.15 at the stop. Return by bus 15E. Take the tram!

title: Lisbon City Sightseeing Misery
text:
City Sightseeing Lisbon Red line
This tour was one of our worst experiences. We (4) purchased the Essential tour. Our first experience was to go to Bel√©m Tower. The driver had difficulty with the ticket purchase but sorted it out after showing him a picture from the website. At the end of our trip we waited an hour and a half for the next bus. Everyone on the bus was furious. The poor driver got an earful from many customers. We decided to Uber as the wait wasn't worth it.

title: Disappointing
text: This is the worst sightseeing experience I have ever had on a sightseeing bus. A short audio is very lacking. Disappointed with experience and a waste of my time and money.

title: The worst city sightseeing we've been on
text:
We always tend to use the red bus City Sightseeing hop on and off when we visit new places. They tend to give you a great overview and orientation of the area. This one cost ‚Ç¨35 each for 48 hours. We purchased the tickets at 11 a.m., and this meant on the 3rd day we were able to get on the bus nice and early to take us to the station for a trip to Cascais.
All I will say is this is a facility to get you around the sights. Nothing more. You're not given the headphones by the ticket seller, then you're left wondering where they are. They are in the front dash area of the buses. The commentary is very sparse with little information about where you are, what the next stop is, and what you are about to come to. When there is commentary its out of sync with the places of interest, by that, I mean you've missed them as you've already gone by them. Make sure you're looking out for the stops the bus doesn't hang around if you're dithering as to whether to get off or not.
The green route is the better route, but smaller bus due to the narrow roads, it tends to fill up at stop 1, so you've no chance getting on it before the castle stop. Blue line more for expo centre. Red line, for Belem.
I am sure there was more to learn about the place, it was quite disappointing from that point of view.

title: Red route tour wasted 3 hrs
text: Total waste of 3 hrs . No information earphone didn't work on bus. Spent 3hrs doing circular of 26 miles around shops and few monuments not knowing what they where

title: Not so great tour
text:
We took city sightseeing tour in Porto and Lisbon and the experience was not there.
Company staff gave us bad directions. Long wait at bus stop sometime one hour. The company has no App for bus tracking.
I don‚Äôt recommend City sightseeing tour company. You should book with Grayline tour or Yellow Bus. There are more convenient.

title: Truly shocking. They need massive improvements
text: I‚Äôm only sorry I didn‚Äôt read reviews 1st the tour of all 3 lines is truly shockingly bad. If I could give no star I would. The audio only explained a few sites and had to listen so rubbish music in between. We‚Äôve used this company in other cities and had been very impressed but they need to massively up their audio here. Lisbon has so much to talk about but only heard but the earthquake in 1755 about 10 times and the fires in 1988. Seriously fix this guys!!

title: Probably the worst of all!
text: Awful! Green line: very few words spoken by the audio system, uninteresting as well. The driver was driving too fast to enjoy anything. Red line: audio was better but the driver scratched the front bumper of a car parked. We stayed on site for 30 minutes not knowing what was going on until I went down and saw the driver signing accident report! No communication whatsoever. The worst!

title: Terrible company to deal with - avoid, use a different city tour!
text: We purchased an online ticket when in Lisbon with our cruise in July. The company‚Äôs own website states buses are every 30 mins. We waited at our chosen stop in heat of 36 degrees for 40 mins and no bus came, until the kids couldn‚Äôt stick the heat anymore so we had to leave and got a taxi. The ticket wasn‚Äôt activated and the company has refused to give a refund despite them not meeting their own commitment regarding time between buses. A completely unreasonable, unreliable company! I even asked for a credit to use in another city (we were only is Lisbon that one day) and they‚Äôve refused that too! Don‚Äôt give this company your money!

title: DISAPPOINTED in Lisbon
text:
Having gone on the Liverpool tour, we were excited to see this available on our day stop in Lisbon for our cruise. Didn‚Äôt even come close the meeting expectations.

We bought tickets in the cruise terminal. We were advised as to the two route options of Red or Blue. We decided Red was the right option for us and hopped on the bus. Fortunately we learned early from another passenger that the Red route only picked up at the cruise terminal‚Ä¶but that we would need the Blue route to get back to our starting point

While the flyer/map says English, only the major stop descriptions are in English.

The design is awful for trying to actually see the language number of the 13 options. The sound is mono ‚Ä¶ meaning it only generates into one earphone, not both. This is problematic when you have busy street sounds and people conversing.

Once we got going, the narrator was very limited. Since we didn‚Äôt start at the usual starting point we thought it would get better when we stop 1 ‚Ä¶ about 30 minutes later. Even then we only could tell it was stop 1 by the map.

Getting going the narrator picked up again. You except silence at stoplights and slow traffic. However most of the narratives were about 3 sentences. As we approached stops, there was nothing that clearly stated stop 2, 3, etc. Again had to figure it out from the map ‚Ä¶ in Portuguese.

Finally arriving at stop 6 nearly an hour after starting at stop 1 (not the cruise port, but the real stop 1) we got off. This was the closest to the cruise terminal. With 10 more stops to go plus needing to get onto the Blue line to get back to the port, we gave up. We didn‚Äôt expect to take 3 hours or more to make it one time around the route.

Very disappointing and a HUGE WASTE OF MONEY!!

title: Non sight seeing tours
text: This was a poor experience compared to similar tours in other cities . The commentary on the headset provided was scant and the brochure was in Portugese with very few tips or descriptions on what would be good to see . We did the red line bus which had 20 on/off stops most of which were not near any decent attractions . Nobody got off at the first 10 stops and nobody got on which indicated how poor the attractions where . Some of the attractions were closed on Monday but the driver didn't know if they were open or not . The only thing I discovered about Lisbon was that the hop on hop off buses are the worst tourist guides I have ever been on.

title: Avoid
text:
Avoid buying from cruise terminal.
You will be told that you have bought green (old town), red (new town) & Blue (surrounding area).
We were met at the bus stop and told to get Blue line first after an argument about the tickets went left, good grief you don‚Äôt want to see anything on the blue line it‚Äôs the rough side of town.
The bus was packed & forced downstairs with no air conditioning & most of the audio was dreadful music.
We arrived at the main meeting point number 1 after 45 painful mins.
We waited patiently being told different places to wait in the scorching sun & watched the chaos.
After 20 mins & letting the red line pass we got on the small single decker bus.
Only to be told our purchase didn‚Äôt include the green line.
We tried to explain we bought all 3 lines to be told it‚Äôs impossible to buy all 3 lines.
While trying to explain, the bus now full went without us.
I can understand ‚Ç¨27 pp for the green & red lines (didn‚Äôt get to use) & then extra ‚Ç¨3 for blue line if u really want to see the rough side.
We bought 8 x ‚Ç¨27 = ‚Ç¨216 if we were told ‚Ç¨30 we would have paid it.
There were other places selling all 3 lines.
The town is easily accessible by foot from the cruise terminal & heard good things from passengers using the electric tuk tuk.
If u really have to use this service just walk into town & get on at any green line stops for ‚Ç¨3.

title: Poor narration
text: Very little narration and they don‚Äôt announce the stops. If you aren‚Äôt on the right side of the bus to see the bus stop signs you don‚Äôt know where you are

title: Avoid City Sightseeing in Lisbon
text: Crappy. They just drove around the city for 2 hours with nearly no narration, what narration there was, was difficult to understand; there was no announcement of stops or what could be accessed at each stop. No clear method to get back to the cruise port. Find a different company.

title: I would give it a ZERO
text: This was the worst hop on hop off bus I have ever been on. the audio was not in sync with what I was seeing and the audio was not informative. Big waste of time. I was able to use my tickets that day and the next but only did the one leg and would not get on again. The company was less than understanding. VERY DISAPPOINTED

title: Crappy tour - no information
text: This was a waster of money-might as well have been on a city bus. Most of the tour was just music with no explanation of what we were seeing or any history. I would not recommend this tour to anyone!

title: Much longer route than advertised - check the route timings!
text: 6 of us went on the Red Route tour from the Cruise Terminal, 27 euros each. It started off well, but the commentary was average and 80% was music being played. The person who sold us the tickets at the cruise terminal told us the Red Route was 90 minutes. 3 hours later, and feeling fried in the heat, we made it back to the terminal. Check that your bus returns to the cruise terminal as we were suddenly told to change buses part way through the route.

title: Mai pi√π!
text: We disembarked from the cruise ship and, having little time available, we chose this service. A decidedly wrong choice! When we made the tickets we were assured that the full tour would last about two hours. We went up at 8.30 and after two hours we arrived at the Bel√©m tower... of course from there we had to return...another hour and a half! Many headphone connections did not work, ours for example... we changed seats twice to find one that worked, but the volume was very low, with traffic you could hear very little! Also not always the information given corresponded to what you saw... probably the service works for other cities, for Lisbon just not!

title: Disappointed
text:
I had high hopes for the tour. My goal was to learn about the city before deciding what to see later in person. I travelled both lines in one day: blue and red.
Two of my biggest complaints are:
1. No air conditioning on the lower level. On a hot sunny Portuguese day the choice was to bake in the sun on the upper deck or broil in the shade of the lower deck. None of them too pleasant
2. The audio commentary was very, very scarce. Each line was about 90-120 minutes long but the total audio time was maybe 5-10 minutes. The information was very basic and repetitive. The rest of the time, the system played fado music. Although beautiful, it gets old when you hear the same songs couple of times over.

Improve the guide, install some AC or at least fans and the score will go up!

title: ABSOLUTE RUBBISH EXPERIENCE. RIPPED OFF AGAIN!
text:
What a shocking experience.DO NOT USE. ‚Ç¨60 wasted poor information passing lots of historical building with nothing on the audio guide but they do tell you about the biggest department store in Lisbon. The map is very difficult to follow, you‚Äôd think by now such a global company would have an app as guidance!
You‚Äôd be better off jumping in a tuk tuk or using a local guide as the red buses are rubbish. Had a similar experience in San Sebasti√°n last year and vowed not to use again but got sucked in by a the clever sales person. I‚ÄôVE BEEN ROBBED NEVER AGAIN!

title: Don‚Äôt book any City Sightseeing tours - dismal ‚Äúcommentary‚Äù and awful music
text: This was awful. Commentary was sloppy, and the same information was told on all three routes. Dont do this tour - the lady with the long ponytail at the Marque roundabout at the beginning of the tour was fantastic and informative. The commentaries on all three buses were dismal. And they played dreadful music constantly. It was awful. So many lovely buildings, parks, etc with such an opportunity to inform. Awful awful awful

title: Rubbish
text: Got tickets for the blue & red lines. Caught the blue line at starting point. Couple of staff hovering around clearly left their brain at home that day. Eventually got on journey, driver was riding other cars/bikes back sides, so dangerous. Blue route dull and like going through the bronx/interstate highway. Got red route later in day, slightly better and more scenic. Staff were of very poor quality.

title: Bloody lip + Bad Service
text:
My Mom got a bloody lip after an emergency break because the driver didnt See the Red Light.

We didnt got the headphones. Only after we requested them and then our Tour was already half done.
Such a bad Service for 81 euros (3 adults) . Stay away

title: Avoid - they‚Äôll waste your day
text: You‚Äôll spend more time waiting for the bus than actually on the tour. The website says 30 minutes between buses but I waiting over an hour for each bus, consistently. Terrible experience, you‚Äôll waste your entire day and the staff are extremely rude

title: Use a different travel company
text: Waited at the bus stop for an hour (busses supposed to come every 30 minutes). No busses ever came - well four busses passed from other travel companies but zero from City Sightseeing. Wasted an hour of our day and ended up Ubering the rest of the day. When I contacted the company for a refund they said no, I had to have requested the refund more than 24 hours prior to the day of use - as if I knew ahead of time that their company sucked and wouldn‚Äôt have any busses running on time. Use a different company if you intend to do a sightseeing bus. There are multiple options and City Sightseeing is the worst one.

title: City sightseeing disaster of a company
text: We used city sightseeing buses in many cities we have visited but lisbons version was very poor. We booked the 24 hour pass and got on the red line at belem and stayed on until we reached stop number one as we wanted to change to the blue line. This is where it all went very wrong. The blue line bus didn‚Äôt show up for 70 minutes and at this stage the line was long . There where staff from city sightseeing there but when they saw how frustrated people where getting they quickly distanced themselves from the ever growing line. The main frustration seemed to be with people who where using the bus to get back to their cruise ships. The blue route bus finally arrived and we managed to get on. We had planned on getting off at the aquarium but it was now 3pm and the last bus was at 6pm so we didn‚Äôt feel we had enough time to get off and get back on due to the unpredictability of the buses. So we stayed on the bus and did the whole of the blue loop which was one of the worst routes we where ever on. Absolutely nothing to see of any interest mainly down through the industrial area of lisbon then up to the aquarium and back down some main roads. The commentary was non existent due to it being a prerecorded version you listen to on individual earphones. The buses are severely underpowered to deal with the lisbon hills slowing to a crawl on some inclines . It took approximately 2 hours to do 3/4 of the blue loop as we got off at the first stop back in the city and used a bolt to get the rest of the way. Terrible experience with city sightseeing and would be hesitant to use them again in any city. We used Grayline the next day to do the green / castle route which we found much better service from. Agin the commentary was useless but the have a live app you can see when the next bus is arriving which was good

title: Diabolical and shambolic service
text:
A complete waste of money. Buses infrequent., rude and bad drivers, used car sales people. Just not worth the hassle, time and money . Don‚Äôt do it!!

PS the headphone sockets don‚Äôt work in a lot of seats‚Ä¶

title: Don't do it!
text:
Absolute waste of ‚Ç¨27. Virtual tour guide (where you plug in earphones to hear what you're seeing) did not work. We tried several adaptors. It took 3 hours to get half way round the red route. We chose to abort for fear of missing our ships sailing. 4 of us paid for this. Total waste of time & money!

Constantly sat in traffic. I'd score minus if l could

title: Waste our money
text: The worst experience we had in Lisbon. Without any information, because quite simply no one spoke English. We were told that for 27 euros per person we could use the red line one day and the blue line the next. The next day 09/11 the bus with the blue line never passed, and neither did the following 10/11. They worked for us normally. The red line bus came whenever it wanted without any specific schedule. Waste our money.

title: City Sightseeing Lisbon should definitely be avoided!
text:
Absolutely bad, had to wait 1.5 hours for the next bus, while Gray Line (another and much better provider) had a bus stop 5 times.
The comments didn't work either.
The roof also couldn't be closed despite the rain.

title: Worst bus company in Lisbon
text: This bus was honestly so awful and not worth the money at all!! Do not recommend using them at all! The Lisbon hop-on hop-off or yellow buses looked way better! The bus would consistently drive past and not stop even if it wasn‚Äôt full! Had to wait over an hour and a half for one single bus to come. Not worth it at all!

title: Wish I had read all the others review first.
text: We found the same things - no air conditioning downstairs in the buses, it was like a sauna down there, the alternative was full on sun upstairs, no usefully commentary on the audio and the tours stop so early (4:30) that we didn't get time to use all three tours.

title: Bad experience you‚Äôll wait over 30 minutes for a bus.
text: We consistently waited over a half hour for our busses other operators like grey line would have 2 and sometimes 3 busses come by before 1 of the city sightseeing tour busses. Bad experience overall and would not book again. I HIGHLY recommend finding another provider who won‚Äôt leave you waiting your day waiting for busses with no audio guides of what you are seeing.

title: Not worth it
text: If you want to get to know Lisbon and move around the city, this is not a good option at all, you waste a lot of time, the frequency of arrival and departure of the buses in different parts of the city is too late, we had to take Uber several times to be able to really fulfill our plan of visits to the points of interest, a joke.

title: Waste of money worst ever city bus tour.
text: Appalling experience on green route, awful music, no commentary. Driver spent all the time on mobile phone. Two sockets failed to work in a group of 6. Not told limited numbers on bus when booking so risked group being split. At most pick up points customers could not avail of bus due to lack of seats. Would not recommend waste of money. üò°

title: Terrible experience using this company for a tour of Lisbon.
text:
Worst experience I have ever had on a sightseeing tour!! Had to change seats 7x‚Äôs to find a working place for the headphones. Minimal information about the sights/ attractions. Two hours later and very frustrated I gave up and took a taxi back to the cruise ship.

üòÇü•µ

title: Waste of money !!!!
text: What a waste of money. No audio guide or personal guide. So 1 1/2 hours on a bus not knowing where we were going and no one to complain to !!!!!

title: outdated
text: I really can‚Äôt recommend this company. The map is behind the paywall, finding the pick up spots is a hassle because half are missing because if construction, getting the location for Bolt or Uber to take you to the pickup is bear impossible because you get coordinates and not addresses. This is especially frustrating for people with limited mobility as is my friend. then there is no way to know when the bus is scheduled to arrive. Setting up a live map should be a given at this day and age. so now we have been waiting an hour at the same pick up spot and have no idea if the bus will even arrive. Also they insist on printing out a receipt. once you have the paper voucher you cant reuse the digital QR. so if you lose it it or forget it you cant get on. why not just use the same QR instead of printing a physical ticket?

title: Rubbish
text:
Pitiful commentary - mostly music. Learned nothing. Major buildings not mentioned when passed.
No mention of what stop you are at when on the bus.
Finishes at 5.30pm whereas others go until 8pm.
Told we had a 48hr ticket but nowhere does it mention on the actual ticket (leaflet/map says 24hr only)
Wish we had read all the 1 star reviews recently before buying tickets.
City Sightseeing should be ashamed of this - it will ruin their reasonable reputation in other cities.

title: Loss of money
text: I think the company is in decline. We used it in other cities and it was cool. But in Lisbon it was a trap. Buses take a long time to pass, until the bus arrives (it seems like it's always the same) there were on average 2 cars passing by. On the blue line, it just didn't pass. That's why they're giving 2 days for the price of one, but it's not worth it.

title: Better to add runs
text: The beautiful tours last 48 hours at the cost of 24 hours. But there are few buses, the wait is eternal. You can't use them to see or enter the monuments, at most one... you waste too much time waiting for them. Already started 30' late from stop 1 with the first race. At 5pm it is too early to finish the service.

title: catastrophe
text: We bought the ticket in the cruise terminal, as the queue for the red line was very long, we went to the first station on the blue line (every 50 minutes).
