Tripadvisor anarchizes you from 10‚Ç¨ per person.
Otherwise the museum is fine, even if it is a little far from the center (and that's why there is no huge tail justifying the queue cut!)

title: Skip the line ticket did not work
text: I purchased 3 advance entry tickets which were described as skip the line. Upon arrival we presented these tickets and were told they are not accepted at the monastery. The line wrapped around the building and was a few hours long. Do not buy these tickets on trip advisor!!! It is a complete waste of money.

title: No entrance tickets
text:
We did not receive the entrance tickets, just a fact sheet, and we could not reach anyone at the phone number indicated. Luckily the lady at the front desk of the museum understood our problem and let us in, otherwise we would have paid for nothing
We'll never go through TripAdvisor again

title: Tickets didn‚Äôt work. Be wary!
text: I didn‚Äôt get sent any tickets. The email I got sent was quite confusing and I thought I had the tickets only to realise in the small print I was waiting for another email to be sent. Tried to call company and number provided wasn‚Äôt a real number. Didn‚Äôt get in

title: Unjustified delay
text: Unjustified delay. Alfa pendular lisboa - santa Apol√≥nia - day 28/07, with departure from lisboa at 18h00 and arrival at terminal station at 21h27. The train arrived in Braga at 22:00.

title: The CP trains
text:
Lisbon Entrecampos to Loul√©, Alfa Pendular in 1st class, with departure at 17.31h
Delay of 11m. at departure. It's not acceptable. I use trains in Europe, Germany and the Netherlands and punctuality is an honor.
Interior of the wagon in good condition although the container on the back of the chair that preceded me had dirty papers. Adequate air conditioning.
WC. A scandal of smell and dirt. The pest odor of urine is offensive to passengers.
And why this pest odor? It's only derived from the sanita to have a hole in "open sky" where the destroyers run. Imagine if the accumulate of bad smell that permanently come out through that hole
The planes have a suction system. And the CP, which is in the ink for passengers, and could replace these sanitas, keep this system, archaic, outdated and disgusting, no doubt.
The bar. A shame. The products presented appear to be of very low quality. The decomposition of the counter is sick. The service provided by the sole official is deplorable.
And besides all this, 25m late on arrival to Loul√©.
A shame and a screaming lack of respect for the passengers. The CP administration has an obligation to go through what we go through on these trains. Get out of the cabinets and use these routes.
Fernando Pimenta

title: Huge delay.
text:
I bought a ticket for 11:30 which would arrive at my destination at 12:37. At 12:15 I was still waiting for the train to start. Delay: 47 minutes. In Tavira was still stopped for more than 15 minutes. It was 13:20 and I had not yet reached my destination ‚Äì Vila Real de Santo Ant√≥nio.
Oh, bad.

title: Late and dirty
text: Unfortunately delayed in several sections of the way, the first-class bathrooms lack water and are dirty, in an Alfa.

title: Ticket purchase fails due to poor implementation
text: ‚ÄúUnfortunately, the ticket machines are very confusing. There is an English language option, but the button for it is not labeled. Contactless payment is not possible, and credit card payment did not work at all three machines tested. This made me miss my train, because of course there was a long queue at the counters. For a concern as simple as buying tickets, I would have liked a much more user-friendly system.‚Äù

title: ABSOLUTELY LEAK
text:
Leave 25 minutes late. No air conditioning. Wagon not found. Permanent stops with shoving even when sitting.
Besides, we get out of his seat.

title: Comboios De Portugal is disappointing (Ticket buying experience)
text: So far the least favorite in this trip. Be sure to not make any mistake in buying your ticket at the ticket machine at Oriente. We bought 2 1st class tickets to Porto. Missed the train for 2 minutes so we went to the ticket counter and was told there‚Äôs nothing we could do. No return no exchange basically. However i went to the CP website and it says something different. I was also told by the conductor to talk to the ticket personnel at the Campanha, Porto and see if we could get a refund. We end up buying regular tickets because we want to see Porto. I‚Äôll update with our experience in Campanha.

title: Heat exhaustion on Comboios de Portugal No train crew to be seen as passengers suffered
text: My Wife Sister in law and I traveled on an IC inter City train on May 29th Faro to Lisbon because of a need to a funeral. It was a very warm day. We traveled in the last car all three are seniors. An hour into the 3.5 hour trip the car began to overheat to the point that hand measurement showed temperature at close to 100F. Complaints were made to staff who told us that the train crew was aware but nothing wad done. The so called Air conditioning system did not work and no attempt was made to fix it or at least provide water to passengers. In the last hour of the trip several passengers began to suffer heat exhaustion. I LOVE TRAIN travel and this is the worst trip I have ever been on. The train crew was no where to be found. A number of passengers were endangered

title: Another day at CP
text:
I just don't give zero because I can't!

title: Train shut down, no one says anything, and it's hot
text: Bad service, probably the worst transport company. In the Sado line, they always go late, turn off, etc, etc. Very bad. The reviewers should be ashamed of checking passes when we have bad service.

title: Price and logistics reviews
text:
Criticism of CP ‚Äì Trains of Portugal

I would like to express my dissatisfaction with the experience we had with CP. We organized a trip with a group of 47 children and 8 adults, having tried to book seats at Alfa Pendular from November 2024 to May 23, 2025. Despite the huge advance, we were never allowed to make the reservation.

In addition, CP‚Äôs advertising of ‚Äúspecial prices for groups‚Äù proved completely misleading. Group tickets were more expensive than if purchased individually ‚Äî for example, each adult paid ‚Ç¨49.90, while the individual value would be ‚Ç¨33. Instead of a discount, we had a price deterioration.

As if not enough, on the return, two of the seats reserved for our group were occupied by passengers who claimed to also have a ticket. As the revisor took more than an hour to show up, two people from our group had to travel standing during this time, thinking that CP had sold the same seats twice. Only then the revisor, who was attentive and efficient (without any fault because we were penultimate wagon), solved the situation.

title: Aggressive and Intimidating Treatment of Tourists ‚Äì Avoid This Train Company
text:
We had an absolutely awful experience with Comboios de Portugal (CP) on the return train from Pinh√£o to Porto.

We had bought tickets for a later train, but after checking directly with the train driver, we were told it was fine to board an earlier service. Once the train had departed, the ticket inspector approached us and told us our tickets were invalid. When we explained that we had been told by a CP staff member that it was okay, he became aggressive and threatening.

He demanded we show ID. My husband had his passport, but I only had mine on my phone ‚Äî which he refused to accept. He then threatened to call the police unless we paid him in cash on the spot. It was extremely intimidating and felt completely unfair. We were forced to pay just to avoid further distress.

We have video evidence of this encounter, and it left us feeling shaken and disgusted. We were two respectful tourists, acting in good faith, treated like criminals for a simple misunderstanding ‚Äî one we even tried to clarify before boarding.

CP needs to take responsibility for its unprofessional, dishonest, and borderline abusive conduct. This kind of treatment of visitors is unacceptable. Based on our experience, I would strongly advise tourists to avoid travelling by train in Portugal unless you want to risk being ripped off or threatened.

Absolutely disgraceful.

title: Do not support!! Fake public company!!!!
text:
Do not use this company!! Much better alternatives both in RedeExpressos and Flixbus. There's absolutely no way for you to know if you will have your train or if the workers decide to stay at home, despite being over-payed by a lot considering what they do. Not last time, but last 5 or 6 times i needed to use the service one of the trains were down, or delayed (not 5min, like more than 1hour, always!)!! Besides all that, both bus companies have updated and upgraded their buses and they are way better than any cp train - at least they don't smell.

What made this place memorable: horrible!
Ease of booking and navigation: only for the rich that travel in expensive trains; others have to buy tickets in person!
Potential costs or wait times: extra expensive considering the quality and time spent and as for the time wasted it can be at least 1h to your train not even departing without any warning.

title: Huge delays

title: 0/10 stars
text: I usually prefer taking public transportation when I travel in Europe, however Portugal‚Äôs train system is one of the worst I‚Äôve experienced. It definitely ruined the magic of the country during our vacation. Next time, we will be taking the buses instead.

title: CP, "no comments!"
text:
Your incompetence is shameful! Even more if we think that you work a lot with tourists and therefore are part of the image that Portugal projects abroad!

text: Prices out of proportion to the country's standard of living and without compensation given the poor services provided. Recurring problems of strikes and damages of all kinds. Random punctuality.

title: Scenic route, rude staff on train, dated train cars
text: We booked the high speed train from Lisbon to Porto and paid for an upgraded first class ticket. Pros: the first class seats were spacious with ample leg room. And the trip offered at me pretty views. The cons: the CP staff on the train were not very helpful and exceedingly rude. The train cars are not well marked. There is very limited luggage space for 25" suitcases and the train staff will not help you lift your bag into the limited shelves at the end of the car or to the overhead bin, so make sure you can lift your suitcase over your head by yourself b/ no one will assist you. The train car we were in was dated and in need of an upgrade. Cloth seats in first class car? Gross!! I commute into NYC via Metro North commuter train in leather seats. Lots of room for improvement CP.

title: RUDE TRAIN STAFF
text: I live in Portugal and at times travelling by train is an appalling experience. Where most of the ticket staff are courteous there are a few who are unbelievably rude. It requires immense self-control not to punch one or two.

title: Disgraceful service
text: Terrible. Unfortunately I have to use the train from Malveira to Figueira da Foz frequently, the train often stops running in the middle of the journey to be repaired during the journey (which always takes at least 30 minutes), or I am surprised by a surprise strike when I'm supposed to change trains (although they let me buy the full ticket). Furthermore, the trains are old, barely work and travel is very slow.

title: corrupt CP
text:
Public company, funded by taxpayers, which is constantly on strike claiming, and I quote, "for better conditions for workers and users".
Absolute lie. CP workers are worried about the conditions of users, the only thing they want is to get more pay at the end of the month.
Even when they are not on strike, the trains are repeatedly delayed and clarifications are never given to users.
The company should pay for us to use terrible transport like CP.
And when they go on strikes, they still have the shame of only doing so when the passes are purchased and they still close the doors so that we need to buy a ticket or pass. They strike and the day is won!

title: Perfect for a cold
text: Please!!! Turn off the useless AC directly at your feet!! Every time I travel Inter Cities this happens‚Ä¶

title: Many Opportunities for Improvement
text: There are so many things they could do better. On the IC, improve the numbering to clearly identify the car. Many people didn't know what car they were on which caused seating problems (not an issue on the AP). Wi Fi is free but terribly slow on the IC. Could not connect to anything. Washrooms with sinks that don't work. No soap, no paper towels or dryers that work. No place on the IC to store large suitcases. Only option is the overhead rack which doesn't work for older people with large heavy bags. Being government run, it's unlikely these things will improve.

title: CP APP
text: I bought my train tickets through the CP app: bad idea. On three occasions I was unfairly charged for tickets I had not purchased. I filed a claim online for refund but there is no news!!! This is not normal, do something about it üò°

title: Travel by train, with comfort and friendliness!
text:
I really like traveling by train and due to personal circumstances I do it frequently (long-distance trains).
That's why I decided to make this note today... In addition to the bathrooms with very poor hygiene (I've seen some improvement in the last 2/3 minutes!), there are frequent delays which makes the schedule "flexible".
So, on my trip, I asked what time the train arrived in Tunis... I also know that there is work on the line!
To which Mr Revisor, unlike his other colleagues who have always been impeccable, polite and helpful, replied rudely, in addition to an expression of boredom, that I wouldn't let him do his job, I had 400 passengers, who could have asked when I bought the ticket, at the ticket office (more than 8 days ago!, would you already know about possible delays at that time?)
I report this because I think it is unacceptable to be mistreated in public for politely asking the conductor of the train I am traveling on, what the timetable is!!!
And because I think that in Portugal we should travel a lot more by train, for all the well-known advantages, we have to be a little more demanding for those who have the right to invest seriously, from all points of view, in the railway.

title: Beware of CP Portugal Rail, can be confusing.
text: We booked our train tickets on line for Lisbon to Porto. I used what I thought was Portugals national rail website but turns out to be a third party app. Able to purchase discounted tickets but no way to translate the ticket information. Upon arrival at Lisboa Oriente train station (Lisbon main train hub) there was no information booth or personnel available and nothing in English. After asking random people for help able to find correct line then determining with train, carriage and finding luggage storage was a nightmare. ONLY use the CP Portugal website, book in advance as they WILL get booked up. If you can ask someone whose used the rail system before to help understand because it can be very frustrating.

title: Delay for more than 45 minutes

title: Safety concerns
text: Took train from Lagos to Lisbon today. On disembarking the train starts to leave throwing my wife to the ground. Luckily she wasn't injured. The train did stop once they realized what happened. However their explanation was there was plenty of time to get off. Obviously not and shouldn't someone be checking for an all clear. Upon complaining to the ticket office at Lisbon Entrecampus station they had nothing to say but lame excuses. Just be careful and look out for your own safety no one employed with CP is concerned for you.

title: Nice guide but waste of money
text:
We definitely wouldn't do this again!
Our tour guide was nice.
But it was definitely not worth the money spent.
We probably had completely wrong expectations.
The historical information about Portugal was very limited (on a 2-hour guided tour with walking gurus we learned about 10x as much)
The tour is limited to about three streets, that's all you can see from Lisbon.
You also don't get an insight into local manufacturers or insider tips with top products but visit normal restaurants and shops.
The food was okay but not great.
The second stop was a restaurant where there was a rice dish, after that we were pretty full.
Better spend your money on a cheaper historic city tour and at a few markets and good restaurants!

title: Overbooked the tour, cancelled us. Ruined the last day of our holiday. No refund until after we get home. Almost ¬£300
text:
We booked this wine tasting for the last day of our holiday and paid in advance for 6 of us costing the best part of ¬£300.

We were asked to change the time the day before and when I said we couldn‚Äôt we were told they were full and our booking was cancelled.

I now have to wait until we are home from holiday before I get the refund which means we can‚Äôt fund another activity.

Why are they not limiting ticket sales to a number that they can handle?

So disappointing

title: Poor poor poor service!
text:
Booked via booking.com

Did not get what I booked.

Booked an executive transfer and got a rude, obnoxious, tracksuit pant and t shirt wearing
lady who had no idea about customer service.

Was then fed into a crappy Renault (def not executive) and whisked away. These people should be involved with airport transfers as if this is how you enter a country, it leaves a re bad taste in one one‚Äôs mouth!

title: Disappointed. Our expectations of the bike lanes were unrealistic.
text:
Perhaps I‚Äôm looking at this from a slightly different perspective to those who have written glowing reports. We cycle regularly at home on cycle tracks, quiet country lanes and, if impossible to avoid, occasionally short sections in traffic. Our average for a trip is 30-50k. When we saw Lisbon had been developing their cycle lanes and was great for a cycle break, we were really pleased, and hoped for miles of unhindered cycling along the coast, as in Mediterranean France. We felt it would be a good way to explore but didn‚Äôt see any options to hire for several days at a time. So we just planned the one, to start with, a 56k return cycle along the coast to Cascais.
Well, it was stop-start all the way as far as we got. The bike tracks kept finishing, and were not particularly well signed, so we often had to backtrack. A railway line ran the length of our journey and sometimes, when the track suddenly ran out, we‚Äôd have to use tunnels to get under the railway and once we had to carry the heavy bikes up steps. As far as possible we avoided cycling on the (very) busy roads, but this meant cycling on the pavements, which were narrow at times. Finding it more stressful than relaxing, we gave up half way and turned round to come back. But we couldn‚Äôt find the cycle path and went for miles to try to find a way to get back across the railway line without using steps. We enjoyed the exercise and the bikes were excellent but thank goodness we only booked one day. I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs great if you only want to go 10k or so.

title: Disappointed
text:
Far too many people in August
Even with advance tickets
The queue was so huge that we were late on schedule and we were not allowed to go back
We could only make the gardens
Besides, we can no longer get in the car
So plan to be on Sintra at least 1.5 hours before schedule

We'll try to get a refund
Avoid tourist areas in August

title: Czech people no hello no thanks pay and shut up
text: trip to Prague with e dreams it starts at the airport book a transfer 1 hour late the delay came 1 hour too early at once 3 hours to wait for our return flight, the 4 star hotel was worth only 2 stars had to pay an extra superior room to access the pool , bowling broke down tennis or rather a vacant lot , many faults answer of e dream when to refund had to see with the hotel while the hotel tells us that we are not the first not to be warned by e dreams of the extra costs I advise e dreams washes your hands of your problems just pockets the money and disappears...

title: Absolute horror tour
text: All in all, not recommended. The only dramatic thing was the 6.5 hour journey in the coach, up and down mountains in the bus. There are no designated stopping points like the Skywalk, but you can get out every half hour, take 2 or 3 photos and get back on. The only thing that was good was the lunch. The views were great, but you couldn't let it sink in. And finally, after tasting the poncha, you had to wait another half hour in the bus because 2 people were going shopping. If you go on a western tour, you can only go by jeep.

title: Did not consider family situation.
text: We paid 171 Euro through TUI for this trip. 90 minutes before the trip, our son got a migraine and we tried to reschedule. We contacted TUI who made several attempts to contact the boat operator. After getting no response for an hour, I went to the boat company stand in the Marina and told them the story of the sick child. They said that to cancel, TUI would have to ring them so we asked TUI to do this but still no joy. They offered us a chance to split the family and for two of us to go at the scheduled time and then reschedule for the other two but we were not going split the family on a family holiday. We spend the next two days trying to reschedule via TUI but the boat company came back and said that we would need a sick cert for our child to prove he had a migraine. We paid 171 Euro and got no trip. This seems very unfair from a customer point of view. This review is not about the trip itself but how we were treated by the company. There are other companies in the area that offer the same trip and we rebooked with them for a lot less.

title: So disappointing!
text: We have taken food tours on every vacation and we have never been disappointed - until now! A totally, disappointing experience. Guide imparted very little useful information, constantly repeated himself, rushed us at 2/4 stops (after telling us there was no rush). He said he was a chef but provided almost no interesting information about the food or history. We have been in Portugal for 3 weeks and could have provided a much more detailed, interesting commentary. The food was also disappointing: one fried sausage croquette per person and tempura beans with a rum drink at stop 1, a very nice cheese board and chorizo at the second (the only nice stop) with one bottle of wine (for 6), and small bowl of average fish soup and a simple rice dish with 1 bottle of ‚Äúhomemade‚Äù wine at the third (again, for all 6 of us!) and a nata and small cup of port to finish - for $100 per person!!!! Reviewing the other food tours, they mostly provided more for less money. We spent at least 20 minutes at a viewpoint, but with almost no substantive discussion - mostly just standing around. We deserve a refund! Be forewarned - pick a different company!

title: The Tour Never Happened
text: I showed up - it was raining and no one was there. I showed up in advance and on time. There was no tour and no tour operator. I paid for nothing.

title: Lisbon is a fail
text:
This was a fail on a so many levels from this tour operator. From the lack of communication to the lack of support from the help desk - this experience was beyond disappointing.

We have been on a Devour Tour in the past and have enjoyed and recommended. On this occasion the meeting point was not accurate. The support team were not able to connect and let us know where we could find the group and at the end of it - we were left paying for something that we never received.

What we hoped was our highlight in Lisbon was such a disappointment. And we ended up paying for their lack of communication to their customer

My advice is that there are other tour operators that will value your business more than Devour Tours.

Sorry James. We used to be a fan.

title: Poor experience. Would not recommend
text:
Not impressed. Way overpriced for what you received. I wouldn't call this a food tour. One stop and dinner and a fado show. Fado show was what gave you the two rating. Could have booked the Fado show and dinner oirselces theiugh the jotel for free. Guide did not stay for the whole event and left us to find our own way back k via taxi or Uber at our own cost. Which was an added expense that was not expected.
This was not advertised in the group overview. Guide should have stayed with us and brought us back to the starting point at minimum. Booking a couple of Tuk Tuks to do so would have been helpful. Will not be re commending this tour.

.

title: Historical culinary tour of Lisbon
text: Agathe was an amazing guide! So knowledgeable and well informed. She was warm and made the tour both interesting and fun! Thank you!

title: Tourist trap
text: Eva was a great guide but her company designed this experience as a fine collection of the worst tourist traps in the city. Book it if you want to experience gas station level food while you could stop at any random restaurant in the city and eat amazing. Make sure not to miss Solar do Kadete, where you will have codfish from a week ago, plastic french fries and diluted wine. Avoid like the plague

title: Poor Service!
text: TERRIBLE SERVICE! I accidentally booked the Sintra Palace Tour for the same day/time as this tour. I notified Devour Food Tour with 24hr+ time notice to cancel. They finally responded no refund and that I needed to contact Viator directly. Viator/Trip Advisor told me no refund. I simply would have rescheduled for the next day but no one would help me. Very disappointing after arranging my Lisbon hotel & tours through trip advisor. Eating the $156+ fee isn‚Äôt the point, it‚Äôs the lack of service and understanding during what is supposed to be a fun trip. Beware when booking.

title: Don‚Äôt do it.
text:
Disappointing- waste of time and money
We just did this two this morning and it was absolutely lack lustre. Inexperienced tour guide, disorganised, disjointed, poor food. The whole thing was poor quality from the design of the tour, the tour guide, and the food was cheap and all round just a waste. I am skeptical about the positive reviews previously on here and wonder if they are client paid. Shop around for better company to do this type of tour.

title: A theft
text: Theft. I paid 28 euros for ice cream. I've already paid half for better work. A theft. They even pay for the lime

title: Diana Tours buses do not run on time and has horrible customer service.
text:
Our hotel provided us a brochure regarding the Diana Tours bus schedule and we thought that it would be the perfect way to see Lisbon. The stop closest to our hotel was number 7 ‚ÄúThe museum of Lisbon‚Äù on the Uptown line. We arrived at the stop at 16:25 PM to wait for the 16:35 bus. We waited over 40 minutes and the bus never came.

We walked back to our hotel and called the company at 17:14 pm asking what happened. They could not explain why the bus did not arrive but did tell us that another bus was coming at 17:35 pm and that we would be returning to our number 7 stop at 18:50 pm.

That did not happen. Our bus pulled into the last stop at 18:30 pm and we were told we had to get off the bus. We explained that we needed to get back to our number 7 stop and that‚Äôs when we were told again to get off the bus. I explained how we had spoken to the company and that we were to be returned to the number 7 stop and we had no way to get back. They said ‚Äúyou did not talk to me‚Äù and you need to take public transportation home.

So we were stranded miles away from our hotel and the Diana Tours company did nothing to help.

title: a day to forget
text: We chose the Lisbon tour with the KOMBO 2 lines option costing 28 euros which means that you can choose two out of 4 itineraries... we did the first which is in the central part and we reserved the right to do the wider one in the afternoon... ...you can get off and on whenever you want......SORRY THAT NO ONE WARNED US that on May 20th there would be a party for the city team and so everything was blocked...not even taxis could be found and we had to walk back......I don't recommend it...it's better to queue and take tram 28. IT COSTS MUCH LESS and is more beautiful

title: Advice re: hop on hop off bus
text: We booked the hop on hop off bus in Lisbon - 2 grayline tickets - from Diana tours kiosk at a cost of 58 euro from the kiosk at marquis de Pombal at the top of the Avenida de liberdade - avoid ! Go for the other bus company ‚Äúcity sightseeing‚Äù . We waited well over an hour on the red line ( they had promised one every 25 minutes) for a bus losing valuable time of our trip and meanwhile 4 of the other company‚Äôs buses stopped by. Would not use them again.

title: Bad experience
text: Sadly we had to get off the boat because it was rocky. The boat is fairly small and they pack in guests. The company refused to provide a refund. We advise not to trust this company and choose another. There are many other options available.

title: No communication from operator
text: The operator was unresponsive when trying to contact to set up logistics. No communication at all. You should reach out to the guests to let them know the details.

title: Pay for "free" walking tour
text: Basically, the tour was a bust. We had booked a completely different tour but were ushered to take part in this one. The guide actually almost only used filling phrases and we didn't learn much about the city and its history. During the tour we made a few stops, one of them was to buy drinks off of the guide's "grandma" which seemed fake to us. What shocked us the most was that the tour was no free walking tour though advertised otherwise. The guide told us from the beginning that it would cost at least 12 euros per person at the end. In our view this does not comply with the concept of free tours and we cannot recommend the experience.

title: Worst experience ever, total tourist scam!
text:
Foi vendido que seriam 5 bares e foram s√≥ 3.
O primeiro bar era horr√≠vel, pequeno, fedido, sujo e o shot era uma bebida muito duvidosa e o copo de shot √© min√∫sculo.
o segundo teve 1 hora de open bar, a cerveja Heineken tinha gosto de super bock, a super bock tinha gosto de Heineken, mas suspeito q seja tudo sagres da pior qualidade.
O terceiro pra ter o shot "gr√°tis" tinha de pagar por qualquer bebida, pedi uma tequila e tinha mais √°gua naquilo do que Tequila.
Por todos o bares foi dinheiro jogado fora, cata turista total.
A balada no final √© boa, mas quase n√£o entrei por causa do dress code que nunca foi falado em momento nenhum no an√∫ncio, tive de "alugar" uma casaco flanelado de um turista QQ por 10 euros pra usar e passar pela seguran√ßa.

N√£o recomendo a ningu√©m, pegue seu dinheiro e ande pelas ruas e bares de Lisboa, ter√° uma experi√™ncia imensamente melhor.

English, please read!
It was sold that there would be 5 bars and there were only 3. The first bar was horrible, small, stinky, dirty and the shot was a very questionable drink and the shot glass is tiny. the second had 1 hour of open bar, the Heineken beer tasted like super bock, the super bock tasted like Heineken, but I suspect it's all Sagres (Portuguese beer) of the worst quality. The third one to get the "free" shot I had to pay for any other drink, I ordered a tequila and there was more water in it than Tequila. Money was thrown away all over the bars, total tourists scam. The party at the end is good, but I almost didn't go in because of the dress code that was never mentioned in the advertisement, I had to "rent" a flannel coat from a tourist in the entrance for 10 euros to wear and get through security. I don't recommend it to anyone, take your money and walk through the streets and bars of Lisbon, you will have an immensely better experience.

title: Not worth the price
text: This wasn‚Äôt what I expected. I didn‚Äôt realize our guide and other people who purchased the tickets would be having dinner with us. It was very expensive for what was offered: bread, cheese, olives, chorizo, and cod cakes. They charge for water. 8 of us were crammed into a very small space, in a very small restaurant. The guide was very nice but this experience was not worth the price.

title: No guide present
text:
No guide at meeting point! Fortunately for us we were able to join a tour run by another company. It was very good
We won't use Discover Lisbon again

title: Boring.
text: Boring, lacking dynamics, and mix many ages, and not the same party for a 20 q for a 40...much better

title: Unfortunate and not professional
text: We showed up at the meeting point of our reservation at 10.00h and it turns out that there was NO TOUR IN SPANISH without warning, without cancellation, with no other option. Disappointing and no refund of booking payment. Playing with customers' time like this seems unfortunate

title: The statues are clear.
text: I was feeling bad. I could not come. I asked if I could come the next day. That was not possible. I asked once again. It was policy....

title: Waste of money and time
text: Waste of money and time no club I paid for club but club is closed I don‚Äôt want to recommend this place any one because of lie with us

title: Not on my list of things to recommend
text: The music was nice the location good and tour guide ,Muhammad, was excellent but, perhaps because I don't understand the language I didn't get it. 2 hours was way too long for the tour. In my opinion it's not worth paying for this tour, I heard beautiful Fado singers while I was walking thru the town. This not a tour I would recommend

title: Sangria is jungle juice.
text: Guides did nothing. The ‚Äú1 hour open bar sangria‚Äù is Fanta, sprite, grenadine and vodka. The last club refused to let me and the 10 others I was with in, for no apparent reason and asked if I was deaf (I am partially) and the guides did nothing to help. Nonetheless two stars because we met some fun people! Wouldn‚Äôt recommend though. This bar crawl ruins lives.

title: Avoid this tour!
text: This tour was a total disappointment. We started a half hour late, walked 2 blocks to a ‚ÄúFado restaurant ‚Äú, so not a tour. The restaurant sat us in a different room from where the Faso musician‚Äôs were performing. We couldn‚Äôt hear or see the show, the single class of cheap wine was a 4 oz pour (charged $10 for additional 4 oz pours). The ‚Äútapa‚Äôs‚Äù consisted of a few wedges of stale cheese. And worst of all, our guide knew nothing about the history of Fado, was reading an explanation of it of his phone. I wrote to the tour company asking for a refund and never heard back from them. I was so annoyed/angry I left early. Terrible experience!

title: Nothing more...
text: Group too large, first bar on top! 2nd bar, sangria not good and if you don't like beer the rest at your expense. The 3rd bar which was more of a discotheque, not very small, simple music, not a real discotheque. I expected better and more discovery

title: Very underwhelming compared to other tour companies around
text:
Although the tour guide was nice, the information provided was presented in a very dry manner and seemed completely rehearsed with no spontaneity. It didn't help that the tour started off poorly when the guide started her presentation right next a religious demonstration blasting music on the square. Instead of moving to a different spot before starting, multiple people had to ask her to move because no one could hear a word she was saying. There was a real disconnect between the guide wanting to deliver her information and making the tour a pleasant experience for the group.

All in all, I find this tour company is poorly run. We also did a tapas food tour with the same company the next night, hoping for a different experience. Unfortunately, we also had an underwhelming experience with that one. I don't think this company takes any feedback seriously and will continue to offer the same tours because there will always be a high demand for this kind of tour. I would highly recommend taking a tour with Hi Lisbon instead. We were blown away with the difference with that tour company.

title: Not as described. You're better off going to a restaurant on your own.
text: We were excited for this tapas tour based on the description on their website and by previous reviews on Tripadvisor. Unfortunately, the tour seems to have changed in the last little while even though the website hasn't updated the information. The "tour" is now at a single restaurant where neither the guide nor the restaurant staff provided any information on the dishes and the wine. It wasn't until we specifically asked the tour guide for a description that he decided to talk a bit about what was in front of us. It was incredibly underwhelming and we definitely regret joining this tour for 35 Euros. We also did a free walking tour with Discover Lisbon the day before which was also underwhelming. I don't think this tour company looks to improve their service and are simply cashing in on their offerings.

title: Avoid Food Walking Tour
text: Avoid the Tapas ‚ÄòWalking‚Äô Tour. We were under the impression we‚Äôd hop between multiple restaurants for multiple wine and tapas tastings. Nope: we were brought to ONE restaurant, immediately poured 3 glasses of wine, and given 3 tiny tapas dishes to share. The guide didn‚Äôt explain anything we were eating or drinking, and barely spoke throughout the meal. We basically paid 35 euro each for someone to make a restaurant reservation for us to eat with a bunch of strangers, at a restaurant we‚Äôd never have otherwise chosen. Incredibly disappointing.

title: You Get What You Pay For
text:
This is free tour, so "you get what you pay for". We did get an overview of some sights in Alfma neighborhood, however, the guide was not well informed. For example, she pointed at the train station and said, "There is the train station. It's very old." That was it. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
Many people on the tour weren't even listening and were just chatting amongst themselves the whole time. So if you really want to learn about things in Lisbon, do another tour.

title: Horrible bars and guides
text: Not the best. Empty bars and ‚Äúclubs.‚Äù Horrible alcohol. The tour guides were creepy and weird. They weren‚Äôt very friendly and a tad rude and offensive.

title: Bad value - Better to DIY Pub Crawl
text: Pretty shithouse. Don‚Äôt expect to get your money‚Äôs worth from drinks. They split up the group a little bit too much, definitely killed the initial vibe.

title: Disappointing and not as advertised.
text: Disappointing experience compared to other Pub Crawls we've been to. I paid for extra for "premium" option for all you can drink gin, vodka, sangria and beer in one hour. But the bar they took us to did not serve sangria and first refused to serve us gin. Also, too much time was spent on the first bar with only one shot included.

title: 30‚Ç¨ f√ºr 3 Locations üòç
text: Was soll ich sagen, ich habe die Tour nach 1,5 Stunden und bei dem Besuch im ersten Lokal abgebrochen. Es gab ein frei Shot und nach ca. 60 Minuten habe ich dann mal gefragt, was wir noch vorhaben. Der Guide sagte wir besuchen 3 Lokale in 4 Stunden. Das hei√üt man bekommt 3 Freigetr√§nke f√ºr 30‚Ç¨ pro Person (war ein Samstag). Das hat absolut nichts mit einer Kneipentour zutun. Pub Crawls habe ich schon mehrfach besucht aber das war mit Abstand der schlechteste. Die Guides sind angestellt und arbeiten nach Vorgabe vom Chef. Also Sie k√∂nnen nichts daf√ºr.

title: Se o seu objetivo for ser ignorado e tratado como um lixo na porta de um club, venha, caso contr√°rio fiquem longe disto.
text: Tudo come√ßou bem, mas quando cheg√°mos na hora do Club, eu e um grupo de outras pessoas fomos deixados do lado de fora, a ver navios. Os guias, que supostamente deviam nos ajudar, n√£o s√≥ desapareceram, como come√ßaram a recusar qualquer tentativa de contato.

title: Avoid, just go out to dinner
text:
Our guide Ricardo was lovely, but the experience was not. A reminder for what‚Äôs listed in the description - you go to ONE restaurant, so it is not a tour as you might assume. You get 3 pathetic tapas, and one took so long to come out that we left (after a party of 4 had already left 15 minutes before) because even if the sardine we were promised finally showed up, we were still going to be hungry. (Which does make sense - this is advertised as tapas, not a whole meal, and not enough tapas to constitute a meal - so our bad for not thinking that through.)

Of the 2 tapas we stayed for, the codfish (a Portuguese staple that I was quite exited to try) was just a fried potato ball with an undetectable bit of fish inside; the ‚Äúcooked at your table‚Äù chorizo was decent but literally just a few slices of chorizo; and the bread we received to eat with it was extremely stale.

We met in Baixa-Chiado and walked 25 minutes to Alfama for the restaurant‚Ä¶ why???? Why didn‚Äôt we just meet at the restaurant? Who knows. The tour guide didn‚Äôt even know because he didn‚Äôt plan it, he took over for someone else, so not great internal communication. It would have been nice to have some history/city info on our walk, but that didn‚Äôt happen.

The restaurant we went to has very mediocre reviews. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs not easy to find a place that will host 15 people but maybe just make the experience capacity smaller and go to a nicer place.

The food was sad. The wine was sad. The view was ok. If you wanted water, it counted as one of your 3 glasses of wine.

We got a past√©is de nata before we started walking, so I guess I can check off dessert even though it happened first?? It was the best part of the night.

The ginjinha that I paid extra for? Nowhere in sight. The fado that other reviews talk about? Nope, not here.

Lotta false advertising. Avoid this ‚Äúexperience‚Äù whether you see it on Eventbrite or TripAdvisor or somewhere else. I paid ~$75 for 2 people to have 3 bites of food, a couple glasses of wine and some water - oh and delicious dessert but as our appetizer. If you get Ricardo on any of their other tours/experience, you will have a great time! But don‚Äôt waste your money on this.

title: Disappointing, too crowded, couldn‚Äôt see the singers
text:
We were placed in a side room that was too crowded for the group. The singers did not want to sit Ny there after the first two songs. They sang in the main room and we could hear them but not see them unless we stood up and went into the other room. And that room was crowded too so there was not much space to stand.
Overall, very disappointing.

title: Non-existing tours
text: I'm not sure how nobody mentioned this in the comments. I read on the website that Discover Lisbon offers several free walking tours and decided to join the downtown tour which was supposed to start at the Rossio square at 11AM. When I got there, I was told by the guides that the downtown tour doesn't exist and that they only have an Alfama tour. The downtown tour was supposed to go through Chiado, Baixa etc., so, another part of the city. Finally they told me that none of the tours advertised on the website don't exist (except the Alfama tour) and instructed me to talk to their manager who happened to be there. When I told him about that, he tried to convince me that such tour is not advertised on their website! He also told me that I have to book a tour via their website if I want to join the tour - which is also not possible via their website. Anyway, if you want to join the Alfama tour, go ahead (though it's unclear to me how you are supposed to book it), but if you aim for another tour, it doesn't exist, don't even bother.

title: Non buttate i soldi
text: Il Peggior pub crawl della mia vita noioso, disorganizzato,non fai niente..20euro buttati lasciate perdere fatevi un giro al Barrio che trovate locali pi√π belli e divertenti

title: Poor choice of bars
text:
Me and my friends did the bar crawl on Thursday night of 2nd of March. Met some cool people. The first bar was quite mediocre, very crowded and with problems of getting drinks that we wanted. The club was good tho.
The next day we decided to give it another shot. Same bar was so called open bar and with even bigger crowd we got the same issues.
The guides were quite good, you could see that some of them were quite experienced, some less. But for sure good people.
Overall not bad, but there are things to improve.

title: Don't bother, not as described
text: Tour description at time of booking: a tasting tour through Lisbon...walk through the historic neighborhoods and sample various small plates and local drinks at three PT restaurants...compare the flavors from various parts of the country, etc., then cap off the tour with a tasty pastry...WRONG. A 5-minute walk from point of departure to a single only restaurant does not constitute a tour. The three restaurants listed when we booked has since been changed to only one restaurant (very likely because our guide took a picture of the original description from my phone, plus he had never heard of Tripadvisor...), nor was there any pastry to cap off. Yes, we saw some Fado, which was not mentioned in the description at all, and is not for everyone. Tapas was okay, wine so-so. None of it worth the price. Needless to say this was way off base from what we booked. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

title: Not good
text: Only went to one location despite the ad saying 3 locations. Tapas were terrible. Don‚Äôt waste your time or money.

title: Para no repetir.
text:
Visita tur√≠stica en Espa√±ol por Alfama a las 11;00. Espa√±ol p√©simo. Poqu√≠sima informaci√≥n, mal explicado.
No se puede vender un free tour en Espa√±ol con este nivel.

title: Disappointed
text:
Our driver was very polite and the trip was well prepared as far as time and destinations but he was not knowledgeable about F√°tima at all. He said the two brothers and their cousin saw the apparition. It was Lucia and her cousins Lucinta and Francisco that Our Lady appeared.
He made reference that you could make a wish there, not pray for special intentions. He obviously knew nothing of Fatima or the Catholic faith.
I was very disappointed with the tour and his lack of reverence at a most holy location

title: AVOID this Company
text:
No confirmation email was sent to us the day prior to advise of pick up time. We spent hours trying to get information and were eventually advised that the pickup time would be 0745 the next morning. Nobody showed up to pick us up on the morning of the tour, and after again contacting the tour company, we were finally picked up at 0835. We were given the last 2 seats in a small mini van, both of us seated in the front row with the driver. My daughter had to sit sideways for the duration of the tour with her legs on top of mine due to the stick shift control column which left no room for her legs and feet.

At each location on the tour, we were simply dropped off to wander around on our own and given a pick up time to meet the driver. A 2 minute explanation was given about the history of F√°tima and that was the extent of the information provided. It was really just the equivalent of taking a very crowded taxi from place to place. Not really a tour at all.

The tour company did finally send an email confirming our pickup time the day after we had completed the tour, which was useless information at that point.

I have taken a great many tours in my travels over the years, and this was by far the most disorganized, and uninformative tour I have ever experienced.

title: Stay away, you life is more important
text: On the way up, something happened. The van fishtail. We all panicked in the van. Driver pulled over to see if we were OK. Physically fine, but scared. Driver told us it, was a issue with the steering wheel. The van had over 400k and the company was aware of the issue and planned to sell it. Great company allowed us to get in a faulty van. We get to Fatima, 2 ladies stay in the van. We were told one of them has to eat. At the end of the time, back at the van. We don't see the 2 ladies. We were told one was hurt. He drove them to a taxi to go back to the hotel. They will take the tour on Monday. We all expected someone to call and check in with all.passengers. Monday I call the company, to let them know about our issue. Spoke to a man, telling g me that they are investigating the trouble. They have called the hotel and left messages for us all. No one got any massage. I told him it would be great customer service to check in and do something for us. He said, basically since we were ok to continue the tour. Than it is our problem, we should have asked to go back to the hotel also. That we could redo the tour on Wednesday. So basically since we were nice people the 5 of us got screwed over. Not even an apology. The driver also gave them a different version of what happened. Not worth it. Stay away from this company.

title: Pe√±a palace Sintra
text:
We‚Äôll the wait in line was just soooooo badly organised!!!we waited in line as you bye a ticket that gives you a slot time to go in ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ that went for soooooo long by back aches‚Ä¶.
Not cheap and very stressful
Once we got in ‚Ä¶. It was like boarding school ‚Ä¶.. hurry up and wait ‚Ä¶. Information was very poor
Not recommend this experience!!!

title: Profit comes before your safety!
text:
Due to enormous traffic chaos and the risk of forest fires, it was not possible to reach Regaleira on time. All parking spaces were cordoned off, you had to park almost 3 km away. Upon arrival, the guide had already left and our tickets were not valid. Along the way we were told by several officers that we could not go to Pe√±a because there was an increased risk of forest fires. We ended up having to buy new tickets to enter Regaleira. And we were also unable to use our tickets for Pe√±a due to the fire hazard.
Unfortunately, tiqets.nl does not understand that it would be polite to warn about these dangers. They apparently consider profit more important than customer safety! Spent ‚Ç¨163.00 for which we get nothing but annoyance in return. Customer service only has some standard automated responses.

title: horrible
text: Visit the Palacio de la pena horrible. It was the second time we went to this palacio. But this time, visit at fixed times because many people and there it was horror, organization, endless visit with queues in the rooms, the cloister, a horror. why bring people in these conditions including limit security

title: Very disappointed with the service
text: We never went, because we mistakenly put the wrong date. I tried to cancel and reschedule, but no luck. The tour agent was very short and could not offer any other solutions. We lost 100% of our payment. Very dissatisfying. Terrible customer service.

title: Pessima organizzazione
text: Pessima organizzazione, anche avendo acquistato i biglietti online giorni prima fanno fare una lunga coda per accedere al parco. Una volta dentro altra coda per entrare nel castello pur essendo scritto che si poteva entrare 30 minuti prima. Se lo avessero detto si poteva visitare il parco pi√π a lungo

title: Brazilian worker poorly educated and rude with clients
text: I was in this store yesterday - on 03/05 around 8:30am and watched the Brazilian employee being poorly polite with the customers, including me, but what left me most sad was to see her being rude with an elderly!

title: ROBBED BY SECURITY
text:
I landed up getting robbed inside the club by the security guards and his friends partying inside. I do not recommend going to this place.
The management is racist as aswell when I got it to their notice.

title: Awful
text: They have an awful card system, they have a card and charge you if you lose the card. Please be aware if you are a man, they will let women in for free but charge men‚Ä¶ for no reason.

title: Don‚Äôt go
text: Terrible!! Don‚Äôt go unless you want to be turned away for no apparent reason. The security at the door is on a power trip. The security guard needs to lose his job. Racism, homophobia.

title: Average
text:
Average music, lots of girls paid for their attendance.
Additionally, when we paid for a square with bottle, we moved the tables 1 meter to have room for our legs, something the staff did not accept and blamed us for.

title: Do not go
text: No unpleasant staff, disastrous square, we are all squeezed, we pay for bottles and we get yelled at because we moved one of the two tables 30cm, whatever, don't go there, if you want to have fun go to the k urban beach which is 500m from this club the music is good here

title: Security guards armed with people

Security judges whether it's funny on the Instagram page with guess entry was ‚Ç¨10

But to fix his yellow teeth, he doesn't use ‚Ç¨1,500.

title: Evitem esse lugar
text:
S√£o racistas e xenof√≥bicos. Evitem a todo custo.
V√£o te cobrar ‚Ç¨1500 pela entrada que nao estava dizendo em lugar algum e mesmo com nome na guestlist, crit√©rios de quem entra de gra√ßa ou quem paga depende de qu√£o curta √© a sua roupa. Seguran√ßas extremamente grosseiros!

title: Racism
text: Racist on the door a place for black peoples don‚Äôt like a black people this is a insane don‚Äôt go to the doc if you are a black

title: Negative experience
text:
I did end up buying antique tiles. The guy at the store was really rude and condescending. Basically told me I should go to museums and learn about Portuguese history when I asked him a question about tiles and some historical context. Be nice to your customers.
Very off-putting attitude.

title: Were not served or greeted. Left without beer.
text: Dar Herr behind the bar found it not necessary to greet us, let alone for us to end his video call to serve us. Got up again after 5 minutes and also left without words. Beer looked great but could not be tasted.

title: The owner is arrogant and not friendly
text: I had the worst experience of my 2 years living in Lisbon. I was waiting outside for this place to open to the public, and the owner who opened the bar/restaurant, was extremely aggressivel and vocal. He told me that the outside table belongs to the bar and I couldn‚Äôt sit there. I tried to explain to him that I was waiting for a friend who was going to sing in his restaurant. With an unprofessional attitude he told me that she is not the owner of the place. I kindly asked him if I could stay sitting there, or should I sit on the calcada do duque stairs? He told me (with his same attitude), whatever I wanted. There were people around who were also sitting at the other tables. Aggressively he told me that I was ignoring him. For me, our conversation had ended the moment he told me ‚Äúwhatever you want.‚Äù He told me that I wasn‚Äôt welcome there and I should leave. It was my first time there, and I haven‚Äôt tried his food, but because of the way I was treated with such disrespect, I don‚Äôt recommend this place and will never go there again. There are so many choices for places at the escadaria do duque, where you are treated better than this. Therefore, I don‚Äôt recommend this place!

title: This town has better
text: Our family made a reservation days in advance and when we arrived we were told we did not have a reservation and then showed email proof and were told to wait 30 mins which turned unit 45. Then were given a two person table for 4 people and judged for asking for one of the bigger tables when it was empty at 10pm. Overall service abysmal and were made very uncomfortable by the staff for what we believed were very basic accommodations. It was very clear the locals were prioritized‚Ä¶ shrimp were not deveined and were not ‚Äúfried‚Äù

title: Worst experience ever
text: We paid in advance, the tour guide never showed up. We waited for an hour in the heat. We called him and he answered the first time he said he will be 10 mins late. But he never arrived and stopped answering the phone. Such a scam!

title: Biggest waste of money
text: Biggest waste of money. Thought we were actually stopping at the top tourist spots just to peek in but we didn‚Äôt. Food was just ok. Would never do it again.

title: Overpriced for What You Get
text:
We recently joined this food tour as a group of 9 (5 adults and 4 kids). While we really enjoyed learning about the Moorish neighborhood and appreciated the warmth and knowledge of our guide Fred, we left the experience feeling disappointed with the overall value.

The historical insights were engaging, and the guide did a good job of keeping things informative and kid-friendly. However, for a tour priced at $130 per person, the food and drink offerings felt underwhelming. Most of the stops were at very inexpensive street-food-style spots, and based on our experience, the total cost of food and drinks likely didn‚Äôt exceed 30 euros per person. In fact, when I asked for a coffee during the tour, I was told it wasn‚Äôt included ; which, at this price point, felt a bit off.

The tour was advertised as 3.5 hours, but it seemed we skipped the final stop and wrapped things up early, which added to the feeling that the experience was rushed and overpriced.

For context, this was the fifth walking food tour I‚Äôve booked through TripAdvisor. The previous four were outstanding ; full of variety, generous tastings, and memorable stops ‚Äî and were all priced between $60‚Äì$80 per person, even in more expensive cities. Given that this tour was double the price in a more affordable destination, it was hard not to feel let down.

That said, the guide was lovely, and we did walk away having learned some new things about the area. With a price adjustment and more generous food stops, this tour could be a great experience. I hope this feedback is helpful for both the company and future travelers

title: Overrated ‚Äòfood‚Äô tour
text: Extremely overpriced for the quality and quantity of the food given. Amount of information around the food was no more than basic.

title: Way too expensive for what it offers
text: A decent food tour but it‚Äôs way too expensive for what it offers. It‚Äôs specifically designed for clueless tourists with good disposable income.

title: not worth it
text: poor value for the money, poor selection of restaurants, one was positively bad, these were not the best restaurants in lisbon, didn't get enough food

title: Our tour was canceled at the last minute.
text:
Three hours before our the scheduled start of our tour we received a text saying that our tour was canceled. We were offered other times on other days or a refund. That didn‚Äôt work for us.
The second ‚Äòdot‚Äô on my rating is because our refund was promptly processed.

title: Very disappointing and very overpriced
text: The food was mediocre at best--easily the worst "meal" we had in Lisbon and the host was pretty annoying. It is hard to believe that Trip Advisor claims that 99% of respondents "liked" this event.

text:

title: Wont allow singles to book tour, 2 person minimum
text:
I was excited about this tour after reading the amazing reviews.
As a solo traveler, this seemed to be a perfect way to learn about the culture and food, and possibly meet new people. Unfortunately, while I was able to book for one person, I quickly received a refund and an email stating that there is a two-person minimum and I would not be allowed on the tour. When I questioned this policy, I did not receive any rationale. Very disappointed.

title: Worst massage I have ever experienced.
text: If you value yourself, go somewhere. I wish I can experience what I went thought. All I can say is that the place is Very dirty to get massage.

title: ‚ÄúRelaxing massage‚Äù
text: Ana broke my shoulders i was in pain all day, my friends said they feel relaxed but i felt like i was getting Punished‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..

title: Rescheduled without notifying
text: Hey everyone, I booked a session over their website but when I arrived there with 15minutes in advance they told me that they rebooked my session for 4 hours later. They didn't contacted me for this changes. In other words they gave it to someone else.

title: Most Painful Massage of My Life
text:
I booked a 2 hour massage after reading so many wonderful reviews and after 2 weeks of traveling, I was more than ready for a massage. The receptionist asked what pressure I‚Äôd like and I said medium - so she suggested the EcoMassage.

Now I‚Äôve been getting massages regularly for years, but this particular massage was by far the worst one I‚Äôve ever had. My massage therapist was so sweet and kept checking in on me in terms of pressure. I kept telling her less pressure, but she kept going so deep that at some point I was seeing stars and thought I was going to pass out. I was in so much pain and told her that, but she said ‚Äúno, I have to work‚Äù and kept going. I literally almost jumped off the table and walked out.

But I stayed, hoping maybe I was just super sore from all my travels and that I‚Äôd feel the benefit of it the next day.

Sleeping was extremely uncomfortable and waking up the next day, I am in physical pain. I feel like I‚Äôm bruised from head to toe, the pain is radiating on every part of my body. I can‚Äôt move without wincing in pain. I feel like I‚Äôve been in a serious car crash.

If this is what their ‚Äúmedium‚Äù pressure is, I‚Äôd probably DIE with the deep tissue massage.

All this to say, I wish I had been more forceful in advocating for myself and my body. I am in severe pain that will likely impact my ability to enjoy my limited time in Lisbon. Simple movements are beyond painful.

The staff was extremely friendly and the atmosphere was great. I will say that! But this particular massage was not at all the relaxing, rejuvenating massage I had hoped for.

title: overrated Lisbon
text: Very disapointing the hotel was very nice it was a locke hotel converted from a old nunnery . The city itself was dirty and rundown looking the locals not too friendly . The pastrys are amazing but the seafood is awful they like old salted cod from the North Atlantic rather than fresh local seafood . Even the touristry areas were rundown looking, Sintra palace was actually big old house poorly kept built really not that long ago . And what the tour guides said was the Portugueese Riviera Cais Cais was a a run of the mill beach town not really exciting Skip Portugal I was very disappointed and would not recommend

title: Horrible experience
text: We were a group of 15 people and were divided into 3 tuk tuk. Unfortunately, the trip was ruined quite directly in the tuk tuk that Catalina drove. She was very upset because we spoke Swedish back there. Already after 2 minutes of the trip she refused to say anything and those who rode in her tuk tuk did not hear any guidance at all. Not for the whole tour. We then asked the guy who drove first to stay a little longer at the first viewpoint because our customers we had with us found it uncomfortable to ride in her tuk tuk. We then ended the tour early. When they dropped us off Catalina pointed her finger and shouted something at us when she left. Very unpleasant! The guy and the other girl who was driving were great but unfortunately Catalina ruined the trip for all of us.

title: A jarring city tour
text: An hour and a half bouncing on cobblestones with many ditches through the town, a bit for the body, even without any prior back pain. Panoramic use, but other than that was provided only minimal information about the city.

title: Not a customer or family friendly business
text:
Eco Tours was the low point of an otherwise fantastic visit to Lisbon. After realizing just how hilly the city was, we took a quick (non Eco Tours) tuk tuk ride up to Castelo de Sao Jorge. My kids (7&5) were obsessed with the ride, so I quickly moved to book a full tuk tuk tour from Eco Tours via Trip Advisor. Eco Tours was easy to book via the app and I thought we were set to go for a 3-hour tour to Belem that evening. When we arrived, the driver informed us he only had one kid's booster seat and he'd need 2 to accomodate us. We waited while he checked to see if other drivers had one; however he came back empty handed and advised, no children allowed on tuk tuks he can't take us. Imagine my surprise, since we had in fact RIDDEN A TUK TUK 2 HOURS EARLIER.

As my disappointed children cried on the street, my mother tried to appease them with ice cream, and my husband secured us an alternate tuk tuk tour from a different company (yes, kids allowed without question). Amidst the chaos, I was told by Eco Tours via whatsapp chat that they have a policy of no children which is indicated on their website. Of course, I booked via the Trip Advisor app so I was not privvy to the no children, no families policy when I paid for my +$200 non-refundable trip.

While I accept, and also acknowledged to the customer service rep, that I surely signed a fine-print waiver agreeing to this and other rules when I authorized Eco Tours to charge me for the trip, I made a mistake that cost me unnecessarily. The bottom line is, we didn't get to take the tour. The tour guide didn't have to spend his time, no one spent money on fuel, and ultimately, my family was the only party who lost out (money and time... and lasting emotion strife after 2 international, jet-lag fueled meltdowns from my inconsolable kids :x ). I expect that a customer-centric tourism company would acknowledge that I didn't cause them any problem, and simply refund me, no harm no foul. Not so, instead, they passed me off to automated phone and email boxes to seek a partial refund despite "the firm no-refunds" policy. I did receive a partial refund for the tour that I didn't take....so including the consolation tour I booked, we spent a hell of a lot of money on tuk tuk adventures in Lisbon and learned that Eco Tours Lisboa is a business that I will NOT recommend.

title: Did not see much of anything
text: Becareful of a tour guide by the name of Bruno, we were cheated the two hours as he stayed in one area the entire time. He told us that the schedule picked online isn‚Äôt available and that he will take us around the town. But for the entire two hours we really that we could have just walked around. This was rubbery.

title: Overpriced tour
text: We weren‚Äôt able to do the itinerary listed in trip advisor as he said it was too busy in the old city. Therefore we didn‚Äôt see the historical sites. He also said tuktuks were restricted in some areas. Extremely over priced for what we were able to see on the trip. Guide was named Bruno and he didn‚Äôt provide much details or information about the city. He took us to a view point that was littered in trash and didn‚Äôt even have a view of the river. Very disappointed.

title: Rough Ride
text: Really rough ride around cobblestone streets Our driver Carlos was late meeting us and seemed drunk or stoned or maybe just strange . His discussion of the city was disjointed and at times senseless. He spent a lot of time fighting/yelling at other drivers . Maybe with another driver it might have been a better experience

title: Good tour but better book onsite with a guide you choose
text: Even though we had requested a French-speaking guide, the guide did not have an adequate command of French which made the visit very difficult to understand and enjoy.

title: Tuk Tuk Tour through Lisbon
text:
Our tour guide Simao was great, he showed us a lot and explained a lot. Thank you very much.
The rest all went wrong!!!
The tour was charged twice to my credit card. We had booked at 2 p.m., the day before I received a WhatsApp for the time at 10 a.m./2 p.m., even though we hadn't booked for 10 a.m. We were at the Hard Rock Caf√© at 10 a.m., unfortunately no one came, another guide had told us that the German guide had already been booked. I still haven't received the money (188 euros) back, nobody cares!!!!

title: Uncomfortable
text: Bumpy less than 3hr ride. Driver was pleasant and knowledgeable but unfortunately we were uncomfortable the entire time. A bit of a rip off honestly and Viator is not accountable at all. If you have any back issues or are tall look elsewhere. Not worth the high rate.

title: Not Worth It.
text:
I took the ‚ÄúFollow the 28‚Äù tour with EcoTuks. The guide that I had said very little and seemed almost disinterested. He pointed out neighborhoods and sights, but said almost nothing about them. He disn‚Äôt say anything about the history, culture , or who currently lives in the areas we passed. Everything I learned about the area/sites was learned from taking a walking tour afterwards.

My guide with EcoTuks was less the expert guide and wealth of local knowledge that I hoped for, and more glorified transit operator. I hope this isn‚Äôt the normal EcoTuks experience, but my advice based on my experience; Don‚Äôt Waste your Money.

title: Not a pleasant experience.
text: Very, very bumpy (ladies be sure to wear a sports bra). Traffic noise so loud could not hear the drivers explanation of sights along the way. Had to tell the driver to slow down and take me back to the hotel early.

title: Discrimination
text: They won‚Äôt let me go on the tour because I am pregnant. I am only 5 months along but I have a big belly. I was trying to reach out to the tour operator the day before my tour to find out the details of the trip. Also, it says that they offer pick up from the hotel, if you stay in downtown (I stayed there) but nobody answered me. I got the answer like 1 hour before the start of the tour. That I have to get to meet up point myself. After I arrived the driver called the office and they told me that I can go on the tour. I paid 180$ for that tour. Also, they refused to issue a refund for me. I don‚Äôt recommend this tour and TripAdvisor stand on tour operator site not costumers. It‚Äôs impossible to get on the phone with someone from Viator/trip advisor. I am not going to use their services anymore. In the town especially central square there are a lot of tuk tuks with wonderful guides for much cheaper price that will take you on the tour.

title: I bought a cultural tour and received a ride around the city
text:
I booked this tour because I had little time with my parents and my husband to see and get to know the historical and cultural aspects of Lisbon and what I received was a ride to the main tourist attractions that I could have done by Uber spending 1/3 of the money I invested . Our guide Vitor was Brazilian and had lived in Lisbon for 1 and a half years. He took us places without knowing practically anything about what we were seeing. To give you an idea of the guide's level, when I asked him about S√£o Jorge Castle he replied: it's a castle. I couldn't believe I had paid for that. He himself, noticing our frustration at the end of the tour, admitted to us that he didn't know much and needed to study the history of the city. Furthermore, the times he got out of the vehicle to explain, he walked quickly ahead and ignored my elderly parents (65 years old) who stayed behind and ‚Äúlost‚Äù what little he had to say about the locations.
I was sad and disappointed with the company that doesn't qualify the people they hire.

title: Mediocre. Wouldn't do it again.
text: Our guide didn't seem to know his stuff and even though we reserved the tour in Spanish, his dominion of the language wasn't good. The vehicle also stalled soon after starting the tour and I had to push to get it going. Two stars because he finished it and was nice.

title: There was no experience to give you the gist of
text: Driver never showed. Ruined our day. Sorry to report this. There is nothing else to report except I wish the driver showed up.

title: An uninformed & uninterested guide!
text:
The tour driver was Eric, a nice guy, but he provided no narration. I finally started asking a lot of questions & got a little info out of him, but not much. The visibility from the Tuk Tuk was very poor, we could hardly see anything from under the rolled up curtain.

Eric drove around, we had no idea where we were or what we were seeing. The overlooks gave us nice views, but that was the only positive of the trip. We finally cut it short & asked home to return us to a drop off point.

title: Left me and my family stranded
text:
Paid for a 3hr tour.

We spent 45mins with the guide and ask if he can stop so we can grab a snack. He dropped us off at a park and said he‚Äôll be waiting on the other end of the park by the exit. We grabbed a quick bite and was problem done in 15mins. We walked through the park to the exit as instructed. Our guide was nowhere to be found. I tried to reach out to him through the TripAdvisor app. No response. We had to call an Uber since we was left stranded. I got a call/text from my guide 45mins after we got picked up from our Uber.

I wanted to rectify my issue with a partial refund. Just to receive an email from Viator that my request was denied with no explanation.

I have time stamps from my call log, texts, and chat through TripAdvisor. Along with my Uber receipt.

I do not recommend this tour base on my experience and the lack of business.

title: Bad experience
text: Booked the Belem tour, guide asked what we wanted to see. Priorities were the main monuments on the itinerary. We didn‚Äôt stop or get off at any. We drove by. But we spent 15 minutes waiting in line for a pastry that wasn‚Äôt a priority stop for us. Guide took us on a strange route which he called a ‚Äúshortcut‚Äù. Couldn‚Äôt hear a word he was saying. Actually ended up in old town despite it being a Belem tour. Guide said he was running out of electric charge and wanted to get back. Overall, a waste of time and money.

title: Don‚Äôt hire this tuk-tuk!
text:
The tuk- tuk driver didn‚Äôt seem interested in giving us a tour. He raced around Lisbon only giving information if we prompted him. We would have to say, ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs that building‚Äù?

Then when we stopped at a monument and the guide told us we had 20 minutes to look around on our own we couldn‚Äôt find him when we returned to the tuk-tuk. He finally appeared after we started looking for him.

It seemed our guide was driving faster than the other tuk tuks. We were being thrown from side to side in the back. Also, when we asked about a beautiful building on the waterfront our guide told us not to go there. He said it was built by the Chinese and he ‚Äúdoesn‚Äôt trust them after Covid‚Äù.

To top off our tour our guide took us back to the hotel 30 minutes before the end of our tour.

title: Guide knew nothing about Lisbon - very disappointing
text: No stories heard: the guide had no knowledge of Lisbon. A taxi ride would have been cheaper and safer. Very disappointed. We asked to stop the tour earlier.

title: Disappointment
text:
Was very disappointed in this tour.

There were very few stops and even less in the way of a narrative from our guide as to the highlights of the City of Lisbon.

Make sure to set expectations with your driver/tour guide before departing on your trip.

title: Mal guia
text: Mal, nos toc√≥ una guia, Catalina Montero, que no tenia idea de nada. Fuimos en semana santa y llevaba muy poco tiempo en la ciudad. Tenia la sensacion que sabia yo mas de la ciudad que era la 3 vez que iba que ella. Bastante defraudado.

title: Not recommend
text:
Hello,
Honestly, NOT RECOMMEND IT.

Tuk-tuk driver was good and kind; however, the tour price was too high, 120 Euros for one hour and a half, and I am alone, so he should give me a discount like the other Tuk-tuk driver they gave me a discount and it‚Äôs was cheaper than the first one.
Although I did not even use the full hour and a half, he insisted that I must pay the same price since he already informed his boss that a customer had booked an hour and a half. Okay, I respect him, and I paid the amount, but I was not satisfied with the outcome.
Definitely not recommended
Instead of a tuk tuk, you can take the Hop-on-Hop-off bus, which offers four lines from which you may choose one or pay for them all. It costs only 30 euros and covers the entire city

title: Beware! you migh loose your money and get no tour at all!
text: I bought a ticket in the Tuk Tour for Sunday 25 at 10 am. Once purchased, I was confirmed for Monday, October 30, 2023! There is no way to change that. Your system is a mess!

title: Worst Rental in Old Saybrook CT
text: This house is a complete dump complete with rodents living in the house, the owner, Bryan Neurath is dishonest and after complaining he did nothing. When the rent was over he refused to return my security deposit and I had to sue him The house is a dump and the owner is a crook

title: Disappointed
text: First it was hot and our guide was struggling with the heat. Second her English was not top notch so she didn‚Äôt understand our question it was hard to understand her. Third she blamed the traffic for a slow tour which was out of her control. Anyway it is June so expect delays.

title: Tuk-Tuk Tour fand trotz Best√§tigung nicht statt!
text:
Wir (2 Personen) hatten f√ºr 10 Uhr eine Tuk-Tuk Tour in Deutsch gebucht.
F√ºr ‚Ç¨ 30 Aufpreis sollte die Abholung an unserer Wohnung stattfinden.
Nach Bezahlung der ‚Ç¨ 30 hatte ich mir dieses nochmals extra mit Abholadresse best√§tigen lassen.
10.10 Uhr rief ich an, da das Tuk-Tuk nicht da war.
Um 10.25 Uhr erhielt ich telefonisch die Info, man h√§tte Probleme mit dem Tuk-Tuk gehabt. Ob die Abholung um 11.30 Uhr ok sei.
Ich best√§tigte das.
Um 11.34 Uhr erhielt ich einen Anruf, sorry Tuk-Tuk ist in 5 Min da.
Um 11.45 Uhr war das Tuk-Tuk immer noch nicht da.
Somit haben wir den Vormittag mit warten verplempert!
Die R√ºckzahlung des gezahlten Tickets l√§uft, f√ºr die Extrageb√ºhr ‚Ç¨ 30 hoffentlich auch.

Ich kann diesen Anbieter aufgrund seiner Unzuverl√§ssigkeit absolut nicht empfehlen!

title: Lisbon city visit
text: Only default available again,didn't use tuk tuks but there were plenty about ,arrived on cruise ship told we needed shuttle bus to get to town centre so no prob there,we were warned not to stray from the main tourist area as pick pockets were everywhere,and to be aware of gangs of young men....great i thought........as we travelled in on the free bus,the streets were littered with homeless people still sleeping under cardboard boxes,grafitee every where,trip took 50 mins dye to chaotic traffic, we arrived in the main square which seemed ok but lots of people obviously not tourists just looking for a victim so we were very wary,anyway after about an wondering around we fought the shuttle bus back to the ship, I was expecting a beautiful city but very limited where we felt safe even with lots of police officers about extremely disappointed, will definitely not return to Lisbon again

title: Disappointing service - arrange when you arrive
text: Our driver arrived 30 minutes late and cut our trip short. Did not follow the tram route as advertised. My advice just go up to the tuk tuk driver of your choice when you are in Lisbon. This was a very disappointing service and there was no benefit in booking ahead.

title: Tour was changed and still not reimbursed
text:
This tour did not happen and I am still waiting to be reimbursed after numerous emails and texts.

The pickup location was changed just before and the tour itinerary changed due to a race that took over the areas we wanted to see. When I responded to their text, I requested a refund before the tour but did not receive an answer.
