Once I got home, the company emailed me, but they said they never heard from me even though I emailed a copy of my text correspondence showing them that they actually did receive my request to cancel. I was ghosted ever since and they still have our money.

I understand that the race was not their fault, but they should know about these types of events well in advance and plan accordingly. And not take people's money if they cannot provide the service where and when they said they would.

title: Bad experience
text:
We booked this trip on the basis of the five-circle reviews in Tripadvisor. Unfortunately, we did not have the same excellent experience that most travelers did. Before I go into details, in case you don‚Äôt want to read my whole review, my advice is if you need to reschedule your tour, be sure to not do it in the middle of a travel day. My doing so led to miscommunication, which resulted in multiple unpleasant, unprofessional interruptions during our tour.

Now for the details. I messaged the company during our flight layover before we arrived, asking for an earlier tour date, which was quickly offered. They requested confirmation, which I was not able to immediately give because we were en route from the Montreal. After traveling for 24 straight hours, we got stuck in customs for 1.5 hours, and it was while in line there that the company called to confirm our earlier appointment. The representative gave me the name of the driver we were supposed to meet, but the name didn‚Äôt register, again, because we were exhausted from traveling and stuck in a very noisy line. We arrived at the designated meeting spot on time, and a driver arrived. I confirmed my name with her, and she showed me my name with the updated tour time on her phone, so we started our tour. About 20 minutes into our tour, I received a call from the company saying that our driver was waiting for us at the meeting spot. I told the representative that we were already on the tour, and she started to argue with me saying that we were with the wrong driver. I cut her off, and told her that was between her and the driver, and I didn‚Äôt want to get in the middle of it. I handed the driver my phone, they had an argument, and then we went on with a tour. Or so I thought. I then got another call from the company, and the representative again started arguing with me, saying that she had called to confirm with me with the driver‚Äôs name, blah blah blah ‚Äì ‚Äì see above. I want to emphasize that it was not our driver‚Äôs fault. The whole experience left us with a very negative opinion of the company, and I‚Äôm sure that the company will provide a response to my review.

title: Wrong tour
text: We booked the Welcome to Belem Tour and received the customary confirmations and meeting place instructions. We were introduced to our guide who was very nice but after awhile we were wondering when we were going to see the attractions that were listed as part of the Belem tour. At that point our guide said that he wasn‚Äôt qualified to give us that tour and said that we had been assigned to him mistakenly. He was apologetic but at that point there wasn‚Äôt anything we could do about it.

title: Terrible experience.
text: Our tour guide did not seem to have any plan for our tour. Trouble answering questions and learned very little. Would not recommend at all.

title: Lousy guides know nothing
text:
Please don't take it or find out who's on you. We're a family of six.
It happened to us that none of them could handle our language and what we hired in Spanish and they didn‚Äôt know anything about history, anything about the places we went. One knew more than another of the two we took
They even told us the tiles were for the weather.....muggy
We really voted silver
In sintra we hired wonder van it was amazing we touched Thomas who knew every part of the place everything with his story

title: Massively overrated avoid
text:
This must be the most overrated attraction in Lisbon. The creaking elevator struggles up the hill if the drivers actually allow you on board before they set off. Serious Napoleon complexes going on with these drivers as they man the tram that slowly climbs the graffiti riddled path to the top of the hill. These guys seem to hate their jobs so much, they really should go and do something more fulfilling!

Once at the summit the views are far from the best in Lisbon and within minutes you will have the prospect of rejoining the ‚Äúhappy gang‚Äù on the decent.

Overrated, avoid.

title: What goes up doesn‚Äôt always go down
text:
Can use your day pass on it . Classic funicular. Opposite Hard Rock Cafe . Not signposted ( unless we missed it).
Seemed to stop at 12.30 lunch.
Everyone gave up waiting. Got bus back

title: Glory Elevator - Be prepared to pay back and forth even if you don't use them
text: The public transport that ends up becoming a tourist spot for the beauty of it and the place. However, they should have more respect for the tourist. The lady who runs the tram and is responsible for the sale of tickets forced us to buy round the way, even if we did not want to go back.

title: In the rain without getting us up
text:
On November 15, 2024 at 6 pm I tried to take the funicular that did not start from the base because the driver said she had problems with the obliterator and had to wait 20 minutes in the rain, so in 15 we climbed on foot on a very steep climb, despite having paid with the Lisbon card the transport that we were not granted. Shortly after, however, the funicular started anyway with other people inside and the driver did not let us get halfway up (firsw was not possible?). Upon arrival I asked for explanations to the same driver who made us take the rain and climb on foot (there were also elderly people) and did not give any... absurd for a tourist.
lousy tourists. Stefano

title: Loss of time
text: This is a joke. 1 minute to climb a street that you can walk without any problems. It is most useful for those who have traffic problems.

title: Disrespectful electrician.
text: I transmit what a family experienced in this elevator. The experience could have been fantastic, if the elevator attendant had not been so EXTREMELY unpleasant to a group of eight people, two girls, the maternal and paternal grandparents, and the parents. We decided not to file a complaint but situations like this degrade the image of the city. I do not upload photographs of the official in question because we do respect people.

title: I do not recommend
text:
Very expensive tourist stuff. ‚Ç¨3.80 for one minute of climbing, then descending. It takes 5 minutes on foot.
Rather take a ride on tram 28 or 12. This is wasted money, furthermore with the viva viagem which costs 6.60 per day with all transport and elevators included it makes no sense to pay for the single route.

title: Tinha tudo para ser um bom momento, mas‚Ä¶
text: √â um elevador hist√≥rico que √© bonito de ver. No entanto, a cr√≠tica vai para o pre√ßo dos bilhetes (3,80‚Ç¨ por duas viagens), n√£o d√° para comprar apenas 1 viagem. Depois, n√£o √© ben√©fico encher o el√©ctrico acima da sua capacidade, pois, em vez de aproveitarmos a viagem, estamos com as pessoas de p√© √† nossa frente, a levar ou com a mochila ou com o rabo de algu√©m. Se a capacidade s√£o 4 pessoas de p√© (ver imagem), n√£o acho correto deixar entrar mais pessoas (o lucro n√£o √© tudo!). Os ascensores j√° podiam estar ‚Äúcom outro ar‚Äù, pois est√£o todos grafitados‚Ä¶

title: 2 Versuche.....immer kaputt
text: Ganz clever.....um mir den beschwerlichen Aufstieg zu sparen habe ich zweimal versucht nach oben zu fahren. Bis ich in der Schlange stehend dran war, war die Bahn kaputt und ich musste laufen...einmal, zweimal....eine 3. Chance gibt's von mir nicht, nur ne schlechte Bewertung.

title: Not worth the cost
text:
On a positive it‚Äôs a beautiful piece of architecture in the middle of Lisbon and we ticked that box.

for a family of 5 at 6‚Ç¨ each, queuing up 20 min for a 30 second ride up isn‚Äôt worth ‚Ç¨30. Would be great if they offered group or family prices.

Found out at the top you can walk up and go on the same viewing platform for free anyway, so you‚Äôre only paying for the lift.

title: Pretty modest view
text:
The elevator is an experience that you can not miss in Lisbon.
Unfortunately, there is a bit of a queue to do, despite the fact that the climb is rather rapid.
At the top the view is rather trivial, not being too high the observation point (better the view from Alfama alta).
It is not worth spending money to go to the observatory (the elevator can be taken with the normal ticket of the means).
It was a bit of a disappointment.

title: Lousy.
text: The super unsympathetic people with very little (if any) desire to help, after swallowing almost 2 hours of queue, are about to go up and tell you that you have to have the right money, and only accept physical card, and according to other comments you can go up the back for free, a place that is not worth visiting

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time and money, 1 hours waiting time
text: Not worth your time, this is an elevator that goes to ‚Äúbarrio alto‚Äù the waiting time is 1 hour and the ticket cost 6 Euros, don‚Äôt waste your time, you can go up there just walking is faster and you visit more.

title: Don‚Äôt pay with your card here.
text: I paid with my card at the elevador of Santa Justa in Lisbon and, instead of being charged 6‚Ç¨, I was charged 10.30‚Ç¨. The most appalling thing is that after countless emails with this company and all the info I provided them, they were ‚Äúunable‚Äù to track my transaction and consequently give me my money back. Please be aware of this company.

title: Tourist scam
text: Don't get on, you can go up from behind, once you get to the top if you want to go up a little more they try to charge you 5 euros more per person, it's a huge scam for tourists and as in Lisbon when it comes to explaining something they don't explain anything, they try to take advantage of everyone, they don't explain anything, I think it's one of the cities that takes the least care of tourists, they try to deceive you in all the monuments, it's amazing

title: Interest-free
text: No interest in paying to reach this view or in addition there is a wire mesh. Don't waste your time walking your way or unless you have the Lisboa card

title: Expensive
text:
Old elevator, located in the historic center of the city of Lisbon, to ascend to the upper part of the city, you must queue, in which there is no awning or anything that covers you from the weather incidents Such as sun or rain

The price per person is 6,10‚Ç¨, the viewpoint is closed

Upstairs, when you go out you give me lift you enjoy beautiful views of the beautiful city, although it is all full of wire to take a photo

title: CLIMBING ON FOOT IS GOOD FOR YOUR HEALTH!
text:
As per the ironic title.
As an attraction (remember it's a last century elevator) it only applies to photos from below and photos from the top.
For the rest it is not worth paying over 6 euros to stay 30 seconds crushed in the cabin of an elevator without any emotion.

title: Useless queue
text: Passing by Carmo Convent you can walk to the panoramic walkway. The terrace is currently closed so it is useless to queue for 45 min and pay around ‚Ç¨7 per person

title: Pro mƒõ nepochopiteln√Ω hype
text: Nev√≠m co konkr√©tnƒõ si m√°m o tomto myslet. ≈†√≠lenƒõ propagovan√° vƒõc. Ze zvƒõdavosti jsem se chtƒõl sv√©st, ale nikde ≈æ√°dn√Ω vstup, nikde ≈æ√°dn√° fronta, p≈ôitom mƒõlo b√Ωt norm√°lnƒõ otev≈ôeno. J√≠zda stoj√≠ jako klasick√° jedna j√≠zda metrem a jedete asi jak dlouho, deset vte≈ôin ? Ne d√≠ky. Tohle klidnƒõ vynechejte, nestoj√≠ to za nic.

title: Santa Justa elevator is not worth it
text: Was fine but views were sub-optimal. The are much better views at nearly by Miraduoros for free. The ticket is not worth it, if you really want to go, take the backdoor walk up the stairs for free ( search for youtube videos for guidance) or get a viagem metro card, the ticket is included in that. We did that.

title: No need to pay
text:
Perfectly useless, you queue for an hour in February for 30 seconds of ascent, at six euros per person, all to arrive at a point that you can reach without paying passing through the high districts.
You can walk past to admire the construction, but frankly you don‚Äôt need to pay to take the elevator.

title: No grace at all
text: Stupid experience, no view has, found expensive for what it offers. It's beautiful, old and gives a desire to walk. But it is very graceless . Not worth it , only if it was for free or for the elderly to rsrsrsrs

title: Cold in Lisbon
text:
Bad service, the queue is huge and the elevator does not move, it is impossible to understand and there is no explanation!!!
And the price of 6,10 euros is absurd

title: Award higher than experience
text: the glance is worth more than the climb (6‚Ç¨ round trip) . very beautiful and original wrought iron construction, in the Eiffel style. and nice viewpoint at the top, but better take the funicular two streets higher, on the station side, because a lot of waiting for not much

title: Too bad.
text:
The view from above is very nice, shame about the rude and incapable staff.
This causes long and unnecessary waits.
The lines are not managed and when the lift arrives you have to scramble to get on.
Absolutely not recommended

title: Setback
text:
Nice lift but that's it.
A waste of your waiting time and ‚Ç¨6,-
You'll be upstairs in 1 minute.
Just walk up the other side.

title: No
text:
No, no interest, long waiting time for ascent and descent with nothing to do through gates
I do not recommend this activity

title: Absolutely useless
text:
I state that we took it just out of curiosity because it was included in another ticket.
Standing 40-minute queue, with a nauseating smell on the finish. To reach a neighborhood that you can easily reach with a staircase or two small climbs. Not recommended.

title: Don‚Äôt queue, try this alternative.
text:
When we saw the queues we knew we weren‚Äôt going to wait then some kind local suggested another way to reach the top.
Go up the stairs at the side of the tower, up onto the main shopping street, turn left and head up the street until you see a shop with a blue sign on the right. Go up the stairs and follow the path.
This brings you up to the other side of the bridge that the lift takes you to.
You‚Äôve saved ‚Ç¨6 and all that queuing. The views are amazing.

title: Useless, Undeserving and Disrespectful
text:
As per the title:
1) Useless: the access to Bairro Alto is absolutely easy from the surrounding streets (two short climbs on busy streets surrounded by shops) so the use of the elevator has a purely aesthetic function.
2) Undeserving: the journey is extremely short and does not offer a particularly impressive view. The viewpoint accessed at the end of the climb (which offers a pleasant glimpse of the city and the castle) is accessible from the road for free and without queuing.
3) Disrespectful: We waited 20-25 minutes (little compared to other reviews) with no cover to protect from the sun. Why are you waiting? The fact that the attendants (comfortably in the shade) waited until the elevator had arrived and the passengers boarded to make the ticket. With a huge waste of unnecessary time. Because making the ticket while people wait in line is obviously too complex...

title: Just walk up
text:
Queues for something that is basically a 30 second elevator ride to a viewing platform which you can walk up to anyway. At ‚Ç¨6/7 a ride it is the ultimate ripoff. Save your cash and walk up.
It looks great but not worth the wait or money. Tourist trap time.

title: There's no point in using it
text:
An hour's tail to get 45 seconds into an elevator where you can't see anything.
The platform can also be reached in 10 minutes by stairs.
All for ‚Ç¨6. We had the life card zapping put anyway....
It's nice but you might as well stay outside.

title: They were still but nobody knew why
text: Elevator in the central area full of tourists at all hours. To improve the organization... after 1 hour of queue we left because the Elevator did not go (maybe ?) But without anyone to inform us. These days the belvedere is closed.

title: Tourist trap
text: Don't bother. You can walk up to the same viewpoint for free. Or, do what we did and visit Hotel Chiado's roof terrace. Same view but spend your ‚Ç¨6 on a great glass of wine instead and avoid the crowds.

title: Go there but don't pay - see it for free!
text:
The elevator dates back to 1902 and is a curiosity that is worth seeing. BUT DON'T PAY TO RIDE IT!

My daughter and I queued for about half an hour and finally it was our turn. Senor captain grumpy was in charge of tickets and pressing the up/down button. We accordingly stumped up ‚Ç¨6 each. The interior really was nothing special. The doors were closed and an ensemble of about 20 paid-up hopefuls awaited the meteoric rise! About 30 slow and mediocre seconds later the "ride" was done. We had reached the viewing platform.

Unbeknown to us, the viewing platform could be freely accessed by all from behind the elevator via the local roads!

So, pay ‚Ç¨6 each, queue for 30mins for a lame experience. Better to take a few photos at the base of the elevator, walk round the back and up to viewing area and then spend the ‚Ç¨12 on a glass of wine for me and ice cream for my daughter!

title: Don't queue or pay
text: Without queuing now, you can climb up the easy mountain and get to the same place where the elevator goes up. Same exact view!!

title: DO NOT GO
text:
DO NOT GO. I'm not one to usually cry "tourist trap" because I find most sites have some value to it. However, I regretted paying for this - there's a long wait (I think there was an mechanical issue with the elevator), it's expensive, and you can't see anything in the ride up anyway because of all the metal railings. And it's cash only. Spend it on a few pasteis de nata instead; it will be much more satisfying.

The WORST PART - the observation deck was closed anyway! They conveniently omitted that fact and collected full price from unsuspecting tourists.

There are free elevators/escalators around the city you can utilize to get up the hill. Or you can Uber/Bolt for even cheaper.

title: Disappointment
text:
I don't think it's worth it, at ‚Ç¨6 per person it's a foolish fool.
No remarkable views and with its own closed viewpoint.
And also queues, 20 P. per trip.

title: Lamentable
text: Hello, despite the presentation of my skip-the-line card allowing a disabled person in need of an attendant, to access this monument, the agent did not allow my attendant to come with me without queuing. So I couldn't visit.

title: Better to save your $5 Euro
text: This attraction is best suited for those with walking impairments and requiring assistance. Otherwise a simple walk to the top of the hill is far more enjoyable.

title: A shame!
text: A shame for the exhausting wait of over an hour, without receiving any information. No operator present who could ask for information about it, no reporting of waiting times that would have helped decide whether to wait or not. An hour wasted! Highly not recommended!!

title: A well packaged package
text:
The structure is very beautiful and is a Los Angeles architectural feature.
But‚Ä¶
The very long queue and the price are absolutely absurd and unjustified.
The viewpoint at the top of the Elevador is in fact directly accessible via a "bridge" that connects it with Bairro alto, at the height of the Carmo convent, the church "without the roof" so to speak. Without paying a cent.
However, we tried the experience in the evening, just before closing, taking advantage of the very short queue and the fact that the price was included in the excellent Lisboa City Card.
The short and insipid ascent does not offer any additional glimpses of the view from the viewpoint.

title: Disappointing and waste of money.
text: Not worth the time or money. Waited 30min get into it, ‚Ç¨6 per person, ride takes 1min, no view or commentary in the lift. Very top viewing platform closed. Just take the stairs at the back if you to see the view.

title: Well, it doesn't have to be
text: Nice view, but that's about it. The lift looks exciting inside, but you don't feel quite so safe. Unfortunately, the staff were not very friendly and were pretty grumpy in the morning. A shame for the nice short trip. It's a visit for a few minutes.

title: Disappointing
text: Unless there's no queue and can ride for free with the 24 hour transport ticket, do not bother. Very easy to walk up the streets behind the lift and get the same view. Better yet, do the Gloria funicular or the Alfama miradouras, all much better value and views.

title: Catch idiots! Run away!
text: If there is one attraction not to do, it‚Äôs this one! Wait 1h30 to take an elevator from which you can't see anything to get to a viewpoint...you just have to keep going up the stairs, it's next to the convent and from there it's free.

title: Luckily it is included in the Lisbon Card
text: Calling it an attraction is definitely too much. ‚Ç¨6 to get on and off within 2 minutes is really too much. The view from above is beautiful, but...

title: Avoid!
text: I only took it because it was free with the Lisbon card... and it was still a mistake. It's only one lift and the queue is exasperatingly slow, you'll waste an hour or more to go to a point that can be reached on foot in a few minutes!

title: Tourist trap
text:
Tourist trap!!
Particular and worth seeing from the street.
But paying ‚Ç¨6 each for a return trip (even at different times) is a steal.

title: View was nice, elevator took too long
text: The idea is nice, it is included with the Lisboa card, but via the back you can take the stairs instead of the elevator for 6 euros to the same view point. Queues are very long for basically nothing.

title: Waste of time
text: An extremely long wait for nothing very special. Queued for nearly an hour and although the views were spectacular, they were no better than you can get from just walking up to the area. 6 euros not expensive but the waste of valuable time so not worth it!

title: A huge tourist trap. A scam
text:
First you have to wait in line for like forever. Then there is no information about how to pay for the stupidly high tariff. 6 euros! It is a scam. There is a small sign that say they only take cash. Ok, we had cash, but when we got onboard the lift, the man claimed you had to have exact amount! He then refused and said he could not exchange pn a 50 euro bill - we were 3 people. We left. Serioisly, you can not treat tourists this way. It is a huge tourist trap. If I could give it 0 stars, I would. Seriously, put up better information that people can see before they get in line.

A tip? Take the free elevator at the bottom of the shopping center. Walk up to the Camp Convent - beautiful place, not a tourist trap - walk around the back and get the view from the elevator tower for free.

title: Do not do it
text: The elevator is definetly not recommended. It costs 6 Eur, the trip itself takes just 1 minute and you have to wait for ages. You do not see much during the ride. I would just take a picture of the elevator - that is more than sufficient!

title: Waste of time, money, and life
text: Don‚Äôt go. The elevator is a beautiful piece of architecture, but this can be seen from the outside. The elevator is horribly inefficient so the queue lasts over an hour. But worse, you can just visit the viewing platform by climbing to the Carmo Convent without the elevator.

title: Useless
text: Useless elevator, going up and down you can't enjoy any view. The arrival platform is also accessible from Rua do Carmo and therefore the 6 euros per person for the ticket are really wasted. We did it because the ticket is included in the Lisboa Card

title: Unwatchable and useless
text:
Even though this lift from the late 1800s (1898) is one of the attractions of the city and attracts numerous tourists, in my opinion, it is aesthetically very ugly and above all useless.
In fact, to get to the Carmo area you just need to climb a few dozen steps and it probably takes less time than the lift (given the numerous queues that form to access it).
Furthermore, the elevator is located in the middle of the buildings and a view of part of the city is only possible from the arrival platform.
Access is subject to a fee.

title: Overated/overpriced
text: Totally overpriced and overated .... you can walk three minutes instead of waiting on the line and take the elevator ...

title: Don‚Äôt bother. Just don‚Äôt. Really. There are a million and one better things to do with your precious time in Lisbon.
text: Wait ages. Not sure how long but over an hour. On an early Tuesday morning in late February! Gosh knows how long the wait will be in summer. The ride up lasts less than 2 minutes. You can‚Äôt really see anything out of the windows on the way up. The views at the top are ok but you can get them just by walking there and there are better elsewhere. Later in the day (when we had taken the elevator earlier) my wife and I wandered up to Chiado - hilly but easily ok if you take it slowly - and found ourselves above the top of the lift. This is one of the most over hyped tourist attractions ever. Don‚Äôt waste your time.

title: No interest
text: 30 minutes of waiting, 2 minutes of climbing. No additional interest in taking it. The viewpoint is easily reached on foot via another access. 6‚Ç¨, included in the Lisboa card (in this case‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs an experience).

title: Better on foot
text:
I do not recommend it, the panoramic view can also be enjoyed on foot from other parts of the city, having paid dearly for the ticket and among other things the top floor is closed
I don't recommend it

title: Do with the lisboa car
text:
6‚Ç¨ to go up and down with the elevator... knowing that you can access the view for free.
I would advise doing it with the Lisbon Card as it is included among the free activities.

title: Do not queue take some stairs, save time and money
text: The tower itself is impressive, however do not waste time and money taking the lift. Walk across the road, going under the walkway, turn left, go about 50 metres and turn right up some stairs, turn right at end if the stairs, walk about 100 metres and go up the next stairs, ut will take you up to the sane walkway that the lift does.

title: Lisbon weekend
text: Much too expensive for a view that can be seen elsewhere. Possible to go there on foot by going up from behind, about 10 steps‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a steal

title: Wasted money
text: Don't go there, there's a queue, you pay 6 euros for tickets to take a crowded lift and not see anything... Greetings, it's full of railings... the view is terrible

title: Senseless
text: A senseless wait in difficult conditions. Better to walk up slowly and enjoy the walk. Six euros wasted.

title: To be avoided
text: It's absolutely not worth it. Almost 2 hours of queuing for a 20 second elevator ride (6 euros if you don't have the lisboa card or other cards that include it) to have a view that you can have in many other places in lisbon

title: do not bother
text: It there is queue do not bother joining it, it was a waste of money. The queue was very slow moving on account that the lift only hold 15 people. We queued for over an hour and paid 12euros only to discover when you get off the lift we could have walked to the same viewing point from over the bridge. we wasted so much time. Just come in from the other side and enjoy the views

title: Go see it but don't get in it.
text:
Go see the elevator but don't pay to get in it. More than 50 minutes of waiting. Impossible to buy a one-way ticket for 4 euros. Price imposed at 8 euros for a round trip and what's more, that day, the cabin responsible for bringing the passengers down was under construction.
In short, a real tourist trap. The climb only lasts a few seconds and what's more, we don't have a view of the street side (but of the walls).
The staff is nice, the elevator is very beautiful, but admire it from the bottom.

title: Scam and waste of time
text: 1h30 wait for a climb of less than a minute and without visibility while the platform at the top is free and freely accessible from the right of the Convent of the Carmelites!!!!! Unless you like wasting your time and waiting standing for the sake of waiting standing? Tell your friends.

title: Don't waste your time
text:
There's no way that makes this worth your time standing in a largely 'un-moving queue (over 1 hour in my case!) for what comes at the end. Yes, the views are fairly good ( nowhere near those from the castle) but with the uppermost viewing platform currently 'closed' the time spent getting there is likely to be more than the time spent queueing .... unless, maybe, you stop to have a drink at the bar/cafe at 'the top' and/or listen to the busker.

From what I could make out there's only 1of2 lifts working and there appears no rationale as to when it goes up/down with no apparent monitoring of how many people remain atop for how long. Very quickly (after taking a few photos) I decided to travel (back) down but there was no indication when the lift would return ... there were 2 police officers (also) waiting but they gave up and when down steps(?) WHEN the lift did arrive (& deposited some people from the (ridiculous) queue, I was the only person (apart from operator) in the descending lift.

title: Good marketing service from the city of Lisbon. The one hour wait does not justify this elevator.
text:
1 hour wait for a viewpoint that you can see by going around the back and going up a few steps
I think the city has a great marketing department
It's a tourist trap

title: to flee
text:
To avoid: go up on foot, it's free.
You can reach the top platform on foot without waiting in line.

title: Tourist scam
text: Only a small handful of people can board every 10 minutes for ‚Ç¨5.60. We waited more than 1 hour 20 minutes to take the elevator. Once at the top, what a disappointment: the platform was closed and we realized that we could have just as easily made the journey on foot... big tourist scam.

title: The scam of the century
text: You will wait in an endless queue to get a two-minute elevator ride at 5.30 euros per head to arrive at a platform accessible to all on foot via Rue des Carmes. Even if it's included in the Lisboa card, don't waste your time in this endless queue at 9 a.m. which moves at a snail's speed to be greeted with relative friendliness! Go on your way‚Ä¶

title: To observe from afar
text: No need to get in the elevator! The architecture is nice (rua Augusta) to observe from below, and it's free! Otherwise the top is accessible via Place des Carmes. And the viewpoint is accessible to everyone!

title: A bit of a scam despite the beauty of the building
text:
As it is included in the Lisbon card and as we pass in front, we stop. 20 minutes in line (up every 10 minutes by 15 max) for 2 minutes in the elevator.
Arriving at the top, we see that we come from there on foot (near the Carmelite convent) and that we can get there on foot by climbing about a hundred steps.
Tourist trap that can be avoided

title: Do not bother
text: Waste of time and money. Don't bother with this queue. So many better free views all over city. Its just a lift and then u can walk back down little streets.

title: Do not ! It's worthless!
text: Terrible long line due to an arrogant elevator attendant who was wasting his time talking and being interesting instead of operating the elevator. The line was immensely long and not worth it. The view is not worth it, because the elevator is not very high. Definitely don't do that!

title: Do not bother
text: When my wife and I first showed up, we joined a long line snaking up the steps from the entrance at the bottom. After quite some time, we wondered if the lift was broken because nothing happened for several minutes after we arrived. We were relieved when we finally saw the lift moving, thinking that meant we could expect regular trips to resume. We were sorely mistaken. After about half an hour of waiting, we looked up some more details online and learned that the lift operates about once every ten minutes, carrying about 24 people up at a time. There appears to be no reason why the lift only operates once every ten minutes, as the ride itself takes mere seconds, and it cannot take too long to load--not that I would really know, since we gave up and left before we got anywhere near the entrance. Save yourself the trouble and skip this attraction.

title: Definitely worth seeing, the climb is not worth it if there is a queue
text: We confirm what many have written, if you have to wait in a long queue to go up it, avoid it, it is worth seeing it from below (even in the evening) and for the view from above it is possible to access it for free by passing from the side of the Carmo Convent.

title: Well yes‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.
text:
I really don't understand why I have to queue for an hour for the lift. It's an old lift... and the ride still costs money. You can easily walk up the small hill and enjoy the view. The lift is a great photo subject but nothing more
Atmosphere: overcrowded
Price/performance: not worth it
Recommend: Photo

title: It's not worth it
text: After waiting almost an hour to get on the lift, I discover that the price is ‚Ç¨5.30 per person. The elevator goes up for about 30 seconds, and at times you can't even enjoy the ride. Once you get there, there is a very beautiful view of the city, but I discover that it would have been enjoyable even if you reached this point from a small road behind, obviously free. Furthermore, you can easily enjoy this panorama from many other ‚ÄúMiradouros‚Äù along the city, free of charge. As far as I'm concerned, it's not worth paying for this attraction, I personally recommend instead spending the money on other points of interest.

title: Tourist trap
text:
We visited the attraction during a crowded day and, after a long wait, we were able to see the monument from inside. Cost of ‚Ç¨5.30 per person for about a minute inside an ancient elevator through which you can't see anything of the outside. Once you reach the top you find yourself on a terrace which can be easily reached on foot via the road behind. The view from the viewpoint is beautiful but also possible from other viewpoints in Lisbon (sometimes free).
Not an advisable experience, given the long waits and the money spent unnecessarily

title: Horrible memory
text:
This establishment does not comply with regulations on priority access for disabled people.
The goalkeeper was very aggressive and did not let us pass.

title: What a rip-off!
text:
I honestly didn't think to check Trip...big mistake
Almost an hour in the queue, ‚Ç¨5.30 (uphill only) and then discovering that I could get to the same point on foot in 2 minutes
But I spent about twenty seconds in a very beautiful wooden cabin‚Ä¶.
Avoid it, it's not worth it

title: I wonder what the meaning is
text:
A panoramic lift, built in 1901 that allows you to quickly reach Largo do Carmo and admire the Baixa from above in all its beauty.
Hours in line (because it leaves at set times and in any case when it's convenient for them). The journey will last 40 seconds?? and the price is 5.30 euros (to be paid in cash!! With the Viva Viagem card entry is free, otherwise I would have avoided it and, in light of the facts, I would have done well!) This is called ridiculous. Also because two steps uphill on foot and you arrive at the same point. It's totally useless. Never have I felt so stupid for wasting time standing in line to do what exactly? 40 seconds locked in a cabin from which you can't see anything? Beautiful to look at just from the outside.

title: Unnecessary waste of money
text: 1 hour long queue and 5.30‚Ç¨ ticket when you can just walk to the very same spot from the back of Convento do Carmo. It is not a similar spot, it is the very same one. Just walk.

title: Do not ride this!
text:
The viewing platform at the top is closed. So, you wait in line for an hour to ride an elevator and see nothing that you can't see from any other high point in the city. It is a total waste of time. Also, we thought at first that the line was going quickly. When we were the group that would go on next, nothing happened for over 30 minutes. Did it break down? We have no idea because they tell you nothing. We just stood there like idiots feeling like we had already waited too long already to give up.

They should honestly just close this. It is stupid. At least we didn't waste any money because it is included in the unlimited metro card.

Please do not waste your time. Better views from the city can be seen from the Castle and many other places.

title: Not elevated above 1-star
text: 1 hour queue for a dirty 60-second elevator to a view obscured by wire screens. ‚Ç¨5.30 fare. You could walk through the square to the Convento de Carmo and come to the same viewing platform for free.

title: A big rip-off
text:
Too much useless waiting, no indication on how to avoid waiting and wasting money.
You can access the tower from the stairs.
Not recommended

title: Fatal
text: It's not worth going up. Full of people and closed top. Endless queue and 10 or less people board at a time every 12 minutes.

title: Mirador closed!!!
text: Everyone queues, the Carris employee collects ‚Ç¨5.30 per person from you and you go up to discover that the viewpoint is closed. You therefore pay for the elevator and ultimately discover a screened space with no real view of Lisbon since the top floor is not accessible. No sign to tell you before spending unnecessarily and waiting for 30 minutes for nothing‚Ä¶

title: The elevator of disappointed expectations
text: We queued for an hour and a half under the sun to see a not extraordinary Lisbon from above. The tower is much more beautiful seeing it from below but there is absolutely no need to go up if you only have time to spare because it's not worth it. the hours in line

title: It can very well be avoided...
text:
Honestly, unless you have the Lisboa Card, which also includes this ticket, I would avoid it, for the following reasons:
1 - long and very slow queue
2 - the view is nothing special (there are much better "miradouri" in Lisbon)
3 - ticket price too high (to use a lift lasting 1 minute)
4 - passing from the back of the Carmo Convent you arrive at the same platform, free of charge and in a very short time

title: Lisbon family dinner
text: The steak was only fat, no quality, a good chef knows this too, not worth repeating, the dessert was tasty

title: Trappola per turisti
text: Assolutamente trappola per turisti. 5,30 euro a persona, salita due piani di ascensore, per godere una vista che si apprezza molto meglio dal castello oppure da una terrazza (gratuita) salendo le scale laterali del monastero del carmo.

title: Torre di Santa Giusta
text: Il prezzo del biglietto √© eccessivo in considerazione del fatto che l'accesso alla torre √© comunque garantito da un ponte che si collega con una rampa di scale alla via che costeggia il lato destro della Basilica del Carmo. Difatti utilizzando questo accesso si pu√≤ accedere liberamente alla piattaforma della torre senza pagare nessun biglietto. L'accesso da questo lato presenta comunque un cancello che deve rimanere sempre aperto per ovvie ragioni di sicurezza. Inoltre anche se il cancello fosse chiuso rimane comunque libera un'area pubblica allo stesso livello della piattaforma della torre dalla quale si pu√≤ godere soprattutto di notte la medesima vista sulla Citta' di Lisbona. Inutile, quindi fare la fila. Il prezzo del biglitto pari a euro 5,30, inoltre, si pu√≤ giustificare come obolo per la sua manutenzione. Negativo il giudizio soprattutto per come viene rappresentata questa attrazione della Citt√† di Lisbona che ad eccezione di questo neo rimane affascinante ed incantevole.

title: No pierdas tu tiempo y dinero aqu√≠
text: No vale la pena en absoluto, es un simple ascensor que te sube a una parte de arriba a la que puedes llegar f√°cilmente paseando. La subida en el ascensor dura 30 segundos y el precio es exagerado, m√°s de 5‚Ç¨. No pierdas el tiempo y date un paseo hasta la parte de arriba y ahorras tiempo, dinero y conseguir√°s las mismas fotos.

title: Horr√≠vel!
text: Experi√™ncia horr√≠vel! ‚Ç¨5 por pessoa (aproximadamente 30 reais por pessoa sendo que √©ramos 5) pra andar de elevador. A ida foi tranquila por mais que tivesse apenas um elevador funcionando, foi r√°pido, n√£o tivemos que esperar na fila, por√©m, s√≥ podiam entrar 15 pessoas no elevador e na volta a fila estava ENORME. Perguntamos para o funcion√°rio onde era pra a subida e ele foi SUPER grosso e mal educado e ainda por cima disse que seriam 2 HORAS de espera na fila sendo que havia a possibilidade de subir as lombas a p√©. Al√©m de ser caro e demorado, existem op√ß√µes mais legais e mais r√°pidas do que isso. Mol vezes melhor poder andar pelas ruas vendo as lojas, monumentos etc do que subir nesse elevador. Mal organizado, caro e sem gra√ßa! N√£o recomendo para ningu√©m!

title: Skuffende
text:
Fin elevator men oplevelsen st√•r ikke m√•l med prisen og den lange k√∏
Turen tager m√•ske 20 sekunder
Mange andre udkigsposter i byen.

title: No merece la pena subir
text: No merece la pena en absoluto, ni el elevador mientras sube (que solo ves hierro), ni las vistas arriba, que sin m√°s, tejados y poco m√°s. Y el precio es escandaloso si no lo llevas ya incluido en la tarjeta de transporte. Es preferible subir el ascensor del arco de la plaza de comercio, que las vistas, si son espectaculares..

title: Overrated sight in Lisbon
text:
This is an overrated sight that is best seen from a distance and is not worth the long wait to go up by lift.

The beauty is best to enjoy from outside, there are plenty of other places that give a much nicer view than the top of this elevator.

title: Teuer, nur ein Aufzug in Betrieb und Aussichtsplattform gesperrt
text: Wir hatten die Fahrt gratis in der Lisboa-Karte dabei. Sonst w√§r es das absolut nicht wert. Aussichtsplattform ist derzeit (wohl l√§nger) gesperrt. Auch f√§hrt derzeit nur einer der beiden Aufz√ºge (schaut auch auf l√§ngere Zeit aus). Wartezeit ist zu hoch.

title: Accessible √† pied par la place Carmo sans faire la queue . Pour ceux voulant monter via l'ascenseur prix inclus dans le pass 24h
text:
La mont√©e dans l'ascenseur co√ªte 5‚Ç¨ ou est comprise dans le pass metro de 24h √† 6.60‚Ç¨.
Vous payer et attendez un tr√®s long moment juste pour monter en ascenseur.
Sachez que vous pouvez acc√©der en haut de Santa Justa par le mus√©e Carmo situ√© derri√®re ! C'est d'ailleurs la porte de sortie pour descendre du point de vue.

Je ne comprends pas que les guides ne mentionnent pas cet acc√®s facile et gratuit !!

title: Do not loose your time and money this elevator is a swindle.
text:
Do not loose your money and time.
This elevator is just an elevator and it does not worth waiting half an hour for nothing.
The best view is from the castle

title: Incomprensible tanta gente en Lisboa en el mes de abril
text: Las colas son impresionantes cuando realmente lo que hace es un ascensor que sube arriba y baja o sea que tampoco vale la pena si quieres buenas vistas puedes subir las calles y verlo desde arriba

title: Better from the outside, don‚Äôt bother going in
text:
Decided to go later in the day, we vowed we wouldn‚Äôt queue for anything else on this holiday after the hellish time we had in Sintra. The queue didn‚Äôt look too bad so we decided to hang around, a queue of around 40 people still took 40 minutes. It really wasn‚Äôt worth it but at least it was included in our 24 hour travel pass.
I would recommend just looking from the outside plus when we reached the top we realised you can just walk onto the viewing platform without a ticket.
Lisbon is great but we have decided not to bother with any of the tourists attractions as they come with massive queues, unorganised staff and leave you feeling frustrated, also a lot of them just aren‚Äôt worth it.

title: Just a lift to no where.
text:
So this is a famous and well located lift in the middle of Lisbon that takes you to a viewing platform all in a beautiful Victorian contraption.

However, unless you have a travel/Lisboa card the price of ‚Ç¨~5 is comically high to travel on it. The ques are crazy and VERY slow moving. The views are ok, but you have safety mesh in the way so pictures are tricky.
But the most important fact, YOU CAN ACCESS THE VIEWING PLATFORM FOR FREE by walking up there.

Note.
In May 2023, the top area was closed and the platform that the lift stops at was completely open. Even when everything was working it looked like you still get pretty decent access for nothing.

Seriously save your money and time and give it a swift avoid!

title: Pas de file pour les PMR
text: √Ä faire au moins une fois dans la vie mais si vous faites partie des personnes √† mobilit√©s r√©duites passez votre chemin car Z√âRO consid√©ration. Enceinte avec un enfant en bas √¢ge, et il y avait aussi 2 personnes aveugles qui faisaient la queue avec nous.

title: Pas terribles
text:
Faire 1h de queue pour 1min de mont√©, je vous conseille de faire une photo et de monter √† pieds
Heureusement cette activit√© √©tait comprise dans le pass Lisbonne car payer 5‚Ç¨ pour 1 personnes et faire que la mont√©e car la descente √©tait en panne franchement abus√©

title: Not worth standing on a queue for an hour to get there!
text:
If you are alone there so it to the good view but if you are gonna wait an hour in the queue, it is really not worth it.
You have the view in other point without waiting for hours.

title: no merece la pena
text: una hora y media de cola, 5‚Ç¨ la entrada y cuando llegamos arriba nos dicen que el mirador esta fuera de servicio. Un a estafa total.

title: Attrape touristes
text:
Nous avons attendu 1 heure et demie pour une ascension de quelques secondes.
Co√ªt de plus de 5 ‚Ç¨ par personne .
Arriv√© en haut nombreuse foule .
La plupart sont arriv√©s √† pied.
La vue est jolie mais aucun int√©r√™t de prendre l‚Äôascenseur .

title: Worst thing in the whole of Portugal.
text:
I have no idea whatsoever why people visit this. You have to queue for ages (half an hour, hour is common) just to ride in an elevator when you can walk up yourself for free and a fraction of the time. They charge you 5.30 euros for the privilege which is a complete and total rip off.
I can't understand why the guy operating the lift takes everyone money on the way in and this isn't done while you're waiting in the queue as it would make things so much quicker.
I was a stupid tourist by going up in the lift, I didn't realise how expensive it would be, how long it would take (I didn't realise how long the line was as it continued a bit downstairs).
It was by far the worst thing I ever did the whole of Portugal.

title: Bon que pour les touristes
text: Une queue interminable pour faire l'aller-retour, factur√© plus de 5 ‚Ç¨. Un attrape touristes pur et dur. Aux dires de notre guide, seuls les touristes empruntent l'ascenseur, les lisbo√®tes pr√©f√®rent monter √† pied par les escaliers et les ruelles. D√©crit comme un incontournable de Lisbonne, √† √©viter. On prendra des photos et basta !

title: No vale la pena hacer cola
text: No vale la pena hacer cola para subir un 30 segundos en ascensor. Es bonito de ver, y sobre todo el museo de arqueologia de arriba, pero se puede ir andando. La cola es muy larga, mala informacion, caro... Id a ver el elevador y la zona, pero hacer cola no vale la pena

title: Perdida de tiempo
text: Estas en cola durante m√°s de una hora. Despu√©s el ascensor tarda unos 15 minutos en bajar a recoger a la gente que esta esperando, y despues te das cuenta que solo tarda unos segundos en subir.¬øporque tarda tanto en bajar? Menos mal que las vistas son magn√≠ficas.

title: Une magnifique r√©alisation derri√®re une √©norme arnaque
text:
√âvitez vous cette √©norme arnaque √† touristes. La plate-forme tout l√† -haut est gratuite et facile d‚Äôacc√®s. Donc vous passez derri√®re l‚Äôascenseur en montant les escaliers ou tout le monde fait la queue et vous montez 50 m. Au milieu de cette rue sur la droite des escaliers. Prenez les. Arriv√©s en haut tournez √† droite allez jusque l‚Äôarche du mus√©e et p√©n√©trez sur la plate-forme. Voil√† vous avez √©conomis√© de l‚Äôargent et √©vitez au moins 1h de queue car il faut savoir que seulement 24 personnes √† la fois peuvent monter dans l‚Äôascenseur. Pas plus!!!
Bon courage si vous voulez vous en rendre compte par vous-m√™me

title: My Visit
text: Not obviously, you do not need to queue and pay for this. We just climbed up the not too steep and long hill and went to the terrace of lift and enjoyed the view.

title: Lent√≠simo
text: El timo no esta en el precio, que dicho sea de paso esta incluido en la Lisboa Card. El timo esta en el tiempo que te hace perder

title: Attrape touristes. Fuyez
text: A moins de vouloir absolument une photo dans l'ascenseur, inutile ! Plus d'une heure d'attente, c'est tr√®s mal organis√©, pas du tout optimis√©. Apr√®s une.montee de 20s environ, vous arrivez √† la plate-forme... totalement accessible gratuitement en passant par les rues autour de l'√©glise des Carmes.

title: Passez votre chemin
text:
Mais qu'elle d√©ception et qu'elle arnaque ! 1h20 de queue pour...rien...on ne l'a m√™me pas pris pour descendre ! Le billet carris n √©tait plus valable de 15mn /24h apr√®s tout ce temps d'attente, j'ai d√ª payer 5.3 ‚Ç¨...
Franchement montez par la ruelle si vous tenez au point de vue, mais ne vous trompez pas, l'entr√©e est dessous...

title: Una presa in giro
text: Anche in questo caso le guide parlavano di esperienza da provare. Evitate di perdere tempo in una lunga attesa. L'ascensore porta sulla torretta dove si pu√≤ ammirare il panorama dall'alto. La fregatura sta nel fatto che ci si pu√≤ accedere anche a piedi, dal convento do Carmo.

title: Passez par l‚Äôautre cot√©, c‚Äôest gratuit!
text: Attrape touriste!!!! Faites le tour et passez par l‚Äôautre cot√©, vous y aurez acc√®s gratuitement!!! Payer plus de 5e par personne pour une mont√©e en ascenseur de 20 seconde maximum et une vue vraiment pas top‚Ä¶ nous √©tions choqu√© de l‚Äôarnaque! De plus, la file d‚Äôattente est longue, vous perdez votre temps!

title: Restez dehors !
text:
Prenez des photos , le plus beau est √† l ext√©rieur ! Structure ext√©rieure magnifique !
A l Interieur, passez votre chemin , il n y a rien √† voir , pour 3/4 d heure d attente en avril .
N oubliez pas de passez √† pied derri√®re l elevator , pour la peinture et la sculpture

title: 2 ore di coda? Anche no!!!!
text: Non ne vale la pena , perdere 2 ore in fila! Meglio andare a piedi! Noi dopo mezz‚Äôora di coda abbiamo rinunciato, nonostante avessimo la Lisbona Card, ripeto non ne vale la pena: tempo perso!

title: Do not queue for this
text: One member of our party really wanted to do this. We queued for 90 minutes for a 60 second ride with dirty windows. It was ‚Ç¨5.20 each and only cash. If you walk for 15 minutes to the square with the Convento do Carmo you can access the same viewing platform for free and if you are really need to go in and old elevator you can go down in it for ‚Ç¨1.60 and no queue. It was highly anticipated, over hyped and missed in a blink

title: Un timo
text:
Es un atentico timo. Guardas cola mas de una hora para subir es un ascensor hasta el mirador pensando que al ser metalico que la unica via de acceso a el es el ascensor y cuando estas arriba te das cuenta que se puedellegar en 5 o 10 minutos andando por varias calles normales y corrientes.
El timo no esta en el precio, que dicho sea de paso esta incluido en la Lisboa Card. El timo esta en el tiempo que te hace perder en la visita a la ciudad

title: Zonde van je tijd
text:
Niet doen.. Kost je bijna 6 euro en een uur van je leven in de wachtrij. Ritje duurt 19 seconden en je ziet er niets van.
Als je toch van het uitzicht wilt genieten, strek dan de benen en wandel rustig en steil omhoog. Dat kan via prachtige straatjes aan de achterzijde van deze lift.

title: Lamentable
text: Si bien la estructura es "bonita" y apreciable desde distintos sitios y miradores de la ciudad en si , gastarse el dinero en subir o acceder a su mirador ( cerrado desde hace tiempo al parecer) teniendo en cuenta las colas y gente que suele haber es perder el tiempo recomiendo subir a cualquier otro mirador la ciudad tiene decenas de ellos muchos m√°s bonitos , sin tanta gente.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time or money
text: We queued for the lift for just over an hour. The lift is mentioned as one of the ‚Äòthings to do‚Äô in Lisbon. Basically, you queue for a lift to a viewing platform that can be accessed by another means. I agree with other reviewers. Skip the line. It will be an hour ( or more) of your life you won‚Äôt get back! Very disappointing. üòû

title: Une arnaque
text:
√ânorm√©ment d‚Äôattente pour pas grand chose
On a un meilleur point de vue de la ville des miradors. Et oui il faut payer pour monter et repayer pour descendre
Je ne le recommande pas
En plus on ne peut m√™me pas monter sur la plate-forme sup√©rieure et cela on ne vous le pas. Par ailleurs le portier est aimable comme un manche √† balai.
Faites une photo de la structure et passer votre chemin. Il y a mieux √† faire √† Lisbonne

title: Initile
text: Coda interminabile e totalmente inutile, in quanto si pu√≤ arrivare alla terrazza proseguendo sulla salita a sinistra dopo le scale. Fanno salire a gruppi di circa dieci persone ad un costo di 5.30 (oppure gratuito con Lisbona card, o con biglietto metro giornaliero) ma non ne vale assolutamente l'attesa, solo tempo perso. La salita dura circa 45 secondi, l'ascensore √® bello, ma ripeto inutile. Potete fotografarlo e poi salire a piedi. Averlo saputo prima non avrei mai atteso cos√¨ tanto.

title: Don‚Äônt waste time in queue, walk there instead
text: Use only if there are no queues and You have transport ticket (24h transport ticket which van be bought in metro stations includes rides on trams, buses, metro AND lifts and elevators). Lift takes up ~every 10-15min ~15persons. Lift itself is 0 emotion attraction, the only effect is view from platform which You can get by simply walking up there on foot using streets. Platform is free of charge.

title: Une arnaque
text: Vendu comme site incontournable dans tous les guides sur Lisbonne, il s'agit en fait d'une v√©ritable arnaque. + de 20 ‚Ç¨ √† 4 pour monter 2 √©tages. 3/4 de queue en permanence qu'elle que soit l'heure. Il y a mieux √† faire d'autant que le point de vue en haut est accessible gratuitement en passant par la rue du haut ext√©rieure. A prendre en photo pour l'architecture mais sinon, passez votre chemin. Il y a par ailleurs d'autres points de vue bien plus beaux.

title: Waardeloos
text: Na ruim een uur in de rij te staan in minder dan 1 minuut boven. Beetje rondgelopen en weer via de trap naar beneden. De wachttijden zijn extreem. Voor 1 minuut omhoog en 1 minuut omlaag (incl. In en uitstappen) neemt de lift ruim 10 minuten. Er gaan 15 personen in de lift. Dus reken je wachttijd maar uit

title: Think hard you'll be waiting a long time!!!
text:
Bear in mind this is February & before the high season. There is only one car working currently so that is making things worse. The queue was over 1.5 hours to ride to the top. Then the viewing gallery is closed. So whilst the views are good they'd be even better from the top level. It takes them an age to get the car from the ground to the top and back down again. The numbers that can fit in the car are small which does not help. I know that it is 120 years old but it seems to take 120 mins to make one journey up & down!
The cafe at the top serves cod & cheese fish cakes which are excellent. Limited drinks menu & nothing beyond the fish cakes. It's as pricey as you'd expect but the quality is good. Beware however it is card only & no cash!

title: Absolutamente Prescindible
text:
Es absolutamente rid√≠culo usar el elevador.
La espera es de al menos 45 o 60 minutos para un recorrido de apenas unos segundos.
La frecuencia del elevador es absolutamente nula, lo que hace pensar que est√° motivado por una penosa gesti√≥n.

title: longa fila
text: A longa fila de espera n√£o compesa a paisagem, que mesmo bonita pode ser acessada a p√©! vale pelo conte√∫do hist√≥rico.

title: Just Look, Don't Ride!
text:
The person who coined the phrase "You've been taken for a ride!" probably rode and wrote about this elevator. First, service is very slow that there is a very long queue to get in. Second, it will cost you 5,60EU for the 30-second ride unless you have a Viva Viagem (24-hour card).

Take note : This elevator is not handicapped-friendly. When you get off the elevator, the only way to the upper town is through the steps going down to the small street toward the museum.

title: Long queue for a short ride
text: We queued for the lift for quite a long time. The structure was quite interesting and the information good. But the ride in the lift was very short and when we got to the top we found the viewing platform was closed so we didn't get the full effect. But it did get to a part of the city we probably wouldn't have visited.

title: P√©rdida de tiempo y dinero
text: Muy caro, de ning√∫n modo justifica las largas colas que genera. Existen otros accesos sencillos a la zona del Carmo, y mejores miradores en la ciudad. Adem√°s, la terraza-mirador est√° cerrada y nos comentaron que posiblemente de forma definitiva.

title: Geld klopperij
text:
Na 1 uur wachten EUR 5,30 betaald voor een ritje van 20 seconden. Boven gekomen weinig spectaculairs....over de brug gelopen staat men binnen 1 minuut weer in de achtergelegen straat.
Voor dit belachelijk hoge bedrag kan je beter de straat voor de lift verder lopen richting centrum- eerste links weg omhoog en binen tien minuten sta je bij de loopbrug van de lift ...geheel gratis.

title: Bellissimo a vedersi da fuori.
text:
Bello, eh! Ma 30 minuti di coda per 25 secondi di salita non li merita!
Fate una bella foto da fuori, perch√® √® bellissimo, ma poi raggiungete il punto superiore a piedi, mediante una breve salita.

title: Ladrocinio
text: Il viaggio verso il Carmo dura 30 secondi, il prezzo √® ‚Ç¨5.60, il numero di persone permessi √® 15 e le corse ogni 10 minuti! Questa √® la ragione per cui la coda √® infinita e non vale la pena farla in quanto il panorama della citt√† si pu√≤ tranquillamente avere dal Carmo salendo a piedi e risparmiando tempo e soldi.

title: Una fesseria
text: Una fesseria. Coda chilometrica per 1' di ascensore che porta a una balconata che si raggiunge gratis con una scala dal retro. Forse se la terrazza panoramica √® aperta (poi da raggiungere a piedi), ci pu√≤ anche stare pagare il biglietto, ma dubito. Consiglio: lasciate perdere. Se proprio non riuscite a farne a meno, passate da dietro, foto e via.

title: Waste of time
text:
Wasted over an hour waiting for the lift, absolutely not worth it.

Worth walking to see it from below as the structure is impressive but I wouldn‚Äôt wait more than 10 minutes for the ‚Äòexperience‚Äô

title: Una autentica perdida de tiempo
text: Sinceramente, me pareci√≥ una p√©rdida de tiempo. Primero estuvimos una hora de reloj haciendo cola para subir a un ascensor que dura literalmente 15 segundos. En nuestro caso, como ten√≠amos la tarjeta de transporte, no pagamos los 5 eurazos que vale subir. Luego te lleva a un mirador, las vistas son bonitas pero nada que no veas en los tropecientos miradores que hay en la ciudad. Cuando salimos, nos dimos cuenta que desde la parte de atr√°s donde est√° la salida (sin vigilante ni nada), se pod√≠a entrar GRATIS. La "entrada" en cuesti√≥n est√° de camino al Convento do Carmo para los que no quer√°is subir sin hacer cola y gratis.

title: A total tourist rip off
text: They charge 4.80 Euros for a return ticket and you can't get a single ticket. When we looked at the ticket it said that it was valid for two trips so, as we were going up on two days for a concert, we decided to walk down on the first day so we could use the return ticket the next day. So we got on the next day and presented our tickets. The driver was possibly the most unpleasant person I've ever come across. He just said 'you can't use this'. I pointed out that the ticket said it was valid for two trips. He said 'only on the same day'. So I asked where it said that. He just ignored that and said I had to buy new tickets. This was at 8:15 in the evening so I pointed out that it would be impossible to use the return ticket as the funicular stops at 8:30 and could we just pay for a single ticket. Again he just ignored that and told me to pay by credit card. So a total rip off for tourists and a really horrible man to have to deal with.

title: Nothing special
text: View from going up is not very nice - there are buildings on both sides close to the tram. If I would need to buy I ticket I would have been really disapponted. 24h hour ticket which can be bought in metro stations for 6,6eur includes all lifts, metro, trams and busses. We ascended and walked down throught nice little streets - that was beautiful

title: P√©sima
text: Ojo! El conductor nos ha cobrado habi√©ndole preguntado si val√≠a la tarjeta viva de transporte. Nos ha dicho que no val√≠a y en el elevador da Bica si vale

title: Beware ‚Äì This Company Is Not What It Seems
text:
I feel obligated to warn others: Elite Trip Unipessoal LDA, registered as a tourism business, is actually operating as an unlicensed construction/renovation company. I hired them (under the direction of Nuno Silva) for a home renovation project, and it turned into a nightmare.

They took full payment, abandoned the job 70% complete, and left behind dangerous electrical work that had to be redone by a licensed professional. The finishing was sloppy, the damage to my property was extensive, and after receiving final payment, they completely ghosted me.

This is not a legitimate or trustworthy business. They are misusing a tourism business license to offer construction services, which is highly unethical‚Äîand possibly illegal.

If you see this company offering any kind of renovation or building service, stay far away. Totally unprofessional, dishonest, and not what they claim to be.

title: Totally unpleasant staff especially in small cafe on first floor
text: Amazing shop with more floors than you can possibly visit in one day but totally unpleasant staff, rude arrogant unhelpful, especially in the small coffee bar on the first floor! Would never visit it again! The cafeteria on the top floor was also way too hot and we left after having been seated 20 minutes with no waiter coming. A lot of room for improvement.

title: Fake insurance
text: I made a purchase at the store and activated the household appliance insurance offered. When I had to use it, I was surprised by conditions that were not clear at the time of hiring. I asked for transparency on the replacement value of the product and they refused to provide any proof. Unfortunate the way they handled the client. I do not recommend taking insurance through El Corte Ingl√©s.

title: Tapas Restaurant in Mall
text: The mall it self is huge. We stopped at a tapas restaurant on the lower level. We waited in line for 25 minutes to be shown a seat. Once we were seated we did not get served.Three other tables ,which were seated after us , got served. The only difference was the locals get preference. I guess they do not want to serve tourists! It was a Saturday & very busy. Would not advise waiting a long time to be seated , if you won‚Äôt get served.

title: Not recommended
text: Worthless lots of expensive shops. Would not recommend this store. Probably on sale. Shop is very spacious and clean. 0

title: A once-trusted brand is falling apart
text:
We ordered a De'Longhi coffee machine from Corte Ingl√™s as part of their Black Friday promotions.

We are still waiting almost three months later.

In that time, we've received about 12 emails promising that the coffee machine would be delivered in the next few days.

However, once we started complaining, and raising our complaints to a high enough level, it turns out that these messages are generated by the Corte Ingles system automatically and bear no relation to reality at all.

When we pushed Corte Ingles to check what the situation actually was, it turns out they had no idea when the item would be back in stock. In fact, we were given the advice to ignore emails from Corte Ingles about delivery dates, until we actually receive a message from the courier to confirm that the item is on its way.

The problem is that every time we have received a message, we had to arrange our lives around it, to make sure that one of us would be at home on the given days.

If the key to customer service is to under-promise and over-deliver, Corte Ingles has a system designed to do exactly the opposite.

Every time we've tried to contact Corte Ingles on the phone, it's a painful process that takes a long time, and involves a lot of waiting. And quite often the phone has just cut off, and of course no one calls you back, you have to start again and go through the whole process again. If you need to speak to them in English, then that's a whole another level of pain and waiting.

What is very surprising is to see the coffee machine still being offered on the Corte Ingles website as if it's still in stock!
They're trying to get people to buy and them keep stringing them along with a stream of emails that say things that they know aren't true.

Basically, you can't trust what's on the Corte Ingles website, you can't trust what they send in their emails, and you have to be very patient to get through to people who aren't going to tell you the truth anyway!

What has happened to this brand?!

Never again for us.

title: Do not park there
text: They closed the garage, and we could not access our car after dinner. There was no notice posted anywhere! We learned that this is quite a common issue, so be sure to check in advance.

title: Attention Orders Online
text:
Pay attention to online orders!
On July 15, 2024 I went looking for a camera intax evo and I see that the Chinese el corte had with in delivery on July 17, which for me was excellent, moreover on a reliable and reliable site... I thought ! Today 2 September I still find myself waiting for the machine , I contact the assistance say they do not take responsibility and that was sent the delay email ( 10 emails in total ) and 2 months waiting ! They with 160‚Ç¨ and I without the camera! Aserio be careful not to keep your money and still say that you do not take responsibility because you do not know the partnerships with whom you work. unfortunately in my case if this is not resolved soon will take serious proportions in court because I know well my rights as a consumer, and it is the company el corte ingl√©s that gives the face. Neither SHEIN nor Temu take that long, for a brand like yours is a shame.

title: Racist Supermarket Staff
text:
Mamadu Cande arbitrarily let one customer go in front of another at the supermarket checkout line.

I was the next customer at the checkout, I am an Asian woman with 11 items. Mamadu Cande asked me if I would be okay with letting a customer behind me, a White woman in her 30s with 1 item, checkout first.

I said "No. Why?!", incredulous. Mamadu Cande grabbed her item from behind mine on the checkout belt, scanned and allowed her to pay first anyway.

It was against my will, illogical, unjustified, unexplained, inexplicable, probably racist and definitely arbitrary.

I complained. Mamadu Cande simply smiled like I was being ridiculous, and gave no explanation. What is the point of queuing if the checkout staff gets to pick and choose who gets to go first? If all customers behind me have only one item, do I ever get to pay and leave?

The other customer was able-bodied and young, did not appear to be in a rush, and did not request to go first. We were not in a 10 item or less checkout line. There was completely no reason for Mamadu Cande to do what he did. I cannot believe this happened at all, and in El Corte Ingles, allegedly the best high end supermarket in Portugal.

title: The food court is not it
text: When I went to Spain a few years ago, I had visited El Corte Ingles and loved it. So when I found out they had a location in Lisbon, I definitely wanted to check it out. Unfortunately, this one just wasn't it. Maybe my expectations were set to high because of the Barcelona one (since it is a Spanish store after all), but the Lisbon one was just lacking. The food court was just filled with over-priced restaurants. The Cafeteria was reasonably priced, but none of the menu items appealed to us. There wasn't any Portugues menu items - it was just basic sandwiches, salads, and burgers. Visting the food court was our main reason for coming here so unless you are planning to actually shop here, I'd recommend skipping it.

title: Spectacular merchandise - Pathetic staff.
text: I have been to El Corte Ingles in Barcelona, Madrid and Lisbon. Typically, I don 't review department stores, but these are really impressive - if you ignore the people who work there and the multiple inefficiencies. The supermarkets are wonderful, but rude staff ruin the experience. Same goes for their eateries upstairs and throughout the store. They do NOT understand any form of customer service, but you may get lucky on any given day. Staff at Lisbon Store are particularly useless.

title: Attention to dress code, nationality, and ethnicity before going in.
text:
This shopping mall is very interesting, with several branches, and I particularly like it the most. It offers the finest collections of products, and I often visit to check out new items and do grocery shopping or buy souvenirs. Although there are cheaper places, I enjoy the presentation and experience of this location and I highly recommended it (due to the products, only).

However, one day when I was not at my best and dressed casually in jeans, a shirt, and a simple jacket, I noticed that security guards were constantly watching me and my friend. If my friend, who has a darker skin tone than mine, touched any items on display, security would approach us, without saying a word. It was a frustrating experience, and it highlighted the issue of racism and xenophobia.

What's worse, I witnessed another incident where a group of Brazilians were being mocked by a (native) Nescafe machine salesperson nearby. This happened on the upper floors of the mall. Though I can't say why the mocking began, I do not see it as a professional or customer-oriented service attitude."

title: Forgetful
text: Restaurant is at top of the store and I went there after shopping. I had the days special which was Brazilian meat with rice, very bland. Dessert was ok. I was disappointed.

title: Disappointing - visit local boutiques all around, instead
text: This collection of shops in an old mansion was recommended by Cabana Magazine. It was very disappointing --lots of spaces empty --and scorching hot inside. Visit all the super, small boutiques in the area (Barrio Alto) instead, where we found lots of great things!

title: Such a beautiful palace / sooo badly managed
text:
The city palace is beautiful and the shops are exquisite and special. You have to like it...
"However, the employees in the individual shops are so unfriendly and not at all interested in selling anything"
They hardly look up and are busy with their cell phones!

title: Boutiques de cr√©ateurs, trop cher
text: Lors de notre visite du quartier do principe Real nous nous sommes arr√™t√©s dans la galerie commerciale Embaixada. Celle ci ne contient que des boutiques de cr√©ateurs sur 2 √©tages. Les prix sont nettement tr√®s √©lev√©s et sans rien proposer de vraiment exceptionnel. Sauf si vous avez les moyens, je d√©conseille et la galerie et m√™me le quartier qui n'ont pour moi aucun int√©r√™t.

title: No interest, move on
text: Found this address in a guidebook. The place is nothing exceptional, the service is non-existent, they don't even know the wines offered, in tasting the wines were not good. 2 glasses, 1 cheese and charcuterie plate 25.-, a tourist trap. I won't go back there.

title: Very very dangerous at night!!!!
text:
The area is beautiful however it is unbelievably dangerous, especially in the night. There are a lot of intimidating men that loiter/ live on the streets below that are not afraid to approach and follow you - I am a 20 year old young women who moved into an apartment on this street and was there for 3 days before I had no other choice than to move as the area was too dangerous for me to leave past dark!!! I personally know of 2 other women who have had to do the same shortly after moving in.
It is such a shame as the area is really beautiful and the street is in a very central part of the city. Just around the corner are great shops and restaurants and it is completely safe! It seems to be this one square that attracts dangerous individuals. During the day it is fine as it is busy however DO NOT visit if you are a woman and alone when it is night time as you will NOT be safe. Google this street and you will see recent news reports of the crimes that have been occurring at night.

title: Mistreatment at the station
text: Terrible treatment at the station's ticket office, the young woman who served us spoke very badly to us, she shouldn't have been facing the public

title: ALERT-train strike affecting schedule throughout the day
text:
BEWARE‚ÄîSTRIKE THRU APRIL 5, 2023. check the cp.ct website before going to the train station. You can go the the alerts section and get information about which trains are not running. NOTE‚ÄîThe train station will still list your train as running and give you a platform number even though the alert information on the website will tell you which trains are cancelled because of the strike. Only about a half hour before the train departs will the station announce the train has been cancelled. The monitors do NOT show it has been cancelled.

The ticket window is nice and will rebook you, but you will get whatever seats are available and will ride backwards because all the forward seats are gone.

And because of all the cancellations, all the luggage storage at the stations is very limited. So you are stuck waiting at the station unless you want to haul your luggage around or go to another storage facility in Lisbon.

Hopefully some people will see this and avoid the hassles we have had today.

Tip: if you show up to your station and your train is not on the line it should be at least a half hour before you are to depart, go immediately to the ticket window to rebook.

title: Detestable! Bad infrastructure!
text: The subject reigns on the spot. The bathrooms are horrible, it's a huge shelter of drugged people harassing passengers and street locals taking all seats. Rolling stairs turned off during peak hours! Day of the week! Thank God there is a shopping area in front, which offers hygiene and safety to train passengers.

title: It's a very beautiful place, but dirty and dangerous
text:
Just like anywhere else, you need to be careful with your stuff so you don't get robbed. It is very well located, but if during your travel time the shopping Vasco da Gama is open, it is safer to stay there waiting to give your travel time.
If your trip is in hours when the shopping is closed, on the top floor of the East there is a glass room that offers sockets, if you have a seat available it is safer to wait there inside. In the winter sale a lot in the season, and there are not many closed places to protect yourself from the cold, especially in the morning hours.

title: Horrible.
text: It's just awful. Dirty, broken stairs, nasty bathrooms, cold, dark and full of scary people.

title: Shameful
text: What a shame. So foreign that passes here what do they think of our country?!. Lack of hygiene and everything careless. As for the toilets besides dirty, neither cleaning records are made. If it was in a commercial establishment the AZAE would not forgive but as it is something public can be in this deplorable state.

title: Third world station
text: I never expected to find such a depressing resort, especially considering that we were on international trips. It has no docks, you are left on internal streets without ramps and uneven sidewalks. Impossible little bag wheels (throughout the station). Underground full of homeless people sleeping there. Zero cops. Few bars. They close early. Dirty bathrooms. Difficult to find suitable information and signs. A mess.

title: Despite a beautiful season, it is poorly cared for and with equipment off
text: Although the architecture is very beautiful, the station is poorly cared for, with rolling stairs off and with a lot of dirt. The train ticket stores were closed (only one was open, with long queues) and the automatic services were out-of-air.

title: Lousy signage and customer service.
text: This station is very nice but the signage is appalling all the people who work here are very rude and uncooperative. You have to arrive in time to find one's life by dragging your suitcase everywhere and guess where everything is. Lousy attention! Some screens you can't see, no one to point. They assume everyone knows everything.

title: bad
text: it looked beautiful, but when I arrived, it was poorly maintained, rusty, poorly cared for, I felt very scared, I clearly saw people ready to carry out scams, it was also dirty and amazingly, Lisbon is a tourist city, and at Oriente station, there was no escalator working, I went up 3 flights of stairs with my suitcase on my back, I'm 61 years old, but I managed to laugh when I saw a poster saying that the escalators were not working, to save energy!!!!!Just laughing, right!!!

title: Not Organized
text:
Took the train from Oriente to Coimbra and back for a weekend trip from Lisbon. The station is on the red line to the airport and to downtown, which is convenient. The rest is not very well organized. It is about 5 levels, with trains being on the top, a waiting area on the 4th floor and a mall being below. There is also a homeless camp on the bottom floor of the station.

It is hard to navigate around as up and down escalators are not near one another. Many people had to either lug their luggage up or down stairs without an escalator. There is very little in the way of information and help if you are new to the station. The trains are also always late. Mine was 2 hours late. I talked to my hotel in Coimbra about it and they confirmed the trains from the station are never on time. Nothing much you can do but grin I guess.

title: Bad signage
text: It may be beautiful but it is very confusing with no signage to indicate where the buses are‚Ä¶destinations etc. Without help it's really confusing and frustrating looking for espressos. I don't want to repeat it and I won't suggest it to passengers who don't know it well

title: Confus√£o no embarque Flixbus em Lisboa Oriente
text: Nunca vi tanta desorganiza√ß√£o, confus√£o quanto o que h√° na esta√ß√£o Lisboa Oriente da Flixbus. Lixo caindo das lixeiras, tudo muito confuso. Os motoristas foram bem gentis apesar da confus√£o.

title: Aus√™ncia de algu√©m que cuide da esta√ß√£o Oriente
text:
Elevadores ( alguns?) fora de servi√ßo
Todas as escadas rolantes do r√™s do chao para o piso 1 s√≥ desciam.
Tive de subir as escadas carregando a minha mala
Porqu√™ isto?
