text: Terrible service. Queue for an hour to be seen and the all customers being told that no cars are available and a further hour wait. Staff tell everyone that they need to be more patient. AWFUL

title: Vergonzoso
text: La peor experiencia que he tenido con un rent a car. Teni√©ndolo reservado con antelaci√≥n, pagado e incluso con el check in hecho para aligerar el proceso precisamente, tardaron 4 horas en darnos el coche (literalmente). Y para colmo, cuando ya lleg√≥ nuestro turno, tardaron una hora m√°s porqie ten√≠an que aspirarlo. Un desastre de organizaci√≥n

title: Do Not Rent From Hertz in Portugal
text:
Wish there were a lower rating. I rented a regular car but when I went to pick it up they offered my a lux Polestar 2 fully electric vehicle. We were driving from Lisbon to Porto so i was concerned about the range. And i told him I'd never driven a
electric car. The guy said Don't Worry! There are charging stations everywhere. He told us to download an app. And if the car needed a top off, charge it while we had lunch. We drove a 1/3 of the way and 1/2 of the charge was gone. Went to our next stop and the charging station we found on the app didnt exist. Found another one and searched everywhere for the charging cable but couldn't find it. Called Hertz and were told we needed to charge the car. Duh. Then they said they needed to send roadside assistance because no one there, it turned out, had any idea how to charge an electric car. Meanwhile, we tried a 2nd charging station cuz it seemed the 1st one didnt work. Called Hertz again. And again. And again. They kept transferring and dropping the call. Finally they had someone from Polestar call me and he also said Hertz had to send roadside assistance. Meanwhile, our day trip is slipping and it didn't work. Meanwhile, we can't reach Hertz. Strangers stepped in to help us find the charging cable and to read the instructions on the Portuguese only charging stations. Eventually we closed and locked the car to go wait in the shade for help. We walked away and the car started charging. Seriously? No one could tell us to do this? Got the car to 54% while we visited amonastery for an hour. Should have been more than enough to get us to our destination. Nope. We had to limp along in the slow lane way below the speed limit for and hour to get there with a tiny charge left. When I returned the car they were rude, made me wait, then refused to make it right in any way. I'm a Hertz Gold Plus Member. Be warned! Do NOT rent from Hertz in Portugal. Or if you must, do not accept a fully electric car.

title: UNETHICAL SERVICE - PROMISING AMOUNT OF RENTAL RECORD WAS DOUBLED IN THE FINAL INVOICE WITHOUT OUR CONCENT AND AWARENESS
text:
BE CAREFULL! they get your money with an initial spoken deal, and once they have the info of your credit card they are charging you more that the deal you have communicated!! AWFUL-UNETHICAL SERVICE, BE CAUTIOUS!!

The story:

The rental agreement we made for 2 days, engaged our Credit card with the total amount of 258 ‚Ç¨ & the car that they would give us was an electric.

After having already paid, the employee told us that a battery of this electric car is about 300km & because this was limited for us ( since we wanted to go more miles )we asked to change the car with a car with gas.

The employee told us that he will upgrade us with another car & the extra cost will be only the gas, and instead of 70 ‚Ç¨ we will pay 100 ‚Ç¨ for the gas ( 100 ‚Äì 70 = 30 ‚Ç¨ , so we should pay 258 ‚Ç¨ + 30 ‚Ç¨ = 288 ‚Ç¨ ).

BUT, out of his confusion he asked us to pay 350 ‚Ç¨ AGAIN without cancelling the previous transaction ( I had a credit card limit so thankfully this transaction did not happen).

I was trying to explain the difference etc but then we asked for the supervisor to solve the misunderstanding.

After discussing with the employees supervisor, she reassured us (after asking her multiple times whether there are any extra costs for the car upgrade & her answer was that the price of 258 ‚Ç¨ would be the total one) that for this upgrade the price & the costs will not change.

I was finally charged 350 ‚Ç¨ where they added up additional fees that were already added on the initial rental record agreement, without informing us from the beginning and of course LYING TO US that we will pay less.

The conclusion

Of course i have communicated with their customer service this was their response :
" I regret to inform you that the charges billed are valid based on the location response"

They do not even admit their miss communication and miss management & they just reply back this is it accept it!

Nobody should accept this kind of treatment and be sure that we are never going to use your "services" ever again.

title: Good Tour, if you are placed in the right seat
text: Had high hopes‚Ä¶ They all got shattered because i was seated in the first row‚Ä¶ Horrible! Couldn‚Äòt see sh1t. I would recommend asking, if you could not be seated front row.

title: Cannot book DE via tripadvisor. Scam?
text:
Can't make the reservation DE. Validation of payment on bank app then no email DE confirmation DE reservation.Trip advisor does not mesde and sends a satisfaction questionnaire by email! I'm waiting DE see if I've been debited DE my account. meanwhile I'll notify my bank by email
To oppose the regulation as soon as it opens, it is the weekend, of course.

title: Pleasant tour but guide Totally disrespectful and unpleasant to the Portuguese culture
text:
On a tour held today July 19, 25, although the route was pleasant, the experience was deeply disappointing and unpleasant due to the guide ‚ÄúMaria‚Äù.

He spoke mostly Spanish, even with many Portuguese on board, which made the experience less inclusive.

In addition, there was no cultural rigor, told distorted stories and disrespectful jokes, such as:

That the Christ King in Lisbon is smaller than that of Brazil because the builder ‚Äúfled with the money and a girlfriend‚Äù;

That Christ the Redeemer lost two fingers in a storm, and that of Lisbon ‚Äúproves that there is no hell that breaks him‚Äù;

That the Portuguese were ‚Äúsmart‚Äù and bended the line of the Treaty of Tordesillas to seize Brazil.

All this was said with a jokeful tone and without any cultural or historical concern.

When searching, we realized that there are several identical reports with other HIPPOtrip guides, which raises serious doubts about the company's script.

The idea of the tour is fun, but communication urgently needs more respect, rigor and sensitivity for visitors ‚Äî especially the Portuguese.

title: Not recommended
text: Hardly anything seen, as it was poorly possible through the vehicle. Presenter was more interested in entertainment than information. Not recommended

title: Entertaining but not very informative
text: The route within the city is unfortunately not very interesting, you can see only a few real sights. The highlight is the ride in the water, where you can see only two Torres and not the cityscape of Lisbon. We had a very nice, always cheerful and striving tour guide (Maria) who did a lot of show and spread good vibes, but that only belied the few real highlights. Unfortunately, the tour had little to do with a good informative city tour. The Portuguese statements were also much more detailed than the English statements.

title: Skip this tour.
text: Well, we expected an informative tour from Tanya and Carlos but what we got was a lets see if we can scare the pedistrians. We rode around and Tanya would yell Hippo Hippo and our response was Hurray! This was done all trip with very little history of the town or information about anything. It would have better been billed as a "Scare tour of Lisbon". You could turn this into a booze cruise tour and then all that would be fun but not what we expected.

title: Tickets cancelled as we were waiting to board
text:
Our booking was cancelled after we paid, as we were waiting to board!
We had booked our ticket in advance and planned our afternoon around the trip. We got to reception, they did have our booking (they checked our name), we paid for our tickets, we went to await boarding‚Ä¶ and then after all that, we were told that our tickets had been cancelled! No explanation given, except that there was suddenly no more room on the boat. This is despite the fact we had a booking AND we‚Äôd just paid for our tickets! So it seems that booking a ticket does not guarantee you a place on the boat at all. This could have been due to a large tour group of tourists coming in.
They did not have room on another trip until many hours later, so we had to ask for a refund. We were left without an alternative to entertain the kids, and still unsure when / whether the refund will appear on my card. Rubbish customer experience.

title: Tourist trap experience to avoid at all costs
text: Tourist trap to avoid. Terrible service by unprofessional and rude staff. One of the worst tourist experiences I have ever seen. Avoid

title: First and last time
text:
We are very disappointed by this activity... We think they should have cancelled because it was a very rainy day. So no visibility (even the driver), the host (very exuberant) was trying to do her show but it didn‚Äôt take because we were stuck in traffic jams in Lisbon.
In short we did not wait to go into the Tagus (not even sure that the Hippobus went there with time) to ask to go out so uninteresting and borderline bearable,
Activity to forget, we prefer tuk tuk a thousand times to visit Lisbon.

title: English speakers should avoid this company.
text: Tour was 90% French / 10 % English language, felt very let down by this as was looking forward to it, it spoilt our experience for our group. HippoTrip should understand that all of us onboard want to hear and understand the commentary. I would not book with this company again and would not recommend them to English speakers.

title: Fatal and unpleasant experience !!!!
text:
The driver of the vehicle during the introduction of the amphibious vehicle into the water did so at a high speed which caused the water to enter unexpectedly causing damage to the passengers of my family:

1) first of all, the water literally soaked the hearing aids I wear in my ears, wetting them and rendering them unusable. These prostheses are electronic devices that cannot receive water directly.

2) the cell phones that we were carrying in our hands also got wet and were affected by the water.

3) the whole family was soaked with water, leaving our clothes completely wet and with a humidity that is not suitable to continue the trip.

At no time, neither during the boarding of the vehicle, nor during the course of the trip, nor at the ticket window itself, did your company inform about the risk of getting wet or directly wet or our belongings.
Not even on their website do they indicate that passengers with any type of electronic devices should safeguard their belongings for risk of being wet or receiving water directly during the trip.

In short a fatal and unpleasant experience that ruined our day !!! !!!
I do not recommend it at all

title: Hippo Hippo with surprises
text: Be careful if you are carrying valuables, we were not warned that you could get wet when entering the sea.The entrance was abrupt and we got wet whole. Some had a camera smashed, others had hate gadgets and others had their phones broken. They should give advance warning of the danger.

title: Activity cancelled
text: Reserved via the website ticks.... I arrive at the meeting point... I am told that there is no place at the time I had booked... I am offered another schedule that did not suit me since I had to leave... the person tells me that they tried to reach me by phone..I never received a call neither a message nor an email...my children were disappointed because we passed buses and the activity seemed nice....

title: Take a trip to the Tagus instead
text: Visit made interesting only by the passage in the Tagus. The land passage is interesting: we do not see much because the partitions are high (yet I am large), we only see very quickly some elements and not the most interesting of the city, the host who does his show speaks too much to say nothing and does not always do the translation in English. Instead, I Trip Tip you to take an excursion in the Tagus River simply because the view from the river is beautiful, especially at the Bel√©m Tower.

title: Buying a ticket doesn't get the trip
text: Unbelievable and Ridiculous. After paying ‚Ç¨200 we were told we have to make separately a reservation. Buying a ticket should lead to a reservation. Extremely disappointing for the children. Nothing on any third party website tells us that a separate reservation is needed.

title: Very disappointing
text: We found it very unfortunate that the guide did not make a minimum of effort to translate even the names of the monuments into French. Not a single word has been translated. So we wasted 1h30 of our time and money

title: Cancellation at the discretion of hippotrip.
text:
Last minute cancellation...
No explanation, even the excuses are of poor quality.
Departure at 11:00 a.m. postponed to 12:00 p.m. take it or leave it
Really not up to par

title: Attention: do not book when it is windy!
text:
Be careful, don't book if it's windy!
We wanted to see Torre de Belem and the monument from the river...
We had specifically asked the day before what would happen if the wind was forecast to be strong. We were told that we would be informed if the tour was not possible. The captain would decide that.
On the day of the tour: no information, so we made the long journey. No information when we registered that the tour could not take place as planned. When we were sitting in the 'bus' we were told that the tour would change 'slightly' because of the weather, but that we would spend enough time in the water.
In the end we had a short tour on land around the harbor (and the comments were mostly in Portuguese and only a few sentences in English), and then we drove into the water 3 times(!) in the harbor area, then we turned around and went back to land. That was it! We paid over 170‚Ç¨ for that... a disgrace! A waste of time and money!!!

title: Awful for young children
text: I drove on the highway for one hour to take my son on this tour (it‚Äôs not really my kind of thing but I thought he would enjoy it). 3 year old children are allowed but there was nothing on their website that said children have to be at least 1.50m to be able to see anything. Usually children are allowed to on your lap in buses or boats, but not on this tour and there‚Äôs no warning about it not being suitable for young children. They just have to sit there and watch something on your phone or something for more than an hour. Definitely a wasted afternoon

title: Terrible
text:
Loud, shrill, terrible. The lady at the microphone talks faster than a fan. You can't understand a word. I kept asking myself during the trip how you could turn this woman off. Or what drugs she had taken to be able to talk at this speed for 90 minutes without a break. Then sometimes some disco music plays. And at an unbearable volume. And then you're supposed to scream and throw your arms up in the air.

If you want to experience a quiet city tour, this is definitely not the place for you. It was not announced beforehand that this was a shrill party trip with bad Ibiza animation. This is for stoned party people who already have constant headaches.

People with cardiovascular problems or high blood pressure could be in mortal danger during this spectacle. What a nightmare.

title: Scam
text: The advertisement was misleading. It said $1:19 per person, and we got to tour, he said it $20. We decided not to go. I want my money refunded.

title: Disappointing
text: I did this tour with a friend and just felt we didn't learn much of anything about the area during the tour. Information was very minimal

title: Problem with tour guide
text: Tour guide wore a keffiyeh and an anti-zionist political pin this week for tour of Chiado. (The guide is from Iceland). Made me very uncomfortable to be around her. It is inappropriate to wear personal, political, and controversal items when giving tours to the public. Keep your politics to your self or dont give public tours.

title: It was more walking than talking.
text: I wish I could leave a better review, but the guide will either makes or breaks your experience. our tour guide was Beatriz and the tour was more walking that talking. The tour was going pretty much like 10 minutes of walking, 2-3 minutes of short commentary, 5-10 minutes of free time taking pictures, while she was on her phone. If you wanted to know anything about the sights in front of you, it was up to you to ask.

title: Free tours are absolutely NOT Free!
text:
Although we have paid for the tour and it was incl. guide, the guide, Sophie, said that one should pay additional 10-20 euros per person.
Free tours are NOT free!!!

title: Tour company canceled night before the tour
text: The tour company canceled the 11 AM tour on the evening prior to the scheduled tour. We had planned our entire day in Lisbon around the 11 AM tour. Very displeased.

title: Very disappointed in canceled tours
text: This company canceled two different walking tours on two different days due to lack of the specified number of recipients required to take the tour. For one of the tours, it was canceled after I showed up at the meeting point. While I understand there is a minimum requirement for this particular company to perform the tour, as a tourist you need to know this because like me, you probably will plan your days around activities like this. Due to their cancellation, I missed out on a day where I could have went to Sintra or at least planned other activities within Lisbon. Rather, I showed up on time mid-day just to have the tour canceled. Maybe this isn‚Äôt a problem during the main tourist season, but in January this happened to me twice. My best advice is to book with a company or individual that doesn‚Äôt have a minimum requirement of walkers for a walking tour, otherwise you may end up like me and canceled on the spot.

title: Almu, a guide with little empathy and a lot of "history". Bored
text: We did the tour with Almu from "Hi Lisbon Walking Tours"... and honestly, I asked him a couple of things at the beginning of the tour, but he gave me a couple of blunt answers with little empathy, so I decided not to ask again. The tour was quite boring, treating us as if we were little children. Not recommendable.

title: Tour per dipendenti aziendali
text: Tour molto approssimato,accompagnatrice inesperta,cibo pessimo,itinerari saltati ,lungaggine nelle descrizioni artistiche,il cliente non viene considerato!

title: Too bad the course is only given in English when I am Portuguese. The lady who gave the explanations did not
text:
Too bad the course is only given in English when I am Portuguese. The lady who gave the explanations only did her duty. Quite cold when I asked when I asked for 2-3 little additional information when I did not understand a sentence in English.
The person did not introduce himself and no information about the history of the natas. Summary course disappointed.

title: not a cooking class !
text:
If you don‚Äôt know how to cut an onion‚Ä¶ take the class‚Ä¶ not that they will teach you how to do it‚Ä¶ but you will do at least that‚Ä¶.

everything is prepared ‚Ä¶ you just put things in a bowl‚Ä¶ not interesting
teacher is great‚Ä¶ but it does not work
you have 3 hours and you sit and eat for at least 1h30 ‚Ä¶. and you leave 30 mn early soooo you put things in bowl for 1h‚Ä¶.
terrible and super expensive

if you are with friends and you want to drink wine and pretend that you are cooking‚Ä¶ this is the perfect class for you :)
i was super disapointed‚Ä¶

title: To flee
text: Disastrous experience, I was not able to participate in the activity once I arrived on site the door was closed, with no response either by email or by telephone and the refund request was not successful.

title: Give me my money back tripadvisor
text: Booked on the 13/02 through tripadvisor upon arrival the place was shut and no one was there. Have got in touch with tripadvisor with no help.

title: Odd
text:
Pastel de Nata Pastry Class

Lisbon

Funniest experience but not what expected

915055462

I had high hopes for this cooking class. My interactions with the owner beforehand were pleasant. She contacted me a couple of days before our scheduled class to reschedule because we would be unable to get to her location in Belem because of the Pope‚Äôs visit.

We arrived about 15 minutes early and the staff on hand was not happy about that. Reluctantly they let us in to sit and wait. They didn‚Äôt greet us or provide any introduction at any time.

Instead of the 8 participants as the website states there were 12 of us. I assume that was because others were rescheduled too. This only impacted us because it felt rushed.

The lead instructor was quite rude and harsh, shaming us if our product was not done perfectly. Once I got over that I found it hilarious and my family spent the next 2 hours laughing at the ridiculousness of the class. When the instructor didn't like the way someone was doing something she took over for them and completed the task. This is a casual cooking class not culinary school. I paid for the opportunity to give it a try, not to have a perfect finished pastel de Nata but to try my hand at making the pastry.

There was not enough water or juice for the 12 participants. We were provided with 2 pastel de Nata‚Äôs - which were the best tasting ones for the trip - we sat at the table for a while while the staff began preparing for what we can assume was the next class. They did not communicate with us at all. We asked if we were done and they replied yes, so they gave us pastry to take with us, which was very nice and we were on our way. All in all the strangest cooking class I have ever taken; yet my family has laughed more about this experience than any other.

title: Not worth it
text:
It's not worth it, it's central but for us it's not important.
The surrounding facades make the landscape a little ugly

title: Maybe I didn't understand it well
text: Sculpture (if it can be defined as such) by Rui Chafes created in 1998 for the Lisbon expo and made up of two empty iron tubes 9 meters long and painted dark, resting on supports and arranged at an acute angle to each other. From afar they might seem like two cannons, also because they are not cylinders but truncated cones. Open on both sides, they should serve as a sounding board for the wind that possibly passes through or for the voice if someone tries to speak inside. Maybe a child might find them interesting, but they didn't say anything to me. They are located near the Portuguese Pavilion, in the open space just to the south of the latter.

title: WATCH OUT FOR THE PARROT
text: Bite by Chico on the hands by Amalia's parrot, I am shocked by the attitude of the staff, I had to go to a pharmacy for treatment. The guide remonstrated with me rather than asking me how I was doing. She told me that this is the first time that it happens, it's not true, another comment on google says the opposite. Real bad faith. No proposal to reimburse me for the cost of the ticket or pharmacy fees. I would contact the Portuguese Ministry of Tourism to see if it is normal for a wild animal to be free in Portugal amongst customers.

title: Too bad.
text:
No attention for people with disabilities, no reduction!
The visible part of the museum is nice, worth a visit

title: No aceptan visitas individuales, solo aceptan grupos
text: Mala atenci√≥n. La casa estaba vac√≠a cuando llegu√© pero me dijeron que no pod√≠a ingresar porque esperaban a un grupo. Por suerte no hab√≠a comprado las entradas antes. Siempre que voy a un museo compro recuerdos en sus tiendas, lo √∫nico que se pod√≠a hacer., Pero no lo hice porque est√° gente es nada emp√°tica y parece que no les da la capacidad para hacer dos cosas al mismo. Si reciben grupos y no aceptan visitas de indiv√≠duos, deber√≠an aclararlo en su portal. Me perd√≠ unas horas antes de volver a mi pa√≠s pensando que los iba a ocupar en este museo. Para los que estamos de paso, los minutos cuentan y quiz√°s era nuestra √∫nica oportunidad de visitar un determinado lugar. No pienso recomendar a este museo cuando mis conocidos viajen a Lisboa. No pierdan tiempo. De ah√≠ me fui al Calouste Gubelkian, que es un museo maravilloso, tiene tesoros de verdad.

title: tormented by events
text:
near Rossio is the church of S√£o Domingos.
according to many one of the most beautiful churches in the city.
the earthquake (1755), fires, works and renovations completely changed the initial medieval structure.
its history is linked to tragic events.
the Inquisition burned hundreds of heretics who were first condemned before the altar of the church and then taken to Pra√ßa Dom Pedro IV where the stake awaited them.
the Lisbon massacre of 1506 when the crowd tortured and killed hundreds of Jews accused of being the cause of the drought, hunger and plague that gripped the country.
The color chosen for the covering is quite horrifying.
we didn't like it.

title: Ostentatious, gaudy and poor.
text: Overly ornate and gaudy. The overly priced museum is full of ostentatious artefacts. Much better places to visit, avoid.

title: Disgrace - lying about opening hours, rude unpolite guard
text: During opening hours, they do not let visitors in. A rude, unpolite guard are sending people away, by swearing at them. An absolute DISGRACE.

title: Unfortunately closed
text: In Alfama, under the former citadel of the castle of S.Jorge, there is this baroque church (built in the early 18th century) which survived the earthquake of 1755. Although I had found the opening hours (evidently wrong) from 10am to 12pm on Wednesday and Friday, arriving at 11 am, precisely on a Wednesday, the church was closed. Even though it has a monumental fa√ßade (which is not in excellent condition), I advise against coming here if you are not sure of finding it open.

title: Horrible
text:
I think it is important to share about my recent experience on my sister and I‚Äôs two week trip to Athens Greece. Upon arrival on July 14th we were met at the airport by Kira our local coordinator. I was lucky that I had done a video call with her before leaving the states or I would not have had any idea who to meet. On the IVHQ website it shows that someone picking us up would have a sign identifying themselves. This was not the case. She placed us in a taxi and sent us to the hostel which is in a less than ideal neighborhood but we tried to keep an open mind. We were not given a code to the door and were left out on the street with all our luggage for well over 20 minutes before someone came to let us in. During this time I used WhatsApp to reach out to Kira to attempt to figure out how to get in. She did not respond to the text for over an hour  and when she did it was after I messaged letting her know we figured it out. We were placed in a room with 10 other girls, not an issue. If the AC worked, which it did not. During our pre arrival call Kira had stated due to the fact my sister who is 18 was traveling with me that she had ensured we would be in the same bunk, and that our volunteer shifts would be the same. 

At bed assignments we were not placed in the same bunk. This again was fine. Orientation was Monday morning we had no issues this day other than the AC and it being no joke 95 degrees in our room. Tuesday Kira met the four of us that were in the community support program we walked about 20 minutes to the first location which was a Kitchen. After meeting the team there we walked another 15 minutes to the social cafe, we were told what we would be doing and that the buildings surrounding the cafe were refugee housing. We then received the schedule for the next two weeks, my sister and I were on opposite shifts for every single day. I asked the other two girls first if they would be okay with switching so that we could work together and travel together. They had no issue with this and then I spoke to Kira who also said as long as the girls were okay with it then she was as well. 

Wednesday morning I woke up very sick. I messaged Kira ‚ÄúGood morning Kira, just wanted to let you know last night I started feeling very sick. Sore throat, stuffy nose. My sister and I went to bed about 11pm and I slept until 1115 this morning. We‚Äôre about to head to our placement after heading to the pharmacy but just wanted to let you know‚Äù I was under the impression that if I started to get sick that it would be Kira‚Äôs job to get me a doctors appointment and note since I was working with food at my placement, Kira would never text me back about not feeling well. Over the next two days. 7/12 girls in our room would be sick. Non of which would receive any medical attention. 

Again all with no air conditioning and being told it was only this hot because of how many girls were in the room. Friday we elected to get an airbnb for the weekend after not being at the hostel for one day I started feeling better we returned Sunday night and after one night I woke up sick again. The air conditioning had been making dripping noises and I had made comments about being worried about mold and that being why so many of us were feeling bad just at the hostel.

I ran into Kira on the street Monday morning. She asked me how I was feeling and I told her that I only was feeling really sick in the mornings and after spending time in the room she nodded and walked away. My sister and I carried on and went to our placement at the cafe. 

The cafe was an awful experience. We were not shown how to do anything and then were just thrown into serving the refugee community. At one point the leader there took my sister and had her go to the rooftop to do service up there. It was over 100 degrees this day, he did not allow her to bring her phone, or grab water before heading up. At this same time the food from Kitchen arrived and the cafe had given out more tickets than the meals they ordered so about 50 people did not receive a meal. Which led to screaming, and pure chaos. I said I needed a moment because honestly I was scared we were telling people who we did not speak there language we had no food for them and with good reason they were upset. People began screaming and were then eating left overs out of the trash. 

At the end of our 7 hour shift at which we did not take any breaks during, at the time we were scheduled to leave went to the leader and asked if there was anything else we could help with since it was our time to leave or if we were good to head out. He looked at her and told her to get back in the kitchen. We ended up working 8.5 hours this day. 

By the end of Monday we felt defeated. We were not spoken to with any appreciation, or respect by the organization we came and spent thousands of dollars to help. We weren‚Äôt sleeping from the heat in our room we were exhausted. We decided Monday we were going to book an Airbnb for the rest of the week so that at least we would not be exhausted for placement. I texted Kira to let her know. 

At the same time in the group chat this message was sent by another volunteer ‚ÄúHey is the A/c being fixed.
It's unbearable.
People are sick, no one is getting any sleep.
Girls are leaving to go stay somewhere else, another is leaving the program early.
We need this problem fixed asap!!!‚Äù 

They had someone there that day to fix the ac but we had already paid for an airbnb. When fixing it there was mold discovered inside the unit. Only took over a week of everyone complaining for something to finally be done. 

Tuesday my sister and I both wanted to cry thinking about going to the cafe. We messaged Kira stating we would like to go over things that we were experiencing before returning and that we would prefer to work at the Kitchen. She did not reply for almost and hour and we did not go to the cafe as we had stated we would not until she spoke with us. At this point we had been in Greece for 10 days and had seen Kira at most two hours. Kira was very disrespectful and not interested in hearing what was going on. She said we were disrespectful, that we don‚Äôt do what we say we will, and pretty much that all of our concerns were not real. 

After arguing with Kira for an hour and not getting anywhere we said that the conversation was not going anywhere and we were not resolving anything so please remove us from the program. 

A few hours later is when we received text in the group chat. From quality manager also pretty much calling us liars.

I have all of the texts Kira cannot pretend that no one was complaining to her about anything or asking for help. 

Two hours after that text was sent Kira messaged me privately and notified me and my sister that we was no longer allowed at the hostel. Which was fine since we had already secured other housing thank gosh. I‚Äôm not sure what we would have done if we hadn‚Äôt been proactive or if we did not have the money to leave. But over the next three days. 6 other volunteers would be ‚Äúexpelled‚Äù and allowed to eat and sleep at the hostel. Which we paid for. 

This has been overall one of the most awful experiences I have ever had. After leaving placement we also discovered that the ‚Äúrefugee housing‚Äù that is around the cafe are actually brothels. And that area is known for sex trafficking and prostitution. The lack of transparency for 18 year old women walking alone here is absolutely astounding. 

Nothing that was promised in my package was how it was there. From the moment I entered the country, emails were sent from almost every one who was there as well over the next few weeks. Because this was devastating on the treatment and lack of communication and support. 

The only person who was any help was David, that man truly cares about the people staying at the hostel, he checked in and did everything in his power to help. He deserves a raise and a promotion. 

I spent the last month asking for a one week refund. Which has now been denied because they are now claiming we were the issue not this horrible program. Waste of money.

title: Not worth it
text:
Overall a very disappointing experience. I did one week of youth support in Lisbon. My main issue is with the cost and ImpacTrip‚Äôs refund policy. The program is already quite costly but I thought it would be worth it due to a week of free accommodation and food plus the opportunity to volunteer which I had never done before. The cost includes an airport pickup if you arrive on the Sunday prior to your week starting. I was initially meant to arrive on Sunday but had last minute itinerary changes due to severe weather that meant I had to change my flight to a different date. My issue was not that I could not get the airport pick up. My issue was that they refused to refund me for a service I never ended up using due to circumstances out of my control. I have emailed and texted ImpacTrip several times asking for a refund or at least an explanation as to where my money is going to go. They responded once saying it is not a part of their policy and could not provide an explanation as to where my money is now going. This is about ¬£45 and as a young backpacker this is a lot of money to me. I think it is unethical and unfair that a volunteering organisation to whom I have given my money and time is happy to keep money for a service I never used. I find it incredibly rude that they can‚Äôt even give me an explanation as to where this money has now gone nor an apology.

Secondly, not an issue as such but more advice. It is advertised that volunteers have to speak English. At the after school care, neither staff or kids spoke much English. Language classes are offered during your week of volunteering. However, I had already spent ¬£550 for this week and this was out of my price range. Also, as I thought English was the required language I did not think this would be necessary. It is also advertised that you can offer to teach English in an informal way to the kids. However, the afternoons are already organised by the teachers weeks prior. I understand the necessity for this having worked in after school care myself at home. However, it just really limited my opportunity to interact with the kids. In addition to the language barrier I really felt like an outsider. I am not blaming anyone for the language barrier or trying to suggest the school should know English. I know we are volunteering in disadvantaged areas which makes this really hard. I just wish someone had told me before that this program would be better suited to people who know Portuguese or are trying to learn Portuguese. In fact, interacting with young kids would be a great way if you are a beginner Portuguese learner :)

Another frustrating experience was transporting to volunteering. I know the website states you should be expected to travel to your volunteering venue. However, I thought this would be within walking distance or a short bus/train ride. I had to take 1.5hrs worth of public transport each way and also pay for this myself. This ended up being 50‚Ç¨ for the week. Again, while I understand this is advertised, it was more expensive than I thought. Also, while Lisbon is safe city, it is always worries me to have to travel so far on my own as a solo female traveller at night. Some volunteers were younger than 18 and raised this with ImpacTrip who simply stated that they should have known they had to travel to and from volunteering on their own. I think that‚Äôs quite a harsh explanation to someone who‚Äôs literally a child on their own in a foreign city.

Finally, the staff at the hostel were rude and unaccommodating. I did not feel welcome and was made to feel like everything was such a chore for them to do. This is with the exemption of the cleaners who do a very thorough job. The hostel is really clean which is always nice. The linen is clean and there are fresh towels for volunteers which is a bonus. In terms of food, it is advertised in the program that the food is prepared on site which it isn‚Äôt. It‚Äôs prepared in another kitchen and brought to the hostel you stay at. This doesn‚Äôt apply to me, but there were several people with severe food allergies such as coeliac disease who were often not accommodated. The hostel staff would tell them their food was prepared with the other food and that it was still fine to eat. Some days there were no GF or allergy-friendly options available and they were told to find their own meals for the day even though food is part of the cost.

As said, it is a shame that this was overall a disappointing experience. I think there is a lot of potential for this to be a lot better and the positive volunteering experience people are looking for.

title: Ok Mobility / DouYouSpain
text: We rented our vehicle with the company Ok Mobility through DouYouSpain, since we could not pick up the vehicle the day we arrived on November 2, we called the next day and they told us that in a couple of days they would resolve our incident, so that we should be patient. It's going to be the weekend, it's been more than 1 month and they don't give us a solution and we're still waiting..... SHAMEFUL!!!

title: Europcar are SCAMMERS
text:
I will never rent with Europcar again, they are SCAMMERS, not only have they not returned the rental block, but in the early hours of Saturday (so that I could not claim at the time), they have charged me ‚Ç¨140.26 .
After delivering the car and confirming that it was in perfect condition.
I hope this helps more people and they don't get fooled like me.

title: So bad
text: Bruh it was so terrible there was no one in there and the music is rubbish don't go in there. Recommend k urban instead. It is so good!

title: Retrograde
text: Doormen of an indescribable level. Without any qualifications, they have no idea what they do, how they talk, who they talk to. It doesn't have the slightest sensitivity. They make obvious distinctions in front of customers, which, to say the least, is backwards.

title: Macho to the max
text: We were 5 friends and they didn't let us enter because we weren't with women. It was not full and only people with female partners continued to enter. Regrettable even reportable

title: bad van, illegal additional charges, disgusting customer service
text:
DO NOT HIRE FROM INDIE CAMPERS!! they are cons. I rented a caravan in Barcelona for a festival. First of all, the thing that they don't tell you in the website - is that in order to take the van you need to pay a deposit (in addition to the rental and insurance price), in my case 2000 euros, and they will do everything in order to not give it back.
In my first day of renting the gas was leaked and the fridge died - and all the food got spoiled. I got back to them to fix it so I lost my first day. Then we went to the festival - in the second day the leisure battery died and stopped charging. We had already been in the festival area so couldn't get out with the vehicle. I talked to the chat support nonstop to find a solution for us but they don't care - they told me to go and buy a battery. I spent my hole 10 days of rental without electricity. Then when I returned back the caravan - the guy at the station looked at it and took some pictures, said it's ok and I can go, and that I will get my deposit back in 2 days. Of course I didn't got it back, but instead, 2 weeks after I got an email from them saying they charged me extra 1200 euros for a plastic damage (that wasn't there when I returned it). what???? It's unacceptable to charge more after my rental is over and we already agreed that there are no damages. I wrote to their support in every channel possible, filled a claim, sent videos and nothing, they are ignoring everything. I tried to cancel the transaction through the credit card company but they say they can't. the least I can do is to warn others not to rent from them

title: Their customer service is non-existent
text: I don‚Äôt recommend this f√∂retag. Their customer service is non-existent. We booked an RV for 4 people- Atlas 5 Auto, three months in advance. A week before our trip, they downgraded our van to one that sleeps only 2 people. After contacting them by phone, chatbot, email, and submitting a request, we received no response‚Äîeven after more than 48 hours, which they claim is their response time. They stopped answering on the chatbot, and calling customer service was not really helpful.

title: NIGHTMARE - STRANDED - DO NOT BOOK INDIE CAMPERS WE ARE CURRENTLY STRANDED IN AN INDIE CAMPER
text:
NIGHTMARE - STRANDED - DO NOT BOOK INDIE CAMPERS
WE ARE CURRENTLY STRANDED IN AN INDIE CAMPER 20KM FROM THEIR VENICE DEPOT, we have been left stranded here for a week now in a van with no working water or aircon, no key to drive the van or lock the van. The call centre in India have absolutely no idea what‚Äôs going on and offer no solutions. The local team are not allowed to order towing or new keys or any maintenance work. Indie refuses to honour any refunds for loss of holiday. It has been an absolute nightmare. We are seasoned travellers and have never had an experience anything like this bad before. My greatest mistake was booking an Indie camper based in the 5* reviews on their website. A quick search on Reddit or Google reveals the truth. Absolutely hopeless, no support and no customer service ethic at all. Total incompetence on every level. Avoid at all costs. After a week of waiting and being held hostage due to the $$$ they had taken from us we have now left the van and gone to a hotel. We I‚Äôll pursue Indie for a full refund and damages. BOYCOTT INDIE CAMPERS - DO NOT RISK YOUR MONEY TIME OR SANITY WITH THEM.

title: Dead battery, ruined experience and poor customer service
text:
Just before we left the pick up site we noticed that the oil light was on as there was no oil. This was then over filled so the oil light was on (and burning smell) the whole time.

Our Indie Camper had a dead battery (they told us it would last a few days, if not the whole trip as we were driving a long way without needing to be charged). We raised this issue on the support line to be told we just needed to charge it. We paid to stay at a campsite, charged it for 12 hours for it to be dead within an hour of it coming off charge again. This meant the water could not be used (including for washing up, toilet or shower as the pump wouldn't then work), the electricity in the van could not be used for obvious reasons. Bearing in mind a camper with a toilet/shower costs considerably more than a camper without, we got no use of this because of them not checking the battery. We paid an excess for a duvet set, for it to not include a duvet. We were in the mountains and very cold because of this the whole trip. They are not willing to give us a refund other than ¬£35 (which they have not actually given us), which is an insult given that a van without toilet/shower was considerably less (we're talking C. ¬£500 for the equivalent time), that we paid an additional campsite fee and generally found it quite stressful that this was not the experience we paid a lot of money for.

The person who greeted us at the end was nice, and they confirmed that the battery was dead and we would be adequately compensated. Instead, we have been told all we can get is ¬£35 back, they are not paying us this and are now ignoring all messages that we send them.

I would not book again with Indie Campers and suggest people book with caution.

title: Terrible - Indie cancelled our trip last minute
text: Terrible experience with Indie campers. Booked and paid in full for a campervan a month in advance for 5 people to collect from Manchester depot. 2 days before holiday we get email to say they have no van for 5 and as a ‚Äúgesture of goodwill‚Äù they will refund us. Left without camper, activities booked and non refundable campsites booked. Customer service extremely unhelpful to the point we were told ‚Äúthese things happen‚Äù. No compensation offered. Have booked before and experience was very good, but if they can cancel with 2 days notice I will certainly not book again and would not recommend.

title: Horrible Experience and Customer Service
text:
Let me start off by saying I don‚Äôt usually write reviews. The service provided by Indie Van was so atrocious that I felt the need. My wife and I rented a van in Las Vegas for a trip to Great Basin, Joshua Tree and Death Valley National Parks from April 1 through April 11. The overnight low temperature in Great Basin the first night was 17 degrees Fahrenheit. The heater failed to light. Needless to say, we were unprepared and had a very long and cold night. The next five nights were in the low forties, but we were able to purchase additional blankets to stay warm. The heater also supplied hot water for the van, so we had to heat water for dishes. We reported the problem and had a back-and-forth conversation via text messages that didn‚Äôt solve the problem. The next suggestion was to contact a repair person. We contacted the repair person. We found out that he could only give us a 3-to-4-hour window when he would show up, which would have cut into our vacation time. In addition to the waiting time, we would have had to pay the repair person a $300 fee. Indie Campers said they would have reimbursed the fee. At this point I didn‚Äôt have much faith in Indie Campers. In addition, to the heater not working the following other items were also a problem: overhead compartment hinge was held in place by 1 screw; All of the laminate on the counters, selves and shower door was peeling; The vents in the overhead compartment were held together by duct tape; The head rest on one of the back seats was broken, which made it uncomfortable to sit; When emptying the gray water the hose connection fell off the van making a mess; while trying to fix the heater, I found dirty socks in the seat; The provided kitchen set was so dirty that we had to wash it before using it.
For reimbursement for our troubles, I asked Indie to waive the additional mileage fee, the early check out fee and the late check in fee. We returned the van early, so the late check in fee wasn‚Äôt applicable. The total of the requests would have been approximately $500 for a rental that was over $2500. The local shop issued the mileage credit. Indie vans offered us $165 credit. That was the end of the conversation from them. We had planned to use Indie Van for a trip to Iceland. We cancel that rental, which would have been several thousand dollars of additional revenue for Indie Vans.

title: Avoid like the plague
text:
Don't go near this company!!
Worst rental experience ever. Everything looked great on the website, while booking and the follow up emails. Apart from no directions about how to get to the terminal. We thought it would become clear at the airport, but not at all. They could have told us it was a bus or expensive taxi journey. After finally getting there we had to wait for around an hour due to understaffing in the makeshift depot. Finally we got to see our campervan, and couln't believe that they could even offer it to someone since the interior was so old, worn and the seats torn up. They had no other vehicles to give us, and the only thing we could do was to spend a couple of hours on the phone to the useless helpline (sounded like it was in India) which did nothing to help and costed masses of money. Finally we got an email suggesting we could go and get the seats fixed and offering to help find somewhere to do it. That was of course not what we wanted to spend our holiday doing! They said we could not get a refund if we did not take the vehicle, so we had no choice but to take it, after many wasted hours. Within a few minutes of setting off a cupboard door fell off, and during our 10 day trip we discovered more and more things that were either broken or broke with the lightest touch. We had to buy strong tape and fix everything in order to be able to use it, including a bed frame that was missing slats and coming apart, blinds, seats and the key. The leaking water tank wasn't possible to fix, so we could not use the toilet or shower or have water for cooking. Luckily the engine worked and we managed to have our holiday, but all the stress and inconvenience caused is something that should be compensated. However Indie Campers do not answer emails and the chat on whatsapp that they tell you to use only works until they do not like what you are saying and do not answer anymore. Saying sorry for things does not fix them. This company is a complete nightmare and should not be allowed to operate!

title: Terrible Experience ‚Äì Booking Cancelled Without Notice and Zero Accountability
text:
Terrible Experience ‚Äì Booking Cancelled Without Notice and Zero Accountability

I had a relocation booking with Indie Campers (via Imoova), and on the day of pickup, I arrived at the agreed location‚Äîonly to be told there was no vehicle available. I spent over three hours trying to get answers from support, only to find out the booking had been cancelled the day before without any notification.

To make it worse, Indie Campers initially blamed Imoova, claiming they were responsible for the cancellation. But after looking into it and speaking with both sides, it became clear: the fault was entirely with Indie Campers. They had rented the van to someone else and failed to inform anyone or update the system, which still showed the booking as confirmed.

This careless handling of the situation ruined my entire trip. I had accommodation and travel plans built around this booking, all of which had to be cancelled last minute‚Äîat my expense. A simple refund doesn‚Äôt begin to cover the time lost, costs incurred, or stress caused.

I strongly advise against trusting Indie Campers. Their lack of communication, professionalism, and willingness to take responsibility is shocking. If you value your time and peace of mind, look elsewhere.

title: Avoid Indie Campers Las Vegas
text: Terrible experience. 4-hour pickup delay with no notice. Van was missing bedding, had one knife, a broken table, no dump hose, and no BBQ (which we paid for). Water and black tank connections were damaged‚Äîwe had to drive to a repair shop ourselves. Support was useless, only via WhatsApp, and falsely accused us of off-road driving. We‚Äôve submitted complaints, but so far, no response. Completely unprofessional. Avoid at all costs.

title: Such a terrible service!!
text:
I booked a camper to visit family for Cristmas me and two teenagers all paid up with extras. Turned up on the day no camper wanted to give us a two berth on a like it or lump it. You guys ripped me off so bad it‚Äôs not even funny Unprofessional, scammers , useless !!! So pissed!!!!
Ruined my family Christmas home to New Zealand last year, thought we were English first timers to NZ. Burnt us. Then extracted thousands out of my account for months after , freaking nightmare. Don‚Äôt go near them
So out of order

title: Please please avoid this company
text: I would strongly recommend that you avoid this company at all costs. We booked a pickup from Amsterdam, we paid for a out of hours pickup (8.30pm) which was 1.5hrs after our flight arrived which i'd hoped was enough. Our flight was delayed by 30mins and when we arrived in Schiphol airport, passport control was taking 40mins meaning it would be 9.00pm before we could pick up the camper. As soon as i arrived in Schiphol I contacted customer support and after waiting 24 mins for a response, they told me they had escalated the issue and closed the chat support. At 8.59 when we were in the taxi on the way from the airport, I received an email saying that as we hadn't collected our vehicle we would be charged a late collection fee and the depot was closed. I immediately contacted support again as we were 5 mins away - I never received a response. When we arrived the depot was closed but there was a telephone number which our taxi driver kindly rang due to language issues. To cut a long and convoluted story short, we had to pay the depot staff an additional ‚Ç¨100 on top of the late collection fee already paid to get the staff member to return. I fully appreciate we were 40mins late but we contacted support immediately to try to avoid any issues. When the staff member eventually returned and the additional money was paid, he was apologetic as he wasn't aware we'd contacted support (I was able to show him the email trail) and helpful but the condition of the van was substandard. It wasnt clean inside or out, the bedding and towels that we paid extra to rent were a shocking quality, the sheet provided was for a single not double, we had to hold the front blind together with tape, the bathroom door wouldn't close (a real issue when driving) and there are no words for the smell of stale urine in the bathroom. If we weren't completely reliant on the van as a means of transport, we wouldn't have taken it. Please save yourselves from the same pain and avoid.

title: The worst experience I've ever had in my life. They are a company of thieves and they just take money and run away. The
text: This is the worst company I've ever encountered in my life. They are a company of crooks. It takes them hours to bring the caravan and you'll ruin your day. And don't forget that the entire caravan parking lot is located in an industrial area with no place to drink water. No one even takes care of you until they bring the caravan. Half of the things are broken. And they told us, "Yes, we know. Take pictures of what's on your mind." After we returned the car, they said everything was fine. After a week, we received a charge of 1,300 euros and no one explains why. There's no one to talk to. They just charge and run away. Anyone interested in renting from them should stay away from them like fire if they don't want to get stolen. This company is a trash can. And as long as I can, I'll post this everywhere!!!!

title: Appalling company
text: Appalling company. Changed dates of our booking at short notice then are i contactable via webchat, telephone or web forms on their site. Unable to get a refund- they are a scam do not use

title: Scammers
text:
Scammers
Scam artists. It's a crap company. They mislead EN you that a camper is available and during DE check out they change the dates.. We found out after DE confirmation email. We respond within 24 hours, but it is impossible to change DE booking.. according to DE chatbot. Impossible to speak to someone of decency. not possible to change DE dates EN and/or book another camper. 1600 euros in the load EN we can no longer go on holiday.

title: A Scam
text:
We searched for a camper available from 1st to 4th August. It showed that there were 3 available, and one four berth that was 'the last one left'. So we booked that, continued through the process, only for after payment, seeing the dates had changed automatically on their system to 7th - 10th August. We obviously don't need the van for those dates. I screen recorded the process via my phone and it is very clear the booking system changed dates without our knowledge.
I have spent hours on to the customer service bot chat, only to be told we can have a 5% refund. Despite two things, firstly their system was at fault, and secondly, according to their terms, if you cancel between 30 and 8 days of booking you will get a 50% refund.
We want a full refund. I have looked through their system, and tried to talk with a decision maker. The entire process has felt like a scam.
Do NOT use this company.

title: I come here to expose bad professionalism and
text: I come here to expose the poor professionalism, lack of respect and lack of organization of this Enterprise. We contacted indie campers to purchase a campervan. After talking to the collaborator Tom√°s Martins and seeing some photographs we advanced with a cart that was in Porto (we were from Lisbon). The cart was in the mechanic, according to Tom√°s to make the replacement of the stove, the fridge and mentioned something with the belt that became very doubtful. We trusted Enterprise and proceeded with the signing of the contract and the payment of the cart without ever seeing it, only in photographs. When we wanted to raise it they said it would be between 15 to 20 business days, which they had never mentioned before the signing of the contract and the payment. We exchanged some emails and went to the facilities in Lisbon to deliver some papers (which apparently were missing) so that the whole process was faster. This was on the 22/7 and we had already made the transfer on the 11/7. After the exchange of emails there we were told by Tom√°s Martins and In√™s Monteiro that we could go pick up the cart to Porto on the 27/7 and was scheduled between 9-10h. That same day we arrived in the centre of Porto for a lifting to which the collaborator Jo√£o leit√£o (who was quite accessible) told us that he knew nothing and the cart was not clean. We asked to see the cart before cleaning and when we went looking for it, the cart wasn't even there, apparently it was still in the mechanic. It is a lack of respect on the part of the employees and the Enterprise in general when we made more than 600km in vain. We again send email with some requirements, namely that the cart be delivered practically to our door and that the indie campers make us the refund of the travel costs (gasoline and tolls).

title: VERY BAD EXPERIENCE
text:
üá™üá∏ Spanish:
‚ùå VERY BAD EXPERIENCE with Indie Campers: They canceled or exchanged my VW Grand California van for an unannounced lower model. After several complaints, they stopped responding and today, collection day, I still have no solution. Holiday ruined and no attention. I don't recommend it!

üá¨üáß English:
‚ùå VERY BAD EXPERIENCE with Indie Campers: They canceled or downgraded my VW Grand California to a lower model without warning. After several complaints, they stopped responding and today‚Äîpickup day‚ÄîI still have no resolution. Holidays ruined and zero customer support. Do NOT recommend.

title: Shameful customer service
text:
I rented a van for 4 people with 4 beds 2 months in advance. 9 days in advance, I receive a simple email to tell me that the van is no longer available and that another model is assigned to me. Except that there are only 2 beds!
This is where everything gets complicated. I try DE contact customer service (only available via a bot chat) for more information and to find another alternative. DE 5 days ago, I have been shuffling from counselor EN without additional information. No responsiveness, contradictory answers. It is horrible! It‚Äôs total uncertainty, I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm going to be able to leave with a van, I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm going to be able to be reimbursed.
To flee!!!!

title: Substandard vehicle, no roadside assistance.
text: We rented a class C motor home that had multiple problems. The license tabs were expired, the battery would not hold a charge, the refrigerator didn‚Äôt work and the bathroom leaked. These were just the major items, molding was coming off the walls, the table wouldn‚Äôt stay latched and the suspension was shot. When I attempted to contact someone, I got a call center in India, and they gave me a WhatsApp number that was invalid. I tried to call the office where we picked up the vehicle, no one answered and their voicemail was full. I texted that number and got a response two days later telling me among other things, that unless the vehicle was parked on level ground, the refrigerator wouldn‚Äôt work. They referred me to the road trip support, but did not provide a number. Having already called the support number on my contract and getting the call center in India, I did not pursue any further contact. We returned the vehicle early due to the multiple issues. When we dropped off the vehicle, the staff were overwhelmed and there was no supervisor on site. Those working there were very sympathetic and apologized for the inconveniences we experienced, they could do little to provide any meaningful compensation. I would not recommend this company to anyone and would caution anyone considering using this company to do a thorough review of the vehicle and not wait until you are on the road check things like batteries, refrigerators, tabs, and overall condition of the RV.

title: DEPOSIT SCAM - 2,000 euros still not returned
text: Rent a full month of a van at the agency DE Paris. Vehicle medium clean but if you say so you cannot leave with the vehicle. Several breakdowns EN DE route but you cannot say otherwise your vehicle return cannot be finalized. In the end, I have been trying DE recover the 2000 euros deposit collected as soon as the vehicle keys are handed over. FUYEZ

title: Scandalous! To flee!!!
text:
Scandalous!!
A van degeulasse (sala, a forgotten EN device in the sink, chewing gum stuck on the sheets...), we had to change at the last minute because the one we had to have had a bed that did not hold. This caused an administrative problem (registration of the new van on their platform) which led to 3 hours waiting in the parking lot before DE allowed us to leave!
Once gone the fridge never worked!! After hundreds DE watsaps (the only way DE contact them) where we were told DE review the video, turn off and on 20 times the fridge, DE stop in a DE van repairman)... so enormous DE stress, energy and DE wasted time. When we send them a certificate saying that the repairer finds that the fridge is set HS they ask us for a 2 review and send us an address on our itinerary. We take a detour and we find ourselves in front of a closed shop. Indiecampers advise us DE return to our original point so that they can see what they can do. Which is 500km DE where we are and will ruin our holiday even more...
We decided to shorten our trip and DE return the campervan earlier than planned but they refused DE refund or DE compensation!

To flee!! Vehicles are rotten and after-rental service catastrophic!!! No solution is proposed except to fend for themselves

title: Avoid using this company
text:
This company are now too big and dont enough staff to manage the demand. Checkin and checkout process is chaotic. They get you to do the survey before collecting the van, van was dirty and I needed to clean it, especially bathroom area. We discovered the compressor was missing from the van- thankfully we didn't have a puncture out on the road. Window blind on front was broken. We had to add adblue just after picking up the van as the warning light came on. No blocks for leveling the van when parked. No plug adapters (needed 2 pin adapters for sockets). No fire extinguisher. We purchased an additional gas canister before we left as you don't know how full the one they give you is. We were told it was cheaper to do it this way and would receive a refund if we didn't use it, quite a different story when you drop off- they don't refund!!! We had to pull our car into the yard at checkout and immediately got a puncture from a nail in the yard. Offered absolutely no help whatsoever, did the online checkout and were told to move, we couldn't go anywhere with a completely flat tyre and absolutely no help. Management hiding behind company policy. ZERO customer care!!!!! Failed on every level!!!!!!
Good luck getting help from customer service if you need it's non-existent, they do everything to avoid helping.

title: THE WORST COMPANY EVER!
text:
THE WORST COMPANY EVER!
We booked camper for 12 days and on day 3 the motor broke. We tried to contact the 24/7 support several times and no-one respond to us. So after 2 days of waiting we needed to drive back to the pick-up center with broken car. After hours of waiting we got a hotel and the information that we are getting a new car the next day. So we lost three days on this... If we wouldn't have driven back, the customer support would not help us at all. After this everything went okay.

BUTTTTTT the 2000‚Ç¨ deposit that we did before the rental two months ago we still haven't got it back. We have tried to contact the customer support 10++ times and sometimes they don't answer and sometimes they reply that they try to figure it out and are getting back to me but they never do. We needed to contact police about this. This company doesn't care about their customers..

PLEASE if you want to have carefree holiday and save your money from this scam.
DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!

They're scammers. We were charged 650 euros after we had checked out and everything was OK. They sent us an e-mail two days later reporting alleged damage involving a payment in that amount. We've tried to get in touch with them. Nobody answers. They steal the money. I DON'T RECOMMEND IT.

Worst company I have ever dealt with. Changed my booked a couple of days before booking. I could not accept the vehicle they were offering me because of where I was traveling. Would not give me anything kind of refund or response. STOLE MY MONEY. Never rent anything from this company

title: Terrible experience
text:
This is one of the worst companies I have dealt with and their customer services is non existent with it being impossible to speak to anyone.
when we dropped out van back we were told there was no damage to the vehicle and no additional charges but 12 days after that we had over ¬£1000 taken off our credit card for a scuff to the wheel arch. the photo that shows the damage has the vehicle in a different position than when I returned it and there is no way to determine when the photo was taken or when the damage occurred because it wasn't raised at check in.

We also had several issues with the van, including being 2 hours late getting it because they first tried to check us in to a van with a huge crack in the windscreen that they hadn't noticed. when we did finally get a van and drove off the passenger wing mirror was so loose it moved out of position in the wind so someone had to hang out of the window and move it back before you could change lanes and eventually it fell off when we went over a bump. my husband had to buy a set of tools to fix it which we have not been reimbursed for yet.

When we got to our first campsite we noticed the van was full of ants and it hadn't been cleaned from the precious renters as they had left a lot of their stuff in the cupboards, the generator and the battery didn't work so we had no AC or fridge and later in the trip a knob for the roof vent fell off and cut my husbands head.

I am trying to get someone from Indie Campers to get back to me about a refund for the damages and to discuss all the issues we had.

do not use this company, there is no transparency with their policies and lots of hidden extras. the premium insurance was supposed to protect us from getting a large bill but it doesn't cover a large part of the vehicle so it pretty much useless.

If a company doesn't have a phone number for customer services its not sign of a good company.

title: Not to rent at Indie campers
text:
To flee at all costs!! Very bad experience with Indiecampers!

We rented a van for a week. When we came to collect it, we were told that the engine light was on.
We refused to take it as it is, because it seemed too dangerous and, above all, not compliant: we pay to receive a maintained and serviceable van.

No solution was offered to us in exchange, as the other vans or motorhomes were either damaged or already booked.
We therefore ask for a refund, as we cannot have the rented van or another vehicle.

The Toulouse agency manager is unable to do anything, because Indiecampers is an international agency that only communicates via chat.
We stay 4 hours in the agency trying to find a contact: it is almost impossible.
We finally decide to leave the agency, and manage to get someone via the chat, who explains that the refund is refused, because we ‚Äúrefused‚Äù to get a working van back.

Yes, he was driving... but with an engine light on, an inside table missing and a broken drawer!

Since then, we have been in battle with them for our money back.
We called on legal aid, which we agree with: French law requires that when renting a van, it must be delivered in good working order ‚Äî without an engine light or other defect.

They are trying to swindle us.
In addition to ruining all our holidays out of unprofessionalism, they steal our money.

We still hope that they will find some humanity in them to pay us back, without any legal pressure being necessary.

title: They're fraudsters, they don't pay attention, they steal the deposits
text: It's the worst company I've ever traveled with. Please refrain from thinking about contracting with these thieves. You haven't.

To begin with Indie Campers does not have a physical structure at the moment to serve its customers. Second, I rented a model and got another inferior and until now I haven't been repaid. They charged 342,00 euros for a scratch in the toldo that is working normally even though it has premium insurance. You don't have access to anyone to talk to. A robbery. Don't come in. Fujam.

title: UnSafe Vehicle, Don‚Äôt waste your Money!
text:
UnSafe Vehicle, Don‚Äôt waste your Money!
Customer Service Phone Number they give you to call if you have any problems with your rental Doesn‚Äôt Even Work, call it for yourselves
At (855) 661-3485.

Rented this van out of the Las Vegas store on July 14th, 2025.
The company has no concern for its customers safety or its customers time.
We waited for over 1 1/2 hours to pick up our camper van, even though everything had been completed online prior to us arriving, they acted surprised and didn‚Äôt even seem prepared to help us.
Jennifer the manager was still working with customers on a 10:00 rental when we arrived for our scheduled 11:30 time. Other customers in the waiting area were complaining and it seems that they were switching vans due to issues they had, this should have been our first Warning.
Not exaggerating, I can‚Äôt make this stuff up these are all of the documented problems that we had.
1. Van was dirty inside and out, still had some personal items in it from the previous renter.
2. Loose wires hanging down under van, Indie employee had to duct tape them back up prior to me leaving on my trip.
3. Roof top tent had rips in the canvas and tears in the screen windows.
4.. Zipper for side door screen door was broken.
5. Bathroom door would not close.
6. Dirty pink liquid was found under sink cabinet.
7. Over all the interior showed excessive wear.
9. Smoke Detector kept going off, but was not due to low battery.
10. Vibration at highway speeds, maybe due to tires being out of balance.
11. Heavy pulsating when braking, possibly due to warped over heated brake rotors.
12. Wiper Blades, rubber falling off and ripped on passenger side.
13. Light on dash, Change Oil Required.
Tried to call Customer Service, but the number does not work.
Tried to use the WhatApp to communicate with Indie Campers, only to receive AI generated responses.
No Help Is Coming From Indie Campers‚Ä¶You Are On Your Own!
We had to drive over 2 hours back to Indie in Las Vegas to Switch out to another van. Second van had problems but was in better condition.
OVER ALL it was a Negative Experience and I would not recommend dealing with Indie Campers. I‚Äôm surprised that they are still in business. Lack of regular maintenance on the vehicle we had could have resulted in a serious unsafe situation while driving through the mountains.
Only positive was from employees Curtis and Tony who are super stars. I believe that they tried to help make the situation better. The manager Jennifer said that she has no power to make changes or to offer any assistance with credits towards our rental, claims we need to message Indie Campers Directly through the WhatsApp.
A branch manager who has no power to solve customer problems or complaints seems like another bad business practice.
Good Luck if you choose to rent from Indie Campers‚Ä¶Remember that
YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

title: Short term rental
text:
I booked for the second year in a row because we had enjoyed it ... we rented the camper for a week, when we picked it up in the heat we did not check the internal condition.
When we got home the van was full of ants and badly cleaned.
We were told it had been spotlessly cleaned and during our cleaning we found documents cards of the old tenants.
Invaded by ants we thought to remove our luggage not bothering to make videos but just a few photos.
In addition to losing the booked trip we also lost the rent of the camper.
Never again Indie Camper!!!
Problems relating to operators who speak Italian, unknown language.

title: HAVE YOU BEEN CHEATED?
text:
Complaint about Indie Campers?!! ‚Äì Who was cheated here?

Once you get closer to the reviews of this company (which you usually don't when booking), you will eventually come across a large number of dissatisfied and - as hundreds of customers now claim - FRAUDULENT CUSTOMERS. And these customers apparently all have the same concern: You feel ‚Äúcheated‚Äù by the company Indie-Campers! ‚Äì What kind of crook is this? Let‚Äôs look into it ...and get our money back?!

I, too, have had corresponding experiences
[and if a lawyer of the company wants to delete this post: these facts (claims) can all be substantiated and proven by documents].

In July 2025 I booked a camper there. And then the theater started:
To date, I have not received a confirmation, nor can the company be reached by phone. ‚Äì Read what customers complain about in rows on the Internet: THE COMPANY IS NO LONGER (or only with a long delay!) after transferring your money, but also on the road when you have a breakdown. ACCESSIBLE AND THE MONEY IS GONE!!
Customers who break down with their carts, some of which are in poor condition, on the road and then do not get help [All readable in the reviews on the Internet.]

I, too, have not received any response to my many requests via different communication channels and with the request for feedback or refund. ES is simply not responding. THE COMPANY INDIE-CAMPERS simply evades its responsibility and DIVES. ‚Äì I guess: the money is collected, the money is gone, and the service is not provided.

But also the booking process needs extreme caution!!! ‚Äì I have booked and before I could confirm the payment, the booking process was aborted. Then I booked again, and then afterwards found that there were two debits. So I paid twice for the booking, but now I have no way to get a refund. What do you call it? Rip-off? Cheating?

In the meantime, I have written to the owner, Hugo Oliveira, in Portugal, but I have not received a reply from there either.

Warning:
This company pretends to be a car rental company (similar to Avis, Europcar, Hertz or Sixt), takes the booking and payment, so collects the money from the customer ... and then disappears. Anyone who bothers to read the terms and conditions will find confirmation: Money gone, company evades responsibility and is not available. And on top of that, there is no immediate booking confirmation.

On the internet I came across a petition that apparently about 350 defrauded customers have already signed. ‚Äì Take a look at ‚ÄúStop the Indie campers company scams‚Äù.

Well, if hundreds of customers are bothering to start a petition, then there must be a bigger scam behind it, isn't there!? Well, JA apparently I was wonderfully ripped off and cheated.

But giving up is not an option! This is going to be a hot fight now... because I'm not willing to just put up with it. If you want to join me, please contact Telegram or Doc Wolf on WhatsApp under DocWolfR

What opportunities do I/we have? ‚Äì We will see. DA comes to me every day with new ideas and I am sure to find a way to stop this company (public prosecutor, tax authorities, EU authorities, unmasking PayPal and other payment services, Wikipedia and last but not least a flood of reviews on the internet). For the sake of European consumer ES, it seems to me urgent that such firms should be closed by the authorities and that money intermediaries should exclude them from payment transactions. Otherwise, the hard-earned holiday pay is gone from many others ... and those already injured remain sitting on their disappointment. Whether I/we can achieve this and get compensation for our damage from the bankruptcy estate of the company Indie-Campers will be seen. But I'm hopeful.

So if you are a victim yourself and want to join my initiative, please contact us.

title: NIGHTMARE TRAVEL SCAM!!
text: UNACCEPTABLE ! We hired a van from indiecampers and after driving 20 minutes the car stopped because of a problem with the battery adapter. We were stranded on the side of the road at night for two hours with 2 kids in the van talking in circle with their chatbot with no assistance offered. The van was towed and we were offered no refund for this trip cancelled on day one and no compensation for our ruined holiday. We even went back to the pick up depot just so we could speak to humans about our experience and ensure we would get a refund but they denied all responsibility and explained they can‚Äôt even get on the phone with the customer service and even they only have access through the chatbot!! A NIGHTMARE!!
