On top of that we booked our trip to the Orly airport because they put it on the website as a pick up option only to find out once there that it is not a pick up point and we have to make our way to Charles de Gaulle after an hour on the chatbot. There is no way to speak to a human being! INDIECAMPERS PLEASE RESPOND TO OUR MANY EMAILS AND MESSAGES THIS IS NO WAY TO TREAT PAYING CUSTOMERS!!

title: DO NOT USE THESE GUYS!
text:
DO NOT USE THESE GUYS!
We cancelled our motorhome hire approximately 4 months before the booking. According to their own policy, this entitled us to a full refund of the deposit paid within 10-15 days. Despite at least a dozen chats/emails requesting the refund, a month later we are still waiting!

Scammers, they robbed us for ¬£1600 as a part of the van fell off. It was glued underneath and was obviously something they do. Then when I went to protest they have ignored me with not 1 reply. Real Scammers!!

I'm extremely disappointed with the customer service from this camper rental company. Despite returning the vehicle on time and in good condition, I was treated with a complete lack of respect and professionalism. The staff were dismissive, unhelpful, and made no effort to address my concerns.

To make matters worse, I have yet to receive the return of my security deposit‚Äîa substantial amount of money. There has been no clear explanation or justification provided, and any attempts to get clarity have been met with vague responses or complete silence. They have not been able to clearly identify any issue on their end that would warrant withholding the deposit.

This level of disregard for customers is unacceptable‚Äîespecially in an industry that should be built on transparency and trust. I would strongly advise others to think twice before renting from this company if they value clear communication, accountability, and basic customer service

title: Do not hire from indie Campers!
text:
DO NOT HIRE FROM INDIE CAMPERS! The whole company is a con and a money grab!

Me and my partner hired a vehicle which subsequently had a non functioning fuel gage followed by a continuous fuel leak. On trip support wanted us to pay to get this fixed, even though we paid for premium insurance and roadside assistance. They then suggested we drive the vehicle, where I highlighted this is unsafe to myself, other road users and drivers, due to fire risk, and for a company to reccomend driving an unsafe vehicle is crazy! After 22 hours they finally organised a tow truck, however the tow only removed the vehicle and wasnt organised to drop us off anywhere so we where left us on the side of the road, in the rain with all of our belongings. We then had to pay out of pocket for the trains and ubers to get to the closest Indie Camper Depot as on trip support claimed they could not assist us to get there.
We eventually got a replacement van, and within 24 hours noticed that the battery on this van was not effective, and the control panel could not accurately show the level of battery left. Five days later, the water pump in our van, which powers the taps and shower broke meaning we could no longer use these products within the van. After contacting customer support we were told that although we had paid for roadside assistance, and were located in a major city with multiple connections at the time, they could not provide this to us, and we would need to pay for the repairs ourselves! They claim they will reimburse you for these things within 5 days, yet we are yet to be reimbursed for the costs of the original break down and thus were unwilling to pay for repairs on this empty promise. On trip support did not then come back with other options to assist us, even thought we again had premium insurance to cover breakages within the van!

I have raised multiple complaints with Indie Campers and have recieved nothing from them, nor any form of compensation even though you pay a fortune to rent camper vans from them!

title: Indie Camper San Francisco
text:
DO NOT USE INDIE CAMPERS! 24 hours before we were to pick up our vehicle Indie Campers emailed to say the vehicle we reserved was not available and that they have given us an upgrade to a full sized RV. Unfortunately, many of the campsites we reserved for our trip had vehicle size restrictions. We reserved a Van, they wanted us to take a full RV.

We asked if they had other smaller vehicles, but they didn‚Äôt. Their solution was that we pick up a vehicle 400 miles away in the opposite direction of our destination. When we said we had reservations for backpacking trails that we could not reschedule, they said they couldn‚Äôt help us further.

They have refused to give a refund despite our calls. The call center is a third party and has no ability to issue refunds. All other communications are via email where we get stock responses reiterating that per our reservation a refund is not possible because an upgrade was offered.

DO NOT USE INDIE CAMPERS! Read all of their negative reviews on Reddit, Google and Trip Advisor first. I wish I would have.

This review is for the San Francisco Location.

title: ATTENTION TO YOUR CREDIT CARD
text:
I rented a camper back in 2023, I avoid telling what happened to me, but I would like to let you know that after 2 years I received a charge tonight at 4.25 on my credit card of ‚Ç¨ 25.00.
They can even clone your credit card.
Unable to contact where I rented the camper number permanently occupied. I can't find any numbers or emails to contact.
I'll be forced to block the card.
SHAMEFUL

title: Don't book with this company
text: Customer support is genuinely horrific. Like, absolutely non existent. I left my purse in a van and thankfully realised while within a 30min taxi ride to the depot. While on the way back, I contacted customer support and asked for the depots phone number so I could contact them and ask them to keep the purse safe. Indie campers didn't respond for 7 hours and when they finally did they told me that they "couldn't share that information". I was gobsmacked. Apparently my only option was to accept that my purse (with ID, credit and debit cards inside) was gone forever. Thankfully we were near to the depot and could return and get it without any issues. All staff in the actual depots seem friendly but the online support is actually terrifying. For a company that heavily markets its 24/7 support they are sadly lacking. My partner and i tried to use the support chat 4 times on our trip overall and we realised afterwards that we never once actually received any help or resolutions for a single query. Incredibly frustrating.

title: STAY AWAY PEOPLE!!!
text: We are a small business who use to cooperate with Indie Campers. A small advice to all businesses like ours. Stay away, they won't help you if you have a problem with hirer, they won't do checks on hirer for you and won't share details about them. On the end of the hire they won't pay for the hire or they will pay some ridiculous amount like ¬£71 for a week of hire. No chance to contact customers service! STAY AWAY PEOPLE!!!

We booked a campervan to shoot in Norway, and at the time of having to pay the balance, the site did not allow us to complete the payment.
customer service (chat with untrained operators and only front) kept making sure that they were handling it, but in parallel we received emails threatening that they would cancel the reservation and keep the deposit.
After having managed, with great difficulty, to get DA customer support to call us, and requesting to cancel the reservation and get the deposit back, they also managed to make the refund transfer to a different DA IBAN.

I can't judge the means, maybe they are well kept, but in terms of customer service I am extremely dissatisfied, and considering that I was renting a means of transport, I am happy that I was able to cancel the reservation as the risk of being left on foot without any assistance is not acceptable.

title: Edinburgh Indie Campers
text:
They didn‚Äôt not inform us about a security deposit that is very large. There was no prior information about this.

They took 3 hrs to get us our van.

The van was great but the company not so much.

title: Stay away!!!
text:
Stay away!!!
I felt like the company was looking for every possible way to charge me extra when returning the van. Terrible service and a very frustrating experience.

title: Do NOT use this company
text:
‚≠ê 1-Star Review: Avoid Indie Campers ‚Äî Unsafe, Unhygienic, and Zero Support
I don‚Äôt usually leave reviews, but after our horrific experience with Indie Campers, I feel it‚Äôs necessary to warn others.

We rented a campervan from their Manchester location for Glastonbury 2025 and paid a premium, expecting a reliable, comfortable setup. What we got instead was a dangerously faulty, poorly maintained van and zero real-time support when things went wrong.

Key issues we encountered:

Leaking Toilet: From day one, the toilet leaked urine into the van. The bathroom seal was broken and the waste cassette was already full, which meant urine was seeping into the main living space and even toward the driver‚Äôs seat. The stench was awful and persisted for the entire trip.

Steering Issues: The vehicle constantly veered to the right and felt unstable at speed. Driving was stressful and dangerous.

Fridge/Freezer Failure: The fridge/freezer turned off randomly, spoiling all the groceries we‚Äôd brought for the week. We spent hundreds of pounds replacing food.

Interior Door Wouldn‚Äôt Lock: We were unable to lock the campervan from the inside. At a crowded festival with known theft problems, this was a major safety concern.

Broken Control Panel: The electric panel didn‚Äôt work, so we had no idea how much water or gas we had. We had to guess everything.

Cigarette Smoke Smell: The interior reeked of old smoke. As non-smokers, this was unpleasant and made sleeping in the van very uncomfortable.

Dashboard Damage: The dashboard was cracked and made the entire vehicle feel neglected and uncared for.

Non-UK Plug Sockets: The van had European outlets despite being rented in the UK. No adapters were included or even mentioned.

Missing Levelling Blocks: Without these, the van was on a tilt the whole trip, affecting sleep and comfort.

Broken Awning: We were warned to be ‚Äúcareful‚Äù with the awning, but upon inspection, it was just broken and unusable.

Blinds Malfunctioning: The blinds above the rear bed didn‚Äôt stay down, popping up at night and disturbing sleep.

No Working Sat Nav or Parking Sensors: The sat nav was completely broken and no alternative was offered. The van also lacked working parking sensors, making it harder to drive safely.

Customer service was shockingly poor. When we called for help, we were directed to a clunky online chat system where responses were delayed, disconnected, or completely unhelpful. At drop-off, the staff offered no support and again sent us back to the same system.

We submitted a detailed written complaint with photos and were promised a resolution within 2 days. We have been told after 2 weeks that they will get back to us with some 'feedback'.

Do not use Indie Campers. This was not just a bad experience ‚Äî it was a health hazard, a safety risk, and an expensive mistake. They should not be renting vehicles in this condition.

title: Avoid indiecamper at all costs
text:
Indie Camper is an absolute scam, go for literally any other company. First of all we booked an Indiecamper for the Dolomites in Italy and we were so excited. The day before they tell us our van we booked is available but a free upgrade had been offered. Except the free upgrade was a bigger, less menovourable, and poorly renevated older model than what we booked, and we couldnt do anythint about it or we wouldnt have a van for our trip. This van was particularly hard in Italy as roads are so small, hence why we booked the smaller van. Also ABSOLUTELY NOTHING is included in the van, you want sheets 80 euro, you want gas cannister, 80 euros, chairs = euros. These are basic things that should be included in a van rental but they want to bleed you dry. Also the van is very cheaply rennovated, most things are made of cheap plastic, drains are very slow to drain, stuff like that.
We also had a small incident in the van, I reversed into a tree stumped and cracked the bumper. Which wouldnt have happened in the smaller van we originally booked, ALSO no reverse censor or camera on this van. We did everything we could, gave them every single detail about the experience as soon as it happened (nearly 5 days before return). The bumper was only external plastic which could be replaced by myself within 2 hours (I dont have any mechanical experience) but they demanded at drop off that I pay 1600 euros, as that the bumper crack was identified on drop off, even the staff member at the drop off apologised prefusely for the price and said to email the company.
When I went to email them they just responded basically with suck it up, you signed the contract we can charge whatever and not show you the pricing calculator.
Go with literally any other camper, Roadsurfer looks much better
Disaster. One intern handling 10 customers. Hours of waiting. Incompetent and unprofessional. Never use them. Not a serious business.

title: RUN!!! Do NOT rent from them!!
text:
We need a NO STAR option!
**Do NOT use Indie Campers.**
We expected a 5-star family RV trip and instead got the most stressful, expensive travel experience ever.

Here‚Äôs what we faced:

* Our first RV broke down‚Äîwindow snapped mid-drive in 113¬∞ heat, and the generator kept shutting off.
* We couldn‚Äôt sleep in it for 3 of the 4 days and had to get a hotel for our kids and senior mom.
* Took 12+ hours to get a ‚Äúsolution‚Äù: painter‚Äôs tape over the broken window.
* Replacement RV had broken parts too‚Äîand no gas (we had to spend $100 more).

Despite everything (including $2K+ out of pocket), their ‚Äúresolution‚Äù after weeks of follow-up was a $65 refund and a 5% discount for a future booking. Laughable.

On top of that:

* Both LA and Vegas pickup locations were messy and unprofessional
* Staff were in casual clothes, juggling multiple roles and looked like drug attacks that just paroled
* Vehicles weren‚Äôt clean
* Zero real support for new RV renters
* Inconsistent processes and communication between locations

Friendly staff onsite staff but can‚Äôt fix broken systems. The customer service runaround (especially via WhatsApp) was unacceptable. Don't get me started with the email chain

Final upfront cost: $4,000+ for 4 days of chaos.
Indie Campers is a joke and should be shut down in the US. Rent at your own risk.

title: Would not recommend
text: When we went to pick up the van in SFO the place was a complete dump. Example: random nails all over the floor, etc. I was in shock. Then they didn't have my bedding that I paid extra for.. told me I would have to go buy some and they would refund me. They never did. In fact, they ended up charging me extra and changing my invoice without any explanation. I tried following up with them and there was no response. I've now disputed it with my cc company. Also, the van itself kept giving me urgent error issues while driving, and the company just said it was for "unknown reasons but it was fine". Not very reassuring to drive around the mountains with your van telling you the brakes are giving out, etc.

title: No compensation, no accountability.
text: Waited 2.5+ hours for our "early pickup" in Keflav√≠k ‚Äì Indie Campers refused to refund the ‚Ç¨222 fee. Paid extra for chairs, table & bedding, which were not provided. Van had check engine light on and cabinet doors falling off. No compensation, no accountability. Worst part of our Iceland trip. Avoid.

title: Never indie campers again! Very bad company
text: Do yourself a favor and don't book an indie camper. Lockanhebote on the website that never stay in life in the end so. Non-transparent pricing policy, extra fees at the end of several hundred euros and in the end the more ‚Äúexpensive‚Äù offer from the competition would have been cheaper and you would have reasonable people towards instead of anonymous unreachable chat support staff who do not get back to you after several hours. I had got the wrong vehicle upstairs without shower and toilet which made the whole holiday more stressful and complicated

title: Horrendous experience AVOID!!
text:
Absolutely Awful Experience ‚Äì Avoid Indie Campers at All Costs

We hired a campervan from Indie Campers for Glastonbury, expecting a bit of luxury‚Äîthings like a working fridge, a shower, and the ability to charge our devices. What we got instead was a catalogue of problems that completely ruined the experience and made the price tag feel like a joke.

The van itself was riddled with issues:
‚Ä¢ The fridge barely worked‚Äîit would randomly power off, leaving food and drinks spoiled.
‚Ä¢ The toilet leaked inside the van, making it unhygienic and unpleasant.
‚Ä¢ European plug sockets in a UK vehicle (picked up in the UK!), so we couldn‚Äôt even charge devices without adapters.
‚Ä¢ No levelling blocks, no awning, and a built-in sat nav that didn‚Äôt work.
‚Ä¢ Parking sensors were non-functional and the steering constantly pulled to the right, making driving stressful and potentially unsafe.
‚Ä¢ The interior control panel didn‚Äôt link up with the systems, so we had no idea when things were full or empty.
‚Ä¢ Several blinds inside the van were broken, compromising privacy and comfort.

We raised all of these issues multiple times with customer service‚Äîand received absolutely nothing in return. The only communication channel is an unresponsive online chat. No acknowledgment. No effort to fix things. No offer of a refund or compensation. The staff at both pick-up and drop-off admitted they‚Äôd only been working there for two weeks‚Äîfurther evidence of the high staff turnover and poor internal operations.

Indie Campers clearly don‚Äôt care about their customers once they‚Äôve taken your money. We feel completely ripped off and let down.

We‚Äôre actively warning friends, family, and fellow travellers to stay well away from this company. No one should experience this level of service, negligence, and sheer lack of accountability.

Avoid at all costs. Indie Campers are money-grabbing cowboys.

title: Poor company.
text:
Avoid this company. Happy to take your money, but very poor.

Fridge freezer didn‚Äôt work. Ac worked at one level. Heating in cab didn‚Äôt work. Water heater didn‚Äôt work. Try to tell them on their site, but all indian people. AVOID!

title: ATTENTION! SCAMMERS
text: A scam directly, malfunctions vehicles and invents damages later to charge you money. A disgrace

title: Society to flee
text:
It's a disaster. We should have read the reviews before renting from them. Like idiots we read the comments on their site when we should have read those of others.
For this price: no one comes to meet you at the airport (cost of 40 euros X 2), a camper in bad condition (no handbrake, impossibility to close the door of the camper from the outside so have to go through the front for the one who closes from the inside, very poor condition with lacerated seats, no glasses, light equipment, ...). Anyway, it's a scam for 3,000 euros for seven days. And then, a Support Service does not exist (it is an AI-managed sculpin with no way to have a human). The agency in Iceland is unreachable. 5h wait because demanded the repair of the handbrake and to be able to close the door of the camper van. In short, we had the chance to meet these worries immediately (but we were told that we had to accept because no other solution) because we are pitying those who have a problem on the way. And then, to close it all off, nothing is clear so we took two kits instead of one. No refund after 10 days ... Anyway, it's to flee.
It's a shame because Iceland by motorhome is a very good option.
Photos can be provided upon request.

title: Truly shocking customer service
text:
Truly shocking customer service and they do not care one bit. The majority (if not all) the 5star reviews are clearly fake as they come from people doing their first ever review and say very little ‚Ä¶more than suspicious. I had the same experience as lots of the GENUINE reviewers on here.
Was told day before campervan not available anymore. Alternative was provided but was massive and too big for us to go where we intended to. Loads of stuff not working (ie fridge) and spent days trying to resolve with customer services waiting 24hrs for each response which just gave us info we had found already on Google (turn off turn on!). We‚Äôre told to go to a campsite to try plug into mains. Miles out of our way and had to pay to stay overnight (even though we had no intention of doing so) only to find we had been provided with the wrong hook up lead that does not work in Portugal. Had to drive miles again to try and find an adapter but no joy. Had to buy cool boxes and then ice every morning to keep things cool but didn‚Äôt really work. So much time lost on our break and so much extra expense. Bedding old, disgusting and completely the wrong size covers and pillowcases provided which were of no use at all and we paid extra for these. Same for the gas bottle that didn‚Äôt work.
All in all an incredibly disappointing trip ruined by the campervans issues.
Then made a complaint only to be told they‚Äôll make sure it doesn‚Äôt happen again for next customer. Raised complaint and now I‚Äôm being completely ignored. Emailed multiple times by nothing. Tried the live chat on the website where is says the wait is 1-3 minutes but after over an hour still nothing. Tried the Facebook page and Messenger but again completely ignore you.
My first trip for 5 years after dialysis and kidney transplant; Truly shocking and incredibly frustrating experience.
I‚Äôm not going to give up so will update with any further information.

title: AVOID INDIE CAMPERS AT ALL COST.
text:
On the surface, our campervan from Indie Campers appeared fine at pick-up‚Äîuntil we opened the door and were hit by an overpowering smell of cigarette smoke. Things only went downhill from there.

Despite having a pre-booked time, we waited over an hour in the office while just two staff members scrambled to onboard everyone. Surprisingly, basic kitchen essentials like utensils, plates, and pans weren‚Äôt stocked in the vans in advance. Instead, the staff had to manually restock each one during handover, a bizarre and inefficient process that delayed everyone even further.

Our van came with a long list of issues. We were told upfront that the dashboard glass was cracked, the gas/water level sensor didn‚Äôt work, and we weren‚Äôt to use the awning. Not exactly reassuring, but unfortunately, that was just the beginning.

The vehicle had a mechanical issue‚Äîit veered to the right while driving. Once parked, we switched the fridge to gas mode and discovered it would only stay on for an hour before shutting off. This went on for six days, spoiling all our food despite our best efforts.

Worse still, the toilet leaked from the first use on day one. It wasn‚Äôt full‚Äîthe seal around the compartment was clearly worn down, and waste seeped through, creating an unsanitary nightmare. You can only imagine.

The online chat support was frustrating and ineffective. We had to re-explain our problems repeatedly, with no real help or the option to speak to an actual person. By the time we returned the van and explained everything to the team at drop-off, we were simply referred back to the same broken support system. No apology, no resolution, and certainly no mention of compensation.

We left feeling completely unheard and deeply disappointed. Indie Campers failed on every level‚Äîcustomer service, vehicle maintenance, and accountability. Travelling in a campervan is meant to be a joyful experience. Unfortunately, this was anything but.

To top it all off, I submitted a formal complaint well over a week ago and have still heard nothing back‚Äînot even an acknowledgement. At this point, I don‚Äôt expect one.

I‚Äôll be steering well clear of this company in the future and warning others to do the same. We've had brilliant experiences with SwiftGo in Stockport, so it‚Äôs a real shame to have such a disappointing contrast here. Indie Campers has completely failed on quality, service, and accountability.

title: Poor communication, refused to reimburse us
text:
Indie campers were rude, poor communication, refused to reimburse us for the tyres blowing despite the tyres being from 2012 so over 10 years old which is highly unsafe. The only way to contact them is via their online chat or WhatsApp but they take ages to reply. When your broken down on the side of an interstate road in the USA at 5pm at night its really scary to not have communication back from them. Especially when we have UK numbers so our phones wouldnt let us call USA numbers for a rescue.
The RV it self had duct tape on bits of the walls. No cover to put over the driving bit so people could see straight into the RV.
When we picked up the RV it barely had enough petrol to get us to the petrol station.
We will never hire an RV from Indie Campers again and will be advising others to stay away too.

title: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY. IT IS A SCAM
text:
WARNING!! THIS COMPANY IS A SCAM. DO NOT RENT FROM THEM!!
Their business model is based on providing insurance that does not cover any incidents, not informing you on the conditions, and then charging as much as possible to your credit card. Making ridiculous charges way above the maximum liability.
Then impossible to reach their customer support. Incredibly poor customer service.
GOOGLE INDIE CAMPERS AND YOU WILL FIND HUNDRERDS OF PEOPLE WITH SIMILAR EXPERIENCES THAT HAS BEEN VICTIMS. CANNOT STRESS ENOUGH NOT TO USE THIS COMPANY!!
Even with their premium insurance they don't cover any damage and they will.find a way to charge ludicrous amount to your credit card without proper explanation. They delivered a faulty and dangerous vehicle and then charging me for an incident that was not my fault. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER

title: Dire
text: Terrifying experience with the personnel who deliver or must deliver the motorhomes, when we told the supposed manager that we had doubts about the motorhome he was going to deliver, because it was not the one we had paid for, he immediately told us that the option was to claim them for the chat and ask for the money, we told this person, who, besides speaking to us in a disrespectful way, and in an aggressive tone, even, that all we wanted was the motorhome we had paid for. He kept repeating the same thing again and again with complete contempt and even with expensive satisfaction, when we told him that he was spoiling our holidays. He had the courage to throw us out of the ship in bad ways, a little pork, that they have to pick up and deliver. In life I have encountered a person in worse attitude, unprofessionalism and less education. Conclusion: completion of consumer claims sheet. This has happened at the pick-up and drop-off ship in Dos Hermanas, Seville. Greetings to the manager, long may the work that gives attention to the citizen I do not see. My advice, don't rent in indie campers.

title: Worst customer service ever
text: We were looking for a campervan rental nearby and ended up at a local branch of Indie Campers in Zemst. The people there were friendly, showed us the different models and based on that we booked a Comfort Compact online. We definitely needed this because we would travel with 2 large dogs. However, 2 weeks later we were told that this camper would not be available anyway and we got an Active Long instead. Going back to Zemst and this one seemed to be ok, was one price category less but no compensation was ever mentioned. 4 days before departure we were suddenly told that there would be another downgrade to a VW Grand California, so back to the local branch, where a friendly young man showed us the model. This would certainly be too small for 2 adults and 2 large dogs. We emailed Indie Campers for this but got no reply! On the day of departure we did not know which camper it would be!!! Eventually the Active Long turned out to be ready for us and we enjoyed a week with our dogs in beautiful Denmark. Because of our own creativity, the dogs have found a place in the camper. During our holiday we tried to contact Indie Campers regularly through the online form and through the chat and even through the email addresses we already had. NEVER did we get an answer. Today we returned the camper, the staff was already a little less helpful but I did get a phone number to which I called 3 times without being heard! Eventually I found another song and this was the first time I talked to a 'real person' about our problem. I still hope for a concession or an answer within the 48 hours as they say it everywhere. I'm curious ...

title: Beautiful trip to Cornwall, UK
text:
One of the worst holiday experiences of my life.

During Sept '23, we had rented a camper for 10 days to explore the southwest, with a goal of visiting highlights of Cornwall, it was my girlfriends first time in England.

The camper itself was of reasonable quality, however due to the unprofessional and exploitatve nature of Indie campers support network - I cannot in good faith recommend others use this service.

We experienced an issue with a damaged window, which indie campers support offered no help with facilitating the repair or recommendation of a repairer.

On return of the camper, we exchanged keys & looked the vehicle over with the London staff to no issue. Later that week my partners UK bank account had been emptied completely with no notice, (¬£600.00), and correspondence demanding a further ¬£1416.04 at risk of legal action for "damages" (a missing indicator cap) caused during our possession was sent. Reminder that there was no mention of this on the handover inspection.

The emotional stress that this has caused myself and my partner is indescribable, and has put great financial burden on myself in tandem with the horrifying experience of being in a new country with now an empty account, and a further unexpected cost incurred of ¬£1416.04.

Indie campers have not been able to produce any evidence that this ¬£2,016.04 is the true cost incurred. And have not provided any support in the discussion.

I would give 0 stars if I could and will never personally use this service again. Due to the unprofessional and aggressive conduct of the support team, nor will I ever recommend Indie Campers as a provider for a short term lease in any circumstance.

Buyer beware.

title: Wrong camper and dirty sheets
text: We had paid for a bigger camper and a smaller one left without a refund, because it's the biggest one they didn't have the sheets were dirty the unskilled staff

title: Very bad experience with Indie Campers ‚Äì Neglected Safety and Non-existent Service
text:
Very bad experience with Indie Campers ‚Äì Neglected Safety and Non-existent Service

We rented a van from Indie Campers and after only a few kilometres we found that the two front tires were completely smooth, to the point that the rope was visible ‚Äì a totally dangerous and unacceptable condition for a rental vehicle.

Unfortunately, we didn‚Äôt check them at first, relying on the check carried out by Indie Campers (who takes about twenty photos of the vehicle, but never checks the condition of the tires, which is an essential safety element).

Following our Customer Service call, we had to have the tires changed urgently in an approved garage. Since then? Radio silence. We‚Äôve been trying to get reimbursement for the advanced fees for over two weeks now, but we‚Äôve been walking Service to Service, with no concrete feedback.

In short, if all goes well, Indie Campers may seem right. But at the slightest problem, no one answers and you are left to your own devices.

I strongly advise against this company, which does not take safety or customer satisfaction seriously.

Very bad experience with Indie Campers ‚Äì safety neglected and no after-sales Service

We rented a van from Indie Campers and, after just a few kilometers, discovered that both front tires were completely bald, to the point where the inner cords were visible ‚Äì a dangerously unsafe condition for any rental vehicle.

Unfortunately, we didn‚Äôt check the tires before departure, trusting the company‚Äôs inspection process. They take around twenty photos before you leave, but fail to check the most critical safety elements ‚Äì like the tires.

After Contacting Customer Service, we were instructed to replace the tires urgently at an approved garage, which we did. Since then? Nothing. It‚Äôs now been over two weeks, and despite multiple follow-ups, we‚Äôre still waiting for a refund. We're just being passed around with no resolution.

In short: Indie Campers may seem fine if everything goes smoothly. But as soon as something goes wrong, no one is there to help.

I strongly advise against using this company ‚Äì they show no real concern for safety or customer support.

title: INDIECAMPERS ARE SCAMMERS -Customer Service is appalling!!!
text: I have a booking to go away with Indie Campers this summer August 15th till 29th August. I made an adjustment to my booking about a week ago. Arranging a different pick up and drop of f point. this took nearly 7hrs to do because Indiecampers only have chatbot system. Now several days later and I have clicked through my booking and the booking has disappeared altogether. despite over 10 attempts with the chat bot. I have no idea if the booking still exists or not. Indiecampers have over ¬£1000 of my money! I am so angry and so frustrated.

title: Find a different company
text:
Vehicle was poorly maintained and in need of a deep clean - floors in particular were gross and the mattresses.
All the window struts were broke, shelves broken, seat covers torn, key lock for door not working ( so had to always go in via front door), the sound system didnt work etc etc when we opened the top skylight it was not on its hinge so it just fell off. We had to spend our time repairing it before we could continue with our trip,
We were 5 people in the atlas 5 and they only provided for of each utensil ( cups, cutlery , cups) and 4 chairs for outside table.

We paid an a ridiculous amount for bedding which was torn, stained and very old. Open and check before you leave the depot.
They did refund us for this in the end, but we were not compensated and were disappointed with the response in regards to all the other issues we had with the vehicle.
During our 9 day rental we contacted them via whatsapp but nothing was resolved. I would hate to have a serious issue during the trip I feel they would not resolve it quickly.

Depot staff were hit and miss with customer service skills.
We waited over and hour to do the final drop off of the camper - which only took 5 minutes. Not sure why they left us waiting so long.

Would not recommend Indie Campers

title: Horrible service. Scam company
text:
Worst kind of scammers. Stay away.

Their booking and insurance is a scam. Just stay away and book your rv somewhere else. Unless you want to see your vacation ruined

title: Potential to be great if not shadowed by forced disaster
text: So truthfully was at a 3 star till the end of the trip. First the good. The 2 teenage workers at the salt lake location go above and beyond. They are understaffed and do not have the resources they need, however they went as far as to give me their personal phone number so I could have my questions answered 24/7. overall the RV did serve its purpose. It got us to our location and my family overall had a decent time. Lastly the tankless water heater was HEAVEN. Honestly probably made my wife forget about anything disagreeable with the rest. Now for the bad. small things initially, things not discussed on pickup, it was out of washer fluid, was dirty in places and we had to do a nitty gritty cleaning, again small things and easily forgivable. things went bad when I tried to use the sewage pipe. the pipe that is supplied is probably from the 70's. I think you have to go out of your way to find a pipe this bad. it is very short and leaks. it also has such a weak latching system. This was my first rv trip. had I known I would have bought a new one before we left. once out there I got covering in grey and... yes DARK water because of this pipe jumping off randomly. This is a horrible thing for anybody new to the RV experience. still not great but forgivable. Now for the worst. When you first pick up you are given a 24 hour roadside support number. they tell you to text not call. well on the way home we got a flat tire on one of the dually tires. I texted the support and got no response. after searching I found a support number and called that. they said they would try to find somebody and would call me back in twenty minutes. 1 hour h=goes by and no response. we call back and are told they do not have a ticket. they try to start another claim, regardless no help. What makes this situation unforgivable is that the vehicle is equipped with a spare tire, but NO jack or TOOLS! the pickup center confirmed this is because of liability. That being said we eventually drove home at low speed on a bad tire which added 4 hours to an already 13 hour journey home. 2 hours into that drive the support called us back to tell us there is no update on the status of our support request. Had a front tire blown out I am convinced we would still be stuck out by the freeway. If you use this make sure you have alternate plans for roadside support as theirs is a placebo.

title: Mal√≠simo. Estafadores
text:
Indi Campers ruined my holiday!
I rented a caravan from Indi Campers in june, and the battery that powers the lights and water did not work since day one. I contacted your support (only a chatbot!), and all I got were vague answers and no real help. We had to live like that for 7 full days!

I had to drive to a workshop ‚Äî and was told it could only be fixed if I left the van for 2 full days. How is that acceptable on a trip I‚Äôd been planning for months?

This is not the experience I paid for. Indi Campers, take responsibility and fix this now! You‚Äôve ruined my vacation.

#IndiCampers #VanLifeDisaster #FixThisNow #CustomerServiceFail

title: WARNING OF INDI CAMPERS!!!
text:
Warning to use Indy Cars!!!!
We won‚Äôt do it never ever again!
The pic up station Paris Charles de Gaulle (20 Min away from airport) we had to wait 3 h to have our motorhome. You have to know this is a huge old factory barn with a dusty, dirty, full of garbage, hot and equipped with two dirty sofas. Beside this the camper was in and outside dirty like a home of rats. The add blue light popped on after 15 km. The damages on the car were extrem. For example we had to fix the rear bumper with gorilla tape not to loose it! The mattress were more black than white. All curtains were out of order.
All this was toped by the way how the stuff treated us. The general manager, Mr. Dja, said‚Äú yes you booked for 2.30. But if you can‚Äôt wait until we are ready with your camper, you can leave anytime. To our question, when he will be ready, he said : ‚ÄûI don‚Äôt know. Wait or leave!‚Äú
Then he left for two hours, leaving his two inexperienced and unfriendly parttime worker (unemployed as told by them selfs), alone with 4 other customers also already waiting for hours. Once he showed up again and we blamed him, how he can leave this two workers alone, he threat me to cancel our booking, without paying back anything. His shouting voice, his threats and his way to treat us is inexaptable. After 3 h finally we were going to document the condition of the camper. The unemployed man said ‚ÄûI give you five minutes to check the van. At 6 PM (in 5 Min.) I‚Äòll close the office!‚Äú And I don‚Äôt care what you do or not. Think about it; this after we were already waiting 3 hours!!!
They absolutely declined to confirm the condition of the camper, from the point of our view. The same procedure when we returned the camper. You don‚Äôt have anything in your hands in what condition you returned the car. As mantioned in many other reviews and due to the matter of fact, that the company is located in Portugal, we already consulted a lawyer in case Indi Campers will try to charge any additionals. At last we had no chance to reach out to anybody from the company either in Germany, France or Portugal. Not by phone, WhatsApp or Emails. Last has been ignored consequently without any response.
The only person at this station, who was helpful and tried to descalate
the horrible situation, was a young lady named Lydia.
Our honest recommendation is
KEEP OF HANDS FROM INDI CAMPER!!!

title: Do not recommend.
text:
We had a good trip at Dublin site but at pick up we‚Äôre shown a scratch on the van and we‚Äôre told it was the people before us who scratched it so we wouldn‚Äôt be charged.
On delivery back the people looked round the camper and said it was perfect everything was fine and we would be refunded.
10 days later we were contacted to say that there was a scratch on the van and they‚Äôve taken ‚Ç¨370 from our credit card!!
When trying to get hold of them though instant chat it took 10 hours for them to respond. Through email it was about a week for them to get back!
Photos have no number plate shown or date and time so we do not trust them.

title: THE WORST EXPERIENCE
text:
¬°¬°Don‚Äôt rent any van from Indie Campers!! They‚Äôll ruin your trip for sure.

When we picked up the van at the Venice depot, we had to come back after driving just a few kilometers because when we braked, the brakes made a metal-on-metal sound, as if they were about to break. When we returned and the guy got in with us and heard the noise, he told us it was normal ‚Äî that the brakes were BRAND NEW and as we kept driving the noise would go away.

We continued our trip toward the Dolomites and the noise kept getting worse. Until we realized that something had fallen off ‚Äî it was the brake disc! We found the brake disc lying on the road! (Photo attached) And to make things worse, it clearly wasn‚Äôt new like they had told us.

Luckily, we weren‚Äôt on a dangerous mountain descent at the time ‚Äî but what if it had happened while going down a steep slope? We could have had an accident!

This was negligence on the part of the company. When we tried calling or writing through their famous WhatsApp chat (because that‚Äôs the only way they respond), they just ignored us. We had to explain the whole story over and over to each operator who replied‚Ä¶ in the end, we were stranded. We managed to get them to pay for one hotel night the next day, and they didn‚Äôt even send the voucher until 10 pm‚Ä¶ an absolute disaster!

They claim to be a great company but they‚Äôre anything but professional.

title: Almost accident by negligence agency!!
text:
1st day with the van:

We taked van in Venecia. The breaks makes noice and came back to the office for speak with
the agency. They said us that the breaks are news.

2nd day with the van:

The breaks felt out the van only 390 km from Venice office. Almost we had an accident for you negligence. You don‚Äôt make a revision van NEVER!!
We had to do an emergency stop.

3rd day with the van:

You didn‚Äôt give us a solution and the van was parked in the same place.

4th day with van:

It‚Äôs raining too much. The night are cold and don‚Äôt have more battery in the van. You don‚Äôt give me a solution.

Pd: 1200 euros for 390 km with the van.
Lost my time.
Lost my holidays.
Lost my money.

Very disappointed with your company.

I want the complete money back of my reservation
You can‚Äôt come back my time.

2025 year and you don‚Äôt have technical support on the road. And you don‚Äôt have a tow. It‚Äôs crazy.

I have the brakes in my hand in this moment.
We are going to Carabinieri to demand your company (the local police suggested that as well yesterday)

title: Indie campers - A disaster: NO ALQUILEIS
text: A real disaster, everything wrong. They didn't replace the caravan with a worse one, and the one we rented doesn't even exist; it's a scam. Afterwards I had no charging cable or water, the doors opened while driving. A real disaster

title: Terrible experience with Indie Campers (Seville, May 2025)
text:
We rented a motorhome for 10 days and it was a disaster from the start. Impossible to contact the center, ineffective customer service, and no real option in Spanish. The motorhome was damaged (broken rearview mirror, door that wouldn't close, loose window, etc.), although we were told it was in perfect condition. When we discovered this, we asked for assistance: they only offered an automatic WhatsApp chat that repeated messages without a solution.

We had to change our plans, park the RV for almost the entire trip for fear of driving, and repair the rearview mirror after a crash because no one helped us. We were charged for pre-existing damage and then charged again later without justification. Furthermore, the equipment was insufficient: the camper van seats 5 and they provide 2 chairs and sheets for one bed.

After complaining, they closed the case without further ado, without apology, without compensation. Lots of marketing, zero service. We will not trust Indie Campers again.

title: Absolutely unacceptable experience ‚Äì I do not recommend them to anyone
text:
Indie Campers demonstrated an alarming level of mismanagement, disorganization, bad faith, and total disrespect for the customer.
It started with an unilateral change to the reserved vehicle: I paid extra for a campervan with an interior WC and shower, and just two days before the trip they assigned me, without any notice or permission, a van with none of those features. I spent an entire day on calls to resolve the obvious ‚Äì that I would not accept an inferior vehicle and that it was their responsibility to ensure the advertised fleet was actually available. Customer service was appalling at every stage: they only answered in English, ignoring local customers, their phone number is deliberately hidden on their website to make contact difficult, staff had zero technical knowledge about the vehicles and could not answer questions, when they finally acknowledged the mistake, they said they could only deliver an equivalent van one day after the original reservation, forcing us to delay our trip and completely ruining our holiday plan. Even then, they initially refused to refund the lost night, requiring yet another heated discussion just to get that resolved.
One hour before pickup, another surprise: the vehicle they promised had ‚Äúa problem‚Äù and was no longer available. They guaranteed another supposedly equivalent van ‚Äì but offered no proper instructions for someone renting a campervan for the first time. And worse still: at collection, the van was poorly prepared and unsafe: The grey water tank was half full, the fresh water tank was nowhere near 100%, the gas bottle valve was jammed, and couldn‚Äôt be turned as the staff had shown us, making it impossible to shut off properly and creating a serious safety risk for anyone driving. When I noticed this, I tried calling ‚Äì they told me technical issues during the trip had to be handled via WhatsApp, where they never replied. We tried to fix it with help from other experienced campers, without success. I wrote emails ‚Äì they took more than two days to respond, with no practical solution other than telling us to go ‚Äúsort it out‚Äù ourselves at a shop. At the return, more proof of bad faith: during the post-rental inspection they confirmed the van was in perfect condition. They guaranteed the security deposit would be released within six business days because it was already ‚Äúcancelled‚Äù. In reality, it took 20 business days, only after repeated email complaints. To top it off, one month after the rental, without any prior contact or authorization, they charged my card the full excess amount (‚Ç¨199) from the premium insurance, claiming they found ‚Äúa scratch‚Äù on the van. At the moment of inspection, they confirmed there was no damage at all. Yet a month later, they conveniently found a scratch and decided to bill me for it, hiding behind a contract full of small print that gives them 30 days to ‚Äúdetect‚Äù and charge for damages.
This is blatantly abusive and unacceptable. They used my payment details unilaterally, without consent, to charge for damage that did not exist at return and which conveniently appeared a month later. Their only response was: ‚Äúit‚Äôs in the contract and you accepted it.‚Äù That is the level of seriousness and customer care they offer: none. Conclusion: Disorganized company, abysmal customer service ‚Äì before, during, and after the rental, no technical preparation for the service they sell, serious safety issues due to poor vehicle preparation, clear bad faith and abuse in handling payments and post-rental charges. I do not recommend Indie Campers to anyone. There are many other companies in the market that offer this service with professionalism, seriousness, and transparency ‚Äì qualities that Indie Campers, unfortunately, completely lacks. If you value your money, time, peace of mind, and safety, choose another company. Avoid this nightmare.

title: DO NOT RENT INDIE CAMPERS
text:
DO NOT RENT FROM INDIE CAMPERS.
One of the worst experiences of my life ‚Äî and my parents' ‚Äî on an RV camper in Portugal.

As soon as we left the RV depot, we began noticing numerous broken items in the campervan, such as shades not staying closed and cabinets coming open. We started making a list and ended up with 28 separate issues, including problems with the vehicle's driving performance. Eventually, the vehicle stranded us at the RV campsite park and never ran again.

This experience was full of problems and issues with the camper. First, we had to jump-start the battery. As we continued our journey, engine lights would come on and off. Then, on our second-to-last day, the battery completely died, and the camper would not start again.

And yes ‚Äî we had paid for premium insurance, which supposedly included roadside assistance. However, when we contacted Indie Campers ‚Äî the only option being a WhatsApp messaging-only number ‚Äî we were told to jump-start the van ourselves.

We managed to jump it, but it barely turned over. We eventually got it running and drove toward a campsite, but it died again ‚Äî this time, we had to push it into the site.

That evening, we contacted Indie Campers again via WhatsApp and were sent in circles. Despite sending our location and a video, as requested, they refused to send a tow truck or offer any real assistance.

We tried everything:

Contacted Indie Campers multiple times on various numbers found on the internet ‚Äî NONE worked

WhatsApped at various hours, chatted with bots and maybe real people

Called the US Embassy

Reached out to their insurance provider in Sweden

Even contacted the local Portuguese police

This was a truly awful experience, and hopefully never to be repeated.
My advice: Never rent from Indie Campers.

title: üö® Warning for travelers planning to rent a caravan with Indy campers üö®
text:
I‚Äôm extremely disappointed with my experience with Indie Campers, and I feel compelled to share it so that others can be warned.

Back on June 15th, I contacted Indie Campers to request a change in my booking due to an unimaginable personal tragedy ‚Äî I lost my brother‚Äôs wife during the war in Israel. As a result, traveling this summer became impossible for me, both emotionally and logistically. I reached out asking not for a refund, but simply to reschedule the trip.

I was told in writing by the Indie Campers team that I could postpone my reservation until the end of the calendar year 2025, in accordance with their policy. Based on that promise, I submitted my new travel dates: September 21st to 26th, 2025, with pick-up in Milan, Italy.

Then, after weeks of slow and inconsistent replies ‚Äî during which I had to chase responses over and over ‚Äî I was told that ‚Äúthe trip cannot be switched to another month or year‚Äù and that only minor extensions of a day or two are possible.

This is a complete contradiction of what I was told earlier.

During this time, I purchased new flight tickets and made travel arrangements based on the assumption that Indie Campers would honor their written commitment. Now, not only am I being denied the rescheduling I was promised, but I‚Äôm also being blamed for delays that were entirely caused by their own poor communication and unclear procedures.

To make matters worse, I initially tried to contact them as early as June 13th, but it was a Saturday ‚Äî I observe the Sabbath and couldn‚Äôt make the call. I contacted them the very next business day, June 15th, yet they refused to acknowledge this and instead stuck rigidly to policy deadlines while disregarding my personal situation.

This isn‚Äôt just a case of bad customer service ‚Äî it‚Äôs a failure of empathy, professionalism, and basic human decency. A company that claims to care about its customers should never treat people like this, especially in times of distress and crisis.

I expected flexibility, support, and integrity. Sadly, I received none of that.

title: Degrading and miserable. The worst thing I've ever experienced.
text:
The most degrading and miserable thing that happened to me in my entire traveling life.

I arrived with my family. Husband, 8-month-old baby, and 8-year-old daughter.

The camper was not in the requested city. We had booked 40 days in advance.

They left us on the street, and the only option offered was for my husband to take the train to Zurich for a three-hour trip to pick up the camper and then drive back alone at night.

When I arrived at the pickup location there was no sign, the keys were gone. They had him waiting at night and in the rain.

They asked him to make a deposit when, in desperation, he managed to get through after 4 hours of waiting.

I end up returning at dawn.

They never returned our deposit or all the taxi and food expenses we incurred because of this.

Sad. Degrading. A lack of respect.

I had never experienced anything like this.

I'm summarizing it because it's distressing to write it, but the details were tremendous.

(Sunday, everything closed, no food for my children, no cell phone charge, and my husband not being able to return..)

Hopefully no one. Never. Let no one put a penny into this miserable enterprise.

What they did is beyond words.

title: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY
text:
I am embarrassed to say I didn't do my homework. A combination of 'an immediate trust' in their seemingly legitimate, well designed website and a need to book something fast. Had I dug a little deeper (which I normally would) I'd have discovered the worst reviews I've ever read about a company, that is still in operation! Let me tell you they are all true.

I hired a camper van from a third party vendor, who was using their site as a marketplace to attract more custom. Thankfully Simon was great, van as advertised, communication all good. However communication with Indie, shocking to non existent. You can only get in touch via on-line chat They reply in broken English if you are lucky. You do not feel understood and nothing is resolved.

I took out the additional insurance policy which they offered me at the time of booking. Which seemed to me the responsible thing to do. It turns out this isn't valid as Simon looked into it when I unfortunately had a little prang in the vehicle. It is only valid with their own vehicles, so why was I given this as an option? I've tried to ask the question on their on-line chat but they have yet to respond, its been 2 days...

Shocking company, untrustworthy, STAY AWAY.

title: Read the 1 Star reviews before thinking of hiring.
text: I would advise reading the 1 start reviews. I have been charged ¬£2500 for damages I did not do. I have been trying to dispute this for 3 weeks and have had my emails ignored. This seems to be common if you read review sites. Very poor customer service once they take your money (you have to agree to them being able to just take money from you card for damages - there is no discussion)! I have provide video evidence to them and haven't had a satisfactory response..

title: Bad experience
text: Bad shopping experience. The vehicle was delivered with 50000km more than those declared, with documents referring to another plate so it was probably not even insured. Engine light on and other damage that was not there when we saw and chose it. AFTER SALES SERVICE NON-EXISTENT, they pocketed the money and hello. We will pursue legal action against this scam.

title: FUYEZ
text:
RUN AWAY!! I can't put 0
Arrived 30 minutes late (plane) there was no one left on site.
Picking up the van the next day The van is knocked out, indoor shower not functional, key broken. During the stay the inner battery failed putting our safety at risk (smell and gas leak) there is of course no tool and none help from Indie. and of course an ultra long customer service response time. I am still waiting for the refund. A fee has been added to the delivery of the van still no answers.
Too bad because the country is very beautiful but the experiment is missed.
BIG DUMB!! TO FLEE

title: Dangerous black mould in sleeping area! Zero compensation or accountability
text:
Our early June rental from Venice turned into a stressful mess. After driving to the Dolomites, we opened the pop-up roof and found serious black mould in the sleeping area (with photos to prove it). We slept downstairs the first night, then drove 5 hours round-trip to Venice expecting a replacement van. Instead, they just ‚Äúcleaned‚Äù the mould and gave us the same van back, still full of fumes.

We lost a full day of our trip, plus money on fuel and tolls. Customer service from the Venice/Italy team was chaotic and unhelpful ‚Äî with multiple teams involved and no real-time support. Post-trip, we were told we were owed compensation ‚Äî but then totally ignored despite multiple messages. We even have screenshots of this.

We were previously loyal customers. Unless they take responsibility and provide compensation, we won‚Äôt use them again ‚Äî and would advise others to think carefully before subjecting themselves to the same dreadful experience!

title: No flexibility, no refunds
text:
I made a reservation with Indie Campers well in advance to ensure I‚Äôd get a campervan in good condition for my trip. I even added extra days at the beginning, thinking it would give me flexibility to shorten the rental if needed.

However, when the time came and I had to take a flight two days earlier than planned, I tried to reduce the booking by those two days ‚Äì only to find out that Indie Campers doesn‚Äôt refund anything once you've paid. Not even for days you clearly won‚Äôt use.

This company is inflexible and unfair. They also charge for extras that seem necessary when booking, but even if you later realize you don‚Äôt need them, there‚Äôs no way to get your money back. Everything is non-refundable.

You can‚Äôt make changes to your booking without losing money, even if nothing needs to change except the dates. It‚Äôs outrageous. I feel like I‚Äôve been robbed. I won‚Äôt book with them again and I don‚Äôt recommend them to anyone who values clear policies and fair treatment.

title: Bad assistance!!!
text:
We arrived at the pick up center to pick up the van, not yet ready when we arrived, they were fixing a piece of the kitchen that broke after 10 minutes.
They told us the gas cylinder was full and when we arrived in the evening, we discovered it was empty. We contacted support, which was bad in our case, to help us find a gas dealer. We drove all morning and no one had the right gas tank for our camper. Assistance was in vain.
Not to mention the cleaning and maintenance of the camper.

title: Avoid at all costs, scamming company, criminal behavior.
text:
AVOID AT ALL COST!

The best advice I can give you. DO NOT USE INDIECAMPERS.

They are an outright scam.

Booked a specific model 6 weeks ahead of time, showed up the day of my booking and they put me in a model that costs HALF THE PRICE. Not to mention the one they gave me had massive electrical problems throughout and WOULD NOT HOOK UP TO SHORE POWER. Ruined our trip. Stole our money. NO PHONE SUPPORT.

You can't talk to anyone in the company to get help. They offer a WhatsApp chat with an offshore indian team that will send you ChatGPT responses.

Pathetic criminal company. AVOID AVOID AVOID

title: SCAM
text:
They're all nice and then they put it there...
They delivered the campervan already with broken parts, we made the video to prevent scams.
Upon delivery the boy took pictures said that everything was fine and after 15 days we were told that the camper was not clean and consequently you know kept 200 euros from the deposit.
I do not recommend to anyone

title: Scammers
text:
Thieves !!! Don‚Äôt use Indie Campers !!!
This company changed the CV that we booked for 4 people to a smaller one that didn‚Äôt suit our needs. They do not give you option to cancel. We had to book with another company and they dont give you your money back. They force you to get something you didn‚Äôt book.
We made booking 3 months ago. Worse Customer Service ever, it takes several days for them to reply. Scammers!!!

title: Very poor experience Ireland location
text: Very poor experience at the Ireland Dublin location. There is no local support available - only support available is an online chat which is based in Portugal and takes several hours to get at best a generic reply. Our pick up time was changed the day of pick up and caused several issues which almost led to us missing one night of our three night rental. We tried contacting them for several hours to understand why it was being changed with no luck. We encountered issues with the gas one night and were up all night trying to sort it but received no responses despite 24hour support. There is a total lack of communication between the local depot staff and head office with each blaming each other for issues encountered. There were a pair of expensive shoes left in a cupboard on drop off totally our fault but we contacted them within an hour and were told nothing was found. Overall it was not a pleasant experience and would never rent from them again, all of the above issues and stresses ruined our trip.

title: Never with them again
text:
Two rentals and two times they do the same to us. Let‚Äôs reserve a specific camper that is what we want and assign us a different camper, much bigger and not adapted to what we need. Shame on you.

Also, this second time I have written to them several times and they have never replied, so if you have a problem do not have any support or help.

In the absence of a response, I finally cancelled the second rental despite losing 50% of it, but if I didn‚Äôt I lost 100%.

That said, I don't advise them at all. Two and no more!!!!
We rented with other companies and nothing to do with it.

title: Don‚Äôt do it! Horrible experience!
text: Don‚Äôt rent here! The fact that they don‚Äôt have a phone number you can call, but only a WhatsApp number, says enough. That is unacceptable for being a car rental service. If you‚Äôre lucky, you get a decent van and won‚Äôt be needing any assistance during your trip. That wasn‚Äôt the case for us, our van broke down literally the day after we picked it up. Simply wouldn‚Äôt start anymore at all. The only ‚Äòhelp‚Äô we got from Indie Campers was to try and ask someone nearby to help jumpstart the car with cables. Which we did and this didn‚Äôt help solve the problem. Then we were suggested to tow the car to the closest mechanic, all at our own cost! After several outreaches by WhatsApp and email, we never received any help from Indie Campers or even any intention to solve the problem. We got no replacement car, so we weren‚Äôt able to even start our roadtrip. In the end we had to rent another car elsewhere to get to our destination. Now, 2 months later and we‚Äôre still waiting to get a refund of the money paid for an unusable van. Horrible horrible company! Would only recommend anyone considering to rent here to quickly let go of that idea and rent elsewhere!

title: INDIE SCAMPERS
text: Absolutely horrible experience. Our van was in terrible condition. And they still haven‚Äôt refunded our 500 EUR deposit. We Will never book with Them again. You shouldn‚Äôt either.

title: Indie Campers ‚Äì Never again!
text:
The incompetence and mismanagement of Indie Campers has left me with a whole day of vacation. Compensation or the possibility of a lease extension was refused on the grounds that ‚Äòa replacement vehicle was finally made available on the same day.‚Äô
First, we received a defective camper where the engine lamp lit up after only 10 km. The customer hotline in Portugal responded only with standardized phrases, which is why we decided to return to the depot. There, the employee told us that everything was fine, you just had to turn the engine off and on again from time to time to continue driving. He said the vehicle was still ready to go.
Despite his assessment, I refused to continue and demanded a functioning camper. An hour-long search for a viable replacement followed. All campers offered were uncleaned inside at the end of March, with unpleasant smells of unemptied toilet, food scraps and used linen. In addition, the vehicles were damaged both inside and outside.
Finally, a camper was found, the defective blinds were repaired and the interior was doused with what felt like 10 liters of cockpit cleaner to fix the dirt. In the afternoon we were finally able to repackage our things. However, the replacement vehicle had to be checked in, and Indie Campers again demanded a ‚Ç¨2,000 deposit, which I refused. An online employee then threatened me that I would not drive anywhere without payment.
When the situation threatened to escalate, the deposit was eventually rebooked internally. We spent more than 8 hours in the depot parking lot without water, toilets or any excuse for the inconvenience. Only the next day could the ride continue under an uncomfortable feeling.
Indie Campers requests a Google rating directly when returning the vehicle. Otherwise, according to the MA, the deposit could not be refunded. As I was at that time in an ongoing complaint procedure about the denied compensation for the lost holiday day, I refused the appropriate assessment. This complaint was eventually rejected.
It was only a month later, after the deposit had still not been repaid, that I contacted Indie Campers via the hotline and threatened legal action. The deposit was finally paid before the deadline had expired.

title: HORRIFIC EXPERIENCE
text:
Bad overall experience.

We had many problems with customer service: the WhatsApp channel is not responding and, in case of inconvenience, you are completely alone. There was also a lack of clarity with the insurance plan: although we documented all the damage in the beginning with photos, we were ultimately charged for pre-existing damages. I do not recommend it if you are looking for a stress-free trip.

title: Lawyers
text:
A real scam!
We paid an extra 180 euros to pick up our van at 10pm in Oslo. There was no one left at the agency. We contacted the chat online, the person tells us that it is impossible to recover the key if there is no one, the same when we contact someone via whatsapp. We call the number displayed on the agency window, we stay on the line 20 minutes with someone who is unable to help us. At midnight, we decide to take a taxi to the hotel (which causes us significant unforeseen costs)
The next morning the person who greets us clearly tells us that it is not his problem what happened to us, and we wait another 1h, we have to fill in some papers (which we had already filled in online)
We FINALLY get back our van which is dusty, dirty, the seats are ripped (which has pierced our pants ) elements hold thanks to a piece of Scotch, the sockets do not work, the fridge is hot and we dare not open it because it reeks all over the van and even less use it, there is leftover food, and gum at the seats, we cannot close the curtain of the windshield, the key does not fit into the water tank it is therefore only closed by hand, the floor, the walls are dirty, the sockets do not work... and we are on the reserve for gasoline and Ad-blue (knowing that in the return instructions of the van, the ad blue must not be on the reserve). Once we are full we start the van and the message "empty engine oil" is displayed. We go back to the depot to report it to them, someone takes care of it, tells us it's OK, we finally leave!!! We're really leaving, after more than half a day lost.
3 days after the motor oil message is displayed again, very dangerous, we decide to add it ourselves at our expense.
At the end of the trip we realize that we were charged 2x the surcharge for the late pickup of the van...
We call the assistance with the professional phone of the person of the agency (yes because when you call you can not reach anyone) and the online person tells us that we will be refunded the 2x180 euros paid for the late withdrawal + taxi + hotel if we send the invoices by email.

We had only one answer in 2 weeks: we are refunded 1x180 ‚Ç¨ within 10 to 15 days. We respond by sending our RIB (otherwise how to have the money?!) And we demand a refund of BOTH late withdrawal fees.. more answers despite our reminders!
And for the oil, it is up to you, as a tenant to make the levels, at your expense, what could be more normal during his holidays and considering the rental price! Also, the battery of the van was always on the last red light = almost empty, should we also have changed the battery during our trip?
Shameful and unacceptable to pay more than 2500 euros for this wheelie bin and non-existent assistance!!!

title: ‚ùåDISASTROUS EXPERIENCE. UNLAWFUL CHARGE AND NO ASSISTANCE. MAI PI√ô!
text:
‚ö†Ô∏è STRONGLY NOT RECOMMENDED! CHOOSE OTHER!
I rented an RV from Indie Campers in April 2025. Everything seemed regular: return took place on May 1, check-out in adversary, damage report at ‚Ç¨ 0.00, deposit returned. BUT THEN, 31 days later I was charged ‚Ç¨ 837.24 for an alleged damage NEVER found at the time of return. I have photographic evidence that shows it was already present at check-in and had never been mentioned before!

I sent them a PEC, emails, several forms provided by themselves, used chat support but never received a satisfactory response and when requesting the booking code they disappeared! They are making it impossible to defend themselves legally and this is unacceptable and improper behaviour!

Moreover, we did not receive any assistance during the trip since hot water and gas were not working, they just ignored us!

Indie Campers has proven to be an unreliable and harmful company for consumers!

title: They're thieves, never rent
text:
They're thieves, never rent. I have been charged more than 2300 euros on the credit card without warning for a damage covered by the premium insurance contracted. They don't claim anything, they just get paid and there's no way to contact them.
En route they also do not give you any support, I went the whole trip without refrigerator because it did not chill.
I'm waiting for the legal deadline to report them.
If you have already rented with them, lock the credit card to avoid surprises.

title: Only interested in money
text:
Amazing about @indiecampers
. They won‚Äôt let me change the delivery city because ‚Äúthey already have a reservation in that city‚Äù but when making a new reservation with different drop off there are available campers. I only ask to change vehicles, not cancel the reservation.

title: LIARS AND THIEVES
text:
YOU ARE THIEVES AND LIARS, you play with the illusion of people who hire a vehicle to enjoy their vacation and steal everything you can without even worrying about making up the lie. Please, you who are reading this: don‚Äôt even think about hiring Indie Campers under any circumstances, if you do they will steal you, lie and try to stay with you in every way imaginable.
We made the mistake of renting a vehicle from this company and it was a real nightmare: bad van, bad communication, your warehouse is a complete mess, lack of maintenance of the vehicle and money that is taken from the deposit without a valid explanation and proven with an invoice. They literally make up the amount of what they charge you at the minimum of damage.

title: Indie Campers is a well-organized scam ‚Äì avoid at all costs
text:
Booking with Indie Campers was the worst travel decision I‚Äôve ever made.

I booked a 4-seater van well in advance and received confirmation via email. When I arrived at the pickup location, I was told the van had been sold and was no longer available ‚Äî with zero prior notice.

After almost 7 hours of waiting, confusion, and disorganization, I was finally given a replacement vehicle that was not equivalent and completely defective. The electrical system didn‚Äôt work, there was no water, and we had no way to charge our devices or use the onboard facilities. At night, the control screen kept blinking and lighting up the entire van, making it impossible to sleep. We were forced to go to bars and restaurants just to use a bathroom or charge a phone. A trip with friends turned into a complete nightmare.

Customer service? Absolutely useless. No phone number to call, and the chat service disappears when the situation gets serious. I waited nearly a month for a formal response, only to be offered a ‚Ç¨64 refund ‚Äî a ridiculous amount that doesn‚Äôt even cover the first day‚Äôs trouble.

To make things worse, I had already written a review on Trustpilot, and Indie Campers responded publicly saying they were ‚Äúhappy to have resolved my issues.‚Äù
Let me be absolutely clear: this is completely false. Nothing has been resolved. That response was nothing but damage control for their public image ‚Äî not a real solution to a real problem.

After reading more reviews, I now realize this happens to many people. Some get lucky, but most end up dealing with last-minute vehicle changes, broken vans, and zero support.

DO NOT BOOK WITH INDIE CAMPERS. They are all branding and no substance. They don‚Äôt care about their customers, break their promises, and refuse to take responsibility.
Unless you want to ruin your holiday, stay away.

title: Horrible
text: Horrible. My experience with Indie campers was terrible. I booked my van a long time in advance, in order to make sure I have it reserved. Three weeks before my trip, the company changed the van model that I booked to a different one, saying that due to logistical reasons, I cannot have this specific van for my booking. I accepted this, although the van was totally different that they offered me. Three days before my trip, they again sent me an email saying that the van will not be available on the date that I have booked, again due to logistical reasons. I tried to get in touch with the 24x7 customer support, which totally ignored me for around 20 times. I also tried to contact the company over the contact form on their webpage, which also did not get any reply. So I told them that I am not able to be there for that late pickup. On the day of the late pickup, the responsible person contacted me via phone and said that I need to pick up the van now. He didn't even know that I had to cancel this. After two weeks, finally somebody responded to one of my many emails and said that they regretted very much this situation and that they will cancel, therefore, the booking. Honestly, I would not book with them again. If there is any sort of problem, they are not helping at all, irresponsive and simply don't care.

title: Scam alert : Indie Campers
text:
Scam Alert: Indie Campers Rips Customers Off with Broken Vans and Zero Support

I waited over two hours just to receive a camper in poor condition: broken table, stained mattress, and a warning light the staff couldn‚Äôt even explain. They showed very little understand of how the vehicle worked and made no effort to help. One staff member, Lorenzo, even admitted that the camper was not in very good condition.

Despite all these problems, you‚Äôre forced to accept the camper or lose your entire rental fee.

On the second day, I discovered by chance that the gas cylinders connected inside the camper were not shut off properly, causing a gas leak ‚Äî a potentially dangerous fire hazard. This was only found because I checked the area where the cylinders were stored.

Also on day two, the handbrake failed, and the camper was undriveable. I‚Äôve now been stranded for nearly two days with two children ‚Äì and Indie Campers has done nothing to help.

I‚Äôve messaged them multiple times. I‚Äôve received empty apologies, but still no action, no solution, and no sense of urgency. They are painfully slow to respond ‚Äì if they respond at all.

Meanwhile, I‚Äôve lost money on non-refundable bookings, the trip is falling apart, and I‚Äôm left dealing with the consequences.

There was no compensation whatsoever for the camper‚Äôs condition, no refund, and absolutely no responsibility taken.

A quick Google search will show you just how many issues there are with this company ‚Äî don‚Äôt make the same mistake I did. Stay far away.

Thousands of negative reviews from people who have been scammed back this up.

This is a company that takes your money, delivers a broken product, and then disappears behind a chat system they barely answer.

Indie Campers should not be trusted. It feels like a scam.

title: Terrible customer service. Impossible to contact. So unprofessional
text: Myself and my partner used indie for our travel around Iceland in feb 25 and I could not warn you enough to stay away from this company. All was fine in picking up the camper but when our camper broke down 2 days later their roadside assistance is so terrible as it is impossible to get in contact with anyone. When we finally did they took us back to the depot and sorted us out with a replacement and while exploring in that van numerous expenses came out of my account for damages to the first van without my permission. Later after the trip had ended I have got in contact again for them to send invoices and damage reports of the vehicle for insurance purposes but they refuse to send the information I ask for that I need to claim off my insurance. If you know what‚Äôs good for you. You will stay clear of this company as it is nothing but heartache when all your after is a few details for you to get some money back off insurance

title: Never again
text:
Three days before the start of our reservation, I accidentally found out that our booking had been changed from an Adventure Truck (with a bed, kitchen, and toilet) to a car with a rooftop tent‚Äîwhich didn‚Äôt have a single thing we originally booked. The vehicle we were switched to was also significantly cheaper, but we didn‚Äôt get any refund. I tried to reach out to customer service by phone and email, but every time I got a different explanation as to why the change had been made.

Eventually, they changed our reservation again to a large RV, which we hadn‚Äôt wanted either‚Äîbut since sleeping in a tent wasn‚Äôt an option for us, we had no choice but to accept it.
The customer service was absolutely useless.
