The car pickup was booked for 5:30 PM. When we arrived, the branch manager informed us in a very arrogant way that they were delayed. I asked how long‚Äîmaybe half an hour? He just laughed and said at least an hour and a half. In the end, we waited four hours for the vehicle! No apology, no water‚Äînothing. They just left us sitting on the steps.

Customers who had arrived before us had already been waiting seven hours!
It was a complete mess and totally unacceptable.

But I still can‚Äôt rate the experience positively‚Äîsuch a delay is simply unacceptable and it totally ruined our first day.

title: My worst nightmare
text:
We rented a camper hoping for a comfortable and hassle-free trip, but it turned out to be a complete nightmare. From the very beginning, we had multiple issues: the generator wasn‚Äôt working, one of the windows didn‚Äôt seal properly and made an unbearable noise while driving, and the fridge door kept swinging open every time we took a turn.

Things got so bad that we had to search for public facilities just to shower or brush our teeth ‚Äî completely defeating the purpose of renting a camper instead of a regular car. What was supposed to be a practical and smooth travel option ended up being stressful and uncomfortable.

To make it worse, our friends rented a separate camper from the same company and faced problems from the start as well.

Definitely not worth it. Save yourself the trouble and look elsewhere.

title: Awful.
text:
IMPOSSIBLE FOR THEM TO ANSWER THE CLAIM MADE MORE THAN 10 DAYS AGO

Unfortunately, the experience was extremely disappointing, especially considering the high rental price.

‚∏ª

1. Unjustified charging of the allowance

I was charged the full credit card allowance without vouchers or technical reports ‚Äî for a slight chafing of an area of the body that was already visible and incomplete, which probably caused the damage. I consider this measure unjustified and possibly abusive.

‚∏ª

2. Hidden defects and poor condition of the vehicle

The vehicle was not in proper rental condition. It had numerous problems that were not reported at the time of delivery:
‚Ä¢ Cutlery drawer: loose, poorly repaired with glue and improper screws. He fell during the ride, damaging belongings.
‚Ä¢ Pillows and sheets: inadequate. The sheets did not fit, the ‚Äúpillows‚Äù were used and minimal pillows. The covers were disproportionate (approximately 90x90 cm).
‚Ä¢ Gas cylinder: paid but not used ‚Äî claim reimbursement.
‚Ä¢ Absence of shims or wedges: this caused the camper to be tilted, which prevented the proper functioning of the refrigerator for two consecutive days.
‚Ä¢ Broken upholstery: both in the vehicle seats and in the camping elements.
‚Ä¢ Darkening curtains: damaged, not fulfilling their function.
‚Ä¢ Lack of adapter for the water hose: which made it impossible to fill the tank.

‚∏ª

These defects constitute hidden defects, not reported at the time of signing the contract, which constitutes a violation of contractual good faith and a breach of the terms of service by the company.

‚∏ª

üìù Booking: EDOD6V

title: LOUSY. DO NOT HIRE
text:
LOUSY SERVICE

MOTORHOME WITHOUT PROPER CLEANING
THEY CHARGED US INSANE FOR DAMAGES THAT NL DID

I DO NOT RECOMMEND
YOU'RE LOOKED AFTER BY THE DIRTY STAFF AND THEY DON'T GIVE YOU BALL

WE WANTED TO CONTACT THEM BY EMAIL BY WHATSAPP AND THEY DON'T RESPOND

I DON'T RECOMMEND IT FOR ANYTHING IN THE WORLD.

title: Scam company
text: The car offered has significant technical defects, which are significantly changed our plans, useless customer service

title: verybad company
text:
WARNING: Do not rent from IndieCampers! Our experience:
o Camper too old to be allowed to rent out (the location manager actually thought so too, but yes there was no other van available ....)
o Different essential things were broken or were even missing (for example, having the exhaust repaired twice of which the first time immediately when picking up the camper.) This cost us the effort and vacation time. In the end we had a list of 20 defects!
o The inventory is so basic that you have to invest yourself. For example in clothing hangers for the hanging cupboard, in soup bowls/ deep plates, a good cuttingknife for vegetables and meat, a.s.o
o Communication with customer service on the road is downright bad.
o Complaint handling is abominable. You get an answer quickly but only with a sop of sweetener. After a lot of nagging, we eventually get the meager amount of 5% return.
o The basic rental price is almost doubled before you actually drive away in the camper. Only the so-called service costs are already 50% of the basic ren

title: Run away!
text: I booked a camper van and paid the reservation + deposit of 2000‚Ç¨. After that Indie Campers asks me for a deductible between 2000 and 3500‚Ç¨ to be paid also before having a rental contract in hand! So I cancel my reservation but Indie Campers explains that they are unable to refund me before payment of the deductible! You can't get someone on the line. Ongoing complaint. Run away!

title: Do not hire from Indie Campers!!!
text:
Indie Campers Las Vegas is awful to deal with and I would not reccomend hiring from them. I hired an Adventure Truck from IC Las Vegas. It turns out they dont own any Adventure Trucks so they gave us a Solis Air instead. Don't get me wrong, the Solis Air was fine - but it is much cheaper than the Adventure truck, which we specifically wanted and they have refused to refund any money. There were also items missing from our essential kit and our vehicle was 4 1/2hours late in being ready and they nearly forgot to give it to us when we arrived back at 7:30pm at their request and were about to shut the gates. It was a really unnerving experience arriving into a new country. Many other people on that same day were waiting hours for their campers or returning their campers due to faults. It seems the fleet is not maintained.
Our parents van was 3 hours late and was dirty and a lot was broken - it was really upsetting.

title: Scammers!
text:
üö®üö®üö® WARNING!!! üö®üö®üö®
This company will steal your money. Whatever you do ‚Äì do NOT rent a vehicle from IndieCampers. This is an untrustworthy company that thrives by draining money from customers after the rental period. It‚Äôs a scam, plain and simple.

They withdrew AUD 1,409 from my account for an alleged scratch on a plastic panel. I asked for photos and documentation, but received nothing ‚Äì just their useless, self-made report. Customer service is absolutely terrible ‚Äì no real answers, just automated responses and people promising to help, only to disappear. No one takes responsibility.

They also took AUD 860 from my deposit without warning, explanation, or any attempt to contact me. I‚Äôve asked multiple times what this charge is for ‚Äì still no reply.

The van we rented had several issues that made the trip unnecessarily frustrating:
‚Äì The battery didn‚Äôt work, so we couldn‚Äôt use power in the van unless it was plugged in.
‚Äì Cruise control was broken.
‚Äì The oil warning light was on constantly. When we reported it, they told us it was ‚Äúnormal‚Äù and we could top up the oil ourselves.
‚Äì One cabinet door was missing, and another was broken.
‚Äì The grey water sensor was faulty. They even told us we could just dump wastewater directly on the ground ‚Äì which is illegal in Australia and could have resulted in a fine.

It feels both humiliating and deeply frustrating to be scammed like this ‚Äì especially when you‚Äôre just trying to enjoy a vacation you‚Äôve worked hard for. I‚Äôm writing this to warn others: Stay far away from IndieCampers.

title: Excessive Charges, STAY AWAY!!
text: I used this company once before with no issues. I should have listened to the reviews! I was charged $2k for a TINY dent in the side panel of the van that I did not cause. I was told at drop-off that it would be a $400 charge, which I thought was still excessive. Then I was charged $2000 days later! The pick-up and drop-off experience should also have been a red flag. The pick-up/drop-off location was sketchy, unclean, unorganized, and we were ignored for 20 minutes (workers walking past us and ignoring hellos) both times before anyone greeted us. The functions of the van were explained to us in a very rushed and unhelpful way. We also realized when we went to empty our gray water that the valve outside the van was left open by the workers when it was given to us without our knowledge. While many of these things are something I'd be willing to overlook, the excessive charges (that so many other users warn you about!) make everything else feel like red flags for an overall sketchy company. I will not be using them again and recommend you look elsewhere.

title: Paid for an RV, Offered a Van, totally unacceptable
text: I booked an RV. After they wrongfully canceled it, they offered to " reactivate" it but for a VAN, not the RV I paid for. that's like booking a hotel suite and being given a bunk bed in a hostel. this company is dishonest and shady.

title: Disappointing experience ‚Äì no goodwill, poor support
text:
Due to numerous negative reviews and my own experience with poor customer support, I cancelled my trip at Indiecampers. There is no statutory right of withdrawal or revocation at Indiecampers ‚Äì and unfortunately no goodwill solution is offered.

Communication is limited exclusively to WhatsApp, which makes the exchange even more difficult. Despite repeated requests for a partial refund, this was categorically rejected. There is also no discussion of factual arguments.

I am aware that you should familiarize yourself with terms and conditions and cancellation conditions in advance. Nevertheless, I would have expected a minimum of customer focus ‚Äì especially as the approach is very strict and inflexible.

My advice: Read the reviews of other customers carefully and check the terms and conditions carefully. Anyone hoping for support or accommodation in case of changes or problems will unfortunately be disappointed at Indiecampers. There are significantly more customer-friendly providers on the market with transparent and fair conditions.

title: Indie campers , not a responsible and honest company!
text: Skip indie campers! Our camper van had faulty awning, choked pipes, and no gray water outlet! No useful help for 1 week and we had to shower and do dishes at common facilities while being charged for these facilities. We had to troubleshoot and bought a pail to hold the grey water, then was advised by the company to pour chemical agent to clear the choked pipes and when that didn‚Äôt work, we had to get a plunger to clear the over flowing pipes ! They offered a 5% discount for all the inconvenience and headaches. We have saved two years for this trip, so it was a huge disappointment.

title: Van not available when arrived in Australia
text:
We had hired a campervan from Indie in Darwin Australia. When we arrived ( the day before we were due to pick it up for 6 nights) we had an email telling us there was no van available the next day and it would not be ready for 2 further days.
We were unable to contact the company and they did not reply to emails for 12 hours each time. There was no phone number.
We discovered that they were running Australia from Portugal so they were not working while we were awake.
Eventually they agreed to put us up in a hotel for 2 nights but this turned
out to be a hostel with no food and us three adults had to share a very basic room!
We had to go out for every meal and had nothing to do as we had no transport. This cost a lot of money which they refused to reimburse.
We had pre booked campsites which we had paid for and could not use.
Indie Campers were very unhelpful and rude and could not care less that we had lost one third of our camper van trip which meant we could not go where we had planned as there was not enough time.
Appalling customer service.

title: NON-EXISTENT ASSISTANCE
text: Non-existent assistance, following the theft of a purse containing the keys of the camper, for 6 days they teased us saying that the replacement key would arrive , in fact never arrived , we had to pay for the hotel to sleep for 6 nights , TODAY I ABANDONED THE CAMPER BECAUSE I DID NOT HAVE ASSISTANCE and all our calls had to start all over again and then lose everything in nothing . A very bad experience that I do not wish anyone!! DO NOT BOOK WITH INDIE CAMPERS

title: Dont rent with Indie Campers
text: We had a terrible experience with Indie Campers. The van arrived late despite paying for early check-in, and the gas system never worked due to their installation error. We couldn‚Äôt cook, shower, or use the fridge during the whole trip. Worst of all, there is no real customer service ‚Äî we‚Äôve been trying to contact them for 3 days with no response. Absolutely not recommended.

title: Very poor customer service
text:
Dreadful customer service and really difficult to speak to a human. It took ages to get hold of anyone after failing to resolve a question on their website after booking. They seem happy to waste their customer‚Äôs time. When you do speak to them, it‚Äôs to a complete idiot who knows nothing. The van we booked wasn‚Äôt available so we were upgraded to a larger, more expensive one. All good but it was way larger and more difficult to drive. I wish I‚Äôd cancelled and rebooked elsewhere. Heating and hot water only works when it wants to. Again customer service slow. Still waiting for it to be resolved. Given a number on pick up for help but again routed to the guy that knows nothing. They seem happy to waste their customer‚Äôs time so they have less to do.
I won‚Äôt book with them again . Used McRent last year who were way better, very helpful and lovely to deal with.

title: Unreliable, avoid
text: We picked up in L.A. and returned the camper in Denver. Polite, chilled staff. Several things were missing, then given to us, when we asked for them. We drove off into remote terrain. However we had not spotted that all the bedding (devets, pillows) was missing. That night we were freezing. We were told to call the L.A. office but nobody ever answered the phone number that was given to us, and nobody replied to my emails. We spent our time buying bedding - i.e. driving for a hundred fifty miles from our rural area and back. We also had problems with our toilet cassette. When we dropped the camper in Denver, polite young staff. We were fobbed off that this needed to be sorted as a bureaucratic process via email, and that we would hear from Indie Campers. We were not reimbursed. We never received replies to our query apart from the generic " we will get back to you" and the regular spam ads. My verdict: The camper was expensive, the service was poor. Avoid.

title: avoid them
text:
We rented a campervan from Indie Campers (Booking #2602891) between 28 May and 1 June 2025, and our trip was seriously disrupted by multiple technical failures and unacceptable customer service.

On the first night, the water pump failed, leaving us without access to the shower, toilet, or sink. We contacted support immediately, but it took hours to get a proper response ‚Äî and we spent the rest of the trip with no running water.

Later, we faced a heating failure as well.

Most critically, the gas locker door suddenly swung open while driving through narrow Scottish roads. This was a serious safety hazard. We had to pull over urgently and tape it shut with help from passing motorcyclists.

When we returned the van, staff acknowledged the gas locker issue and told us no damage report would be filed.

Despite all of this, Indie Campers:

Ignored our formal claim for over a week

Charged us for body damage caused by their faulty locker

Charged the damage to a card not listed in the rental contract

Still has not offered any refund or compensation, even after promising to reimburse campsite fees

We have extensive evidence (videos, chat logs, emails) and will be escalating this to consumer authorities and filing for chargeback through our bank.

I‚Äôm sharing this to warn others. Indie Campers promotes ‚Äú24/7 support‚Äù and ‚Äúreliable vehicles,‚Äù but in our case, neither were true. Extremely disappointed.

title: Appaling Customer Services
text:
Appaling customer service, tried contacting them several times befofe my trip as they changed the specification of my camper van twice and wanted to know if I was eligible for some money back as the one we got wasn't what we chose.

Also after the trip we had done some damage to the vehicle (hold our hands up to that one) we were given an estimate of ‚Ç¨4000 to repair the damages due to where some of them were.. initial deposit taken as stated in the terms and conditions and now they have also tried to charge an additional ‚Ç¨8000 euro for damages on a separate damage report stating that the damages were not picked up on the initial inspection even though they're photographed on the initial inspection with costings alongside them. This is an ongoing case but trying to get any contact through the company is extremely difficult and has been from the start so I will be raising the issue with my bank once the pending transaction clears for them to also get involved.

Alongside all of this when presented with the van it was covered in bumps, scratches, dents and cracks done from previous incidents that would have subsequently been charged for but the repairs never carried out and the costings they put on their quotes are extremely excessive considering that they do not carry out the repairs.

title: Booking cancelled without reason, zero assistance
text:
We booked a motorhome with Indie Campers in Lisbon two months ago, all confirmed and paid for (600‚Ç¨). We receive an email: reservation cancelled without any explanation.

They reimbursed us, yes... but now a camper like that costs twice as much.
We found ourselves with no last-minute alternative, skyrocketing prices, and completely nonexistent customer support.

The phone number? Nobody's answering.
Emails? They tell you they're not being read.
The chat? Just automated bots, impossible to talk to a human.
We were left without travel and with real economic damage.
This management is unacceptable, unserious and totally disrespectful to customers.
We expect additional reimbursement or some form of compensation.

title: They're crooks! Don't book with them!
text:
They're crooks! We have rented many times with other companies and we have never had problems, with them instead they never end.
At the time of collection of the vehicle we were deducted more than 2000 ‚Ç¨ without warning ‚Äúin case we caused damage to the vehicle‚Äù disrupting the entire budget of the holiday. During our stay in Sweden we received a parking ticket that we paid correctly in the following days, after a few days from the delivery of the vehicle we are deducted the equivalent of double the fine. We write several times to receive assistance by sending the bank receipt of the transfer and no one has ever replied. After 8 days from the delivery of the vehicle they charge us almost 400 ‚Ç¨ for a small scratch that we never caused. Despite the drop off the campervan was checked and no problems were reported and our deposit was unlocked.
They're looking for excuses over excuses to steal as much money from you as possible. Read this review, find out about it on the Internet and don't make the same mistake as us! Choose a more serious company that doesn't make your vacation a nightmare.

title: Total Ripp off. Sausage campervan ever
text:
Campervan rented for two weeks. From day 1, things went wrong. The fly windows and awnings didn't work. It was 35 degrees so we slept with everything open. We have a 6-month-old baby who was bitten by a mosquito or other animal every 5 minutes at night, just like us..of course this was accompanied by a lot of crying. Luckily I'm handy and the next day I was able to fix everything a bit. ( This is not my job I am certainly not traveling )
On day 2, the fridge broke down. We came back from a trip and came back to a fridge full of food that was getting bad. As well as the food for our baby.
The person who handed us the camper doesn't care. It's day 3 of our trip and we already don't have a fridge. Every night at restaurant costs too much money and is not possible with baby.
Our relaxing journey has been all stress so far.
Our camper trip with something more luxurious has been a hell of a journey so far.
DO NOT rent a camper from Indie campers. You're going to get ousted. The camper is a dump on wheels. The mattresses give you back pain if you are only 5min on it.
Normally you want your trip to last as long as possible. I want this trip over as soon as possible, so I don't have to be in this camper anymore.
Pure rip-off!

title: INDIE CAMPERS- TO BE AVOIDED AT ALL COSTS
text:
Terrible experience
Awning not working and still they have the face to tell me that all is well
Customer service non existent
Road tax not paid on top of it and not managed to obtain RAC service
Stay clear- Stay clear

title: Abandoned by indie campers in the middle of nowhere
text:
My boyfriend and I rented a campervan through Indie Campers for a 12-day trip to Italy. We checked in last Sunday in Lisbon and on Monday evening, already in the Pyrenees, the engine started to overheat. Today is Wednesday and we have been waiting for three days for assistance from Indie Campers, which only works via WhatsApp messages. They take hours to respond and every day they say that we will only have the trailer and taxi the next day. The order of events was as follows:
Day 1 - before leaving the pick-up center I noticed that one of the tires was completely destroyed. I asked to have it replaced and was told that I had a spare tire in case that one burst and to contact roadside assistance the next day. After complaining a lot, they replaced the tire, with a different one on the other axle, which is unsafe and illegal. I left Lisbon 4 hours late having paid more than ‚Ç¨140 for an early pick-up.
I asked them to open the bonnet because it wouldn't open. The mechanic on duty said, laughing, "But you're a mechanic? You don't need to open the bonnet."
Day 2 - The van overheated. The roadside assistance responded 1 hour later telling me to put more coolant in the tank (the bonnet wouldn't open). After trying a lot, I opened the bonnet and put water in because the tank was completely empty and I was in the middle of nowhere. I drove 1km and the van overheated again. I discovered that a pipe on the bottom of the engine was broken. I reported this to the roadside assistance. 3 hours later they said they would pick up the tow truck the following morning.
Day 3 - I was informed that the replacement car would be delivered at 3:30am in the opposite direction of the route I had to take. I refused and asked for another pick-up point, which I had to find myself. They accepted. At 4pm they said that it would not be possible to transport it today and that it would be done tomorrow morning. Day 4 - It's 2pm and I'm still abandoned.
We'll see what happens next. We're desperate, with a van that won't move. We paid ‚Ç¨1,700 to make a trip that won't happen. We don't know what else to do.
In√™s Pereira

title: False damage charges made 1 full month after drop off
text:
In May of this year, I rented one of the most expensive RVs from this company. The service started off poorly ‚Äî they delivered the vehicle an hour and a half late because ‚Äúit wasn‚Äôt ready.‚Äù

The trip went smoothly, and when I returned the vehicle, the employee who received it told me everything was fine after checking it and that I was free to go. I handed over the keys and left. Shortly after, they refunded my deposit, and I assumed everything was settled.

A FULL MONTH LATER, after I had already returned to my home country, they contacted me claiming they had found supposed damage to the vehicle and were now trying to charge me over $2,800 USD for repairs.
How is it possible that damage would appear a month later, and no one noticed it at the time of drop-off?

The company refuses to cancel the charge, even though I have a photo of the RV taken the night before it was returned, clearly showing it without any damage.

Be extremely careful with this company. If you already rented from them, make sure you document absolutely everything and don‚Äôt trust any verbal confirmations.

A completely abusive and frustrating experience.

title: Never again!
text:
My experience with Indie Campers was among the worst I have ever had with a rental service. Below are the main reasons why I strongly advise against this company:
1. Serious technical problems with the vehicle:
Not even a hundred kilometers after the withdrawal, a warning light came on that read "Lower the oil level. Go to the workshop." It was midnight and we had to stop at the first autogrill we met and spend the night there. The next morning, we contacted our trusted mechanic who advised us to find a mechanic in the area to do a check explaining that some of the oil was definitely to be removed to avoid damaging the engine in the long run (problem that can happen with diesel engines - I will not dwell further). Embittered but with no other choice, on Saturday morning (Holy Saturday), when we woke up, we looked for a local mechanic and went to his workshop. The mechanic made all the necessary checks and, listen listen, told us that indeed part of the oil was to be removed practically repeating the exact same words of our trusted mechanic. This detour obviously cost us both money and precious time. Despite sending Indie Campers an itemised invoice for the mechanic at the end of the rental, Indie Campers still maintains that it was probably a faulty sensor! Almost implicitly stating that both I and the two mechanics (who don't even know each other!) are insinuating the fake!

2. Further problems with the vehicle:
In addition to the oil, we had problems with the gas (which we solved thanks to my manual skills) and the leaking bathroom sink. All this during a traveling trip where every comfort is paramount.

3. Delay in delivery
The motorhome was delivered to us two hours late, without warning and without any form of compensation. If we had been the ones to return it late, the penalties would have been triggered without hesitation. Insomnia, double standards, double standards: when it comes to cash, Indie Campers is very quick and unyielding. But when it comes to acknowledging their mistakes or offering a refund, they become vague, evasive, and entrenched behind ‚Äúinternal procedures‚Äù and their Ts&Cs.

4. Unacceptable pressure on return:
At the end of the rental you can receive the "way sheet" only after filling out a review via a link sent by Indie Campers itself, by email, sitting immediately. A truly absurd attitude, bordering on psychological intimidation to force positive feedback.

5. Poor customer support:
The responses received to the email exchange that lasted more than a month were superficial and lacked any real will to resolve. They pretend to appreciate the feedback and then send copy and paste emails that offer no form of compensation even behind a certified problem.

In summary: Indie Campers is a company that demands punctuality and payments from customers, but that proves totally unprepared, reluctant and arrogant when it comes to taking responsibility.
The trip was compromised by avoidable technical problems, poor support and total lack of correctness. Never again.

If you want to rent a van/camper, contact a certified dealer who guarantees professionalism and assistance. It might seem SLIGHTLY more expensive but considering that with Indie Campers full insurance is not included, the gas cylinder is to be purchased separately, etc. etc.... those extra euros will make you gain health!

title: Avoid at all cost
text:
Van did not have toilet cassette installed so we could not use toilet in van. Support advised us to stay at campsites and purchase a cassette when we came across one and that they would reimburse us. We are still awaiting reimbursement. The staff at the pickup location also told us to keep the grey water open at all times, which is quite bad for the environment. Ad blue light came on within 2 hours of picking up. Propane tank was not totally full AND we were charged twice for it from Indie in addition to filling it ourselves. Still awaiting resolution on these issues from Indie campers. Not to mention the ma y hours we spent trying to find a place that sold the cassette and additional stops and alterations to our plan caused by the lack of a working bathroom on the van. When we finally found a place to purchase it, Indie support didn‚Äôt answer for over an hour and then told us they didn‚Äôt know the model of cassette!!!! The experience with a camper is super fun and the only reason for 2 stars. Would highly recommend using Roadsurfers instead.

Update on 9 June: we are still awaiting a reimbursement for the cassette and double charges totaling over 4000 NOK. Indie campers has completely stopped responding to us for two weeks.

title: A fraud!!!
text:
Bad service!
The leisure battery didn't charge so we didn't have water or light. We had q stop at campings to cook, use dishwasher etc, and of course, pay for these services.
Impossible to contact by phone. Only wsap but no one responds.
Not even the emergency phone number works. A fraud !! Avoid renting in this company!!!

title: Avoid Indie Campers if you can!
text:
We rented a van from Indie Campers in Edinburgh and wouldn‚Äôt do it again. We arrived at 3 PM and didn‚Äôt get the van until after 7. We were there a bit early, but still ended up waiting over 4 hours.

The staff at the depot were doing everything they could and were clearly trying their best, but they were massively understaffed and completely overwhelmed.

When we finally got the van, it didn‚Äôt feel properly cleaned ‚Äì the toilet was empty but still smelled awful, like it hadn‚Äôt been properly disinfected. The handover was rushed, and it quickly became clear the van wasn‚Äôt in great shape either: The kitchen drawers didn‚Äôt close properly while driving, most blinds were broken so we had to use towels for privacy, the indicator light kept giving us a warning and kept coming up when driving.

Small things that added up and left us feeling very frustrated. We complained to Indie via WhatsApp whilst on the trip but they did very little to help and told us to try and fix the blinds ourselves.

To top it all off, we completed the van drop off, inspection and had our deposit returned. One week later we got notice that they charged us ¬£1,400 for a small dent in the side of the van we didn‚Äôt even notice which is outrageous.

Like I said, the staff were doing their best, but the company behind it just seems to be after your money. So just be careful. Avoid Indie Campers if you can as it‚Äôs just not worth the hassle!

title: Hands off!
text:
Misleading information from landlords. We had to pay for services that we didn't even use. Indie Campers refuses to refund them.
Hands off!

title: Scam artists
text:
Avoid this company.
They will keep your deposit making up that you damaged the vehicle.
Stay clear of them.
Would never recommend this company

title: Changed reservation with no notification ruined vacation
text: IndieCampers is impossible to contact and when I sent emails to try and figure out why they made a drastic change to my reservation I never get a reply. Their chat bot does not even reply other than saying "my name is Danish Saleem and I am glad to assist you today." Emails go unanswered. I think IndieCampers is a total scam that just steals your 50% deposit and has horrible customer service. I have tried several phone numbers found online and none of them even ring up or have an answering machine. Do these RVs even look remotely the same??? NO!!!

title: PUT THEM OUT OF BUSINESS
text: DO NOT USE INDIE CAMPERS. there was minimal damage to the car (think $100-$200 maximum). They told us at drop off that there will be no charge and even if there was it would be less than $300. 1 ENTIRE MONTH LATER, we were charged our security deposit of $5600 and insurance and a bill for $8000. THEY ARE NOT RESPONDING to a single email or call and leaving us in the dark. This company should be put out of business ASAP.

title: Rental Gran California
text: Unfortunately the vehicle gave us problems with water and gas and the customer service was unable to help us. We hired a vehicle with a higher average price precisely to give us a sense of freedom but unfortunately this was not the case. We will no longer use this company for our family trips!

title: DO NOT RENT A VAN WITH INDIE CAMPERS!
text:
Disastrous experience!!!

I rented a van in Faro via IndieCampers, and a week later I returned it to their local partner, Indicar. When I returned, no damage was reported to me, I did not sign any documents attesting to any damage, and everything seemed in order.
I would also like to point out that I took the formula with total premium insurance!

But a few days after my return home, I discovered several attempts to charge my credit card: one for ‚Ç¨691, then another for ‚Ç¨350, without any clear justification. Then I receive an email accusing me of damaging the van, followed by threats of recovery if I do not pay immediately.
Besides, I never got my deposit back for 199 euros!

I strongly contest these unjustified accusations and aggressive methods. I have never validated or been informed of any damage during the restitution. This is unacceptable, and in my view illegal.

I definitely recommend against renting a car with IndieCampers (and their partner Indicar in Faro). This experience was stressful, unfair and seems like a real scam. Too much risk. Run away from this company.
DO NOT RENT A VAN WITH INDIE CAMPERS!

title: DO NOT USE INDIE CAMPERS
text:
Firstly Faro pickup location is small with no parking, needed to move our car 5 times while waiting.
Ordered a specific Atlas 5 Auto as this suited our needs, but upon collection Indie Campers had changed the camper without our knowledge. When we complained they said the van we wanted was available but had not been cleaned. So we had to wait 1.5 hours while they "cleaned" the camper.
After 1.5 hours waiting, the camper van was supplied with the grey water tank still full and the water tank still full of stagnant water. We had ordered a gas bottle but what was supplied was not a full one as they did not have the correct gas regulator.
Freezer had no door. Part of the fridge were held together with sticky tape. Window hinges were missing or broken. Window blinds held together with more sticky tape or parts missing so blind would not stay down. Paid extra for outside chair, this was covered in mud.
Worst was that the toilet was broken forcing us to return back to Indie Campers for a repair.
We paid an additional ‚Ç¨92 for early pick up at 10.30am - eventually left Indie Campers at 15:15 with the van in the above state except toilet working.
Local staff said contact Indie Campers after the trip to complain - he showed us on the website where to do this. He also said they get complaints daily about the camper van conditions but the company do not allow them to take them out of service to make the repairs.
The reply from Indie Campers was staggering.
They said we had not followed procedures by reporting the fault during the trip. I said this would be a waste of time as you would not send an engineer to a campsite to fix the physical problems with the van. Their reply, it is policy to use WhatsApp to report faults.
I asked for early pickup to be refunded - their reply NO as we decided not to take the van they wanted to supply - even though it did not meet our requirements
They blamed us for breaking the toilet - even though we literally collected the van, went to my house to load up (I live in the Algarve 15 minutes from Indie Campers) and tried to insert a chemical tab.
Said they are not responsible for cleaning the chairs - when we took they keys we accepted the van in that condition, and therefore entered the contract. Same applies for parts held together with sticky tape - we accepted the keys and therefore entered into a contract.

After many emails, I got ‚Ç¨39 compensation - still to be paid.

Terrible van - i have even seen reviews where vans have broken down due to no oil in the engine - and remember you have signed the contract at that point so you are responsible.

Indie Campers tried to have my Trustpilot review taken down - Trustpilot said no, good on them.

Do not use these people. Be aware of who you are entering a contract with.

title: INDIE CAMPER SCAMMERS
text: THEY'RE SCAMMERS. NEVER HIRE THIS SERVICE IF YOU DON'T WANT TO BE ROBBED. They give you the camper in terrible condition and then they want to take care of any scratches (that I already had) To save us that disgust we hired the premium insurance to be covered 100% , so and everything, they debited me ‚Ç¨3,000 from my account for damages that I did not do, and they also do not detail what is the amount of each damage in any case. Anyway, they take money off your face.

title: Beware!
text: Terrible company -- I wish I had researched it before booking! Their "24/7" chat doesn't work, they don't respond to emails and their phone number leads to someone who can't hear anything on the call. Stay clear!

title: Do not rent a camper from Indie Campers
text:
I want to warn everyone about Indie Campers. Do not rent a camper from them!
Three weeks after the van was approved at drop-off, they suddenly charged ‚Ç¨3,000 to my credit card, claiming I had caused damage. They sent photos, but it could have been any camper van ‚Äî there‚Äôs no proof it was the same vehicle.
Besides that: I had purchased their most comprehensive insurance, with a deductible of just ‚Ç¨200. So even if the damage had been mine, I should have been covered. At pick-up, staff clearly told me that everything was insured ‚Äî only reckless driving would not be covered. Unfortunately based on that, and the all-clear at return, I didn‚Äôt take photos.
And honestly, there‚Äôs more to complain ‚Äî but I‚Äôll leave it at this for now.
Now that I am reading other reviews I found out I am not the only one who became a victim of their mal behaviour.

title: Disenchantment
text:
Like many opinions, mine is unfavourable.
What is described below is live. I am currently in Austria, my plan was to take the Van to Vienna and return it to Milan.
Recovery of the Van went well, the employee even spoke French which allowed me to have clear reminders of instructions.

I lost my engine at the end of the third day when the Van had run very well during the day. The light asking for Adblue came on suddenly and then the engine stopped in the middle of town. The situation was very stressful. Despite picking up Adblue from the nearby gas station I added, the engine didn‚Äôt want to know anything. (NB: I had even asked the employee again how to check the product level and she literally told me I didn‚Äôt need to worry about it). Now I think she didn‚Äôt know what she was talking about.

Fortunately, city employees helped me push and park the truck safely.
Currently, indie Campers‚Äô 24/7 emergency services (only via chat) have still not responded to me (I contacted them more than 4 hours ago) either via WA or on their website. I am therefore in the unknown in the heart of Austria.

I am very disappointed by this lack of responsiveness and professionalism to this complicated situation that could have happened in the mountains.
I had to stay for the night at the last minute (270‚Ç¨).

If you are not convinced by this review, For little more:
The kitchen equipment is rudimentary, not even a pair of scissors, no bowls or cups to drink. I asked for a cleaning kit = shovel and wiper, not even a sponge and a cloth. And the sheets are stained.

Future action

title: Disappointed by the Service ‚Äì Hoping for a Response
text:
I expected better from Indie Campers. When issues came up during my trip, the online assistance was frustratingly slow and unhelpful ‚Äî responses felt automated, with little effort to actually solve the problem.

Even worse, customer service after the trip has been disappointing. It's been difficult to get clear answers or accountability. I‚Äôve tried to raise my concerns, but so far, it feels like I‚Äôm being ignored.

I‚Äôm still hoping someone from Indie Campers will take this seriously and reach out to resolve the situation. Until then, I can‚Äôt recommend their service.

Justine Hermant JVQ96V

title: 24/7 ASSISTANCE.. Are we sure?
text: I still have to start the journey and already I feel like giving a negative assessment. 24/7 chat (are we sure?) boasting that they have added a REAL PERSON to the conversation but then write nothing. There is no phone number to talk to someone. Double credit card charges even if the site declined the reservation. We're off to a great start.

title: ‚Ç¨1129 trouble and nefarious customer service
text:
A frustrating experience with Indie Campers. We paid over ‚Ç¨1100 for 5 days of travel and from the first moment it was a disaster.

When we arrived, they tried to give us a different camper (although bigger), which did not serve us by the route we planned. Finally, they agreed to give us the model we had originally booked, but it was broken: the water pump was not working. We agreed to take her only on condition of financial compensation, as it was late and we had no choice.

But the problems didn't end there:

The heating did not work because a window sensor detected that it was open, when it was not. We spent two days without heating, wasting time of our trip looking for solutions in blogs and videos until we managed to fix it on our own.

We were given only one gas cylinder, when there should have been two.

The swivel seat of the co-pilot, key to comfort eating, had no locking system and rotated only constantly.

During the trip the blinds went off their rail and we had to find our own life to put them back so that the light would not bother us.

The bathroom door opened itself all the way, even during driving, being a great danger.

To top it all off, many charging connectors weren't working either.
Compensation for all these failures? 25‚Ç¨ and refund of extras. A real mockery in front of everything we suffered and time wasted during a trip that should be to enjoy.

We feel ripped off. Indie Campers is not responsible, offers no real solutions and its customer service is practically non-existent.
We will not rent with them again and we recommend that you seek a more serious and professional company.

title: Extremely dangerous and illegal rental. No fair resolution.
text:
Extremely dangerous and illegal rental ‚Äî avoid Indie Campers at all costs.

We rented a motorhome from Indie Campers UK in April 2025, and the experience quickly turned from disappointing to genuinely dangerous.

At pickup, we were presented with a van in shocking condition, torn seats, broken fittings, missing components, an exposed 240V exterior socket, and a filthy interior. I raised concerns, especially about what appeared to be illegal tyre tread, but was assured by staff it was just cosmetic and the van was mechanically sound. The only alternative vehicle they offered would've meant we lost a whole day of our trip, so we reluctantly took the van.

On day one, a brake fluid warning light appeared. Support told us to purchase brake fluid and top it up ourselves. We did, but two days later, while driving on steep Highland roads, the brakes failed completely.

We were stranded in a remote location, with Indie Campers‚Äô only support channel being WhatsApp message, which took up to 3 hours per reply. Eventually, after being told to take the van to a garage it was confirmed the vehicle had serious safety defects, including illegal tyres, no functioning brakes (obviously), and more shockingly that the MOT had expired four months earlier! This meant the van hadn‚Äôt had a legal roadworthiness check in 16 months.

We were left without a working vehicle, and stranded for 12 hours. Our holiday was cut short, and we had to fight for basic assistance from their support. Eventually, we had to take a three hour taxi to stay overnight in a hotel where we had to cart all of our luggage from each place; and then drive a rental car three hours back to Edinburgh.

Back in Edinburgh, we returned to the depot, only for staff to openly admit that they don‚Äôt check MOTs or roadworthiness, only basic visual inspections. A blatant violation of UK law and a gross failure in duty of care to their customers.

Furthermore, a staff member accessed our personal data from the rental agreement and used it to locate us on social media, which we believe to be a serious breach of data protection (UK GDPR). Indie Campers has denied this, but we hold evidence to the contrary.

Indie Campers has since issued a refund (which was their legal obligation), but have refused any meaningful compensation for the risk to our lives, the emotional distress, and the severe negligence that ruined our trip. They won't even acknowledge the fact that the vehicle had no MOT and they even declined to refund the two nights of campsite bookings that we missed because of the breakdown.

We are now pursuing legal action and have reported the company to the police and Information Commissioner‚Äôs Office (ICO).

If you value your safety, your holiday, and your legal rights, do not book with Indie Campers, and if you do; check your vehicle at least has an MOT!

title: A scam disguised as a van rental company
text:
This was a scam. Period.

Indie Campers charged me over ‚Ç¨3,000 for a supposed dent on the roof of the van ‚Äî a damage I absolutely did not cause. I returned the van exactly as I received it, without a scratch. They didn‚Äôt even do the final inspection with me. They told me to just leave the keys and they‚Äôd handle it‚Ä¶ Days later, I got an email with some photos and a ridiculous invoice.

It‚Äôs a clear scam: they don‚Äôt let you be present during the inspection, then they claim there‚Äôs damage and charge you a huge amount, knowing you can‚Äôt prove anything. And worse ‚Äî they take advantage of young renters under 25, who aren‚Äôt allowed to purchase full insurance, and then trap you with charges you have no way to fight back against.

I‚Äôve already filed a consumer protection complaint and will keep pushing this as far as I need to. If you‚Äôre reading this before renting: don‚Äôt be fooled by the trendy branding and slick website. If something goes wrong, they‚Äôll throw you under the bus and leave you completely defenseless.

title: Appalling company - DO NOT USE
text: The van's toilet cassette was not empty. The deposit has not been returned due to a wholly ridiculous damage claim that is now in court. DO NOT USE!

title: BEWARE RENTING FROM HERE!! READ THE REVIEWS AND BELIEVE THEM ALL!!
text:
****This experience is currently active.

We reserved a couple days before the trip. I've seen Indie Campers all over the world and figured they were legit. And, of course we purchased the Premium Insurance. The night before, I read some of the reviews and became concerned. On trip day, we arrived at our designated pick-up time. Only had to wait 1 1/2 hrs. That was good compared to things I'd read. We thought we had scored as our rental was a brand new motorhome. The 30ft. Pursuit 27xps. It looked clean, but got it home and there was dust everywhere. I don't think it was ever wiped down from when they received it. There was a hefty "prep fee", yet clearly no prepping was done as the floors were dirty, the van dusty all over, the toilet paper dispenser hadn't even been added nor did they catch it was missing a ladder or check the heat and a/c. There were no videos up for us to watch either. I had to clear all the dust out, but we were excited.

We drove from San Francisco to Oregon. A few hrs. into our ride, we realized the A/C didn't work. A 14 hr. ride without A/C was awful. We rented the big motorhome so we could transport my disabled father. No A/C for him was not what we bargained for. As we got closer to Oregon and the sun went down, we tried the heat. We didn't have that either. That was the first of our issues. We also noticed the steering wheel seemed to have a lot of wiggle room. Getting ready for bed, my father got the big bed while my husband and I took the bunk. That's when we realized there was no ladder. No ladder meant no bunk. It gets better.

Parked in OR for 4 days. That was great minus the uncomfortable sleeping arrangements. Husband on the couch and me on the table. Everything seemed to work fine. On the ride home, we were either freezing or excruciatingly hot. A few hrs. out, we noticed the brakes squeaking like crazy. This is where it starts to get really shady.

I have to return the vehicle by myself. On my way to return it, another truck comes into my lane. To avoid them, I have to move over just a bit. Turns out, this RV is literally just under the max size before it's considered an oversized vehicle. Inching over just a bit where, unfortunately, there was a pole. I'm not sure if it was the pole that took out the side mirror and awning, or wires hanging off the pole that grabbed hold of the side mirror, or if the mirror took out the awning, but damage done. I immediately pull over and attempt to contact them. That's when I realize I can't contact the location. When we rented, I specifically asked the gentleman about this texting issue I read about and he clearly said do not worry about it. All you do is ask to speak to a representative and you'll get a human. WRONG. I followed his directions precisely and the human says to contact that dept. via What's App. She states clearly: that is the ONLY way to handle issues while on the road.

WHAT'S APP? Who does this? First, understand the communication is sporadic and half-assed. I can ask a question, get a response right away then wait several hrs. for my next communication. Second, it's always a different person and they literally have no idea what they're talking about. They finally tell me to proceed to the depot for drop off. However, the RV wasn't safe to drive with one mirror and an awning half off. I waited, in the heat, for 4 hrs. until my husband finally came and drove us home. Not once did they ask if I was safe, needed a tow truck, etc. They sent me some forms to fill out for their insurance and boy, are they something. The forms are from the EUA, ask for the "Federal Vehicle Information" and have a section for my "supervisor" to fill out. I asked them for proper forms and they tell me to look in the glove box. I ask if I will find the proper forms there and no response. I go to look in the glove box when I realize there's no glove box. I completed their forms, but am still waiting to receive the proper paperwork for me to complete that will also allow me to include my insurance info. as a backup to the premium insurance I purchased.

We also can't drop the RV off unless they're open. The next morning, I called AAA to get towed. Took awhile to find a truck able to tow us, I go to What's App and ask if I should have the RV taken to the shop instead of the depot to help things along. A couple hrs. later, they give me an address for a service center, but now it's going to be closed and they can only accept during working hrs. Now, we're going into day 2 of trying to return this RV. The tow truck goes to drop the RV off and the mechanic refuses to accept it. He says he told them he won't take it. The driver's calling me for the phone number to Indie Campers, but of course, I don't have one. I gave him their address and I'm currently sitting here hoping they were able to deliver it.

I just recommend before renting from them that you know exactly what you're getting into as this mess has been the most chaotic and stressful experience with a rental company that I've ever had. I've rented all over the world, including RV's in Europe. I will never rent here again and highly suggest people think twice before doing so themselves.

title: Avoid Indie Campers at all costs!
text:
I rented an RV from Indie Campers in Edinburgh for a 3-night trip in the Scottish highlands. While driving, I accidentally scratched the door and sill against a concrete bollard‚Äîa minor dent which independent mechanics have quoted me to cost ¬£525.

Unfortunately, my experience with Indie Campers quickly soured when they charged an exorbitant ¬£2,820 for the repairs! This is almost 5 times higher than what a reputable mechanic in the area quoted!

Although we had an insurance with a maximum liability of ¬£2,500 (basic package), almost every kind of damage is an exclusion to its coverage.

Despite my immediate objection, they proceeded to debit ¬£2,820 directly from my account (only have a debit card) WITHOUT authorisation.

Attempts to dispute the charges have been met with vague explanations, internal (rather than independent) repair estimates, and dismissive responses. The company's damage policies proved ambiguous and unfair.

I strongly caution potential renters: Indie Campers may initially seem convenient, but if anything goes wrong, you risk significant financial stress due to grossly disproportionate and poorly justified charges. They will take the money from your account and will not give you any evidence of where the charges come from. Please use an alternative company with fair policies!! What was supposed to be a bucketlist experience turned into a financial nightmare for us.

title: False advertising
text: When I made my booking, the website advertised a 20% discount with a timer indicating that the offer would expire in a day. This urgency prompted me to make the reservation. However, a week later, when I checked the van dimensions, I noticed that the price was actually lower than what I had paid, even with the 20% discount applied. I requested a refund for the difference, but Indie Campers informed me that it wasn't possible. They have dynamic pricing and can adjust their rates as they please. To me, this feels like false advertising. They should be ashamed of themselves, and I definitely do not recommend booking with them. Don't be deceived by their offers; it's all misleading.

title: ASKED FOR MONEY FOR NON-EXISTENT DAMAGES
text:
ZERO VOTE because the day after the return of the camper they send me an email inventing a damage of about ‚Ç¨ 100 that they would have withheld from my deposit.
Except that these reports should be made at the time of delivery in the physical presence of the customer.
But the damage they were referring to was already present at the time of withdrawal. Such a mistake, and such an attitude FOR ME IS VERY SERIOUS.

title: A criminal conspiracy .. to avoid like the plague!!
text: To be avoided like the plague.. a criminal conspiracy ... beware !!! they will do anything to steal your money .. our camper was infested with ants .. non-existent assistance and unspeakable means ... stay away from these villains !

title: Absolute scammers!!! Don't waste your time and money
text:
Absolute scamers!!!

Don't trust the company at all, they will take a huge 3000 aud bond and then will wont return it. They'll claim some damage on the vehicle which was pre-existing!

The online support is nowhere to be found, we were left days with no contact.

The vehicles which they claim are new have warning lights all over them, the battery does not last even a couple of hours, the drains stank. We even had our toilet cassette still full at pick up!!!

They're thieves!

title: Indie Campers: A complete ripoff with zero standards.
text:
Where do I begin? Our experience with Indie Campers was nothing short of a nightmare. What starts as a seemingly affordable rental quickly becomes a money pit, thanks to a laundry list of hidden fees ‚Äî from propane to *extra charges for paper-thin bedding*, and a ridiculous cleaning policy that expects customers to return the van cleaner than they received it. Honestly, I‚Äôve stayed in budget hostels with higher standards.

The van was disgusting on arrival. Despite a worker proudly claiming they use ‚ÄúAI‚Äù to assess cleanliness, I found hair in the shower plughole, dirt caked into drawers, and grime all over the floor. If that‚Äôs AI cleanliness, we‚Äôre doomed. Add to that broken fittings (a bathroom door that flung open while driving, busted blinds), and the whole thing felt thrown together with duct tape and denial.

The bedding they charged extra for? An absolute joke. Duvet was barely thicker than a napkin, and the sheets didn‚Äôt even fit the bed. Comfort clearly isn‚Äôt on their radar.

Then came the real kicker: we tried to shorten our trip, which the staff at the collection point said was possible. But online support? Rude, unhelpful, and clueless. We were told the van had already been booked to someone else (???) *before* our rental was due to end. Make that make sense. They refused a drop-off at a different location with no reason, and we received **no refund** or even basic assistance. It cost us extra money on flights and left us scrambling ‚Äî all for a subpar service.

The customer service is non-existent, and the overall experience left us feeling ripped off, stressed, and disappointed. For the price they charge, you‚Äôd expect at least the basics: a clean van, functioning amenities, and someone to answer a question without attitude.

**Bottom line: Indie Campers wants hotel money for hostel quality. Save yourself the trouble and go with a company that actually values its customers.

Thanks for coming to my TedTalk.

title: Means falling apart, customer support equal to 0
text:
We booked a van about a month and a half before the rental. Only at check-in, through a video tutorial, we were informed that the vehicle was not equipped with either inverters or solar panels. This makes it impossible to use direct current if not connected to an external source, limiting the use of electrical outlets to 12V USB only. The 220V sockets are therefore unusable, making it possible only to charge low-power devices, such as a mobile phone.

We found a clear malfunction of the battery: we were forced to stop at the campsite to make a recharge, but even without devices on, the battery discharged quickly, reaching a third of the capacity in about ten minutes. This made the water pump, interior lights and other electrical systems unusable.

We were not able to take advantage of the shower or hot water. Upon our arrival in Catania, we were informed that the van came from Naples and we were reported a fault with the stove. Alternatively, we were provided with a monoflame camping stove, which allows the preparation of only one dish at a time. A gas cylinder was also delivered, theoretically useful for heating and hot water, but also not working.

Although the vehicle is newly built, its general condition has appeared neglected. During some nights we suffered the cold because of drafts from windows that were not perfectly closeable and insufficient thermal insulation. The mosquito nets and blackout curtains were all damaged or broken, to the point that they had to be fixed manually between the doors. The interior was also dirty and worn: the table, for example, was unstable and maintained by a simple screw.

Upon arrival we shot a video to document the criticalities of the vehicle, which have progressively worsened during the journey. Furthermore, at the time of collection, the vehicle did not appear to have been properly cleaned: we found remains of food in the drawers and toilet paper behind the toilet.
Finally, although the staff at the pick-up point were available, the number provided for emergencies was inactive.

BAD EXPERIENCE!

title: Dangerously Unsafe Van & No Real Compensation ‚Äî Avoid Indie Campers
text:
Our experience with Indie Campers in April was not just disappointing ‚Äî it was dangerous. We were given a van with front tyres that were completely bald and illegal to drive on. We were told to drive over 600km across rural Australia in the rain with no assistance, no replacement vehicle, and no support for 3 days. It was reckless and unsafe.

On top of this:

The toilet was full of human waste from a previous guest, which we had to clean ourselves.

The main access door was broken and confirmed as such by their own staff.

Cruise control didn‚Äôt work (essential on a long road trip).

The advertised oven didn‚Äôt exist.

The bathroom smelled awful due to poor ventilation and a broken window.

Despite all this, Indie Campers offered a mere $90 refund ‚Äî not even enough to cover one night of our $2,600 booking. Even a simple 3-day refund for the time spent on the road with unsafe tyres was refused.

We‚Äôve now filed with WA Consumer Protection and are preparing a small claims case. AVOID this company until they take customer safety and responsibility seriously.

title: Worst experience ever
text:
The van was old and the main door open many times while driving, no sat nav or gps .. we had to use our phone even in remote areas of Australia to guide us.
The fridge was super dirty, the windscreen has some sort of glue that was really hard to clean
I paid full insurance with them and unfortunately I had a accident and the AC broke down .. I had to paid them 4300 dollars because of the damage when the same AC cost 1400 .. completely a rip off company will not recommend

title: Indie campers is not an option for your trip
text:
THEY'RE SCAMMERS.
It's been a horrible experience. First, there is NO ROADSIDE ASSISTANCE. The camper had brake problems from the beginning of the trip, there is no phone to call, only a chat in which you are treated in a very bad way. We lay on the road and they haven't accepted our claim. Worst of all, after the trip they tried to REMOVE ME FROM THE CARD almost 2000‚Ç¨ for a small imperfect in the body that we have not made and that they argue with low quality photos.
I have seen more reviews in which they tell similar experiences.
INDIE CAMPERS IS NOT AN OPTION FOR YOUR TRIP.

title: Horrendous company, avoid at all costs.
text:
We picked up our campervan on Sunday 16th March 2:30pm from Auckland. A day later, upon opening the toilet to put in the first chemical tablet, we were horrified to find that it wasn‚Äôt at all clean and that there was faeces from previous users in the toilet (see for yourselves in the photo!). When we complained to customer services, they said it was our fault for not checking this during the onboarding process. We have rented ccampervans from companies in the past, and feel that to shine a torch down the toilet is above and beyond a ‚Äúreasonable‚Äù check in process. We‚Äôre also shocked at the fact that the cleaning rules require someone to fully clean the cassette prior to return and so this should imply the previous users had been fined for leaving it in this state but that Indie campers staff have then failed to rectify the situation when surely there are thorough checks and processes in place for a campervan to be fit to rent out again.
The complaint was escalated but we were told repeatedly the same stance and that they would review internal processes as a result of our feedback. It was incredibly disappointing considering the expense to rent a campervan with Indie campers (we had it for 3.5 weeks!) and we would suggest to avoid the company at all costs. They care very little for their customers.
In addition to this, we were told to refill the Adblue and were shocked when this light came on 2 days into the trip! We ended up having to put a ridiculous amount in (at our own expense) making us sceptical that it had ever been filled in the first place (we emptied a full 20 litre can of adblue in to the van, and also had to put in an additional 5 litres!!). At the same time as the adblue light came on, we ran out of windscreen wiper fluid - we had to also buy this and fill this up, this is after only day 2, and once full we didn‚Äôt have to fill it up again. Finally, we had the engine oil light on and we took steps to contact the 24-hour support (who told us which oil we need to buy to refill it, when clearly this is only something a mechanic would do and not our problem to resolve!!). As we were going through Queenstown a week before our return, we decided to visit the depot to speak to someone face to face, and were told that there was nothing they could do so we‚Äôd just have to keep using the van for the following 7 days, which certainly added stress to our holiday.
Overall, one star and a terrible campervan company considering none of these issues were caused by ourselves. We would recommend to avoid at all costs.

title: Fraud!
text:
There you are. Months in advance a camper booked for our young family with two toddlers (twins). Just before landing we received an email that our camper was no longer available. Once they arrived at the depot they knew nothing of a bill of exchange and could not explain any compensation as we had paid more for a larger camper. Not out of luxury but simply, because the only camper was where we could fit two child seats. At the depot I was ‚Äòallowed‚Äô to call myself to solve it. Several call requests failed to get through. By chat I was told however I finally received a response after 4 hours if I wanted to send an email. We are now with a completely different camper where we just lost the suitcases and stroller. On explanation about the child seats I am still waiting so we went to the store to find a solution. What was supposed to start as a fun start seems to be mostly avoiding contact and answers at Indie Camper. You can figure it all out for yourself! ü§¨

Worst of all, the mileage in the contract was almost 4000 miles lower than the initial reading. However, the maintenance booklet stated that the oil had to be changed every 3000 miles and that would be at a mileage of 41000 so this is not possible at all.
What a fraud. How can you live with yourself like that!?

title: THEY'RE SCAMMERS.
text:
POOR QUALITY VEHICLES AND NEFARIOUS CUSTOMER SERVICE
We rented a camper in Milan (the very nice workers) and gave us many problems from day one.

Black smoke and a horrible smell were coming out, we tried to contact the road service and it took all afternoon to give us a solution (which was basically to take it to a mechanic and pay for it ourselves). He lost us all day and the rest of the trip kept giving us problems.

In addition, after the trip they tried to charge ‚Ç¨2,000 more for damages that are not ours (having hired the insurance that covers everything). Good thing there wasn't any money in the checking account we gave them, if they didn't take it from you without saying anything.

After the horrific experience we searched for ‚Äúscam Indie Campers‚Äù on the Internet and, surprise, we were not the only ones. They use the same modus operandi with many clients.
FULL-FLEDGED THIEVES

title: Horrible experience
text:
More than advice is a warning, NEVER book from Indie Campers anywhere in the world. You will have problems in every respect, from hidden costs, to changes of means and hours compared to what you have chosen, to disproportionate additional costs often associated with non-existent damage.

Hello I am Alessandro and I travel and I have been organizing trips for 20 years.
I have travelled to all continents using all kinds of services.
I've never dealt with such a poorly organized company bordering on fraud in my life.

Let's start from the beginning.
My trip included a camper to travel all over Portugal and I rely on them.
I mistakenly did not search online for the company's reputation this time and trusted it. Only later did I realize that leaving aside Trustpilot reviews are almost ambiguously positive.
Instead on any other platform you will find several reviews of terrible experiences, many even in cause.

I proceed to book the camper unaware of this. I start coldire that the discounts they propound are fake, as they never expire so what you see are real prices and nothing taken for granted.

I place the order for a new and large enough camper because I needed to travel a long way and have some security of the vehicle.

Also to stay even quieter opt for their premium insurance and essential kits and gas cylinder.

Just a few days before I leave I receive an email telling me that the motorhome I booked is not available and that I will be assigned another model that had a lower cost and had already been widely used.

I ask at least to have a refund of the price difference and am informed that it is not their policy to return the cost.

I leave and as soon as I find myself at the pick-up I am informed that there is not even that model but an even more basic one and pass me the term quite broken.
The guys at the pickup do their best but I'm not convinced. Because I see that the model I had chosen is parked in plain sight and I am told that he does not have the documents to leave.

Let's take a look at the camper and it had an unusable curtain, the convergence of the steering was terrible, which forced me throughout the journey to stand with the steering turned to go straight. The bathroom curtain was hideous and dirty plus a dissolving pill found under the bed that soiled everything.
The windows at the top were completely unscrewed and dangled if I had not fixed them, when we loaded the water filling the tank leaked and water entered the corridor, in short, also serious safety problems, in addition to the drawers that open at every bend.

I am also informed that if we were delayed a lot they could assign the camper to someone else by cancelling our booking. I also discovered by reading their absurd terms and conditions that for every half hour of delay to delivery or collection there is an extra cost of 50 euros.
We are leaving anyway because we had no alternative.
During the trip we needed assistance for quite problematic situation beyond those mentioned, the gas was exhausted and we found out only later that they send you a list but with distant points and the only solution is to return to them by charging you more for the tank than the reservation paid, I still do not understand why.
However, assistance is practically non-existent, they respond with done phrases but never give real help.

To rest assured I check what their insurance covers in their terms after hearing the deal of delays and as also communicated by the guys in the pickup, the other and lower part of the camper are not insured, as well as all the interior and even accidents. At this point, I don't know what it's for. Take a look online at what happens to some people with regard to those who have had problems with insurance, it is something chilling.

When I go to the pickup I always have the feeling that something is strange. For every question or request posed you never have exhaustive answers and always wait for confirmation from the parent company asking with their tablet making them wait long times even for nonsense.
Also the pickups are really in uncomfortable areas and seem almost abandoned.

In short, it made everything really complicated and in the end I paid 2,500 euros for a broken camper that was worth much less. If we then add those that you read online that really stay away.

title: Avoid Indie Campers - Great Vans, Disastrous Customer Service
text:
While the van itself was fine, Indie Campers has the worst customer service I‚Äôve ever encountered.

Just hours before landing in Vienna, they informed us that our van was no longer available. At the depot, we were told we'd have to wait until the next day. After sending over 10 emails, we finally convinced them to book us into a hotel, only after waiting 6 hours at the depot, during which the team lead literally said, ‚Äúlet them go walk around somewhere.‚Äù

The next day, we showed up on time, only to be delayed another 6 hours before finally receiving a van at 5pm(with a burnt fuse, no less).

To top it all off, they refused to offer any compensation, despite it being clearly stated in their own policy.

If you never have to contact their support, you might be fine. But if you do? Prepare for 50+ emails, a wasted day, and absolutely no accountability.

title: Horrific experience, ruined vacation
text:
A horrible travel experience.
We booked a campervan with Indie Campers for two weeks, paying roughly the same as pay with other companies even though they initially seem cheaper.
The second battery never worked and we immediately reported it to support, which takes hours or even a whole day in our case to respond. Subsequently the first battery also died so we were stopped in a parking lot and it was on this occasion that they made us wait a whole day before responding.
After that they then wrote to us several times and guaranteed that if we advanced the repair costs, they would reimburse us the full amount so we did also because it was impossible to do otherwise, we were just stopped. A very high cost. We send the invoices and they tell us that we are not entitled to any refund.
This is highly dangerous (leaving two people with a non-working vehicle) and unprofessional.
I recommend booking with other companies. The worst holiday we've ever had, all because of these unfair attitudes towards customers.

title: TO ESCAPE to Italy
text:
I chose Indie Campers for the price,
I run away from them for the deplorable quality of service.

1st experience in May 2024 in Milan.
Unpleasant, rude staff, who speak Italian behind my back and make everything complicated to finally overcharge me for things I don't even understand (since I don't speak Italian and they barely make the effort to speak English).

2nd experience 1 year later in Venice.
Vehicle poorly maintained (table leg, window shutter and stove fire broken, shower vents and sinks blocked...).
At the time of return, a parking lot with vehicles parked in bulk in all directions, the container of the neighbor that blocks 80% of the passage... I park in the only accessible place. The lessor forces us to maneuver in all this disorder, with limited visibility and impossible conditions. Result: it pushes us back into the container...

Invoice: 925‚Ç¨ to pay for a plastic window angle and a taillight broken because of him and all this mess... (obviously, the reversing radar did not work either).

I chose Indie Campers for the price,
I understand that the instruction is to make up for it later by charging exorbitant additional fees.

I gave them the benefit of the doubt in Milan, but my experience in Venice confirms that this company is definitely not well managed and that the customer is not a priority, except when it comes to paying.

I advise you to go elsewhere, even if it means paying a little more, you will end up there avoiding all these disappointments.

title: Bad experience
text:
The overall rental experience was positive (Booking #2213225): comfortable, functional campervan and efficient service.
However, at the end of the trip I was charged a fee of ‚Ç¨638 for breaking only the plastic body of the rear-view mirror, a component whose real market price is around ‚Ç¨30-50.

I asked for an explanation but was told that this is a standard cost under the policy.
I regret, however, to see a total disproportion between the actual damage and the amount claimed, especially given that the amount almost reaches the cost of the rental itself.

I believe transparency and fairness are key to maintaining customer trust, and I sincerely hope the company can reassess its position.
I am available to review this review in case there is a gesture of common sense and fairness.

title: Indie campers is scam!
text: What a awful business is this! Never hire a camper from Indie Campers!!! Indie Campers charged us for a damage that we didn't caused. When we called Indie Campers thit a question over our delayed deposit, they said the deposit was delayed because of the damage. I told them we did't caused any damage but the customer service said that we had to send an email to CE sepport. When we got the damage repport with false pictures of a random campervan, Indie Campers took ‚Ç¨929,21 straight from our deposit on our creditcard. We don't know what we have to do now to proof they are wrong. But we can warn you guys! Do not hire a campervan from Indie Campers. Scam is their business model!

title: Avoid like plague
text: Customer service is just terrible. Everytime I'd ask a question to their customer support, only more questions arise. Pick up time changed, pick up location changed, wrong cable given, no screen wash poured and on top of all of that, they promised a reimbursement for a ferry and when I asked for it, I was told no. I did eventually get a half answer to that, which was that they don't do that anymore, even though it was one of the promised benefits before my booking was placed. Surprise surprise, they are ignoring my emails now. Never again with them.

title: Very disappointing.
text:
Very disappointing.
Our Jeep‚Äôs rooftop tent leaked badly ‚Äî soaked mattress, forced to sleep in the car. Proof and campsite receipt sent on April 11th. Only a single night‚Äôs campsite reimbursement was promised ‚Äî and still nothing by April 28th. When returning the vehicle, we met other customers with the same issue. The problem was clearly known. Very disappointed.

title: Scam
text: be careful it's a scam, never use indie campers!!!they gave us a non-working van, we repaired it at our own expense after their written promise of a refund, only to then say that they will not proceed with the refund

title: Worth experience ever. Unfair T&Cs
text:
Worst rental experience in my life‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve been travelling for more than 15years, always made sure my rentals were covered with some sort of insurance. My bad i didn‚Äôt read the full contract before renting with Indie. Rented an outback van (ducato 5.4m) to do a road trip from Perth to esperance in western Australia. It started on a bad taste as indie campers modified my booking 3 days before pick-up. The van was only available 24h hours later‚Ä¶
Finally we picked up the van at Perth depot. In the middle of nowhere. Pretty poor offices‚Ä¶
Pick-up was really not professional at all.
Little explanation, extra not ready (bed set, cooking set,‚Ä¶)
We‚Äôve been warned that the insurance doesn‚Äôt cover the top of the van, got the keys and that‚Äôs it. I asked to add additional damages on the contract. He didn‚Äôt bother. Been told to take pictures, i‚Äôll be fine.
Then while driving, i‚Äôve been very unlucky, a kangaroo hoped from the side of the road, and hit the van pretty badly. Luckily no passengers were injured.
Once we found signal i reported the incident to the support chat. What a mistake!!! Just been told it‚Äôs not covered. I‚Äôm liable for all damages and I‚Äôve to organise everything like towing back to depot (700km) and repairs.
I eventually made it back myself to the depot and wanted to discuss with the staff to organise the repair. Just been told i shouldn‚Äôt have told support that I hit a kangaroo. Now everything needs to go through them and it‚Äôs gonna be expensive.
I believe they gonna ripped the hell out of me with unrealistic repairs.
To be honest damages are not that bad. Wind screen, left front light and wing to be repaired‚Ä¶
I‚Äôm just hopeless how it‚Äôs gonna unfold‚Ä¶
Never heard any rental company that leaves the hirer fully liable for animal road incident‚Ä¶

Update after drop off:
Indie camper is asking for 7000$ for the repair at the check out.

No quote is even provided. I requested to check the quote, i‚Äôve been denied‚Ä¶
