title: Weak camper conditions
text:
It was our first camping trip with this company and unfortunately was a disappointment. The conditions of our camper were not the expected and the indicated for a long trip: at the departure the car oil was at the minimum, almost in reserve, the pneus without air, the gasoline almost in reserve, water was lacking in the clean paratroopes and we discovered two days later that one of the large drawers had been ‚Äúarranged‚Äù with a little piece of paper. He left during the trip and could have caused something worse.
Also in the choice of the caravan there were crashes. We visited the rental space in January 2025 to see the options live and talk a little about the most suitable caravan. We gave all the details (travel in April, two children) and we were recommended the pop top: it decided to be a bad option because the bed above did not isolate the cold and the wind that was. We had quite cold every night.
As for the gas: we had a problem with the gas box and the assistance asked us to purchase a new box ensuring it was already spent (bought 4 days before the problem - at departure). We checked and actually the box was still full so we asked for help from a caravan driver who confirmed that the problem was the caravan and not the box.
Finally... a lot of crashes that could have been avoided if they had delivered a cart in good condition.
Experience with them not to repeat and we do not recommend the indie campers for a safe trip.

title: Never got started
text:
Had an email to pick up VW at Bristol airport. Could not find depot, since then found the depot has moved into town. Went to town depot, not one there, started 'live' chat, which is a joke. Three hours later at 20:00 got an email saying I couldn't pick it up today.
Next day turned up at the depot at 10:00, no one there again. 'Live' chat said the pick up time was 14:30 so we filled in time until 14:00 went to depot still no one there. Started 'live' chat again. Spent the next 2 hours awaiting a reply on 'live' chat. Left discussed.
Hoping as I haven't cancelled my booking but they will not supply a van I can get a full refund.

title: RV Hire - San Fran - Terrible On Trip support and complaints team
text:
We rented a Four Winds RV from Indie Campers in San Francisco. The hot water system never worked, even after following all instructions and refilling the propane ourselves at a cost of $50. We reported the issue during the trip through their "On Trip" support, which was completely useless.

On return, their own engineer confirmed there was a fault (not user error). Despite this, the "complaints" team tried to blame multiple things ‚Äî including claiming we hadn‚Äôt purchased a separate gas canister (something never mentioned in the RV instructions) ‚Äî which they later retracted after admitting they hadn‚Äôt checked properly. It showed they had no real understanding of their own product or setup.

Total cost of the rental was $1300, including a $200 "set-up fee" ‚Äî a complete joke given the vehicle wasn‚Äôt properly checked before handover. Their final excuse was hiding behind their T&Cs instead of offering genuine customer service.

After weeks of chasing, they offered just $20 for the massive inconvenience of not having hot water for the entire trip.

Strongly recommend avoiding Indie Campers ‚Äî terrible support, misinformation, and no accountability.

title: Just don‚Äôt
text:
Absolutely and wholeheartedly can‚Äôt recommend Indie Campers.

Booked a full 11kg gas bottle for my journey and got an illegal to use, way too old gas bottle which was also empty. Because of the age I couldn‚Äôt refill it at official refilling stations. After issuing a complaint I was told I don‚Äôt get a refund because I didn‚Äôt use the gas bottle. Make it make sense.

Further the heating system didn‚Äôt work on the first days with minus degrees outside and had to be reset thrice almost every time before usage.

The oil change was due in November 2024 (my rental was march 2025) and for that reason after less than 24hrs after pickup the oil service was due and I had to drive a detour to another depot.

The car overall was still dirty on the outside and dusty on the inside. Plus some food remains from previous renters were found. Even though I booked the after clean service, I had to clean the car from the out and inside before drop off in order to get my deposit back.

That is also a funny fact - in order for the local staff to review my claim for a partial refund because of the many issues on the road and for completing the drop off, I was told to leave a 5 star review on google. Otherwise no action will be taken. Also indie campers shortens the salary of the local staff, if there is an issue.

So overall, sh*t service, questionable condition of campers and horrendous working conditions.

There isn‚Äôt going to be a future rental experience with them and don‚Äôt trust the google reviews. Probably a lot of people who hoped for a refund for their services as well but never received any.

title: Trust the bad reviews
text:
RV camping is a great way to travel - just don‚Äôt do it with Indie Campers!

They provided me a nonfunctional vehicle. I‚Äôm not sure if it had even been inspected before they handed me the keys.

They started out by asking me to complete and email stating everything was in working order before I‚Äôd even seen the vehicle they were giving me.

As a first time renter I definitely didn‚Äôt have the knowledge of all the different components needed.

They pointed to a black tube explaining it was to dump the waste water. However - they did not provide an essential component of the tube and I only realized this when at the campsite and tried to connect it the first time. So I had to buy this piece.

Then I tried to fill the water tank. Neither of the 2 hoses worked so the next day I had to go back to the hardware store to buy this.

The customer service acted as if they were being gracious by offering to reimburse me the expenses! These are things I‚Äôd already paid for.

There was no hot water in the shower. So only hot showers were at the campsites we stayed at.

The website boasts a TV in the camper, it actually has hookups inside but there is absolutely no TV. It also says there is WiFi on board. Another lie.

I guess with all the other bad reviews I should have been forewarned. Please do an RV road trip just with another company! RV camping is really fun.

title: Scam. Avoid at all costs!
text:
We booked the biggest and most expensive RV from Indie Campers Las Vegas for 10 days.
10 hours before pickup I got an email that the RV is not available and we will get a smaller RV. Went there on time. Indie Campers Las Vegas looks like homeless center.
In 3 hours that we waited, only 2 families got their RV. Total of 7 families were waiting. Vehicles were given out when customer dropped them off *as they arrived*. They were dirty and malfunctioning.
When I started asking a firm question: "Where is my RV?", they threw us out.
We did not get any RV, our family vacation plans were ruined.

Place was dirty, no water, no coffee, no restrooms.
They have not refunded the money. Customer service is a joke.

title: Are we just unlucky?
text:
Writing this while on day 6 of our 2 week booking with Indie Campers.

Having had multiple issues with our vehicle which we collected in Faro, the latest is the last straw.

At 10.30 am usi g the company WhatsApp on trip support number we reported that the van would not start. After 1.30 hours we still had no acknowledgement from the company that they weee resolving our issue. We had to resort to finding local assistance after which we are now unable to switch off the engine without having to jump start the van.

I should note that this is not the only issue we have had with the vehicle none of which have been resolved

Shockingly bad customer service from Indie Campers and I will not be using them again after this

title: lousy.
text:
bad, you can not speak to anyone live. I had a booking downgrade from a motorhome camper to a normal motorhome. all communicated by email, I could not cancel the booking and I was not refunded anything.
Zero assistance, only millions of emails a BOT that answers you and if you want you have to call to the USA or Portugal. To be avoided without doubt

title: Skip Indie Camper San Diego office
text:
Save your money and a whole lot of frustration. Do not rent from this company. They broke their contract with me to provide a safe RV and I am still fighting with the company to get my money back.

I had tried to call the San Diego office a few days prior to confirm the reservation, change the drop off time, ask questions about their cleaning fees but they have no local phone number. I was routed to a call center in India. There is no way to directly talk to the person you are renting a RV from.

On the scheduled rental day, I arrived at the unmarked, filthy San Diego office (which was so gross it must violate a variety of healthy or safety codes) to find that the RV assigned to me was not in safe driving condition. The vanity cabinet inside the RV was broken with the shattered glass insert held together with tape. Broken glass in the passenger compartment of a moving vehicle is unacceptable to me. Not only was the RV dangerous to drive, but it had not been cleaned - dirty dishes in the sink, mouse droppings under the bed, exposed sewer hose in the under-bed outside storage, a horrible mold like stench throughout the RV, sand in the shower, ect. I was specifically told there was no other RV available for me to rent during my reservation window and there was no way to fix the dangerous cabinet in less than 24 hours. I walked away with no RV, and desperately scrambling to save my kids' spring break. I tried to call but got nowhere. I have sent multiple emails which have resulted in cut and paste style responses. They broke their contract with me to provide a safe RV and a month later I am still fighting with the company to get my money back.

title: Theft of forgotten items
text:
Forgotten things were stolen.
Nothing was allegedly found, although we had communicated the exact subject.
Absolutely untrustworthy!!!!

title: BAD experience. HIDDEN FEES.
text:
Booked at the Edinburgh branch for a 9 days roadtrip in the Scottish Highlands. Made to wait for 2 hours before we could pick up our van because their internal system was down and they had no idea when it would be back up. All we could do was wait.

When going through the vehicle before handover, we were informed that the UNLIMITED MILEAGE was actually a capped mileage system (at this point we were furious because this was not stated on the website OR in the booking AT ALL). When inspecting the vehicle, the staff didn't go through anything at all. We had to inspect the vehicle by ourselves to make sure that we had everything we paid for:

1. Water tank wasn't filled - had to ask for it to be refilled before we left.

2. Two of the cupboards were broken - had to ask for it to be fixed before we left. A staff member came to fix the two that we mentioned but there were other screws loose, one of which was the window blinds holder, and another was the other screw in the cupboard, that we ended up having to TAPE and RE-TAPE every single time before we drove off. It got so bad that the tape wasn't holding it together and we had to stuff our luggage in between the cupboard door and the bathroom wall so that it wouldn't fly open during the drive. We contacted Indiecamper support but all we got was 'the depot is closed' and 'you will be charged if post-inspection states that the items are damaged by users'. No other help was rendered. We have receipts of the exchange with the support/ roadside assistance in both Whatsapp and Email.

3. We purchased the bedding from them but was only given ONE even though there were TWO beds. Asked for an extra bedding but was told that it would be an additional cost of ¬£50+ (this is ridiculous). The beddings, when we fitted the sheets and pillows, smelled weird.

4. Even after waiting nearly 2 hours to pick up the vehicle, no discounts were offered to us as compensation. We had to ask if they could give us the extra bedding for free as compensation, and were told yes begrudgingly. Customer service was pretty much non-existent at the shop itself.

After returning the vehicle, the checks were not done in front of us. Instead, we were told that we were okay to go and that the deposit would be refunded to us within 5 days. Nothing showed up in the bank account within 5 days. About 2 weeks later, we received an email stating the damages incurred, 2 of which were caused by a third-party vehicle, on the side of the vehicle, which during pick up, the staff mentioned that it's covered under the Basic plan insurance that comes with every Indiecamper rental. Without any inquiry about the damages, they instantly charged our card without notifying us beforehand. Also, the amount incurred for the damages (apparently according to Indiecamper's OWN price table, which we don't get to see, and was not notified of beforehand) was almost 2 TIMES the amount quoted to us from a local repair shop in Scotland, which is extremely ridiculous because the original quoted cost by the local repair shop is already very pricey. It was also very unprofessional of them to simply charge the card without prior approval from the card holder.

No compensation was offered for the internal cupboards that were broken for the ENTIRE duration of our trip. Card was charged before any prior approval was given. No communication and extremely lacklustre customer service. Would NEVER recommend them ever.

title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY
text:
Terrible Experience ‚Äì Unauthorised Charges and Unsafe Vehicle

I would strongly advise against booking with Indie Campers. Our experience was a disaster from start to finish, and it completely ruined what was supposed to be a relaxing holiday.

First of all, the van we received was in terrible condition ‚Äì it was old, poorly maintained, and quite frankly falling apart. Within the first day, the cupboard screws came loose, and things were rattling and falling off. It felt unsafe to drive, and we spent most of the trip worrying about whether the vehicle would even hold together.

The worst part? Indie Campers charged our bank account for a damage that should have been fully covered under the basic insurance plan we purchased. The damage was inflicted by another car driving into us at a round about. These charges were made without our authorisation, and we received no satisfactory explanation or breakdown of the costs. It felt like a scam.

To make matters worse, customer service was completely unhelpful both before and during the trip. We tried reaching out several times but were either ignored or met with vague responses that didn't address our concerns.

Save yourself the stress and look elsewhere for a campervan rental. This company is not trustworthy, and their vehicles are not safe.

title: At your own risk
text:
With Indiecampers, you not only risk ruining your holiday, you also risk your lives.
Not only was the vehicle we were entrusted with very poorly maintained (which forced us to return twice to the depot to have it repaired!); but above all, the campervan was equipped with summer tires, in Iceland!!!
With snow that can come on the roads at any time, we left on the side, vehicle stuck in the middle of a snowstorm and having to resort to an overpriced breakdown.

If you have already booked, take the time to check ALL the essential equipment (tyres, headlights, windscreen wipers, windscreen raisers, electrical control console, heating, gas and water, at least).

Apart from the summer tires, the control console of all the electrical equipment that breaks down, the torn windscreen wiper, and the window raiser buttons that operate randomly: car radio that does not turn on, worrying engine (engine overhaul light that turns on, particulate filter warning light that lights up...), suspended bed that comes off along the way, heating system that issues alerts, the gray water valve that does not work, the camper van manual not found, the bedding kit and the crockery kit frankly not up to standard.

And finally the campervan was all damaged everywhere, although they warn well at the start that the slightest scratch will be charged a hundred euros, despite the insurance taken out. One wonders what they do with these penalties since obviously they do not repair their vehicles.

title: You should read this ->
text: Renting in Indie Campers was the worst thing we have done in a long time, we were given a caravan of 5 with many scratches, blows and shattered in which the water never worked, told us that water is missing in the tank., filled it up, we realized at 200km that it also did not work like this, we called them and they did not give us any solution, we asked the boy where the 5th person sat and told us a seat without belt that has on it a sticker that says "do not go there in travel" the tires are summer on a trip through the north of Iceland in April where many of the roads had snow and ice, we almost killed ourselves, we have been in a car park 8 hours trying to talk to them and no one answers because the battery does not work and the caravan does not start, all this paying the premium plan that is supposed to have 24/7 assistance. You are in time to find another place to rent All photos are from when we were given the campervan.

title: Abusive repair cost
text:
I put this assessment because I can't put less.
We made a small dent (about 2 centimeters) in the ceiling. Despite having the premium coverage we have been charged 1,750 euros, cost totally disproportionate to the actual value of the repair.
The worker's treatment was correct.
I do not recommend that you use this rental company ha that any setback, however small, can ruin your trip and your economy.

title: Disappointing, bad customer service
text:
I rented a Jeep Wrangler from Indie Campers for a 4-night trip from their San Francisco branch, and the experience was pretty disappointing.

The pick-up was slow and disorganised. I waited around 30 minutes just for someone to take a few photos of the vehicle. The staff didn‚Äôt seem to know what was included with my booking ‚Äî I had to specifically ask for the bedding kit, gas cooker, and even the ladder for the roof tent. If I hadn‚Äôt brought it up, I doubt they would‚Äôve provided them at all.

Once on the road, we found that the ‚ÄúTravel Essentials Kit‚Äù I paid extra for was missing key items. The bedding was just a couple of pillows in plastic bags ‚Äî no duvet or blanket, which was frustrating once we reached our first campsite. The camp kitchen setup was also damaged: the sink extension had no support and just hung loose, so it couldn‚Äôt be used properly.

Drop-off was even worse. I‚Äôd paid extra for a late return at 7pm and arrived early at 6:20pm ‚Äî but the depot was completely locked. I called customer support several times. The first person didn‚Äôt seem to know anything about my booking and said they‚Äôd call back, but never did. After over an hour of waiting and more calls, someone eventually showed up at 7:40pm with no apology or explanation.

There‚Äôs also a hefty ‚Äúpreparation fee,‚Äù which doesn‚Äôt reflect the condition of the vehicle or the gear we received. I contacted customer service after the trip to explain everything, but they weren‚Äôt willing to offer any refund or compensation.

Overall, the service didn‚Äôt match the price, and I wouldn‚Äôt rent from Indie Campers again.

title: They ruined my holiday
text:
They just ruined a holiday of 10 days for two people who had been working hard in the last months looking forward to this 10 days of holidays, who arrived in Perth for a rent that could never start.

THEY ADMITTED THAT A GLITCH ON THEIR WEBSITE IS LATELY CAUSING THIS PROBLEM TO SEVERAL RENTALS. THIS IS UNACCETTABLE!

We arrived on time for the pick up of the campervan, with the food and stock shopping already done for the next 10 days just to find out there is no vehicle for us, even if we did the check in two days ago on their website. We even received an email from them only a few hours before the pick up time confirming our rental.

The customer service is only offering us a refund of what we spent for the rent (which is the least as legally requested since we had no chance to start the rent) OR 4 nights paid in a hotel, with low budget, and then a campervan from the 24th April.
We arrived from Melbourne just for this trip and we booked AND PAID a campervan. As a campervan is a substitute for both a car and a hotel we found ourselves with empty hands

title: Cancel reservation on the spot
text: Calgary depot canceled our reservation without any notice or compensation, although we flew all the way there. Terrible customer service. Avoid at all cost.

title: SCAM
text:
OUTRAGEOUS
Don't trust these crooks and liars.
On the surface everything is beautiful on their ads and social networks but the reality is a nightmare.
We rented a van for 2 weeks in Australia.
Despite the relative cleanliness of the vehicle and the concerns related to the electrical system for autonomy, everything went well until the return of the vehicle.
The inventory is proceeding normally and the agent has me sign the document for the return of the security deposit.
But three weeks later we receive an email telling us that they proceeded to debit ‚Ç¨1230 with the credit card for a supposed scratch on the bumper.
How can we afford to use our credit card more than 3 weeks after returning the deposit?
We do not receive any invoices, nor proof of the exhorbitant amount but just 2 photos "Check in,Check out" of the vehicle.
These photos appear modified in their favor but do not clearly show the stripes accused..
On the other hand, we can clearly see that the vehicle is damaged in the same place in the 2 photos.
They therefore blame us for a damage already present on the vehicle!
Despite an exchange of 30 e-mails with 4 different people from the complaints department, no refund was made.
This service is catastrophic, in bad faith and never answers our questions or takes into consideration the evidence we provide.
They are justified by an article of their contract, which they know by heart how to divert a word from a sentence. Obviously this article does not apply to me.
You feel like you're talking to robots, practicing how to spit out speech and typical phrases learned by heart.
Once they have taken the money, they look away from the obvious evidence of their fraudulent scheme to never repay.
It is a disgrace that this company can still rent vehicles and take advantage of their customer to extract exorbitant and unjustified amounts.
We have made a report to the DGCFRB to denounce these practices.

title: Be careful of this Company
text:
Our experience with indie campers: Extremely bad. Please don't touch this company.
We made a reservation a year ago and didn't get a camper in the end. All vehicles were in extremely poor technical condition and uncleaned and disgusting from the inside. Mold and rust, some windows fixed with armor tape etc.
We cancelled our trip and then it took us forever (20 emails with support) to get our money back. Transaction fees of ~250‚Ç¨ go to our account. Just beware. It borders on rip-off!

title: They don't offer any service for there customers
text:
Be wise, choice another company for a trip with a campervan. Look at my Google review for further information.
BAD company

title: Would you pay ¬£1,500 for a trip with fake support?
text:
Would you pay ¬£1,500 for a trip with fake support? I did‚Äîand I‚Äôll never do it again.

We booked with Indie Campers (Edinburgh) as first-time vehicle hirers: four adults, one of whom was pregnant. What was meant to be a memorable birthday getaway quickly turned.

Start with the basics: the vans are not fit for purpose. They‚Äôre unsecure, anyone can access the interior via exterior service compartments, for which we were given no key. From our experience, and from reviews we‚Äôve now seen from around the world, I can‚Äôt recommend them from any depot.

Check-in was rushed. There was no demonstration, just a quick verbal overview. Before we‚Äôd even loaded our bags, a staff member moved the van and crashed it into another, shattering a rear light that was never repaired. Still excited, we signed the handover form, unaware this was just the start.

Once we set off and drove 200 miles to begin our carefully planned trip, we discovered:
1. The toilet didn‚Äôt work, very concerning especially with a pregnant passenger.
2. The windscreen blinds wouldn‚Äôt close, compromising privacy.
3. No key for the service compartments, making the van completely unsecure.

We‚Äôd paid nearly ¬£200 for ‚Äúpremium insurance‚Äù with promises of ‚Äúroadside assistance‚Äù and ‚Äúon-trip support.‚Äù In reality? Support was WhatsApp-only, and every solution required us to pay upfront‚Äîeven for repairs.

I contacted support from night one to late the next afternoon. Their two suggestions:
Visit a repair centre at our own cost (vague reimbursement promised as they had to use whatsapp to confirm if they would)
Drive 200 miles back to Edinburgh (we‚Äôd paid for mileage upgrades‚Äîthis alone would‚Äôve cost us 400 miles)

We chose the repair centre. Embarrassingly, they had no notice from indie (and had never worked on an indie van), no parts, and no time for us. Indie‚Äôs suggestion? Try another garage or head back to base. I explained the urgency: no toilet, no security, no privacy. They didn‚Äôt care and their messages were extremely patronising, repetitive and included troubleshooting videos of random youtube people using equipment that was not in the van we had(?).

I requested escalation. Their response: still no phone calls, just WhatsApp or email. They did offer to reimburse two campsite stays as a ‚Äúgoodwill gesture‚Äù for the toilet but the only options were still: fix it yourself or drive back.

Eventually, they said they‚Äôd contact a second repair location. When the time came, they instead sent me the number and told me to call. I refused- they own the van, not me. I requested roadside assistance again. Their response: ‚ÄúSupport is WhatsApp-only.‚Äù

We gave up. I‚Äôd wasted hours of my holiday trying to get help. We continued the trip, feeling deflated.

When we returned the van, the staff laughed it off and apologised. No power to help, they ‚Äújust work there‚Äù. We later discovered the toilet never even had a fuse installed‚Äîdespite paying ¬£173 for a ‚Äúpreparation fee‚Äù. Clearly, no one had checked the van.

Their final compensation offer? A whopping 8% refund, not even covering the prep fee to acknowledge they didn't check the van was fit. For a ruined, stressful, and unsafe experience.

This review barely scratches the surface, but please- don‚Äôt book with Indie Campers. They offer no real support, no accountability, and no one to talk to. What should have been a special trip became a stressful ordeal. I am now going back and forth on email with apparently the highest I can possibly go in their complaints team (the name changes all the time so clearly they all just pick up messages) and am getting absolutely nowhere. They are yet to acknowledge and respond to 90% of my complaint.

If you‚Äôve already booked with them, I urge you to rethink. Don‚Äôt let your holiday become a disaster like ours.

title: DO NOT USE THIS TERRIBLE, DECEIVING COMPANY!!!
text: DO NOT USE THIS TERRIBLE, DECEIVING COMPANY!!! Unfortunately, this company absolutely spoilt our once in a lifetime trip up the east coast of Australia. I have waited for a month to leave this review until we had escaped the hidden 30 day period, in which they reserve the right to hold the almost ¬£1800 deposit, and take any further occurring fees!! Having read the reviews, my partner and I have been unsure as to whether to leave this review due to Indie Campers threatening policies and other customers‚Äô experiences! We had no heads up about the tolls throughout the states, which was a total faff trying to sort out. Just a pre warning for anyone deciding to go with Indie, do your research on the tolls etc to avoid those extra costs and admin fees at the end. Another heads up, if you are hoping to freedom camp, be aware locals don‚Äôt like it! After checking with the locals in Broome, we were told there was no issues with us sleeping in the cul-de-sac. We spent the afternoon and evening there, quietly and with the van open incase anyone wanted to chat to us. We went to sleep at 21:30 and were then woken up by an enormous bang at 22:20ish. We rushed out the van to find a bright yellow and black hazard style sticker on the bumper saying ‚ÄòYOU PARK LIKE A C***T, DO THE WORLD A FAVOUR AND DESTROY YOUR LICENSE‚Äô. We believe someone had thrown a firecracker at us. We checked around, but it was pitch black and we couldn‚Äôt see, or hear anything. Anyhow, we were missing a grey water hose which we were told to go and buy and they would reimburse us, never received that money. Within a couple of days, we had water pouring from underneath the van whenever we ran anything inside. We suspected a blockage so bought some unblocker. That didn‚Äôt work. We contacted the ‚Äò24/7‚Äô contact number which is only WhatsApp, despite me requesting a phone number to call, to which they refused. After suggesting drain unblocker, they advised us to drive over an hour from the Blue Mountains back to the outskirts of Sydney to an RV garage. We changed our plans and left the following morning reaching the garage at 8am when it opened. We were then almost laughed off the site after being told ‚Äòno chance, we‚Äôre booked up for the next 3 months‚Äô. After receiving the same message from the next garage that they hadn‚Äôt contacted, Indie Campers took from 9am until 1:30pm to give us a response as to what they wanted us to do with their van. We were told the branch in Sydney were not able to help us???? A garage was then booked in for the Monday morning in Port Macquarie over 400km away. So that‚Äôs now Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Mondays plans spoilt chasing around a problem with Indie Campers van, 4 days out of our 21. I requested that there was some kind of compensation, we were told it has been passed onto complaints, Ha, good one! We didn‚Äôt hear a peep about that after making several more requests over the next month. The garage helped us and fixed the problem on Monday. Unfortunately, we were coming to the end of our trip during Cyclone Alfred. We contacted Indie Campers again and asked for some advice as to what to do in terms of getting the van back, but received very little help. We drove for 6 hours on the Sunday through the worst driving conditions I‚Äôve ever been in. We gave the van back on the Monday morning and were told all was good and that we‚Äôd get our deposit back soon by the fantastic staff at the Brisbane office, hats off to them. Having left Brisbane for our next destination, later on that day I suddenly wondered when exactly we would receive our deposit back, so messaged Indie again. This is when the tone completely changed, passive aggressive, rude and blunt. All customer service had gone out of the window at this point. This is when we learnt they could keep our deposit for up to 30 days. Almost ¬£1800 when you‚Äôre away on holiday can really effect plans!! After arguing over message, I attempted to ring the Brisbane office using the number from google to find that it is a dead line?! I then used google maps to find a nearby business, rang them and request they go over to Indie Campers and ask the manager to call me. Will rang me and was fantastic, he explained the van was all good, nothing to worry about and that our deposit should be back within 6 days. On the 5th day, I received an email from Indie Campers essentially blackmailing me by telling me that they will not release the deposit until I had left a review. Well, having read others reviews I felt I had no choice but to leave a good review at the fear they would then find scratches dents, marks or unicorn hair and charge us a fortune. The money came back, thank god. No sign of any compensation or even a message/email regarding it. Absolute money grabbing, scamming, unhelpful, holiday spoiling crooks.

title: Terrible service
text:
We rented the camper in Iceland for 7 days and as a first impression it did not go as we expected. In fact it was not delivered in good condition... tires that had to be spiked by now were totally worn, internal cleaning questionable... dirty mattresses, kitchen and stove with fouling, broken toilet cap and consequently unpleasant smells all the time... and to conclude the fridge was really in terrible condition, in fact every time it opened it came out a vomit smell.
Roadside assistance also questionable... we got bogged down in the snow (again because of worn tires) and we were not given any assistance... indeed we had to call a tow truck at our expense.
Finally, more than a week after our return after the deposit had been returned to us, they tried to charge us more than 700‚Ç¨ for a line that was noticed in a second revision (the one that was written to us by email), not provoked by us.
An email was sent via lawyer in response to this payment and at that point they backed out writing to us that they were wrong...
(Please know that before starting the deposit return they will ask you for overall feedback)
We're not picky people and we've made do, but that's not how you treat a customer...
For us it will be the first and last time

title: DO NOT USE
text:
Misold our campervan.
Booked with water but had no access.
At pick up we were told we would receive compensation as we booked and paid for a van with water and ours didn't. Even though we had our confirmation clearly stating water.

Bedding was stained and had holes.
Stereo never worked.
The generator didn't work.
Van dirty and contact support everyday.

Tries to give them a chance to settle it before reaching the trade commission and reviews but nothing prevailed.
Shocked at the service and have photos as evidence.

title: Should be avoided
text: A rental company that tries to charge you the maximum deductible they can and also earn money from overcharged extras. very bad business traits and next to no customer service. should be avoided

title: DO NOT RENT FROM INDIE CAMPERS
text: This company is not trustworthy. The only way to communicate is via their site and so as we encountered issues, we had to wait to get a response. The check-in procedure was very brief and they did not give us the opportunity to review the camper itself. The cleaning kit was a joke with no real broom or trash can and we paid extra for that. There was no tv in the camper. The chairs that we paid extra for were junk and kept falling apart. There were screws that fell out that we could have driven over and popped a tire. Furthermore the camper was not clean when received; we found candy wrappers the first night. The hook ups were loose at the camper and we struggled with every hook up and unhooking. The electrical connection was not even connected at the top (see pics). Of course we didn‚Äôt discover that until we hooked up the first time. The water connection leaked the whole time. The middle step into the camper kept coming unhooked and posed a major risk to my 80-year old mother. Most of the switches are not labeled and that was very frustrating. When I brought these issues to their attention, I was told that since we accepted the camper as it was there‚Äôs nothing they will do. Honestly I want a significant refund because this whole experience has been such a nightmare.

title: HORRIBLE HEARTLESS CROOKS!
text:
DO NOT BE LURED BY LOW PRICES OR PROMISES!
Make no mistake. This company should be put out of business! You are nothing but a dollar sign to them, and they will steal your money, your time, and your peace if you give them the chance. They basically stole $2,000 dollars from me. Danish Saleem had absolutely no empathy for my issue and did not care that I would be out $2,000. He could only parrot policies and did not seem to understand that they were taking my money without delivering a service or product.

title: Super frustrating
text:
Indie campers, is an armature company who turned a peaceful trip into an horrible experience full of frustration.
Especially when waiting to get my money refund back.
They gave me false information about the insurance, then when called me back to say that the information provided was wrong I brought the vehicle back and demanded full refund.

They didn‚Äôt pay me back for the fuel I put in the vehicle (I received it 1/4 full and returned it 3/4 full)
Saying that my bank transaction wasn‚Äôt enough proof of charge.
Moreover having to run after them all the time for updates.
I highly recommend staying far away

title: Ladri
text:
Very bad. days after the return of the camper and after checking it they send us a photo of an alleged scratch near the wheel, taking from the card the 500 euros deposit and asking for another 700.
After I had taken out premium insurance and the campervan was rechecked on the way back.
Now I'm going to have to waste time and money on a lawyer.
I strongly advise against it

title: Unfair practices to the detriment of the consumer
text:
My experience with Indie Campers was extremely negative due to repeated incorrect payment requests, opaque management and Premium insurance that proved almost useless. Following damage to a door, I was presented with a quote, as the insurance does not cover some parts of the van (spoiler: there is no deductible). The costs should be determined by a price list, but I was asked for an incorrect amount, trying to subtract the deposit of ‚Ç¨199 again, without mentioning it in the document. Only after my complaints was the error acknowledged and the amount corrected.
Subsequently, after settling the remaining ‚Ç¨1.954 for the damages listed and assessed at check out in my presence and despite seeming out of proportion, a week later I was informed that the balance had been changed because they had reassessed the damage. But how? Wasn't there an "objective" price list?
As if that wasn't enough, Indie Campers initially denied receiving the balance, claiming they only took the deposit. Only after providing irrefutable proof of payment did they admit the error. According to the contract, Indie Campers has 30 days to charge further damages, fines, etc. and that is what I think they march on. The reality is that they sent me back the same document, with the same damages, but recalculated differently.
Initially the total damage was ‚Ç¨1,954, then it became ‚Ç¨2,639, but at times I was even asked for ‚Ç¨3,124. When asked for an explanation, they simply forwarded the same document, without any concrete justification for the price changes, claiming that they had the right to internally reassess the damages.
Meanwhile, reminders of payment continue to arrive with threats of legal action, without the actual amount owed being clarified first.
After the umpteenth email in which I asked to speak to someone (impossible) or to receive detailed evidence on the changes in the amounts because otherwise I would proceed to report everything, their response was that they had already communicated previously that they were evaluating the situation and the discrepancies mentioned (by me).
No concrete explanation, no immediate solution, just a generic answer that does not address the problems raised in the least.
Their method seems to be this: they ask you for money with varying amounts; they threaten you with legal action; they do not provide the evidence solicited to support their claims; they do not allow you to talk to a manager; Only if you notice mistakes (after endless emails), they reassess the figure and ask you to bear with them. All this happens almost a month after the end of the trip... and the story is not over yet!

In conclusion:
Bad experience, zero transparency and payment requests without any logic. If you are considering renting a campervan with IndieCampers, read the contract carefully and be very careful: they may charge you unjustified costs, and Premium insurance may not protect you as you think.

title: The worst experience with a camper we've ever lived
text:
Our experience was very negative. We were never told how many robberies there were in Rome. And on top of being victims of a vandalism, they came in and took out practically everything, to get in they smashed glass from the driver. We had to replace it on our own, since √çndie Camper (during business hours according to Google) there was no one to attend us and replace the unit or change the glass. Where the assistant WhatsApp sent us to repair, they have no emergency, they have no glass either....!!!! We walked many km trying to get glass as it rained and it was very cold and we did not want to get away from our belongings.
When we return with the glass changed, the bill x that glass and the police complaint, we are told that the glass, original for being from another company Do not recognize it!!!! Pathetic because the same assistance to the traveler had recommended us to change it so that we could continue with our trip safely. One pays the premium franchise to avoid situations like these, but large companies cmo Indie Campers thinks in your pocket only.
We have travelled with other companies before, this time we wanted to change.... I do not recommend them!!!! Be careful, don't be naive like usüò≠

title: No respect for the customer
text:
Indie Campers = Completely useless customer service!
Mail, chat, pec...it doesn't help: they reply with pre-set phrases, copy/paste and your problem remains.

My case: while waiting for the invoice (after more than a month of payment) I explained that I had a deadline for reporting (almost 2,000 ‚Ç¨ of advance spending) and that I would lose the refund if I did not receive the invoice by a certain date. Nothing to do, after 15 days still nothing. And I threw away 2,000‚Ç¨! Thank you...you will never see me again!

title: STAY AWAY!! They don't care about the travelers AT ALL.
text: I would NEVER NEVER use this company again. I went with them as their website seemed detailed and they have a world wide presence. Our experience was EXPENSIVE and FRUSTRATING! We paid for "out of hours" pick up, which they said they could not accommodate. They would not refund. Quality of van horrible--holes in sheets, dirty blanket, ripped, seats, inoperable lights, refrig smelled of fish, cigarette smoke in bathroom, sand in all of the cabinets. A big thing was safety as the passenger chair would not lock in place and swivel sometimes on it's own. We went to a local gas station and grocery store to stock up and the gas light came on in the first mile. While putting the groceries away, we found the horrible smells and we went back to ask for a new van, but we couldn't reverse the van as no one told us how. They had us wait over an hour and told us to open the windows. You could tell they were mad at us now as they were nice when we first got there but totally ignored us when we showed them our concerns. I had called prior to our arrival and asked about propane, and there was another extra fee for that. We only were able to use shower once as water ran under door and down the middle of the van. So we had to pay for campsites with showers since the van one was unusable. We called for help multiple times and spend hours getting the run around. I would never use this again as it wasted SO much time trying to reach anyone for help or fix things to keep going on our adventure. Now that I've heard others horror stories, ours wasn't so bad, but I never want to pay that much to stay in a filthy broken van again.

title: Hidden costs!
text:
Terrible experience with indie campers.
We booked a campervan and was super excited till a few days passed we checked our emails just to double check every thing and there was SO many hidden costs that we was not told about! More than half the price more ! We messaged to find this out and they did not want to know. We asked to change dates to reduce our time in the camper, but that was so much money also.
So we cancelled the whole campervan with the 100% refund. And still lost ¬£150!

title: Worst campervan experience ever!
text:
I have rented many campers before but never have I had a worse experience than with Indie Campers. You pay a ton of extra fees for service and preparation of your camper before pickup (about $800 in total!) And then they rent you a camper for 2 weeks that has a faulty heating system. With temperature near the freezing temperature we had to book 7 nights of accommodation cause it was ice ice cold in our van. Both me and my partner got super sick and our 1.5 year old as well. Upon contacting their customer service they were super unhelpful. They just make some suggestions: you can try this, or this. But nothing works and the problem remains. Then they suggest to buy a portable heater...
Our fridge also had mold in it and the drawers were not cleaned.
After returning the van everything was cleared upon inspection. And now 5 days later I get an email saying I need to pay for damages. With 2 shady photos included without the license plate' visible nor a time stamp. They say they will simply charge my credit card. Indie Campers is a fraudulent company and I highly disencourage you to hire a camper with them.

title: SCAMMERS
text: I would NOT touch this company with a ten foot pole. Do not trust the 5 star reviews, when I seen the bad reviews, I thought it would never happen to me. But I hired a campervan through them, and I‚Äôve been charged almost $2k for damages I did not make. If you do hire through them take photos of everything, inside and out, and even then, expect them to come back at you 3 months later claiming you‚Äôve made damages. They couldn‚Äôt even give me a mechanic quote, just fake quotes created by Word Documents. There are Facebook groups with hundreds of people that have been scammed by this fraudulent company

title: Lack of customer care
text: They don't have the insurance for the upper and inferior parts of the vans, l DON'T RECOMMEND TO GO WITH THEM IF YOU ARE NOT EXPERIENCED, if you damage the vehicle in the upper and inferior part they will charge you everything (and for the van every damage is multiplied)

title: Do not use indie campers munich
text: The service of this company is a scam. I returned a camper without any incidents. A week later, they charged me 2000 euros for a small dent in the back, which was not present when I returned the vehicle. Moreover, incredibly, this was not covered by the insurance I had purchased, and it is inconceivable that such a small repair could have cost 2000 euros. After checking other traveler review sites, I found that, unfortunately, this is a common practice of Indie Campers, which tend to be cheaper than other camper rental companies but systematically impose these unjustified additional charges.

title: Scammer masquerading as a camper hire (my opinion). Steer clear! BE CAREFUL!!!!
text: I rented a vehicle in Sydney, Australia for this Portuguese-based company. The vehicle seems to or was probably previously damaged at the time of pick up. When I returned the vehicle, I made the observation that the window had some damage, expecting it would be covered by their "protection plan", and if not, by my travel insurance. A few days later, apart from the bond, I was charged more, without any notice. Soon, I had been charged literally tens of thousands of dollars on my debit card. I complained, requested repair invoices to provide to the travel insurance and all requests were evaded. I went to Fair Trading NSW, but this was ignored. I then lodged a case with the NSW Civil & Administrative Tribunal (NCAT), which is legally binding and enforceable, only then did they start to provide some information, which was however inconsistent. After more than year from having rented the vehicle, the NCAT Member made an order to return my funds. I'm lucky to have seen the back of this, even if I was made "whole", I wasted so much time to recover my funds.

title: Poor customer service and very poor van quality
text:
Indie Camper New Zealand:
We paid for an early pick up time in Christchurch and did not actually receive assistance and our vehicle for two hours after this. We were still charged an early pick up fee and have to now go through AI bots at customer service to try and get a refund because the retail rep at the Christchurch location didn‚Äôt put in the refund request like she said they would. The staff was disorganized and clearly did not have the van ready for us at pick up despite booking an early time well in advance.

We also had several issues with the van that were unacceptable for the amount we paid for it;

-One of the cabinets was duct taped closed and was unusable
-The table leg and windshield also had duct tape holding them in place which was rather concerning about the integrity of the windshield.
-We were not given a gray water hose and had to find another camper to lend us theirs to empty our vehicle.
-The gray water tank was also full upon arrival and we had to deal with this our first day of camping.
-the fuel level was less than 1/4 tank on pick up so we had to immediately find a fuel station before starting our drive.

Overall our customer service experience was very poor and it is impossible to contact a human to help with issues, you just keep getting routed to chat bots that don‚Äôt actually get back to you.

Due to our issues with the van and poor service I would not recommend Indie Camper to anyone looking to travel.

title: WORST EXPERIENCE
text: DO NOT EVER rent with this company. It is dangerous and not worth your money. I just went through the worst experience in my life. title: Strict Policies, No Refunds, and Total Frustration
text:
I booked a camper van with Indie Campers Van Australia based on some online reviews, and things just went south from there. My visa didn't get approved, so I couldn't even make it to Australia, but they still charged me $1,338.99 AUD, no refund, no rescheduling, and not even a little room for negotiation. I mean, life happens, right? It‚Äôs really frustrating when a company insists on this rigid policy no matter what goes on.

I felt like they were just taking my money with no care about my situation. It‚Äôs hard to believe that I ended up spending so much for a service I never even got to use. I‚Äôve had some pretty bad experiences before, but this one really takes the cake. It‚Äôs just not fair to expect people to pay the full amount when unforeseen things, like visa issues, come up.

I don‚Äôt recommend Indie Campers Van Australia at all. Save yourself the headache and consider other options if you‚Äôre planning a trip.

title: üö® Avoid Indie Campers ‚Äì Unfair Deposit Charges & Terrible Customer Service! üö®
text:
üö® Avoid Indie Campers ‚Äì Unfair Deposit Charges & Terrible Customer Service! üö®

My husband and I rented a campervan from Indie Campers in Edinburgh in May 2023, leaving a deposit of almost ¬£1,700. Upon return, their staff inspected the vehicle with us present and confirmed there was NO damage. They assured me the deposit would be fully refunded within 6 days.

After a week, I received an email claiming they found a scratch during a post-return inspection and charged me the full deposit! The so-called ‚Äúevidence‚Äù they provided was undated pictures, and they refused to show the photos taken at the actual return inspection. They even admitted in writing that they missed the scratch during the initial check, yet they still charged me!

üîπ No timestamped proof of damage at the time of return
üîπ Refusing to provide original inspection photos
üîπ Ignoring my GDPR data request (UK GDPR and EU GDPR violations which can result in fines of up to ¬£20 million or 4% of annual global turnover)
üîπ Unfair contract terms (30 days to charge damages with no proof the van wasn‚Äôt used)
üîπ Extortionate repair cost with no itemized invoice

I have reported Indie Campers to UK Trading Standards, the Information Commissioner‚Äôs Office (ICO), and the Portuguese Privacy Regulator (CNPD). If they do not refund my deposit, I will be taking legal action.

This company uses unfair terms to scam customers out of their deposits. BEWARE before booking with them! üö® #Scam #IndieCampers #Avoid

title: Caravan with engine problems and no return of paid diaries and no replacement of vehicle
text:
We rented a caravan in Rome (reserve 0YQ7PK) and simply on the day 10/01/2025 the caravan had a problem in the engine, we stopped in the highway for 43KM from Florence, the assistance of the highway arrived and rebounded to a nearby city (PIST√ìIA- Italia), which would have an authorized FIAT workshop, only that in the workshop they did not do this kind of service was only sale and revision of new cars and there began the despair.
We contacted the idie by the emergency wattsaap and had to send a new trailer to take the caravan to a workshop and a taxi to take us to Florence so we could pick up a replacement caravan. Which didn't happen. We had to sleep "on the street" without energy, in the cold of 3 degrees because we had no way to move to a camping.
The other day (11/01/2025) a trailer arrived and no taxi arrived to take us to Florence, they took the caravan to an office and informed us that they had not obtained any taxi service to make our transfer and that in the warehouse in Florence there was no caravan available for exchange, and they informed us that it was to give us the way to get out of there and share all receipts for refund, we requested the cancellation of the other reservation days we still had and the extra kilometers we paid since we still had 3 days of daily.
We took a train to Flore√ßa and from there another train to Lisboa, as we had a ticket from Rome to Lisbon for only 4 days, when we would deliver the caravan and follow to our next destination.
They informed that the refund would take place in 10 days, because after all these days we only had a refund of half the value, still lacking $460,00.
When contacted by the same Watssap we were informed that we should contact by e-mail because the complaints team would have already been communicated and would give continuity to the refund, since so far nothing of the refund and simply do not answer any more e-mails.

title: Dreadful Experience
text: We hired a Conqueror camper van from San Francisco. It was not ready at the agreed time of 1pm after an hour delay we were introduced to the vehicle only to discover the battery was dead and that had to be replaced. We were required to select our own cutlery, plates, cooking pots, bedding etc - all of which had been pre-ordered. We finally left at 2.30pm which resulted in arriving after dark at our first booked site. The cooking pots required serious cleaning before we could use them as they were covered in grime. The following morning we discovered that the shower screen leaked water over the whole of the vehicle floor and the towels we had been provided with were filthy and only good for soaking up the water. These then needed to be dried! We were told to get some silicone for the shower screen but that did not work. We subsequently discovered that the hot water system was leaking - probably the heat exchanger. We consequently spent our whole 25 days without hot water or a shower, having to use campsite showers and boiling all our hot water requirements! We were not provided with the chemical 'tabs' that we had ordered and paid for. There was no plug for the kitchen sink and after a number of attempts to buy one we ended up buying a container to wash up in. There was no privacy screen for the front windscreen The tank indicators did not function correctly. Although we turned the freezer to maximum and used electric hookup whilst on steps it would not keep meat frozen. We returned to San Francisco across Dumbarton Bridge and could not pay online because we did not have a US zip code (being British) So despite advising Indie that we would pay the $7 toll we were charged $27.00 and told that was how they did it! Despite a long and detailed report on the very many difficulties we had experienced to Customer (dis) Service we were only offered a 10% credit (despite our request for 20% and at the time of our complaint Indie were offering greater than that as a discount for new bookings!!) We did receive a credit for the cost of the chemical tabs and dish towels they had not provided. All these difficulties ruined our much anticipated holiday, not only with the significant discomfort we suffered but also the time spent trying to resolve these many issues. We could never advise anyone to hire from Indie.

title: Don't believe the marketing hype. They're a tech powered, venture capital driven money making machine.
text:
I had a very poor experience, my impression is they have one objective: to extract as much money from their customers as possible.

Two weeks after my rental ended they took $375 from my credit card account. I contacted them immediately. Apparently, I'd requested the premium insurance at check-in, and they'd 'forgotten' to charge me. 'Fortunately', their online check-in was broken and so I'd checked in through their online chat function, the transcript of which proved conclusively.

You might think they'd be apologetic? No, within 2 hours of raising the issue (now three weeks after my rental ended) they were able to rustle up a ludicrous and fabricated damage report. (See the pictures). Although it was convincing at first.

After sourcing better images, it was obvious they were attempting to charge me almost $700 for a reflection in the paintwork. Google Street View showed it was clearly of the building opposite.

Interestingly the damage report also specified that the damage (reflection) was down to the primer.

What do I infer from this?

* damage reports are produced without a physical inspection of the vehicle
* they're not on your side
* you could easily be charged for non-existent damage
* the depot staff have zero say in the process. They might tell you everything is OK, but it's not their call
* pay with a good credit card so you can do a charge back.

Eventually, I got all my money back but it was a massive hassle and stressful. I was lucky because the damage report they sent me was so ludicrous and I had transcripts to back up my claims. If they'd cropped the 'damage' pictures more closely, and been a little more conservative in their claims it could easily have turned out differently.

title: Stay away from this company
text: They stay away from this company, completely without any concerns with the customer, unfortunately I did not check the reviews before here, if they had read before the comments would never have been related to this company, they rent this car caravan on other random sites for 1 euros for you to work for them and take the vehicle to another city, but they can not deliver the vehicle to you 6000 euros because of lack of organizational capacity of the company that enslaves an employee (which by the way has no fault and the company was not very helpful) that they alone have to do all the functions of the company, this sad reality in full year 2025 in Europe, without any storage structure of the vehicles, then they put the vehicles in rustic terrain without having any interest, so they have been able to get me a solution, then they would try to get no money in the price of transportation, they will get the same way, they will avoid the solution that is not a compromise that the vehicles are left with

title: !!!DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH INDIE CAMPERS!!! COMPLETE SCAMMERS!!!
text:
!!!DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH INDIE CAMPERS!!!

!!!They are complete cons and will scam you out of everything!!!

This company is an absolute disgrace. My friend and I booked a large camper van through Indie Campers for a road trip from Cairns to Melbourne. It was supposed to have two double beds, a bathroom, and a kitchen‚Äîperfect for our trip. But when we arrived, they pulled the first con. They told us they didn‚Äôt have the van we booked and forced us to take a 4WD ute with a rooftop tent instead. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?! A tiny ute with a tent doesn‚Äôt even come CLOSE to what we paid for.

This downgrade completely ruined our trip. No space, no comfort, no bathroom, no kitchen‚Äîjust a cramped and miserable experience. We couldn‚Äôt even complete the trip as planned because it was so unbearable. We had to cut the trip short and come home early from Brisbane. What should have been an amazing experience turned into an absolute nightmare thanks to Indie Campers.

To make matters worse, this company has ZERO communication. They refuse to talk to you on the phone, dodge questions, and avoid giving straight answers at all costs. If you try to get clarity or even discuss your concerns, you‚Äôll be met with vague emails or total silence. It‚Äôs beyond frustrating and downright unprofessional.

And just when we thought it was over, two weeks after returning the vehicle, they have the audacity to try and charge us over $4,000 for a tiny dent! A DENT TWO WEEKS after we handed back the car, they suddenly ‚Äúdiscover‚Äù damage? This is beyond shady‚Äîthis is a blatant money-grab. There‚Äôs no way to prove when or how that dent happened, and it reeks of a scam.

Indie Campers is the WORST company I have ever dealt with. They don‚Äôt honour bookings, they lie to your face, they give you inferior vehicles, and then they have the nerve to try and rip you off even more after the fact.

DO NOT BOOK WITH THESE SCAMMERS. They will ruin your trip, take your money, refuse to communicate, and then try to take even more. I wouldn‚Äôt trust Indie Campers with a bike, let alone a camper van. Stay far, FAR away!

title: SEWERAGE LEAKED FOR 4 DAYS
text:
SEWERAGE LEAKED FOR 4 DAYS, WORST EXPERIENCE EVER. Indie Campers SF did nothing to solve the situation and offered us partial refund that didn‚Äôt come close to covering our additional expenses. RV was generally in very poor condition. They ruined our Great American RV Experience we had planned for a year.
-       Toilet broken and taped together (photos)

Indie has no solution saying they were unable to deliver replacement. Indie took over 72hrs to respond. Partial refund given after daily messages and complaints for over a week didn‚Äôt come close to covering our additional costs, let alone holiday disruption and general trauma of cleaning up other people sewerage all day.  They are the worst company I have ever dealt with. There are other options out there, please use them! They don‚Äôt give a stuff about their customers and their vehicles are dangerously and disgustingly substandard.

title: A Disastrous Experience with Indie Campers ‚Äì Think Twice Before Booking!
text:
I booked with Indie Campers for what was meant to be a dream trip in Brisbane, but their actions turned it into a stressful experience that I wouldn‚Äôt wish on anyone. I feel it‚Äôs important to share my story to warn others.

I reserved a Jeep Wrangler 8 months in advance, carefully selecting this vehicle for its off-road capabilities, which were essential for the destinations I planned to visit. Just 5 days before my trip, I was notified that my reservation was being replaced with a Trekker model, a vehicle that does not meet the standards or functionality of what I had paid for. This change was made without my consent, leaving me no time to arrange alternatives.

This substitution forced me to cancel parts of my itinerary and compromise on activities that were central to my trip. What should have been a seamless and exciting experience turned into an ordeal of frustration and stress. Despite reaching out to their customer service team multiple times, I received no meaningful resolution or compensation for the significant inconvenience and financial losses caused by their decision.

I have reported this issue to the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) and to the Queensland government‚Äôs consumer complaints body, as I believe it‚Äôs vital to hold companies accountable when they fail to deliver on their promises. Additionally, I have raised this matter with my lawyer, who will be pursuing this further. Consumers have a right to expect what they pay for, especially when they book months in advance.

If you‚Äôre considering using Indie Campers, I strongly urge you to rethink your choice. My experience has shown me that they cannot be trusted to honor their commitments, and their customer service has failed to provide solutions in moments when they matter most.

I hope my review encourages others to explore more reliable alternatives. A company like Indie Campers, which can so easily disrupt customers‚Äô plans without adequate resolution, is not one I would ever recommend.

title: TERRIBLE
text: The WORST experience with a rental. Overcharged with no refund for overage they snuck in. Terrible customer service. Dirty offices. We should have known from the first interaction.

title: Unbelievable - Do not rent under any circumstances
text:
I very rarely give bad reviews, but at Indie Campers I have no choice but to warn every potential customer.

We rented a camper from 26.12.24 to 06.01.25 and made and from the standpoint of D√ºsseldorf into the Black Forest. Luckily we were able to make a stopover at a friend's house to wash the totally dirty and incomplete kitchen kit. After only 300KM the AdBlue started immediately, which according to the employee should only start after 500-600KM - which did not bother us much, because we had to fill it continuously anyway. But then it really started. On the first evening in the camper we found that the privacy screen is torn for darkening and not raking in. So there was no way to black out the van. We were then recommended on Thursday evening to come back to D√ºsseldorf on Monday, which would have shortened our trip by 4 days and of course is absolutely unacceptable. And so it went on in one tour.

Here is a list of all the inconveniences:
1. The bed sheet of the booked essential kit was missing.
2. The kitchen utensils were so dirty that we had to clean them first.
3. The kitchen set lacked a spatula to turn meat or eggs as well as the salad bowl.
4. Two of the 4 plastic jars were torn on all sides, so the liquid just flowed out.
5. The storage space under the dining table was dirty and had to be cleaned by us before use.
6. At the bottom drawer in the kitchenette, the lock is broken, so it opens when you corner. We had to tape them every day so we could drive safely. With a frightening driver, this can lead to a bad accident!
7. The replacement gas cylinder was empty, although we were told it was full and when the first cylinder was empty we had to take a rather large detour in the Black Forest to buy two new cylinders.
8. Shortly after driving off, the AdBlue lamp was already lit and we had to refill directly, not after 500KM as we said.
9. The window in the bathroom could not be detected and ventilation was so difficult in the bathroom.
10. The privacy screen for blacking out on the driver's side lacks a small knob in the axle, which means that we had to re-clamp it daily.
11. The privacy screen for darkening on the sliding door lacked the snap-in function, so darkening was not possible. In addition, the privacy screen is torn on both sides over a good 10cm and also the guide rail is not firmly anchored in the door (screw cannot be tightened, hole used).
12. On a few days, the upper center console between the driver and the passenger drew water and it started to drip.
13. In the second part of the journey, the front light in the bed area began to flicker. There's probably condensation in it. The result was a complete loss of control, so the light was always on when power was active in the van.

The daily resetting and fixing of the privacy screen, gluing of the drawer, the always burning light and all the other points have severely restricted the quality of our holiday and is absolutely unacceptable to us.

The ongoing support conversation is also unbelievable.

Better find another place to rent a camper and save yourself the hassle.

title: A challenging time which was not a nice one
text: We arrived after a long journey my partner and i after working long hours all year.to an awful car parpark and saw the motorhome which looked unclean and not like wed expected .i asked for an upgrade but was told no.my partner and myself had rented the van for five nights and were excited to go to tiede.we were told it would have heating and hot water .when we arrived we were told the boiler was broken and no heating no hot water.Five days no washing and feeling unclean and froze at tiede with no heating minus ten degrees.It was an extremely challenging experience After returning home im still recovering from a terrible cough for nearly three weeks from this experience.We complained and they refunded us80euos.Never again!!!!

title: AVOID Indie Camper!
text:
I strongly advise against renting from Indie Camper based on my recent experience. From the outset, the process was fraught with hidden fees that significantly increased the overall cost of the rental. Upon receiving the van, I was dismayed to find it in poor condition. The interior showed signs of neglect: the chairs were broken, and several electrical components, including the outlets, were non-functional. Additionally, essential items like bed sheets were overpriced, adding unnecessary expenses to our trip.

The most troubling aspect of our rental was the abysmal customer service. Communication with Indie Camper was a nightmare; each time we reached out, we were connected to a different agent who seemed unaware of our previous interactions. This lack of consistency led to repetitive questioning and a frustrating runaround without any resolution. We encountered conflicting information regarding simple requests, such as adjusting the pick-up time, which further complicated our plans and diminished our overall experience.

Overall, Indie Camper failed to meet basic standards of vehicle maintenance and customer support. Their hidden fees, subpar van condition, and unreliable customer service make them an unsuitable choice for anyone seeking a hassle-free camper rental. I hope this review serves as a cautionary tale for others considering Indie Camper for their travel needs.

title: DISHONESTY

title: Indie Campers ‚Äì Fraud and Abandonment of Customers in Need
text:
Here I share our disastrous experience with Indie Campers on our van rental in Iceland. Not only did we face fraudulent practices after restitution, but we also faced a total lack of support in an emergency. Details of our journey are as follows:

1. Problems with mountain assistance
During our trip, we encountered a breakdown with the van in the middle of the mountain, in difficult climatic conditions. Despite our multiple attempts to reach Indie Campers, we had to wait more than 8 hours for an answer. This unacceptable wait not only put our safety at risk, but also caused significant delays in our journey.

Faced with their total lack of assistance, we were forced:

To pay ourselves a taxi (‚Ç¨680) to reach the nearest town.
To use an external tow truck, again at our expense.
This is an inexcusable situation for a company that claims to offer 24/7 support. This is clearly a failure to assist anyone in difficulty, which is not only contrary to their contractual commitments, but also deeply irresponsible.

2. Fraudulent claim for non-existent damages
Once back in France, we received an email from Indie Campers claiming ‚Ç¨ 1074,52 for "damages" allegedly discovered after the return of the vehicle. This claim is totally unjustified for several reasons:

During the check-out, the condition of the van was confirmed as impeccable. The agency representative thoroughly inspected the vehicle, took photos, and signed a document attesting that everything was in perfect condition. She even assured us that our 2000‚Ç¨ deposit would be refunded within 10 to 20 days.
We were not informed of the need to take photos on the way back. Having been reassured by the staff of the agency, we did not find it useful to take additional photos. This shows their clear intention to take advantage of the situation.
A week later, Indie Campers suddenly informs us of this fictional "damage", a practice we consider fraudulent and dishonest.

3. Non-existent customer service
Since then, we have attempted to contact their customer service to clarify the situation. However:

No consideration for the evidence and arguments we have presented.
A threatening attitude, informing us that our deposit of 2000‚Ç¨ would be withheld if we did not immediately pay this unjustified sum.
Conclusion
Indie Campers is not a trustworthy company. The following is a summary of the harm we have suffered:

Exorbitant personal expenses (‚Ç¨680) due to their lack of assistance.
Attempted fraud with a claim for fictitious damages.
Stress, wasted time, and feelings of total injustice.
I would strongly recommend against Indie Campers for all travellers. If you care about your safety, your time and your money, go your way and choose a more reliable and honest company.

Recommendation:
Avoid Indie Campers at all costs and share your experience to protect other travelers from their fraudulent practices.

title: SCAMMERS! NOT RENT IN INDIE CAMPERS
text:
We rented a camper for 10 days and unfortunately we scratched it. Aware of them we were willing to pay the damage despite taking out insurance with themselves, which served no purpose because they claimed it did not cover the scratch area. Despite this, we wanted to pay for the detail an amount but indie campers quoted us damages for 1300‚Ç¨ that we would be charged from the prepaid warranty. We could do little because we had already delivered the warranty. We told them that we found abusive, unfair and arbitrary the amount they delivered to us and gave us the answer "they are the prices and policies of the company", without giving us alternatives.

In addition to Indie Camper Milan staff, they are edges and rude. We were with a 1-year-old baby and we were held for more than 2 hours pending the quotation of damages.

Bad experience. DO NOT RENT!

title: Avoid Indie Campers at all costs.
text: Even the booking process was confusing and it seems like the booking process could be very easily open to scammers to take advantage of it. The help received from indie campers was useless and actually made me feel quite panicked. Avoid indie campers at all costs

title: Stay away from indie campers.
text: Hello we have experienced the same problems and are now battling indie campers. We hired the van in Napoli and the lady on site was fantastic.
