title: Avoid this company at all costs
text:
Complete frauds and scammers. Do not ever book with this company.

We booked a van 6 months in advance with two double beds and two days before our departure, they switched us to a van with only one bed and offered us an $80 refund. They had already tried to do this once, five days before our booking and we said it was unacceptable. So they said they would give us the van we originally booked but two days later, we received another automated email saying that we again had been swapped to an inferior van with one bed again.

It has ruined a holiday we have had booked for six months and when you call the help line, they say they can't help. Their live chat provides no assistance either.

Book with any other company if you don't want to be scammed.

title: Fraudsters, a mob internationally, don't rent with them
text:
I've had a terrible experience with Indie Campers: a brazen scam.

Rent a Carado motorhome with Indie Campers for 4 days has been one of the worst decisions and experiences I have had in this type of services. I have been charged an outrageous ‚Ç¨1,673 alleging damage to the side door of the motorhome (a simple bun under 10 cm), something totally disproportionate and unjustified. Most outrageously, the damage was not even caused by me, as I explained repeatedly and in detail.

The company's response has been absolutely unacceptable. They hide behind their ‚Äúcompany policy‚Äù like a robot, showing a total disinterest in listening to or solving the real problems of their customers. They don't care about the truth, the client, or any reasonable argument. Even when the damage was clearly caused by third parties, they make no effort to investigate or understand the situation.

It is evident that Indie Campers is a regular practice to collect deposits at the slightest excuse, regardless of fairness or customer experience. My big mistake was not to have reviewed the numerous negative comments about this company on the Internet before, which seem to confirm a repeated pattern of scams and abuses.

In addition, the service is poor in every way: the company is clearly poorly managed, its staff is unqualified and customer service is absent. They treat you with indifference and show no professionalism or empathy.

Please don't trust Indie Campers. If you don‚Äôt want to go through the same bitter experience, look for more serious and responsible alternatives. Here they will only encounter abuse, neglect and unworthy service.

title: Fraudsters
text:
Be careful, rent with other companies! Bad experience bordering on scam.
Indie Campers carries out MISLEADING ADVERTISING. The beautiful van is new that you see in the photos does not exist, for you there will be a patched van, which if you are good you will be able to use if you but badly makes you lose days of travel around mechanics.
Our van ACTIVE had to have swivel seats to be able to eat inside the van. The seats didn't turn, despite the fact that the photos and online description said so. We brought it up to service but they told us to go to a mechanic to make sure of this...
Also the sewage pipe was broken, this meant that when the van was moving there was a vomiting smell all over the van. The shower water because of this problem went down from the van and not into the black water. So the shower was unusable if you didn't want to risk a fine!
Our journey lasted two weeks and during this time the assistance was not helpful indeed, first they made us lose a day to make us go to the mechanic and attest that it was really as we said... and then keep the van exactly as it was.
In addition to the discomfort these problems made us spend more than expected, we had to make much less free stop and go to campsites to wash and to be able to eat with a table outside.
The only refund we got was a ridiculous 50 euros for ‚Äúthe repair costs. While we who rent have to compensate everything, they can compensate a maximum of 50 euros even if they rent you a non-working van (paid top dollar!!!)

title: DO NOT rent from Indie! Unjustly charged $2700 and a broken camper!
text:
We will NEVER rent from Indie again. This company is a total scam! Do NOT give them your credit card details! We rented a camper for 3 weeks in the US (Phoenix-Phoenix) and paid an amount of $3500.

On day 2, we camped without hookups for the first time (common in US national parks). We woke up in the middle of the night, in the dark and freezing cold (below zero), to various beeps and alarms. Indie only has a WhatsApp number, no phone number to call. We asked for help but got no adequate advice. We concluded ourselves that the battery must be dead (even though we hadn‚Äôt used anything that night to conserve battery), and Indie‚Äôs advice was to have it repaired at an RV repair shop. We followed this advice, but it cost us half a day, and we had to pay $266.17 out of pocket. Indie later reimbursed this amount.

On day 12, we encountered more problems: the right rear tire showed an alarm indicating a problem, and upon inspection, it appeared there were missing parts on the valve (unlike the other tires). We contacted Indie, and their advice was again to go to a tire shop. However, it was Thanksgiving, so this wasn‚Äôt possible.

On day 13, we discovered that our grey water tank was completely loose, meaning we were leaking grey water wherever we went while showering, washing dishes, etc. The tank was hanging loose underneath‚Äîdangerous! Upon inspection, we found that this wasn‚Äôt new damage; it had previously been patched with duct tape! When we contacted Indie, they tried to blame us for the issue, claiming that we caused the damage, even though we had proof that the dent on the side of the camper was already there when we picked it up. Additionally, the sink drain was completely loose, causing the bathroom sink to leak water all over the floor instead of draining properly. Indie advised us to drive to a depot in San Francisco or Los Angeles. However, we were far from these locations, and we didn‚Äôt have enough miles to travel that far. Our itinerary didn‚Äôt include these cities, but we decided to deviate from our plan and drove from Sequoia National Park to San Francisco. When we arrived on the weekend, the depot was closed, and the swap could only happen on Monday. After a day of waiting and numerous follow-up contacts, we were finally told we could swap. Indie then told us over the phone that we needed to pay another deposit of $2100. We refused, as we already had a deposit on our credit card for the first camper. The depot didn‚Äôt ask for another deposit, as the first one was already reserved.

On day 19, we discovered that the reservation for the deposit on our credit card had been converted into a full charge of $2700, with no prior notice. We contacted Indie several times, but they only agreed to "refund" the amount once we returned the camper. We explained that a deposit should be a reservation, not a charge.

For our swap, we repeatedly told Indie not to charge us for extra miles. However, in our new rental contract, Indie allotted us 700 miles (6 days x 125 miles) for the return drive from San Francisco to Phoenix. This was impossible, even with the shortest route. We repeatedly pointed this out and received vague responses. Eventually, we were told not to worry because Indie would add the miles from Sequoia to San Francisco and back as a "detour" to our total mileage.

After 3 weeks, we returned the camper in spotless condition, without any damage, and with all tanks full and emptied as required. However, we still have not received our deposit back. Furthermore, $329.77 was suddenly charged for "additional miles," with no explanation, even though Indie had previously promised not to charge us for the detour miles.

We are desperate! We‚Äôve lost an additional $2700 (on top of the $3500 for the camper) and have no idea how to get this money back. Our vacation was filled with misfortune, extra time, and money wasted on this camper. We tried to inform our credit card company to stop Indie from charging us, but this is apparently not possible. Once you give someone access to your credit card, they can charge whatever they want, and Indie takes full advantage of this.

Note: We have extensive evidence of all the damages and communications.

title: Dire experience in Iceland
text:
Dire experience with Indie Campers Iceland, I don‚Äôt usually write very bad opinions and less as long as I will relate.
On the day of pickup the van we were offered had a heating breakdown (and we talked about Iceland in December) so we asked for change, it took almost three hours to give us another so we lost the first day of vacation. They don‚Äôt warn you that the gas bottle for heating at night only lasts one night, worth the redundancy, which is almost ‚Ç¨60 bottle per night (for that and the daily price of the van you go to cabins or hotels and rent a stroller). If you have a problem the 24-hour support phone does not work (at least at night), as we burst a wheel at eleven o‚Äôclock at night and had to call 112, total of the joke more than 600‚Ç¨ of repair that we had to pay in advance (and that we contracted Premium service). We'll see if the insurance takes over and we get our money back. From an outside window a small corner was broken, which can be fixed with a little adhesive and they want to charge us whole (200‚Ç¨ which is the franchise because according to them it costs 1000 and I peak the repair). Also if there are two double beds and you ask for two bed services, because you suppose it is one for each, it turns out that when you go to pick up the caravan you are asked how many people go and if there are four people they charge you two more services because they are per person not per bed, although when you assemble it turns out that there are only two sets of sheets and duvets and four single pillows that must be what you are charged.
I add that when we picked it up, the three people I had returned were claiming and when we went to return it to two people and each of them also claiming.
Anyway a dire experience

title: BRISBANE OFFICE IS TERRIBLE
text:
Indiecampers‚Äô Brisbane rental office was an awful experience.

First, the guy checking me forgot to give me a gray water hose AND show me how to empty the toilet cassette, which resulted in me having to dump my water into a drain on the side of the street which is not ideal for the environment.

The check in guy also said that when I drop it off, we can then check how many KM‚Äôs I drove and switch to the pre-paid plan if I went over the free plan, ‚Äúor whichever one is cheaper to help you out‚Äù. Then at drop off, he wasn‚Äôt actually there and someone said I had to pay the pre paid, higher price no matter what. So he falsely advertised to me at check in.

I had a minor parking accident and dented the side of the van slightly, and at drop off I was honest about it. The guy told me they would run it through the local repair shop to get a quote so that it would be cheaper for me, instead of going through main Indiecampers which would overcharge me for sure.

I get my full security deposit back, but then a week later they charge my credit card $5,000 USD for the 2 minor repairs from my dent.

This is the most negligible, illegitimate, and unfair charge I‚Äôve ever seen with any car rental company. I‚Äôm actually appalled at the way their customer service said they would ‚Äúdo the right thing‚Äù only for them to go and charge me a completely fake number just to get my money.

I will be using my credit card‚Äôs rental car insurance to file a claim and unlawful charges for this. This is absolutely obscene and I would not recommend using Indiecampers to anyone.

title: Terrible experience
text: Indie campers was a terrible experience. I got a leaky bus in Iceland, it was raining in all the time. The sheets I had to pay extra were moldy in advance. I had to stay overnight twice out of necessity because I couldn't keep anything completely dry anymore. Afterwards, they just put ‚Äúproblem solved‚Äù behind my complaint. So nothing was ever done, despite photos, control of the persons there (who agreed with my story) and a detailed description of what was going on. The customer service is so poorly structured that there is no main office or central point that you can reach, so you always have others on the line every time you dial in for something. The staff on site also only work with the same system. Which gives a lot of ambiguity and frustration and therefore you are not really helped if something is really going on.

title: Bad experience, worse customer service
text:
We rented a Four Wind camper for 12 days in California.

PRO: easy to use website and booking
CON: bad commodities, sketchy prices, bad customer support

---- full review

We rented an RV for four people, with wetsuits and surfboards. When we arrived, they told us they were out of wetsuits, and so they proposed to remove the surfboards as well, with a refund after the check-out date. We agreed as wetsuits and surfboards are kind of a bundle.
After the rental was completed, they told us *we* decided to remove the surfboard and thus we couldn't be eligible for the refund.
0/5‚≠ê

Aside from that, the RV had minimal (too minimal) commodities. We paid for the "essential kit" and we got 2 pillows and 1 blanket. And we were 4 people!
The cookware was worse than a student's kitchenware. They provided 1 small pot and 1 small pan. Couldn't even make a pasta for 2. Not even a decent knife. We had to spend 2 hours and 200$ to buy missing blankets and cookware at Walmart. Not fun when you just spent 3000$ for a camper.
1/5‚≠ê

Adding 1 star because the desk guys were friendly.
2/5‚≠ê

I tried to solve things by writing the customer care but they were rude and ignored my request.
0/5‚≠ê

Next time we'll use Roadsurfer or a similar service.

title: BAD EXPERIENCE BORDERING ON THE SCAM
text:
The worst rental experience I've ever had. I will never rent a vehicle with INDIE CAMPERS again and strongly advise against anyone doing so. They have proved to be unfair and dishonest since the beginning of the rental.

The van was delivered to us 3 hours late, changing the vehicle directly on site without warning. Shortly after leaving the pick-up location, we ran out of diesel, without even time to reach a gas station. We had to call a tow truck and pay for it, despite the 24h assistance, expense that was reimbursed only after some time. After two days, the vehicle's AdBlue also ran out and we had to refuel at our expense, despite being guaranteed it would last for the entire holiday.

The worst thing was the charge of 1209.03‚Ç¨ for a small dent at the top of the camper, not covered by insurance. They showed us photos without date or time and withdrew the amount from the card without notifying us, soliciting several times a further payment. And this despite the fact that we had taken out premium insurance.

Finally, today I received an email from INTRUM, a Portuguese company, who contacted me through INDIE CAMPERS to collect an additional ‚Ç¨613.40 credit. I'm guessing it's a fraud for all intents and purposes.

I hope this terrible experience of mine will help anyone thinking of renting a campervan with this company, to prevent a pleasant holiday from turning into a real nightmare and a cheap bloodletting.

title: INDIECAMPERS TRIED TO BUY MY SILENCE, LITERALLY
text: INDIECAMPERS TRIED TO BUY MY SILENCE, LITERALLY, AFTER AN OVERCHARGE, WHICH THEY DO ALL THE TIME. In response to my Trustpilot review of September 12, 2024, Indiecampers tried literally to buy my silence. In a 10/3/2024 email, the "reputation agent" indicated, after "discussion with her managers," that Indie would be "happy to accept your dispute and refund you the 614.77‚Ç¨." The catch was, "We would greatly appreciate it if you could reconsider your review." When I indicated the same day in my response that I would not remove the review, the "reputation agent" responded, again on 10/3/2024, that, "After further careful consideration, we won‚Äôt be able to accept your dispute for the 614.77‚Ç¨." I am not a lawyer, but that it not only unethical and immoral, but I imagine some place to be illegal. Shame on this company. Do not get sucked in by their "deals."

title: Indie Campervans are an unreliable service amd should be avoided as a campervan rental.
text:
Indie-competent, ‚ÄúNew Zealand‚Äôs South Island franchise to be avoided.‚Äù.

Recently we traveled to Christchurch, New Zealand to rent an Indie Poptop Camper for a five day tour of the South Island, albeit a compressed time to visit an area so packed with places to see. We shuttled to the Christchurch office and met with Phil who checked us in and gave us a short explanation of the camper van we were to use. He mentioned there would be an oil light on but not to worry, maintenance was scheduled when we returned the van in six days. It was our first red flag.

Excited for our adventure we drove off and headed toward Mount Cook. As we pulled out noticing the oil light lit as warned, we also noticed we only had a quarter tank of gas, an added red flag. We pressed on but noticed the camper van struggled anytime we needed to climb. We didn‚Äôt think much about it and arrived at our first nights stop. The next morning as we made the turn to Mt Cook and more climbing the engine light came on. We now had a the oil light, engine light and an obviously compromised vehicle moving slowly uphill. We attempted to contact Indie through the Q code as instructed but we did not have strong enough cell service to go through the steps. We decided to change our plans and divert to Queenstown where we knew they had an office. We arrived at noon and spent hours trying to get help from Indie. At one point they sent us a list of local garages to take the van to the following day. The vehicle wasn‚Äôt safe to drive farther so we had to sleep in the parking ones the Queenstown Events Center and drive in the morning to their office as instructed.

We arrived at the office the following day at 9am and no one was there. We contacted Indie again and they said they‚Äôd work on it. Fortunately at 9:30am the manager Shane arrived but had no notice we were coming for help. He was helpful but it wasn‚Äôt until almost noon that he was able to exchanged vans for us. We were also charged a second bond on the van and they said they couldn‚Äôt refund the previous one until we completed the trip. It made no sense to us but we just wanted to get on the road so we paid it.

We were upset we had lost more than a day with van issues but decided to be positive and create an abbreviated plan. We headed for Milford Sound. The new van was exactly what we had hoped for, it climbed easily and we were reassured from this that the previous van was compromised from the time we left Christchurch.

We visited Milford Sound and found a campsite just outside of it surrounded by snow capped mountains and cold air‚Äî-we had a hail storm as we checked into the campground. Once we parked we planned our evening of heating the water, cooking our dinner from the groceries we picked up and going to bed after a frustrating couple of days. Unfortunately, Shane had forgotten to change the empty LP gas tank so we had no hot water, gas grill or hot water. It‚Äôs hard to describe how disappointed we became at that moment.

That evening we ate peanut butter sandwiches, took a cold sink cleanse and tried to stay warm that night. In the morning the temperature in the van read 7 degrees. Our fourth night continued our focus on discussing the ineptitude of Indie Campervans. We only had five nights scheduled and what we expected to be an exciting trip was marred by the constant problems presented by Indie Campervans. .

The next morning we drove out of the park, headed back toward Christchurch for our fifth night. We found a place to exchange our empty LP gas so we would have the amenities we expected every night. The van was due back by 11am so we had a full day of driving so we could arrive on time.

We believe the people we worked with at Indie at good intentions but low competency. We were first given a van that was obviously compromised mechanically as recognized when we were told to ignore the oil light as it was scheduled for service the following week. The second van wasn‚Äôt prepared properly and we suffered for that too. In summary, Indie Campervans of South Island New Zealand lack competency and because of that our trip was significantly compromised. We are extremely disappointed.

title: DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!!!!!!!!!
text: ICELAND Indiecamper: This company scams and lies to their customers and rips them off 1000 Euros. Let's start with the check in, where the staff were trying to make you pay for as many extras as possible but leave out the important information. We had the van booked for 5 days which means that only 500 km (100km/day) are included for free. When we were doing the check in we told the staff member that we'll be doing the ring route (1400km), and she, if she would have been a competent and well trained employee, would have told us about the opportunity to "only" pay an extra 300 for unlimited kilometers. But of course she DID NOT tell us about it because she knew that we well end up paying an extra 600. At the check out we were obviously shocked when the staff member said we have to pay an additional 600‚Ç¨ BUT we will definitely get the difference between of 300‚Ç¨ back since the check in member should have informed us about this. He even told us where to make the claim. Well he just wanted to get us out of the way because we didn't get anything back. Now 2 weeks after our trip we all of the sudden got charged 1000‚Ç¨!!! on our credit card for a minor damage (a hard plastic part broke). After asking them for a proper cost analysis an invoice they're not responding anymore. They just want your money and when you email them you just get automatic emails with the t&c's you agreed on when signing the contract. All in one it's a LEGAL SCAM and they rip you of as much as they can. I definitely would not recommend dealing with these camper van rentals ever again as they are very dishonest and scam you for ridiculous costs that are absolutely outrageous!!! DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: To flee, a scam
text: To flee, real hustlers. We rented a motorhome in Spain for 4 nights. First of all, they are false prices. They advertise 40 euros per night and multiply the price by 2.5 at the time of payment by adding a fee. They forced us in front of them to put a positive review on their site when our file was not yet closed. 15 days later they charged us 360 euros because they discovered a scratch while during the inventory of the return, we were told that everything was perfect, we had neither a quote for repair, nor dated photo , it is a real scam this company.

title: WARNING: NEVER RENT FROM INDIE CAMPERS!!!! SCAM + EXCESSIVE CHARGES
text:
WARNING: NEVER RENT FROM INDIE CAMPERS!!!! SCAM + EXCESSIVE CHARGES

EXCESSIVE FEES:
When returning the vehicle, we were charged ‚Ç¨2,500 for a tiny dent, barely visible and for which we are not at all responsible! We didn‚Äôt dent the van during our trip, so only two explanations are possible. First, the dent may have been there from the beginning. We didn‚Äôt get a check-in, and we arrived at night on a dark parking lot, making it nearly impossible to see any damage (we have photo evidence). When we returned the van, it was covered in dust and mud, which would have made any inspection even harder. Or, someone may have grazed it in a parking lot. In either case, we are not responsible! Even if we were (which we are not), the amount they charged is outrageous for such a minor "damage," especially given the state of the van and the other vans on the lot‚Äîthey clearly never repair the bodywork! It seems like a scheme to make you pay for their overpriced insurance, which, according to many people, doesn‚Äôt even work! You can search online; I am far from the only person who has experienced this, as there are many complaints on subreddits, Facebook groups, and TrustPilot reviews! I wasn‚Äôt aware of this beforehand, so please don‚Äôt fall victim to this fraudulent company as we did! Indie Campers‚Äô practices are called out in multiple countries. I will probably join one of the movements against this company, which scams its customers!
No check-in process: We collected the van at night on a dark parking lot with no guidance. It was impossible to confirm the initial condition of the vehicle, and no check-in confirmation was provided.
Engine oil pressure light: The "engine oil pressure" warning light came on very frequently. We were told it was nothing to worry about, but the problem persisted throughout the trip.
Empty gas bottles: Although the staff assured us that a gas bottle would be available (only charged if opened), we found two bottles... both empty, leaving us unable to cook on the first night.
Battery issues: The van battery was only charged to 30% when we received the vehicle. Furthermore, the battery and water indicators were faulty.
No igniter for the stove: The stove had no igniter, and no lighter or matches were provided, so we couldn‚Äôt cook the first evening.
Heating and hot water malfunctions: The heater would shut off spontaneously after a few hours, meaning we had to spend every night in the cold. The water heater worked intermittently, forcing us to take cold showers at times.
Unacceptable cleanliness: Upon arrival, the floor of the van was in terrible condition, with large, dirty stains all over (we have photo evidence). The interior also smelled terrible, like a sewer.
Damaged window blinds: Half of the window blinds were either torn or non-functional, making it impossible to sleep past dawn.
Gas leak: We were advised never to use the gas with the trunk closed. We soon realized why‚Äîthere was actually a gas leak. Every time we opened the gas bottle to cook, the smell of gas quickly filled the cabin, which is a serious safety hazard. Having to cook with the trunk open in 10-degree weather was far from ideal!
Leaking fridge: The van‚Äôs fridge was constantly leaking water onto the floor, which was incredibly inconvenient, especially considering the meager cleaning kit they provided (which included a "sponge" and a tissue).
PLEASE DO NOT RENT WHITH SUCH SCAMMING COMPANY !

title: ROBBER SCAMMERS. DON'T RENT.
text:
HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE, DO NOT RENT. (I give it a star because I can not put less)
At first everything seemed great when renting the caravan, until we got there and were informed that a deposit of 2000 euros had to be paid, which we had not been informed at any time when renting the camper.
After posting bail, we left there very upset that we had not received enough information.
When night came, we realized that there were no blankets and that the heating of the camper was not working, so we had to return from where we were so we could get some sheets.
But worst of all, bail has been returned. We were told several times that it was returned 3 to 7 days after returning the caravan. Seeing that this did not happen we called them, and they told us that it could take up to 10 days, very angry I called them and I had to do it several times to deign to answer. After answering, they told me that the deposit had not been released "by accident" according to them but that they had already released it and that it was now up to "the bank's time" to have the money. We called our bank to see if they could tell us something and they told us that the deposit had the release date on November 11, 2 MONTHS AFTER RENTAL. Of course, when they said they had already released him, they stopped answering all kinds of messages and calls and the times they answered they blamed the delay on the bank and its efforts.
After all the formalities, complaints and abandonment by the company I only have to put this review and report them to the consumer office for misleading advertising, poor treatment and customer service and abusive or unclear causes.
Our failure was not to read the reviews before renting, but I doubt that the few good reviews this company has are real.

Please be very careful and rent nothing with them.

title: indie campers bad and fraudulent service
text: poor and fraudulent service. No staff at the collection or return. deposit requested by phone and never returned to date

title: Leaking Gas and Almost Freezing Temperatures
text:
I made the mistake of ignoring the reviews.

I was downgraded right before my trip and told I had no other option. The van I had paid for wasn‚Äôt available, even though it was showing on their website but at a higher price.

Vehicle was delivered with a weird half tank of gas, zero windshield fluid and low add blue. I had to pay for those right away.

Propane tank was put in last minute and I didn‚Äôt see it didn‚Äôt fit and was jammed in sideways. The gas stopped working while
in the south and the loss of two days of cooking was an inconvenience but I just turned it off. I took it to a camper sales place and they confirmed neither tank had o rings, the backup tanks, while almost empty, was able to be connected safely but the primary one was not safe to use.

The blinds on both sides won‚Äôt close giving me zero privacy and the two roof ones won‚Äôt either ensuring I am up with the sun. I often work all night so this isn‚Äôt ideal.

The toilet cassette‚Äôs wheels fell off and now won‚Äôt fit in properly. Because of this there was some leakage and I tried to hose the compartment out and some leaked into the bathroom.

Jumping forward the tank that was safe to use is now empty. I take it and get it refilled and now when I turn on the gas the whole van smells like gas. I spent the night before last in 5 degrees and last night I paid for a hotel. Tonight, however, is going to be cold and even colder for the next few days.

Indie Camper says I can drive several hundred kilometres (out of my allowance), give them another deposit for a replacement that may be just as bad so
I can continue my vacation.

I just want it to be over as this is an unsafe vehicle and I have spent a fortune buying things to stay warm and a kettle to have hot water. Indie Campers just confirmed they will not allow an early exit with refunded unused days.

I rented twice before with Roadsurfer and had a totally different experience. Nice and safe with great customer service. Will stick with them from now on.

title: Unbelievably Poor. Awful.
text:
We had a nightmare from the start with Indie Campers in Marseille.
Our Nomad 5 was a complete wreck: fridge not working properly (we were given a cool box); no cutlery or crockery, lock to the main cabin broken, shower door missing, sink cracked, not possible to secure the table, the hatch above the drivers opened at speed.
Crowning glory on day one was no water. We had to take it to a workshop to repair (pump was not connected to the tank). Customer service was hopeless. Getting stopped by the police for a faulty indicator was another highlight of the trip. This list of faults is not exhaustive.
By the end of the six days, my sons and I put it down to experience. However worse was to come: despite the check out going fine (and we were given a lift to the airport which was kind), a week later photo analysis highlighted a dent towards the rear (amidst the plentiful other dents, bashes and scratches) which must have happened during our rental. We lost our entire Euro 2000 deposit.
These guys are unbelievable. The staff member admitted that the Nomad 5 fleet was falling apart and they needed to get rid of them.
We were given Euro 150 compensation during our trip but this is kind of meaningless having lost 2000 euros.

title: Indie Campers tried to kill us.
text:
Indie Campers Cairns tried to kill us. Avoid these cowboys.

They left the gas bottle pumping gas into our van. So lucky not to have been poisoned or to have had an explosion.

And they did this all to try to save money -- they didn't have enough gas bottles.

The van itself had many other faults. Fridge didn't work. Air conditioning didn't work. Door didn't open. What a shambles.

title: 799th for a hull and mirror of a rear-view mirror, FLIGHT!
text:
799e for a pvc coating and a rearview mirror, DU VOL!

The pvc coating and the mirror of the driver's rearview mirror detached in a crash at low speed with a camper van.
The base, electrical connections and structure are intact (explicit photos)
=> 799th taken 2 days after check-out for the complete replacement of the rearview mirror without justification, invoice, or diagnosis of a garage to prove this exorbitant sum!

No replies to my emails! of the flight via completely excessive billings without even bothering to justify!! FUYEZ

title: Fraudulent service and non-existent assistance
text:
- Italian version (English version below) -

Do not rent absolutely from this manager! My experience, which is still ongoing, is extremely negative: I have never experienced such a poor and, dare I say it, fraudulent service. On 2 October I returned a van to Lisbon after a 10-day trip. Upon return, a local attendant checked that the van was not damaged or otherwise in the same condition as the start (for example our van had a large dent and a crawl on its side already at the start) and greeted us saying that the van was in perfect condition. Everything seemed perfect, but a few days later the problems started.

First of all, I had to contact IndieCampers multiple times to get back the 2000 euro deposit I had paid on delivery. After days of insistence on my part to resolve this situation, the bail was actually returned (but I wonder what the service would have been like if I hadn't insisted continuously for days). Even then, I thought it was all over in the right way. Instead, on October 31, IndieCampers decided to subtract me about 800 euros using the payment methods used for the rental. All this happens without any kind of communication from IndieCampers.

So I decide to write, for the umpteenth time, to the assistance, who replies that the 800 euros are due to damages discovered in the last month and that all the damages are perfectly reported in a "Damage Report" that I should have received. Too bad this report wasn't sent to me. They reply that in maximum 24 hours I would have received it: about 72 hours have passed and I have not yet received any news of the aforementioned report, despite the fact that I am writing to support continuously.

- English Version -

Do not rent from this company under any circumstances! My experience, which is still ongoing, is extremely negative: I have never encountered such poor service, and I would even say fraudulent. On October 2, I returned a van in Lisbon after a 10-day trip. At drop-off, a staff member inspected the van to ensure there was no damage and confirmed that it was in the same condition as at pickup. He assured us the van was in perfect condition. Everything seemed fine, but a few days later, problems started.

First of all, I had to contact IndieCampers multiple times to get back the 2000 euro deposit I had paid upon pickup. After days of persistence on my part to resolve this, the deposit was eventually returned (but I wonder what the service would have been like if I hadn‚Äôt continually insisted for days). At that point, I thought everything was finally settled. Instead, on October 31, IndieCampers decided to take about 800 euros from me, using the payment methods I had used for the rental. This was done without any communication from IndieCampers.

I decided to write, yet again, to customer service, and they replied that the 800 euros were due to damages supposedly discovered in the last month, all of which were detailed in a "Damage Report" that I was supposed to have received. Too bad that I never received this report. They said I would get it within 24 hours, but around 72 hours have passed, and I have yet to see this report, despite my continuous messages to customer support.

title: Damages Overcharging
text: We booked an RV from Bilbao in September 24 to travel around Northern Spain. We were very excited as we thought we had a really good deal and the whole vibe during the check in was very positive. The RV was in really good condition, and everything was going smoothly until the checkout. At some point during the trip it seems that we caused a "scratch" on the exterior part of the tent that is mounted on the top side of the RV. Taking into account that we had paid for the premium insurance, that according to the guys in the check in didn't cover any damage in the bumpers and the roof of the car and also the fact that the scratch was not even a real scratch and it could be easily washed out, we delivered the RV on a Sunday morning, before the Bilbao Indie Campers pickup center had opened, as we had to catch an early flight. A few weeks later, we found out that this "scratch" was charged by Indie Camper's remote relative department, 452.09 Euros!! It seems that premium insurance doesn't cover any damage above the side windows, and not the roof as we were told. But even if this is indeed the case, Indie Campers charged a damage that shouldn't cost more than 30-40 Euros, 452.09 Euros!! We started a thread with the support team trying to explain to them that the charge is totally unrealistic, but their official reply has always been the same, that the damage cost is according to their internal standard pricing process. In other words, someone in a remote location saw a photo of a scratch and decided to charge it 10 times more, without even having a real view of the actual "damage"! As a conclusion, Indie Campers may have really competitive rental prices, but it seems that they are trying to compensate that through overcharging damages. BTW, they are not even obliged to fix these damages, so we paid 452.09 Euros for nothing!

title: Do not use this company.
text:
Do not use this company!

I typically reserve my Google reviews for positive experiences, but my recent rental with Indie Campers compels me to share a deeply disappointing and troubling experience.

Initial Rental Experience: We rented a van from the Barcelona depot. While the pickup process was smooth, the van itself was noticeably well-used and not as clean as expected. Additionally, there was a lack of information provided regarding safety measures, local traffic laws, and low emission zones in the area.

The Incident: After traveling approximately 40 minutes from Barcelona, we parked in a paid public car park designated for vans. Unfortunately, our vehicle was broken into through the back window, and all our possessions were stolen. Although this incident was not Indie Campers' fault, their subsequent response was appalling.

Customer Support Failures: Despite advertising a 24-hour helpline, we were unable to reach anyone via phone, email, WhatsApp, or their online chatbot. Frustrated and distressed, we returned to the depot the next day seeking assistance as it said online they were closed. Instead of support, we were informed that we would need to cover the costs for the broken window, forfeit our deposit, and pay an additional deposit for a replacement vehicle. All of which were covered in the insurance we took with them.

Unsafe Vehicle and Inflexible Policies: Feeling unsafe in the original van due to its easily breakable PVC window, we requested to switch to a more secure model with glass windows and no advertising. Despite multiple available options, Indie Campers denied our request, stating that if we felt unsafe, we could leave the van but would forfeit our money. Unable to afford this loss, we reluctantly accepted a smaller replacement van under the insurance policy. However, we were told we could not be refunded the price difference, even though the new van was cheaper.

Issues with the Replacement Van: The replacement van was significantly smaller, less comfortable, and lacked essential amenities like a toilet‚Äîparticularly problematic as I am six months pregnant. Additionally, the van was very well-used, with visible damage, broken cups, and unclean equipment. While the depot staff were sympathetic, they were ultimately ‚Äúunable‚Äù to assist us, and the manager we spoke to was equally unsympathetic and unhelpful. We were directed to file a formal complaint, which, as of today, remains unanswered.

Financial and Policy Concerns: Indie Campers seemed intent on extracting additional fees at every turn. Upon returning the van, our diesel fuel was not refunded despite leaving a third tank. We were also charged ‚Ç¨4 for exceeding the mileage limit by just 14 kilometers, completely ignoring the extra trips to and from the depot we had to make. Furthermore, it was evident that the policies on windows and damage were being obscured with post-it notes, and signs prohibiting vehicle tours before pickup or drop-off were present, indicating a lack of transparency.

Overall Experience: We initially ignored other negative reviews, assuming they pertained to different locations or isolated incidents. However, our experience confirmed that these reviews were accurate. Indie Campers' staff admitted to issues with fairness and cited growing too quickly for a startup as a reason for their shortcomings. Their lack of compassion, flexibility, and understanding was shocking, especially given their marketing focus on safe and happy travel experiences.

Final Thoughts: We are not blaming Indie Campers for the robbery, but their handling of the situation was exceptionally poor. There was no apology, no proper vehicle sign-off, or safety checks, even after experiencing nearby deadly flash floods. The complete lack of concern for customer safety and well-being was both surprising and disappointing.

Based on our experience, I strongly advise against renting from Indie Campers. Their focus on profit over customer care and safety makes them unreliable and untrustworthy.

title: Do not rent with indie campers!
text: I would not hire with indie campers again. We planned our trip with the indie campers team and went over our route of each country we were planning to visit, we double checked with them that we had the suitable toll stickers and vignettes for the countries we were going to. About a month after our trip ended we revived a fine for ‚Ç¨170 (the fine was actually for ‚Ç¨120 but indie campers are charging us ‚Ç¨50 extra for being fined) as we apparently did not have one of the right vignettes for our trip. If the indie campers team did not know what vignettes and toll stickers we required they should not have told us they did. In addition to this, we were told we would get a full tank of gas when we set off however we were given an empty tank meaning we had to pay to refill the bottle when we were there which was a very lengthy process. The van itself was lovely and I wish I could have given a good review, but this company is full of additional hidden costs and do not offer any help.

title: Disaster
text:
It was a disaster.
The turn signal and windshield wiper broke off on the first day. It was just glued. That's gross negligence.
Indie Camper didn't help us. You said everything was fine when you handed it over. We therefore lost two days and were unable to drive our route as planned.
We would like to warn you not to book with Indie Camper.
The quality of the camper was also a disaster.
The camper was also dirty!!!!

title: Take many photos and videos at the van return
text:
When we rented this summer we had a lot of fun in the van we rented from IndieCampers. The service itself was correct.
However, before renting from them you should be aware that it seems common for them to charge for damage within 30 days of renting. Damage that many users suspect IndieCampers invented.
In order to avoid disappointment, we encourage potential users to take numerous photos and videos of the vehicle both at the time of collection and upon return.
In our case, when we returned the van, the staff on site told us that everything was in order after completing a tour of the vehicle. We were surprised to learn 2 weeks later that we had to pay several hundred francs in fees for a scratch that we are certain we did not cause. Unfortunately, we didn't think to make photos and videos at the time of the vehicle's return, and therefore couldn't dispute. It's hard to tell if it's really a habit at home, but in our case the employee advised us to take many photos and videos when he entrusted us with the vehicle, but was careful not to do so when returning.

title: bad experiance
text:
We rented a camper for 4 days at a cost of over 900 euros, we received it over an hour late and it had no hot water for 3 days. Contacting customer service did not help.
Let's say it's still tolerable. Two weeks after we returned it, we received an additional charge on the credit card of 500 euros for damage they claimed we caused to the toilets in the caravan. I am not aware of such damage, and I am still waiting (a month and a half has passed) for them to send me proof of damage at my request (photos, repair invoice, anything). First of all, they charge the customer, without asking or explaining, not clear by what right... and they don't bother to send proof of the damage either.
They charged me 420 euros for cleaning the camper! Almost half the rental cost.
We returned a clean and tidy camper, and even if we assume not, I don't know how many workers need to be hired to clean a camper, the cost of which should add up to this astronomical amount.
don't book

title: Worst experience ever Indie Campers
text:
Never ever book Indie Campers. We had booked and paid for one with pickup from Dusseldorf
Pick up was actually a 90 euro Uber away.
Got there van had no petrol, no gas, no linen flat Tyre, dirty
Then they wanted 2000 euro bond which was never mentioned..we had no confidence in the place so had to make decision to walk away and cost us another 1400 euro for accommodation
You can't talk to anyone. Communication skills are terrible

title: Fraudster company
text:
They're slit faces (cheeky)! First, I find it very unprofessional for the company to reserve details for customers to stop doing or doing things, in order to be able to charge them extra without any qualms. I paid for a package that included post-travel cleaning. Wherever you rent and pay for a cleaning, all that is required is a minimum of order and that everything is in proper condition. What they did in Indicampers was give me two bags so that I had to remove the bedding myself (besides, I gave them four blankets as a gift, since the coat they delivered was not enough). I was charged for cleaning, even though everything was spotless, even swept away, except that the slab (complete and every thing that happened to me, which were also very few, and I had to buy many things on my own) was stored in the box, washed quickly, WITHOUT FOOD OR REMAINS.

On the other hand, at the time the car was delivered, I was informed that the discharge was done and they had to show me that the ‚Äúpull plugs‚Äù were outside, as the buttons indicating if it was empty or full were bad and ‚Äúfull‚Äù appeared, and I had to believe them. When I returned it, I previously discharged the waters, as I was connected in a camper for four days. I did exactly what I was told and I have a video recorded: ‚Äúyou should do the unloading and then hose it down for a while and you‚Äôre done.‚Äù The amazing and really frustrating thing is that when I handed it over, with a flashlight they checked from the toilet entrance to see if there was anything left in the pond and said, ‚Äúthere are papers still in the pond.‚Äù Impossible! I made sure I didn't flush papers and dump them in separate bags in the dumpsters. Then they asked me, ‚ÄúDo you have the pills that came in the kit?‚Äù I handed them over, flushed them and told me I had to wait and then rinse again (of course, since you know you deliver the car on the last day and usually have the flight, you waste your time to justify charging). The person who delivers the car never mentions how thorough the check will be at the time of delivery so that you at least try to comply with that, nor that inside the kit there are pills that serve to clean the pond. Even so, I assure you that they would charge the same, because I am not the first to claim for this. $250 is an excess and abuse, as well as being a charge for a cleanup already paid for and for a discharge that costs $10 at a dump station.

I would never rent again on Indicampers, and every time you ask me, it is impossible for a good recommendation to come out of this scam company.

title: Worst renting experience. DO NOT RENT.
text:
Worst renting experience I've ever encountered. DO NOT RENT WITH INDIE.

Enormous amounts for small damages : We were charged 2400‚Ç¨ for a dent in the side panel, that we had to pay on the spot when we did the chek-out. Indiecampers doesn't even let you a few days to get the amount on your account, you have to find an immediate solution. (even though they have my driver's licence + all of my personnal information)

Hidden fees : They came back at us 4 days laters making me pay another 500‚Ç¨ for the EXACT SAME DENT, pretexting that it's another one because it's 10cm away.

They also make you pay an extra 15‚Ç¨ when reimbursing the tolls, even though they clearly said "We're gonna take care of the tolls payment because you have an automated pass in the Van, we'll come back with an invoice" but still charge you 15‚Ç¨ more saying that "Indie Campers is authorized to charge a ‚Ç¨15 administrative fee for the process of identifying the driver and liaising with the transit entity.". Issue is they didn't let us choose how we paid the tolls, so they make you pay the 15‚Ç¨ anyway.

Useless customer support : We had van battery issues during our trip which the customer service did not help with (only point of contact you have is a whatsapp live tchat...).
We got stuck in the mud, and the customer service staff barely helped us to find a local towing company.

Only good point was the Oslo pickup center staff which was very kind and very comprehensive.

My only advice : do not rent a van with indiecampers.

title: Don't rent with Indie Campers
text: All I can tell you is to be careful with renting at Indie Campers. They are very irresponsible and take care of nothing. We rented an Etrusco profiled camper for 23 days and had no help wheel. We specifically asked the attendant in Paris if it broke and he answered to speak on TE and it would be solved. Unfortunately it happened and they sent me to speak to the SOS of the route. They have no help on routes. I had to pay ‚Ç¨740 for the trailer and they didn't take over. Plus I paid the premium insurance to be quiet and nothing. They're crap.

title: absolute hell, ruined trip
text:
My reservation number is J0VV3P. My left low beam headlight doesn't work!!!! When filling the tank with water, it simply leaks out due to leaks!!! The battery charge lasts for a couple of hours with the engine off, provided that the energy is spent only on autonomous heating!!! That is, what this car was created for is missing!! I would like to hear clarification from you on this matter...
My reservation number is J0VV3P. I also want to add that we were given dirty bed linen, which is why we sleep in sleeping bags. Autonomous heating only works when the engine is on; this is a consequence of the fact that the battery has been in need of replacement for a long time; it has simply used up its resource. When the engine is turned on, the timing belt makes a lot of noise and prevents us from sleeping, our engine also interferes with the sleep of the surrounding people on the camp site, which is why I have to constantly look for a place at the maximum distance from others....

title: Worthless service, worthless business.
text:
Indie Campers is unfortunately not the company they exude to be. First of all, the camper must be picked up in very remote places. Then we had to wait 2 hours before it was our turn and there was a lot of hassle about the deposit. In addition, the first camper revealed defects even before we were gone, so we had to wait again to get another camper (which also had various defects).
In the meantime, this has been over a year, and we paid all the tolls at the post office on our last day in accordance with the rules of Indie Campers. However, the Portuguese system is slowing down, so we (apparently) had one toll bill outstanding later. However, this was not known to us, and cannot be paid from abroad. Now, more than a year later, we got this bill from Indie Campers (of 3.21) with a fine of 15 euros. There was supposedly nothing they could do about this. We will no longer book with Indie Campers. Fucking company.

title: Super bad customer service!!
text:
Renting from Indie Campers was a major disappointment. Upon picking up the camper, I found it in poor condition‚Äîdirty, with broken features, and clearly not maintained. Despite my complaints, the staff seemed indifferent and unhelpful.
After returning the vehicle, I was shocked to receive charges for damages that were pre-existing. Luckily, I had documented the condition of the camper, which helped me contest these unfair claims.
The customer service was frustratingly unresponsive, and their billing practices felt deceptive. Overall, my experience with Indie Campers was stressful and unsatisfactory. I strongly advise potential renters to consider other options and document everything meticulously if they choose to proceed with this company.

title: You will be scammed out of your deposit...
text:
Renting an IndieCampers van is all great until you get to the security deposit part. You can read all about it from Reddit posts and I will contribute here with my story.

I delivered a van after an 8 day trip, which went OK. I left it clean and treated it as if it was my own. There was some damage on the top-right-back corner of the van which was found by their after-trip analysis. I don't recall the moment the damage was done but I don't question it as they take photos before and after. I also parked close to trees so no problem there. As expected I would cover the damages. All good so far. Now let's get to the value! They are going to keep 1869.24 euros from my deposit because that is the cost of the repair. ??? Almost 1.9K to fix a "light dent"; their words not mine?

They also didn't send this damage report until now, 2 months after the trip, I guess because they were not sure how to deliver this ridiculous news.

If you are comfortable with trusting them with a large security deposit or paying overpriced insurance, go ahead, otherwise, I would avoid.

I am completely open to negotiation and paying for damage in rentals but not like this and not these values.

title: a NIGHTMARE
text:
With one word: a NIGHTMARE. A total disaster: the van broke due to lack of ordinary maintenance and after that moment nobody was able to support us in any way, nobody was willing to take accountability. We were completely left alone with a broken vehicle (not because of us, but even in that case it would be wrong, especially because we paid for the extra insurance).
The negative online reviews are true: as soon as you have any kind of little issue, your are left alone and you lose holiday time.
A tip: be sure to travel with good and positive friends, who are able to cheer up the mood.
Check-in: This is not a check-in service. People who work in the pick-up centre should be able to give the right informations, help you in any possible way and they should care about the customer. Nicer people would be great.
(PS: we had to change the first van with another one, and they asked for another 500‚Ç¨ deposit.........)

title: INDIE CAMPERS SUCK
text: The vehicle was nice and everything went well at first , the customer service sucks , nobody answered the phone when we had trouble with the roof tent , the video they send you to get to know the vehicle is from the early 2000 probably , and didnt include all the precautions you need to take to ensure nothing happens to the vehicle or the tent in our case , We paid the inaurance and we had bad climate in a lake , and the tent flew over the camper , broke from the camper and we had to pay 1500 EUROS on a tent that the cost is 400 euros ,,we explained that in the video they sent us there was no explanation that we had in the vehicle this pins that hold the tent to the ground , if we had seen it in the video we would have used them ,,, we explained this and wrote to custumer service and they didnt care , they charged us the 1500 EUROS wich is an abuse to their clients , i told them that if the tent was to be charged its ok but you will ship it so i can fix it and use it in one of my vehicles , and they said that they cannot do it because it was property of INDIE CAMPERS ,,, and they cannot ship the part because it was they're property and they didnt have to ship the part wich i paid 3 times its cost and it was theirs ,,, so for me im never renting with them in my life ,, the insurance is not good if you dont pay the best insurance , its ridiculous , they didnt help me at all in customer service , and basically i feel robed for paying a tent 3 times its cost and didnt get to keep it ,,, from me your not getting a penny more for INDIE CAMPERS , people if you rent with this company pay the full ensurance ao you wont get any surprises at the end of your journey ,,, and INDIE CAMPERS , make sure you update your videos , wich probably takes one day to get them better ,,, you lost me as a client

title: Bad.
text:
Bad experience!
In May 2024, together with two friends, we rented a van to make a roadtrip in Iceland for a week. It turns out we had the chance of a duck hitting our glass, damaging it. As recommended by the company, we contacted the 24-hour service to resolve the problem, and the problems started. As stated in the contract it is the contractor's responsibility to call a trailer. Initially they gave a quick solution that would be about 50 km away, which allowed a quick solution to the problem. We were warned that we could be rested that they would handle the matter (contrary to the context). What is not our surprise when, without knowing why, the company contacts another service that would be more than 700 km from where we were, this service that would take about 7 to 8 hours to arrive, we ended up waiting for more than 10 hours! Since we were informed that this service was on its way, we could only wait for it. During this process we talked to more than 4 people in the assistance chat, all of them without knowing exactly what was going on having to be us to explain everything again.
With the arrival of the trailer comes the worst possible news, we had to be ours to pay an exorbitant amount, about 5400‚Ç¨. We made the return trip to the only IndieCampers shipyard in the whole island and, in conversation with the staff, realized that it would be an absurd value even given the high values practiced in the country.
Upon returning to Portugal, we contacted a lawyer to see if this whole process was correct. We were never returned the communication, not even by registered letter. It was impossible to contact IndieCampers.
After this episode the image of IndieCampers is very bad, a company you can not trust, which provides contradictory information and is not clear in its communication. A great disappointment and I will definitely never hire your services again.

title: Fraudsters!
text: We ordered an atlas 5 motorhome in Milan, we are from Spain, we went by plane to Milan, we arrived where they have to give us the car and they tell us that that motorhome has been broken and that they do not have it... at the same time we get an email that tells us that they replace it with an Etruscan "a lower motorhome", we tell it to the guys there and they tell us that they do not have any Etruscan, that they can only give us a camper the nomad pop top that was there with barely load without gasoline, we go that they had just left it. We want to make a claim and they give us a whatsapp that answers you a bot, we have no choice but to leave with the camper since we had 3h that even they did not know what to do... When we arrive to return it we tell the whole story to the girl who receives us and gives us a phone number that you can call and finally talk to a person, explain the case and tell us that it will give us compensation, obviously all lies, still not finished the film, a week later we get an email and we are told that they have received a report of an accident we have had with another vehicle, that if so inform them that they have insurance, obviously also false. In conclusion we have not been given any compensation and still have the ‚Ç¨2000 bail that from what I see they want to put us in a fabricated accident. Hope you read this before you rent there. Cheers!

title: NEVER RENT FROM INDIE CAMPER
text:
Their campers are of very poor quality and when you need help (because something will 100% break in these low-quality campers) their costumer support is terrible.
They will only provide you with google-search links on what you have to do without doing ANYTHING themselves.
Save your vacation and DO NOT RENT FROM THEM!

title: Never book on this website
text:
2052179

Never book on this website!

We rent a jeep with pop-up tent for 7 nights in Las Vegas. The check-in was catastrophic, the jeep was not cleaned, the sheets of the previous customer were still in the tent, the access ladder was not the right one, the vehicle is given with less than a quarter of the full and must be returned at this level, the tires were at the indicator of wear and the person in charge of the site tells us ‚Äúyou can go to discount tyres, they will change them for you for free!‚Äù so I rent a vehicle with an additional package in km and I have to go change the tires?? Everything I mentioned before would not have changed if we had not checked everything.

From our 1st night, we realized that the fridge power outlet was not in the vehicle so 1 week without fridge in the desert, the differential that allows to choose between 2 wheel drive or 4x4 was broken so impossible to drive between 4x4 mode, this prevented us from accessing places we had planned to visit thanks to this mode. Objects of the additional equipment (tables, chairs) are really bad bills, the table was broken so did not hold the high position.

After realizing this we contacted the service by phone and Whatsapp message. By phone we have a robot that talks to us and redirects us to the website where no human answers us, and on Whatsapp a reply in 30 minutes is announced, well it‚Äôs been 9 days that I wrote and still no news, the same for the email sent to ‚Äúexcellence service‚Äù

We probably wouldn‚Äôt have been so disappointed if we had chosen a local hire company with low promises, but for the moment Indie Camper promises an efficient service, a hassle-free trip, and an excellent experience at 1400‚Ç¨ per week!!

I hope to have an answer one day from their services because it is not normal to sell powder to the eyes and not have problems afterwards

I will never go back to this site, and invite you to do the same!

title: After 60 days they still don't return bail d 2,000. Of course I received confirmation that there was no damage-
text: Watch out!!!! I rented one of their vans for a few days. After 60 days I have NOT been refunded the 2,000 euro bond, they should have returned it within 15 days because I had no damage, it is held in my bank until they feel like giving you a button! There is no customer service, they do not give me solution, it is a shame of company, they abuse the helpless people under this desperate situation. I've heard from a friend who knows more people who've done this to him! I will never rent with this company again without regard to people. SHAMEFUL

title: Terrible
text:
A truly questionable trip from the very beginning. We arrived in Porto to pick up the van and waited 1 hour and 30 minutes. After that, they handed us a visibly questionable van. We realized during the drive south that there were missing parts and others that were falling apart.

The door handles come off if pulled to open the doors... then the biggest problem: we realized that the key no longer opens or closes the doors, and the electronic button lock is broken. Not to mention the musty smell throughout the van...

We called the company‚Äôs number, and they told us to get in touch via WhatsApp. The operator on the other end told us to continue our journey because, in his opinion, it wasn‚Äôt a big problem... (not being able to lock or enter the vehicle isn‚Äôt a big problem...).

So, there was a heated discussion, and they told us to go to Lisbon to change the van (the contact with the support team happened at 10:30 in the morning). We drove for 2 hours and 40 minutes to get to Lisbon, and when we arrived, no one was informed about the problem. We waited 3 hours before the new van was ready, which was much larger than what we had booked in advance. We received no refund for gas, tolls, or the time we lost.

Terrible vacation, terrible van, and terrible company; even the second van had questionable odors... we paid 100 euros for cleaning, but it wasn‚Äôt cleaned at all.

If I could give less than one star, I would! Never again!!

title: DO NOT TRUST THIS COMPANY
text: My husband and I rented a campervan from Indie Campers, and after 30 miles of highway driving, the clutch burnt out and we were left stranded and our whole vacation ruined. Despite paying for 24/7 roadside assistance, the company support told us they couldn't help us so the host had to use her personal insurance to have is towed. We were charged our full security deposit of $3700 CAD to pay for the repairs on the vehicle, despite 1, the vehicle had just been returned from a 750 mile rental the day we got it, and 2, the cost of the repairs were $800 less than the security deposit so the company pocketed the extras. The company has done everything to redirect us away from them by wasting our time trying to get money from the third-party insurance company they use (Riverside) only to be told they can't help us either (but they did say they agreed we should not be held responsible for the repairs given the circumstance). I can go on and on and on how horrendous the business practices are of this company, but I'll leave it at that and hope everyone sees this review before considering renting from Indie Campers.

title: DON'T PUT YOUR LIFE IN DANGER FOR A LOWER PRICE, IT'S NOT WORTH IT. What we thought would be the best trip of the year soon
text: THIS COMPANY PUTS YOUR LIFE IN DANGER AND TAKES NO RESPONSIBILITY FOR IT. Please do not opt for this company that offers ‚Äúcheaper‚Äù prices the amount of added costs + poor maintenance of the Vans could have resulted in something very serious. Today we are here to tell our experience but it might not have been the case.

title: Lousy experience with IndieCampers!
text:
Lousy experience with IndieCampers! We rented a van between September 30 and October 5, 2024 (6 days) and from the second day EVERYTHING went wrong. First the van's internal lights failed, then an engine warning appeared, then handbrake failure and worst of all: THE BRAKES FAILED COMPLETELY! Yeah, the brakes. We ran out of brakes in the middle of the road because the van did not have even basic brake fluid maintenance. This caused an accident that could have been much worse.

The worst is not only the extreme negligence of delivering a vehicle to us in those conditions, but now they are trying to charge us 1388 euros for the accident they caused with their lack of maintenance. Their customer service is a joke, they just sent me absurd instructions like it was my job to fix their ramshackle van.

This trip was complete chaos and ruined our vacation. Instead of enjoying ourselves, we were all the time concerned about our safety and trying to fix problems that should never have existed. IndieCampers is not only irresponsible, it is also dangerous. They don't care about the safety of their clients. Don't rent with them if they value your life and your money!
Booking 5Q4KD3

In the photos we have documented all related problems. I hope we can work something out with the police.

title: DON'T rent from Indie Camper!
text:
Indie Campers is unfairly holding up my money!
This is a story of injustice and an unacceptable customer approach.
In short - We had a flight cancellation due to a threatening attack by Iran on Israel. We had a hard time communicating with INDIE and faced some inflexible and fixed approaches to our case, although it is an extreme case that was not under our control!
After all - I had to replan and reschedule everything from scratch.
Unfortunately, there were 700 Euros differences in the price - I was refused to get any of it nor to get it back as a voucher! On top of that because of minor damage, they charged us 500 Euros instead of subtracting and although we had premium insurance (we tried to use all the money that was left on their side! )
On the last day of my trip, I found out that the amount was being documented literally as a "refund" on my Indie account but only visible to the customer service staff - I was shocked. They don't want to release our money!
They are so aggressive and abusive and will do anything to get your money.

title: very low quality
text:
The local service and staff are of very low quality. Long waits. I advise paying extreme attention during the camper pick-up phase, checking the tires, ensuring it is clean, and that all required accessories are present, including the cable and water hose.

In our case, they initially offered us a camper with bald tires, dirty, missing accessories, and several non-functioning items, including the side windows, which, unfortunately, we noticed did not stay open only during the rental period and were unjustly charged to us as damage. When I asked for photos of the functioning windows during the pick-up phase, they told me that they were not available. Unacceptable!

title: Awful! Stay away from them
text:
It‚Äôs unfair that we even have to rate this company with one star. My advice, as echoed by many others: stay away from this company. There are better alternatives in Spain and nearby (which we found out later) that offer much better service.

We waited at the depot for two hours to receive our Active van. During that time, three other couples were also waiting, each dealing with their own van issues, while other customers kept coming back with problems‚Äîan absolute mess. 2 of them asked for a full refund after driving for 20 minutes and encountering difficulties with the van itself. Our van had no water at all, but still the staff pressured us to take it, claiming they had no other options. They gave us Indie Campers' customer service number, instructed us to take the van without water, and suggested we ask for compensation later (don‚Äôt bother‚Äîthey won‚Äôt compensate!). After waiting an additional two hours, a technician finally arrived and fixed the issue. While they initially refunded us for the Essential Kit, we discovered two days later that the charge had been reinstated‚Äîcompletely useless.

The chiller wasn‚Äôt working, so all our food was ruined‚Äîit didn‚Äôt even work when plugged in. We were forced to dine out and absorb the extra costs because, as expected, they wouldn‚Äôt cover them. They even had the audacity to suggest we purchase a new fridge ourselves and submit the receipt later‚Äîwould you trust them to refund that? Not at all. Plus, I shouldn‚Äôt have to spend time during my holiday dealing with problems they should be handling.

To top it all off, our van wasn‚Äôt even insured for the first two days, despite us having paid for it. The staff at the depot were so overwhelmed that they forgot to activate it (thankfully, we didn‚Äôt have any accidents).

The vans are in terrible condition. When you arrive for check-in, it becomes clear that your van hasn‚Äôt been properly inspected‚Äîno water, battery not charged, nothing. You‚Äôre left waiting while they scramble to check everything, and that‚Äôs when the problems start. They simply don‚Äôt have time between rentals, and they‚Äôre clearly understaffed. The team is burned out and visibly frustrated with the company.

We all want to enjoy our holidays, but this experience was a complete nightmare. It‚Äôs a real shame because Portugal is beautiful, but this situation completely ruined it for us.

title: Don‚Äôt rent. You will regreat it. They lie cheat and deceive you. Absolute garbage units and service is even worse.
text:
Absolutely no customer support or service. Be prepared to spend your holiday trying to contact them in a broken down piece of junk. Fantastic web site. But complete scam. Don‚Äôt risk your holidays and money. I lost 6k and two weeks of holidays. And about 5000 more on out of pocket expenses because of this company. It‚Äôs not anything like renting a car. They only gonna take your money and your luck to get out of parking lot with out unit having major problems and they don‚Äôt care. Even with the 50 bucks a day insurance to cover it. You will spend twice as much trying to collect.
Absolutely zero customer service and no phone. Just a chat bot. And zero refunds for anything . No matter what. Even if you spend two weeks in the service center. You will pay for the renting of two weeks even if you never use it

title: Avoid at all costs!
text: Horrible company that does not care about its costumers. The camper they gave us was terrible. Extremely dirty (mouldy yoghurt on the walls and ceiling dirty‚Ä¶), broken equipment in it (broken table among others) and we did nog get the equipment in the camper we were promised (no bed sheets among other, which resulted in us freezing and not sleeping the first night in the camper). We had to clean the whole camper ourselves, buy tools to fix the table and buy our own bed sheets to not freeze to death. All because contacting their help departement is completely useless, no help at all. They care 0 for their costumers, they just want your money.

title: THE WORST
text:
A few facts:
Van broke down around 5pm, only one day after the rent started.
I've tried to reach Indie campers immediately as the emergency took place . Didn't get any feedback until midnight - there is no way to call them by phone. Neither for emergencies. Only via email or a useless WhatsApp chat. I had to navigate the website for 30 minutes in order to understand what to do.
It turns out that I need to contact the insurance of the van. Finally I could arrange to be rescued by the tow truck.

Every time I tried to communicate with them I have never had the same operator which followed the case. Always a new one and I had to tell my story every time again. Really frustrating.
After one week I'm still waiting for feedback and for my money. I had to book another car with another company to continue my trip. I have received no assistance nor allowance nor refund nor courtesy car by Indie Campers.

After almost one month, I haven't yet neither a clear feedback on the next steps of the practice, nor my money (1300‚Ç¨). That's really outrageous.

Zero value for money. My worst experience ever. Would never recommend it. I give only one star because I cannot give less.

title: Scam: extreme loads for 1 scratch
text: At check-out we were told that everything was good. We go back to our country and a few days later, they take us 2000‚Ç¨ from the account for a "scratch". We tried to challenge it, but we were unsuccessful. We feel ripped off. The Award is out of orbit. I do not recommend this company, it is a lottery and you risk losing huge sums. They'll take the money from you when you get home.

title: Nightmare trip with Indiecampers!
text:
Reservation Number :#1710378

Nightmare trip with Indiecampers
We rented an Active IndieCamper Van for two weeks. We were very excited about this trip however it turned into our worst nightmare. We picked the Van at the depot it was fine, the Van looked more worn out than we expected it. They gave us a short explanation but told us to check the video for further details. We later realised the video was lacking a few details that were quite important ,how to get rid of the grey water for our Van especially and how to fill the water tank.
After further inspections we realised few things in the Van were not there as expected or broken, no rear parking sensor, fridge was extremely small and not properly working, the piece to refill the water tank was missing/ didn‚Äôt fit any of the points to refill the water, lots of scratches on the outside and inside, upper windows not properly closing. On the second day we had a small accident and the real nightmare started, we contacted the customer support team they were giving us very confusing answers and couldn‚Äôt really tell us if we were covered by the insurance or not. We were not able to contact someone in person to clarify our doubts after the accident. The customer support was giving us the same routine answer to all our questions. This made us have a very anxious trip as we didn‚Äôt know what cost we were expecting for the repair of the van, they didn‚Äôt want to tell us even though we send pictures. We had to cut our plans short as we wanted to avoid any extra damage so we stayed at a camping place until the end of our trip. When we brought the Van back we were told that everything was fine and we would get the deposit back. We were quite surprised because we notified them about the damage and expected them to tell us about prices and next steps to take. We got the deposit back and a few days later they charged our credit card without previously notifying us about it. My friend had to request an explanation to understand the cost that were charged to us. They send a picture and a price no cost break-down nothing. We requested a in detail cost-breakdown that they refuse to provide. We understand that we have to pay for the damage but at least provide us with some explanation on how you calculate the cost because 3305‚Ç¨ for a dent and scratch on the top of the van is a lot of money to pay! Never eve booking with Indie Campers again.

title: Last time renting here
text:
Terrible experience. Avoid where possible. The cheap rental price is compensated for costs at the end. A small dent in the side of the Van is now costing us ‚Ç¨2,200 without a chance for an explanation (money was suddenly withdrawn from our account). The receptionist said he can‚Äôt help and I need to call the hotline, who then again said she couldn‚Äôt help, need to write an email.
Additionally, we didn‚Äôt receive adequate cooking equipment, having to buy our own, and bed equipment not even adequate for one bed (although we booked a bus with two), meaning we all froze at night time).
Last time!!

title: Van Trip in Spain
text: they told us that the chemical toilet pad had already been inserted but it was not and the first emptying of the black water was not a good experience... after a few km the indicator light to insert the adblue starts... 30 ‚Ç¨... the gas came out of the stove with very little flame, changing the gas cylinder same thing... main mosquito net with holes and the shutters jammed or did not hook and detach continuously. For the rest for goodness sake a nice experience anyway, maybe next time we'll hope for a better van

title: Indie Campers= The worst service company in the world.
