text: The worst service company in the world. They deliver dirty motorhomes, without emptying the tanks, without properly insulating, with smoke alarms that are constantly raised when cooking, with constant vibration of the windows and entrance door, falling parts, no indicator works, so suddenly it tells you that you have to change the oil, the hose to discharge the wastewater without adapter. In our case the second day dirty water started coming out through the shower. If you need to turn on the generator the smell of gas is tremendous and better open fans and windows. And finally you find that you have been charged penalties at the price of a luxury hotel room, for arriving late having given advance notice and without any information and ambiguous answers plus constant threats of penalties. We're going to claim the company and the U.S. consumer bureau, which is where we took it. And certainly don‚Äôt even think about renting or relocating with this company.

title: I can only warn against Indie Campers! ‚Äì Never again Indie Campers!
text:
I can only warn against Indie Campers! ‚Äì Never again Indie Campers!

I rented and paid for a motorhome with a premium package (incl. a fully comprehensive with 199‚Ç¨ excess) at Indie Campers in Frankfurt am Main (Maintal) for almost 500,00‚Ç¨ and felt completely secure.
During the rental period there was a small accident with minor sheet metal damage / scratches (see photo, rear right).
I wanted to report the damage directly to Indie Campers, but couldn't reach anyone on the day of the accident and also for 2 subsequent 2 days!
On the 3rd day I was finally able to chat with a person at Indie Campers very time consuming (not on the phone!) and it was agreed that I should fill out a claim form that was not present in the camper when returning it.
When I returned this form, I received it from an Indie Campers employee and filled it out completely (for insurance).
After that I was told only in English that I had to pay the tremendous sum of almost 4,000‚Ç¨ for the damage to the camper, which I refused, because I had bought the premium package after all and there was a fully comprehensive insurance with 199‚Ç¨ excess in it!
I took a taxi to the airport with my wife without making a payment because we had to catch our flight to Brazil.
One day later, without notice and without my knowledge, Indie Campers simply debited this tremendous amount from PayPal!
I didn't realize that the collection procedure was about the two
Payments for the rent of the camper is still valid!
This is cheating on the customer and pure rip-off!
Many people have reviewed Indie Campers negatively on the Internet.
I have called in my lawyer, who will return the collected, high sum, minus the deductible, and can only warn against Indie Campers!
Never again will I book a camper at Indie Campers, which is out to rip off and deceive its customers!
You can support a petition in which rip-off and cheated customers of Indie Camper have signed up! >>> "Indie Campers have ripped us off"

title: CON ARTISTS! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
text:
SCAM COMPANY!!! Avoid!!!! DO NOT rent from indie campers. They are screwing over thousands of people out of thousands of eur/usd/gbp. They purposely buy faulty vehicles knowing they will break down and then they are very pushy for you, the customer to work on the vehicle yourself. If you do it, you are then liable for the damages and they will start taking money from your credit/debit card. Their customer service team also lie about what they‚Äôre doing to try to help you. My family and I rented a van from them and the power steering stopped working. We were on our way to a motorway but luckily I went the wrong way and had to turn around down a side street, where the steering stopped working. If that had happened at high speed it could have been catastrophic and fatal. They took 10 hours to call a tow truck because for those 10 hours they wouldn‚Äôt stop trying to convince me to do some handy work on their van. I was stranded with my wife and two kids (4 & 2) in the rain and cold. I called 5 local mechanics who all advised me to absolutely not do any work on their van. It‚Äôs obviously their responsibility and their insurance should have covered it. There are thousands of forum entries and Facebook groups with countless stories of various ways they con people. They also hire people to write good reviews for them, so ignore those!!
They will ruin your vacation and steal from your bank account. Avoid them, report them, and look a reputable company instead!

title: Stay away from Indie Campers!
text: Stay away from Indie Campers. They will charge you hundreds if not thousands of EUR/USD for simple dents that cost 50 EUR/USD at most. Their insurance does not cover the most basic cases. Please don't do it yourselves!

title: INDIE CAMPERS NEVER AGAIN, I DON‚ÄôT RECOMMEND.
text: This company was not the best choice for our trip, everything is an additional cost: basic insurance does not cover anything, included kilometers are ridiculous, bed linen not included, kitchen supplies to pay separately, a simple hand broom, gas, etc. The vehicle was delivered to us dirty, without AddBlue, with a chemical tank. It was dirty, the seat was broken. We had an accident and the door mirror kit broke. We were charged an amount equivalent to three times the price of a new mirror, in other words, they want to make money from customer accidents. They refused to share these costs set by the company. : INDIE CAMPERS NEVER AGAIN, I DO NOT RECOMMEND.

title: Do not rent from this company! They are dishonest!
text: Do not rent from this company! They are dishonest! They are disorganized! They steal from customers! They charge fees that were not previously agreed upon! The staff is completely poorly trained! The environment is dirty! They do not respect customers! They lie so they can screw you over later! I really regret having rented from them and I will definitely never go back! They robbed me and deceived me!

title: Bad experience
text:
Bad experience. We rented a campervan for the first week of September. The RV was delivered dirty. The site in Marcon where the vehicle was collected is in a situation on the verge of hygiene. We had an appointment at 1:00 p.m. to pick up the vehicle. Nobody in the office welcomed us and after 45 minutes we were expecting a guy, who in the meantime had entertained himself to talk to foreign tourists, handed us the vehicle doing a very quick and summary check out. We took the camper home to load it and spent half a day cleaning it. There were ants, hair everywhere and the chemical toilet was filthy. We left for our trip too bad that the same evening the water did not come out of the sinks because the pump had broken. We asked for assistance from the Indie numbers. Assistance was practically not given to us. We advised that we were going back to the Marcon office to solve the problem. I point out that we were stuck on the street without water with 3 small children. Back at the Marcon headquarters the Indie employees made us lose another 3 hours before, because as the only solution they proposed to give us a camper that was not sanitized,
then because they asked for a new deposit on a credit card, a card that was blocked from their previous deposit made at the time of rental. They basically didn't give us any campers and they kept our money.
After making the refund request they replied that their procedures do not provide for refund. They basically kept the money without giving us the service we paid for. I strongly advise against this company.

title: DON'T RENT AT INDIE CAMPERS
text: Indie Campers p√©ssima escolha, na rece√ß√£o estavam 2 Jovens < 20 anos a ¬´despachar¬ª mais de 15 clientes numa s√≥ tarde. Vemos o video do funcionamento mas n√£o conseguimos testar - pe, a agua quente que n√£o funciona, a tenda do Jeep Wrangler que deixa entrar agua quando chove, atendimento por mail e Whatsapp quando surgem os problemas e que n√£o nos arranjam hotel, deram-nos uma morada onde estavam umas casas de madeira com telefone que nunca atenderam, com aspeto abandonado, lixo a porta. Tivemos de arranjar hotel para 2 pessoas 3 noites enquanto roupas, edredons, almofadas secaram... NUNCA re-embolsados. D√£o a hipotese de andar 200 km x 2 (ida e volta) para arranjar o buraco da tenda que j√° estava identificado pois j√° tinha fita cola a ¬´tapar¬ª. Pretendem que sejam os clientes a fazer a manuten√ß√£o das carrinhas e a gastar o tempo de f√©rias para tal. J√° tinha tido essa experiencia nos Pirin√©us em 2021 - perdi 2 dias numa oficina sem poder usar a carrinha para transporte e a ter de ficar num Hotel. Dei mais uma hipotese A Indie e foi muito mau. Durante este tempo usei carrinhas de outras companhias sem qq problema. Desaconselho INDIE We rented a Conquest Van and a Jeep Wrangler with a tent for 3 wks in the US for 6 adults and one baby 2 yr old - we started in salt Lake city and dropped off in Seattle. For this we paid 7500 + 5000 euros. We were included in a larger group with 4 other Conquest Vans - total amount exceeded 35000 euros - we thought we could have special rete or special treatment ... The 1st problems was because I made a mistake when booking the wrangler and I said I would start in Seattle and drop off in salt lake, the other way around. When I noticed the mistake, 3 wks before departure, I informed Indie Campers and they charged me another 600 euros. Special treatment ... When we arrived to Salt Lake to chen in there were 2 yeong boys < 20 yrs old to check in more than 10-15 vans.... The van were dirty and, although you may see the videos before, it's impossible to confirm that everything is working properly. So on the 1st day we found out that the main door of the Conquest van did not close well, it happened to open while we were driving. We neve had hot water in the Conquest, always had to shower inb the parks WC, sometimes far specially with a 2 yr old. Worse than that, on the 3rd day it rained a lot and we found out that there was a hole in the tent (already known because it was partially covered with regualar tape...), all the inside matress covers pillows, pijamas were soaked. WE contacted Indie and they booked a cabin for 2 people - when we went to that cabin nobody answered, we called 2 phone #s which never answered, the placed looked abandoned with lots of trash outside. We paid for 3 nights in a motel, the cheapest in town - 700 USD for 3 nights for 2 people - never reimburesed. The remaining 17 nights we slept 6 adults and one baby in the Conquest Van - we only used the Jeep for driving of part of the group. We asked for being re-imbused but so far no contacts were made.

title: Legal scam, maintenance at YOUR cost
text:
Be aware your holidays can turn to a nightmare in few seconds.
Team is nice but the company isn‚Äôt. Motorhome poor furbished and engine failure and repair at YOUR cost.
Engine: I had to pay for the maintenance of the engine in a garage as some lights starts to appeared on the dashboard. The company doesn‚Äôt cover for the engine maintenance but want it same as we took it or they charge you. Imagine when it arrived day 2 of the holidays when I wasn‚Äôt responsible for this. Surely the unlucky of the 5 last people however my bills went way up and even the ‚ÄúCustomer service‚Äù refuse to pay for the repairs.
Furniture: sleep 6 but only 3 outside chairs, a small outside table 50 by 70cm, 2 plates of each, 2 spoon, a coffee maker for 1 person, the bedsheet didn‚Äôt cover the full bed, the second bed didn‚Äôt had the bedsheet or the duvet. No adaptador for legal camping plugs. Heater works 1 on 2 and never when plugged to electricity. Blackout or mostico net didn‚Äôt work so had to maintain them down with headphone cable. Water pipe to fill the tank is 2m long! Just a joke at the moment of using it. Never see so little investment in the furniture make you holidays enjoyable.

Indie Campers is the last company I recommend to have a nice relaxing time. All the extra of the motorhome is at your financial cost, the furniture make your day to day miserable and the engine maintenance poorly done hby them will be added to your invoice at the end of the holidays with no way of see it back.
Be careful with this legal scam.

title: Odd Smells, Dirty Sheets, and Lies
text: We rented from Indie Campers while touring Iceland. They gave us a van that had a strong, off-putting smell, and we opted to rent the extra bedding option. The sheets were soiled. When we returned the van the next day, we were offered a refund for the remaining days we didn't use the van. However, after a week into our trip, they decided to revoke the refund and required we pay the full amount. This company is not trustworthy, nor is the customer service satisfactory. Do not rent from Indie Campers.

title: The worst
text: They're thieves, don't hire them. We rented a campervan for 8 days and the second one broke down, they had us waiting all day, offered us an impractical replacement and then did not want to return the unoccupied days. We were not even refunded the deposit of 500 euros, being that the premium insurance deductible is 199 euros. They couldn‚Äôt be worse, what was supposed to be vacations turned into meetings with the lawyers so they could sue them to pay us back.

title: Terrible experience! Don't do it!
text:
Terrible experience! Don't do it!
We could only take the camper 4 hours after the pick-up time. The air conditioning was broken, very annoying in California. The bed linen, pillows, blankets, camping chairs and cutlery were not available and we had to buy ourselves. We would get that money back but that took a lot of time and energy before we finally got it. After two hours of driving, the arm of the wing mirror on the driver's side suddenly collapses, probably this arm was not fully out when we took the camper. Awkward because dangerous. The result was that the mirror flew off. Road side assistance was not for this, we were told after difficult contact with customer service. We should get it fixed ourselves. We have been in contact with various garages, judgment was: click in new mirror and done. Max 50 dollars incl labor costs, but the mirror was nowhere in stock and because we were passing through we had no time to wait for it. So we returned the camper without a side mirror. Charges Indie $400 estimated repair fee for that! They then immediately debited the entire deductible from the credit card. So now endless contact with customer service again. Everything about the chat/mail because no one can be reached by phone. Don't do it!
So are you thinking about an Indie camper? Save yourself the hassle, time and money and rent your camper elsewhere!

title: Indie Campers California
text:
Hello!

Although we had read a lot of negative reviews about Indie Campers, we took a chance because some reviews were positive and this company offered the kind of RV we were looking for on our trip to California. We rented a class B (Winnebago Solis) for 4 people (2 adults and 2 children 3 and 5 years old), we left Las Vegas with a return to Los Angeles.

My conclusion; I strongly advise against this company. Here's why:

1. Since we have young children, we rented with the RV 2 child car seats and I wrote to the company a few times to make sure that these would be available when picking up the vehicle in Las Vegas, I was assured that yes. When we arrived, we were given only one seat. We were given no explanation or even help. We were told to go buy a seat at our expense at Walmart and make a claim at the end of our stay to have the seat reimbursed. We were forced to transport our 5-year-old to Walmart without a car seat, which is super dangerous and also completely illegal. It started our stay badly.

2. After only 1 hour drive, kitchen tap water is used for the first time. It's completely flooding the floor of the RV. I contact the company by email (because the company does not offer help by phone), and explain the problem. Again no help, we are told that the vehicle exchange is impossible and that we have to find a place by ourselves to repair the problem (we are not even helped in our garage searches). You can quickly see by examining the RV that one of the kitchen faucet pipes is cracked, which prevents us from using water (as much faucet, toilet, shower, etc.), because the pressure of the water in the cracked pipe makes everything flood with each use. In short, we finally find a place that repairs RVs, nothing compatible with our vehicle, and finally we find a way by ourselves (with a piece of hardware) to fix the problem temporarily. All this, again at our expense and in addition, it wastes us a lot of time.

3. I could also mention that when picking up the vehicle, instead of 2 complete bedding kits (including pillows, sheets and duvets), we were only given 3 contour sheets and 3 pillows (we were 4 people), we had to buy warmer blankets because everyone was cold at night. The pipe to fill the drinking water tank was damaged, almost impossible to fill, it took a lot of time and the water flew everywhere. The grey water tank was pierced and flowing all over the land. In short, a ton of problems, the vehicle was far from in order and it is obvious that no one had done any checks before renting this RV back to someone. Moreover the employee in Los Angeles (where we went to postpone the RV at the end of our stay), told us that this RV should never have been rented as they are state.

I must say, however, that the worst part was the team on site in Las Vegas, everything was weird, the employees were so nonchalant, they really laughed at us. I found the service quite worse in Los Angeles, the person was much friendlier and seemed really sorry for us, but it doesn‚Äôt change the fact that Indie Campers is a big company that clearly has a management problem. In conclusion, I would say that this company doesn‚Äôt care about customers, it doesn‚Äôt offer any help in case of problems (I dare not even imagine hell if a more serious problem happens, like an accident). In short, I made a claim to the company, to be reimbursed for the child car seat, the rental for the car seat I had paid for and did not have, the part bought at the hardware store and for the lost time. I was reimbursed the equivalent of C$300. I find it OK, but without any more stress and inconvenience caused by their negligence, I would have preferred to have more, but hey, it‚Äôs better than nothing. In conclusion, I do not recommend, it is better to find another company if you want to spend a more relaxing and safe holiday. Hopefully, my comment can help others not get fooled and it can help the company improve and make changes. We paid 4000 Canadian dollars (for 9 nights), it is expensive and at this Award we expect much better!

title: Iceland
text:
We used Indie Campers and strongly advise against it:
1) We booked the vehicle months in advance and a few weeks before leaving we were greatly increased the fare. After a difficult negotiation we accepted a smaller increase although important (not serious)
2) there were hidden defects of the camper at the time of delivery (a double bed was unusable as the pieces were not suitable for mounting the bed)
3) many indie camper users (met along the way) have reported important critical issues
4) non-existent customer service (cannot contact them by phone, the message box is answered by a totally useless chatbot)
5) faced with complaints we were treated with great and embarrassing indifference.

We are strongly disappointed and do not recommend using this company: to avoid!

title: Don't choose Indie Campers
text:
I will start by saying I would never choose Indie Campers again and would advice that no one else choose them either.
Now I will explain why. Me and four friends hired a campervan for five people to go on a trip from Berlin to Poland. A week before the trip, Indie Campers confirmed our reservation and said we would have a four person campervan.
Of course we spent the entire week calling them to get more information from them, because obviously a four person campervan would ruin our five person trip. They kept giving us really vague answers, just telling us unless we received an email from them there was no news. We never got more information or ways to fix the situation and kept calling and emailing daily, speaking with people who didn't seem to be aware of the situation and didn't seem interested in fixing our problem. We spent a lot of money on long distance calls, plus waisted a lot of our time trying to fix the issue and came under a lot of stress.
Long story short, they gave us a four person campervan which not only was a downgrade but ruined our vacation plans mid vacation. We actually had to keep one person out of the original trip and spend a lot of money making last minute plans for him. But on top of it all, they said they would reimburse us 900‚Ç¨ (which was the difference between the van we had reserved and the one they gave us) and we're also having a problem with this. They never even suggested they'd make a reimbursement until we demanded it via email and still it took them over two weeks to issue it, which means that nearly a month has gone by and we still don't have the money or any sort of follow through from their part.
Frankly, the whole situation is a disgrace. If they couldn't offer the van we had asked for, they should have done something about it earlier on, plus offered some kind of assistance given we had to make so many plan changes. They could have offered we take two smaller vans instead of one, reimbursed our money right then and there so we could use it for the car we had to hire, plus tent, sleeping bag etc we had to buy as a last minute solution. Basically, they could have done SOMETHING, but did absolutely NOTHING. They don't even seem to understand there are consumer rights to take into account, and we are firmly considering suing the company because our consumer rights were not met.
When we returned the van we let them know our reviews would be very negative because our whole experience had been negative and they didn't seem to care at all. Their only answer was "sure, we understand".
Of course we would never consider hiring through Indie Campers again. We're strongly advising everyone we know to avoid them and would also give the same advice to anyone reading this. Don't spend your money on overpriced vans, from a company that doesn't actually care whether you get what you paid for or not. Save yourselves a lot of unnecessary stress and choose any company but Indie Campers.

title: The worst company to rent a van
text:
Very bad experience with Indie Campers. I do not recommend it to anyone. The treatment was null and minimal, they explained everything to us half-heartedly without clarifying VERY important information. The condition of the van was terrible. We had to make repairs during the 7 days we had it.

And be careful, because now, 2 weeks later and once they had already returned the 2000‚Ç¨ warranty, they are taking money out of our bank account with minimal damage that according to a local mechanic is impossible to cost 2148‚Ç¨ that they have withheld from my account. We are already in contact with a lawyer to deal with this case and also to file a complaint as a company for many other irregularities that have been detected by this company.
We will never travel with this company again, you should know that there are FB groups and even forums on reddit to take legal action as there are many people who have been scammed.

title: Dishonest company to flee...!!!
text: The van was in poor condition and dirty when it was delivered to us. It was poorly organized, long waiting times, unclear explanations from employees. During the trip, parts fell as damaged, e.g. two windows. At check-out, they told us everything was good. Once with us, we receive an email where they say they discovered a scratch and that they ask us 2145‚Ç¨ of the deposit that had already been returned!!! Total cost for one week of old and dirty van: 3.895‚Ç¨. Anything. There are plenty of negative reviews on the web about Indie Campers who are making dishonest money. Avoid renting with them. We will try to take legal action to have them return the money they stole from us.

title: Feel like a scam - Unscrupulous staff
text:
We picked up our Camping car yesterday, August 17th 2024, at the Indie Camper depot (22 Rue de la Haye, 38070 Saint-Quentin-Fallavier, France).

The camping car was presented to us, damaged with lights cables, cut and hanging on the outside, tape all over, dirty and uncleaned. When raising concerns on the state of the camping car, the staff told me that it was ‚Äúillegal‚Äù for them to clean the outside and that I should take it with customer service. Not only the staff were unbothered and clearly did not care at all about the situation, they were also agressive.

The hanging/cut cables were stitch back together, with tape.

I asked for another camping car as this one did not feel safe and in a good enough state to be drove (not just unclean) and I was told that it was this one or no other and that I should take it with customer service. Being on holiday with two small children very happy for us to go holidaying I resigned and accepted to take this camping car.

We discover the following later ‚Ä¶. the fridge door opened wide while driving, breaking a couple of glass bottles, it actually does not shut and we had to buy tape to keep the door closed.

The battery were not charged even though we were told they were, which means that we had to have dinner with the motor on, so we could have electricity. Also, fridge not working as a result.

The main door does not shut fully with a constant gap of lights where cold, water/rain and noise gets in.

The drains of the shower and bathroom sink are blocked, water does not go away and therefore cannot be use.

I will post pictures so visual opinion can be made.

I have contacted customer service which remains silent.

This is clearly an unethical company with untrained, unprofessional and unscrupulous staff. This feels like a scam.

With safety in mind and given the state of the interior and exterior, I can only worry about the engine/motor, the breaks and overall safety while driving this v√©hicule.

We have paid a total of ‚Ç¨2833.34 for the whole trip, including full Premium insurance.

Anthony

title: Stay away from IndieCampers if you want to enjoy vacation
text: INdieCampers is the WORST camper van company! We weren't provided an electrical cord and we had no running water in our van even though the van had a kitchen and shower and sink, none of which worked properly. The worst part of this company is the assistance. They only respond and troubleshoot through email which wastes so much time when you need assistance. I would use any other company but this one. While we were on the road we met so many people who had used them once and never again. They promised us a $400 refund and they haven't done it. Based on the customer service reps who answer the phone (beyond bad) they never will refund it! IndieCampers has a very bad rating out among camper van users. Rent elsewhere if you want to enjoy your vacation! Ours was severely negatively impacted by this decision to use IndieCampers.

title: Really NOT good
text: Really not good. The booking, website, design is amazing. But the moment to pick up the camper is a mess. We paid extra to pick up the van later than the working hours and no one was there. We had to do everything remotely by ourselves with someone on the phone, Find the keys hidden in a parking lot (like a scape room). And the drop off of the van really bad. V-E-R-Y rude staff. Forcing us to leave a review before letting us go

title: Van was terrible with hardly anything working
text: A shocking state of the van outside bumps knocks just generally very poor. The inside sockets not working fridge not working properly lost a lot of food. Tried to complain nobody was bothered. Ruined are trip avoid.

title: If you break down, they won't help!!!
text: Our vehicle overheated and spent 8+ hours waiting for roadside assistance. The WhatsApp roadside help line asked me to troubleshoot the problem while we were stranded on a remote highway. The customer service rep stopped responding, leaving me and my friend with no option but to drive a failing vehicle to the nearest town. Once in town i contacted whatsapp again and got a different rep. They then suggested I get the car to a mechanic, pay UP FRONT for the repairs. Only when the mechanic turn me away did the WhatsApp fellow ask for our location to send a truck. That was 8 hours ago and still have not received any information about the tow or where i am supposed to stay tonight. Zero stars if I could.

title: If I could give this company 0 stars, I would.
text:
I cannot put into words properly how bad our experience was with Indie Campers, but I will attempt to, and I will create points to keep it short.

- We had to wait for 2 and a half hours over our pick-up time, which made us miss our equipment hire collection time, and delayed the holiday on the first day.
- The waiting room had mould growing on the ceiling and walls.
- We had to remind them of the extras we paid for (as they had forgotten).
- They could not provide us with a wrench/spanner for the gas cylinder and told us we needed to buy one.
- There was a very unpleasant smell in the fridge of something rotting.
- The van was falling apart.
- We had to pull over as the brakes were over-heating on mountain roads, leaving our LIVES AT RISK.
- We were stranded with a broken down van, with next to no help from the customer service team.
- Their internal communication was non-existent.
- We had to pay for 2 nights in a hotel before the company had even thought about organising transport for us.
- After half the holiday spend stranded, they asked us travel 3 hours back to Venice for a new van.
- On the way back to Venice, they decided to tell us that the new van would not be ready until the day after, leaving us stranded once again.
- We turned down the new van and any more of their services.
- We did not even have one full day in the van for the holiday.
- We are now pursuing action against them.

I cannot recommend enough to stay clear of this company. There are plenty of other campers companies like Road Surfers etc.

title: total disregard
text: I COME THROUGH THIS DECLARATION TO SHOW MY DISSATISFACTION AND INDIGNATION WITH THE COMPANY INDIE CAMPER'S. I BOOKED A MOTORHOME IN ADVANCE FOR A TRIP WITH MY WIFE AND DAUGHTERS. I PICKED UP THE MOTORHOME AT THE COMPANY'S YARD ON 07/13/2024 AND RETURNED IT FOR RETURN ON THE SAME DAY, 07/27/2024. DURING THE RENTAL, THE VEHICLE HAD PROBLEMS FOR TWO DAYS, CONNECTED TO EXTERNAL POWER, HOWEVER THE VEHICLE WAS NOT WORKING OR CHARGING. I CONTACTED THE COMPANY THROUGH CHAT, THEY ASKED ME TO ACT AS A MECHANIC AND ELECTRICIAN, I DID AND IT WAS NOT RESOLVED. AFTER TWO DAYS WITHOUT POWER, THE CAR RETURNED. BUT IT WAS A LOOOONG TWO DAYS WITHOUT POWER AND WITH CHILDREN. ON THE RETURN, A COMPANY REPRESENTATIVE TOGETHER WITH ME DID THE ENTIRE EXTERNAL AND INTERNAL CHECKS OF THE VEHICLE, VERY carefully and slowly under the sunlight, we saw together that the vehicle was in perfect condition and for this reason the company representative went into the SYSTREMA AND REDUCED THE RENTAL, AS I SAW. AFTER A FEW DAYS THEY CONTACTED ME BY EMAIL SAYING THAT THERE WAS A DENT IN THE FRAME OF THE CAR AND THAT THEY WERE GOING TO CHARGE ME. I SAID THAT I DID NOT AGREE BECAUSE THE EXTERNAL AND INTERNAL TECHNICAL INSPECTION HAD BEEN CARRIED OUT AND THAT THE REPRESENTATIVE HAD GAVE THE OK AND DOWNLOADED IT WITH ME. THE REPRESENTATIVE TOLD ME BY EMAIL THAT UNFORTUNATELY THAT WAS HOW IT WORKED AND THAT HE COULD NOTHING DO ABOUT IT. I THEN ASKED HIM WHAT THE PURPOSE OF THE REPRESENTATIVE'S DELIVERY INSPECTION WITH ME WAS AND WHY AT THE TIME NOTHING WAS FOUND AND AN OK WAS GIVEN? I SIMPLY SAID YES AND CHARGED MY CREDIT CARD, TAKING AWAY ALL THE CREDIBILITY AND TRUST I HAD PLACED IN THE COMPANY. A DISAPPOINTMENT.

title: Horrible Company, do some research, they will take advantage of you any way they can!!!!
text:
Be very cautious with this company! They will try to scam whatever money they can out of you in very unfair fraudulent business practices. I would recommend doing a short search online and you will find dozens of horror stories about this company. There is even a FaceBook page with hundreds of members who have been cheated out of thousands of dollars by Indie campers.

I actually had a great 9 day rental with one of there vans and returned it in great condition. Did a thorough investigation with their representative upon drop-off where we found no damage, he even remarked on what great condition the van was in and returned my 2000$ deposit at that time. End of story, All good. Not quite! Four days Later I receive a email saying they found damage on the van and they helped themselves to 780$ from my credit card without ever consulting me. They sent me a picture of the damage and it was extremely minor and superficial. There's no way that would cost 780$ to fix, if they even bothered to fix it. It was so minor that the representative I dropped it off with didn't even notice it. Seems like a money grab to me and there are dozens of stories just like mine. Some are far worse!! Please do a little research about this company and stay well clear of them. I wish I had!!!

title: Wring information on website / poor customer service
text:
Bitter sweet taste w Indie Camper. Our flight was delayed, contacted support right away to let them know and, event though the website stated pick ups where available until 6:30pm, they said if I didnt make it by 6pm I'd have to come the following day. They also stated late hours pick up was available for an additional fee, but they didnt honor that either. I requested to at least be reimbursed for the night I wouldnt be using the camper, but they refused it. Asked to talk to someone w the authority to make it "right" but they simply said no one is available and theres nothing I can do.
Why say pick ups are available until 6:30 pm, but then shut down at 6??
on the other hand, once we picked up the van, Francesca was great and very thorough, and when we dropped it off Antonio was also outstanding. Just wish the company was not so corporate greedy and be willing to do whats fair

title: Don't book!
text:
Please note: do not book!

Our recent experience of renting a motorhome at Indie Campers in Milan was disappointing and full of problems. From the beginning we were confronted with a series of inconveniences that seriously affected our holiday.

The pick up in Milan is very difficult to reach. It is an hour from Milan and there is no public transport to the pick-up location (25 minutes walk with your bags).

On arrival there was a lot of hassle and a lot of ambiguity. Chaos with unprofessional action.

Once on the way we soon noticed an unbearable smell coming from the toilet, similar to rotten eggs. This smell made us feel nauseous and with headaches for two days. Despite several cleaning attempts and the use of bleach, as advised by customer service, the smell lingered. This was just the beginning of a series of problems.

Unfortunately, that wasn‚Äôt all: a broken cabinet closure, the bathroom window didn‚Äôt stay open, at night we suffered from flashing lights in the camper, the camper‚Äôs battery didn‚Äôt fully charge (so without power almost didn‚Äôt work), the fridge leaked at high settings and customer service proved unhelpful despite repeated requests for help.

To make matters worse, the promised towels were missing, the washer fluid ran out quickly, one of the hobs did not work, and the sink did not run. The shower curtain was full of mold and the shower was full of hair.

The mosquito nets also did not close properly, allowing mosquitoes to enter. Blood stains from mosquitoes beaten to death were on the walls, the bedding smelled stale, and the engine oil was just about empty.

The camper came with insufficient amenities for the price we paid, and upon returning no one spoke English, which made communication difficult.

Given the many problems and the impact on our vacation, we wanted help and compensation when turning in. No one could help us any further and you will be sent from the locker to the wall.
Conditions were well below the norm, and the lack of support from the Indie Campers team made our experience even worse.

We DEFINITELY DO NOT recommend Indie Campers because of this negative experience and the lack of adequate service and support.

Do you want a nice holiday; do not book here!!

title: Indie Campers ripped us off
text: Indie Campers have kept 449 Euros from our deposit for a new spare tyre after we had a small screw in the tyre on our 2nd last night in France. The cost of a top-of-the-range tyre for this Mercedes van is ¬£120 plus fitting in the UK - we have exactly the same model at home. We are happy to pay for a new tyre - just not 449 Euros. The only way to contact them is via "online chat", no phone number to be found. My complaint was processed but the reply simply listed the "standard charges" which included a new tyre. This is greedy and money-grasping. Do not be fooled by the company's "hip" marketing and image - they have completely ripped us off and will not engage personally.

title: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY IN SWEDEN !
text:
Customer service was the worst that I have experienced.
Van not ready on time; ZERO on-the-road support/assistance; Poor equipment level; BBQs routinely thrown away after the rental; ZERO response to our complaints via both local operations team and customer feedback mechanism. Extras are expensive - especially the additional km packs.

title: IMPRESSIBLE. COMPANY CHAOS. NUNCA M√ÅS
text:
On July 19, I had contracted to pick up an Atlas 5 Motorhome at the Indie campers center located next to Milan Airport.

When I arrive what I find is real chaos. All customers with angry faces. After an hour waiting. The attendant is trying to deliver the dirty caravan, no, next thing. Sir tells me you haven't been given time to clean it because the previous client delivered it at 11:30. I tell you I'm not taking the dirty caravan. As you can see in the photos the manager started washing the motorhome in front of our eyes while at the same time attending to other angry customers.

After seeing my face and after two hours I was delivered the caravan without water and without the gray waters thrown. A real mess.

On return I contact customer service and they tell me that they give me a 10% discount on the next rental. What I'm demanding from Indie Camper is that I indense myself. Obviously I do not intend to rent in this company anymore.

Maintenance of the motorhome the null. The manager told me that I had to cast the adblue haha that funny. As I saw my angry face the manager sang proving that it passed like the flies of me.

Unpresentable. I don't understand how they can treat customers who feed them like that. I spent over 2,500 euros.

title: Really embarrassing.
text:
We rented a van from Indie Campers in Las Vegas on June 24, 2024 and left the camper in Salt Lake on July 5, 2024
To the chek in listless and incompetent staff.
They delivered a dirty camper both externally and internally.
After leaving we realized that the gas tank was only 1/3 full.
At the first stop we were looking for the inside table but there was only the foot.
As if that were not enough they did not deliver the two sets of towels that we had requested and paid for.
One of the two requested pairs of sheets was also missing.
The camper very comfortable but not maintained.
The bathroom door and the door under the kitchen did not close, so during the journeys they slammed, disturbing the Guide a lot.
And to complete, there was no connection pipe between the equipment for draining gray water.
A disaster.
I do not Recommendation Indie Camper.

title: Avoid these scammers at all cost!
text:
Our experience with Indie Campers was extremely disappointing and frustrating. The van we received had no working electricity, which meant we couldn't shower, cook, or charge any devices throughout our trip. When we reached out to customer support (which is outsourced), they unhelpfully instructed us to take the van to a mechanic at our own expense.

Having purchased premium insurance, we were assured that any issues with the van would result in a replacement being delivered to us. This turned out to be false. Instead, we were told to drive back to the pick-up center, pay a new deposit for a replacement van (if one was even available), and customer support couldn‚Äôt confirm availability as they couldn't contact the property directly.

Upon returning the van, we were unjustly accused of damaging it and were charged ‚Ç¨199 on my debit card without permission. The staff at the Rome pick-up center were extremely rude and unprofessional.

To make matters worse, we witnessed another family from Australia picking up their rental van, which had to be jumpstarted twice before they could even leave. It seems Indie Campers routinely takes advantage of international tourists.

The so-called premium insurance is a complete scam and offers no real coverage. I strongly recommend avoiding Indie Campers under any circumstances. They provide subpar vehicles and then find ways to charge you extra once you return the van. Their rental agreement allows them to charge you for nearly anything up to 30 days after returning the vehicle. Save yourself the headache and choose a more reliable rental company.

title: Don't trust this company.
text:
Don't be fooled by the name, they're not hip nor reasonable. They rip you off and tell you lies. Unfortunately, we had damage on the top of our van, which is not insured even if you buy the premium insurance. Indie campers charged us 2400 euros, twice as much as would be reasonable, thereby making our trip truly miserable. It overshadowed the fact that the van would stink of sewer for the first half our when we took off, while we made sure everything was emptied, and the fact that the extra kits that we purchased were far from complete.

Nasty experience.

title: Worst customer service
text: This company has the worst customer service. Do not rent from them, you will regret it. I rented in Iceland and it‚Äôs impossible to reach a live person. No one calls you back. The van is old, the heater didn‚Äôt work. Terrible

title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!! SCAM!
text:
AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ANY COST! If you did miss all the nightmeare stories other families went through with them and rented with them like we did, block your credit card right away! They will give you a beat up van that already has been damaged and will claim that you have damaged it. We returned the van with no issues, it was all clear at the check out and we received our refund back. A couple of days later we received a charge for 2865,41 Eur for damages we did not inflict! Read the contract! It says that they can charge you for any damages up to 30 days after the check out! Even after the check out went with no issues! They are a fraudulent company! Check the FB page called ''Indie campers have ripped us off'' to learn how other 1400+ people have been ripped off and scammed just like us! We are in the process of involving the lawyers and fighting to stop the injustice. This is a nightmare! SCAM! AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Date of experience: June 30, 2024

title: DON'T RENT WITH INDIE CAMPERS
text:
We are agree with all bad indication. Don't rent with Indie Campers ....
We met some problems. No support, ...
DON'T BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY

title: Appalling no customer service
text: We booked a campervan to go round Sweden they changed our booking to a day later so would have shortened our trip and all of our campsites needing changing etc and friends who had also booked a van not able to travel with us. Tried live chat five times and ignored person just would not respond, called and got cut off and submitted numerous complaint forms all without response. worst company I have ever dealt with. Only option left to cancel booking and only likely to get 50% refund when they could not honour our booking and so should have been full refund cost us a lost holiday and ¬£800.00 - disgusting company. Please avoid at all costs this company cannot be trusted and do not care about customers

title: Sicily vacation frustrated by dismal Indie Campers service
text:
Today, from the quiet of my home and not from a campsite in the sun and in need of much cleaning, I will tell the story of a frustrated vacation in Sicily because of the rent of a camper.
For starters, the pick-up point is in an industrial area behind the airport that forces you to take a taxi that, despite being only 6 km away, cost 25 euros. I think it wouldn't be a bad idea if Indie had a regular shuttle, even if it was paid for. And the reason is that to go from the airport to pick up the vehicle you can take a taxi, but to do the reverse route you play it. Especially since the check-in and check-out procedures are endless and also depend on the number of customers who have gathered at the same time. If the process also has any impact, it can take hours. When I arrived there was only one person to deliver and receive. On delivery, there were two.
That said, in our case, the camper we were assigned was delivered to us just as they had surely received it: it was dirty on the outside and inside, with barely a third of fuel, the additional battery 10% and the empty water tank. We were advised that night to sleep in a campsite and charge battery and water tank. As if that were not enough, the vehicle key (only one) had a depleted battery and did not work. It was to be operated by the physical key built into the controller. We were recommended to find ‚Äúa Chinese‚Äù, buy the battery and claim its amount through the company forms. Perhaps someone wonders why we admit to this whole series of breaches and that is that after almost two hours of procedures under a sun of justice, tired of the trip and wanting to start enjoying, one signs anything to get out of there.
Finally, we set off and ended up at a campsite near Lido di Noto. We arrived late at night and the recharging poles were not available so we had to wait the next morning. The night was torrid and we started to adjust the cabin to sleep. First surprise, one of the backs of the back seat that should lie down to look like a bed, did not. The switches that actuated each backrest seemed to cross at every push. Perhaps the lack of battery did not help either, but we could not start the engine at 12 pm.
We tried to mount the bed on top and we did, but it was absolutely impossible to sleep there in all the heat that accumulated.
Very soon in the morning we found a square near a recharging pole and while we took a walk to the village for breakfast, we left it charging. Before leaving, we found that the vehicle system detected that it was connected, however, after about three hours, when we were preparing to continue the route, we observed that the battery was still with 10%. We wrote to the support center by email (there is no emergency phone) to report both failures: battery and sofa bed. Hours passed and there was no answer.
Given this perspective, we decided to rent a night in a nearby hotel. In that hotel we also put the battery to charge to no avail. After three hours, it was still with 10% charge and that is not enough to activate the fridge. Since we were still unanswered we decided to extend one more night in that same hotel. And the truth is that we never received a response to the complaint.
We couldn‚Äôt and wouldn‚Äôt miss the holidays and decided to continue traveling by modifying the plan and going to hotels to sleep. As extras we had hired a butane cylinder, but since the fridge did not cool, we could not even cook for a single day and returned it intact.
The return process was also extremely tiresome. In both cases you must fill out a form of many questions in which if you do not show satisfaction you must explain the reasons. And all this with the mobile phone and in deplorable environmental conditions. Result: since we arrived, hour and a half lost. And lucky for us that we were delivering at 11:00 and the flight was at 21:30. Not like two more groups delivering with us and flying two hours later. Without a taxi to pick them up because you can't order one without knowing what time you're going to finish and one of them got complicated because of a little bump. Quite an adventure, but nothing fun.
As you have already anticipated, I have requested compensation from Indie Campers to cover my room expenses and amount to 632 euros for seven nights, duly documented plus the refund of the cost of the unused cylinder: about 50 euros. His answer: ‚ÄúWe are studying the case, be patient.‚Äù A week later we continue with the blocked deposit and the reiterative message asking for patience.
The signed contract itself states: 5.4 The security deposit will be returned to the Traveller at the end of the Rental Period by a member of the Indie Campers staff, provided that Indie Campers determines that the Vehicle is in the same condition as it was collected by the Traveller. The person who received the van, reflected in the system the delivery without any requirement or observation and let me know. More to go! And yet, eight days later, they have not lifted the hold.
Honestly, I hope that what happened in Catania is an exception and not the rule at Indie Campers and I also hope that they choose an amicable settlement that as of today, July 18 has not yet occurred. I will continue to report because I think it is necessary these types of platforms that give voice to the user.
(I simply add a photo of the condition of the controls to raise and lower the rear backrests to transform them into a bed, as an example of the general condition of the rented camper)

title: Avoid at all costs
text: Genuinely horrific to deal with. Booked a campervan to travel to the Europa League final, paid the ¬£99 out-of-hours collection fee and confirmed my time of arrival when booking and again before I left. I contacted them again on the day of travel to confirm the pickup time and was told the depot would be closed at that time, and I couldn't collect it. This occurred on the day of travel, and despite pointing out that I had previously confirmed my arrival time and paid extra for it, they said no and stopped responding on the live chat. I then had to book an Airbnb for the night, and they refused to give me the van until 9:30 am the next day. When I arrived at the depot to collect the van, the on-site staff told me he had been there until midnight the previous night, waiting as nobody on the online team had actually checked with him depot opening times. We then had nearly a 2-hour wait to get the van as their systems weren't working. Have flatly refused compensation or a refund for anything I've paid for that they then stopped me using. Terrible sham of a company, avoid at all costs

title: Very bad experience with Indie Campers ‚Äì safety neglected and no after-sales service
text:
Very bad experience with Indie Campers ‚Äì safety neglected and no after-sales service

We rented a van from Indie Campers and, after just a few kilometers, discovered that both front tires were completely bald, to the point where the inner cords were visible ‚Äì a dangerously unsafe condition for any rental vehicle.

Unfortunately, we didn‚Äôt check the tires before departure, trusting the company‚Äôs inspection process. They take around twenty photos before you leave, but fail to check the most critical safety elements ‚Äì like the tires.

After contacting customer service, we were instructed to replace the tires urgently at an approved garage, which we did. Since then? Nothing. It‚Äôs now been over two weeks, and despite multiple follow-ups, we‚Äôre still waiting for a refund. We're just being passed around with no resolution.

In short: Indie Campers may seem fine if everything goes smoothly. But as soon as something goes wrong, no one is there to help.

I strongly advise against using this company ‚Äì they show no real concern for safety or customer support.

title: Horrible exp√©rience
text:
Dear Sir or Madam,

We rented a VW Grand California from your Olbia agency from July 1st, 2025 at 4:30 PM to July 8th, 2025 at 7:00 PM (reservation no. 530PK4) for a total amount of ‚Ç¨1,712.56.

Upon collecting the vehicle, we immediately noticed several major issues:
‚Ä¢ The fuel tank was not full;
‚Ä¢ The water tank was also empty;
‚Ä¢ The awning was broken;
‚Ä¢ The step was missing;
‚Ä¢ The bed mattress was simply a block of uncovered foam, which does not meet basic sleeping equipment standards.

As no alternative was offered on site, we had no choice but to take the van in this condition.

The following day, on July 2nd, the water pump started malfunctioning, running continuously without pumping, leaving us unable to use the shower, sink, washbasin, or even the toilet.

We immediately contacted your assistance service via WhatsApp. Despite numerous messages, no practical solution was offered to resolve these issues.

On the morning of Friday, July 4th, we discovered that the gas bottle (which we had paid for) was empty, even though we had barely used the stove. Faced with this series of malfunctions, we had no choice but to return the vehicle to your Olbia agency. However, no replacement vehicle in proper working condition was provided to allow us to continue our trip. Moreover, the rental agreement was closed without any documentation being given to us, despite our repeated requests.

From that point onwards, we were forced to pay for hotels and restaurant meals in order to continue our vacation until the evening of July 8th.

We have kept all the necessary evidence to support our claims, including receipts for the expenses we incurred due to these issues.

In the interest of resolving this matter amicably, we are requesting a full refund of the rental, as the contract was clearly not fulfilled.

title: Indie Campers - Ireland - Truly Awful Experience
text:
We rented an Atlas 5 Berth campervan for 1 week 30.06.25 - 07.07.25. The cost was in excess of ‚Ç¨1,500 for the week. Pick up is from a rural location in North County Dublin. When we arrived we were informed we could not leave our car there, so we had to drive it into the village and leave it and hope for the best. The staff tried to push extra insurance on us by trying to frighten us if we did anything wrong to the van, they also charged us extra for a bottle of gas that we weren't expecting, they said this is how the owners make their millions! We commented that there was an awful smell of gas from the compartment and were told this is normal. We were shown around the van very quickly on how to operate it, it was an automatic, the you tube tutorial we were sent was for a manual. Once we left the site we travelled to Wicklow. Upon arriving we quickly realised the water was not working, therefore no way to wash, clean or use the the toilet, all the reasons why we booked this expensive van in the first place. The "customer Service" in Portugal which is through whatsapp were no help, and once we got in touch with the Dublin site, while they initially advised it was a minor fuse problem, following which they stopped answering our calls/texts. In the end we had to source 2 mechanics at considerable expense to us to fix the issue, so three days without water. The mechanic stated the water pump was broken before we took out the van and that we were the third family he had seen that week.
The awning and blinds didn't work properly either.

More importantly the smell of gas that we were told was normal got worse, we reported the issue and got no help, in the end a fellow camper who works with gas advised us it was extremely dangerous and fixed it for us. A truly awful experience all round and very stressful.

While we all know things can and do go wrong big companies like this should have people ready to respond and help fix the issues and not leave families to their own devices. We were offered a refund of ‚Ç¨70 for the entire experience and even though we have sent further complaints we have yet to hear back. I would never recommend this extremely unprofessional, unhelpful company to anyone.

title: No camper, no refund - stay away!
text:
Like so many others, I'm saying Stay Away from Indie Campers. We rented a campervan, paid for premium insurance and deposit and the full trip in advance of pickup. Got to the depot (in the San Francisco Bay Area) and they informed us that the camper we'd reserved came in broken, they couldn't fix it over the weekend, and they had no substitute (many campers in the lot, he told us none of them were functional). He was very helpful and told us how to contact headquarters for a refund - they're refusing it entirely. So we were out a camper and a trip, and they're keeping the money as of they'd fulfilled their obligation.
Though reading the online reviews, as I wish I'd done previously, seems like maybe we dodged a bullet - if we'd gotten the camper, the trip might have been worse.

title: Irresponsible Company with the Worst Rental Experience
text:
We booked an Atlas 5 in Zurich on 4 - 12 Jun 25. Worse rental vehicle experience ever.
The awning for our assigned campervan was not working right from the start yet they assigned the van to us. We asked for a replacement but obviously there was none and we had no choice but to proceed with the rental.
Then worse was to come. The grey water was leaking from an inner pipe which was not connected to the main discharge pipe! We were wondering why the grey water indicator was 0% all the time until it was pointed out to us that the grey water has been leaking from the wrong pipe underneath our van! So obvious that Indie Campers didn‚Äôt check the vehicle at all!!
Worse was that the bathroom shower area and all the sinks choked from the second day onwards and we spent all our time plumbing and clearing the chokes!

I asked for a full refund but they offered a derisory 5% discount on the next rental, as if I would rent from them again!!

And this is how they reply;

‚ÄúAfter reviewing your case, we noted that the pickup form you completed indicated the van was clean and that all facilities were functioning properly at the time of collection. However, we understand the inconveniences you experienced during your trip.

In line with our refund policy, we will compensate you with xxxCHF (3% of my rental) as a gesture of goodwill. Please note that this is the maximum amount we can offer in this case.‚Äù

They don‚Äôt acknowledge the issues I raised.

And by the way, Indie Camper will delete the negative posts!

title: Bad experience with indie
text: The agents at Hamburg Office are excellent specifically Sara !!!! ( who was really helpful) but I would say the hidden management of the company need to up their game , in this day and age , you should have a better point of contact , the Chat Line is pretty useless and you cannot email them, well you can but you get a response. I was given a local phone number for advice but of course that didn‚Äôt work . Thankfully we didn‚Äôt have any problems that we couldn‚Äôt eventually solve ourselves . We would never use this company again , and wished I‚Äôd looked at Trip Advisor first !!!!

title: No
text:
Indie campers is a scam! First you pay online a month before and you don‚Äôt have a contract! It is sent to us once we have collected the vehicle. We were in Australia contract signed on a tablet, in
English , write very little and we were never told to check certain points!
Kangaroo and bizarrely it turns out that accident with an animal is not covered despite a premium insurance which is very expensive! breakdown at our expense over 1100 kms and now we are sent the repair bill using the fingerprint of our cb they try to take directly from our account the sum of 12000 euros!! No assistance during the whole trip is smoky this assistance by chat they know nothing and say nonsense!!! To be banned

title: Nightmare experience
text:
Ok where to start.
We are currently travelling in Greece with a camper from indie campers (more like SCAMpers)
We were already suspicious at pickup, but as usual, us being too naive, went with it.
There was barely a check done beforehand, but since we were with a 6 month old baby in the blistering heat we just wanted to get moving. I had to make photos of all damages myself. When I notified the rental guy about window blinds being broken, a door lock not working, I was told not to worry about it. We were immediately told to upgrade our insurance, for "peace of mind". Let me tell you, peace of mind is the last thing we have right now.
Despite being told the adblue was full, they clearly just filled it just enough for the light to go out. After not even 100km, the warning light for adblue started lighting up.
After not even a day, the fridge broke down. First we were told it was a common issue. Almost immediately after that, we were told they never had that happen to a customer before? After another few hours (bear in mind, there is no way to call them, just Whatsapp messages, were first you are connected to a bot, and it takes hours to get an answer) we were told it was because of the 12v battery in combination with the heat (this is Greece, it's always hot), despite it being connected to the electricity on a campsite nonstop.
So, then I asked to have it repaired. They told me to get it repaired myself and that they would reimburse be. After checking their rental agreement, nothing is written about that. The rental agreement tells you to go to a RV repair place assigned by indie campers. Nothing like that happened to us. Now they are asking me to just go buy an electric cooler and send them the receipt. This is really a joke. Furthermore, as I said before, almost all window blinds were broken, with the fixtures lying around on the floor.
We paid for tableware, that was almost all dirty when we took it out of the box they gave it in.
The gas canister, also supposedly full, was already half empty when we first used it. They also give a secondary gas canister in case the other one "empties early" but it doesn't even have the right connection.
I can go on and on and on about this, bur clearly it's just a massive money grab with zero respect for customers. STAY AWAY!

title: Do not recommend, stay away
text:
I booked through indie campers and I I promptly found out I was lied to in the booking. The host for the car I booked was actually from this other company that was advertising on indie campers and after I submitted my booking, they wrote to me and said that they don't have that car anymore or any model like that and they also don't have the heater that was advertised in the booking and that if I still want to continue with another car and no heater. After some deliberation I was ok with that since we are travelling in the summer time, but right after I agreed he also said that 'hey you know that unlimited mileage you requested is not actually unlimited, it was a bug in indiecampers site and we only offer 150 miles/night.' After that I said I don't want this booking anymore as there is already too much false advertising and I want a refund.

Now this is where the problems started, on indiecampers website it says clearly there is a cancel booking button and they even show screenshots of it, but in fact there is NO SUCH THING and you need to write to their customer service if you want to cancel. The customer service is extremely slow and even deliberately ignoring you if you pursue this. I spent almost 3 hours of my time mostly waiting and remaking the chats with their customer service in order to get my request for a refund and cancel the reservation. The first 4 chats I initiated the person on the other side introduced themselves and then did not reply anymore, I literally got ghosted by customer service. After a few tries and the following day in the morning, I finally got someone who took my request and helped me, but still it took 3 hours in total of waiting.

In the end due to false advertising on that guy's cars I lost 53 GBP due to the cancellation policy, because that's how it is. it was OT's campers if you are interested and I would not recommend either OT's campers or indie campers at all, stay away from them. If you don't believe me, read the horror stories on reddit about them.

title: Avoid this company at all costs ‚Äî premium insurance means nothing to them!
text:
Avoid this company at all costs ‚Äî premium insurance means nothing to them!

We rented a camper and paid for the premium insurance specifically to avoid being liable in case of an accident. Unfortunately, an accident did occur ‚Äî and we did everything by the book. We filled out the police accident report, followed every instruction from the rental staff, and were told everything was in order.

Fast forward a couple of monyhs later: instead of handling it through their insurance (as they should have), the company completely dropped the ball and is now trying to make us pay for the damage ‚Äî despite our premium coverage. They even sent a debt collection agency after us!

We weren‚Äôt at fault, we followed every step they asked us to, and we had top-tier insurance. But apparently, that means nothing to this company. Their failure to file the claim properly is now somehow our problem? Completely unacceptable and borderline fraudulent.

This has turned into a nightmare, and we‚Äôre now stuck dealing with threats and stress for something we should have been protected from. We trusted this company ‚Äî and that was a mistake.

Do yourself a favor: go with a rental company that respects its customers and honors its insurance policies. This one clearly doesn‚Äôt.

title: Worst customer service in history
text: van had to go into the shop an hour after renting it. They would not provide a new van or a pickup. Had to cancel as we were pressed for time due to slowest customer service response in history. Had to leave the van at a dealership for repairs that would take over two weeks and now they will not refund my $500 deposit although they promised they would after 30 days. Worst experience. Avoid them like the plague.

title: Unreliable and unable to provide solution, fingers off!
text: Have already rented many campers, this time unfortunately for Sardinia via Indie, all good until a few days before the trip the camper was simply cancelled without giving reasons to us..flights booked, 2adult 3 kids and before Easter hardly any alternative possibilities, the indie staff has shown themselves affected but also unable to find or offer a solution...a camper landlord should be obliged to provide replacement service in case of short-term cancellation, I also do not get the money back as a tenant if I cancel at short notice, without giving reasons. no customer orientation, dubious and untrustworthy..fingers away from the company and their cooperation partners.

title: Many problems with Indie Campers in Iceland
text:
I absolutely do not recommend Indie Campers in Iceland. We rented an Atlas 5 campsite for 7 days in April to go around Iceland and it has been a disaster. We had an engine failure on the second day, a leak in the fresh water tank, windows not working, armchairs cracked, the camper is not 5 people (maximum 4), we have had to refill the Adblue three times and, above all, the assistance service at check-in, during the trip and at check-off has been very bad. Plus, premium insurance doesn‚Äôt cover just anything, the fine print tells you once you get there while you‚Äôre asked to sign the contract. All this was not unlucky, during the trip we met many people who also traveled with different models of Indie Campers camper and all had similar problems, especially the engine error, which is the most serious of all. At check-off they had us waiting almost two hours because it turns out that the workers had gone on strike because they had not been paid... It looked like a company in bankruptcy.

Really, at the moment I do not recommend renting one of their campers in Iceland at all, let alone for the very expensive price they have. I think it is much better any other company of simpler and more reliable campers. However, the heating and cooking worked well for us, we were able to complete our trip and the experience we loved despite these problems.

title: Abusive cost repair
text:
I put a star on because I can't put less on.
We made a small dent (about 2 centimeters) in the ceiling. Despite having the premium coverage we have been charged 1,750 euros, cost totally disproportionate to the actual value of the repair.
The worker's treatment was correct.
I do not recommend that you use this rental company ha that any setback, however small, can ruin your trip and your economy.

title: SCAMMERS AND CRIMINALS!!!
text:
I start this review by saying PLEASE DON'T BE A VICTIM FROM THIS COMPANY. I rented their RV in Las Vegas. Nevada. My first impression was like I was walking into a homeless shelter. I got stranded in a gas station in Utah on my way to a campground. The RV did not want to start due to a defective battery (according to a mechanic who did a jumpstart)
Their customer service is below terrible, all the communication is through Wasap. After waiting hours with my wife and a 4 year old, they answered back and blamed me if by mistake I had left anything on, or put diesel gas instead of unleaded. They did not want to give me a refund for the money I spent for the jumpstart ($100) and the day that I lost going to the shop to replace the battery.
In conclusion, I wish I could know before I made the decision to rent an RV from Indie Campers.
DON'T BE THE NEXT VICTIM!!!

title: CAREFUL
text:
WATCH OUT. They're scammers.
With 4 days to pick up the campervan they change my pickup location. In an isolated and difficult place to get to. I can only get there by taxi at a cost around 100‚Ç¨ from the airport and 45 minutes from it.
The night before I get on the plane, they call me on the phone to tell me that the pickup time instead of 09:00 h., has changed at 16:00 h., in the afternoon.
They give no option with so little margin time to adjust the rhyme. We decided to cancel the trip forfeiting the amount of airline tickets
I demand the reimbursement of the bed kit, cleaning,... (100‚Ç¨) and the extra for premium insurance (100‚Ç¨) and after chatting on the web with a robot I get absolutely nothing.
You can't call them and talk in person but they can call you at any time.
Zero professionals and zero open to customer satisfaction.

title: SCAMMERS/SCAMMERS FLEE
text:
Do not rent with this dishonest company ü§• @indie_campers
We only had problems with them including a puncture that could have been much more disastrous (dashboard tire pressure drop indicator not even working!)‚ò†Ô∏è. Vehicles are not maintained at all contrary to the beautiful image they like to put forward on networks. Moisture, water flowing from the wall, wet mattress, forgotten toilet box, black engine oil coal parallelism not realized, vibration while driving and I go on!!!
