title: Indie campers Marseille
text:
Marseille
We rented a Marco Polo from Marseille. The guy who dealt with us was lovely but the good news ended there. We had ordered fold up bikes but when we arrived all of their bikes were broken. You could have made two good ones in a few hours but they hadn‚Äôt. While it didn‚Äôt ruin our holiday it did change it significantly as we had planned to stay out of towns. The van also only had 3km of fuel in it despite paying for ‚Äòfull to full‚Äô. This ended up costing me ‚Ç¨40 more as I filled it and didn‚Äôt need to. Only 1 of the gas hobs worked in the van. This became less important when the supposedly full gas can ran out on day 3 after boiling kettle 5 times. The water pump also stopped and I had to reset the electrics. It happened 3 times in 7 days. When we dropped it off we were told it was because it was the end of the season and everything needed repairing!!!
The van did drive ok.

title: DO NOT USE INDIE CAMPERS ICELAND
text: Indie campers in Iceland my advice to future travellers is to avoid using this company. The cleaning is very poor. We had ladies dirty underwear down the side of the chair and the handbrake did not work. We reported to the company and they told us they disengage them because they freeze due to the weather, this then makes it hard to do hill starts but also makes the vehicle unsafe I‚Äôm sure that Icelandic authorities request safe road worthy vehicles on their roads and I hate to think what the insurance company would say if they knew that handbrakes were deliberately disengaged new. Overall the vehicles are generally very tired and well used and the fleet needs upgrading.

title: Avoid this con of a company like the plague, they will scam you.
text:
Avoid this con of a company like the plague, they will scam you.

Hired a camper in Spain, and the actual experience at the time was great.

However, 3 weeks after our return, I suddenly received an email that head office had reviewed the returns pictures, and had charged us almost ¬£2,000 for damages.
After investing a lot of time fighting this, I even received a call from a guy at the hiring site who 100% agreed that there was no damage, and that this was clear even in the photos that head office had supplied.
Eventually, this charge was reversed, but despite promises no apology or compensation was received.

Unfortunately, we did not learn our lesson, and did not cancel the card. Another couple of weeks later, I received an email that we had incurred a fine in Belgium during our hire.

It took me all of about 5 seconds to note that the registration did not match, and this also occurred 2000km away from the hire location, when our return mileage was about 300!

Do *not* hire from this company or it will just start a chain reaction of frustration and charges.

title: big bluff
text: Big bluff. Nothing interesting to report. Lots of money for buses and entrance tickets, to visit a site of modest importance.

title: Tour guide did not provide tour of interior palace as stated in viator description!
text:
Sintra was beautiful -loved the furnishings in the palace as compared to empty buildings in Alhambra. Overall, with what we saw, we would rate stonehedge a 2, Alhambra a 5 or 6 (but worth doing) and today's sites a 9.5.
However, our tour guide sucked today. We were all separated (Joe and Connie in one van, Sarah in one and us in one due to us booking on separate cards). We understood so no issue and it was fine getting a day to ourselves.
Our tour guide was Antonio and he had zero enthusiasm for his job. He knew his history but showed no joy doing his job. He was anxious at each stop to get to his cigarette. The other tour guides (Sarahs and Joes) were with them as they walked through the palace interior (as our tour description described) and talked about everything. Ourguide left us as we entered and told us we would see the bedrooms on the first and second floors then move on to the open area and finally the kitchen where he would meet back up with us. Very disappointing.
We are now on our drive back to Lisbon and he will not get any tip. He is a pill. In fact, we feel we should get a full or at least a partial significant refund.

title: Not a guided tour!
text: Booked the Fatima day tour for Easter Sunday .We were really excited to spend this special day on this tour . What a disappointment.. The tour guide basically gave us a 15 minute talk before each stop explaining to us what we would see and then left us alone to explore each of the sites . Due to it being Easter Sunday, they ran the tour in the opposite order than they usually do stating that Fatima would be too busy in the morning, and we would need to leave it for the afternoon which was understandable‚Ä¶ . The lunch restaurant in Nazare that the guide suggested was very good but he neglected to mention it was cash only ( we did have cash but it did surprise some of the other guests in our tour group) .. when we reached Batalha is when the guide realized that the church was closed .. I feel like this is a huge oversight on their part. as the tour operator. they should‚Äôve known the church was not going to be open and planned for something else to do during that time . We then reached Fatima where he left us to explore . I would have liked a more guided experience . If you need transportation to and from Lisbon to the sites this is for you and if you want a guided experience then I would look elsewhere .. not the guided experience we paid for .

title: Very Disappointed
text: The trip to Fatima was disappointing. Our driver's English was very hard to understand.. At Fatima he dripped us off and told us when and where to meet. None of the brochures at Fatima were in English. It wauld have been nice if he had taken the time to explain the site and point out the significance of each building. From there we went on to Obidos with very little time to walk through the town. Overall, all 4 of us in our group were highly disappointed. We did feel that a different tour guide would have made a difference.

title: The embarrassment we suffer
text:
On 12/03 we went to the meeting point, in front of the Hard Rock store in Lisbon, we arrived at the point at 7:40, the tour was scheduled to begin at 8hrs. The guides at 8 arrived, we accompanied our guide (I do not remember the name) who would do the tour in Portuguese, with us were 3 women who spoke Spanish, so it would be Portuguese and Spanish.
We settled in the van, in the 2 seats right behind the driver, me and Paulo, my husband, we were on a honeymoon, as I said we were already sitting and waiting to leave, when the head of the tourism agency approached the van and asked us to leave the same pq had a problem with 2 other passengers, so we did and we left the van, who was informed that because there had been a problem with these 2 customers, who spoke English, we would be allocated in another van, since the guide could not speak q 2 languages, because seiae in which we left would now be Spanish and English, could not be the Portuguese. I already in advance, before the van, q we would, get close to us, I already questioned! Is the van full?? And it was said that yes, they would have 2 vacancies, which would be occupied by us, me and Paulo, I soon began to find a lack with us, since we were early in place to pick up good places and together in the van, but we were told that we would go together, when the van arrived, there was only a vacancy next to the driver and in the last row of the car in question, it was there that we were indignant and said that we would not be separated the whole journey. Whether you take a tour, bus, van or other means, we want to have at our side the person we will interact during the trip, we will appreciate together the landscape and exchange ideas of everything we will see on the way and in the stops, that is, we will enjoy together all the time, the q we were private what took us out of the van, in which we would do the tour.
The embarrassment was not only that we were taken out of the van, as well as wanting to make it seem that we were being conoreensive, the q made the passengers of the van talk q we were delaying their ride from the new van, the q would only have the separate seats.
I wanted to cry for the way we were treated. Because we were not given a solution, for a problem they created, but two options, either go apart or not go. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS COMPANY.

title: Poor experience with Inside Lisbon Tours!
text:
First bad experience for my family in Portugal.
Tours with Inside Lisbon Tours operator is a mass production even though it is called small group tour. ~50-60 people are gathered at a meeting spot and broken into preselected groups of 8 people per minivan. Everything depends on your luck, my family of 3 were put in a group with another 5 people who couldn't speak English for a whole day. Guide (and they are below average with this operator to begin with compared to others) had to translate everything in two languages obviously slowing down the group when she could and talking about something we already passed when she couldn't. Realizing that I called operator right away since I had another tour booked through them to check if they can guarantee for us to be next time in English speaking group. They refused stating it is against their policy. Cancelled the tour right away (thanks Viator) and booked with another operator. They have a bigger much more comfortable bus (day trip with three people at the back of a minivan is not great) and albeit group is multilingual they had 3 guides, Spanish, French and English, creating much better experience at quite a bit lower price. So beware, with Inside Lisbon you may have group speaking your language or have a poor experience like me.

Sintra itself is nic, but Cascais is a bit of a waste of time. Would be much better if a tour would visit both castles in Sintra skipping Sascais (Inside Lisbon tours only one)

title: Horrible lost $200+
text: I booked the tour twice and was told there was no room on the tour for me and suggested another day, (when I would be sailing to South Africa.) I lost $200 due to the ‚Äúnon refundable policy. No communication. Horrible service.

title: Lisbon Food and Wine
text: The tour operator was pleasant and knowledgeable but the tour was overbooked and we couldn‚Äôt hear what he was saying. We‚Äôre often crammed into small restaurants and had to stay outside and not be able to see. Too much alcohol and not enough about how they prepared food

title: Poor service
text: We were very disappointed in our tour. We paid for a full day tour but were only given a half day. We did not get to see the second palace at all. I would not recommend this company.

title: Terrible Tour Company Bad Policy
text: Horrible customer service no provision for Torrential rain. The day before tour we contacted operator since heavy rain forecasted for morning tour. They told us afternoon was sold out and-said too late to cancel. The day of tour-we made our way to meeting point. It was absolutely pouring and windy. We had an umbrella and rain coats but we were getting soaked. There was no way this could be even remotely acceptable to walk in. Puddles and soaking wet. We contacted operator again and were told to bad tour goes any weather. Ridiculous. If people want to walk in horrible weather all wet they can-but should be given option to cancel. TERRIBLE POLICY.

title: Worst day trip of my life
text:
Don‚Äôt waste your money.
This company does not care about your experience.
I was put in a Spanish speaking tour even though I don‚Äôt speak Spanish.
They said by my name they thought I could speak Portuguese which is very close to Spanish.
Guide disregarded my concerns and said he would also do the tour in English.
Spanish was spoken first and by the time he translated to English we were far past the monuments and the Spanish group would start having a conversation in Spanish so it was hard to listen to the English version.
When I asked the driver to ask them to
Keep it down so I could hear him, he replied with ‚Äúhow do you think I feel‚Äù? And then said that that was the reason why he asked me to sit in the front seat.
Waste of money and a day of my trip I cannot get back.
Buyer beware. Rent your own car and you‚Äôll see it at your pace without being rushed around.

title: Too difficult
text: We visited Lisbon on sky princess timing dictated we had to book the afternoon tour, which meant a hot afternoon. The tour description details that participants need moderate fitness level. I would disagree - I am 71 go to the gym each day and practice yoga daily I consider myself quite fit, . However this tour was beyond my fitness level. So I would caution anyone before booking this tour. The level of walking and standing ( no seats or rests available) while listening to the history of Lisbon was intense. Several people younger than I dropped out of the tour and I myself chose to leave before the conclusion. I think insider Lisbon should amend their fitness requirements .

title: 2 languages in 1 group- would not recommend!
text:
Our guide Felipe was 5 star BUT the because half of our group was English-speaking and half was Spanish-speaking, he had to rush through saying everything twice. No time for questions until later (not when we were at the point of the tour when we wanted to ask them) and because he spoke in Spanish first, by the time he went through his descriptions in English, we were often leaving the area he was discussing.
It wasn‚Äôt our guide‚Äôs fault, in fact, he had to work twice as hard as the other guides. It‚Äôs the tour company‚Äôs fault for trying to save money by coming 2 groups speaking different languages instead of using 2 separate guides.
We had booked months ahead so it had nothing to do with when we booked.

title: Commercialization at its worst
text:
I‚Äôll keep this short. Commercialism at its worst. Seriously! I‚Äôve been to the Sainte-Anne-de-Beaupr√© Shrine in Quebec. I‚Äôve been to Lourdes in France. I have been many religious shrines that have could spiritual and up lifting. This was not it. After walking the grounds which I found expansive I found that every location ask for a donation which was fine. But I found the ‚Äúgift shop‚Äù disturbing from the glow in the dark Virgin Marie‚Äôs to the wax body parts you can burn (instead of lighting candles to pray). Check out my pics and you will see what I mean.

I don‚Äôt think the Virgin Mary predicting this‚Ä¶

title: Really cruded...
text: Realy friendly qbd Grate guide, but the places that we visited was popper turist traps. I wuld definitely try to find a castle that are les known and touristy...

title: Is Lisbon Small-Group Portuguese Food and Wine Tour a scam?
text: My wife and I signed up for a food and wine tour in Lisbon. They sent us a link with directions to meet at the Praca do Principe at 5:30. recommending we arrive 15 minutes early. In fact, we arrived at the meeting point at 5:10. There was no one there. We waited for one hour but no one showed, I tried to call and text but no response. They, of course, had my phone and e-mail address but did not contact me. I contacted them via their website and was assured that "We're on it" and that I would receive a response "within 24 hours". Dead silence. I have disputed the charge on my credit card and do not expect to have to pay for the tour. Nevertheless, they ruined our evening by making us wait over an hour and not showing up. The fact that they have not responded to my inquiry makes me believe this is a scam.

title: Too much talking, not enough walking
text: Our guide was Anna. If you want an extensive wordy history lesson, she is your guide. On a 2 hr tour, we did not leave the main square (meeting point) for 45 minutes. She talked the entire time. By 1 hr later the tour was only about 25% complete, and we bailed. I have a masters degree in history and hitting people with a blizzard of words and details is not the way to convey what could be an exciting story.

title: Subpar service from tour company.
text:
The places that we visited were great and worth visiting. However, the tour company was not able to deliver quality service. The tour was supposed to be a small group but because they did not have enough drivers or guides they combined to groups for a total of 20 people. The tour started 1 hour late because we had to wait for a bigger bus. The tour guide was basically a chaperone and did not add anything else as a guide.
I will not use this tour company in the future.

title: Avoid this tour company if you are expecting it to be in the language of your choosing
text:
Booked an English tour but wound up in a group with 80% french speakers and a tour guide who spoke almost entirely in French. Completely avoid this company until they can address this language issue. Our tour guide was decently friendly and overall I would have given him about an average/slightly below average grade (the worst of my 3 portugal tour guides but still not terrible). I blame the company for forcing him into doing dual hmm language tours.

Also, we sat in the back and the van‚Äôs ceiling is too short for someone my height (6‚Äô2). Kept hitting my head on the low roof and the van was extremely hot in the back. Up front the guide was speaking entirely in french with the french half of our ‚Äúsmall group tour‚Äù and really didn‚Äôt engage us in conversation the entire day (thats ok because we‚Äôre introverts so didn't mind) but would have liked for some input on air conditioning and proposing an alternative seating arrangement so taller people could have space (seemed unsafe as each bump I nearly broke my neck on the roof).

We would have been better off taking a direct trip from Lisbon to Obidos as it was the highlight of the trip.

title: Great guide, vegetarianism ignored
text:
I was going to score 4, as the guide was brilliant (Martin), but then it dawned on me, the word ‚ÄòFood‚Äô in the title and the price

Martin was brilliant. Knowledgable, effervescent, keen to answer all questions, and clearly adored his job. MARTIN WAS EXCELLENT

Not all the food stops were great, but on the whole you got several ‚Äòsmall plates‚Äô throughout.

My partner is vegetarian though, and I made this clear at booking. In essence this was not prepared for, and ‚Äòad-hoc‚Äô, ‚Äúoh just eat the cheese bits‚Äô was how his was managed. Specifically at the final food stop, which had clearly taken a large chunk of the price of the tour, at a fairly high-end restaurant with its own guide provided.

At this restaurant, zero alternative was offered, so she sat with a sardine , 2 pieces of sausage, and cheese in front of her.

This was very shirt-sighted in 2024, and a huge surprise in such a broad minded, food friendly city as Lisbon

Guide - 5*
Food - 1*

= 2*

title: not doing it is just bad
text: disappointment this tour, despite the very enthusiastic guide, this is absolutely not recommended. Food and drinks are seriously substandard and an insult to the beautiful dishes and ingredients they have in Portugal

title: Would like to have more food tasting
text:
Leslie was great and made it really fun. The walking wasn‚Äôt too hard, area was fairly level.
Food wasn‚Äôt good. We wanted to get a taste of Portugal food and got a piece of cheese at one stop, cod cake at another stop, pork sandwich at another stop, pickled sardines at last stop.

title: Very bad
text: I've done a lot of trips with them and for once I'm forced to change the destination for serious work reasons they make me pay the penalty... terrible

title: Buyer became.
text:
I struggled to rate this because my poor rating isn‚Äôt about the locations themselves, but the actual tour. Specifically, the guide and the amount of time at each stop.

While I loved each location, the tour doesn‚Äôt allow you enough time to truly appreciate each stop. If you‚Äôre looking to just stop, take a couple pics and say you were there, then that‚Äôs what this is. In √ìbidos, I didn‚Äôt even go in to a single shop or buy anything, because it only allowed time for me to walk from one end and back to the meeting spot. Nazare is the only spot where we had enough time to eat, but pretty rushed and, again, no time to even visit any of the shops. I was very disappointed at F√°tima where I didn‚Äôt even have enough time to visit the shop or even pick up a candle.

It‚Äôs simply too many stops to do in one day unless you are okay with just touching and leaving.

My MAIN complaint and reason for the poor rating is with the DRIVER/Guide. He drove way too fast. 140 kph (90mph) the entire way ‚Ä¶ it was raining heavily that day and made absolutely no modifications to the speed even though every single digital sign advised so. I was sitting on the passenger side, so I know for a fact the speed he was going and when I asked him, he said he was driving the legal speed which was not true. When I asked if he could adjust it a bit, he looked at me and said he does this drive every day and knows how he needs to drive. I politely told him that I don‚Äôt doubt that‚Äôs true on other days, but today‚Äôs conditions were different. He made no modifications and continued to pass every single vehicle on the road with the exception of 2 sports cars with equally irresponsible drivers I‚Äôm sure. He failed to consider the enormous responsibility he has on his hands, the lives of 8 others, one of which was a toddler, and another an elderly recently retired couple. A complete irresponsible decision. It made what should have been an enjoyable day to a terrifying experience that I was tempted to just get off and figure out how to get back to Lisbon on my own. Not knowing how easy or hard that would be, I felt trapped. I had read a similar review before booking this tour and dismissed it thinking it was just someone that‚Äôs overly nervous. Now I realize they were not exaggerating at all and I would definitely not recommend this tour to anyone. Nothing is worth placing your life in unnecessary risk.
You can easily just take the bus from Lisbon to Fatima or any of these places without a guide that basically just tells you things you can easily research on jour own.

Second complaint: the driver flat out LIED. Our first stop was Fatima and before arriving he asked each of us, if we planned to buy any religious items, and, if so, he would stop at a store which would be the only chance we would have to but anything because there is no other shop at the actual destination stop. So, I felt compelled to buy my items at that store. Only to find out later that there is, indeed, a store at the basilica (the actual catholic shop). One of the other passengers mentioned it as we were leaving Fatima, so too late for me to even go to it. I find it hard to believe that the driver doesn‚Äôt know this and makes me wonder if he gets some kind of commission from the store he stopped at ‚Ä¶ in retrospect, I found it odd that he was standing at the register while I was paying. Especially, when I had made it obvious that I was very unhappy with his irresponsible driving and wasn‚Äôt engaging with him in any way, shape or form during the drive.

I will admit that the return drive was a lot better. It wasn‚Äôt raining, so the speed wasn‚Äôt so much a problem for me then and he became much nicer (maybe because he remembered we would be rating).

But, Buyer, beware.

title: Terrible operator who totally ignore me and unresponsive
text:
I think the operator lack flexiblity. I was not feeling well and ask for a change of date to the tour. They did not even reply me after I pm the operator . I understand I should have informed earlier but I was really not feeling well at the night before due to jet lag . Being a day tour operator , I think there should be some flexible in this . I did not even ask for refund.
I find it unprofessional and lack of ethic . I would request all to not go to this operator. They ignore my request and was not reasonable. It was a terrible experience
I hope the operator can please contact me

title: Great guide but over priced for what you get
text:
We had a great tour guide was a pleasure to be with her however the overall experience was extremely dissapointing for the price that you pay. We didnt even have the traditional desert which should be a must in our opinion. Choices of food not impressive at all and small portions. Example : Cheese tasting was just one square of cheese !
Its a pity cause guide was really nice but just not worth the money

title: very bad organisation
text: We were due to leave at 8.30am for a full day trip. Text message at 7am to say tour guide sick and trip cancelled. They really should have a back-up plan for one sick tour guide. It was the last day of our trip and we'd filled in the other days so nothing left to do.

title: Total waste of time
text:
Very average and disappointing having been on 11 different street food tours over the years this is the only one we didn‚Äôt enjoy everything was average and 3 of the stops terrible from cold food tasteless food it would of been 0 from 5 if the last 2 hadn‚Äôt just saved it our Chilean guide tried his best for what was he had to work with .
Save your money and do your own

title: ALONE CAN BE DONE
text: Absolute disappointment. Due to the large number of sights, we had booked a German-speaking guide. When we were picked up, only a friendly guide showed up who knew nothing and could only speak English. Fortunately, the cancellation was fairly straightforward. We did the tour on our own with a few reservations and almost 2 hours late and can confidently say that it was worth it this way too. It must always be mentioned that these are absolute tourist hotspots and are accordingly overcrowded. Worth seeing, but make sure you have time.

title: Waste of time
text: Obidos was a wonderful place to visit; needed more than 45 minutes though! The rest of the trip was a laboured waste of time. Not enough time for lunch- we had to leave the restaurant after waiting 40 minutes as the waiter could not commit to serving us within an hour - not a real cristisum of the tour except that we were left at a busy time to choose our own restaurant in Nazare which was already overloaded with tourists! Just enough time for ice cream

title: Deplorable
text:
Very poor organization, too much pollution linked to pollution!!!!!
In short, we didn‚Äôt see anything because there was so much waiting!

title: Tour stranded a solo traveler
text: Bus driver refused to pick me up then left the pickup area without me even though I was in the park and couldn‚Äôt find them, something I communicated with the tour operator several times. I found myself alone in a park early in the morning (only 5 minutes after the pickup time) so I took an Uber to Sintra and had a lovely‚Äîand cheaper‚Äîday to myself. Skip this tour and take the Uber, it‚Äôs quick and convenient and you can spend time at your leisure at more sites than the tour brings you to. Buy the tickets to Sintra online like I did. And you won‚Äôt have to wait in line if you show up at or a little after your schedule time slot.

title: Bilingual tours are not well structured and awkward.
text:
The itinerary fails to tell you that you wont be spending some free time on some of the main attractions of the Sintra park. It is ONLY the palace even though nearby theres a lot to see.

The tour is most often bilingual so you will have to be lucky to get a guide that can smoothly switch between both languages. Mine spent 80% of the time on the language that we havent selected until we complained.

Lack of microphone for the tour guide made things difficult too since the Sintra palace is pretty tight while walking the corridors and there's a lot of people.

If you choose this tour, you will be giving up some precious time in Sintra park. If you dont have time its fine, but we decided to abandon the tour group since it was uncomfortable for us to be together because of the language barrier and also we would miss most of Sintra. Specifically the mouros ruins.

Giving it 2 stars instead of 1 because the tour provided us 80% refund since we abandoned it, so at least customer service took responsability. Would not recommend though.

title: Do not open tickets on mobile phones!!!
text: We booked tickets in advance. Once we got there, we couldn't open the tickets on our phone - we had to buy new ones!!!!!!

title: It's not worth it!
text:
Very bad. There is no clear information for transfers. All very expensive. Bad organization.
It can easily be avoided.

title: Tour driver/guide was terrible !!
text:
Most boring trip, the guide behaved like a cab driver. He never made any efforts to share some facts and the group of 6 were always on their own. One couple was always late and finally the driver gave them the notice after 3 attempts.

I asked him to tell them in the very first place after coming 30 mins late and he ignored. He didn‚Äôt even want to suggest where to eat for lunch. He felt he would be accountable if it something was not good. Spike more in French than english.

Moreover, the places were not worth visiting for 1 hour stop. Seeing some dead places wasn‚Äôt worth and the so called tour guide took it to another level.

If you want to save money, consider going on your own to the places and spend some quality time.

title: Bad experience with Carlos
text: Bad experience with carlos, he didn‚Äôt do much for us and refused to answer my questions. I felt as if I was a burden to him on the tour by just existing. I was very uncomfortable and the others on the tour noticed his attitude towards me as well. Lastly, They didn‚Äôt show us all the things advertised in the pictures which I was upset about because I specifically booked the tour for the other sight

title: They won't hold themselves to their word. Avoid
text: When they tell you you'll get to visit a palace and the beautiful town and you get 15 minutes in town and denied entrance to the palace they still refuse to refund you even when the guide says you'll get a full refund. There are plenty of other tour companies that give a similar offering, choose them instead.

title: Verzichtbar
text: Der Guide war gut und nett, die Tour selst ein Witz. Die Gruppe war mit 18 Leuten keine kleine Gruppe und die Locations und die erhaltenen Tastings eer ein Witz, dann lieber etwas mehr Geld verlangen und das bieten was man verspricht.....

title: mala
text: El tour es aburrido, son muchas horas arriba del carro, no vale la pena, el gu√≠a Rui hablaba mal espa√±ol, no se le entend√≠a bien. Nazar√© no tiene sentido ir, es solo una playa y F√°tima a menos que seas muy religioso es muy aburrido. Adem√°s llegaron tarde a la hora del encuentro por la ma√±ana.

title: Un authorized charges
text: Did not book this tour. Booked a private tour and was charged for 2 different tours. Disputed the charge and TripAdvisor said I needed to dispute with my credit card company. Terrible customer service. Will never book anything through them again.

title: Poor Trip
text: We were supposed to visit Pena Palace in Sintra. Due to strike the Papalce was closed. We were only mentioned this at the time of boarding, with no option of withdrawing. We were directed to see Regaleira palace. The driver dropped us off at the parking lot. We were not provided with any tickets (which other tour groups were) and there was no one to guide us through the important events related to the palace. We wondered around on our. We started the tour at 8:00 am and lunch was at 2:45 pm. It was a total waste of time and money.

title: Cancellation and not acknowledged
text: I booked this and paid for the tour. Unfortunately I had to cancel via trip advisor as the cruise ship we were on came in later than the start of the walk. On the day of the tour the company contacted me as had not received cancellation. Very disappointed as no refund provided

title: Not a good experience
text: Guide was very friendly, but for an English language tour, his English was not very good or fluent. Also when we stopped he didn‚Äôt tell us where restrooms were located or stay with the group for explaining sights.

title: Just go to restaraunt for good local meal
text: Marta was our guide and save your money and just go have nice meal somewhere. First stop was a small piece of cheese and a shot glass of port. Second stop a shot glass of the cherry liqueur, (could have bought for $1.50 euro) second stop in very crowded bar, small glass of very sweet green wine and fried cod cake ($3.75 euro,) then a pork sandwich that was good with small glass of beer and then to a restaurant definitely set up for large groups because they had back room with tables set for 20, one piece of cheese, 2 small shrimp, a roll, very pices of sausage and olives. No great info, very boring and again just go to any of the markets, etc and spend your money there.

title: D√©cevant
text:
Visit√© hors saison. Il faut d√©j√† payer l'entr√©e, √† laquelle on ajoute le prix du bus (plus de 12 euros par personne) pour faire le tour des sites de Sintra + 3 euros pour prendre la navette du bas du parc du palais jusqu'au palais.
Une fois arriv√© tout le monde √† la qu√™te leu leu et c'est parti. On se suit les uns derri√®re les autres comme des moutons, tour le monde au m√™me rythme le long des guide files et des plexiglas. C'est mal fichu, presque oppressant. L'int√©rieur est sans int√©r√™t l'ext√©rieur amusant tout au plus mais en assez mauvais √©tat. Je ne recommande pas ce site. Privil√©giez le palacio nacional bien plus chic et la visite plus douce et sans contrainte.

title: Don‚Äôt do this one unless you like to stand rather than walk.
text: This is not a walking tour! It is a standing tour. Beware that this guide was not even aware of the pain of standing on the stone walkway in the same square never moving for well over one hour. Horrible experience and yes, I eventually needed to walk, so after two hours of standing and barely moving, I left.

title: Unfortunately disappointing
text: I am a bit confused by all the positive reviews (the main reason I booked this trip), maybe we just got unlucky. To be clear, the places that we visited were stunning, especially Cabo da Roca, but the tour itself was lacking... a guide. The Pena Castle should be interesting, but we were rushed from room to room with no explanations and no time to read the descriptions. In fact, we were trying to listen to the stories other tour guides were telling to their groups. Then we were dropped off at Sintra for "free time" again with no explanations (just the info when we will be picked up). The Cabo da Roca was fine and we were provided plenty of time to take pictures and enjoy the views, but again no explanations. Finally (at the risk of sounding like a broken record), our final stop (2 hours free time in Cascais) was the same. I do hope that today was just a fluke, but cannot give this tour a good rating.

title: Horrible & Hungry
text:
We have done many food tours across the world but this was by far the worst. It isn‚Äôt even worthy of being listed by TripAdvisor as a food tour. This 3 hour tour was only 5 stops total, and one was only a shot of alcohol. To start, we notified the tour in advance that my daughter is vegetarian and they told us that they accommodate her, but that was unfortunately not true. 3 of the 5 stops were focused on meat, and at each of the stops, the guide would come over and ask her if there was anything currently available that she wanted to eat. There should have been some thought or planning done in advance. The options for her were sad looking pastries or a plate of carrots unrelated to the dish we were trying. Overall the limited food we tried was good but was limited and was missing, at the least, a sweet element. Since Portugal has so many famous pastries and desserts we were hoping to try the famous pasteis de nata. Since it was only 5 stops, it wasn‚Äôt overall that much much food. Our last stop was supposedly a dinner which consisted of a few shrimp and sausage. It was simply a tasting of a few pieces per person spread out on a restaurant table top - it was pathetic. The vegetarian substitution for my daughter was a plate a frozen peas and carrots. Also pathetic.

Also, the locations she chose were extremely crowded and some members of the group had to separate and stand outside. The people that stood outside didn‚Äôt get to hear any of the information provided by the tour guide. The tour guide also wasn‚Äôt good at talking to the whole group at once. When someone would ask a question she would only answer that person and not share the information with the whole group.

At the last stop on a food tour you usually get to ask all of your questions and get some recommendations but instead she disappeared into the kitchen for 25 minutes and then talked to one man in our group for the rest of the night.

After the tour we went and had dinner. Worst food tour ever!

title: Insight Vacations Country Roads of Portugal "Don't even think about it!"
text:
This tour was very badly organised and shoddy. A couple of examples:
In Lisbon we were supposed to see where the Portuguese tarts we made (that was the inference in the brochure). In fact after visiting Jer√≥nimos Monastery we went to a grassed area across the road and were handed a Portuguese tart each from a cardboard box! Then we went across to the river where there were a couple of toilets and a very long queue in the sun and no shade! We found other options after leaving the tour and staying in Lisbon for an extra week.
It's an eleven day tour and on two of them we didn't get into our hotel until 8pm.
The Algarve: no time to see much at all.
The meals we had were all very poor generally and the initial get together meal was a coach ride away to a run down area with weeds everywhere and a view of the river if you had a good pair of binoculars.
I could go on but to summarise it was dreadful and my advice would be forget this tour, base yourself in Lisbon, Porto and Evora for a few days each and take local trips.

title: We regret having booked this tour
text: Really bad experience. Guide just dropped our family off at sights and did not spent time explaining what we are looking at. Do not recommend this tour company . Wished we would have done a walking tour.

title: Not sure this is a normal experience for this tour company
text:
We were so disappointed. Wanted to love our tour through Lisbon, but it was far off from what we expected.
The Tuk Tuk was uncomfortable for a 4 hr tour. Every hole in the road caused discomfort. Unfortunately our guide seemed burned out and put 0 effort into our experience. He stopped at sights and told us to get off and walk around. He just waited for us to come back. Most of the time without any explanation about what we are looking at . We got more disappointed as the tour went on. Thought a few times about just walking away. Paid lots of money for a tour we could have done on our own. We all feel like we know nothing about Lisbon. We have done many tours across the world but never did we feel so ‚Äûalone‚Äú especially in a private tour ! Miguel seems like a nice guy. Maybe did not have a good day. But it sure impacted our day in Lisbon

title: Poor communication and effort by Tour company
text: Having booked I Tour You day tour to Sintra, Cabo de Roca and Cascais months ago, arrived in Lisbon and advised tour had been cancelled by company with 24 hours before departure.

title: Last-minute cancellation
text: Last-minute cancellation without any explanation! This ruined our plans, we had to go on our own and wait in endless queues.

title: Last minute cancellation for undue cause
text:
They canceled on us last minute. They cited a strike starting the day before our tour, but we were able to go on our own that day without any striking. They also said that it was World Youth Day and there would be traffic constraints, but that didn't impact our ability to get there whatsoever.

While I understand cancellations have to happen, it would have been nice to be given more accurate information in the cancellation message, to try to accommodate alternative plans (like going the day before), and for it to not be so last minute.

For what it's worth, we actually had a really pleasant time going on our own. It was easy to get there, we got there early to avoid the mad rush, and we were able to hike around the area to explore the different sites.

title: Must take 112a ride to the Castle next time...
text: Warn that you climb 500 feet in Elevation, straight up in 10 minutes. I was taken away in an Ambulance. Tour Guide was great, and helpful.

title: Very negative
text: After waiting for more than hour at meeting point, I received email stating that the tour is cancelled. This impacted my entire plans. They didnot bother to call and despite I contacted no answer. I don‚Äôt recommend at all

title: Unreliable
text: Never got to experience this tour because it was canceled by the tour operator without giving any reason. Very, very disappointed.

title: Agress√£o do dono Fernando Pereira
text:
I just don't give 0 because it's not even possible.
I was just coming in. It was going to be my first experience at this disco. I was trying to go by to get a drink with a friend, to what I'm stuck, separated from her and held by the wrists by a man. This man was clearly under the effect of drugs because otherwise he's just a complete trustee. He tried to grab my wrists several times, left marks on my arm. A lot of people had to get ahead because he was visibly altered and I must be less than about 30 years old than he and I am a woman. When I was able to get back to my group, we were approached by a security who sent us out there. We were upset and confused, realizing that we were expelled from the disco because I was assaulted. Because whoever attacked me was the owner of the disco, Fernando Pereira. An unusual shame (of him, clearly). I hope he finds the psychiatric help he so needs.

title: The worst experience
text: The worst experience even at lisbon night. We were a group of 6 people, everyone payed 15 ‚Ç¨ to enter, after 30 of frustrated harassment from the bar owner to the man's we were invited to quit.

title: Awful
text: The worst and most traumatic experience I had, the person who let everyone in rejected me for not being Portuguese, claiming that I spoke the language well, pushed me out of the waiting line saying that I could complain to the police if I wanted. . Definitely the worst and only terrible experience I had in Lisbon.

title: Experi√™ncia Negativa
text: Depois de esperar horas na fila vendo o seguran√ßa passar conhecidos dele na frente das outras pessoas, fui questionar a postura dele e ele disse que caso eu quisesse entrar eu teria que pagar 300 euros pra ele. Ou seja, o que era pra ser uma noite divertida foi bem ruim, houve uma tentativa de extors√£o em tom de amea√ßa. Com certeza n√£o recomendo o local.

title: A waste of time
text: The gardens have so much potential but as a result of a lack of funding not worth visiting. There are an amazing variety of plants and trees (most of them not identified) and no map to take you around the most important "exhibits " in the garden. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME.

title: Disappointed, no love taken
text:
Very disappointing! Not worth the ‚Ç¨5pp unless it‚Äôs a donation to get some work done to the gardens!! The pathways are very rough, stones and potholes. Wear good walking shoes!
The water features are full of algae and moss.
The gardens are not looked after, overgrown and full of leaves!! No maintenance done!

There are not many markings telling you what the plant/tree are or where they are from!!

No map!! No wheelchairs as it‚Äôs very hilly and rough rocky pathways!!

title: A little disappointing
text:
Rather disappointing, this park is poorly maintained, especially the part with its small wooden bridges.
Nice even to take a plant-based break there.

title: Garden
text: I visited on a Sunday morning in December and didn't pay for a ticket, otherwise I would have been crying over the money I spent. Not worth it!

title: A shame
text: This is the worst botanical gardens we have ever been to, it was so sad and disappointing. Except for the entrance everything was left to rot away we must have been in and out in 10 minutes.

title: Laiss√© √† l‚Äôabandon
text: Ce parc poss√®de un √©norme potentiel cependant il est tr√®s mal entretenu. Un bon nombre de v√©g√©taux est malade. Certaines all√©es sont inaccessibles par manque de taille. Les retenues d‚Äôeau sentent mauvais car non cur√©es. Les fabriques sont toutes en mauvaises √©tats. A fuir si le parc ne fait pas une profonde r√©novation.

title: Would be OK for free, but not for 5‚Ç¨
text:
5‚Ç¨ entrance, everything is "under renovation", although I dont believe they are actually working on _anything_ there. The cactii area is a freaking joke. No one has done anything there for months.
Lots of peacocks and a few nice trees make it good, but there was basically only 1 tree with a color other than green in there.
They close at 17:00 in March.

title: Very large garden but with practically nothing DA do or see (and admission is also charged...)
text: Being located in the upper part of Lisbon makes a few visitors come, but honestly it's not worth it. Admission is charged and inside there is nothing special, except a few plants and a dirty pond. I recommend going elsewhere

title: Disappointment
text: Poorly maintained and impassable garden with stroller. No signposting. This is a shame because there are spectacular trees not highlighted.

title: Avoid!
text: That, a botanical garden??? A shame! The Chernobyl power station is better maintained than this wasteland. To avoid (especially as admission is for a fee)

title: Botanical Gardens Lisbon
text: There were quite a few issues with the gardens. There was a queue to buy tickets from a small office. The waiting was unacceptable. 4 staff but only one serving. The gardens must have been pleasant once. Found them run down and untidy. The toilets had not been cleaned for sometime. The little caravan to buy drinks from only takes card which is ridiculous for a 2 euro bottle of water.

title: Not a great experience sadly
text:
The overall impression that I got from our visit was one of neglect. The walkways were treacherous in places and many of the plants appeared to be in poor shape. The water features looked stagnant and unpleasant. Quite disappointing really. The paths are very steep in some parts which we were only told about after we had paid for our tickets. Not really suitable for anyone with walking problems.

On the plus side it wasn‚Äôt very crowded. There was only a relatively short queue to get in when we arrived but the queue moved incredibly slowly as there was only one person issuing tickets, largely due to the fact that the ticket office was only big enough to allow two people in at each time!

Overall, not really worth the effort getting there.

title: Not worth the money ‚Ä¶ paths are treacherous
text: So poorly maintained‚Ä¶.paths are broken and treacherous‚Ä¶. Planting overgrown on the paths ‚Ä¶ areas sectioned off and building materials just left on the paths. Water feature waterfalls dryas a bone and full of winter debris.

title: Little interest
text: Poorly maintained garden-No plan to be located inside the poorly referenced garden-plants or not at all closed botanical museum without being informed at the entrance although we are allowed to pay the entrance of the museum!

title: Poorly maintained sad garden
text:
You are better spending the ‚Ç¨5 somewhere else. The gardens are poorly maintained, with large sections blocked off. The garden beds are dry and unmulched, and many of the shrubs need proper pruning. The plants are not all labled. The paths are in need of repair.
Ponds are full of sludge. If you are a plants person, you can only be disheartened. The only staff I saw were those collecting money. Where are the gardeners?

title: Fine garden for the rest but...
text: In itself it is a beautiful garden with a wide variety of trees and plants, and oasis of peace in what is otherwise quite a busy neighborhood. It's a nice place to stay and I can see myself reading a book. However, if you have to pay the full entrance price then accommodation such as a toilet, a terrace where you can have something fresh, etc. has been welcome. Moreover, the ‚Äòsensory garden‚Äô and some taps that could give the whole a bit more cachet were not in operation. It was good but not enough.

title: Access badly lets the gardens down
text: Wonderful nature in the heart of the City. However pathways can only be described as dangerous. Holes, uneven surfaces, loose stones, steep, all unsuitable for anyone with a walking problem, push chairs and wheelchairs. It‚Äôs a shame as it obviously desperately needs money spent on improvements.

title: No point!
text: Very disappointed! To avoid! Gardener certainly on holiday!!! What is the 6‚Ç¨ paid by each visitor? Some interesting trees!

title: Outrage
text:
holiday masters and we came to spend the day in Lisbon. My partner really wanted to visit the Botanical Museum. We travel with two pets. We have accessed the enclosure and as you enter before buying the ticket there are some bathrooms and a staircase where I have stayed with the bitches while my wife bought the ticket to enter herself, because we knew in advance that pets cannot access and I understand.
Two operatives approached me to ask me out, telling me they couldn't be animals there. Museum rules. They have always been very friendly and polite.
I have spoken to them for a while giving my opinion and claiming that I do not UNDERSTAND how it is possible that right at the entrance of the compound where there is no garden you can not wait for your companion, while she makes the visit. Unfortunately.

title: Bad experience
text:
Very neglected place.
Could be nice park, but no one takes care about this Garden.
Roads and paths, specially steps , are just dangerous to walk.
So many dried trees, almost no flowers.
Definitely not a place to visit in Lisbon, where are so many free and nice parks and gardens.

title: A lot to do
text:
Unfortunately, a space with a flora with many possibilities and is very neglected, from flora to roads and sculptures.
Charge ‚Ç¨4 to those over 65, without any information.
A garden that besides already some signs on the plants, there is no guide of paths or signs for the visit

title: Toilet!
text: Unfortunately, we were unable to enjoy the garden. The search for the second toilet (despite the sign) proved unsuccessful because it was closed!

title: Disastrous
text:
Without a doubt the most neglected botanical garden I have ever visited.
Dirty, neglected, with nothing good to highlight unfortunately.
It's not worth paying to enter, especially ‚Ç¨5.
It's been very sad to see how it is

title: Garden
text:
How can you pay to see this???
Decadence, carelessness, bad treatment, a shame! I won't pay to see this again, shameful!

title: Needs some TLC
text:
I have to agree with the other reviewers that this botanic park is underwhelming. It looked a bit neglected and compared to botanic parks in most national centres was disappointing. Having said this, for the ‚Ç¨5 fee it‚Äôs a nice bit of shade and greenery and many visitors could be seen lying down relaxing in the shade of the trees.

It is located on the side of a hill and you enter at the top of the hill reasonably assuming you can walk down and exit from the bottom of the park. Be aware that the exit at the lower part was closed/under construction so you have to climb back up the incline to exit the park the way you entered. Not recommended for those with any physical limitations.

title: A real disappointment and an unjustified entry fee
text: As confirmed by previous reviews that we read before entering, the botanical garden is absolutely not worth the visit, much less the 10 euro entrance fee. Unfortunately, the variety of plants takes second place compared to the lack of care, if not even the abandonment that reigns almost everywhere... Too bad!

title: Little to see here
text:
This shouldn't be confused with the actual Jardim Botanico Tropical in Belem which is lovely!

This is a small park with many trees and a few flowering shrubs. There are gardens on the upper level but they aren't at all well kept and the whole place has a slightly derelict air. The pond was neglected and full of algae.

There are many beautiful parks and gardens in Lisbon where you can walk and rest free, so I wouldn't waste money paying for entry to these ones.

However there is a very nice ice cream shop across the road - Niva Cremeria Gerlateria Italiana - that's worth a visit!

title: Giardino abbandonato - ne sconsiglio la visita
text: Visitato a Giugno 2023. Ne sconsiglio la visita. √à un giardino abbandonato. Le farfalle non ci sono. Il giardino all‚Äôitaliana √® dismesso. Meglio impiegare il proprio tempo a Lisbona per vedere altro.

title: A dull garden not worth paying to see
text: As Botanical Gardens go, this one is dull and not worth the entrance price. It is no more than an arboretum. Nothing is explained. There is no theme. It isn't especially attractive. I think it is one to miss.

title: Jardin √† l‚Äôabandon, aucun int√©r√™t.
text:
Compte tenu de l‚Äô√©tat du jardin, faire payer 5 ‚Ç¨ par personne frise l‚Äôhonn√™tet√©.
Le seul int√©r√™t est de profiter de l¬¥ombre des arbres.
Mais, les travaux aux alentours ne permettent m√™me pas un peu de calme..
Nous avons pr√©f√©r√© en rire et au final, on se souviendra de ce parc.

title: Decepcionante
text: El √∫nico atractivo son algunos √°rboles realmente espectaculares por su tama√±o, pero en general esta bastante descuidado , no creo que se deber√≠a cobrar entrada por esta visita

title: D√©ception
text:
Nous avons √©t√© d√©√ßus par cette visite, ce jardin devait √™tre tr√®s beau il y a longtemps mais souffre d'un manque d'entretien flagrant.
La collection botanique n'est pas du tout mise en valeur, c'est vraiment dommage.

title: Ungepflegt
text: Sehr ungepflegt und keinen Eintritt wert. Besonders der Mann der die Tickets kassiert hat, war sehr unfreundlich und schlecht gelaunt.

title: Don't waste your time
text: This really is a sad excuse for a botanical garden. Better to Spend your 5 Euros on an Espresso & Pastel de Nata. Mirkwood without the charm.

title: Che tristezza
text: Un posto mal tenuto, mal curato ed abbandonato a se stesso. Pensavo fosse un‚Äôottima soluzione per un bambino invece sono stati 10‚Ç¨ buttati al vento! Lasciate perdere

title: Not worth the money
text: This garden was underwhelming. There are relatively few plants - mainly trees - with lots of repetition. Some of the plants seemed on the verge of dying, such as the cacti near the entrance. The place seemed generally neglected. There was no evidence to suggest that the state of the park was as a result of some sort of experimentation, such as rewilding.

title: Worst playground ever
text:
What idiot thought it would be a good idea to cover the playground with pebbles?? It‚Äôs impossible to take in a pushchair, difficult to run after your child and god forbid if your child falls, they‚Äôll get scraped up!
My daughter was wearing sandals and kept getting stones in her shoes (as was I!) , so she took them off, but couldn‚Äôt run and had to walk carefully, because the stones kept poking her feet. Then I saw other children throwing handfuls of stones and each other and another group of kids throwing stones on the slide, so when my daughter tried to slide down, she couldn‚Äôt because it was covered in stones. Absolute rubbish! I definitely wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place.

title: Unspectacular
text: There was nothing to see. It‚Äôs not even a park, just a couple of dead plants and an artificial pond. Not worth visiting. Very disappointing.

title: Disappointing experience.
text:
We visited the park as information indicated that it included a selection of games dedicated to mathematics. We had details of a route to follow through the park which indicated where these were. We struggled to find some of them and those that we did find were covered in graffiti/vandalised/unkempt.
The park might be nice for walking dogs, jogging or sitting on a sunny day, but overall our impression was that it was unkempt and the mathematics trail not worth a visit.

title: Underdeveloped garden area near Belem Lighthouse
text:
Jardim Do Japao is a park area situated between the Museum of Popular Art and the marina just before reaching the Belem Tower. Here you find an open field of grass with planted trees that are not yet tall nor mature so little shade on offer. The park backs up against the Belem Lighthouse, a minor attraction in the area.

There are food trucks, stalls and little pop ups along the promenade in front of this park that make for a good place to stop for a bite to eat. Otherwise, not much reason to visit specifically. There are much larger and interesting parks and green space around Belem than what you will find here.

title: Lack of information to the public
text: Unfortunately with a lot of sadness this closed for more than 3 days and the citizens do not even get information of its reopening whoever goes and subjected if you hit it with the face in the door nothing of pools

title: Lawn Chairs Forbidden
text: Wonderful garden except that they don‚Äôt allow personal lawn chairs. If you can‚Äôt squat on the ground (like me) you are out of luck. This policy seems to have no rhythm or reason. If you are there for an outdoor performance be prepared to sit on the ground. The few benches in the park are not sufficient. Signage is also dismal.

title: if you are desperate
text:
Dont expect too much. There is a tiny area that is nice to sit, the rest is surrounded by either an ugly building or car noise. The gras is completely full with duck sh*t, so it's even hard to sit there.
By far not the best park/garden I have seen but there are hardly any other options either.

title: Disappointing and distressing. No visit to the zoo with a clear conscience
text:
This zoo is more than just getting old! I'm sorry, but I can't recommend a visit here with a clear conscience. Apart from the fact that the price of admission for what is offered is almost cheeky, in the end I really felt guilty about some animal species that are kept there.
Run-down, loveless enclosures with animals, which show practically all obsessive-compulsive disorders. We then skipped the dolphin show altogether in order not to have to watch this torment. In hindsight, I am ashamed of the visit and would therefore encourage everyone to consider supporting this zoo with a visit.

title: Will never visit a zoo again
text:
Unfortunately, I find myself echoing some of the negative opinions shared by others.

The Lisbon Zoo has an impressive variety of animals, but it‚Äôs hard not to feel sadness for some of them, given the conditions they are kept in.

The bird enclosures, in particular, were distressing. Some of the birds appeared to be in clear distress, confined to cages that were far too small.

The chimpanzee enclosure was similarly inadequate. On the day I visited, the chimps showed signs of stress, likely due to ongoing maintenance work in the park, and had smeared their feces on the windows.

While the dolphin show was impressive, it was heartbreaking to see such intelligent creatures confined to a small environment when they belong in the open ocean.

My visit to the Lisbon Zoo left a lasting impression, but not a positive one. As I walked out, I couldn‚Äôt shake the sadness of knowing that, while I was leaving, the animals would remain locked in cages, often for the rest of their lives. It has made me question whether I would visit another zoo, and I sincerely hope that zoos, in their current form, become a thing of the past.

I truly hope that the Lisbon Zoo takes the feedback from myself and others seriously, and works to improve the conditions for the animals in their care.

title: Animal cruelty in 2025!
text:
I‚Äôm surprised by the positive reviews of this zoo. For capital city in an intelligent European country this Zoo is positively barbaric. They are solely a space for human entertainment and not for the protection, conservation and wellbeing of the animals enclosed there. I was in tears leaving with my young child. The primate enclosure was the final straw, seeing the the highly intelligent orangutan's, gorillas and chimpanzees all pushed outside in the pouring rain with the doors to their enclosed shut so they‚Äôre forced to say outside for visitors to see if abysmal. The reptile has such space spaces, esp the Komodo dragon. There were several elephants in such a tiny space it makes you sick to see. These magnificent animals should be kept in much bigger spaces and with adequate.

The dolphin display was not running when we arrived only at 11am and 2pm but after seeing the rest of the zoo we had to leave.

Awful that they are allowed to operate. I urge animal lovers to report this zoo and make them accountable to changing how they treat these beautiful creatures.

We are members at ZSL London Zoo and the difference between both visitor attractions is between night and day. They could learn a lot by visiting other zoos who do conservation much better.

title: Jardim Zoo-Lixo
text: Visit done in the afternoon, but paying the (exaggerated) price of 29 euros, of course nobody thought of reducing the value of the entrance for those who enter after 14:00! Logically, it was not possible to visit all the animals in so little time. We just missed the dolphin show for lack of information. As mentioned earlier the cable car did not work and (almost) never works, but is included in the price of the entrance! The worst thing was to see the (huge) amount of JUSTICE throughout the park, it seems that nobody is concerned about the matter! The animal compartments were also pretty dirty. I only hope to have contributed to the feeding of the four-legged animals, and not to the feeding of the two-legged animals who do not struggle to keep the space minimally clean.

title: Horrible. Not to repeat
text: Awful, awful, an experience to never repeat. Slim, sick-looking animals, many of them alone. I don't like these kinds of sites and we went just because we had a birthday party. But it's to come out in tears. Sorry.

title: Not recommended
text:
This zoo is in urgent need of some renewal and especially better enclosures for the animals.
Some animals sit in very deteriorated spaces, often straight on concrete.

title: The dolphin show is without animation! Nothing interesting.
text:
The dolphin show is no longer what it was. My 4-year-old daughter didn't even care about it.
The St. Ignatius zoo is more interesting.

title: Bad.
text:
It is with great sadness that I communicate that my visit was terrible.
I came with the family for the first time to visit the Zoo of Lisbon , I took care to call the park earlier to inform me about prices , operating shows, inform me that everything was working.
We enter the park the train is not working and the telescope is not working .
The kids were excited to walk in the same .
It's really regrettable

title: Bad visit
text:
Bad experience! My family and I are very disappointed, we paid a very high price and we barely saw most of the animals the animals go hungry, have no water, the white rhinoceros and super dry elephants without any water, the bears go really badly, the tigers very lean, did not accept the ticket ricky rock just because we bought the tickets on the net has no connection.
They don't cut the vegetation.

title: Sad and potentially dangerous for young visitors
text:
Saddest experience ever.
The bird enclosure has this beautiful and smart birds in very small cages WITHOUT anything else besides sticks to stand on. One of them was banging its head against the cage. Nothing to engage them.

The baboon enclosure has inappropriate fencing, a small baboon squeezed in and out without any problem. Luckily it did not approach any of the children. Otherwise, this would have been a very tragic situation. There were no staff members around, and nobody seems to be aware ofthe situation.

title: Sadly won‚Äôt be returning anytime soon. Prices are unjustifiable!!!
text: A far cry from what it once used to be! Sadly all the exhibits where mostly closed or in severe need of repairs, not many animals left to see.

title: To not repeat for sure
text:
My children loved the dolphin's show but I was very disappointed with the conditions some animals are living in.. Animals closed in confined spaces (monkeys for example) looking so sad.. I felt very distressed when I left the site.
There were places with dried artificial lakes, no water in it at all.. The bears place and monkey's were the most shocking environments.
Purely there for human amusement. It's very very sad..

title: D√©ception
text:
Il est choquant de constater que certaines installations de parcs animaliers continuent de tol√©rer des conditions de vie pr√©caires pour les animaux qui y sont h√©berg√©s. Ces cr√©atures majestueuses et vuln√©rables m√©ritent le respect et des environnements adapt√©s √† leurs besoins naturels. Malheureusement, les visiteurs de ces parcs peuvent √™tre t√©moins d'animaux d√©prim√©s, en d√©tresse et pr√©sentant des signes √©vidents de malaise.

La qualit√© de ces parcs animaliers laisse √©galement √† d√©sirer. Les enclos √©troits et d√©pourvus de v√©g√©tation perturbent le bien-√™tre des animaux, leur privant de la stimulation mentale et physique n√©cessaire √† leur √©panouissement. Des esp√®ces sauvages captives qui, dans leur habitat naturel, courent librement, sont ici contraintes de vivre dans des espaces restreints, √©loign√©s de tout semblant de vie sauvage.

title: Muito abaixo das expectativas. Pre√ßo absurdo!!!
text: Uma desilus√£o, com muita pena minha. O pre√ßo √© absurdo para o que oferece. Muito poucos animais. A maioria, n√£o se consegue ver. Os que se v√™m est√£o moribundos. O passeio de telef√©rico √© pobre. S√≥ se v√™ vegeta√ß√£o. N√£o recomendo! √â muito triste...

title: M√° manuten√ß√£o
text: Para o pre√ßo dos bilhetes, o zoo devia ter uma manuten√ß√£o muito melhor, havia at√© lixo dentro de alguns recintos dos animais

title: Terrible
text: Small enclosures, animals do not look in good condition, posters outside showed animals they did not have. Lots of enclosures were closed off or empty. And paid 27.50‚Ç¨ each for what was distressing visit. ‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è

title: The years pass
text: I had already visited on two or three occasions. However, it is currently surprising in the negative. We cannot ignore the fact that the years take their toll but maintenance is needed

title: Save your money. Don't buy it!!
text: Was sooooo excited to wear the beautiful earrings that I got. Unfortunately they were FAKE by the time I got home and wore them once. My gold was fading to a bronze brown color. Sad part is I got some for my mom and a friend. Wish I had known better before I got scammed out of all my money.

Unfortunately, the jewelry does not meet the high quality standard that would do justice to the delicate craftsmanship. Instead of a (quite usual in this price segment) Gold plating/gold plating is offered as a gold plating of inferior quality.

After just a few wears, the gold plating is already worn off and ugly signs of wear are showing. The joy of the piece of jewelry is gone after just a few weeks! Due to the poor quality of the gold plating with inferior pigmentation, it is a sin compared to the sophisticated filigree of traditional craftsmanship and the effort and care in the work of the producers.

The customer service (not the store manager, but the marketing department responded to the complaint!) showed no understanding. But what can you expect when a traditional company is taken over by a corporation and run with structures like those at Disney World?

So: Hands off - unless you only want jewelry for the display case. Absolutely not recommended!

**ENGLISH VERSION**

Unfortunately, the pieces of jewelry do not meet the high quality standards that would do correspond to the delicate craftsmanship. Instead of gold plating (which is quite common in this price segment), gold bathing of lower quality is offered.

After just a few wears, the gold pigmented coat is already worn off. The joy of the piece of jewelry is gone after a few weeks! Because of the poor quality of the gilding with inferior pigmentation, it is a sin against the sophisticated filigree of the traditional craft and the effort and care in the work of the producers.

The customer service (not the store manager, but the marketing department responded to the complaint!) was unreasonable. But what do you expect when a traditional company is incorporated and managed with structures like those at Disney World? So: Hands off - unless you only want jewelry for the display case. Absolutely not recommended!

title: Tours with too long and uncomfortable journeys
text: Tour of the main monuments and sites of interest of the city, the movements are many and slow and the cars are not comfortable. Our guide was a very good and polite guy who transported us around the city, but it is a very superficial tour without great explanations of a historical, architectural, cultural nature. Just brief hints. Keep an eye on the clock as every half hour in excess has a cost of about ‚Ç¨ 60.00 which is charged at the end of the tour. We found it boring.

title: Not a techno club, its only house
text: Not a techno club definetly, more like a house club with ~20 people. Went there on Saturday, ticket was 12‚Ç¨ ;( sad experience. Not for a person who likes to go to underground techno clubs. But if you are a house fan then it alright

title: Fake alcohol, expensive, rude and ugly people
text:
The Kremlin smells really bad because of water leaks. The bathroom probably hasn't been cleaned in years, and as others mentioned, there is no toilet paper.

They appear to have fake alcohol and several members of the company have felt ill after one of their terrible, expensive drinks. Avoid. It's the worst club in Lisbon I've ever been to.

title: Ridiculous
text: Halloween night, terrible staff. Your security guards are aggressive. If you have to work, do it well. embarrassing.

title: I don't recommend it to any friend
text: Place with terrible service, rude and aggressive security guards, bad and expensive drinks. Paperless and dirty bathrooms.

title: Kremlin Is done for me
text: This place si a joke, One guy at the entrance told me to take out my rings why I denied and when to another place. So long for those ridiculous and low vibe place‚Ä¶

title: Blatant Racism
text: Avoid this place. They charged the people of color in our group more than white customers standing right next to us. No explanation, just straight-up racism. Staff were rude and dismissive when we called it out. If you're okay supporting blatant discrimination, this is your spot. Otherwise, stay far away. Shame on this place.

title: DRUGGED CREW - STAY OUT
text: Terrible racist club. VIP‚Äôs where thrown out because someone was sitting in someones neck. Security guy threw a FIST to the guy. Insane to watch this. They should be locked up. CLUB WITH DRUGGED PEOPLE AND CREW

title: Agressive VIP bouncer
text: We had a table of +1k casual, but because my friend went in the neck of my other friend bouncer pushed my friend in the face randomly

title: Terrible
text: My little brother was knocked out for no reason. Last time I organise an event here. Never come here again. Marginal bouncers. Especially that little baldy. Never again.

title: Racist, violent and abusive security
text:
A very very dangerous place, the bouncers are racist they punched/hit us at the door, one of the guests came in shoes which they reported were not appropriated, when asked if we could come back after changing the shoes , bouncers started abusing us physically, punching a woman on her head and she passed out, they still didn‚Äôt stop. title: Outrageously Unprofessional, Disgusting and Unhuman Behaviour!
text: Recentl we made the mistake of opting to go to this club. This turned out to be the worst decision we made throughout the entire Erasmus project. The club policy stated that if you sign up and included to the guest list ( a simple application form providing you with the respective QR code for people to scan in the entrance ), the entrance is free before 1 am. All the people went in but since I wasn‚Äôt familiar with the policy, I found that out in the entrance. We kindly said we didn‚Äôt know that and apologised and proceeded to move to the end of the line to complete the procedure, of course without interfering with the people in the back that wanted to get in. When we went again, having everything ready, the person in front (a muscular bald guy) told us something about having to pay 50 euros EACH (there were 2 of us), promptly changing the price to 250 (!) euros each, unlawfully, indicating a clear abuse of authority. When I asked about what‚Äôs the difference between doing the application back home or here, he blabbered some stuff about ‚Äúrespect‚Äù. We clearly didn‚Äôt disrespect neither him nor the beach club, neither did we cause any problems. After we went back again they said that the best thing they could do is make an offer, 20 euros for me and 10 euros for the girl (another unjustified distinction). Let me note that the time was still before 1 am. DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE AS WE DID!!

title: Racist! Do not come here if you are black.
text:
I had a great time in Lisbon it‚Äôs a shame I have to Leave this review. This venue was the only negative experience I had in Lisbon but due to the outrageously racist attitude by this establishment, I have to warn others so they can avoid experiencing the same thing.

Our group consisted of 6 men we are all from the UK. 4 black men and 2 white, 3 of us all black had left another and we agreed we will all meet at K Club. When we approached the doorman we asked if there was an entrance fee and we‚Äôre told it was ‚Ç¨250 each I was shocked and asked why it so much? The doorman said ‚Äúthis is a guest list only club, if you don‚Äôt like the price go elsewhere.‚Äù
Sensing the vibe we left and as we walked down the water front the other 3 members of our group were approaching we told them what had happened. Our friend could not believe it so they decided to go and speak to the doorman. Our 2 white friends went to doorman and asked about entry and they were told it would be ‚Ç¨50 each.

My friends then asked why we (their black friends) were quoted ‚Ç¨250. The doorman became very hostile and told our friends to leave they could not get in any more they asked to speak to the manager. This escalated the situation and the doorman told they to leave in a very impolite manner not wanting to escalate the situation further they returned to the group.

Fortunately we continued to enjoy our night elsewhere and had fun. But this put a downer on the trip. You do not expect this from such a metropolitan Western European city. It‚Äôs a reminder that there are things you have to beware of when travelling as a black person sometimes you will be treated differently purely due to the colour of your skin.

Lisbon is a brilliant city and I felt welcomed everywhere but this place is a stain on the city.

title: Worst Ckub ever
text:
It is with regret that I share my recent experience at your nightclub. Despite an investment of over ‚Ç¨1000 for a lounge, the overall experience fell unexpectedly short. The staff we encountered unfortunately exhibited a level of incompetence and arrogance that significantly marred the impression.

The quality of service received did not align with the financial expenditure or expectations. As someone with a background in the industry, this was unquestionably the most negative clubbing experience I've ever had and i traveled the World. It is my hope that efforts will be made moving forward to enhance the standard of service and the professionalism of the staff. Guests' investment in such an experience undeniably warrants a greater sense of appreciation and attentiveness.

title: Scam tourist
