title: the insolence of the staff from position No. 1 at Lisbon Airport
text: we booked a bus ride from Lisbon airport to the city center. we had a few hours for a change. booking a ride, I had a confirmation in the made reservation request for a child seat. the woman from the position bula slow, then canceled our ride. ruined our afternoon. luckily the booking gave us the money, but never again with this company

title: Better not
text:
I received reward from Booking - free taxi service by Laneexpress from airport to our rented apartment for Lisbon visit.

After landing we went to the meeting point and there was no sign-off a driver.... There were three display boards and my name on an A4 sized paper was visible, another driver called the number in order to help me not to make any roaming costs, but no one answered not for one but for several calls.

After disatiisfaction and lost time, we used metro... We have never received explanation or apology from this company, and Booking taxi department processed our complaint in vain...

I don't recommend anyone to go through that while on vacation.

title: Save yourself the money and take someone else.
text:
I genuinely think this is a very fishy service.
I went around in circles trying to find the right person to start with. Then, after going round and round in circles, I finally found Miss Ego.
She was super rude, unhelpful, and told me I was a no show as the flight was delayed and so were our bags.
The other booking agents seem to strongly dislike this bunch and they directly said to me they work with amateur drivers during my initial search for the right rep and the driver.
I wised up and instead of arguing with Miss Ego (who, after starting off super disrespectfully with me after she literally told me my money was gone and when I got upset she tried to ‚Äúteach me manners‚Äù. .. yeh, that‚Äôs a no from me), I decided at that point that I am incorrigible and opted for a cab.
May have cost twice as much but saved me 500% of the headache - which is what I was trying to do with my mobility challenged 80-year old father and 75-year old mother. Advice 1) don‚Äôt use this firm. Advice 2) don‚Äôt book any taxis through booking dot con.

title: Unreliable company
text:
Company with lying drivers who don't answer the phone. He left my family (including an 8-year-old child) waiting at Lisbon airport until 23:30.
I complained to Mr Jonas and he quite badly polite said that the driver is not required to answer the cell phone.
Everyone knows the chaos that lives in Lisbon Airport because of the inability to serve passengers well and this was not taken into account by the driver Rui.

title: Don‚Äôt Book
text: Booked taxi in advance from Lisbon airport to city hotel , taxi didn‚Äôt turn up. I rang the number given several times when I reached the designated meet point , no answer !!! Don‚Äôt book them !

title: Waiting for the driver/taxi for more than half an hour.
text: I have been waiting for more than half an hour at the airport arrivals and there is no sign of the driver. They don't even answer the phone. I asked a colleague and was told it is arriving in 20 minutes. Absurd. What do I book to do if I have to wait so long

title: Cancelled our driver 30-mins before pick-up time.
text:
Cancelled our driver 30-mins before pick-up time.

On arrival, e were promised a 16-seater bus and they turned up with two vehicles and said they no longer had it available - although they were happy to charge us for the full price still. On the way back to the airport they called 30 mins before we were due to be picked up and said they had a problem so they could no longer collect us, leaving 14 ladies with their cases on the side of the road, luckily Lisbon is a popular destination so we could get Ubers. Absolutely do not recommend this company.

title: Very disappointed
text: I booked this company to pick us up at the airport but they didn't turn up. The other taxi firms at the airport said that as the drivers had not been paid then no taxi would arrive. We had to pay again to get into Lisbon. Very disappointed.

title: P√©simo servicio

Pr√©cision : sur le voucher il est indiqu√© que le client n‚Äôattend pas. Seul, le chauffeur attend.

title: DO NOT BOOK- Cowboy company
text: The worst experience arriving to Lisbon. We had 4 adults and 4 children booked on a pre-booked taxi and arranged by BA. Upon arrival (after they had taken us away from the airport office) at the taxi they then say we had to pay ‚Ç¨10 euros IN CASH for the children to have boosters (even though this is not the law in Portugal- we checked). Once we argued that everything was paid for they said that actually it was for the driver. The children were completely distressed by their refusal to resolve the situation. We then called their ‚Äúmanager‚Äù and we asked to pay by card or get a refund they refused. They also refused to give us receipt of the purchase in advance. We finally called BA‚Äôs emergency number and they mentioned this is categorically not policy and to not get in the car. They tried to threaten and say Uber would refuse to take us but this was not the case as we got Ubers with the children safely.

title: Bad hike, poor organization
text: Unfortunately the castel DE pena and Regaleira were closed, it can happen but we were only notified in the morning on the bus. We were offered to go down but by now we had organized the day like this and we left. As an alternative they took us to visit the National Palace of Sintra and another one whose name I don't even remember... bad experience honestly. Lunch practically compulsory in a restaurant with which they have agreements... we could choose not to have lunch there and go around the center, too bad that the restaurant was isolated in nothing. The guides are useless, they accompany you, they say 3 words counted for each place where they take you and stop. Bad experience, wasted money. In addition, GetYourGuide (where I booked the excursion) censored my review stating that it did not comply with their policy (which is probably to deceive people). I must have been unlucky, I don't recommend buying on GetYourGuide.

title: Very very disappointed
text: We were a family of 4 with about 40 people on the bus -our guide was Mr Mario-I do not think he should be called a guide also-inspite of repeatedly asking him to explain the history of the places we were seeing,he did not say a word and at the Garden of Regalaira he did not even come inside saying that his card had expired 10 days back-unfortunately we were left on our own without any explanation of what we should see inside and it so happened that we actually did not see the tunnels it is famous for-his only job was to tell us what time we should come back-so so disappointed-would not recommend this tour with Mr Mario as the guide to anyone-it was a waste of our money-we had taken the tour on the 10 th of June 2025-even the company should have made sure that his card had not expired

title: Rude & Indifferent Cattle Car
text:
Firstly, shame on TripAdvisor for false advertising. This was advertised as no more than 25 people, but we were on a 41 person bus that was completely full. We also booked an English tour, but instead was Portuguese, French and English - so as a result any commentary was limited.

Not that commentary would have been great since the guide (Antonio) was a rude jaded veteran who cared more about getting free drinks and food for himself at each stop than the enjoyment of his guests. He is a go through the motions guy that should move on to something else.

His colleagues seem to fit the same mold, so recommend skipping Lanetours if an option for the itinerary you wish to do. We have great experiences with the other 5 tour companies we booked on this Portugal trip (and found Portugal fantastic!)

The stops themselves were nice and can recommend this loop, just pick a different company.

title: Overall disappointed.
text:
There are a lot of reasons where this tour fell short, and I feel a bit sad that I hadn‚Äôt chosen a different company to execute the tour but this was a last minute option. It was overpriced for the experience and professionalism received. The guide had communicated to be back at the meeting point in 45 minutes, and had left before that time, forcing me to get an Uber to the next meeting spot. I didn‚Äôt even get to see it because by the time I arrived we had to go to the next point.

It‚Äôs too many spots for one day, and so it feels super rushed the whole time. You really will feel like as soon as you get out of the bus, you have to rush to get back on so you don‚Äôt get left. The communication wasn‚Äôt great, it was difficult to often find the guide as he had no stand out clothing or umbrella to help find him. I was quite disappointed in the whole experience.

title: Bruno Almeida tour to Sintra and Cascais a dangerous riot. Not for seniors.
text:
Bruno was the worst kind of guide. He paid no attention to the safety of his group. Nor did he track that everyone was staying together. He wanted to plow through without imparting any facts about what we were seeing. He was committed only to delivering info to be read later on Whattsapp. The tour was a total waste of time and money.
What was the worse thing about Bruno Almeida? When asked to be respectful of the pace of the seniors that were lagging behind in 104 degree temperatures he outright refused.h He blamed them for being old and not capable of keeping up so they were not entitled to see anything!!!! I can‚Äôt believe this guide has ever been credentialed.
Then he turned a private conversation and began to yell at the group, Am I a bad guide? Multiple times trying to raise a melee!!! Please stop these entitled seniors. It was damgerous and created terror! The riot atmosphere was pure insanity! The negative manner and anger to a simple request was totally unprofessional.

title: Boring and not worth the price
text: It wasn‚Äôt a detailed trip, felt like i just paid for being driven around in an air conditioned bus. Information about locations were not detailed and twas so brief.

title: Scam
text: Had a tour and they never picked us up! We also had another group doing a different tour & they didn‚Äôt show up either! After an hour on the phone, they kept giving us the run around with NO answer & left all of stranded at the pickup location!

title: Not reliable
text: Golpe! Absurd! I arrived at 8:15h, and by the combined time 8:30h they said that they were late, had not arrived, infirmed the wrong registration, and until 9:00h they kept telling me another registration, and did not appear at the meeting point Alameda Cardinal Cerejeira. The person who communicates with you says he is not on the bus, so you don‚Äôt know if the information is true. In the end, they said that I did not show up at the meeting point. And they didn't give me my money back or they didn't pick me up for another trip.

title: Terrible and disappointing experience
text:
This tour was a big and unexpected disappointment. I booked it after looking at reviews. But here‚Äôs how it went.
We left for F√°tima at about 8.40am. We were taken straight to a shop on reaching Fatima, this is not on the itinerary!! The merchandise was very expensive and we spent 45 minutes here which was an absolute waste of time and unnecessary. The tour company probably gets a commission for dragging people here. This delayed everything!! Everything in this shop was very expensive, rosaries holy water etc was triple the price. I bought nothing from here and just wanted to get out of there and so did the other people on our tour. But nobody said anything to the tour guide Lili. So I went to him and told him we would like to leave.

We then went to the shepherds house which was really good and that was one of the reasons I booked this tour. Our tour guide Lili was very knowledgeable and did a good job of explaining everything about the 3 shepherds village. We also got to see their houses.
After that we left for the sanctuary and reached there at 12.30pm and were told that we would get 30 minutes to visit the sanctuary and had to leave F√°tima at 1pm.
This really bothered me as I felt we wasted so much time in the shop and had we not gone there we would have been able to spend at least 2 hours in the sanctuary.
The itinerary said we would spend 2 hours in F√°tima and there was an opportunity to hear mass. I can understand not having an opportunity to hear mass but 30 minutes was too less to visit the entire sanctuary. When I told the guide Lili that it was unfair that we just get 30 minutes at the sanctuary he told me that I should have booked a private tour if I wanted more time. That was unfair as the itinerary says 2 hours in F√°tima. So I was not being unreasonable.
As a result of this I did not go back with the tour. I stayed back in the sanctuary and took another bus later in the day back to Lisbon and was able to make most of my time at the sanctuary.
I hope the tour managers which is Lanetours takes this feedback on board. I regret doing this tour and I would definitely not recommend it.

title: Not what we signed up for!
text:
We did this trip in order to see Fatima and our tour operator gave us hardly any information about Fatima. At each location he basically just dropped us off and did not tell us about the location we were seeing.
This tour felt like a glorified transportation trip with no air conditioning on our bus.

title: Just a ride in a hot, cramped bus b
text:
It was basically a bus ride, in a cramped and stifling hot bus. Don‚Äôt go if you‚Äôre over six foot tall, the seats are cramped together and the AC did not work.

Looking to learn about the sites you are visiting? Google them because they don‚Äôt tell you anything about the places you are ‚Äúdropped off‚Äù at.

title: Scam
text:
We were not told we would go to a very secluded restaurant at the end of the trip. It was neither mentioned on the voucher nor by the guide. So people had to pay for a menu on which there was no price (27‚Ç¨ actually). I ordered nothing but the girls seated at my table were not comfortable about this situation, they didn‚Äôt dare to say no. At the end of the trip, going back to Lisbon, on the bus, the guide gave everyone a QR code to have some good ratings but as I confronted him with his lack of honesty, he did not give me the QR Code so here I am, writing this review on my own.

That is a shame ; people should have the choice and not be compelled.

I personally think that the restaurant and the guide are in cahoots

Also we stayed about 30min in Cascais.

title: Disappointing
text: The visit itself well, although too long not used and the visit to Cascais dispensable for how fast it was. The worst part is that for lunch there was already a restaurant in which the menu was priceless. It was ‚Ç¨28 that didn't deserve it. I feel ripped off.

title: Run away is not worth the price!
text:
Alfonso is a good guide but yesterday the program was not respected.
We didn‚Äôt stop at cascais as it was marked in your program and in addition we spent the morning by car only so no visits to the streets, shops then stop at the mouthful of hell very beautiful but the small shops were closed seen it was the morning...
Then visit in the late morning of Regaleira at the pace of the race and no visits to the gardens downstairs or the building we had no time it seems.....
Barely time to take some pictures , no time to enjoy the place a minimum climb in a tower etc...
Then meal 1h therefore impossible to visit the center of sinta barely time to eat then departure for Pena at 1:45 pm.
The classic low tour except that the ticket to visit the interior of Alfonso Palace did not work so visit without guide but he tried to explain us after things had seen as best he could.
We had 12 minutes to visit the small chapel and the viewpoint then 30 minutes to do the inside of the Palace.
16h back to Lisbon arrival at 16h45 at the return point.
We are disappointed with a service paid 160‚Ç¨ for two. for two.

title: Shady company
text: I went to the location they told me to go to, in addition I went to the location in this listing, and no tour guide showed up. I messaged them on WhatsApp and Trip Advisor that morning and they never responded. Now they‚Äôre saying I was at the wrong location and they tried calling me which is completely false. I should have known with only two reviews that something was shady.

title: Locations amazing, but not a good fit for those wanting more detail
text: The locations were amazing and our tour guide was very friendly and a pleasure to be with, however, we were disappointed in the amount of time spent in each location (too short - less than advertised) and the lack of information offered out each location. This isn‚Äôt really a guided tour, it‚Äôs more of a transportation option if you‚Äôd like to hit each of these spots on one day. If you are looking for quality time and detailed information about these locations, this is not the tour for you. If you are looking for more of a means to getting to these spots, this is the right fit. In hindsight, I think a small group tour would have been a better fit for us, but I don‚Äôt think we were entirely clear what we signed up for.

title: To flee
text: We were offered a change of activity from half a day to a full day, we should have refused. We spent most of the day in villages with no real interests to spend only half an hour in Sintra (the same time as in Estoril. Two hours for the meal, the same time we had for Sintra (waiting time included to access the park and palace). The tour is conducted in a military way, leaving us with barely time to go take pictures or go to the bathroom. We are even picked up at the exit of the palace because we are "late" (30 minutes to visit, you will not even have time to read a single sign). In short, run away and book an activity that focuses only on Sintra and Pena Palace. This one is not worth it and you will not be able to fully enjoy the gem that is Pena Palace.

title: Beware the airport transfers arranged by Lanetour are a Scam:
text:
We had a transfer booked and paid for arriving on an international flight early morning on the 16 June. The booking states if it takes you more than an hour to reach the driver the booking is void and you lose the payment.
Our flight was due to land at 7.10. This means we would have until 8.10. Our flight landed early. Touch down at 6.43. But, as logically happens with early arrival, the Ground Crew were only ready 15 minutes later. So, we disembarked at the scheduled time. Therefore arriving on Lisbon soil at the scheduled time. We are not ones for dallying and moved fast through the airport. On receiving a message from Ricardo, our driver, we messaged back at 7.22 to say we were at passport control. His response with many loaded ‚Äú‚Ä¶‚Äù astounded us: ‚Äú Ok.. let me explain: your flight landed at 6:43 ... After landing, 1 hour is counted.. after that 1 hour the service can no longer be carried out...‚Äù.
It was clear from this message that there was dubious intention to honour the agreement and timeframe printed on our voucher. We were already suspicious and not thrilled with the dismissive attitude. Nonetheless, we rushed through and reached the meeting point at 7.55 - which was 15minutes before our intended flight arrival and time registered on our voucher. We received no response to our 7.57 message saying we were there and then found a disheveled and acerbic women who claimed to be the owner of the Lane Transfer company. She told us Ricardo had left on another transfer. This was at 7.57‚Ä¶. SCAM ALERT‚Ä¶ therefore despite our printed timeframe giving us until 8.10 to arrive Lane Transfers had taken our money and managed to get more business from someone else in the time paid for by us. It‚Äôs a great scam when you can get double payment for a single service provided. We attempted to reason with the woman, but she was obnoxious, shrill, unprofessional and basically told us she did not need to be honourable as she had plenty of business and did not need ours. We have travelled a lot and have not been robbed like this before. The reason for this review is to help travelers to not use this company. There are plenty of competitors who work with honour and care about their customers - Lane Transfers is definitely not one of those and you should give it a wide berth!

title: This was Transportation, not Guided Tours
text: I am surprised that the reviews are so high. This felt like transportation, not a tour. Our guide shared little to no information at every site. The large van wasn't very comfortable - little leg room and the AC wasn't cool enough. If you just need transportation to key locations, it's good.

title: Poor experience: communication and politeness could be improved
text: This tour was supposed to stop in Batalha but did not. When we arrived in Nazare, I asked the guide why there was no stop in Batalha, he was almost insulted that I asked the question, as if I should have known. Other passengers didn‚Äôt know either. There were 4 stops listed for that tour and we skipped one: do we get a refund as this is not what I consider honouring a contract? Communication failure? Before arriving in Nazare, the guide told us twice on the microphone with poor sound that we had to be back at 14:45h. Bedford heading off, a passenger dared ask the guide the time we had to return: the guide responded ‚Äú let me repeat a third time..‚Äù on a rather unpleasant tone‚Ä¶well at 14:45h we were back but the guide and half the group didn‚Äôt show up. We waited until 15:05h and departed with the driver only. Suffice to say that we were mocked. The plan had changed a second time and no one telling us. Perhaps I‚Äôm too generous with my rating.

title: Horribly Crowded
text: Horrible place all crowded no space to be or sit, looks like a sardines can, this tourism is destroying Lisbon and their uniqueness

title: Recreational Substances
text: If you need drugs, go to Cantinho Bar Benformoso, in the evenings/night you can spot the black guy in sunglasses at the steps, who sells drugs and people take them in the stair way. Police don‚Äôt really bother anyone.

title: Tourist walks at night blocked for drug users
text: Got stuck when walking up the alley ways to Graca by the local drug gangs who were protecting their customers shooting up in the stair ways. Not a place for women or families.

title: Litter, graffiti, drugs
text: This area is going downhill fast. Which is a shame becuse it‚Äôs so diverse it could be amazing. Many of the cafes have been closed down. The drug dealers are creeping in and drug taking happens in open sight. There was a recent nurse. Place to be avoided. Not a place for families.

title: Urban nightmare
text: Horrible experience, full of drug addicts, some of them violent. We passed by there on a Sunday morning, somebody from my family was slapped on the street and we ended up complaining to the police (who seemed not to care for the violence). Avoid going there. Avoid renting a place there.

title: really rude
text: Really rude company, I had a event cancelled last minute also and really found it uncomfortable speaking with Rita, looking at the below it seems the company don't respond well to negative feedback and try to deter others from doing so which is quite unprofessional. The trip was nice but I would rather work with a nicer company and nicer people.

title: Great activities poor management
text:
Great activities however shame that the people that work there are rude and poor in communication. Be prepared to wait days for responses, have your activities cancelled and changed last minute. Really difficult company to work with. Those that go I'm sure will have a great time as the reviews below suggest but for anyone actually looking to organise it spare yourself the hassle and stress and go with someone else.

They list a number they don't actually want you to call or message them on, but only respond to emails on existing booking once you use the WhatsApp to prompt them. The company customer service is a joke.

title: Very disappointing
text: I picked this scavenger hunt because it was the only one I could find that you could do with just one smart phone (I was with my 11 year old children who don't have phones). We went on 'Santos-o-Velho‚Äòs Downtown Dash'. Once I had worked out how to redeem my code (which is tricky) we were presented with a succession of 8 locations. Each was shown on a google type map along with our current position so you just follow the map rather than solve clues. Once at a location you simply have to take a photo and then answer a question (answers easily found online) in order to progress to the next location. And that was it. I had been hoping to have puzzles to solve by looking at our surroundings, but it was clear that the creators of this 'hunt' had no local knowledge - nothing quirky, no added value. One of the locations was a museum that was actually closed for refurbishment and at 2 of the locations duplicate questions popped up. Very disappointing.

title: Not worth the money
text: The music added nothing to the trip. There was no information given about the sights or history of Lisbon. There was no sunset as it was still daylight when we finished the trip. The free drink failed to materialise so make sure you're not shy and ask for it. Can't really recommend this trip.

title: Not a good value.
text: We signed up for a Hop on Hop off because it seems to go to four different places. As it turns out it only goes to three places, and two of the places are pretty much right next to each other (about a 5-minute walk from each other). So it's basically a boat from belem Tower to cais sodre (which would amount to an $8 Bolt ride for two people. The boat is small and fairly open so if the weather is not good, you are exposed. The boat leaves every 1-2 hours from each destination so you definitely don't want to miss your boat. They also have a disclaimer indicating that times are variable based on the weather so you never really know if you're getting on the boat until you see it. One of the destinations was supposed to be across the river (caichilas) and it was listed on the email we received after we bought our ticket ($25 each). (Going straight from cais sodre to caichilas by public ferry costs about 3.5 euros and it leaves every 15 minutes). When I pointed this out to the lisboat guy at the dock, he asked to see the email I received and took a picture of it as if I'm the first person in Portugal to ever read the email that listed one of the destinations as caichilas! On the plus side, the crew was reasonably friendly and they went out of their way to pass slowly so you could take pictures of the caichilas area and also of belem Tower. There is a marine type head on the boat. They give you 48 hours to use your ticket but we never went back on the boat after the first trip,

title: Better not
text:
In itself a nice route and in good weather you can also take great photos, but the disadvantages outweigh:
1. There is no indoor area, so in January, despite 14 degrees and sunshine, everything freezes. Actually, you should not offer this tour in winter.
2. There are no comments or other explanations during the journey! This has nothing to do with hop on hop off and against the background it is also quite overpriced.
3. The route from Bel√©m to Lisbon was so slow that you could only get seasick in the waves...
4. It is more important for staff to attract all possible passengers on board than to stick to the timetable. The fact that the passengers who have already boarded, meanwhile, are sitting on the uncomfortable chairs as ordered and not picked up is secondary...

title: Beware of LISBOAT!
text: Do not use Lisboat for the tour to Belem. Unreliable company boat left with 1 hour late on schedule and non-existent return ride, canceled without notice, they forced us to spend more money on taxis and lose 16 euros return ride. Misleading behaviour for users

title: Lack of information
text:
The problem is the lack of information.
We took a usable 48-hour ticket. The first day the return took place in a different place from where we had docked so taxi home. And on the second day the schedules were different. No boats at 3:00 like we were told when we bought the tickets, so taxi again. No information on the schedules at the Tower of Bel√©m .
A real pain....

title: Very frightening boat trip in Lisbon
text: Took a river boat trip from Lisbon to B√©lem. Weather was good - nice sunny day but water was a bit choppy but nothing to worry about. However when boat neared B√©lem ALL changed - difficult to get alongside the floating pontoon as waters were so choppy & when we did get moored disembarking the boat was incredibly frightening. EVERYTHING was moving, the boat, the small portable gangplank, the pontoon & the attached rollered gangplank up into the caf√©. I am fit but I completely felt I‚Äôd lost the use of my legs when leaving the boat & became so very lightheaded. Just so much instability had made me feel like this. After 3 hours in B√©lem my husband & I thought that the return trip would be calmer but alas it wasn‚Äôt!! We got on to the boat, then one of the mooring ropes suddenly became loose & there was just ONE crew member to sort as the other crew member had gone to WC/Caf√©!! It was a terrifying situation to be in - one solitary crew member having to suddenly do TWO tasks. He jumped into the wheelhouse & started up engine to reposition boat against pontoon - then to run to back of boat to quickly tie-up to the mooring. He worked well but we as passengers were petrified & we will never travel again with Lisboat in Lisbon. Please improve your health & safety & please employ more crew for your boats. We all want to feel safe and sound whilst relaxing in Lisbon.

title: Terrible
text:
I did not go on the boat. When I went to the Lisboat Window, there was nobody there. I didn‚Äôt know where to go to get the boat, since there were several boats at the Terminal. After I went around and asked about ten different People working there ‚Äî I figured out that the boat had already departed.

There were NO signs to direct Ticket holders who were unfamiliar with the Terminal.

title: Terrible experience
text: We did not receive proper direction from the person in charge, which led us to the wrong boat. When we went back to explain the issue, she was rude and unprofessional, even laughing in our faces. Regardless of how we missed the boat, her behavior was inappropriate, as she found amusement in our situation and made fun of us.

title: Not a good experience. No information poor communication. Not what was expected.
text: We've been living in Lisbon for just 2 months and had friends visit for a few days. We thought about taking a hop on hop off bus tour to get a guided trip of our city. I then saw we could do it by boat with Lisboat. Not so. I asked the woman when I bought the tickets about the tour and she said there was a QR code on the boat. I asked on the boat and was told it was in the bathroom. It wasn't. No guide, just a boring (and beautiful) ride down the river to Belem. We took a Tuk Tuk back to get more of a guided trip. Totally not worth the 58 euros per couple.

title: Difficult bottom pacifier
text: A scab with the minimum possible service, no information and as far from affordable as you can get. Hard-hitting rock bottom among all the other tourist traps.

title: Boring with absolutely no commentary, very average.
text: The boat trip was boring. No commentary whatsoever so there was no understanding of what various landmarks were. We walked back for 90 mins to avoid the return boat trip.

title: Not really an experience
text:
A trip on the water ‚Ä¶ always an experience!

We came to the station Belem Tower andnobody was at the ticket desk ‚Ä¶ the guy arrived 2 minutes bevor the boat left !
Very slippery way down ‚Ä¶. Staff not really interested in guests. No guided tour at all - any public transportation is cheaper and might be friendlier !

title: Self-taught bike tours
text: The guide was very very nice but unfortunately he was the substitute and didn't know anything about the type of tour we had to do and we paid for a tour but we could have gone on our own by bike. We collected and read the information self-taught.

title: Decepcionado
text:
Nuestro gu√≠a de habla hispana fue una persona muy buena y agradable. Pero una gu√≠a horrible. Era profesora de historia... As√≠ que primeros 40!!! minutos que pasamos en nuestro punto de partida escuchando TODA la historia portuguesa hasta nuestros d√≠as. Cuando comenzamos a caminar, y estamos como bien, finalmente... ¬°Pero luego caminamos durante 4 minutos y nos paramos de nuevo durante 20! escuchando la historia del terremoto que se puede contar en 5 minutos perfectamente. Nadie quer√≠a ser maleducado, as√≠ que nos dejamos llevar. Mas tarde, la gu√≠a simplemente iba a su aire, sin mantener control de grupo... si deten√≠amos para tomar fotos o nos perd√≠amos entre la multitud, ella no ten√≠a idea porque no estaba mirando. Al final del recorrido, fuimos a Alfama, uno de los barrios m√°s famosos de Lisboa. ¬øY sabes qu√© est√°bamos haciendo en lugar de explorar el vecindario? Est√°bamos viendo videos de youtube de cantantes de fado famosos... Y eso considerando que el fado no es nada nuevo para nosotros, y hemos estado en varios conciertos de fado en Oporto. Nuestro grupo era solo de 4 personas, tal vez ella podr√≠a verificar si estamos interesados en ver
videos de youtube en lugar de hacer el tour... De todos modos, lo intent√≥, supongo, a su manera. Pero est√°bamos incre√≠blemente aburridos ya que no compramos una conferencia de historia o un curso de introducci√≥n al fado, sino un walking tour.

title: Got no-showed
text: Convenient meet-up location, only our guide did not show. We were scheduled to meet at 10 so we got there around 9:50. By 10:20, I had tried calling the company multiple times and no answer. 10:30, we gave up and sat down at a cafe, then got a call from a very snappy man saying we missed the tour and it was at 9:30‚Ä¶ I have confirmation emails, vouchers, etc that all say 10a. Very frustrating and didn‚Äôt get offered a refund or apology of any sort

title: Horrible prices
text: The environment was excellent and the employees exceptional, but the prices are absurdly expensive and do not justify the service.

title: Disorganized
text: Disorganized staff. Food and drinks overpriced. Especially old jokes, but some good talents in the line-up. No glasses of water are served. Fries and sauces came separately, with 5 minutes difference. We left to smoke and when we returned there were people sitting at our desk. Our drinks, for drinking, had been placed by them on an empty table. They said it was an employee (I don't know if it was) who assured that we had left.

title: LOTS OF DISORGANIZATION
text: We had a reservation for 8:00 pm for a table of 10 people, by then almost everyone was already at the table, it was a pleasant atmosphere, lots of good energy, good music and out of nowhere a BIG DISORGANIZATION, music blaring that you couldn't even hear the friends who were front and side for me, a HUGE DISORGANIZATION in the catering, orders placed and it took more than 2 hours and 30 minutes to arrive at the table, okay I completely understand a full house but the fact that there were only 2 employees serving a full room? Shameful for the restaurant, above all, very bad for those who are serving. I placed my order at 8:30 pm for a starter and it only arrived at 9:54 pm‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. Another fact to point out is when ordering through an app I found it funny and modern but it ended up being a big mess and disorganization as some were eating while others were still waiting......not to mention that one of my friends waited almost 3 hours for a hamburger, he even mentioned to an employee that he would wait another 10 minutes, otherwise he would cancel his order, after a while the employee said it would take more than that, ‚Äú10 minutes‚Äù so he ended up canceling it until the hamburger arrived at the table. and he ended up accepting, as he was eating he was the last one to eat as everyone at the table had already eaten, we discovered that the hamburger was completely raw ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ it was sent back, everyone who ate the hamburger complained that the bread was COLD meat or breading was BURNED around it and one of them even came raw, I hate making these types of comments because I've worked in the area but I honestly found it shameful that a place that could have a lot of potential and is going down the drain, all around me I saw and heard customers complaining either because it was burnt or the food was cold or because they didn't order it... To make ordering easier, it would be easier for the employee to place the order, it would be easier for everyone, customers and employees, so everyone same time and everyone was satisfied, it was the first and perhaps the last time I come to this establishment, I'm sad because I really liked the comedians and the space, but the food was a huge disappointment, we spent almost 300 euros and were dissatisfied, I won't recommend it... ‚Ä¶

title: Far below expectations
text: The quality of the food does not match the price at all. We paid 15 eur for a dish with 4 pieces of spare ribs that had more bone than meat... The food came cold! The spectacle of (and some of) the comedians was limited to misogynistic comments, and they spent more time making fun of the hair, names and professions of people in the audience than telling jokes with real content. A disappointment...

title: S√≥ que n√£o....
text: Chegamos a porta, tinha fila pensamos okay est√° tudo a espera de entrar. Chegamos a nossa vez, o mo√ßo que estava a porta a registar os bilhetes ( que nem sab√≠amos que iam ser precisos) n√£o falava nem portugu√™s nem ingl√™s, era russo. L√° conseguimos falar com um rapaz que estava na fila que tinha comprado bilhete pro espet√°culo que ia ser completamente em russo. Sa√≠mos do Seixal pra vir experimentar, visto que n√£o h√° supostamente cartaz pro comedy club viemos a surpresa.... Pra n√£o voltar a repetir.

title: N√£o vamos voltar.
text:
N√£o recomendo.
Menu caro para o tipo de espet√°culo que nos proporcionam. Deixa muito a desejar pela falta de qualidade e de profissionalismo de algumas comediantes que subiram a palco. De lamentar.

title: Didn‚Äôt understand the racist(?) joke
text: The performance overall was nice, but the singer made a joke where she said ‚Äúwe are improvising like a rap battle except we have GOOD style. We are GOOD people, we are good like Eminem, not bad like Jay-z.‚Äù Now, maybe something was lost in translation and I would love to hear an explanation of what she was trying to say with that joke and maybe I‚Äôll delete this review, but all I heard was ‚Äúwe‚Äôre good white people, not bad Black people.‚Äù Maybe she felt safe making that joke because there were no Black people in the audience, but I did not appreciate it and it really distracted from the experience for me.

title: Terrible... Unacceptable
text:
A horrible, squalid and decadent place that certainly does not seem like a place where you listen to fado.
At the entrance to the venue the employee is a violent man who put his hands on me, I am a lady in my late forties , throwing me out of the door with such violence, throwing me into the street and locking me and my friend out of the door before the show started, just because she kindly asked to explain the fact that the tickets sold did not have assigned seats, but first come, first served... (when purchasing the ticket it is not mentioned anywhere... Only a mini paragraph in English at the bottom of the page after the purchase visible by scrolling to the end) terrifying experience. The police had to intervene... Horrible, really not recommended.

title: Aggression by Indian employee my 50 year old Italian friend
text: It was awful. I invited a non-Portuguese friend of mine of 50 years to experience a night of Fado as we do every time I visit, I am a Portuguese of 44. The employee who received us from non-Portuguese origin indicated us completely separate places in the room. Attention because this information is not given to us before buying the ticket that the seats are not marked. I pointed out that my ticket was two-place and that we wanted to stay together as the show was beginning he suggested that we talked out there (my friend here was not even hearing what I was talking to him even) I followed him to get out and my friend without realizing where I was going came after but I suggested that you stay in there and go watching the show the moment when the employee without absolutely no reason comes behind me and violently grabs my friend by the arm under the axil and literally shoots her out of the establishment. My friend yelled for him to let go and I too and immediately tried to hold her so she didn't fall to the road the moment he came back in and closed the doors and locked us outside. Without ever saying anything. We called the police and tried to get the complaints book that was only very expensive was delivered to us more than an hour after the incident and even one of the musicians tried to persuade us not to write the complaint. Horrible place and in nothing reflection of the Lisbon Fado experience. Even ASAE should also check the conditions of the space.

title: Racism at Fado (Show)
text:
My husband and I were looking forward to our Fado night at Lisboa em Fado. Unfortunately, Sara Paix√£o, the female artist that performed that night ruined our evening.

At first things went as planned. We arrived, sat down and fully enjoyed the show including the sing-along.

At the end of the performance, several people went to the front of the venue to speak with Sara and with a male artist who also sang that night. My husband was feeling a bit claustrophobic, so he decided to skip the meet and greet session and stepped outside. As I patiently waited in line for my turn to speak with Sara, I noticed that she was very friendly and engaged in conversation with all the people who approached her. When it was my turn, she totally ignored me and attempted to speak with the people who were behind me. Although her behavior caught me off guard, it immediately dawned on me that she was being dismissive because I am a Black person. I do want to point out that I do not play the race card every time something goes wrong. There are instances like this one however when it is obvious why one is being discriminated against. I had also realized early on that I was the only Black person in the audience which is trivial to me. Despite her behavior, I still congratulated her and let her know that I had had a great time. She did not deserve my kind words after what she had done but I am proud of myself because I demonstrated that I am the bigger person. She swiftly thanked me and proceeded to start a conversation with the folks behind me.

I am an open-minded, highly educated, well-dressed and well-behaved person who expects to be treated with utmost respect and dignity. Shame on you Sara Paix√£o for having such an unacceptable behavior! I have already shared my experience through social media and beyond. I also have a video that proves that I was in attendance that night.

There is no place for racism in society, especially in this day and age. Moreover, businesses should value all of their customers because they depend on them. Lisboa em Fado depends on us the tourists, who are the people who attend these types of shows.

title: Didn‚Äôt feel welcomed and the organisation of the show was not there
text: Need to organise more of what they will sing, felt very disorganised and wanted the audience to sing more than the artists. Need to show more care for the customers and looked after without no rude comments if people want to have another glass of wine

title: worst experience of fado
text:
worst fado in lisbon,waste of money and time,highly disappointed.
For Live concert I was not expecting 20 minutes of prerecorded screening of fado.

title: Very disappointing experience - 4-hour tour LISBOA
text:
Pensei bastante sobre esse review. When we did tours in the past, we always have a follow-up of the person asking if he liked the tour. No one has contacted us. Their instagram is very active and I contacted and booked the tour with them in January to February 6.

The lack of proper communication significantly damaged the experience, as we missed the opportunity to learn about the rich history of Lisbon. I found this misleading and lack of professionalism for a tourism company, I explain why:

I booked a tuk-tuk tour with Lisbon Espera Porti Tours for 300 euros. I made it very clear in the conversation, that I would like to have the tour in English. I was expecting a professional and engaging experience in English, as Carla promised me it would be. Given that this is a tourist service, I did not question your claim ‚Äî speaking at least basic English is the minimum expected of a company that serves international tourists. Unfortunately, the reality was very different from what was promised.
When her husband Carlos called us, it became clear that he spoke very little English. He could not explain anything about the history or sights of Lisbon in English, it was all literally in Portuguese despite promising me that he spoke English. And I had to constantly remind him to speak English ‚Äî otherwise he would only speak Portuguese. This forced me to translate everything to my partner, which was frustrating and completely overturned the purpose of a guided tour.
To make it worse, I realized that other tuk-tuk tours around us stopped at the sights and explained their meanings in fluent English. In contrast, our experience was disorganized and nothing engaging. Carlos was leaving us at a point, saying ‚ÄúAnd for it, I will be here when you return.‚Äù My boyfriend who has an interest in learning about other cultures, could not even ask questions because Carlos's level of English was extremely limited.
For 300 euros, that was extremely unfair and disappointing. A tour for this price should offer an informative, pleasant and trouble-free experience. Instead, we feel deceived and frustrated. I do not recommend this company to anyone.

And the worst of all this?? Their website says they speak English! But neither the minimum nor the basic was discussed with us.. What absurd and deceptive propaganda

1/5 - Avoid at all costs

title: Horrible cancellation!
text: The organizer messaged me in the morning asking if we could move the class from 3:00 to 4:30. This was inconvenient and I thought it was odd, but I moved my schedule around to make it work. When I was about to call my uber to go at 4:00, he cancelled altogether. This was valuable time in my trip to Portugal lost on such short notice. Stay far away from this ‚Äúexperience!‚Äù

title: My bad review of Tripadvisor
text:
My bad opinion of Tripadvisor. I bought a gift for a friend of mine - a cooking workshop 26.01 17:30. 1 day before the workshop, I got a text with my certificate.

At the specified time, my friend arrived at Lisboa Food Studio. It was closed. Calling the address indicated, it turned out that there was no workshop on the day. I have no complaints about Lisboa Food Studio, I have no doubt it's a great place.

But Tripadvisor has not fulfilled its obligations. I paid the money for the workshop, my friend spent time on the road and, despite the rain, arrived on time and had to find out why there was no workshop. I am very unhappy and do not recommend Tripadvisor for booking experiences

I tried to book this master class earlier, last time I got cancelled because the group didn't pack. My money was returned and I was warned in advance. That's fine. But this time, I'm very disappointed with Tripadvisor.

title: Two mixing bowls between 8 people = limited involvement and poor experience and not good value for money.
text:
The facility was really nice
Miguel seemed really nice and his delivery was good.
Unfortunately the ‚Äòlearn from scratch‚Äô class was not as expected.
Two mixing bowls between 8 people is not really a ‚Ç¨45 per person hands on learning experience. The format is just wrong especially post Covid. Lots of awkward waiting around to participate, everyone‚Äôs hands on the dough. We ended up in a team of five due to other participants being a bit clueless. We had a child who wanted to do it all and to be fair to his parents they barely participated because of this. Just became irritating and embarrassing so we left. Expected Miguel might at least contact us to see what was wrong. He didn‚Äôt. We requested a refund and were denied and to make matters worse Miguel never sent us the post class recipe and instructions.
If you want to learn how to do it all and participate this is not the course for you try Compadre Cooking School. A big disappointment in an other wise great trip

title: Nice experience as such, but not skillful storytelling
text:
The idea is good, but the museum needs to be able to communicate in an efficient way. Audioguides only worked semi-well, the story was childlike and at the same time it wasn‚Äôt so right for smaller children. The vision for the museum‚Äôs narrative seems random; especially unfortunate when there is so much history to tell without it being flat and bad.
We did not hear anything that we did not know in advance. It has so much potential to become so much better!

title: Infantile
text:
Suitable for 12 years old or less.
Very basic instructions spread over one hour .
One can not speed up audio to keep up with your walking.
Walked out after 10 minutes.

title: Bad, not worth it
text:
I didn't like it, stupid, childish, little information. Don't spend $ in this place or time.
Go to the streets that will be more fun

title: Nice idea, bad implementation
text:
Nice idea, bad execution!
Unfortunately, this museum only contains videos or photos; there are no old artifacts on display or anything like that. It's like walking through a YouTube video.

title: Most boring experience‚Ä¶walked out after 20 mins
text:
This is a great example of trying to dumb down a subject to make it accesible and devaluing your precious subject.

As someone who is intrigued by history and travel I had looked forward to visiting the Lisboa Story. I was so disappointed. It felt like someone had tried to dumb down the subject and ensure people have to make no effort to read anything or use their brains. This revolves around the use of unhygienic audio guides. There is no choice but to use the audio guides as the whole thing is based on listening to boring, amateurish audio that is thin on content, whilst looking at terrible visual loops on tv screens.

The best museums understand that one size does not fit all and provide different exhibit areas that will appeal to different people. This is definitely not one of those.

We walked out after 20 minutes of tedious boredom. Such a waste of money.

title: Doesn‚Äôt worth the time and money
text:
I am Portuguese and I know the basics of Lisbon city history. After visiting Lisbon Story Centre my knowledge about Lisbon history remained unchanged. Obviously this is not a good sign.

The description says this is an interactive experience but there is no interaction here. We are given a audiobook that starts playing automatically when we pass through the rooms, there are some screens on those rooms, and that‚Äôs all. There is not even a single button to push to interact with anything!

In the first rooms, the audio is not synched with the video on the screen, so you are listening to one thing and watching another thing, which is very confusing!

In the last rooms, the audio and the video are synched, but when you enter the rooms you start listening and watching in the middle of the content, so you need to wait the content to finish and then finally watch it from the beginning.

Normally when I visit museums or exhibitions about history, the first thing I get is a chronology bar, with the main events and periods marked. This one has none.

For me was a waste of time and money visiting this exhibition the way it is. Hope it can improve a lot and be a really story telling of Lisbon. I do not recommend it as it is today.

title: Waste of time
text: The worst museum I have ever been to. Unorganized, without any signs or help. Terrible experience. It is a waste of time.

title: Worst exhibition we have ever seen
text: Uncritical portrayal of history. Glorifying presentation. Embarrassing and bad. We would never have believed it possible.

title: A short walk through the story of Lisbon (from the Portuguese perspective only)
text:
The museum tells the story of Lisbon in a short and straightforward way, basically taking you through the main events from its foundation to what it has become today.

I found it a great option for tourists who may not have much time in the city and are interested in learning a bit more about Lisbon (which was my case).

It was a good experience overall. The museum has a decent structure, there's audio guide available, some interactive parts, staff is friendly, tickets aren't expensive, etc.

What really pissed me off was the complete lack of mention of the peoples who were cowardly and brutally colonized and slaved by the Portuguese from the XV century.

They do have a specific section where they talk about the great navigations and the discovery of the new world, however, they only emphasize how courageous and bold their explorers were and how their conquest made the crown wealthier, not even bothering to briefly mention at what cost it all came - millions of lives, to say the least.

Being from one of these countries I found it extremely disrespectful, specially as these events still have a huge negative impact on our society to this day. It should be their responsibility to show people (specially new generations) that colonization was all but heroic.

title: Taxi ·ªü Lisbon
text: ƒê·ªìng h·ªì b√°o ch·ªâ 12 euro nh∆∞ng g√£ t√†i x·∫ø thu c·ªßa t√¥i 33 euro v√† n√≥i l√† ƒë·ªìng h·ªì ch·ªâ c√≥ t√°c d·ª•ng ·ªü trong th√†nh ph·ªë. Th·∫≠t gh√™ t·ªüm, T√¥i s·∫Ω kh√¥ng bao gi·ªù quay l·∫°i th√†nh ph·ªë n√†y.

title: Wait for an Uber or Bolt
text: How pathetic to get ripped off by a taxi driver, who charged us more than 3 times what he should have, and then tried to give himself a tip. The last tome that happend to us was 1998 in Bolivia. Use Uber or Bolt.

title: Fatal.
text: We arrived at Lisbon airport and took a taxi. To our surprise, he immediately put a screen up so we couldn't see it (tax meter). We told him we wanted to go to the bus stop to go to Sagres. He told us they were on strike (a lie). We also told him to drop us off there, he dropped us off far from the station and to top it off, he charged us 35 euros when it's a 10 euro ride and it's in cash. A very nice man at the subway told us that the best option, so you don't get scammed, is Uber. I will never take a taxi in Portugal again.

title: Flight from the airport to the center of Lisbon
text:
The trip from the airport to Lisbon (Plaza Comercio) cost us ‚Ç¨44. However, the return trip to the airport cost us ‚Ç¨12. Also, they don't let you pay by card.
The outward journey seemed like a scam to us!

title: Official taxi driver scammer
text:
We took an official Taxi, not tarot, but he cheated us: he didn't turn on the meter and asked for payment in cash, asking us 38 euros (instead of the 15-20 euros that should cost a ride yes a Taxi).
Take Uber: there are thousands of them and you know how much you will spend.

title: Beware of overcharges
text:
On May 29th, at 7:15 am on a quite busy morning, a taxi from campo grande to terminal 2 was 7 euros. The driver was professional and courteous and we have no complaints about that experience. However, On June 7th at 6:15 pm, a taxi from Terminal 1 to campo grande with very little traffic cost 15 euros. The number on the back of the cab was 3041 and the driver was a short man with grey hair and a short greyish beard. He turned off the meter and we were unable
To see the total cost. He was not forthcoming with any kind of explanation as to the fare. I feel we were intentionally taken advantage of. Do your research - under and bolt may be the better options.

title: Horrible Taxi experience Lisbon Airportrt
text: I just arrived today at the Lisbon Airport, at 715am I took a taxi to the VIP Arts Hotel which is 2.4 miles from the airport. A heavy set white driver charged me ‚Ç¨45 for a ride that is normally ‚Ç¨15. He said on a Sunday is more, I felt robbed. Horrible experience.

title: Do not use Lisbon taxi
text:
Do not use Lisbon taxi. Our driver did turn on meter, however told us meter is not accurate on face value and charged us 50% more.
They refused to take credit card. While we told him that we did not bring cash, he took out the machine to take credit card and demanded 50% surcharge.
The license is 89 FQ 12 with taxi id 2643, alvara n 193039
Use uber or bolt, just raise the bid to get a driver, still cheaper than taxi and hassle free

title: Rip off airport taxis
text: After arriving at Lisbon we waited outside in a very long line for taxi. Our driver was very nice, helpful and informative putting us at our ease. When we arrived at our hotel, he quickly jumped out and retrieved our case from the boot - then charged us 50euros for the fare. I thought it was expensive but having just arrived we weren't too sure so we paid him and gave him a tip. Inside the hotel we asked reception how much the fare should have been - they said no more than 15 euros! We had been ripped off! Please make sure that the driver puts the meter on before you start off, or else they will try to rip you off - seems to be a standard thing in Lisbon with newly arrived tourists like us so be aware!!

title: Lurendrejeri
text: Request a fixed price or take an uber with fixed price, paid before the wonder comes. The other taxis are playing you. EUR 20 is a guide price. Airport to city center.

title: Complete scam
text:
Beware of taxis. Uber bookings were busy, so after a long flight decided to take a taxi. About 5 minutes in the queue. Drivers were not taking card payments and fare quotes to Lisbon varied from 30 to 40 euros.
Waited 15 minutes and booked with uber. Approx 9 euros.
Uber pick up zone is very easy to find.

title: Welcome To Lisbon And Get Ripped Off
text: We were warned as even the airport website indicated some were honest and one assumes most were not and we found one that was not. He had a meter , and a credit card service and was all smiles with friendly advice in broken English; where are you from; first time in Lisbon; all the usual. And then when you felt comfortable, tried to check the price but there was a language barrier and we paid double the normal fare. Silly us for trusting. Ask the fare, ensure there is a meter, and prepare to argue. The Visit Lisboa service at the airport sold vouchers for a fixed price but they were not available as no one would commit to a voucher service and you know why. They do it well in Spain; time for the same in Portugal.

title: Lightning shelter Lisbon taxi
text: A 20-minute drive costs ‚Ç¨46, about five times the normal price for Uber/Bolt. We didn't understand how the price could have gone up so high during the trip and the driver pushed a button at the destination and told us the incredible price. No receipts. A very unpleasant experience!

title: Lisbon Green and Black Taxi Rip Off
text:
Beware when getting a Lisbon Green and Black Taxi if you plan on paying by card.
I wasn't vigilante enough. He's chatting away like he's my best friend, tells me all about his wife and three kids, says the fare is Eur 24. He's such a nice guy. I don't pay as much attention as I should when I ding my card. Why would I make a note of the taxi number?
I didn't notice the transaction on my account until the following day and I'd been charged Eur 240.

Tip. If you can't pay cash or get an Uber and you have to pay by card, double check the amount and note the taxi number.
This type of thing is not as uncommon as it seems.
Your options are limited when you try to report the theft.

Be wary out there!

title: Cheaters
text:
Avoid! We didn't know the way. We checked this later... for 5 km the taxi driver took from us 48 dollars! you can take the metro or order BOLT (price to the airport from the hotel less than 10 euros).
No bill, no evidence..(becouse of the blackout) - they have great excuse..

title: PAY ATTENTION TO NEGATIVE LISB√îA TAXI REVIEWS
text: We made a 20-25 min trip in an ‚Äúofficial‚Äù black and blue taxi. I first checked Uber to get a sense of price; result was 16-20‚Ç¨ at that time. I asked the taxi driver to use his meter. He pointed to his phone, saying that was his meter. When we were about halfway to our destination, I got suspicious as the price already over 30‚Ç¨ and climbing fast. The final trip price was 51.5‚Ç¨. Maybe he had his screw-the-tourist rate applied. On return by Uber to the same place we started, cost was just under 10‚Ç¨. Great driver to boot. I would like to think this experience was rare, but from other reviews it is unfortunately not.

title: Attention fraudsters
text:
Lisboa Airport to Oriente Bus Station
Actually I asked a man at the taxi rank from the bus goes to Oriente, but he took my suitcase, led me to a taxi, when asked what it cost he meant, I can see that then from the taximeter
I didn't care if it worked.
Shortly before arrival he shows me his phone with the indication 120 ‚Ç¨
I thought that was his daily intake.
Again I ask what it costs, again 120 ‚Ç¨
I vehemently ‚Äúare they crazy! You are really crazy! ! ! maximum 10 ‚Ç¨‚Äù

Then he ‚Äúok, its free for you‚Äù

I quickly took my things and left.

In hindsight, I thought I should have photographed him, but I couldn't think about my indignation at this naughtiness

title: Do not use official taxis at the airport, scam!
text: We have taken the official taxi line from Lisbon. We get in a first taxi, without announcing a price. Seeing that he did not put the meter, he announces 25‚Ç¨ (vs 9‚Ç¨ on Uber), we insist that he put the meter, stop and force us to get off while our 2-year-old son was asleep. We take another taxi, it announces a fixed price of 25‚Ç¨, we gave in. An organized scam, long live Uber. Do not use taxis, especially. We learned after Bolt allowed the use of transport with a child seat from 15kg.

title: Shameful scam
text: Alone with my sleeping children, for a race of 6 euros, I did not see that the driver had between 39, 36 euros on the tpe....

title: Scammed by the "authorized" taxi at Lisbon airport
text:
TDLR - do not pay more than 20 from airport to Lisbon center and ask for a receipt!

We got scammed. We took a taxi from the authorized queue (even verified with a police office that was there that these are legit ones). He did put the meter on and when we got to the hotel it showed 12 Euros. But then he pressed some buttons and it turned into 36 euros. It was late and we were tired so we assumed it was because we were 3 people and had luggage - in the morning we checked with the hotel and realized it should have cost us 20 Euros at most. What a disapointment and what a poor intro to the city and country

title: Extortion of Taxiata from the airport to the Jos√© Malhoa Mercore $40,00 Euros
text:
I took a taxi with Mr. Luiz Carlos on the 26th day of the flight from Naples. He went to Cortez, but by arriving at the hotel Mercure Na Jos√© Malhoa, he charged me 40 Euros for the race!
Detail my suitcase was in the door bags, I felt coarse! An abuse of a Brdileiro who lives there. Taking Profit
He said he'd turn off the Taximeter and we'd make a right price. At the end changed and separated the amount of R$ 20,00 Euros in another compartment (DETAIL HE IS FUNCIONAL).

title: Taxi Rip Off
text: Took a taxi from central square to night market. 1.75kms. Didn‚Äôt notice the driver didn‚Äôt put meter on. Charged us 19.20 euro. Damn ripoff, this guy gives the taxis a bad name. Wish I had taken a picture of his rego. Make sure the driver puts the meter on or get out. One thing we noticed was his taxi could take 7 persons. Avoid this taxi.

title: Disservice to tourism, do NOT take taxi
text:
The first day we arrive in Lisbon and take a taxi from the airport to the hotel , a 25‚Ç¨ journey, we are charged 45‚Ç¨.
We discussed it at the hotel and were surprised but it must be a regular thing for the way we answer so I recommend Uber or metro and NOT take taxi.

title: Robbed with knife iPhone 15
text: Knitted by a taxi driver in Santos leaving the city. First wanted 25 after 80 I didn't have and refused and pointed me knife and stole me iPhone 15. At least I complained and you'll get to that cock

title: Look at Lisbon airport taxis
text:
Transfer Airport-hotel: 27 ‚Ç¨. Watch this. He didn't put the meter in, and on arrival he showed us an alleged official fare chart.
Transfer Hotel-airport: 12,50‚Ç¨ . Taxi called by the hotel. √ë

title: GOLPISTAS!
text:
If you think you're safer taking a taxi, you're wrong. S√ÉO ESTAFADORES/ Scammers. From the airport only center, a run that would give a maximum of 10‚Ç¨, we were charged 24‚Ç¨. The taxi driver changed the route several times to increase the route and justified that he knew the route better than the GPS.
Whoever comes to Portugal, stay connected. Use public transport, which works. An absurd!

title: We've been robbed
text: Very bad service, he was a rude person and he stole our money when he was going to give us the change. Fatal, you can't trust me, I don't recommend it. Besides, bad looks...

title: Scam taxis drivers- DO NOT USE
text:
Got a taxis at airport to bus station. This fare is normally 8 euro in cab, taxis driver had no metre. When he got to bus station 5 min drive he demanded 25 euro.
Absolute scammer. Ill never use Lisbon taxis again, will always opt for uber now in future

title: Taxi in Lisbon with No.1133 with usury prices
text: taxi number 1133 charged 3 times the usual price, mock arguments and excuses as justification. we were under time pressure , foolishly paid for it.

title: Some Taxis Lisboa taxis are thieves
text: Same as some other reviews I saw. You have Taxis Lisboa taxi drivers out there that are thieves, charging you at least 3 times what they really should be charging. Was charged 50 Euros from cruise terminal to hotel in center, 15 min drive.

title: THIEVES, CROOKS
text:
All the taxi drivers in Lisbon are crooks!!!
When they see tourists they ask for 5 times more money than normal.
We got out of the cruise ship 5 different couples and families, everybody has been robbed from the taxi drivers going to their hotels.
We paid 68‚Ç¨ from the cruise terminal to hotel mundial 5min distance.

DON'T EVER TAKE A TAXI TO LISBON

title: Scam and rudeness
text: Arrived late in Lisbon we wanted to make the trade work.... taxi driven by a young woman, who did not speak to us, was on the phone all the way, and start bitching in English when she could not find the address, charged us 40 ‚Ç¨ the race! And back to the bottom.. A real thief. We returned by metro at the end of the stay for ‚Ç¨ 5 max. We will not be picked up there. Too bad first impression upon arrival. Fortunately the rest of the trip went well.

title: ABUSE OF TAXI DRIVERS
text: Sometimes I am for granted that the professionals, in this case the taxi of Lisbon airport are honest. Nothing further from the truth. I was scammed 30 euros for a 10 euro race (there are 6 kilometers from the airport to the hotel). I will not file a formal complaint because unfortunately I did not take the license plate number. I hope this serves as a warning to others.

title: Airport taxi scam
text: I was another one to RIP off by taxi at the Lisbon airport. We had just around 10 min to the hotel and paid ‚Ç¨50. On way back we took uber and paid ‚Ç¨12.60. Absolute scam . The city should do something about it. This is shocking and unacceptable.

title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
text: Like so many others, we were completely ripped off by this taxi company. What should have been a 5 min. drive became a "scenic tour" until I pulled out my phone to inquire where he was going? He then turned around and headed to our hotel, made a "wrong" turn, and rerouted. He dropped us off at an intersection and demanded 50 Euros!!! We couldn't believe it. We paid in cash, which as I see now, was a blessing.. We booked an Uber home and had a seamless experience. Wish something could be done about this company given all these negative reviews.

title: Criminal Taxi Driver in Lisbon
text: Diogo Cravo charged me $1,089 US dollars for a four-mile taxi ride. Clearly, he knew this was a fraudulent charge as our other taxi rides were between $9 USD and $11 USD. This was not a mistake he was unaware of. When I got back to the U.S., I thought my account with Bank of America would be adjusted when I submitted a billing dispute. I submitted all the information I had to show this was a fraudulent charge. They denied my dispute three times, explaining that without a receipt I had no proof. I provided a copy of my hotel folio, showing I had stayed in Lisbon for three nights (this happened on day one), copies of my daughter's bank statement showing how much a taxi ride should be (just back and forth between our hotel and downtown) and letters explaining in detail this transaction. So not only did Diogo Cravo rob me of well over $1,000 USD, but Bank of America also helped him succeed with his crime.

title: Pinto e Rocha taxi - Beware - dont pay by card - dont use at all if you can avoid
text: If you have to use a taxi in Lisbon beware. Many want you to pay by card. DONT! You stand a chance of being fleeced, finding you have been charged much more than you expected. You could be charged over ‚Ç¨1,000 more in what looks like a Lisbon taxis scam.

title: Lisbon taxi scam
text: Another victim of a taxi scam in Lisbon. Do not use them, just take Uber! I had a 6.35 euro fare, used my Wise card to pay. Got a receipt for that amount but the money that was deducted was for 50 euro and to an account named Superbock. Wise investigated this and has nothing to do with Superbock, so obviously using a fake account to deposit money in. The receipt I got was for a cash transaction, so the scam is well done! Very frustrating

title: Avoid at all costs , use uber
text: Do not use charged us 87 euros then added on toll charges and baggage allowance ‚òπÔ∏èdropped us off not at the correct destination , so used a Uber will never use them again should have only been 40euros

title: Taxi scams Lisbon
text:
I took with my partner a taxi from Plaza de Comercio to Casa Ramiro (very famous seafood )
He spent all the way with the taximeter screen turned, he had no customer-facing taximeter like others we used.
He gave us a lot of absurd turns, until we arrived.
When we arrived on the screen it said ‚Ç¨8 and tells us that it is ‚Ç¨18, to which we told him that it said ‚Ç¨8, not ‚Ç¨18, supposedly it was a fee (non-existent) started arguing and in the end we ended up paying the ‚Ç¨18 for not messing it up and enjoying a few days of vacation.
Both at home Ramiro and in other taxis, we shared our bad experience and were told that he had cheated on us.
It was a Peugeot rancher and he had tattoos, one of them a cross on his neck, for what it helps
I didn't get a license plate from the mosque we were running.

title: Don‚Äôt use them
text: Don‚Äôt use them. Charged ‚Ç¨48 for a 1.4 km journey from the airport to Ibis Styles Lisboa Aeroporto. Wanted cash - said his card reader wasn‚Äôt working. Absolute rip off.

title: Apparently driver neck weight us from airport to hotel scammer small
text: This is my feedback on the operation of the Lisbon taxi took a taxi from the airport to the hotel cost us 30 euros and drove about half an hour. It was in the evening at about 7:30 p.m. on the way back home. Also booked a taxi from the hotel to the airport drove 17 minutes and on the counter was 12 euros so apparently in Portugal the taxi drivers cheated

title: Taxi scam
text:
We found out too late. We were directed to a taxi by the supervisor at the rank. You expect a vehicle with a taxi sign in the correct colours to be bona fide, but no. On arrival at destination driver demanded extorinate amount for the fare. Went in about 'that's the price for the service'. Only I had the family there and they didn't want a conflict etc. I'd had have the cops for him. As I sat in the back I never noticed there were no licence details on show and no sign of a meter.
This is obviously happening everyday. What are the authorities doing about it ?
I'll be reporting this to Lisbon Airport and the local taxi regulator. Anyone in the same position should do this too.
The taxi number was 588. Watch out for him.
Use an Uber.

title: LISBON AIRPORT TAXI SCAM
text: We arrived at Lisbon Airport and grabbed a taxi to the hotel. Driver was actually friendly, so I let my guard down. I couldn't keep a constant eye on the meter from the back seat, but an occasional glance during the 20 min.ride, the ‚Ç¨ was reasonable. BUT, I didn't look at the meter as we arrived at the hotel. He shut the meter off and said ‚Ç¨32.50 CASH. Probably should have been no more than ‚Ç¨ 15. No way to really dispute it. I paid it, but I'm still pissed. 10 days in Spain prior without a single problem with taxis. Live and learn!

title: Green roof taxi scam from the airport to the Mundial P. Martim Moniz)! Paid 38 Euros pr 7 km. Shame!
text: At the exit of the airport in Lisbon, a policeman tells me a taxi. So I take it with confidence! No meter seen inside.

title: Alert with some drivers!
text: Alert with some drivers, abuse the good faith of tourists who seek a few days of tranquility fleeing the conflict, appropriate the change, do not give receipts to not leave a mark. Unbelievable that there is no complaints system to prevent a few bad taxi drivers from leaving all their mates in a bad way. I had a very bad experience with the 240 license.

title: Beware of taxi charges from Lisbon airport
text:
Beware of rip off charges.
Took a taxi from the rank outside the airport arrivals. Driver stated fixed rate ‚Ç¨35. Genuine Lisbon taxi, we accepted and duly paid on our arrival in Lisbon.
Our return journey, again a genuine Lisbon taxi, on a metered ride, ‚Ç¨12.50.
MAKE SURE YOUR TAXI DRIVER IN LISBON IS USING A METER

title: Considered chicken to pluck
text:
Having read negative reviews, I did not accept the many taxi drivers who offered themselves outside the airport. I thought I'd stand in a long line to get a taxi that would give me more guarantees.
Unfortunately the experience was absolutely negative.
The taxi driver had a Reckless Guide and red at traffic lights was not considered. Upon arrival electronic payment was not accepted and I shelled out 45 euros while the taximeter showed just over 10 euros.
I avoid further comment.

title: Lisboa Taxi - UNRELIABLE
text: Upon arrival at the airport in Lisbon we took a taxi. As it goes, the taxi is assigned. It was a single ride of 8 km. Upon arrival at our destination the taxi driver asked for 38‚Ç¨. He only accepted cash and could not/would not display on 40‚Ç¨. Immediately afterwards, I formulated a complaint on the company's website with a photo of the license plate of the taxi, but it was never followed up by them. Afterwards, we learned that such a trip can be a maximum of 15‚Ç¨. Upon returning we arranged a ride through Uber. It cost us 9,45‚Ç¨. That such a society tolerates such corrupt practices is unacceptable. So don't call on this taxi company!

title: Taxi cheat you at Lisboa AirPort
text:
Took a taxi with reg number Az87hd
When We stopped, ta driver turn off taxameter and said I had to pay 40 Euro for AirPort to a place close to old Town.
Use Bolt or Uber!

title: Take the Metro
text: Uber experience in Lisbon not nearly as reliable as other major cities. Provided false pick up times on each trip and on one occasion I was advised that the driver was unable to pick me up. Charged as a no show which was corrected by Uber. They forced me to take public transportation which worked out to my advantage .

title: Incredible naughtiness!!!!
text:
Incredibly cheeky!
We used (or wanted to use) a taxi 3 times...
The first one claimed we didn't have to go to the address we gave, although we were sure. We hadn't asked him for his opinion either. Then he let us out halfway & said we were wrong anyway (?!) the rest we ran (and we were of course right with the address!) I don't know what his problem was?
The second one was very annoyed, but has taken us to the desired place without further ado.
The third one was DRINKING!
He got totally angry and called us crazy several times (made a gesture with his index finger against his forehead, so a la do you have a bird?) because we only wanted to drive a short distance (on foot 25min). We didn't want to go on foot due to medical problems & it was totally cancelled!
Then he told us to run or get an Uber...

Sorry, but the taxi drivers don't have to be surprised when no one drives a taxi anymore and everyone only uses Uber.

Absolute cheekiness!
Well-intentioned tip: In Portugal, just take Uber from the start and save yourself the taxi theater!

title: Do not trick by taxi driver at Portugal
text:
Really take your time to ask for price before you get into the taxi or just arrange Uber instead.
There actually has a meter on the top left hand corner of their front mirror, but passengers will not see it unless driver press somewhere on the mirror
What I experienced was being charged Euro 45 from cruise port to my hotel that is actually 1km away .As a reference, I taxi from Sintra which is 26 km to the same hotel was just Euro 36 after.
The trick the driver used on me and my husband was to use the busy and confusing environment to play tricks on us.
There was long line up at the port, there actually lots of taxi .The driver rushed to us and pretend to be sooo busy and grapped our two hand carry luggages and dump into the trunk when it is our turn to get the taxi , because of the rush ,busy environment and vibe we didn't realize that was no visible meter and forgot to ask the price before we got into the taxi , when my husband realized it and asked the price, the driver said Euro 45.
He also mentioned he has to pay Euro 10 to the cruise line, I do not know how true it is!!
There is actually a meter on the taxi that I realized when I taxi from Sintra!!
So, in order not to get rip off by driver there, please take your time to ask for price, prepare for small change , or just arrange Uber which is more reliable
The way they rip us off is totally unacceptable!!!.

title: Avoid Taxis at Lisbon Airport! Damage in the right.
text:
We arrived in Lisbon, coming from Spain where we were treated very well and served by taxi drivers, in several cities. The run to the hotel, only 8 km away, cost 35 Euros !!!! At the hotel, reception staff was also scared and instructed us to use only Uber.
What taxis don 't know is that their dishonesty dirty the image of Lisbon and Portugal .

title: Be Aware
text:
We arrived at Lisbon Airportand asked information center about the best way to get to Oriente station as our flight was 3 hrs delayed and had train tickets to Porto. The information ceneter advised us that it is only 2 train stations from the Airport and will be faster and more economic as the Taxi would be around 15 Euros.
