Once at the Metro station the metro stopped. So went back up to take a Taxi and as i was in a hurry did not ask how much? Got in the Taxi and it was about a 10 min ride to Oriente Station.
So i asked how much do i owe and was ready to give him 20.00. He said it is 38 Euros. sShowed me the meter and he had maniuplated. I told him the information center told me Max of 15.00. He said they do not know what they are taking about, I paid as i did not want to miss my train. Once up in the train 2 ladies had taken a Taxi from the Airport for 12.00 Euros.
So be wary and deal before you get in a Taxi in lisbon.
I forgot to take the Taxi number, He is a Tall about 6ft tall with long hair and his name is FAVIO. He also was bragging about travelling and said he managed 5 Taxis.

One other day in down town Lisbon another Taxi driver said his Meter is over headted and does not work. So guess what i got out of the cab.

It is sad that they give a bad experiance to travellers.

title: Scam!
text: Watch out for scams! We paid 35‚Ç¨ for a trip from Lisbon city centre airport (ibis Av. Fontes Pereira de Melo) Friday, September 13 at around 1:30 pm / 2 pm. Mercedes vehicle. The driver, 60/65 years old, had placed his meter in the glove compartment and I realized it on arrival. Obviously his counter was ‚Äúloaded‚Äù at the Check-out! Be vigilant!

title: Scam and PHYSICAL AGGRESSION by taxi driver 3283 Lisboa
text: Taxi 3283 Lisboa, short, hairless taxi driver. Transfer airport-Barrio Alto Lisbon. He asked us for the ride 33 euros (price 10-15 euros), did not accept a credit card and obviously did not use the taximeter. I got out of the cab and took a picture of the license plate to report it. After 2 minutes that we were in the street we found him in front of us and and he SHOUTED that he wanted my phone otherwise "he punched me", in the end HE KICKED ME with all his strength in the shin (luckily without consequences, only severe pain and shock) and ran away insulting us. Of course I'll report it and call the embassy, and I'll do anything until the friend loses his license and the desire to do certain things. SHAMEFUL that people like this can work with people, there is no control. AVOID TAXIS IN LISBON (use BOLT, the local Uber).

title: Scam
text: From the airport to the hotel 2,5km or paid 40‚Ç¨ and just a fee, for me I no longer ask for a parking space with a taxi ............ ..........

title: Taxi number 2372 to avoid TERRIBLE
text:
Taxi 2372 to avoid
Airport - city centre route
He started saying that with him you could only pay cash and to get to the center he charged us 40‚Ç¨ when the taximeter marked 15‚Ç¨ saying it was an airport tax
TERRIBLE SCREWING THE VASTER EXPERIENCE UPON ARRIVAL IN LISBON

title: Lisbon, the taxi scam
text:
A real black and green taxi scam in Lisbon. From the airport to our Pension, 7km, we took a taxi because we could not order by Uber having not installed the Roaming feature.
On arrival the Rating amounted to 33‚Ç¨ to be paid in cash.
Today we hired an Uber to go to the Bel√©m Tower 12.5km from our Pension. It cost us 11‚Ç¨.
When you come to Lisbon install the Uber app and do not forget to complete with the Roaming feature of your phone.

title: Attention scam
text:
The taxi asked us 20 euros for an 8 min drive between the airport and an Inn near the airport
What a scam. We had to stay in the car because we didn't want to pay

title: Tax fraudsters
text: I arrived in Lisbon on July 14 about 3:30 I took a taxi at the airport from Lisbon to Cascais the taxi driver went by the bridge 25 April (I got to know later by someone who was unnecessary ) arrived at the destination charged me 83 euros I didn't want to believe I thought he was joking he justified the amount because he had paid tolls. It ruined my first day of vacation. That's why Portuguese taxi drivers have bad reputation outside of Portugal never take a taxi in Portugal again. Be very careful if you can pick up Uber all the time.

title: Uber Lisbon
text: Beware of Lisbon Uber they are thief's. Uber won't help you and the driver will deny anything... you are on your own... absolutely the worse service

title: A lot of smart loose
text:
Sure there are excellent professionals but in four trips, twice we have been conned and twice we have had to argue, not recommended.

We were charged 40 euros to go from the airport to Libertade, a journey of 10-15 Eur.

title: Taxi Lisbon Airport
text: Arriving at Lisbon airport we decided to grab a taxi to our hotel in the center, the first thing the driver asked us was where we came from and telling him that we came from Spain put a bad face, next fact he told us that he did not have the device to pay by card, we told him that there was no problem and asking him more or less how much he could leave , he told us that he did not know. We decided to ride. The man was falling asleep so we caught his eye and from that moment on he was somewhat friendlier. Our surprise , when we arrived at the hotel and looked at the taximeter he scored 9.85 Euros and when asked how much was to pay him, he immediately deleted the screen and with his face well washed he told us it is 30 Euros. My husband and I were shocked, I actually took the license plate number because we felt stolen. We will not use this service again in life. I don't recommend him to my worst enemy.

title: Private Taxi, a rip off , and aggressive
text: We took a private Taxi from Lisbon airport to Caparica, normal price with Bolt‚Ç¨15-20 euros‚Ä¶ our rip off taxi driver ‚Ç¨65 euros.. just don‚Äôt get in a private taxi.. they are very aggressive as well .

title: Bolt and Uber in Lisbon; not completely only partially useless
text: We were in Lisbon for a week and a half and tried using ridesharing for most of the first week. Both companies batted about .600 (for those not into MLB lingo, they worked 60% of the time). The rest of the time, drivers seemed mystified as to where we were, despite our location being activated on our phones. The reality is, they knew where we were, but apparently both apps had difficulty pinpointing our location and relied on us, with our limited knowledge of the city to verify whatever location they came up with. Rather than drive a block or two to where we were, drivers just drove off after 5 minutes, a practice uber encourages by forcing payment. The upside of all this was it forced us to rely on Lisbon's metro system which turned out to be efficient, safe and cheap.

title: Robbery
text: We were robbed by a taxi driver in Lisbon who charged 60 euros for the 3km journey from the airport to the hotel, an absurd, so be careful taking a taxi at the airport

title: Ripped off
text: Don't trust these taxis. We went from Lisbon Airport to Travessa da Queimade 46. A fare we later found out should only be around 25-30 euros. When we arrived I got out to get our bags and my wife paid him - 45 euro's !! then he said the transaction did not go through and by this time he charged us 50 euro's. Soon after I check our account and both transactions had gone through. A total charge of 95 euro's - no wonder he wanted to leave as soon as he did after dropping us off. Use Uber - not these coloured taxi's !!

title: HORRY SERVICE
text:
Waste/ Taxi driver must be with some advanced senile dementia or persistent obnubility. Wholesaler, poorly polite, unpleasant and still wanting to give explanations about the absurd fee he charged.
Portugal is doing very badly in this bad service to tourists.
May God have mercy on the soul of this unfortunate, who must already be very close to finding him.

title: Also been ripped off !!!
text:
Arrived in Lisbon this morning and immediately had a bad experience with the taxi.
From the airport to the Iberostar Hotel 35 ‚Ç¨ ‚ô•Ô∏èwere not prepared for this rip-off ,as I have always read Taxi driving would be cheap.ü´£

title: Do not use the Green roof taxis
text: Dreadful taxi, nothing more than a bunch of crooks, if you are travelling to Lisbon download the Uber App. Fantastic service from Uber all week.

title: Taxi rip-off
text: We went on a cruise and arrived in Lisbon. We wanted to take a taxi to Belem. The taxi driver asked for 40 EUR and we knew he had cheated us. But we didn't have much time so we took a taxi. The return trip cost 12 EUR. Unfortunately, that was our first impression of a beautiful city.

title: Beware of thieves
text:
I found a dishonest person helped by those who coordinate people to direct them to taxis outside the airport. He took advantage of it because I was alone and to travel two and a half km, since the hotel was nearby, he made me pay ‚Ç¨34. Absurd, definitely a thief.
I recommend that if you are alone, never take a taxi for 6 people, as they already charge more.

title: Unfortunate
text:
We arrived at the airport at 6 am and looked for a taxi to take us to the hotel.
The driver was a strange guy because, in the cold of the morning, he was wearing extremely short shorts (not even Bermuda shorts!).
I had bad taste, wore perfume that burned my nostrils and drove very dangerously.
But that was the least of it. Worse was the unfortunate guy stealing from us, charging 4 times more than expected.
It is regrettable that a citizen has to live by cheating, by hurting people.
I'm not angry, I feel sorry for a person who survives on the product of his dishonesty.

title: Live & learn
text:
Arrived in Lisbon from cruise. After getting into cab to be taken 3 miles to our Hotel, Our cab drives handed us a card stating flat rate 45 euros.
I questioned the cab driver but he stated no speak English.
Once we arrived at hotel we were told by hotel check in we over paid by 25 euros. ALWAYS ask prior to getting into cab as taxi drivers in Libson are notorious for being dishonest.

title: UBER NOT TAXI IN LISBON
text: We took a taxi from the rank at the airport (expecting fare to be approx ‚Ç¨15-20 as per my enquiries. The meter was racing and we arrived at our city centre destination with ‚Ç¨50 on the clock. Driver wouldn‚Äôt take a card so had to give cash. After this we used Uber daily - excellent service and very cheap. Our return trip to airport cost just ‚Ç¨14.99. Lesson learned

title: Alone
text: A run that I often do, this time it cost me dearly, he didn't speak Portuguese well and kept saying where I came from if he earns well, shame on him.

title: They don't care about Europeans
text: Scam and very dishonest, 70 euros to go from the airport to the city. If the driver does not tell you an approximate price before taking the price, do NOT take this taxi

title: Lisbon Airport Taxi
text:
Airport Taxi Drivers

Unfortunately this remains a terrible service. Big thiefs, some of these guys. Took us on a short ride, the machine displayed an amount of 7 euros to be paid , charged us 15 euros, didn‚Äôt give us the receipt. Thought that after 14 years it would be different. But no. Always take the plate number and call the police if things don‚Äôt go well.

title: I would avoid Bolt Portugal
text: Have had a number of bad experiences with Bolt drivers cancelling at the last minute having accepted the trip and leaving me in a difficult situation. Just today pre-reserved a trip to the airport. Driver cancelled at last minute when he was already late. The app tried repeatedly to get other drivers who all refused. I cancelled the trip and sought alternative transport. Bolt then charged me for a cancellation. Outrageous. Have been trying to submit an official complaint but being given the roundabout by Bolt support staff. This is actually illegal as they have to allow formal complaints according to Portuguese law.y experience suggest Bolt is not reliable in Portugal.

title: Lisboa (Lisbon) Taxicab Drivers Steal From Tourists
text:
Lisboa (Lisbon) taxi drivers are obviously criminals intent on stealing hundreds from tourists. Diogo Cravo stole $138.69 by providing a receipt for 12.85 Euro, but secretly swiping my credit card for $138.69. Even though I provided the receipt to Chase Card Services and timestamp proof of the fraud, they initially refused to reimburse me, but the decision is currently being reviewed by another un-contactable department.

Avoid Lisbon taxis and use Uber or Bolt. If forced to use a taxi, pay in cash unless you want your credit card to be charged hundreds of dollars. Because of this experience, I will always go for ridesharing services where possible.

On May 19, 2024, I submitted written details and uploaded receipt and other documentation/details to the following entities:
1. Pol√≠cia Judici√°ria by email.
2. Department of Central Investigation by web form.
3. City of Lisboa by web form.
4. U.S. Consulate in Lisbon by phone.

I expect Diogo Cravo and the many other Lisboa Taxi criminals to be arrested, especially since I shared information about countless other tourists being ripped off. If they are not arrested, I‚Äôll have to assume that city officials are part of the scam to steal from tourists. I hope that is not the case as Lisbon was my favorite city on my recent travels.

title: Lisbon taxi
text: Avoid Lisbon taxis they over charge. Stick to Uber. I visited recently and the taxi (not Uber) spoiled our trip and it was our first impression

title: Avoid Lisbon's regular taxis
text: Most Lisbon taxi drivers, especially the younger ones, work in order to overcharge tourists. They will obscure their meters or not use them at all, take longer routes, and so on - often while claiming not to speak English even when they do. Use Uber or Bolt, for transparency and reliability. They're also much cheaper.

title: Habitual Scam Artists
text: Ensured the meter was on, ensured we took a direct route, we were in an 'official' Lisbon Taxi - all the advice given to tourists arriving in Lisbon, but upon arriving at our hotel the driver switched off the meter, got out to remove our cases then said the fare was ‚Ç¨28. I said the meter said about ‚Ç¨14. He insisted that was the distance then pointed to a supposed price list in the rear window. It was raining, we'd been delayed five hours, he caught me at a low ebb and I knew I was being ripped off, but didn't know what to do. I insisted on getting a receipt, which he agreed to. I foolishly gave him the money, he returned to the car to get my change, then drive away! Shameless thief - and another family member had the same experience earlier that day traveling from the airport. These guys prey on unwitting tourists. With hindsight I should have brought him back to his taxi meter and told him to show me the fare - apparently it's illegal not to use the meter - Or I should've asked a member of the hotel reception staff to come to advise on the situation. But I paid, like a fool. These guys are career criminals who do this day after day. Don't be afraid to refuse payment until you're sure it's a valid price. Otherwise this horrible start to your visit will linger in your mind - and finding a way to report the cab number to a taxi regulator seems impossible....I'm still trying

title: Watch out for scams
text: We thwarted an attempt by the driver to scam us. We were picked up at the airport in Lisbon and taken to Britania Hotel. Our meter said our cost was just under 14 euro. The driver asked for 43.50 euro! He said it was a "weekend fee". My husband told him we travelled here a month ago and there was no such thing. Then he asked for cash and would not take credit. When we pushed further, he said to give him what we thought the ride was worth - it's worth what's on the meter! He left with 25 euro cash. We will always use BOLT or UBER in Lisbon as unfortunate as this is. One driver taking advantage of tourists is one driver too many.

title: Taxi driver scams!
text:
I arrived at Lisbon airport and wanted to take a taxi at the taxi stand. You expect it to be neatly regulated. I couldn't find a taxi that accepted a credit or debit card, cash only! That's actually the first Red Flag! Then the ride from the airport to the center of Lisbon cost me 67 euros! I had asked others in advance what it would cost approximately and they said around 15 euros. The amount he told us was really disproportionate. He reacted very aggressively. When I told him to call the police, he agreed, but I was very shocked and paid to get it over with. However, I now want to warn other people!
A second time I thought I was smarter and asked to turn on the meter. The driver arrived with an app on his phone; according to him, it is the latest of the latest and that everyone works that way nowadays. I was scammed again with the amount I had to pay. For me, for this reason and many others (including the enormous queues for the tourist attractions), no more Lisbon!!

title: Rip off Lisbon
text: Where do you start ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è ripped off from airport - ripped off from town to hotel - be careful! They say don‚Äôt use √ºber but in my experience they are much more honest in the pricing - so fed up - been ripped off in restaurants- taxis - shops - wont be back to Lisbon anytime soon

title: Beware of scammers.
text: A taxi was assigned. Taxi with dark green roof. Airport Lisbon Hotel Borges Chiado (center) Upon arrival at the hotel we (2 people and luggage) had to pay no less than ‚Ç¨ 38.50. Crook.

title: To the person involved, hang your head in shame, the level of deceit you showed was incredulous.
text: Took a taxi from terminal 1 of Lisbon airport (grey with green roof) on Thursday 11th January 2024 at approx 1030 to HF Fenix Garden hotel in centre of city, approx 15 mins journey time, driver came across as nice caring sort but charged us 35 euros, only when we exited the car did my wife advise me that he turned off meter at 12 euros just before stopping, the moral of the story, challenge if you think you are being fleeced, I asked before we left airport on approximate cost to which he declined and said meter decides cost ! Subsequent conversation with hotel staff confirmed the 35 euro cost was 2.5 to 3 times what it should have been. This experience left an extremely bad taste on what was an otherwise enjoyable weekend.

title: Airport Taxi over charging tourists
text: I arrived with family on 30/12 at Lisbon airport. We took a taxi from the taxi rank to the hotel that is 5 mins away. What a mistake that was. The journey should have been less than ‚Ç¨9 (I used the fare calculator on the taxi website later to verify it). But he flashed a charge card and pointed yes to a fare that was‚Ç¨24.50 and said that‚Äôs how much it was. We didn‚Äôt quite believe it but paid it at the time and asked for a receipt and took a picture of his license plate. Later on when we contacted the taxi company on the receipt about the over charge, the company responded and said the number plate on the receipt was not the number plate in the picture so they can‚Äôt do anything about it. I have reported it to the Lisbon authorities but not sure if anyone is going to reply yet. I also couldn‚Äôt see any meters in the taxi so I should have insisted they advise the cost beforehand.

title: Be aware! Check the meter of taxi before leaving.
text: I arrived today here in lisbon. I took an airport taxi Cal√ßada do Carmo where my hotel is located. The driver used ways to locate the place, after he typed the address he drove but he didn‚Äôt use his set belt so i was worried then after around 8 mins. He said that he forgot to put on the metro so he turned it on, then he continued to drive until we reached the destination. When i checked the metro it was 7.20 euro then he said that i should add 10 euro because he forgot to turn it on before leaving the airport. Not my fault! Is it fair for 10km distance? By the way he didn‚Äôt put on his set belt the whole journey. The plate number is on the photo.

title: Negative experience
text: The taxi taken from Via del Commercio in Lisbon to the airport was a real disaster. Reckless person. He was driving talking on his cell phone...without his seatbelt on...with the seat folded forward he was trying to hide the taximeter...when we arrived at the airport he unloaded our suitcases on the pavement and took the money and left with a rush that didn't give us time to realize it... so as not to dwell on the decorum of a person... (tracksuit trousers, a tank top to show off his gym muscles. Cap with visor that not even his eyes) very bad experience (it also created a lot of anguish) I will remember it forever and I will think twice before taking a taxi in Lisbon. Unfortunately the negative reviews I had read are true...

title: Avoid taxis if at all possible. Uber instead.
text: Taxi drivers don‚Äôt seem to know their way around their own city unless of course the circuitous routes they take are a very unsubtle way of ramping up their charges. Out of 12 rides over a 10 day period, 3 by taxi and 9 by Uber, the three by taxi involved unsolicited tours of the streets of the city in 2 cases ending up at the wrong destination. All the Uber rides went without a hitch directly to the required destination often with knowledgeable and friendly drivers.

title: Be careful with large taxis that look like luxury, they are
text:
Public taxis in Lisbon, in general, are cheap and have very friendly professionals. The exception that proves the rule and with which you have to be careful. Large taxis are allowed to charge more so if you are in line at the airport to take a taxi, be careful!!!
A trip (Airport - Portugalia in Pascoal de Melo) that normally costs ‚Ç¨10 at most, they charged us ‚Ç¨30, a theft. The police who are organizing the queue at the airport do not notify you, but you should know that you can tell them that you do not want a large or luxury taxi and that you prefer to wait for another one. By the way, the taxi driver was very unfriendly and tried to hide the taximeter at all times.

title: Take any other means of transport if possible
text: From Norwegian Viva to my hotel in Baixa (Equina Urban Lodge) the driver charged 35 Euro which is more than 3 times what it should be. Unfortunately due to mobility issues and lack of planning time, I had no choice. Makes Paris taxi service look like a charity. This is 2023 wtf. Cheaper if I had paid for my daily data and used an app.

title: Beware Lisbon Portugal taxi drivers Rude, Rip-Off tourists!!!
text:
Lisbon Taxi - Cautious and beware taxi driver Rip You Off !!!

It was very shocking to me. The taxi no only without meter but also must pay cash only. It was very rude he dropped us cross street to hotel, we have to carry our own luggage and bags to hotel. I ever ride in a taxi that does not have the meter running and drop off custom not front hotel.

That's just crazy no matter what country I am in? ‚ÄúLisbon Portugal‚Äùthey can charge whatever they like.
Dishonesty and overcharge tourists.

This upset me and gave me an initial negative impression of Lisbon.
Carry on bad reputation for the city
Advices and wake up call for Lisbon city to change the rules required taxi driver quietly for licence and matter not rid off tourists then will more welcome tourists to visit this beautiful city.

title: Dishonest taxi in Lisbon, Portugal. Take Uber instead.
text:
Lisbon Taxis are overpriced, often have no meter or a shady meter and offer poor service.

I took a taxi from the cruise port in Lisbon to my hotel. The driver didn‚Äôt have a government approved meter, he overcharged me by 15‚Ç¨ on a 35‚Ç¨ fare, and dropped me off across a busy street from my hotel. This taxi ride will be my last one in Portugal.

Uber is available and honest in Lisbon, Portugal. Take Uber instead of a taxi!

title: Extortionate taxi price, get an Uber instead
text: Taxi from the cruise terminal to a hotel around 10 minutes away charged us 48 euro, ripped off, avoid!!! Get an Uber instead.

title: Nunca! Never!
text:
V√° para as Partidas do Aeroporto P1 no piso 2 "Kiss & Fly" que √© mesmo ao lado e utilize Uber!
Go to the P1 Airport Departures on floor 2 "Kiss & Fly" which is right next door and use Uber!

title: Never take a taxi in Lisbon
text:
We arrived at the airport at midnight and all Uber and Bolt cars canceled our rides and those of other people who weren't going very far
We were tired and decided to take the taxi in the official queue.
We got in the car and the meter was charging an astonishing 10 cents per second! Unbelievable!
I asked him to stop at the first bus stop so we could get off and we still paid 22.50 euros for a 2-minute ride! He kept saying that the fare had a very large adjustment the previous week... very dangerous
So I called Bolt from that place and my ride to the hotel was 6 euros‚Ä¶ if I stayed in the taxi it would be around 200 euros for sure

title: AVOID RAXIS IN LISBON AT ALL COSTS
text:
AVOID TAXIS IN LISBON
I hate generalisations, but sadly, begging mugged by taxi drivers (specially those taking you from / to the airport) seems to be the norm rather than the exception in Lisbon.
We took a taxi upon arrival at the airport to get to our hotel. The driver showed some artistry in overcharging us, no doubt the result of a repeated, perfected pattern. The taxi meter showed 12‚Ç¨ something, then he charged the extras (this is understandable, since luggage and airport transfer fees are not registered by the meter) and this added up to 24,90‚Ç¨. I insisted on paying on the spot, but he wouldn‚Äôt listen and went out of the car to take the suitcase out of the boot.
Once he entered the car again, as if repeating his previous words, he said 34,90‚Ç¨. I replied he had said 24,90‚Ç¨, and when trying to refer to what the taxi meter showed, discovered he had performed his magic again to show, now, 34,90‚Ç¨. When I confronted him he said he ‚Äúhad to‚Äù charge me for his waiting time at the airport. By then I had it very clear that I was being overcharged, so I asked for a receipt. Can you read the license number in it? Neither can I, good proof he wanted to leave no trace. Oh and he wouldn‚Äôt take cards, so I had to pay in cash.
As a result we didn‚Äôt take any other taxi in Lisbon and moved around with apps like Uber and Bolt which provided excellent service at very reasonable prices. Incidentally, a Bolt car to the airport on the day of our departure cost only 10,67‚Ç¨.
So please spare yourself a bad experience in Lisbon and look for alternatives to taxis, I wish I had read the reviews in this forum myself before our trip.

title: Lamentable
text: Black and green taxi 395, driver Miguel Neto. No counter. Picked up at the airport and arranged by the airport. Bottom line: a scam of 73 euros for a daytime Lisboa Cascais. The airport contacted disclaims all responsibility and tells us to file a complaint! The tourist office also washes its hands of it. Impossible on the invoice to have an Autos taxi Ribeiro e Rei telephone number. To believe that this is organized racketeering?

title: Bolt at Lisbon airport- what a bad expetience
text: The bolt service from the Lisbon airport is a disgrace. It only works if you doing a long trip. Shorter trips are always refused. Bolt Blane er again.

title: THIEVES! Now only UBER
text: If you need to take a taxi at the airport, take an UBER. I paid ‚Ç¨25! They put me in a huge car by myself without telling me it cost more. Thieves! The same ride with UBER ‚Ç¨5.06!

title: Total scam
text:
Do not take a taxi when leaving the airport, a taxi without a meter which charged us 27 euros for a 10 minute journey.
No meter and what's more, doesn't speak English
Very easy to scam us
We got screwed on the way out but on the way back we took the metro for 3.30 euros and with great ease.
Bad image for taxis in this city!!!!

title: Don‚Äôt do it
text: They will charge you more period. Every single one of them. Better to do Uber or just walk or just know they will charge you 5-15 more. One wanted to charge us 150 for a trip that was 20.

title: Over charged and then told I need to chase the matter with my bank.
text: They say they take extra amounts to prevent fraud on your account and that the extra charge will be refunded but if it isn't you have to contact your bank. Sounds like fraud to me. I had sufficient funds on my Bolt balance and no problem with my credit card . So why all the extra hassle..? should have taken an uber.

title: Avoid taxis in Lisbon
text: If you ever visit Lisbon you should try to avoid taxis specially if your coming from the airport. As an alternative you should use UBER. The black and green taxis reject service if is short distance, which most are, because the airport is in the city centre. If you don‚Äôt have luggage (there is extra fee per luggage) they will reject as well. They hide the taximeter and overcharge you. Unfortunately is getting worse again. Best to avoid taxis in Lisbon! #taxi #taxiservice #taxilisbon

title: Taxi fraud
text: I see that I am not the only one who paid more than the meter showed for the taxi ride from the airport to the bus station. When I arrived, the meter was quickly turned off (which showed 8.70 euros). I was then told that I had to pay 12 euros. After asking, the reason given was that I had luggage with me. It was hand luggage. After a short discussion, I paid the taxi driver because the whole thing was too stupid for me. Taxi number: 3313

title: The thief
text: We took about 6 taxis and 1 of the taxidrivers was very dishonest .it was the one when we arrived late in the evening at the airport and needed a taxi to our hotel. The taxi driver was a young pretty lady with long black hair, lot of make up and very long coloured nails, who didn't seem to be an expert and had difficulties to find the street of our hotel. During the trip she was discussing with a man on her phone. In the end when the taxi was still moving she was very impatient to make as pay: 37 Euros...more than the double of the regular price. What an unfriendly welcome to Lisbone!

title: Don't take a "official" taxi
text: Taxi charged us 33 euros for less 6 km ride from the airport. The ride took about 15 minutes. Just 1 straight road on from the airport. The meter first indicated around 7 euros. When we arrived at the hotel a 25 airport fee was added. We tried to argue but eventually conceded as we didn't won't to deal with all the negativity when just arriving in Lisbon.

title: Scammers
text: Arrived at the airport and went to the hotel. Should have cost around ‚Ç¨17 according to prior enquiry at the hotel. 2 people, 1 large suitcase and 1 piece of hand luggage. The car taxi directed us to a van taxi on the grounds that it had been standing for a while. When we left the airport, the meter was on but it wasn't running. It said ‚Ç¨3.35 the whole time. When we asked, we were told it would cost ‚Ç¨32 because it was a van. Exact prices weren't posted. Especially since the taxi driver suddenly couldn't speak any English or Spanish. At the Mercure Hotel, I went to reception without paying. The friendly employee came out with me straight away. And there was a bit of back and forth. I offered him ‚Ç¨25 or the police, because he was a rip-off! He accepted. The hotel employee said that a guest had called the police a few days previously. I can't recommend Taxi Lisboa and we haven't and won't use it. So do Uber or Bolt!

title: we will not return
text: I speak as a traveler, not as a tourist. The best: the climate and the friendliness of the vast majority, which make you feel at home. The worst: we will not return because they have made everything very expensive, there are too many people everywhere and some taxi drivers are frauds. The taxi is cheap in Lisbon, but be careful with those who cover the taximeter, manipulate the flag drop and refuse to give you a receipt. For all this, for trying to make quick and easy money, tourism will end up falling in the area. We are travelers, we are foreigners, but we are not imbeciles.

title: Taxi Scam Lisbon Airport
text:
BEWARE of taxis at Lisbon Airport. We were told afterwards that they were known to rip off the tourists.
We paid 48 euros from airport to old town. We found out this was over 3 times what it should have cost.
Our hotel organised taxi back to airport and the driver was lovely. He also said it was well known to be dishonest. He advised going through airport to departure side which involves crossing airport but you stand a chance of getting a honest driver.

title: Esperienza molto negativa
text: Torner√≤ sicuramente a Lisbona, ma non prender√≤ mai pi√π uno di questi taxi. Purtroppo abbiamo trovato un tassista disonesto che ci ha chiesto pi√π del dovuto. Abbiamo pagato perch√© avevamo molta fretta. Questi soggetti che gettano ombre sulla categoria, si dovrebbero ricordare che nell'era della tecnologia le cattive notizie si diffondono alla velocit√† della luce! Un controllo non guasterebbe.

title: Plus jamais
text:
Arnaque, un conseil ne prenez jamais un taxi √† Lisbonne. De l‚Äôa√©roport au m√©tro alemeda 24,5 euros. Je pensais que c‚Äô√©tait les prix fixes a√©roport-centre-ville comme dans beaucoup de pays. Un monsieur d‚Äôun certain √¢ge comme chauffeur, comme quoi l‚Äôhabit ne fait pas le moine! Le reste du s√©jour j‚Äôai pris Uber et j‚Äôai toujours √©t√© satisfaite. A mon d√©part j‚Äôai fait alemeda-aeroport j‚Äôai pay√© 5,55 euros pourboire inclus.
Voil√†, un homme averti en vaut 2!

title: Frightening experience
text: Drove erraticly.Mafe phone calls while driving.Couldnt find ,4 pts Shearton hotel.Rang two people for directions.Stopped in middle of road.Asked me to sit in front to use my Google map.A frightening exoerience

title: Mai pi√π taxi a Lisbona solo uber
text: Transfer da aereoporto di Lisbona a cascais con uber 28 euro autista disponibile,transfer inverso 60 euro con taxi. Da notare il tassametro spento e l'autista che guarda il cell mentre guida. Solo pagamento contanti e nessuna ricevuta. Purtroppo non parlando portoghese e avendo gi√† aperto il gate non ho potuto contestare ma se ritorno a Lisbona mai pi√π chiamer√≤ un taxi

title: No a good experience
text: Not pleased with this taxi service or driver. Hotel estimated a ‚Ç¨8 trip from Martim Moniz Square to the cruise port but the driver charged ‚Ç¨15. The driver spoke ZERO English and did not know where to go once he got to the terminal. If you take a cab to the cruise terminal have someone who is bilingual and speaks Portuguese negotiate the price and explain where you are going.

title: Terrible experience
text: We used Lisboa Taxi to get from the airport to the old town and the driver told us he can‚Äôt drop us off at the address provided. He stopped 1km away and we had to walk with luggages down and up the hill after 17 hours of flight üòï. On our way to the rented place we saw quite a few taxis on the narrow roads. That was so unprofessional and a terrible experience for us!

title: De taxirit op de heenweg bijna 3x zo duur als op de terugweg.
text:
Van 16 tm 20 Februari heb ik een stedentrip naar Lissabon gemaakt, toen ik geland was pakte ik een zwart/groene taxi bij de aankomst ik had een taxirit van 6,5 kilometer van de aankomst naar het 3K hotel en ik moest ‚Ç¨24,- betalen, toen ik vanmorgen een taxi terug pakte van het 3K hotel naar terminal 2 moest ik maar ‚Ç¨8,40 betalen. Dus op de heenweg moest ik ruim ‚Ç¨15,5 meer betalen, dat vind ik toch flinke oplichting!
Bij aankomst had ik geen flouw idee wat een gemiddelde taxi kost en tuurlijk kan het zijn dat ze avond tarief vragen, maar 's avonds om 21.00 uur is het ook een stuk minder druk als op een maandagmiddag rond 13.00 uur.

title: Da evitare
text:
Meglio 100 volte Uberto o botte, e comunque i servizi pubblici sono eccellenti sempre preferibili.
Evitarli √® meglio ,√® una categoria economica in estinzione che tende all imbroglio x sopravvivere.

title: Buon servizio ma...
text: Eravamo un gruppo di 14 persone per cui ci siamo divisi in 4 taxi...autista giovane e simpatico,ci ha chiesto se era la prima volta che venivamo a Lisbona e ci ha fatto un miniracconto delle vie principali...all'arrivo in hotel (6 km circa)la sorpresa:26,40 euro(con 3.60 euro per i bagagli...ormai fatta abbiamo pagato senza obiettare ma,sentiti poi gli altri che hanno usufruito dei taxi,c'√® chi ha pagato 23,ma anche chi 11...consiglio:informarsi prima di quanto potrebbe costare la corsa,non dire che √® la prima volta che si √® in citt√† e controllare bene il tassametro (a volte nascosto o girato non verso i clienti).

title: Me estaf√≥, me insult√≥ y hasta me empuj√≥ cuando vio que le estaba sacando una foto a su matr√≠cula
text:
Tuve un retraso en un vuelo y me vi obligado a pasar la noche en Lisboa. La compa√±√≠a a√©rea nos aloj√≥ en un hotel cercano al aeropuerto que no se hallaba a m√°s de 5 minutos en coche (nos indic√≥ que el precio del trayecto deb√≠a hallarse entre los 5 y 7 euros). Comprob√© m√°s tarde por UBER que el trayecto costaba 4.5 euros. El precio era lo de menos porque me lo pagar√≠a la compa√±√≠a a√©rea presentando factura. La factura que me entreg√≥ el taxista no inclu√≠a ni sus datos ni nada, solamente que me hab√≠a cobrado 12.3 euros, hecho que me hace dudar mucho de la legalidad de esa factura, cuando adem√°s puso fecha el d√≠a 7 de enero cuando los hechos sucedieron el 8 de enero de madrugada. Mi duda es si el taxista no estaba permitido que trabajara ese d√≠a y a√∫n as√≠ lo estaba haciendo. Porque no entiendo su negativa a poner la fecha verdadera y rellenar correctamente la factura como hizo el taxista que me llev√≥ al aeropuerto al d√≠a siguiente.

Cuando le dije que cumplimentara los datos correspondientes al taxi, empez√≥ a ponerse violento y grosero. Cuando vio que saqu√© el m√≥vil para fotografiar la matr√≠cula empez√≥ a insultarme e incluso me dio un empuj√≥n.

Pens√© denunciarlo, pero me quedaban 4 horas para descansar antes de volver al aeropuerto y, por eso, decid√≠ continuar mi viaje (de eso es de lo que se aprovechan).

Dado que no s√© si cual es la Ley de Protecci√≥n de Datos en Portugal (si es que existe), adjunto la foto que le saqu√© al taxi despu√©s de que el taxista saliera del mismo a empujarme, omitiendo el √∫ltimo d√≠gito de la matr√≠cula (74¬∑RH¬∑3*) . El taxista era una persona de 1 metro 70-75 cent√≠mentros, corpulento y entrado en carnes, pelo blanco y entre 40 y 50 a√±os. Aunque para eso de la edad soy muy malo y adem√°s la noche era cerrada. Si os encontr√°is alg√∫n taxista con esa descripci√≥n en un Dacia y la matr√≠cula que os indico, tened mucho cuidado.

Mi consejo es que todo el que vaya a Lisboa utilice UBER para evitar estas situaciones. El mayor enemigo del taxi son los propios taxistas

Fecha de la experiencia: enero de 2023

title: Servicio de taxi
text: Mi experiencia cuando sub√≠ al taxi es que no tenia tax√≠metro, la cual me sorprendi√≥, me cobro 25‚Ç¨ desde el aeropuerto hasta el hotel, me dijo que le diera 30‚Ç¨ y dijimos que no, y le dimos 1,50 de propina encima, y cu√°l es mi sorpresa que el d√≠a que me voy, el hotel me pide un taxi para ir al aeropuerto y me cobro 13,50‚Ç¨, estando encima 20 minutos en un atasco.

title: Not so tradional!
text:
The boat was not comfortable. After 40 min seated, my back was already hurting.
They announce it as a tradicional Tagus boat, but after some research, I come to the conclusion that there is nothing traditional on that! It's just an old wood fishing boat painted with different colours! Next time I will take a different option for sure!

title: Could be better
text: NOTHING NICE. Our time was always controlled, there were almost no good photos. It was always let's go, let's go, we have to go, as if we weren't going to pay anything extra if time passed. Could be better? Yes you could. But unfortunately the person on the day must have been in a bad mood.

title: bull
text: The boat was broken and did not get to go and have not been reburst for the sunset we never got to see very mad about it . will not use trip adviser again

title: Buyer Beware
text:
Buyer Beware !! They had clearly OVERSOLD this cruise. They put 6 people in seated positions at the back of the sailboat, and then asked our group of six to huddle on the mat on the front of the sailboat‚Ä¶.no seats, no backrests, NOTHING to hold onto.

At one point, the winds were strong enough that the sailboat listed far enough as to have us start to slide towards the edge of going overboard. We screamed. It was frightening. We asked to change places with the six in the back, but to no avail. They finally agreed to make room for three of us to move to the back.

It was pure negligence on their part. And it was only by the grace of God that this did not end with a tragedy.

title: Awful service
text:
Extremely dissatisfied with the lack of communication regarding this. We made the trip to the area well in advance as no one rang to tell us that due to adverse weather it was unlikely to go ahead. We had to telephone them they did not tell us and were told 10 mins before that it was cancelled. We had to wait in the area for 2 hours to get an Uber back to our hotel and had we known we could have spent the afternoon doing other things. A refund does not make up for that lost time
It was a special anniversary trip and it ruined the day

title: Worst Cooking Class ever! Frozen cod from Costco like box store. Boiled potatoes. No vegetables. Rice pudding. Cheap!!
text: The worst cooking class! Pour quality of food. One person stirred milk for an hour. Another cut up garlic. Ridiculous!!

title: THEY CANCELED THE TASTING
text:
My reservation was canceled the night before the appointment.
Four days later I'm still waiting for a refund.

title: Poor Taxi Tour FRA Lisbon Airport to Hotel
text: We booked EN taxi in advance for 73‚Ç¨ with pickup at Lisbon airport and drive to the hotel. That taxi driver treated us very badly, he smashed the car door like we were a criminal. He answered very rude. It was the first time we traveled to Lisbon and it was also the last time. We will never go there again. Bad taxi ride that ruined it all.

title: Terrible experience!!!!
text: To start to get to T2 you have to use the shuttle and there is nowhere DA this thing so I walked to T2 and there is no sidewalk along the road so people are forced to use the shuttle. Once we get there we understand nothing about how to get to the controls because of the little order inside. Finally once you get to the gates if you want to charge your phone there is only one column where you can insert your charger but half of the sockets do not work and we all find ourselves crowded there to try to charge your phone. I will be used too well with Fiumicino airport...

title: Horrible! No organization!
text:
Very bad organisation and bad experience at Lisbon airport.
Very few seats seated. People are forced to sit on the floor to wait. This is not normal!!!

title: Lisbon Terminal 2 ‚Äì and Lisbon in General ‚Äì Deeply Disappointing
text:
Absolutely awful experience at Lisbon Airport Terminal 2. The terminal was overcrowded, chaotic, and completely disorganized. There were barely any seats available, and the food options were shockingly overpriced for the quality offered. Staff were unhelpful and, frankly, rude.

Sadly, this attitude wasn‚Äôt limited to the airport. During my entire stay in Lisbon, I encountered consistent rudeness from people across the city ‚Äì from taxi drivers to shop staff, restaurants, and even locals on the street. I‚Äôve never experienced such widespread hostility in one place. It‚Äôs incredibly disheartening in a country known for its beautiful scenery and rich history.

It often felt like every corner was another opportunity to be overcharged or treated poorly ‚Äì a sense of being taken advantage of rather than welcomed. It left me with the impression that tourists are seen more as targets than guests.

Lisbon is undeniably a beautiful place, but the experience as a visitor was so unpleasant that I would never return. I truly hope others think twice before spending their money here, as hospitality and basic courtesy seem to be sorely lacking.

title: I will never visit Lisbon again because of this airport
text: I will never visit lisbon again because of this airport. When I landed there was a scammer outside trying to drive us to lisbon, he looked very strange. When I asked my taxi driver he said that if we went with him we would have been robbed. But the worst was when going home. There's way too many people for the size of this airport. There is very little to eat or buy. Nothing is where it should be as in other aiports. The signs are bad. It's very hot and sweaty and noisy. There's absolutely nothing good about this airport at all.

title: Terrible experience!
text: Lisbon airport is the worst i have ever experienced and that has been a lot around the world. So unorganised with very long queues to get through passport control leading to so many people missing their flights. Staff uninterested in helping you make your flight so give yourself 3 hours. Very sad as country and people are amazing just the airport let's then down. Fortunately we didn't have small children unlike some of the poor families stuck in queues the length of the terminal.

title: Are we humans?
text:
WORST airport experience, when leaving Lisbon (21/6-2025) to go back home with connecting flights!

Though there was TV-screens that show where you need to go for bagage-check in, it only showed the time and not which desk to go to. Me and my mother went to one desk which turned out to be the wrong one. We had to go to another desk which was about 2-3 minutes away, BUT my mother then felt a lot of pain in her knee and couldn't walk anymore and needed assistance. I then had to get help to find a wheelchair and a person (staff) to help me push my mother and our 2 big suitcases to the other desk. I was left searching after a wheelchair somewhere in the airport, because the staff said that they haven't got a specific place where you can get a wheelchair. I found one eventually, but then it was a big problem finding a person to help me push my mother in the wheelchair so that I could push our bags to the other desk. The staff ("My way" and others on the airport) were incredible unhelpful and either didn't want to understand the problem or didn't feel like it was a problem. Here I also have to say that if you leave your suitcases unattended you risk paying a fine of 600‚Ç¨. Since NO ONE seemed to care to help me and my mother, I had to push my mother's wheelchair while she held on to our suitcases at the same time and push everything to the other desk. No human decency to be found. When we went to the other desk we saw a huge que with probably 100 passengers waiting in line. While waiting in the que, from nowhere a girl (staff member that I had spoken to earlier) approached us and said that we could pass the que due to that we had special needs (wheelchair). When we got to the desk the woman there asked us to step aside and wait. She then asked us if we had booked assistance (they say to book it 48h before travelling). We said that we hadn't because my mother's knee stopped working AT THE AIRPORT.
Though the woman had a quite bad attitude (as well as the majority of the other staff members I had talked to) she finally helped us. She called the assistant team and they said that they could help us in about 45 min-1h. We emphasized that we needed to get help before our flight was leaving. We checked-in the suitcases with her help and then went to the assistance team area in the airport, to wait for assistance. After about 30 minutes we finally got assistance to the gate (and plane).

I give 1 star for a security guard at the customs service for showing that he really wanted to help me but couldn't leave his position, the girl that said that we could skip the line, the woman at the desk (though she was skeptical) and the people that assisted my mother to the plane.

When we arrived to Lisbon there weren't any problems, the problem was when we were leaving.

To the staff: If you don't like to help people don't work in service. You made an already stressful situation even worse.

The people in Lisbon were very kind, so it's a shame that the staff was awful at the airport.

title: THE POOR ORGANIZATION OF LISBON AIRPORT ALMOST LEFT ME WITHOUT VACATION TO HONDURAS AND IRRITATED ALL MY YOUNG CHILDREN HUNGER
text: The other day I was going to Tegucigalpa with my 13 little children and they almost got a bummer because of the poor organization of the airport. We were about 45 minutes locked in a bus that moved like 4 meters every 5 minutes we entered 16 minutes late to the flight we had and the flight attendant told us that one more minute and the plane took off üõ©Ô∏èüõ©Ô∏èüõ©Ô∏è. We wanted to buy a quick ham sandwich but it was not possible and my little children gave me the bar on the flight because they were hungry. I'm not going to visit Lisbon because I don't want to set foot in that airport again. Go well in advance and caution through that airport because it will fail at the most opportune time to annoy you travel, flight or vacation üèûÔ∏èüèïÔ∏èüèûÔ∏èüèïÔ∏è.

title: Crappie airport
text: The worst airport i ever experienced. Literally always planes leave late always some kind of problems with the airport landing and taking off. Some areas of the airport doesn't have airconditioner. No signs to point you where you can find certain things. Even if you find some help they are clueless. So if you go through lisbon make sure you have 4 hours at least otherwise you screwed.

title: Worst Airport Experience
text: Simply the worst airport experience in over 40 years of travelling. No signage or wayfinding, rude and unhelpful staff and a queue for passport control so long that we only just made our flight.

title: 2.5 hours to clear passport control
text:
It took us 2.5 hours to clear passport control with U.K passports . Is this a Brexit benefit?
I‚Äôve been travelling a long time and this was the longest wait ever. I won‚Äôt be coming back.

title: Terminal 2 is a disgrace
text:
Terminal 2 from Lisbon Airport is the worst I have ever been to.
You get to Terminal 1 and you have no signs of how to get to Terminal 2. You eventually find out from someone by asking around that there's a shuttle bus. You get there and you have to hurry and get a seat before they run out. There are far too few seats and charging stations.
Food and drink is pretty limited. I would say that the airport terminal is a real disgrace.

title: Avoid Lisbon airport
text:
Lisbon airport is so badly designed and with long walks it‚Äôs just a total mess. It‚Äôs hard to know where to start. We left an iPad on the plane and were told to go to lost and found.. 40
Minutes later (you walk everywhere in Lisbon airport) we arrived to a total scrum and chaotic situation trying to reclaim it. Gave up and left

title: Lisbon Airport Taxi Rip-Offs
text: BEWARE of taxis at Lisbon airport. Long queues and then total SCAMS. Taxis are out to rip off tourists, charging 3x the normal fares usually. Taxi driver prey on tired tourists (after a long flight and then a long queue) and once you get into the taxi, they drive off quickly and you are trapped. Ubers costs around EUR 10 and even if surge about EUR 14. We were charged EUR 33. Difficult to argue. From then onwards, we only used UBER. Our trip from the hotel to the airport on UBER costs EUR 9.90.

title: Lisbon airport queues are ridiculous!
text: Avoid Lisbon airport until they sort out the queues at passport control. The wait on arrival for non-EU passports was an hour and 50 minutes, almost as long as the flight. In comparison, coming back to Manchester took 32 minutes from landing to exiting Terminal 1, and that included waiting for hold baggage.

title: Don‚Äôt use Sutransfers Lisbon for your airport transfers, very poor.
text:
We booked return transfers from Lisbon Airport to Jupiter Hotel in Lisbon we paid in advance about 3 months in advance around ¬£45 pounds. The transfers were via SUNTRANSFERS - Lisbon ( DO NOT USE this company) , Our plane landed on time.
However it took nearly 2 hours to get through Lisbon Passport Control (Diabolical)
and then 30 minutes to find our Suitcase (cases were scattered all over). Don‚Äôt go to Portugal Lisbon the airport is discriminating against British tourists it took all the brits 2 hours to get through, Dutch people were getting through within 15 minutes!! It‚Äôs time we treated EU travellers how they treat us!
So having finally got through passport control, surprise surprise No Taxi was there,
I had to phone Sun Transfers and they said he waited nearly an hour. In passport control we had no phone signal whilst in there, I phoned when we got through and told them what had happened, they said it would be 35 euros to send a taxi, I told them to forget it and cancelled our return with them and got a refund of ¬£18!
We got an UBER from the airport to Jupiter Hotel, it cost us 10 euros.
Sun Transfers are allegedly looking into this event?? They will let know the outcome after there investigation and will email me there outcome within 20 days??
What a joke. So the answer is Don‚Äôt use SUNTRANSFERS in Lisbon for your Transfers to your hotel or to where you are going. Use UBER more reliable and half the price!!
Better still Avoid Lisbon as their Passport control is a disgrace.

title: Worst experience
text: The worst airport I've seen in terms of departure. No indication to find the check-in machines. Very few ticket offices open compared to the number of travellers. We barely had time to get to the gate. Very nice staff.

title: Glad to be through
text: Shockingly unfriendly, incompetent police at passport control. You are restrained by a policeman to check that the daughter is not travelling without parents, sent away by an uninvolved person and shouted at when you try to explain that your colleague has my passport and has demanded that I stop there. Airport quite chaotic.

title: Poor Communication
text: Very poor communication. Flight delayed but made not effort to inform us about it! Not great, made me not want to fly from here again!

title: Don‚Äôt fly through here
text: Last flight of the day is severely delayed BUT you can‚Äôt enter the terminal more than 3 hours before departure. Outside the terminal there are only a few sitting spots, already packed without the 120 delayed passengers, the toilets aren‚Äôt approachable and the ventilation emits intolerable noise.

title: Total chaos!
text:
Total chaos met us in Lisbon after flight from Rio de Janeiro. With more than 10 transatlantic flights arriving within an hour early Monday morning chaos was total. With only 3 operating passport counters and more than thousand passengers it meant no chance to reach our connection without jumping the ques. We had more than two hours connecting time and it took us short of an hour to go by bus to the terminal.
Also boarding time was set 50 min before departure ‚Ä¶ in other words more or less no time for passport control. Avoid this unorganized airport

title: City beautiful - airport and taxis underground
text: Catastrophic airport! Totally crowded, hardly any seats and the taxi driver has buttoned us for 7 km to our hotel 45 euros. Lisbon could learn from Rome, where it is pointed out in front of the taxi rank how much a journey can cost at most!

title: Airport totally inadequate.
text: Inadequate airport for a large influx of tourists. Third World Terminal 2. Dirty, small, almost zero services, for checking into a huge place without any service, of an unheard-of squalor. To be avoided.

title: Lisbon airport taxi trick! Go uber
text:
The taxi are literally refusing you because they want cash only!
Wonder why????
Also check they put the meter to avoid being scammed with the imaginary tarif they decide depending on the client .

title: Lisbon Airport is a nightmare
text: While the airport is comfortable, the transfer area is horrendous and insufferable. I‚Äôll fly thru Istanbul in the future.

title: Airport Lisbon terminal 2
text:
More than none... Many people no seat to wait... idem comment of 2017... no improvement... inadmissible we are livestock for these companies and this airport üò°
And I haven‚Äôt seen the toilet yet!

title: Berck berck
text: The worst airport I've ever seen! Terminal 2 is for low costs so it doesn't matter if you treat passengers like cattle! However, they don't forget to set up (shabby by the way) shops to pump even more money. Staff recruited on 'jefaislageule.com' or 'jaimfairchier.com, of your choice! In short, to flee absolutely!!!!

title: OMG! Absolute Nightmare!
text: OMG! Will never return to Lisbon again! Not until they get a new airport or more staff! Over an hour in the arrival queue and not even half way to the passport check in desk...Looking like at least another hour!!!! Not enough desks to cope with the amount of arrivals. Totally unorganized and tops the list of bad airports for the fifty so countries I have visited so far in my travels!.....Least the staff could do is offer water! Nightmare! Go elsewhere!

title: One of the poorest airports ever
text:
Of all the airports in the world I have flown from....Lisbon Airport terminal 2.....is without doubt the worst airport I have ever had to experience.

The airport is totally disorganised in every way.....the terminal has very limited seating and is packed with people sitting all over the floor.

I find it hard to believe this airport is actually in Europe as the standards and help from staff in this so called airport non existent.

Avoid this disaster zone at all costs.

title: Unpleasant experience at the Lisbon Airport
text:
We are a family with a layover at Lisbon Airport, traveling onward with a connecting flight. This has been the worst experience ever. When going through security, we encountered two female security guards shouting at passengers in a way that is completely unacceptable. It is a clear lack of respect. We were treated like soldiers in a war zone. They were speaking Portuguese, shouting "vai vai vai" and "hey hey hey hey" while angrily throwing our belongings around.

I speak Portuguese, but my family does not. However, we were afraid to respond for fear of the consequences. It was embarrassing, and I have never experienced anything like it. My family was in shock as well. We have no desire to fly through Lisbon as long as this kind of treatment persists.

Passengers are customers, traveling for leisure and paying to have good experiences‚Äînot to be treated as if they are in a prison camp. We sincerely hope something is done about their poor attitude and angry behavior, which has no place in an airport. There was absolutely no good service at all.

title: FAULTY TOWERS OF AN AIRPORT.SHAME ON PORTUGAL.
text:
Disgraceful, a horrible experience to use this ‚Äúairport‚Äù.
Shame on Portugal to treat its tourists with a terrible exit after spending a fortune within its country. A complete and utter shambles from front door to the plane door.
I will absolutely avoid going to Portugal and using this dump ever again.
FAULTY TOWERS OF AIRPORTS.
WORST AIRPORT EVER.

title: Terrible airport experience. Extremely long queues. Need more than 3 hrs if departing from here
text: Terrible airport experience. Passport control was so long we nearly missed our flight. Gate time info on screen was wrong. Very bad experience at Lisbon airport.

title: Worst airport in the world
text: The worst airport in the world and I've been to third world countries. Rude staff, passport control 2 hours on arrival, 1 for on departure but, it states on the information board,17 minutes to gate. We told the staff of our dilemma and they weren't interested, happy for me and my grandson to miss our flight, we got to the front without help from any of the staff. Sadly great city but, will never come here again

title: A disgrace
text:
Robbery prices without a gun, half a litre of hot water 4.50 euros, coffee 3 euros, souvenirs from 25 euros ... an absolute disgust for a bad service.
If I could leave less than one star I would.

title: You will be sorry if you fly to/from Lisbon Airport
text: Worst airport experience ever. Will never fly to Portugal again if this is how they think their tourists, which are a primary revenue source for the country, should be treated. Ridiculously long lines for passport control cause people to miss their flights even though they've arrived three hours ahead of schedule. The question is, why don't they check the passport at the time of security? A complete mess and no thank you. My family and I will go somewhere else.

title: Bad.
text: Bad terminal, people sitting on the floor for lack of chairs. If you are unable to accommodate passengers, an obvious solution is not to have so many flights. The airport does not meet the demand. Do not go hungry or thirsty, for you will not even find a place to sit down and eat. Worst terminal in Europe

title: Worst airport in the world
text: Worst airport ever been to. Not enough seats and passport checking catches you out as you have to go through just prior to going through to the gate with many passengers missing their flights due to queueing.

title: The worst of the worst
text: Worst of all: no seats, endless queues for check-in, security, unkind staff, a complete fiasco in some kind of cattle shed. Lucky we didn't miss our flight!

title: Bad airport to come when issues occur
text: Awful airport and services. Airport system was down on 10th September 2024 around 2pm and no organisation, no communication and staffs are seem to be clueless, don't care or not bother to help. Also staffs don't speak international language "ENGLISH" so is hard to communicate with. The queue is so long and people missing their flight due to system down and they not even send out extra staff to deal with problem at the check-out gate. Well we were there and not sure if we want to go back to Lisbon in the future.

title: Long queues and chaos.
text:
Lisbon airport is the worst most disorganised airport I‚Äôve travelled from.
I arrived 3 hours before departure to a very very long check in queue when I eventually arrived at passport control the flight was boarding the e gates didn‚Äôt work there was no staff to ask for assistance.
There was another very long queue at manned passport control I had to squeeze to the front and eventually got through and had to run to the gate and luckily boarded the aircraft unlike some poor passengers who missed their flight shocking.

title: Lisbon airport T2 is the worst place in the world. Cattle for slaughter are treated more humanely!
text: Lisbon airport terminal 2 is the worst I have ever travelled from. Filthy, no seating, under-dimensioned food and shopping. Rude and incompetent staff- the agressive woman at the food counter pressed all the buttons for choices on the card machine and told me "this is Portugal" when I complained. We waited over 2 hours to check in, and then sat 2 hours on the plane because of a "data" problem. Th captain informed us that he had no information on our take-off time and there was no-one to talk to when he went down to the tarmac to find out what was happening. At the same time, planes were taking off with departure times after ours- selective data trouble I guess.That could have something to do with the incompetence of the check-in woman. We had a great holiday in Porto, this experience was so bad that I will avoid Portugal at all costs in the future.

title: Worst airport in the world
text: Absolute disgrace. Hundreds of people crammed into a metal shed with very few seats and even fewer facilities. No organisation to any queues, only seemed to be one person slowly checking passports, other passengers getting agitated, frustrated and pushing through. Deeply unpleasant place and potentially dangerous.

title: Horrible terminal
text: Terminal 2 is too small. No seats, overcrowded, nothing is functional and there's not enough space for everyone. It just sucks!

title: A real tragedy!
text:
Terminal 2 of Lisbon airport is the worst in Europe.
There are too many flights and the terminal is not capable to host so many people. People sitting and eating on the floor, not enough space for the people in the queue at the gate.
A pure disgrace

title: Dangerous
text:
I have never experienced such a dreadful airport ,Terminal 2 is like walking into a detention centre or a prison.
I do worry that some serious accidents are going to take place in departures. Not enough seating available, not enough food centres ,no enough toilet facilities. The entire place is dirty. Tired people sitting on the ground,on the stairs ,everywhere. This is meant to be an EU member .I will NOT be returning to Lisbon and I really could not advise anyone to visit ,as terminal 2 is dangerous.

title: A guide to getting out unscathed; it is not a joke.
text:
Go with just enough time, not a minute more than is reasonable. I would recommend that you use the metro; no other transportation, no taxi, no Uber, no bagpipes. Go to Aeroporto, Linea Bermella. Use the last euros on the card rechargeable (Explorer). Exit at T1 and walk to the bus (yellow) located on the upper level, without entering the airport terminal lobby, along the sidewalk and outside stairs. This bus, which leaves every ten minutes , takes you free to T2 from where low-cost airlines (Volotea, Vueling, Ryanair etc.) depart (unless you travel on official TAP, IBERIA, etc. lines).
Consider yourself dead.
The waiting and check-in ships (?) are spartan, third world and overwhelming. The shorter the time you can stay in them, the better. You will leave on foot (at least we) to the plane passing through warehouses, passageways and storage rooms. The runway , and take-off.
Security control is not easy either; tapes, trays and hubbub galore. I don't understand that low-cost travel entails this regrettable treatment. Nor does it understand that Lisbon maintains this terminal.

title: Terrible airport
text: This is the worst, most unorganized airport I‚Äôve even been to. If you are flying TAP, give yourself about two hours more than you‚Äôd think you need.

title: Airport well located to reach the center by public transport.
text:
Definitely don't take a taxi, very unfriendly and do not adhere to prices.
Airport is well located to take the metro, bus and train.
Airport staff very unfriendly.

title: Worse airport terminal ever visited. Avoid it if you can
text: I thought this was a temporary brunch of the Lisbon airport as it looks like more a camping site that an airport. How this is even allowed? I visited Lisbon many times and thankfully I‚Äôve never experienced terminal 2 before even traveling with Ryanair. What is going on here?? There are very very few facilities, the food is terrible , there aren‚Äôt seats for the people even if there is clearly the space! And can you charge 9 euro for a baguette with fake mozzarella and tomato also cold??? I‚Äôm speechless and I would 100% avoid to choose an airline which flights to and from this horrible place.

title: Worst Airport Experience Ever.
text: Totally overcrowded, nowhere to sit in the hall while waiting for a boarding card. Very rude security woman. This airport is too small to handle the number of passengers. I will never visit it again.

title: A horrible night in Lisbon Airport
text:
Because of ongoing airport strikes, my flight was routed via Lisbon. Despite the fact that there were a great number of people in the airport, everything shuts down at 11pm!! Lounges close, elevators are turned off, escalators are turned off, cafes close, and although check in starts at 3am, it is not possible to go through security until after 3,30am.
I have travelled a lot, but this was one of my worst experiences ever!!
TIP....make sure you don't have to spend time in Lisbon Airport after 11pm!!!

title: Scam taxi at Lisbon Airport
text: Please be aware when you come out of arrivals. That there are scammers operating. We just arrived, myself and my daughter. It had been an early flight and we were both very tired. A guy approached us and asked if we needed a taxi. We said yes. He took us to a car waiting with a driver. We didn‚Äôt even have time to ask how much before he was driving off. It was a 20 minute journey and he charged us 150 euros. Yes I know we should have refused to pay but 2 women in a foreign country they saw us coming!!! I‚Äôm posting this as I don‚Äôt want anyone else to be scammed by these people. If someone approaches you just as you have arrived and asks the same say no.

title: A long queue (3 hours) but everything was translated into English.
text: After standing in a queue at the airport for three hours, we had to wait another half an hour to collect our bags. It was helpful that all the information was translated into English.

title: Most miserable place on earth
text:
The rudest most horrendous security staff on earth.
They confiscated a face cream that was cleared in London on the way in.
When we came back the staff were shouty, throwing belongings around.
This is truly a backwater staffed by people without social skills.
The cafes are staffed by miserable unfriendly servers.
Avoid if you can

title: 35 minutes of waiting for a failed connection police check!
text: Failed connection to Lyon following more than 35 minutes of waiting at police checks while we arrived from Dakar by TAP 20 minutes late and we left for Lyon with the same company which did not deign to wait 5 min the many

title: DO NOT USE HOPPA TRANSFERS EVER !!
text:
TERRIBLE service by HOPPA transfers [ SMALLER VAN and no HELP ]

1. Despite their confirmation email stating 6 people , 6 large suitcases and 6 hold on bags , the van could not fit 3 cabin hold on bags
2. Driver refused to put them on the floor on front seat area which was empty.
3. Driver had an attitude from the start that we could not even talk to him as he knew best. He was moody and unapproachable.
4.He orders another car which we had to pay . He then says CASH ONLY . I have just landed and had no time to withdraw enough euros cash for 6 people.
5. They came 40 mins later !!
6. They gave no receipt !!
7. I was reassured it will be sent to my email but nothing turned up at all even 5 months down the line.
8. NO PHONE NUMBERS on the original confirmation email from Hoppa is answered
9. I immediately emailed Hoppa as no numbers are answered stating our experience at the airport and all i received was same attitude from a person answering the emails with say about 15 emails going back and forth with different excuses and different reasons in each email extending over a period of 2 months refusing to help or acknowledge that a smaller van turned up , no help at the airport, had to pay CASH ONLY at the airport , NO RECEIPT provided + promises of it sent on email NEVER TURNED UP !! , NO EXPLANATION why we had to pay CASH ONLY and why we were LIED to that receipt will be provided via email that NEVER CAME .

HOPPA took no responsibility , provided no apology or sympathy to customers who had paid for their service which was never provided and then to TOP IT UP , they had a non sympathic person emailing constantly with with different excuses and reasons on each separate email instead of looking at how to improve a service to a customer who is clearly saying something has gone a miss.

My friend who used their services in Hongkong last year had similar issue with HOPPA . A smaller van turned up for them too !!!
CLEARLY they have an issue and has refused to listen.

title: Awful T2 L
text:
Nobody on the passport desks while tge queue grows and grows.
Of course automatic passport control system not working.
Have never seen anything like this.

title: Tried to book transfer with a folding mobility scooter
text:
I contacted Ziptransfers for a private transfer from Lisbon Airport to central Lisbon for Four adults 4 medium size pieces of luggage + hand luggage also a FOLDING Mobility scooter. Their reply was somewhat confusing as they said that they could not accommodate non foldable mobility scooters or wheelchairs. My request clearly stated FOLDING. I re mailed them to explain however to no avail
I am disappointed as I chose Zip transfers as they were top of the Google list and this was to be my first trip abroad with my folding scooter

title: Terminal experience like kettle
text: Terminal 2 is very bad. Sanitair before checkin is outside in an external temporary mobile toilet home next to the garbage bins. After getting through safety a way to small waiting area. But wait for the end, after the gate-number is known get in a line to enter the kettle area. Before entering the plane you have to get into glass separated lines like kettle to wait for the walk to the plane. Really long wait before entering the plane. Horrible experience, even for a low budget terminal.

title: No show!
text: Confirmation good, day prior Driver communication good however, on the day of transfer the Driver never showed up or was possibly late and we had to obtain alternative transport. We called and message the Driver with no reply until 18 minutes after our booked transfer time. No refund issued!

title: The Nightmare Airport
text: Don‚Äôt ever travel here. The system here is inefficient staff is rude. Place is dirty. You‚Äôre not missing out on anything. Do not come here. It‚Äôs a nightmare

title: Lisbon Airport Taxi drivers can ruin your day
text: We arrived at Lisbon airport late in the evening and decided to take a Taxi to the hotel.Unfortunately it didn't go well.The driver was very aggressive from start.As soon as I opened my mouth to tell him the address, he shouted at me that he can't talk as he had first to get out of the airport area.I was a bit in a shock as I didn't understand what provoked the anger.I kept quiet until he stopped the car, then I tried again.He shouted at me which Lisbon we wanted to go to " the south? the North?".I showed him the written address of the place, but he totally lost it and kept on shouting we should speak portugese before coming. He then continued driving for a bit and when I told him that his behaviour was terrible, he stopped the car in the middle of nowhere and asked us to leave.We spent hours walking before finding another Taxi.

title: Our booking was subcontracted out to Uber but I was charged the full price for the booking.
text: I booked a ride from our hotel in Cascais to the Lisbon Airport. The day of our booking the driver did not come so I called the transport company and was told an Uber was on the way to pick us up. Unfortunately, the transport company did not provide the Uber driver with the authorization code. After some telephone calls back and forth the driver received the code and we could finally leave for the airport - nearly 30 minutes late. As it turned out, the transport company charged me Eur 55.81 for the ride but they paid Uber Eur 25 (of which the driver got Eur 19). I feel scammed by this company and would not recommend using their service. Just book directly through Uber and save aggrivation and money.

title: The terminal of shame
text: The terminal of shame. Compared to terminal 1, it's day and night. People are parked. There is no place to sit. We wait in a corridor like a cattle tattoo.

title: Terrible
text:
Terminal 2 is fine if you are a goat or cow waiting in line for the slaughter house. There is nothing but queues before going to the gates and once a the gates everyone with their cabin luggage must go throught one of the few shops in the terminal. There are maybe 4 shops, nothing of interest and 3 dining options. No lounges. Every single seat is packed, families are spending hours sitting on the flour. When standing in line for boarding, the line is bend through other gates lines because of limited space in the terminal and al gates are right next to each other.

It's a third-world country terminal, no more or less.

title: Terminal 2 is unsafe!!
text: On July 19th 2023, we were traveling through Terminal 2 of Lisbon airport. There was a lengthy queue for passport control and the crowds of people waiting became frustrated with the delays resulting in a huge crush of people and a very dangerous situation unfolded. Any elderly or children in the queue could easily have been crushed and died. There were no airport staff on hand to control the situation. Terminal 2 should be closed until customer safety is assured. Do not use Terminal 2.

title: Lisbon Airport Terminal 2
text: Lisbon Airport Terminal 2 is an accident waiting to happen. The volume of passengers using the terminal is unsafe, for its size. However, improvements could be made, with additional seating and more staff to direct passengers. My flight was delayed yesterday evening 7June 2023, and there were families and the elderly who had nowhere to sit. Very hot, and outside McDonald's pretty scary as people crushed together. I felt faint and panicky. I am sure parents with small children were very worried. Whoever manages this terminal needs to step up or go, as they are not doing their job. This is not a one off but a regular occurrence. Sort it out before there is an accident.

title: Valise seule s√©curit√© nul...
text: Au terminal T2 une valise seule, j'ai pr√©venu du personnel √† 3 reprises pour une intervention de la s√©curit√© afin de faire √©vacuer cette valise. Verdict pendant 2heures la valise est rest√©e seule... D√®s mon d√©part pour prendre mon avion direction la France, la valise √©tait tjs l√†.... Inadmissible....

title: City-Airport-Taxis.com Nightmare!
text: Absolute Nightmare.. Avoid...Avoid , Driver never showed up at Lisbon airport , rang the emergency number and was put through to voicemail . Eventually got a refund . This transfer in Lisbon is Untrustworthy and Unreliable ... DO NOT USE!!

title: Lamentable
text: Ante todo decir que lo primero es, EVITA LA TERMINAL 2. Si te toca esa terminal date por ganado. Apretado, hacinado, sin comida, sin mas posibilidad que esperar tu vuelo en las peores condiciones. Hablando del aeropuerto en si, todos los vuelos se retrasaban o ten√≠an incidencias, no he visto una cosa igual. Lo mejor, es la tripulaci√≥n, que obviamente no tiene nada que ver con el aeropuerto e intentan mitigar en las puertas de embarque todas esta problem√°tica.

title: Day light robbery
text: Do not get into the queue for the taxi rank at the exit door at lisbon Airport, got chargedv38‚Ç¨ for a 15 minute journey into town, absolute rip off, pre book your Uber or get bus/ train, these drivers should hang their head in shame

title: Thieves at the airport security in Lisbon
text: I was traveling from cancun Mexico to seville Spain , I bought duty free in cancun airport , perfume and mescal , when I arrived they took it away from me !!! It was sealed and I had a recite that said it was bought in duty free !! They are thief‚Äôs

title: NO SERVICE WHATSOEVER
text: No one waiting for us in arrivals. Rang the Hoppa contact number, thinking it was the taxi driver. No such luck, it was a switchboard that had no ideas on where to find my driver. Gave up and took an airport taxi. They ripped me off with ‚Ç¨25 for a ‚Ç¨15 journey but at least I got to the hotel. Subsequently tried to contact Hoppa on the number given with my order. All I got was another (WhatsApp) number which was manned by a dumb robot that told me it couldn't locate my order number.

title: SCAM - Lisbon Airport Taxi
text: Bloddy beggars...scammers, the trip to downtown should cost no more than 15 Euro. He charged us 28 Euro. ALWAYS take UBER. Let these scammers go hungry or switch to Uber.

title: No flexibility
text:
Our plane was delayed by an hour and we arrived 20 minutes late for the activity.
