The group had already left, which we understand but the organizers showed no flexibility or understanding by refusing any reimbursement, even partial of the activity... it was the bachelorette party of one of our friends and in addition to the disappointment of missing this moment, we were unable to replace the activity with another, due to lack of reimbursement.
Don't count on them to fix you or put themselves in your place.

title: Misleading prices on website
text:
Misleading prices on website. The bike I chose was advertised for EUR 59, when I selected the date for the next day for a 24hr rental period it went up to 67, and at checkout the VAT was added, making the total 90!!! Displaying ex VAT may be legal, but it is misleading and certainly not common practice in Europe, whether you are a restaurant, a hairdresser or a car rental.
Bike was in good condition but expensive.

title: Es ist kompliziert
text:
Wir wollen an einem Montag 2 R√§der f√ºr den n√§chsten Tag buchen. Der Laden ist zwar geschlossen, aber es ist angeschlagen, dass man Online reservieren k√∂nne.
Ok, dann online.
Wir w√ºhlen uns durch eine Homepage ohne Filter. Welche Gr√∂√üe bei welchem Rad, welche Schaltung vorr√§tig ist, muss von uns recherchiert werden. .. Also klicken wir uns durch jedes einzelne Rad. Wie umst√§ndlich!!!

Endlich alles im Warenkorb, dann sehen wir, dass eine Kaution von 960‚Ç¨ verlangt wird. Ist ja nicht ungew√∂hnlich. Aber wir haben mit solchen Deposits schon schlechte Erfahrungen gemacht. Jetzt w√§re es toll, wenn wir nachfragen k√∂nnten.
Es wird ein Chat angeboten. Ok, dann via WhatsApp weiter. Auf unsere Frage gibt es leider eine Standardantwort mit √ñffnungszeiten.
Sonst nichts.
Wir entscheiden uns am n√§chsten Vormittag pers√∂nlich in den Laden zu gehen.
Neuer Tag, aber es wird nicht besser. Der Angestellte sagt, dass es ohne Online-Buchung nicht funktioniert. Also alles auf Anfang: wir klicken uns im Laden durch jedes Bike, denn niemand kann uns sagen, welches Rad in welcher Gr√∂√üe vorr√§tig ist. Es gibt auch keinerlei Beratung, welches Rad zu uns passen k√∂nne.
Zum Gl√ºck fahren wir Zuhause auch Canyon und kennen unsere Gr√∂√üe.
Denn wir wollen langsam mal los. Es soll jetzt schnell gehen. R√§der und Helme (5‚Ç¨/Tag/Person) in den Warenkorb. Name, Kreditkarte, Handynummer eintragen und schon ist die Best√§tigungsmail da. Yeah!
Doch jetzt wird uns gesagt, dass wir eine Stunde warten m√ºssten, damit die R√§der fertig gemacht w√ºrden. Dass wir angerufen werden, sollte es schneller gehen, ist ausgeschlossen.
Auch die Nachfrage nach dem Deposit bleibt unbeantwortet. Hat der Angestellte nichts mit zu tun. Wird automatisch geblockt/gebucht. Wann der Betrag von der Kreditkarte wieder verschwindet, wei√ü er auch nicht. ‚Ä¶
P√ºnktlich eine Stunde sp√§ter stehen wir wieder im Laden. Die R√§der auch. Prima! Ein netter Angestellter guckt nach der richtigen Sattelh√∂he und wir fahren endlich los!
Ja, ich wei√ü, Anf√§ngerfehler gemacht: Wir haben nicht gefragt, wie die Schaltung funktioniert. Aber wir wollen los. Die R√§der Zuhause haben zwar eine Sram. Diese haben eine Shimano-Schaltung. Das wird doch bestimmt √§hnlich sein.
4 Kilometer fahren wir, dann probiere ich runterzuschalten. Ich hab keinen Umwerfer, aber vorne rechts geht es nicht. Ich versuche vieles und gleichzeitig l√∂st sich mein Sattel und ich sitze viel zu tief. Oh nein! Also umdrehen und zur√ºck zum Shop. Da wird uns schnell geholfen. Ich lerne, dass mein Bike eine Sattel-Automatik hat, mit der ich den Sattel hoch und runter stellen kann. Eine kurze Einf√ºhrung in die Gadgets w√§re hilfreich gewesen.
Es ist 11.30 Uhr als wir zum zweiten Mal losfahren.
Die R√§der funktionieren gut.
Als wir abends zur√ºckkommen, sagt der nette Angestellte, dass alles cool sei. Wir m√ºssten die R√§der nur abstellen.
√Ñhm, und die 960‚Ç¨ Kaution? Die w√ºrden automatisch in den n√§chsten Stunden zur√ºckgebucht. Da br√§uchten wir uns keine Sorgen machen. Vielleicht sind wir ja kleinlich, aber wir h√§tten schon gern eine Best√§tigungsmail, dass die R√§der wieder ordnungsgem√§√ü da sind und die Kaution zur√ºck auf unsere Karte geht. Anscheinend ist dieses un√ºblich.
Damit machen wir den netten Angestellten leider Stress. Er muss telefonieren und etwas ausf√ºllen. Kostet ihn mindestens 10/15 Minuten Zeit. Klappt aber letztendlich.
Am Ende haben wir f√ºr 6 Stunden mit zwei Gravel Bikes (Road Bikes waren und viel zu teuer) und 2 Helmen 88‚Ç¨ bezahlt. BTW: Ein Schloss h√§tte extra gekostet.
Wir sind zwar Biker und m√∂gen moderne Rennr√§der. Aber das n√§chste mal gehen wir wieder zu dem netten √§lteren Herren im oldfashioned Radladen.

title: Very poor service
text:
The store has an impressive website trying to actually book via internet proved to be impossible, showing zero availability (regardless of bike type or size)

When in Lissabon, we visited the store, hoping to get more info. We got no info, just that we had to ‚Äûbook and pay first‚Äú

We were told that they could not check availability or give us any info - we had to book and pay via their website before they could give us any info ‚Ä¶

Bottom line - the store was packed with rental bikes, but the staff were not interested ( or capable) in telling us if any of these bikes could be available‚Ä¶

Despite the fact that the store was filled with bikes

title: Bad customer service
text: Didn‚Äôt do very well, I was charged 350 euro for a broken chain selector which suddenly went bust. No empathy whatsoever on the issue. Bad experience. Sorry for the bad wrap but its true.

title: Disappointing
text:
Definitely not luxury. Not many seats, so definitely for a younger crowd. Seating was on front of sailboat. It was extremely hot which may have added to the need for some shade.......Drinks were fine and they were generous with them. Adequate snack, but not all that appealing....
Guides were nice. Overview of harbor with some interesting history.

title: Unexpected Charges Marred Experience
text:
We had a wonderful time on the boat tour, and our tour guide was exceptional. Their enthusiasm and knowledge made the experience truly enjoyable.

However, we were quite disappointed in Lisbon by Boat because upon arriving at the marina to learn that we would be charged the full adult price for our 6-month-old child. The website did not indicate any charges for infants, and despite mentioning the child in the booking comments, we received no prior notification of the additional 60 euro fee.

Given that infants cannot partake in the food or drinks included in the ticket price, we believe a revised policy would be beneficial. Perhaps offering a reduced rate for infants or clearly outlining infant charges on the website could prevent similar surprises for other families.

We were charged a fee at the marina, allegedly because our boat exceeded the maximum passenger limit. However, there seems to be significant confusion regarding this limit. While the people at the marina claimed a maximum of 16 people, the company website stated 14, and a sign on the boat indicated 12. Our group consisted of 6 passengers (including an infant), 9 additional passengers, and 2 crew members, already surpassing any of these limits. Also, I informed the company ahead of time that we were bringing an infant, so they should have made arrangements for our infant. Given these discrepancies and the fact that the boat was clearly overcrowded, we are puzzled as to why we were charged. This unexpected fee has left a negative impression of the company.

We would have happily adjusted our plans, made other childcare arrangements, or considered a private tour had we known about the infant fee in advance. This unexpected cost significantly impacted our overall budget for the experience. We hope this feedback can contribute to a more transparent and family-friendly policy.

title: WE DID NOT GET ON BOARD. OUR CONCERN REGARDING OVERCAPACITY WAS DISMISSED. IRRESPONSIBLE RISKING LIVES.
text:
The sail was advertised being a luxury yacht. However, it was an old sail boat. In addition the tour company Lisbon by Boat had overcapacity on board. IT WAS NOT SAFE!! My wife and I are experienced sailors and there was NO WAY that we were goin to take the huge risk.

We told the tour operator and he dismissed us by saying that that is the number of people that they normally carry on board plus the crew.

I AM REQUESTING A FULL REFUND!!!

title: NO sailing - only tour by motorboat
text:
We had chosen Lisbon by Boat because it was sailing tour - was more expensive by the way than motorboat tour.
Very unfortunate that they don't even bother to actually sail and just go around by motor.
There was enough wind because around us we saw several sailboats doing the sailing. So we felt cheated because we paid more for a sailing trip instead of a trip with a motorboat.

title: Much better religious sites to visit in Lisbon.
text:
There are far better religious sites to visit than this one. Surprisingly smaller than many other religious sites and frankly quite unremarkable.

The stain glass windows are the highlight of the visit.

title: Massive Romanesque building, the visit to the Treasury can be saved
text:
On our early afternoon in Lisbon, this is the Cathedral and was the only attraction we decided to access.
From the outside, it appears much smaller than it really is, perhaps because of the rather squat shape and the very "square" proportions of the facade, while the interior reveals, not without a little amazement, its actual dimensions.
The premises on the upper level house the so-called "treasure", a collection of clothes and various ecclesiastical objects, which we thought might be worth visiting, upon payment of the ticket (not exactly cheap), but in my opinion there was nothing interesting. It is also a pity that the large cloister behind was not open to visitors due to work in progress.
Overall, despite the undoubted architectural finesse of the building, it was half a disappointment.

title: PICKPOCKETS IN ALFAMA
text: The walk was beautiful but you have been warned about professional pickpockets which happened to me. On the last day so wallet in my backpack. At an unexpected moment after removing it from my chest to go up a flight of stairs they struck. Wait for police station 3 couples and after us w3 more came in.

title: Hellish din
text: Such an iconic place completely ruined by the ambient noise. What idea to install the ticket office inside the Church üò≥

title: No
text: despite the lisbocard you still have to pay at least 4‚Ç¨. In addition there is a super nice church below which it is totally free!!

title: Unwelcoming inside
text: Very beautiful cathedral from the outside. Inside everything is paid and even on the left when entering while there is a passage. Besides, a young woman is there to tell you in an unkind way, and constantly on her mobile phone. Unwelcoming

title: Be careful, not honest at the ticket office. They say that the ticket gives access to everything, but forget to say that the cloister
text: Be careful, not honest at the ticket office. They say that the ticket gives access to everything, but forget to say that the cloister is closed. I had asked for a ticket for the cloister, so fundamentally dishonest.

title: Quelle deception !
text: La cathedrale a ete manifestement completement secularisee. Il n‚Äôy manque plus qu‚Äôun McDo ou BK. Tres de√ßu et les gens de l‚Äôaccueil ne comprennent pas qu‚Äôil a pu s‚Äôagir (il y a fort longtemps) d‚Äôun lieu de priere ‚Ä¶ une vraie catastrophe ininterressante

title: Sch√∂ne Kathedrale
text:
√Ñu√üerlich sch√∂ne Kathedrale die wir auf dem Fussweg zur Burg gesehen haben.
√úber das innere kann ich nichts sagen, da ich f√ºr eine Kirche keinen Eintritt bezahle.

title: ‚ÄúFree‚Äù scoldings to spoil your day
text: Very unprofessional owner. We cancelled within 10 minutes of tour due to torrential rain we kept hoping would stop and received a long, email reply advising us how inconsiderate we were for making the guide ‚Äúwait in the rain‚Äù for us. First, the guide was presumably giving a tour IN the rain, correct? Second, although it was apparently not soon enough for Mr. Guerreiro, we DID give notice. How many times have tours started late while waiting for someone to show? We thought we did the courteous thing but were scolded like children. When your business model relies on word of mouth, it‚Äôs best not to reprimand your customers.

title: Left after not moving for 15 minutes
text: Spent 15 minutes listening to the last 5000 years of Portugal's history, spoken at machine gun speed, without moving a step from the walking tour start. We left the group and did a 5hr walking tour of our own. It was supposed to show us the locals view of Lisbon, not a never ending boring history lesson (I love history but that was not the scope of the tour).

title: Disappointing
text:
A few weeks ago we did a tour with Nicole. She's a very friendly young guide (although she's not a local--she moved to Lisbon from Brazil, if I remember correctly, for college). At the outset she spoke about Portuguese history for a looong time, barely taking time for a breath. She spoke too softly, too fast, and her accent was difficult to understand, so we got about 1/2 of what she was saying. (A young man asked her later on in the tour to please slow down when she spoke, so it wasn't just us.) Not positioning herself in front of everyone meant that she had to turn her head behind her and from side to side, causing us to lose even more of what she said.

I am interested in the history of a place and want that in a tour, but in other cities we have gotten that while visiting their historic neighborhoods and other beautiful or note-worthy sites. During this tour we did visit the Alfama area, which was a highlight, but otherwise walked through a lot of normal or commercial parts of Lisbon. Not what I was hoping for. In another highlight, though, the tour ended at the terrace of Igreja da Graca, which has excellent views.

title: Chill Out versus Guru Free Walks
text:
We read about this tour company in the Rick Steves Portugal travel book.
We did not enjoy this tour on April 30 given by Dodo, one of 3 names he gave us.
Why?
1. The first 30 minutes of this tour was verbal history. We stood in the often heavy rain while we watched other tour groups move to shelter. The group was large.
2. He doesn't speak to you, he speaks "at" you. He never takes a breath. Fast talker!
3. He does not wait for the entire group to assemble at the next stop; thus, if you are not in the front, you miss out on hearing about the next stop.
4. He never took a break, we never sat down, we climbed up and up.
5. At the end, he clearly expected the minimum 10 Euros + per person. Then, he preached to you to post on Instagram, etc rave reviews.

Guru Walks offer a slower, more enjoyable pace and cover the same or similar stops.
We are in our 70s and very active travelers

title: DISCRIMINATORY AND UNPROFESSIONAL "OWNER"
text: Worst, unprofessional, discriminatory company we have ever encountered. Wouldn't let us on tour because we had kids! Guy who claimed to be owner was confrontational and couldn't even give valid proof on their website as to why we weren't allowed to join tour, even though we arrived 12 minutes prior to start of tour. DEFINITELY DONT WASTE YOUR TIME! SANDEMANN WAS AN AMAZING TOUR- GO WITH THEM!!!!

title: Worst tour ever
text: Worst tour ever. We were turned away because we had children. The ‚Äúowner‚Äù was mean rude and a horrible person. Stay away!!!!!

title: Not a fan of this tour
text: This was my least favorite tour I took in the 10 days in Portugal. I found the guide to be boring also arrogant. Not sure I believed all his explanations on why people tag the walls as signs of approval. Looks like vandalism to me. The walk was rather strenuous up several steep hills and numerous stairs which should be mentioned in the write up. On a hot day for 3 hours this could be too much for some people. We did stop for a rest room break. Also the tour ends a bit of distance from the starting point requiring one to find transportation back to their hotel or the starting point.

title: Horrible!
text: What a horrible experience! The staff at the port are not helpful at all! We have been waiting to get our luggage now for two hours and of course we will miss our flight to Madrid.

title: DO NOT take a taxi at the cruise port!
text: Had a similar taxi experience as previous reviewer. Did not don on us that taxis lining up at the cruise port were just waiting for suckers. Was charged 60 euros cash for a ride that would have cost less than 8 euros with a regular black and green metered taxi. Jut walk a bit out of the port area and hail a regular taxi.

title: Lisbon cruise ship port taxi ripoffs
text:
Taxis waiting for fares are often very dishonest, Grossly overcharging passengers and then stating that they have no change.
People leaving cruise ships should be especially cautious, as taxi driver know that you have plenty of cash and may be in a hurry to get to the airport, etc.
A couple we know got into a cab without asking what the fare was to their hotel and were charged 32 euros for a taxi ride that normally is 12 euros or a little less. They handed the driver 2 20 euro bills and he said that he had no change.
They had no recourse but to let him drive off with 28 more euros than he was entitled to.

Be careful and always ask the exact fare before getting in the taxi. Ask if he can make change for 10 or 20 euro bills, or make that you have change to avoid being ripped off.

These are good rules for travelers to follow everywhere, but the you should be especially careful at the Lisbon cruise port.

Lisbon does have uber, as well

title: Poor communication
text: A disaster! The meeting point guidance was unclear so 10 guests missed the tour. We made it to the restaurant, the food was poor, the entertainment was mediocre. Do not book this trip!!

title: Awful Pub Crawl Tour with Destination Tour in Lisbon
text:
It is the worst pub crawl tour i have ever attended. I was in pub crawl tour on 20.09.2024 with this company. ƒ∞ had many pub crowl tour in different cities but pub crowl with Destination tours in Lisbon was awful.

They dont reply the phones allthough it was written on the brochure to make a reservation on phone.
So i had to ask help for reservation from my hotel Reception.

They accept the payment in Advance that i have seen for the first time. Normally it is paid to guide at the the beginning of the tour.

It was expensive tour according to the service was provided.

First of all the meeting point was inside of a hostel. The Door was not open. ƒ∞ couldnt get inside till someone comes who stays in the hostel. A certain square could ve chosen instead of a hostel.

I saw no one who was waiting for us.By the help of a guest i went to Reception which was on the second floor. I asked for the tour. The Receptionist had no idea. Told me to go upstairs.

When i was there , i didnt see the guide. After waiting 10 minutes the guide arrived. We were 20 people after a while. The guide told ud we would stay there for 30 minutes but we stayed there 50 minutes. I cant say it was a bar. ƒ∞t was only top of a hostel.

ƒ∞t was written on the brochure we would go to Pink street where i would like to see much. The guide also told we would see. But we didnt. When i asked he said it is a dangerous area and crowded. But 2 minutes away from the point we stay. I requested if he could show , he didnt accept. In one of the bars where wevwere Cool and the ambiance was good. Allthougt we didnt finish our drinkings the guide told us to go out in 15 minutes. Before he told us we would stay in 3very bar 30 minutes.
He was always dissepearing and come back again.
Because im alone and dont know how to go to my hotel i requested him to.help by finding a taxi. He said " dont worry i will help you" .
But when i asked him for returning to hotel he didnt want to help me.
I went to security guards of the club where we are to help ne. And i looked for taxi.
ƒ∞n the program there were 3 places :
1. Bairro Alto
2. Pink street
3.Docks
We saw only Bairro Alto. The other twp places we didnt see.
The guide's name was MARTINI . For me he was not a guide. He explained nothing about the area. He didnt guide. He only walked through inside the bars with us. That was all. We were always looking for hƒ±m not to loose hƒ±m in this crowded place. He was like a guest , like √∂ne of the people in the tour instead of a guide. He didnt care about people.

ƒ∞n the other cities in the pub crowl tour the guide explained the important points about the area where we were walking through.
ƒ∞n this tour there was nothing.
ƒ∞t is pity for such a beautiful City like Lisbon.
ƒ∞ will never choose this company g√∂r any tour again.

title: A tour? Really?
text:
The description said it was a walking tour for 1 hour followed by dinner at a local restaurant with Fado Music.

Let‚Äôs start with the tour. We walked and stopped at two spots to take pictures as they were on top of the hill and in our last stop finally the tour guide opened his mouth to show us a graffiti wall mural representing the Fado tradition. That‚Äôs it! That was the walking tour.

After that we went to the restaurant, which lasted 2 1/2 hours where you had to be quiet and not talk to anyone while they were singing. Food was OK not the best.

Our tour guide left the restaurant in the middle of the meal, never to be seen again even though the description said you would return to the original spot were the tour started in the middle of the city.

This left everyone trying to look at GPS to try and find their way back.

Awful, awful, awful!

title: Tourist trap
text: The tour guide was good and knowledgeable, music was beautiful but the experience overall felt very cheap. After a short tour you‚Äôll end up at the Alfama Grill where the food is simply awful and the service is just as bad. Half of the people in my group did not even touch their plate. Sangrias took almost an hour to get to us. After the performances the singers will go table to table trying to sell their CDs for 10 euros a pop. The whole thing was just bizarre and laughable, a tourist trap. We did a similar flamenco tour in Sevilla, (albeit without food) that was much higher quality.

title: Tour was cancelled without notice to us.
text: The tour was cancelled without notice. I need to get a refund. Waited at meeting place for 45 minutes before somebody at the hostel told us it was cancelled. Not a good expetience

title: Should've read the other reviews
text:
In hindsight, we only have ourselves to blame. We booked the tour based on good avg reviews here, but shouldve read the reviews in detail. Similar to others we were shocked at how rude, condescending and arrogant the guide Rodrigo was.He insulted multiple guests on the tour and barely provided any information about lisbon (and much more about himself!). As others have pointed out, the food is also atrocious. Music was good - but the whole night was ruined by Rodrigo.

Do yourself a favor, do a different tour.

title: Too much Rodrigo, too little Fado
text:
The ‚Äútour‚Äù did not begin until quite a distance from the meeting point. This first bit of walking was unnecessary and did not connect to the promised topic. If you are not familiar with Lisbon, know that this will be a steep walk with many staircases and little to no accessibility for anyone with a disability. The info we were eventually given by Rodrigo was, in fact, interesting, but was overshadowed by Rodrigo himself. He was self-important and condescending. He also had endless negative things to say about Portugal, a country we very much enjoyed visiting. Perhaps he was trying to be funny? After an hour and forty minutes, we arrived at the cafe. We were seated 10 cm from the performers in a very cramped setting. Rodrigo then transitioned from tour guide to annoying waiter. The food was, unfortunately, atrocious. Finally, the promised singing began. After only two songs, the performers walked table to table trying to sell us their CD‚Äôs. Still hungry, we attempted to make our escape between sets, only to be chased down by Rodrigo wanting us to stay for desert. No, thank you. While walking around after the show, we encountered other members of the tour, who also lamented the awful food.
By all means, go to Lisbon to learn about and listen to Fado. But don‚Äôt do it here, and don‚Äôt do it with Rodrigo.

title: Burla - Encomenda nunca confirmada, chamadas n√£o atendidas e dinheiro retido
text:
(PT) Efetuei uma compra e, no pr√≥prio dia, enviei o comprovativo de pagamento. N√£o obstante, nunca obtive qualquer retorno por parte da loja a confirmar a encomenda. Volvido um m√™s e ap√≥s v√°rias tentativas infrut√≠feras de contacto telef√≥nico, enviei e-mail a cancelar a encomenda. N√£o responderam, como era expect√°vel. Continuam sem atender as chamadas e sem devolver o dinheiro. √â uma burla. N√£o aconselho. N√£o comprem aqui. Rid√≠culo... //
(ENG) I made a purchase and sent proof of payment the same day. However, I have never received any feedback from the store confirming the order. A month later and after several unsuccessful attempts to contact them by phone, I sent an e-mail to cancel the order. As expected, they didn't reply. They still won't answer my calls and won't refund my money. It's a scam. I don't recommend it. Don't buy from them. Ridiculous...

title: Burla on site.
text:
I did not go physically but I tried to place an order on the site.
This store does not send any emails confirming the order. After getting me answered the phone once, the employee said that he would send me the order that day.
I waited a few days, no orders were delivered. I'm trying to get in touch with the store and I'm systematically disconnected. Refuse to answer and respond to emails. Oh, bad. For me this site is a jerk.

title: Not really worth it
text: A souvenir from every country I travel is a bathing duck. I have also been to various dug stores to buy a special squeaky duck from the respective country. I was disappointed with the store in Lisbon. We didn‚Äôt happen to walk past it, but walked there with Google map. Difficult to get up hills and down hills to not get a duck at all. Not one country/city duck existed. Very annoying. Lisbon was still beautiful.

title: Disappointed
text: I‚Äôve tried to visit the store three times. It was never open. There were no messages to the customers. I‚Äôm really disappointed.

title: Avoid!
text:
We took a private tour with Captain Manel and Sandra on a larger boat‚Äî4 hours for 690 euros. The boat was in great condition, everything worked well, and Captain Manel is probably the most stylish fishing guide I‚Äôve ever met.

Unfortunately, the fishing experience was far from acceptable. Slow fishing is normal‚Äîit happens. But what made it disappointing was the lack of effort. The Captain spent most of the time talking to Sandra or on his phone, instead of trying to improve the experience by changing bait or location more actively.

He only changed location twice, and that was after we complained. In the end, he showed us how to bait a hook and then stepped away from the process completely. We had a few short sessions and that was it.

Overall, the value for money was almost negative.

title: Extremely hot buses
text: The bus was extremely hot. They advertised that all their buses have air conditioning but none of the drivers turn on the AC.

title: Oh, bad!!!!
text: Oh, bad. Buses take a long time to pass and not always fit the people who are waiting. It takes 30 minutes for the other one to pass. Do not meet schedule, do not recommend and never picked up this type of transportation. Very bad.

title: Worst experience
text: This is the WORST EVER tour that I have taken in my whole life. And I‚Äôm not that young and have taken a lot of tours. What made it so so so terrible was the driver. The rudest person ever. Change your job, or please, fire him! He drove recklessly, honk that horn to every car and human on the streets, and the cherry on the cake: before leaving the bus in one station, we were going to ask a question and he held his hand and said ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have the time to answer questions or recommend anything.‚Äù I don‚Äôt know his name, but he was the driver of the 12:00 bus leaving from Marques de Pombal in Lisbon. My recommendation is simple: fire him.

title: Avoid grayline red bus tour
text: Red bus ‚Äògrayline‚Äô tour was terrible! Commentary on the bus was so poor-pre recorded, often off sync with the stops, often telling you after the stop what you should have got off at & too much music rather than information. Also completely unreliable-we ended up walking from the castle as the bus didn‚Äôt turn up!

title: Would not recommend
text:
Told pickup would be in 25 min and it was an hour and half later. Bus could only take 5 waiting and no details of next bus arriving to pick up the many others waiting. Would not recommend using in Lisbon city. Another company had three buses arrive during that time,
And very hard to use there sight to find pick up areas and your location.
Bus driver very nice under the pressure that was out of his control.

title: You‚Äôd be better off walking!
text:
Great trip if all you want to do is go around in circles and not get off the bus. Most of the audio was faulty and the frequency between pickups was so bad that we were able to walk 4kms to the next stop and still beat the bus (which meant pick up was over an hour later).

Probably why all the other Red buses are full and these have plenty of seats.

title: Disappointment
text:
We bougnt a ticket online for 48 hour tour, but were no infos about sport event, so they have finished the tour that day at 13.30!!!!!

One tour the bus beoke down in the middle of the traffic, was waiting 30 min to re-start!!!

Finally we lost our tickets on the boat, than we tried to use the last round showing the voucher, with no success!!!!

We were declined from the bus!

title: Don't bother!
text: This was the worst HOHO bus I've EVER been on!! There was very little commentary and what there was was over really annoying music, which was on constantly, even when there was talking. What commentary there was was repeated over and over again! It also took sooooo long. The traffic lights in Lisbon seem to be constantly changing to red so you feel like you're going nowhere fast! The blue route seemed to go on forever, and that was with missing out one of the main stops. Also if you're going from the port be aware that you are taken to stop one first which takes nearly an hour and that's before your route actually starts. You can get there in 10 minutes on the subway. All in all, a MAJOR disappointment!

title: Simply the worst
text:
By far the worst HOHO bus we have used anywhere in the world. We have found most great but this one (the red bus but others said the yellow bus was also poor) was terrible. The route was slow, seemed to go off track as we spent some time hurtling down a motorway, and almost no commentary. I heard the same music about 10 times.
We intended to do both routes but couldn't wait to get off and explore this wonderful city on foot ourselves. We wasted over two hours on this bus and saw little and learnt nothing.

title: Disappointed victim.
text:
If u want to spend 4 hrs stopped at traffic lights this is the trip for you. No time to hop off.
Avoid if you need to get back to cruise ship.

title: Disappointment and a real nightmare.
text: The blue line is a real kidnapping. Over 2 hours of anguish in the outskirts of Lisbon with vision of buildings under construction and state road as the ring roads. The far periphery without the possibility of being able to access a taxi service to immediately go back. A nightmare and a great waste of time

title: Do not recommend this tour, sold under false information
text:
Advised before tour it would take one and a half hours for tour A, where we change to tour B for returning to cruise ship. From port it took 50 minutes. Tour actually started at stop 1, there was no commentary, so at stop 3 a couple of us went to complain. Bus driver said we were on the wrong channel, started driving again, he said he'd check at next stop, refused to stop for us to make our way back up stairs. We arrived at stop 4 one hour and a half after start. He did not reset commentary so a group of passengers left the bus. Complained to rep at the stop, who told us to talk to the bus driver, who was not interested. No rep at port. I have Complained to company who claim there was commentary, an obvious lie.
No voucher or refund offered.

title: STAY AWAY!!! Go with Grey Line company.
text: Got on a bus and paid $108 Euro. Went 2 stops and got off at the zoo. Went to get back on the bus but waited over 1hr 30mins for the bus. Never showed up. Ended up getting a taxi back to our hotel. Total waist of money. Grey Line bus passed our bus stop 4 times. Stay away from this company. Told me they would send me a refund but still waiting. Horrible experience.

title: Disappointing!
text:
The worst visit with this company!
At several places on the bus the headphones did not work. Very succinct comments not to say non-existent! When there was a comment it was almost inaudible and especially out of step with the sites or monuments concerned.
Very disappointed compared to our previous experience ..... 6 years ago

title: This is a scam
text: The worst hop on hop off bus experience. It is a scam. Zero information, which means you are just pating the money to drive you around. Through the whole round there may be 3-5 phrases in your earphones. Funny. As I undertand the yellow buses are better but the sightseeing red ones is just a scam.

title: No Greyline
text: No Greyline. They cheat. We went for a longer trip service. After the bus has left and 15 mins out of city, they announce not all places will be visited. If this is not cheating what is?

title: worst hop on tour ever
text: we try to take these when we are in a city somewhat or brand new to us. we did this in Lisbon, and only stayed on the whole way as many areas were closed on a Sunday so stops were not made. We think these are a great way to see the city but on this one tour, the driver was very rude and completely uninterested in anything to do with the passengers. He should be fired.

title: Frustration
text:
The first thing I have to say is that it was the worst experience in Portugal. We arrived in Lisbon after a week touring the country and enjoying it. We thought that because of how big Lisbon is, the bus would be good option, since we were only one day. Nothing further from the reality... it only served us to take us to Belem and to return, we had to wait for a great time, once in El Centro, it was disastrous!!!!!!
We didn't find the pickup points and didn't even see any buses
Great frustration for spending 64 euros on something that is not worth anything.

title: Underground bad
text:
What a mess. Even zero points would be well-intentioned.
We have often travelled with this company throughout Europe. Actually always quite ok, as you can get a quick overview of the city.
The buses are in very poor condition and half headphone jacks are broken. The audio is way too quiet.
Twice we waited an hour for a bus and nobody came.
Save the money and ride the metro or taxi...

title: Weak
text: As an expensive bus ride ok, but don't expect much; Chaotic, different providers, tone bad, spoken often doesn't match location; permanently boring music, dull...

title: Horrendous, Waste of money & time
text: Awful, infact horrendous. Don't waste your money. Although, I feel Citysightseeing Hop on Hop off won't care and don't care as they don't read or respond to any of these reviews on here whatsoever. Terrible audio. Party of four of us paid ‚Ç¨120. Red, Green & Blue routes. No audio, crackling headset sound, couldn't hear anything. Music mainly and then the audio would work and say a few words when it worked. Terrible.

title: Grayline is not on its game in.Lisbon
text: We have done multiple Grayline tours and usually find them informative and well-run. In this instance, we had no audio for nearly 2/3.of the trip. We drove through Lisbon not knowing what we were seeing. The brochure is quite skeletal and not informative. Our driver didn't make any effort to assist, we could have had a robo-driver. We considered hopping off to wait for another bus, but it was standing room only, so we thought we.might be stranded for hours. The narration didn't sync with the stops. There was.one.point where a large urban greenspace was touted and there was no tree in sight. Long periods of music with no narration. There.was no explanation as to why most.of the stops were noteworthy. Really below average and not satisfactory

title: Very bad
text: Very poor knowledge of Lisbon‚Äôs history. They don‚Äôt have much to say around the city. Lots of music. Wouldn‚Äôt repeat. Very hot

title: Terrible experience
text: The red bus tour from the port in lisbon was awful no audio information about the tour if that's how it can be described most of the time we were stuck in traffic not seeing any places of interest at all the tour cost us 30 euros each what a total tip off.

title: Poor city sightseeing in Lisbon.
text: Very disappointing. There are 3 routes: red, blue and green. The red and green routes were far too similar. The blue route was a waste of time. Generally there was a great lack of audio concerning Lisbon and no announcements when we reached bus stops. The drivers race through the city forgetting they have passengers. Cannot be recommended.

title: Don't spend your money on this
text:
Terrible experience.
Little to none information given on the city of Lisbon.
Long waits in traffic.
So bad I can't believe this cost 30 euro each.

title: Horrible
text:
Not worth the money
Very poor service spent the whole time in traffic staff rude no clue what part of lisbon we were in
Shocking absolutely shocking

title: Poor experience
text:
Slow service with limited information
Would not recommend unless you want to waste your time and money. Competitors service much better and punctual.

title: Horrible Redline Bus Lisbon
text: Don‚Äôt catch de redline in Lisboa, terrible services, I haven‚Äôt had the pleisure to take the Greyline, but it seems to be more puntual and very profesional.

title: Use another company!!!!
text: As other‚Äôs have said, I wish I would have read the reviews first. Didn‚Äôt because we take these hop on hop off tours all the time when traveling and never had a problem. So to confirm what everyone else is saying, it was not good. Mostly music on audio. Broken audio ports. BUT that would have been okay. It just never came back for over an hour. We stood waiting in the hot sun, watching two other bus lines go by us constantly. As in they were running on time. I finally called City sightseeing and was told that there was construction in Lisbon. Funny since we had already done part of the tour IN the actual city before getting off AND the other bus lines were running frequently. When I asked how they expected people they had dropped off to get back the agent responded that they make no guarantees. Don‚Äôt use this company. You will waste time. The Grayline company was one that kept going by. Try that one

title: poor choice
text: The Greyline hop on hop off bus is terrible. We waited at the stop to transfer to Cascais rounte for over an hour and no bus showed up. Save your money

title: Useless, don't buy
text: Same crappy experience as others - playing music all the time instead of narrative, very few busses running, drivers don't announce anything. Other reviewers complaining about audio jacks - believe me there's nothing to listen to even if you find a working jack.

title: Waiting times too long
text: Sometimes you have to wait over an hour for the bus, even though the website says that it's every 30 minutes. You don't learn much about the city, but there's annoying music. Every other socket doesn't work properly. I would use a different provider in Lisbon than CitySightseeing.

title: Maulkorn about review
text: Since I have recorded a second negative review about the Sighseeing Lisbon mail contact, it was not published by Tripadvisor

title: Stay away do not use this Service
text:
Only had a little time in Lisbon so thought we would use this to see the city quickly and listen to the information and learn a little. We bought our tickets on line and had them ready to get on the bus. $84 cdn! We stood in line for 30 mins while people were buying tickets as they got on the bus and the bus driver was struggling with this and was telling people they should buy the tickets at the office or online. We finally loaded then waited another 20-30 mins for them to load the bus. WE Finally started moving and we waited patiently for the information to start playing as we drove through Lisbon. After about 10 mins there was still no information, I got up and talked to the driver and he said he was sorry there was nothing he could do??. So we paid $84 waited close to an hour to leave the start location. Then we had no information as it was not working. then we got off the bus about 15 mins into the ride and wasted a good part of our Day.
We reached out to the Company and they reviewed this and were happy to refund us 10%. Really you have got to be kidding me!!

title: Bad experience due to reckless and rude people
text: I recommend not purchasing these packages, they are useless and wasteful, furthermore, where they offer the boat tour on the Taro river, consider that it is nothing more than a little trip without an audio guide and without any explanation from anyone, the boat is open, it has no cabins and there is air everywhere, 4 of us got bronchitis. The staff who manage the company from the moment the tickets were delivered are rude and uncaring.

title: Just don‚Äôt do it!!!
text: I think that this company has just 1 bus. You‚Äôll wait for hours at any point. Just don‚Äôt take this company, you are faster by foot.

title: Don‚Äôt take the bus
text: They don‚Äôt tell you when you buy your ticket at the boat dock that it will take over an hour and a half to get to the first stop on any of there lines (red,green or blue). The only ear piece that worked where we sat was 1 out of four connections. Our daughter could not find any working at the top deck. The one that did work never said much but played Portuguese music. Watch for you stops or you will miss them. I could go on but I think you get the picture.

title: Waste of time and money
text:
Terrible. Waste of money. Do not ever use them.
Audio didnt work only play Fado music. Driver doesn't make announcement of stops.
You had no idea where in the city you are .

title: HORRIBLE. Avoid this company!
text:
Horrible!!!! The "Yellow Bus" is not great but ANYTHING is better than the CitySightseeing Red Bus ("City").

I booked this "Hop-on/Hop-off" Tour. Hah!! It is nothing like that. At 9.20AM I was at one of their stops. After over an hour and a half no "City" bus showed up. At least 4 Yellow Buses went by and several other "LisbonSightseeing" buses (that are also Red) went by. And I waited.

After waiting until 10.45 AM I gave up and purchased a Yellow Bus tour....at least they had come by several times. That tour was ok.

Subsequently, I contacted "Customer Service" at "City" and enclosed a summary of my terrible experience with them, included a photo of myself standing by the bus stop, a copy of my paid invoice, and a copy of the invoice that I paid to the Yellow Bus Company.

I expected "City" to apologize and refund my payment. Instead they told me that their service was operating normally that day and that the first pick-up at THAT bus stop was at 11 AM. Really? Not exactly Hop-on/Hop off, right? Anyway they told me that no refund would be forthcoming....too bad sucker!!!

I will be protesting this charge with my credit card company, and I am quite sure my credit card company will reverse the charge.

If "City" was a decent company they would have apologized and refund my payment and saved me, and them, the headache of dealing with a contested charge.

AVOID THIS COMPANY!!

title: Bad
text: Bad experience. They have even poor routes because they don't explain anything. One has to guess where the stops are. The audio is almost just music, it's guessing everything. Very bad service at the main station to get on the buses. Appalling....

title: Disappointing - take the other company!
text: Echo other reviewers and wish I‚Äôd read them before booking. Terrible almost non-existent audio (just music playing). Long wait times (watching 4 of the other company pass), no information.

title: No way!
text: Very little information about the city and you have to wait almost an hour between buses! Never had such a bad sightseeing bus!

title: Terrible is an understatement
text: It's terrible, we were never able to go up to use the service, you wait and wait, they arrive at any time‚Ä¶. Except the one they're supposed to say it is. Don't buy it, you'll spend your time standing in line instead of reading the city. We never use it, the most efficient is an Uber or walking

title: Don‚Äôt bother
text: Not good. There is barely any audio, it is mostly music, and the audio that they have is very sparse and never plays at the right time so it is impossible o know what they are talking about. When you buy your ticket online it is challenging to find out where to meet the bus as no information is shared with you at the time of purchase. Disappointing for sure.

title: Not Impressed
text: Lisbon City Sightseeing Hop on Hop off was a disappointment primarily because of an outdated, in need of repair audio system, the lack of commentary and the wait times at various stops. Buying tickets to The Monastery and Bel√©m Tower was not beneficial in the least. Wait times were at least 1 hour at each. A good way to get around the city but a look with nothing to listen to trip.

title: Lisbon sight seeing tour
text: My wife and I were only in the city for a few days, so we thought we'd take a sighting tour. We paid for two trips, the red line and blue line, at one of the bus stands. We were told where to go to get the bus, and after waiting an hour and 40 mins we were informed that the bus wasn't coming, but our tickets would be valued for the next day. So we got up early and took public transport to where the sight seeing tour starts it's journey. We did not really have a long wait for the blue line tour, we put on the headphones provided and sat back waiting for the commentary to begin. I can't say exactly how long we were on this tour but it seems like a very very long time. The commentary only came on a few times, telling you about a few places we couldn't see or had past by, and the rest of the trip was filled with Portuguese folk music or Fado music as they call it being played into our headphones. The whole experience was so bad that I offered my wife ¬£100 not to make me take the trip on the red line. She told me to save my money as she didn't want to go through it again.

title: City sightseeing bus tour in Lisbon
text: The city sightseeing bus was a major disappointment. We got on the red bus which was ok. They are supposed to stop at each stopping point at least every hour which is too long to wait. In Barcelona there were many buses and stopped every 15 minutes so you never had to wait long. The blue bus was the worst. The driver drove with two feet so it felt like stop and go which caused me motion sickness. The audio tour guide didn‚Äôt give much information during the trip. It was a waste of time. I won‚Äôt use this bus tour again and don‚Äôt recommend it.

title: Bad experience. Lost time
text:
Don't take it. You will spend more time waiting than visiting the city. It is assumed that at the stops that coincide the purple and red lines they run every 30 minutes... well no.
In several seats the headphones do not work.
I recommend the Light Seeing (Grey Line) competition with more modern buses and much more frequency between them.

title: Incredibly bad
text: Booked due to bad weather despite the many negative reviews. The option with a red/purple/blue bus line was chosen. There is a draft everywhere on the buses. Drivers drive very recklessly, especially towards pedestrians. The rest of the staff is mostly unfriendly. The red and purple bus routes differ little and little information is provided. You can mostly hear annoying music. The highlight, however, is the blue line: it took us almost 2 hours and we mostly drove past social housing blocks. Absolutely horrible offer and a waste of time and money.

title: Take th other company
text: Several other sightseeing busses has passed us, but citysightseeing buses no. Waiting time is one hour, instead of 30min. Ir wouls be nice to wait in a cafe, but no schedule for busstops is avalable so we just standardi and wait.

title: Do not book / Reserve in advance
text:
Do not book in advance. Terrible service. The queues are long and if you decide not to use the service you will have a hard time to get your money back.

Grab one of the friendly Tuk Tuks. Much better service for a comparable price.

I cannot stress this enough. DO NOT BOOK/ RESERVE in advance if the links is here.

title: Very disappointed with very long wait times
text: We were very disappointed in our experience. The buses were so infrequent we never did catch the bus we wanted and had to switch to another company. Wait times were way too long for a young family and timing was not posted. Make sure you read the fine print before choosing your company and route, especially in the shoulder season.

title: Complete Rip-Off - Avoid !!
text:
Purchased ticket online. Staff at cruise port initially didn't know what to do so missed the first bus..

Got on the next at 1.15pm and sat there for over 30 minutes.

The red route bus then made it's way to the Terminal area - there was lots of music but hardly any commentary.

We got off the bus and stood at the Terminal waiting 40 minutes for the Blue route bus.

By this time a large crowd was waiting in total confusion on what was happening, but there were no staff anywhere - though there were lots of staff and lots of tour buses for rival gray line.

A bus arrived and we checked with a staff member who confirmed it was the Blue Route so we boarded.

At this point we noticed that City Sightseeing did have 3 staff at the Terminal - they were the disinterested 3 people standing away from customers and chatting between themselves.

The "Blue line" bus then left and made it's way back to the cruise terminal - it was the rong bus we'd been told to get on.

Even the commentary was lacking on their too, and when there was some it didn't relate to where we were.

We had spent from 1pm to 4pm and did not get what we had paid for.

We did not risk going back to the Terminal as our ticket expired at 6pm.

A complete waste of money AND our valuable day in the port of Lisbon.

title: Not informative enough - did not run on time - not enjoyable
text: As an ex - employee of Belfast City sightseeing, I and my family were very disappointed with this service in Lisbon. We traveled on two occasions to Belem, Sunday and Monday 17 and 18 March 2024. Firstly the buses were not on time, they were old and dirty, the plug in points for the audio did not work ( very poor). The information from the audio was terrible, did not mention the stops and gave very little information of the City. Why do you not have a personal tour guide on the bus? It is hard to beat the human touch! Your competitor the Gray line seems to be a better service with more modern buses and much better facilities. My family and I were very disappointed and felt the whole service was not value for money. You need to do better and up your game.

title: Bad info
text: Re HOP ON HOP OFF BUS you must avoid the company "City Sightseeing Portugal" in Lisbon. We had a 48-hour-ticket for red, purple, blue & green lines and it was a total disaster. Hardly any info as ear plugs system didn't work, rude driver, old buses and no info about dep.times en route. In 2 days we only managed the purple and green line as buses never showed up at stops.

title: Wasted money
text: Terrible experience! Waste of money, the bus frequency is really poor so if you get off you risk not seeing another one pass for a good two hours. The audio didn't work and the last bus leaves at 5pm!!! We had to return by taxi

title: Avoid them at all costs
text: My wife, friends, and I bought tickets online and went to the bus stop (stop 6 on the blue line). And then...the bus never came. We called, we used the online chat...both said the buses were running but couldn't tell us when a bus would come. We'd been waiting over an hour, so saying the bus runs every hour was a useless response. The phone number on their website is in England, and after a bunch of time talking in circles, the woman said she'd find out when the bus is coming then call me back. She never called. We eventually gave up after nearly 2hrs and left. We had pictures of ourselves at the bus stop sign. The company refused a refund, saying we didn't cancel 24hr in advance. Not my fault, since we didn't know you wouldn't show up! They said by email they would investigate and maybe give us a refund. Then, their investigation found that the bus came while we were waiting, a miracle! Somehow it came and we didn't see it! A bunch of lies. My credit card company luckily took my side, demanded proof the bus came during the period I was at the bus stop, and the company had nothing. Imagine if they'd just said "sorry" and refunded me the money. I wouldn't be here talking trash about them.

title: Avoid this company
text: Absolute shockingly poor service. We were unable to use our tickets as after waiting over an hour for a bus it arrived full. Driver informed us another would arrive in two hours. Hop on hop off (what a joke). The company refused to refund so technically stole our money and is doing lovely Lisbon a disservice to local tourism. Moira

title: Avoid!
text:
Awful service. We waited almost 1 hour for the bus, a small bus arrived that was completely full. We were told we had to wait another 2 hours for the next one. We didn‚Äôt want to take the chance in case it was full again and the service would be stopping around that time also.

Requested a refund as we spent ‚Ç¨100 on tickets and didn‚Äôt get to use the service at all. Refunds declined.

Save your money and avoid!

title: Terrible waste of money, worst in Europe
text:
Utter rubbish,
If there was a chance to give negative stars I‚Äôd gladly do it.
Bus is falling apart, drivers can‚Äôt drive, can‚Äôt even stop on a red light. Audio doesn‚Äôt work in most of the seats. There is NO description of what we should see so 99% of the time you can‚Äôt understand what to even look at.
Worst experience out of all countries we took a sightseeing bus. Rubbish and a disgrace

title: AWFUL
text: AWFUL. Do not waste your money. We paid 100 euros for our group of five last week, one bus came to the stop and was already full, and we were told it would be 2 hours til the next. Never got to use the bus service since the service stopped a few hours later. No refund since the tour company said it was ‚Äúclearly stated in website that it was every 2 hours‚Äù. How is that hop on hop off? AVOID!

title: Dreadful. Use another tour company
text:
Dreadful. Use another company.
We waited for over an hour for a bus and gave up and walked in the end.
When I complained to the company I was told the wait between buses can be 2 hours so it‚Äôs not ‚Äòhop on hop off‚Äô and simply doesn‚Äôt work as a way to see the city, The buses themselves are tired and we struggled to find any headphone sockets that worked. Even when they did the commentary is so short that I don‚Äôt feel we got to learn about Lisbon at all.
Other buses like Lisbon Sightseeing and Yellow Bus are more frequent so try them instead. And/or get a daily metro ticket - covers the trams as well and the lift too‚Ä¶Lisbon is great but don‚Äôt use this company

title: Total rip off
text: Paid ‚Ç¨54 for 2 tickets. The sound didn‚Äôt work in the ear plugs for the whole journey round and the maps were useless. Therefore you had no idea what was at each stop and whether it was worth getting off the bus. The bus was full so we couldn‚Äôt move seats and other people had the same problem. I emailed them on return to complain but haven‚Äôt heard back from them. Definitely NOT recommended.

title: Lisbon City Sightseeing Portugal
text: Absolutely shocking service. There's hardly any bus stops available and little sight of buses!!! Total waste of money and our precious time! We ended up walking most of the time. I would certainly not recommend this service for seeing the city and surrounding areas. We're used hop on and hop off buses in many cities and have found them excellent but Lisbon service is a disgrace.

title: Appalling service, do not use
text:
The first day we went on the bus,we were shuttled to a centre point to catch the bus we wanted. That was ok. The lady that sold us the tickets told us they were valid for two days. On the second they was nobody at the stand in the terminal and no one outside were we had previously caught the bus. We waited for over half an hour,no bus appeared and nobody from the operator. Finally we decided to have a walk instead.
This was the worst experience of this operator and we were left out of pocket as we did not get what we were promised. We used this operator in maderia and cadiz and the service was excellent. Lisbon you had better pull your socks up as I would not recommend anyone to use you.

title: Poor commentary
text: I have used CitySightseeing Hop On Hop Off buses in a number of cities, and they have been excellent, and well informative. However, not so in Lisbon. The routes, times etc were all good, but the accompanying commentary was awful. It played painful music when they had nothing to say, and what they did say was poor and infrequent. We learned nothing about an extremely old city, when there was so much to tell!!

title: Absolute waste of time and money
text: Absolute waste of time and money. No commentary. The bus only went past each stop every two hours, with no way of knowing what the time-table would be. We had to catch a normal bus to get back.

title: To flee
text:
I would prefer to put 0! After spending ‚Ç¨60 for 2, we receive a QR Code to take the buses
Bus that we wait for more than 30 min at the stops

The first driver gives us a ticket once the QR code is scanned which we do not keep

We made a short trip for a stopover to visit.

What a surprise when I wanted to get back on the bus! The driver didn't let us get back on because we had to show the paper ticket! The online QR code does not work!!!!!

TO FLEE

title: City Sightseeing Lisbon - Red Line Route Tour - RUBBISH
text:
I have never written a negative review about any travel experience but this tour was beyond rubbish!!!

We were on a cruise and apparently on docking days the hop-on-hop off tour bus comes straight to the Lisbon cruise terminal - we thought great - how convenient. What it didn't tell us is that we would sit, in the cold, for nearly an hour before leaving the dockside. Some passengers sat there for 1 1/4 hours. When you only have a few hours in the city this is unacceptable.

Many of us couldn't hear any narration because the systems weren't working. I had to share 1 ear plug from my husbands headset, so that I could hear some narration. It was the worst guide to a city that I have ever encountered. Many of us on the tour hadn't got a clue where we were on the journey and it didn't tell you when you would be stopping and where you were on the route. I actually started my own commentary as we went along to take away the boredom. It actually made folks smile and was the most engaged many of them were the whole tour.

There are a number of tour buses in and around Lisbon and I'm sure some are better than this. Just to reiterate - the City Sightseeing Lisbon has red, green, purple and blue line routes. We did the red route from the cruise terminal.

DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY

(ps this was not a cruise-line organised trip)

title: Can't tell you how bad it was
text:
Terrible service.
I've done countless hoho tour buses all over the world and this one is the worst !

Picked up at cruise port but doesn't return there so be careful.

Commentary is Terrible and not in sync with what you are actually seeing.

THE WORST HOHO EVER ! AVOID

title: Stay away from this hop on hop off buses company
text: Horrible experience!! Last time using this company, buses are old, staff not very friendly but the worst part is the lack of reliability. The frequency is totally off- there‚Äôs no consistency and no way to track the time that buses are passing by in every stop. My mom and I got stuck at the Belem tower stop for hours, the bus never showed up. We had to Uber back to the center of the city. Personal opinion, don‚Äôt waste your money in this company, there are other options to get to see this magnificent and amazing city, Lisbon ü©∑

title: Dangerous driver
text:
So very disappointed. Very hard to find the stop to first get on. Headphones did not work (tried a few ports) so we had no idea where we were or what we were looking at. We joined ¬Ω way round so stayed on to go back to the castle to get off. Drivers changed and the 2nd driver shouldn't be allowed behind a wheel. You could smell the clutch burning. Yes some of the roads are steep and very bumpy but the ride was horrendous, we'd already driven the route once before and no issues so definitely the driver who was also busy talking on the phone (video call) whilst driving.
Think before using this company.

title: Catastrophic
text: I gave 1 because you can't give 0. Absolutely avoid, the buses are crap, the boxes to hear the tour don't work, so if you find space the box doesn't work, the staff is super unfriendly , borderline impolite. I've done this kind of tour in many cities, I've never seen it!

title: Pure scam
text: Most headphone connections are poor. Old-fashioned buses with smooth tires. We changed to a different company afterward and have not regretted it. In conclusion, be very careful with your choice (there are 3 companies) but actually I didn't read the comments before...

title: Worst City Sightseeing Tour Ever
text: Absolute waste of money and time. Joined the red route at the cruise terminal and found very limited content and commentary. Spent most of the time driving with no advice of where we were or sites of interest.

title: Worst hop-on-hop-off bus ever
text: Very old bus with a lot of noise, a fault in the audio guide could only be partially resolved after the driver restarted it several times. It was very drafty and cold in the bus. When changing from the "blue" to the "red" line, we had to wait almost an hour at 8¬∞C (the red line is supposed to run every half hour). Another company has new buses with heating inside and a much higher frequency (3 buses with the same destination/route)

title: It's a scam, don't fall for it
text: It's a mess, they're pickaxes, there's no sufficient bus and the audio is a continuous fado...don't under any circumstances take this line. 100 euros were wasted

title: City sighting on off bus lisbon
text: This was the worse on off bus tour we have taken. Having done 3 previously I was looking forward to this tour. The first thirty minutes we had no commentary. The bus driver rebooted the system and the commentary crackled tgereafter but the music was clear. We tried different seats but no improvement. We were told we would visit the castle but did not. Apparently you had to change buses and pay a separate fare. City Sightseeing ignored my complaint, apparently it was my fault as all the information was on the Internet and I could of used the map. Difficult when we did not know where we were as the stop numbers were not displayed clearly. All in all a very poor tour.

title: Bus trip
text: Map is awful and hard to find bus stops. Stops not marked. Drivers do not stop at stops. Christmas music is played more than any information being given. For ‚Ç¨30 I learnt nothing.

title: Not worth it
text: This was our day of arrival activity to get a feel for the city. We purchased the tickets that covered all the routes and only ended up doing half of one. The audio on the bus didn't work well, and on the seats it did work for, there was very little information provided. There is constant music playing with the information spoken over the music. The information also repeats as the bus doubles back on the route. The audio controls did not work well, and it was hard to get it loud enough to hear. We also waited at a stop for 45 minutes before giving up and leaving. The bus was clean, and the attendants at stop 1 were very kind and helpful.

title: Lisbon hop on hop off bus
text:
4 routes - 3 of which cover the same route, at least partly.
Not a lot to see on the red or purple routes and they take far longer than necessary to do such a short distance.
It rained on the day we used it and we had water coming through the roof/windows and lights.
Most of the headphone jack points not working, and commentary very poor re information given.
Worst city sightseeing bus I have ever used

title: Don‚Äôt do the blue!!
text:
We did the purple and blue routes. Purple was great and went by the coast with great attractions. Blue was too long, very light on content and basically a trip to the old expo park and back.
As with these tours, lack of a real time tracker also meant that 30 mins between buses was a long time.

title: Very disappointing experience, to be avoided!
text:
Very disappointing experience, starting with the gentleman in charge of tickets who is very unpleasant! What followed was no better, we were treated to fado music the whole way, with barely a few explanations from time to time on the locations and monuments we passed.
A useless, expensive and disappointing tour, to be avoided.

title: This hop-on hop-off option should be avoided!
text: You know these tours and the procedures from various cities, but I feel compelled to write something about the Lisbon version here, because unfortunately it falls far short of other tours. We had to constantly swap seats because two speaker systems didn't work on one bench. Sometimes the headphones didn't even fit into the jack and the headphones themselves were also broken, which of course was easy to replace. Two lines constantly drove along the same streets. And there was almost only music playing?! You drove for ages through beautiful areas and weren't told anything. In other cities, you are constantly explained what you are seeing. The green line is driven through the old town in small buses and you should have a strong stomach here. The driver sped up and down through narrow cobblestone streets and rammed the curb several times, so that we had to hold on tight all the time and it smelled of burnt rubber. It was more adventure than sightseeing and seemed anything but safe.

title: An appalling waste of money and saw nothing beautiful in Lisbon
text: Four of us, all adults over 60, paid 27 euros each at the Port in Lisbon, having been approached by their salespeople as soon as we got off our cruise ship, The Britannia. We got on the bus and then sat there for almost an hour - it didn't leave until the bus was full, whilst other tour buses left earlier. We finally got going. The earphones we were given droned Portuguese folk music which was okay for five minutes, but it was constant apart from when we were given some pre-recorded information about various sights - the recording must've been out of sync with the location of the bus though, because none of it made any sense in regard to where we actually were and what we were seeing. After about 20 minutes we got off the bus at the cathedral. We were expressly told that another bus would come in about 20 minutes, or after that it would be an hour. We looked around quickly and were back at the bus stop in 15 minutes. We waited there for almost an hour, but no bus came. We started walking the route that the bus would take. No bus showed and in the heat we ended up walking all the way back to the port and the cruise ship, about a two hour walk. So, to sum up, four people paid 108 euros to sit on a stationery bus for an hour, take a 20 minute awful bus ride of the concrete jungle city streets (nothing pretty) and then get off at the 4th or 5th stop at the church. That was it! If I could get a refund, I would. DON'T GO WITH THE COMPANY CITY SIGHTSEEING LISBOA.

title: City Sightseeing Tours - waste of time and money
text:
City Sightseeing Hop On-Hop Off in Lisbon
One word to describe this hop on-hop off bus tour - RUBBISH!
Actually a few more words - pathetic, rip-off and hugely disappointing!
Started on the Blue Line - driver roared through the town - most uncomfortable - and the commentary was very uninformative - "on your left, a statue", "on your right an old building"...
Changed to the Red Line. The driver kept braking sharply - also very uncomfortable. Absolutely no commentary on the headphones, just a bit of static.
All in all a very disappointing and uninformative introduction to the lovely city of Lisbon - save your money and buy a guide book instead!
P.S.>>> if you sit on the open top deck, look out for the low tree branches - no warnings - they could take your eye out.

title: BAD! RUN AWAY
text:
The worst of my life!
We have used the service all over the world... never seen such degradation: few buses, rude staff, incorrect timetables... book something else!

title: Absolutely to be avoided!
text:
We strongly advise against taking this Hop On Hop Off bus.
Especially the blue line lacks any interest, unless you intend to visit the aquarium. The journey really is very, very unattractive and you will waste your time! If you still opt for taking this bus, take the red line.
Furthermore, if it is raining the roof and windows were not waterproof, causing water leaks along the ceiling, windows, and seats. It was a truly unpleasant experience.
Consider opting for a tuk-tuk or purchasing a bus and tramway ticket. These options provide a more enjoyable transportation experience.

title: Sightseeing Portugal lied to us.
text:
THEY LIED TO US.
Two hours they said. We got on at 9:30 am and enjoyed driving around the city of Lisbon.
At around the two hour mark we turned away from the waterfront where our cruise ship was docked within sight and began climbing into the hills again.
It is now 12:55 and they parked in a bus lot. PARKED.
When we asked when they were gonna take us back to the ship they pointed to another bus. When I asked that driver how long to the ship he said one hour.
ANOTHER HOUR!
I'm done with Lisbon. We had a couple other things on our itinerary other than being held captive on a bus for what will be about 4 hours before we are taken back to where we started.
DO NOT TRUST SIGHTSEEING PORTUGAL IN LISBON.

PS. The driver also broke off a 10 foot long arm sized branch that fell on 4 passengers. Didn't stop. Didn't even ask if they were OK. SMH...

title: Poor experience
text: Information poor, sent on blue line which was 2 hours of nothing, waited over an hour for another bus route, buses not regular and commentary did not work bought a 2 day pass but binned it after day one, had a better day walking

title: AWFUL!!!
text: Awful!!! Don't bother wasting your time and money!!! 45 mintirs wait for a bus to come along and their commentary doesn't work!

title: Poor service
text:
Map for cruise connection is incorrect. Have to get our at 5 rather than 6.
Service is unreliable. App only works on older phones. No information on bus movements available.

title: Don‚Äôt do it!!!
text:
Do not waste your money. Terrible. Blue line is so boring and a waste of time. Commentary is poor.
So disappointed. We also did a tuk tuk tour which was more expensive but sooo much better value.

title: awful
text: We paid 27 euros each for 48 hour access to this 'hop on, hop off' bus and managed to get a grand total of one bus. They were no where to be seen ! I struggle with mobility issues and needed this to get around but we waited for hours in total at various stops. When the buses eventually turned up we were not allowed on them even though there was space. A total waste of money. Do not use this company. I have tried to complain but have been unable to find a way as the website doesnt have Lisbon as an option. We bought the tickets from inside of the cruise terminal so thought it was a legitimate business. Trust me, it is not.

title: Terrible - Portuguese tourist agency you should be ashamed of our first experience of Lisbon
text:
Absolutely terrible, busses every hour. time to get off look round and then have to wait one hour for the next bus. Would take two days to stop at each site if you wanted to get on and off. Guided tour earphones didn‚Äôt work.
Driver was miserable. Wish I had looked at reviews first!

title: Not that good
text: I was a bit disappointed having bought the 2 day 4 line ticket for our party of 3. The Blue line is a waste of time as there is very little of interest on the route and the Purple and Red lines overlap. The Green route is through very narrow through winding streets that would be better walked and the Red coastal route is served by tram. In addition the commentary is sparse and mostly filled with music. If I had my time again I would buy a travel card for ‚Ç¨6.50 per day which gives access to all public transport across Lisbon, including the rickety old trams

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time or money
text:
We could not have been more disappointed than with this ‚Äútour‚Äù. These are the red Lisbon Sightseeing hop on/off buses you see frequently. We purchased our tickets at our hotel and made our way to the ‚Äúbus station‚Äù. We waited 25 minutes for the first bus for the Belem red line tour, which goes riverside. We had paid $26 Euros each.

Once onboard, we quickly learned there are no fans nor A/C on the bus, so try to navigate to a seat with a side window, if it‚Äôs warm. Next, the displays for you to choose your language of choice were so poorly lit, we had to get on our knees to read it. The English translation one was a joke. I felt I was listening to Diego from the Dora the Explorer cartoon. He gave VERY little information about the stops. As an example‚Ä¶‚ÄùMuseums are great places to learn new things‚Äù. Really?? Next, the stops were out of sync with the speaker so you‚Äôd arrive sevminutes later to the clock pointed out previously or try to guess which place had been spoken about . It was so bad. Also, there was music playing the entire time between what little information given. I stopped listening completely.

Last, it was SO bad that few people‚Äúhopped off‚Äù at all, since the stops and information was out of sync. We were concerned that with full buses, we wouldn‚Äôt get a seat on another bus.

I‚Äôd give it a zero, one is too generous.

title: Use another service.
text:
Poor buses. One driver was really aggressive to other used and really didn't care about passenger comfort.

Many of the audio outputs didn't work.

Infrequent services. Others were running 2 or 3 to this one.

title: Worst sightseeing
text:
Drinks are not allowed to be taken away, staff are unfriendly, waiting times are long, guests are mostly old and very unfriendly, it's just not enjoyable under any circumstances!
Otherwise it's actually quite OK.

title: Our experience has been horrible!
text:
The service is horrible! We bought a 72-hour ticket. The bus, which is supposed to run every 20 minutes, doesn't run. We stayed at the stop for 45 minutes waiting. We had time to catch the bus that left for Cascais, but we missed it by 2 minutes because the bus didn't arrive. The boy's response is that the bus always leaves on time, that what we were waiting for was on time. I wanted my money back, but the queue was long and my husband convinced me to take another bus and amazingly... it was supposed to leave at 11:20 and it left at 11:24... two weights, two measures.
The information we had from the driver of this same operator is that the bus would pass at 10:20 am at the stopping point on the other side of the street.
Something is wrong. But if I can give some advice to those of you who are reading, buy from other operators, I wanted to change and I was wrong. I never had a problem with the other, better-known operator!
Ahhh and the delay wasn't just one day and not just once.

title: Use Yellow bus instead!
text: Waited for over an hour and didn‚Äôt see any buses for the blue line (castle). Saw 1 mini bus (as opposed to full length bus) for the green line that was full of course! Take your money and book with yellow bud instead! I‚Äôve used this company in many other cities but Grayline HOHO Lisbon sucks!

title: Too expensive, little information, long waiting times
text:
Not recommended. Waited far too long for the connecting bus. Incorrect or no signage at the stops. The audio guide rarely said anything, so you could mostly hear loud music.
Ok for a rough geographical overview. But nothing more. Better to invest the money in a tuk-tuk driver who knows the area. This trip brings you much closer to Lisbon.

title: Not recommended
text: Last day of holiday spoiled by going on the blue line which is pointless and ugly compared to the rest of beautiful Lisbon then being unable to find any of the poorly marked stops. No timetable available and not that frequent. Both our headphones broken in first hour

title: The Worst Ever
text:
I wish I had read the reviews. They are spot on. The headphones worked intermittently, the volume control didn‚Äôt work so you could barely hear anyway, and there was very little commentary only music.
Save your money and book with one of the other companies.

title: Beware of HOHO bus tours in Lisbon
text:
This is the worst city HOHO tour I‚Äôve ever taken. We began at the cruise ship terminal, charged 27euros each and given a map. The commentary was nonexistent upstairs and intermittent downstairs. Nobody knew where we were as the bus stop numbers fir the red line didn‚Äôt match up with the map provided. Never were we told what actual stop we were on. There was NO air conditioning downstairs and it was 12.30 when we boarded. I told the seller that I wanted to go to the Hard Rockcafe and asked her the stop number before boarding. Was told it was either 14 or 15. It took 2 full hours to get there, looking at boring scenery other than our trip to Belem and that was when we finally had a stop after 90 mins to complain to the driver about not knowing where we were. Everyone onboard was very angry and from the cruise ship. It was a dreadful experience and very expensive fir next to nothing. We walked back to the ship from the Hard Rock Cafe,arriving back at 5.20pm. There was nobody at the information desk to complain to as it was now unmanned.
Be very careful buying HOHO tickets in Lisbon.

title: This is a SCAM not worth the 30Euros per person‚Ä¶.maybe 5.
text:
SCAM, SCAM, SCAM. Only music 99% of the time in the audio guide rather than having a narrative of the city historic landmarks. Not worth the 30 Euros per person.
When we asked the driver his answer was ‚Äúthe route is new and we need to record the new content‚Ä¶.‚Äù

title: Absolutely Terrible
