text: Awful. The music was very bad the place was horrible. When I wanted to go out because I lost my tickets I had to wait until the end and the bouncer pushed me violently when I tried to explain to him that I needed to go out.

title: Awful.
text: Lousy. Being 4 minutes late, they have not let us in and treated us badly and called us high-handed. I never leave a review, but I've been very angry, don't come back.

title: Discrimination
text: Avoid this club at any cost, specially if you're a minority. It happened to me once, they allowed all my friends in but I wasn't allowed. When I asked why, they didn't have me a plausible excuse. The only think that I had different was my skin tone. Let that sink inüòò

title: Tourists avoid
text: Visited last night... 3 English tourist women. First queued in the wrong queue and then got told to move to another. System was confusing. They charged us ‚Ç¨30 entry each to get in which we did think was a lot and now thinking back they overcharged us as we were English. The club was full of very young people I suspect some were underage. Some looked like children. The drink tokens they gave us were for 3 drinks each and they were awful. Tasted like water. When we went to leave the bouncers were asking why and one blocked us briefly which I thought was odd. Would NOT recommend if you're a tourist visiting. From reading other reviews after visiting I'm just glad we didn't have a worse experience.

title: Waiter takes advantage of me
text: Don‚Äôt go to this disco, I do NOT recommend it at all, I had a horrible experience, a bald waiter with a tattoo on his arm was disgusting and touched my ass, yelled and the waiter laughed in my face... I don‚Äôt understand how there can be people like that and less who work with the public.

text: High class shop, with a very grumpy doorman. Want to cheat you out of money because you are a tourist. Terrible tent, don't go!!!

title: Terrible experience
text: Don‚Äôt go into to this nightclub the bouncers will not let you in and discriminate, if there is a group of 3 boys, especially if you are black. They will coerce into buying a table for 300 or 500 euros if you want to go in the nightclub.

title: TERROR TRAUMATIZANTE DE NOITE
text: Fui com um grupo de amigos na Lust in Rio. Um horror de lembran√ßa desse lugar. Est√°vamos numa mesa reservada com direito a consuma√ß√£o. title: Terrible
text: Worst club I have ever been to. They let minors (im talking 14 year olds) in. Terrible. Disgusting environment.

title: A espera de uma resposta
text:
Bom dia,
Espero que como um espa√ßo que deseja crescimento ( ainda mais ) que essa cr√≠tica seja levada a s√©rio e compartilhada (no m√≠nimo) com a equipe de seguran√ßas.
Vou sempre ao Lust, e sempre defendo quando dizem algo sobre o espa√ßo, entretanto ontem tive a falar com um dos seguran√ßas na entrada na qual foi bem simp√°tico e por eu dizer que quase sempre n√£o enfrentava filas me ofereceu a entrada de 12‚Ç¨ e trocou pela de 15‚Ç¨ ( o que n√£o fez grande diferen√ßa, mas pronto) ENTRETANTO logo no fim da festa por volta das 5/6 hrs esbarrei com ele, agradeci e disse que havia gostado da festa, ele muito ousado pegou minha m√£o e esfregou nas suas partes √≠ntimas, eu me assustei e disse ‚Äúei, est√° louco?‚Äù Eu estava com uma amiga e ela n√£o percebeu, chamei para irmos embora porque fiquei muito desconfort√°vel, e contei a ela o ocorrido, ela foi logo chamar aten√ß√£o dele, o que √≥bvio que n√£o foi NADA porque ele riu na cara dela! Afinal o que √© uma mulher chingar um homem e ainda mais seguran√ßa n√£o √©?
Tenho amigos influentes nas redes sociais e n√£o me importaria nada de manchar (novamente) o nome da discoteca, como aconteceu com o caso das seringas! O que espero √© mesmo uma tomada de atitude por parte do Lust.

title: Worst experience ever!

title: What hours are they REALLY open?
text:
I went to their (English language) website, and I couldn't find any information on what hours they're open. I even searched their website using words like "hours" and "open". Their website seems very professional, so it's baffling why they'd omit such crucial info.

So, I got there this morning at 9:15, because Google Maps said they'd be open at 9, and no stores were open, just delivery guys unloading trucks.

text:

Only restaurants and eatery are open.
Since it's pretty far away, not worth it in my opinion.

title: Tourist prices tourist food
text: A real clich√©. Overpriced food and drinks, same fare as you would find anywhere. Manufactured items for evaluated prices. Became a touristy area with prices to match. Maybe it is different in the summer, otherwise I do not know why it has such a high rating.

title: catch stupid?
text: we came for the street art on the walls but mainly restaurants and stores. meh meh, nothing exciting

title: Go only if you wanna eat here!
text: They have a few clothing shops, restaurants, murals on some of the wall, maybe if you have active kids, plenty of room to run around, if you r not eating, don't waste your time, location is a bit out of way. Belem with the Tower, Monastery, Discovery Monument n beach is much better, not to mention Pastel de Belem.

title: Overrated tourist attraction
text: Authentic feel but badly maintained. Bad shops and even worse restaurants. My first and last visit. Very disappointing.

title: Boring and nothing new
text: The truth is that I don't know why this site is so successful. This is a series of clothing or food stores, with prices that are not cheap. In addition, it is quite far from the rest of Lisbon's attractions. It is not worth wasting so much travel time to visit it.

title: AVERAGE‚Ä¶.. ;-(
text: If you have an hour to waste or just to have a drink...the rest isn't really great...we're being sold a bit of the dream in the guides

title: Bof bof !
text: Pas d‚Äôinteret. Pas grand chise √† voir. Pas d‚Äôartisans comme il est dit dans les descritptifs. Quelques boutiques de souvenirs. Aucun interet.

title: Divertente
text: Posto carino e innovativo con differenti proposte di cibo, drink e cibo. Da vedere soprattutto con l atmosfera serale.

title: Tourist trap
text: Tourist trap to the fullest! The idea of it sounded great, but once we got there you can see it screams this is for tourists. Some may love it, but not for us.

title: Worth seeing once
text: That‚Äôs definitely a tourist trap. Worth seeing once? Maybe. Worth spending money here? Not so sure. It‚Äôs interesting to see the graffiti art and enjoy the design itself, but the quality of the food is questionable in the majority of the places.

title: Ca√ßa-turista
text: Super ca√ßa turista. Restaurantes claramente para turistas com pre√ßos salgados. Livraria Ler Devagar √© muito bonita, voc√™ vai ver v√°rias fotos por a√≠ - o que as fotos n√£o mostram √© a camada de p√≥ que cobre os livros.

title: Yawnnnnnnnnn!!
text: In and out of the few shops in 20-30 minutes. Dont waste you time. Might be nice in 5-6 years. Better attractions elsewhere. ( This is NOT not an attraction).

title: Pas n√©cessaire
text: Il y a mieux √† faire √† Lisbonne , une rue avec des restaurants et des bars dans d‚Äôanciens entrep√¥ts avec quelques boutiques. De mon point de vue cela ne vaut pas le d√©tour.

title: Mistreatment
text: The people in this store are very incompetent, they don't know how to treat customers properly, and they don't understand anything about laws, because I bought a kaabo scooter and it broke the steering bar 2 days ago without even an accident, which is a consumer's right. I went to exchange it for another one and was told that I couldn't exchange it, I would have to send it to Spain because it was considered my misuse, and when I started saying that I didn't use it badly and then the aggression started, don't go to this store, it has to close

title: "flea market" = fake
text: Nothing to do with a flea market, just handicrafts, ceramics and clothing. Nice restaurant. Nice reuse of an old factory site.

title: Tourist shopping - this is why I visited Portugal?
text:
A number of small tables or ‚Äúpop up‚Äù (although they are hardly temporary) stores. Some interesting stuff and many places to get some food.

I suppose if you like that sort of thing, then you‚Äôll like this. But there‚Äôs an entire historic city and mom/pop restaurants that need seeing.

title: The 'Trendy' Stale Urine-Scented LX Market
text:
I visited LXMarket last Sunday, and my experience left much to be desired. Upon entering, I was immediately greeted by the faint smell of stale urine, which I assumed was a lingering reminder of the previous evening's binge drinking by LXFactory patrons. The market appeared to be filled with overpriced items that catered to a specific hipster aesthetic. It seemed as though people were pretending to be poor while overindulging in trendy consumerism.

Most of the market stalls offered nearly identical merchandise, characterized by items associated with attention-seeking individuals who want to signal their pretentious personalities by appearing "modern," "unpretentious," and "cool." It appeared as though many of these products were designed to fit a particular photocopied lookalike style.

The entire experience struck me as superficial and contrived. It felt like the market was more about creating a facade or image than offering anything of real value. I couldn't help but notice the irony of people pretending to be poor while purchasing overpriced items. It seemed as though they were trying to adopt a certain aesthetic without truly understanding or embracing the values that should accompany it.

I also couldn't fathom how anyone could justify buying poor-quality, overpriced food in an environment with the persistent background aroma of stale urine.

Overall, my visit to LXMarket was disappointing. It appeared to be a place where people go to put on a show rather than experience anything genuine or authentic. It's a location where individuals can purchase the illusion of being cool, modern, and unpretentious, but ultimately fall short of achieving those ideals.

Additionally, it's worth noting that LXMarket is a reflection of a larger trend towards gentrification and the displacement of working-class communities. The LXFactory area, where the market is located, was once a thriving industrial hub but has transformed into a trendy neighborhood with high rents and expensive boutiques in recent years. This transformation has resulted in the displacement of many working-class residents who used to live and work in the area.

LXMarket, in many ways, symbolizes the negative aspects of what Lisbon has become. It's a place where people can consume the illusion of authenticity while the real authenticity of the neighborhood is being erased.

title: Avoidable
text: More or less a trap: nothing that you can't find around Lisbon, you can easily do without it.

title: In my opinion it‚Äôs a scam
text:
Unfortunately, this museum visit was a major letdown and definitely not worth the price of admission. The exhibitions consisted mostly of uninspired photographs by unknown or amateur photographers, contemporary paintings lacking depth, and low-quality art installations that looked like student projects from a local fine arts academy.

The only redeeming feature is the building itself ‚Äî a stunning piece of architecture that blends beautifully with the coastal landscape and complements the nearby bridge in a truly striking way. But you can admire that from the outside for free, which I would highly recommend over paying to go inside.

Save your money and enjoy the view from the outside.

title: Negligible
text: In my opinion it is not really worth it, there is nothing of architecture, except the structure itself, very nice to see outside, but it is not worth paying the ticket to see a fairly insignificant contemporary art exhibition and reproductions of a boiler and a hydroelectric plant

title: No
text:
Pretty lame museum. Hole of uc.

Plenty of room for two or three pictures that anyone can take.

All the opposite of the Macau Museum which is: very dense and interesting.

So museum to avoid. And if you look at the admission price: to flee

title: Crazy rejection
text:
Maybe I prefer classical art like Caravaggio, Monet, Van Gogh, but also modern art, if we talk about Warhol, De Chirico, etc.
Here were his exhibitions one on plays of light and shadow projections... the other huge canvases hung with a jumble of colors...
Lost time üò©

title: Not really worth the money for what it is
text: The modern building was beautiful but once inside the exhibits were not really worth writing home about however the older, former water plant building next door was much better. I would have spent more time in there but the friend I was with was not enjoying it as much as I was

title: Bad art
text: It's mostly technology. This exhibition is quite exciting and well done. Art is a little short. The modern museum or gallery is small and unfortunately shows the works of a completely unknown American "artist" who apparently thinks she can replace quality with quantity. Really rarely seen such bad art.

title: Unfortunately, a visit is not worth it
text: Interesting architecture. But unfortunately, the visit is not worth it. Very disappointingly small variety of exhibitions. Looking from the outside and going to the observation deck is completely enough.

title: Don't waste your time here
text:
This muesum has two buildings; a modern building and an old brick building. As of this date, the modern one has just two exhibits. Some art kids painted on canvas. A second that is a little more interesting that used light and screens in a dark room.

The second building has some art. And, there's a large walking tour of steam powered electric power generation. Many of the motors are cut open for viewing the inner parts of these turbines.
But, the tour is not well marked, no arrows on the floor, there's no guide to explain things. Easy to get lost among the huge boilers and coal pits, as we did. It's not worth the 11 euro per person.

title: Not acceptable
text: The museum's website said it was open on December 25, and it even made me buy tickets. I went there and it was closed. Such a thing is unacceptable

title: Disappointed
text:
I long wanted to visit Maat, regretted. The most interesting is on the outside.
By purchasing the ticket you can also visit the old electricity museum, which has better content than the Maat.

title: Evidence that exterior counts!
text: The highlight is clearly the exterior, both the new as well as the old building. Save the money of the entrance fee and enjoy the exterior!

title: boring. do not go inside. cool building
text: super boring. nothing to see. wasted 10‚Ç¨ for fake woke bull. exhibits were made by a child who discovered internet for the first time. my grandma wouldve made a better exhibition on african culture and she is from the balkans.

title: 11 Euros poorer and a half hour older. Another flashy building with nothing in it.
text:
Seriously- The first building is just a power plant. Pipes and boilers and stuff. They did a heck of a job painting and polishing it, but it's just a power plant. I spent two minutes looking at stuff, and 18 minutes looking for the exit.

The gallery building featured a drum circle covered with a macrame tent, and a second room with framed random Polaroids. In and out in five minutes.

It's not just the money I was conned out of though- it's the precious hours of my holiday time getting there and back

11 Euro and my afternoon for this? Don't be a sucker like me.

title: Very disappointing. But nice view from the outside. Only visit the Electricity part!
text:
We visited both museums, that is, the electricity building that was quite interesting and beautiful from the inside and outside, and the modern art museum, that was really worthless and deceiving.
The building of the MAAT is quite amazing, specially when you're standing on the top of it, with a beautiful view. But, the exhibition there was, except the percussion part, really unadapted for young children (the pictures), and there was even a very disrespectful comment about Marine le Pen in one of the pictures shown (regardless of the fact that I like her or not).
The colors exhibition was of no interest at all. Art is a question of taste, for sure, but this cannot even be considered art. We were very disappointed and deceived by the art propositions in such a beautiful and respected city as Lisboa.
I do not recommend the restaurant at the MAAT itself either. Extremely expensive and the Caesar salad was very dull and simple. For 16‚Ç¨ we expected more than just green leaves and a bit of chicken. And 3,5‚Ç¨ for a tiny bottle of water is also robbery.

title: Beautiful building. Poor in art.
text: A very nice building on the outside and inside, but a trifle of exhibitions. They call it architecture and the one at the entrance couldn't tell me why. The one with interesting engineering, but difficult for lay people to understand. And art doesn't even look ji is expected.

title: MAAT is not recommended
text: What could be disappointing about art, architecture, and technology? I don't know how they did it, but this was probably the worst museum I've ever visited. The building itself is beautiful! But there was nothing inside either of the two buildings to make it worth the trip. I know that the architecture of Portugal is stunning but none of that was featured in the museum. The technology might be a nerd's delight but seeing all those steam engines and power generators were boring to me. I do not recommend this museum.

title: Not worth a visit
text: Expected more architecture, but only the museum is the architecture piece. Art was displayed in the basement but exhibition was only the underwater reefs photography. Technology was found in the Tepco power station but only focused on Energy. Overall felt it was not worth 12 euros per person entry ticket

title: Huge disappointment.
text:
Museum of Arts changing collection, there is just the basement with some underwater photos and color gradients that are not very understandable. At the electricity museum in the old electrical factory, the first floor with the turbines and alternators was closed to visitors because...privatized for a party with boom boom music. An absolute shame!
Matt reimbursed us for the ‚Ç¨34 ticket due to this scandal. This is unfortunately not an exception in Europe.

title: A FREE TICKET
text:
I've been wanting to visit MAat for some time now, more specifically the Joana Vasconcelos exhibition...I was a little disappointed. Although there was an interview with her... there was no paper support, just a leaflet in English, nor audio support. Not even a QR code to use with your cell phone to be able to enjoy a visit more informative
It was a FREE TICKET, with little to retain and in my opinion not very comprehensive.

title: Fraud
text: On the day of the visit, the weather was bad and half of the exhibition was closed. There was no refund of the value of the tickets or advance information, nor the possibility of using the tickets for another day

title: Horrible and disastrous bordering on ridiculous
text: A place where you really can't judge a book by its cover, since it has a beautiful facade with a stunning view of the river from the roof for free and while inside it's proof that art is no longer made like it used to be with pieces of anything for people who think they are artists! In addition to unnecessary apologies made as "freedom of expression", which is actually an incentive for the practices represented by so-called "works"

title: Horrible
text: Worst exhibition ever seen by the ‚Äúartist‚Äù Joana Vasconcelos. Absolutely horrible. They should pay us to watch this‚Ä¶

title: MAAT - A communications disaster.
text: We were really looking forward to seeing this on our recent visit to Lisbon. The architecture of the buildings was beautiful but the main galleries were closed - just a few bits and pieces to see in the Power station. What made this so annoying was that we visited on Sunday and were told that the main gallery was closed that day for a event but we could visit the Power Station. We returned later in the week to be told the main galleries were closed for refurbishment. None of this is communicated anywhere. Website makes no reference to this. Tourist offices have not been informed. It does take a bit of effort to get there so it was very frustrating. Even when you get there there is no signposting so finding the entrance itself is an effort. Five stars for the architecture but zero for the management and the communications.

title: The place is CLOSED!!!
text:
The place is CLOSED!!!
There was nothing about it on the website. We bought tickets on their website without any information that it was closed. Traveled far to get there. Then it was closed. When we asked how we could get the money back for the tickets, they said we could use the tickets at another museum that looks like a technical museum. We were not interested in another museum. Money out the window

title: Disappointing visit to Maat
text: The structure is very particular and offers a beautiful view of the Tagus river but inside the museum only offers an exhibition on plastic recycling and the other building houses the machinery of a former power plant which is not interesting to me

title: Modest art? No thank you!
text: Exceptional view, superb architecture. Very pleasant caf√©, with friendly staff and very welcome beer in front of the Tejo at sunset. One detail: the contents are very lacking (which for a contemporary art museum is no small problem!!). The installations of "modest art" are truly unworthy of such a noble place, despite the admirable efforts of the curators...Why not put a little more effort into finding works that are worth the price that visitors pay for the ticket?

title: Geen aanrader
text: Wij vonden dit museum echt een flop. Van buiten prachtig en bovenop een mooi uitzicht. Flink stuk gelopen om er te komen, maar van binnen stelt het vrij weinig voor. Strenge beveiliging. Tassen moeten in een kluis. Hele aparte kunst, niet onze smaak. Op internet leek het heel wat voor te stellen, maar ik zou er lekker langs lopen en van het uitzicht bij de kust genieten.

title: Don't waste your money
text: We were bored to tears. The art was unimaginative and there was an exhibition on plastic which was extremely dull. The second building had a tour of some large steam boilers, which was about as interesting as it sounds.

title: Une super coquille vide
text: Une coquille vide ... le mus√©e para√Æt superbe de l ext√©rieur mais l expo ... jouets et explication ecologique du plastique (c est connu depuis 15 ans) ... vide ... par contre tr√®s le point de vue est superbe ... se poser au caf√© du mus√©e avec le pont du 25 avril en panorama c est grandiose ...

title: Mehr Schein als sein, man muss es sich SCH√ñN trinken.
text:
Absolute Entt√§uschung. Wir waren schon in sehr vielen Museen in Nord- und Mitteleuropa, aber haben noch nie so wenig gesehen/erlebt. Schade, die Geb√§ude von au√üen haben viel versprochen aber wenig gehalten.

Das rote alte Geb√§ude wird wohl Elektroingenieure ansprechen oder alle die im Kraftwerksbereich unterwegs sind und gerne Schaltpl√§ne lesen.

Das ‚ÄûKunstmuseum‚Äú bietet nur 2 R√§ume, in einem steht/h√§ngt wenig drinnen und im anderen eigentlich nichts. Vielleicht sollte man davor ausreichend Sangria oder Portwein zu sich nehmen und sich die Ausstellung ‚Äûsch√∂n‚Äú trinken.

Investiert das Geld lieber in der Markthalle, die bietet auch Architektur und guten Geschmack.

title: The most awful museum ever!
text: The worst museum experience ever! Totally incoherent and poorly organized. It was next to impossible to find the entrance. I crossed the footbridge, saw no sign whatsoever pointing to the ticket counter. I wandered haphazardly and found the entrance to one building. They staff were incapable of pointing me to the entrance to the former power station building. When I finally found the other entrance, I hadn‚Äôt noticed the ticket office off to one side, easy to overlook. I presented my ticket at the labeled ‚Äúentrance‚Äù and was told I had to go upstairs to have my ticket scanned for entry. Basically I spent 20 minutes trying to find how to get inside, and only 20 minutes inside, since there was virtually nothing to see but a few random ‚Äúcontemporary‚Äù art installations that held no interest whatsoever. Complete waste of time and money.

title: The absolute worst bar none
text: This museum was a dumpster fire. Literally awful. The building itself is a beauty to behold. Stunning. I was expecting something about architecture or at least beauty inside. Instead what I got was disgusting interactive exhibits on war protests and utter nonsense. Totally a waste. The worst museum I have ever been to.

title: Spild af tid
text: V√¶rste museum jeg nogensinde har bes√∏gt. Fuldst√¶ndig ligegyldig udstilling og stort set intet at se.

title: Gebakken lucht
text: Dichte zalen, geen liften (afgesloten), heel kleine tentoonstellingen. Prachtig design gebouw, aan de binnenkant teleurstellend.

title: Nada de arte, vergonzoso.
text: Edificio vistoso pero inc√≥modo, lleno de escaleras , mal se√±alizado, dividido, para pasar de uno a otro hay que salir (a veces bajo lluvia) y no est√° clara la entrada al siguiente. ¬øArte? Cero. Otro eslab√≥n m√°s del fraude que significa el 95% del auto proclamado "arte contempor√°neo". Dec√≠a Horacio que "una obra de arte es un poema sin palabras". Pues aqu√≠ hay s√≥lo palabrer√≠o que intenta desesperadamente justificar la ausencia total de talento y t√©cnica en quienes pretenden ser artistas y curadores simplemente militando en alguna causa o teniendo amigos que les facilitan indebidamente exponer. ¬°Qu√© p√©rdida de tiempo y dinero! No pongo duraci√≥n recomendada porque no recomiendo la visita.

title: Vraiment d√©√ßus de l'int√©rieur des b√¢timents !
text:
La note concerne l'int√©rieur des deux b√¢timents en rapport avec le tarif d'entr√©e.
Nous nous sommes fait pi√©ger par le nom "Mus√©e d'architecture et de technologie" ! Le mus√©e est divis√© en deux parties : le b√¢timent futuriste (expositions d'oeuvres modernes pour le c√¥t√© "Art" (pas beaucoup √† voir, pas de lien entre les expos) et l'ancienne usine √©lectrique voisine (donc, vous visitez...une ancienne usine, repeinte certes, mais qui ne nous a pas vraiment int√©ress√©e).
Tout √ßa pour la modique somme de 9e/pers (notre Lisboa Card de 72h avait expir√©).
Comme l'a dit Chloedo28, le meilleur du mus√©e est √† l'ext√©rieur. Du toit du MAAT √† la forme arrondie et sympa (dans l'espace public), vous pourrez admirer le pont du 24 juillet au coucher de soleil.

title: Waste of money
text: Unless you are into modern and bizarre art, don‚Äôt waste your money. The best of MAAT is seen from the outside for free. Interesting looking building and nice view from the roof‚Ä¶both free.

title: Very disappointing
text: Praised by tour guides, the Museum of Contemporary Art in Lisbon is particularly disappointing: poor collections, almost no works by the great contemporary masters, huge spaces almost empty. No point. For ‚Ç¨15, you are also entitled to the adjoining "architecture center" (not to be confused with the MAAT), simply lamentable.

title: If you like this sort of art, great.
text:
For me personally, I didn't like it. Most of the exhibits were too abstract for me. A canvas where most of it is just black paint with bits of something on the edge doesn't classify as art in my mind.
The architecture part was a single section with exhibits that seemed to have little to do with buildings or design. One exhibit was a tv screen with men making odd noises.
I hoped for much more varied works, so I'm somewhat disappointed.
There was a very helpful lady who directed me to the loo, but most staff seemed too cool for school.

title: Negative value for money
text:
Value for money-negative price
The museum currently has a closed section. Some noteworthy work related to pop art, but otherwise not worth it. Cost ‚Ç¨15 adults too much for what it offers, 7.50 students

title: Parking mess
text: Parking lot only accepts cash--not terribly "contemporary". No ATMs nearby. Wasted an hour just trying to get out of the lot!

title: Disgusting and disturbing!
text: This so called art exhibition included a photograph of a man masturbating, a picture of a naked woman with a fresh scar from having a surgery for ectopic pregnancy, a picture of a naked pregnant woman lying on what looked like a prison floor, two men hanging by their tongues. It was a more a display of dehumanisation than of ‚Äòart‚Äô. Not one piece evoked any uplifting emotion. Do not take children to this exhibition!

title: Don‚Äôt bother - weird place and unfriendly staff
text: Don‚Äôt bother. Staff rude, very dismissive, sold us tickets, did not ask if we wanted to pay in pounds or euros- charged us in pounds (more expensive) You should airway pay in local currency. We asked for an Audio guide. They said they did not have one. Turned out it was broken so we could not understand much about the exhibits. We looked for the Jackson Pollocks, which appeared on the leaflet, when we asked where his works were she told us, at the end, that his stuff had gone to another museum- this was one of the few things we wanted to see. There were 2 Picasso paintings, a few Andy Warhols, but apart from that it was weird. ‚Ä¶.if you like looking at torn cushion covers which people think is ‚ÄòArt‚Äô then go ahead. Cafe also expensive, but comfortable and bright. Waste of time and money in our opinion.

title: Disappointing
text:
Extremely disappointing.
Except the top floor which presents some interesting works.
Two-thirds of the museum is empty.
It remains art so my review is subjective but I advise against ++

title: The masquerade
text:
A beautiful museum, interesting artists.
The place is well maintained, the staff is friendly.

At the end of the tour, we decided to drink at the museum caf√©. The milkshake looked good, nothing was less true!
So began the descent into hell...
After an exorbitant Award and long waiting minutes, a certain Pedro decided to ambush us. This drink was nothing but a pancake dough disguised as milkshake.

Yes! You will not believe us, but the milkshake had to be cut with flour and egg white. (Photo attached). Poor Pedro had indeed made the wrong career and had probably interned a few weeks earlier at the local Pasteleria. We then left these milkshakes behind, alone, attracting no one but Pedro who must have made good pancakes. It is with sadness and disgust that we strongly advise you to avoid this place.

The terrace was empty, so there was a reason...

title: Awful
text: Everybody very rude! Waste of money!!!Don t waste your time there are other museums much more important!!!!just ignore it

title: More like B or C category and unfriendly
text: Everything B to C - unfriendly staff - the museum obviously prefers that groups go through without explanations. You are not allowed to explain things to your friends. Unbelievable.

title: Your choice
text: What is modern? The definition is worth asking to you by you before you step inside. We found no answers to that question inside here.

title: Not open during stated hours
text: Business states open Sunday 10-6. Spent $20 on Uber to show up at 4 pm and it‚Äôs closed with no sign. Needs to keep online presence updated with correct hours

title: As a bad employee, in the middle of a good team, you can lose everything.
text:
I've been to this place for the entire month of October 2024, almost every day. It is the same as saying that I left there about 300 euros (or more).
I will not again put my feet there, due to the incredible lack of education, of notion, of ways, of knowing to be of a single employee.
I get up from my seat and go to the payment box. Once there, the individual in question asks me: "What was it for?" This, after I go there daily, as I already mentioned, and I always have a routine behavior. When I say I was in the box, naturally, to pay, I hear on the other side: "I'm not guessing, I'm not a witch!" From then on, the level was always going down. Inacredit√°vel. Do all bar employees have divinatory powers except for him? It can only be that, since this situation had never happened to me in all other times, with all the other colleagues of this little character. Nothing to say about the rest of the team working there. Too bad to have this rotten apple there.

title: Dov‚Äôera?
text: Non siamo riusciti a partecipare. Cliccando su ‚Äúottieni indicazioni‚Äù ci ha portato da tutt‚Äôaltra parte. Sarebbe meglio verificaste questa cosa. Chiesto il rimborso ma √® stato rifiutato

title: Safety concerns
text: We were very disappointed with this tour. Our driver Daniel made us feel concerned about our safety. It was raining very hard. Raining so hard that other drivers had their flashers on and were driving slower. Daniel was driving too fast for our comfort level and was texting! When we asked him to please stop texting, he got very indigent and brushed off our concerns. He did stop texting after we firmly insisted that he stop. I think Daniel is in the wrong job.

title: Very bad
text: Don't go there, they are capable of ruining the wedding because they don't know how to deal with emergencies, everything is terrible, disgusting organization

title: Poor Experience with Marlin Lisbon
text:
Unfortunately we had a poor experience with Marlin. The young staff (crew) were pleasant and great, but management and administration was very poor. Staff were disorganized and we were ultimately ushered on to the wrong, older, smaller and poorly maintained boat - and at no reduction. When we returned from the two-hour tour, the office staff were gone (9pm). The boat was old, dirty, and poorly maintained. The lavatory was gross. The few, gentle follow-up messages sharing of our dissatisfaction were met with no response. The company seems bent on taking advantage of tourists to Lisbon.
This is the first time I‚Äôve ever written a negative review, but I‚Äôll wish to save others similar disappointment. Find an alternative, good experience and enjoy!

title: Disappointment with Lisbon Serviced Apartmenrs
text:
A big disappointment with Lisbon Serviced Apartmenrs for the mercenary way of treating guests.
I had the car broken down in the parking lot of the place which is extremely tight. I paid in advance for 4 days (80 Euros), but only left 2. Still on site, I requested the refund for the other 2 days, since I did not leave the car there anymore. They did not answer my request and said that this request was only made by email. When I sent the email, they invented the story that the email had to be sent on the date of my refund request. Just shit excuses.
At Lisbon Serviced Apartmenrs the customer is never right!

title: Move on, tourist trap, exorbitant price, there's better elsewhere!!!
text: For tourists, 2 cakes bought at a stand, no prices displayed (like many stands) and 9‚Ç¨ for 2! Already one which should have been chocolate as requested was not and the donuts look like the ones from the day before, 2 saleswomen who take 10 minutes to serve you, in short to avoid especially since there are better elsewhere and cheaper , total scam for foreigners. To avoid it is advice

title: Disappointment
text: I went forty minutes and arrived waiting to eat a good cod. I ordered a cod to Br√°s in PETISCAR had no taste of anything, it was pure potato straw baginho. It was just a disappointment.

title: much to do about nothing

In any case, you should not sell ham that is too old and dry!!!!

title: Homofobia Alert
text:
Local HOMOF√ìBICO/ HOMOFOBIA ALERT.

While I was attending a musical concert after having dinner at the aforementioned market, I was approached by a barmaid if I wanted any more drinks, I said no thanks.
In my naivety I thought the bar was going to close and that I was passing by the tables asking that question. But no, there were many more people without drinks who were in the place without drinks on the table. Then an elderly man addresses me in a loud voice and tells me that if I don't consume I have to go out and that I have to behave, this "bad behavior has to do with the fact that I have my arm resting on someone's shoulder." another man and we exchanged a few kisses with respect. The guy who is the father of the owner of the place called the security guard and disappeared from the scene. I called the police and filed a complaint with the authorities. Sexual discrimination is a crime in Portugal. Do not visit this place due to homophobia of the owners.

Estando eu a assistir a um concerto musical depois de ter jantado no referido mercado, sou abordado por uma empregada do bar se eu queria mais alguma bebida, disse que n√£o obrigado.
Na minha ingenuidade pensei que o bar ia fechar e que estava a passar pelas mesas a fazer essa pergunta. Mas n√£o, havia muitas mais pessoas sem bebidas que estavam no local sem bebidas na mesa. Depois um senhor de idade dirige-se a mim de voz alta a dizer-me que se n√£o consumo tenho de sair e que me tenho de comportar, isto do "mau comportamento tem a ver com o facto de estar de bra√ßo apoiado no ombro de outro homem e trocamos alguns beijos com o respectivo decoro. O fulano que √© pai do dono do local chamou o seguran√ßa e desapareceu de cena. Chamei a pol√≠cia e apresentei queixa √†s autoridades. Descrimina√ß√£o sexual √© crime em Portugal. N√£o frequentem este local pela homofobia dos familiares/donos.

title: Disappointment
text: We, who are regulars of the beautiful markets of the west of France, with very well stocked Halles, were very disappointed by these halls, very touristy and rather small.

title: Heel klein en weinig sfeer
text: Wij snappen niet zo goed wat mensen hier te gek aan vinden. Het is echt heel erg klein en in de omgeving ook verder vrij weinig te bezoeken. Wij waren er in de ochtend en liepen er zowat alleen. Totaal geen sfeer. Vanuit tram 28 hier gekomen. Daarna via het cactuspark richting LX factory gelopen. Dat is wel een leuke route

title: Servi√ßo inadmiss√≠vel
text: Servi√ßo inadmiss√≠vel. Vigilante e seguran√ßa mal educado e rude, expulsou me do local ap√≥s terminar de comer. N√£o me deu livro de reclama√ß√µes depois de o exigir. Est√° na lei!

title: Not worth a trip
text: Just a crowded, hot food court. There are so many other places to visit, I'd avoid! Long lines for even a drink... We went to visit the Feira da Ladra and Mercado de Santa Clara, both of which were hot, disappointing, not remotely scenic... Avoid and visit scenic neighborhoods near the water!

title: Exaggerated prices. I do not recommend.
text: Prices are too high, in some cases, twice as high as on other surfaces. To avoid if you don't want to be fooled.

title: Disappointing
text:
We are giving this tour 1 star‚Äîand only because of two positives:

1. The optional boat ride through the caves was stunning and a highlight.
2. Our driver, In√™s, was punctual, kind, and handled a difficult situation with professionalism and care.

The tour experience was extremely disappointing and completely misrepresented. According to the description, we were supposed to visit: Algar Seco, Boneca Cave, Benagil Cave, Praia da Marinha, Praia Dona Ana, the historic town of Lagos.

Instead, all we did was the boat tour, which we could have booked ourselves, and then followed the boat captain‚Äôs lunch recommendation. That was it. No other stops, no guided itinerary, and no visits to any of the promised beaches or landmarks.

This was also the driver‚Äôs first time doing the tour, and she had not been given any instructions. As we left Lisbon, she had to call the office to ask where to go and what the day‚Äôs plan was. She was simply told, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a private tour‚Äîjust do whatever the guests want.‚Äù We were never informed that we‚Äôd need to plan the day ourselves.

This was not a curated experience‚Äîit was a self-guided day with a driver, and not at all what was advertised. Had we known this, we could have saved money by hiring a private driver and booking the boat directly.

The operator should issue a partial refund for false advertising.

title: Awful service.
text: You have to buy a card to get into a locked area. Then you have to use the card to get out. My card let me in allright at the Restauradores station but didn't wanna let me out!? Some employee was sitting in a booth but just gestured me angrily away when I approached him for help. In the end I had to do like in NYC in the 80s and jump over the gate. Thought the guy would come screaming after me but no. Just watched me with a bored look. Passersby were also like zombies. What a weird city this is.

title: Disappointing
text: Among the worst I have ever tried, little understandable purchase rechargeable card, the employees do not give explanations, indeed they make up stories about residual credit.

title: Nefarious staff
text: We have spent a few days in Lisbon as a family, and an extraordinary city with excellent people. The worst the subway staff. Poor manner and unhelpful. Especially last Thursday, August 22nd at 10.30am, 11am in the Parque station next to the Central Park Hotel in Lisbon, Mr q was in the booth next to the ticket machines, q is supposed to be there to help, we tried to ask for information and help with the tickets, but I totally ignored us, not even decent to answer q could not help or something. I pass us absolutely, watching only for himself with a bad book education. It should be somewhere else and not in front of the public. FATAL LISBON METRO WORKER

title: No sales consultants at some stations
text: Be careful take several tickets when you are a family and not a single card.transportation clean enough. Very easy to navigate

title: Fraut ticketing system
text: The payment system on the metro is a an absolute joke. We paid 4 times for trips and the cards wouldn't work correctly. I was with my daughter once of these times and made the mistake of going through the barrier just in front of her. Her credit wouldn't work. So she was sick the other side. She went to the ticket office to sort it out. There was a queue but peopke keep queue jumping. When she got to the front nobody spoke English. She didn't know how to use the ticket machine to try topping up again. She tried to use two of my debit cards which work everywhere else in Lisbon & worked fine to charge me the money they took for trips we didn't make 4 times. I suspect either the cardboard tickets they give you are rubbish and keep failing or its a get rich quick scheme. Either way, it's extremely annoying.

title: Very long times in between trains
text:
12 minutes or more waiting for the train.
This waiting time is sometimes even longer.
This is happening now on a regular basis, not randomly.

title: Very long times in between trains
text:
Very slow ‚Ä¶ at rush hour 10 minutes or more waiting for the train.
This is happening now on a regular basis, not randomly.

title: Pior experi√™ncia da minha vida
text: A n√≠vel europeu √© provavelmente o pior sistema de metro que existe. Fiquem o mais longe poss√≠vel deste servi√ßo, principalmente linha verde em que circulam metros de 3 carruagens para centenas de pessoas‚Ä¶ resultado? Lutas di√°rias entre pessoas das mais variadas faixas et√°rias para entrar no metro. Acabam por entrar obviamente os ‚Äúmais espertos‚Äù sendo que os mais debilitados tem obrigatoriamente de esperar pelas proximas.

title: Scammers and thieves
text:
The worst public transport!
At the first visit, we bought two tickets in the machine at the airport (until we were waiting 15mins in the queue) and the machine gave us only one. So we had to buy another one. After second purchase, the machine gave us also second ticket from the first payment. So we ended with three tickets.
At the second visit, we bought tickets online. The metrolisboa.pt website redirected us to the portalviva.pt website. We choose two 3-days daily tickets and proceed the payment. No confirmation after the payment only the cart with out tickets was shown. The tickets should have come to an email. It is already 5th day, and nothing came. We were calling to the contact support, but the voice was recorded and it was only in Portuguese. We texted an email to contacto@navegante.pt, but few mins later we received an email from their email server that email box is full. It is really sad that public transport of such a big city supports scammers!
They robbed us for our money (in 4 days we spent for public transport in that horrible city almost 80 EUR).
Even when we bought daily tickets at the machines, after some while we realised the tickets are not valid everywhere! There are more public transport providers with different types of tickets and we had no idea which connection we can use and which not! We came to the station, waited 15 minutes for bus, and when in finally came, we found out at the bus driver, that our ticket is not valid. So we had to find another station and another way to our destination.
Except all of these, the metro goes very rarely. We came to the Alameda station on the way to the airport around 7AM during work week and waited almost ten minutes! Once we even couldn't get inside due to mass of people inside!

title: Falta de higiene nas carruagens
text:
Segunda feira uma crian√ßa vomitou numa das carruagens, para grande admira√ß√£o minha e por coincid√™ncia, 2 dias depois entro na mesma carruagem e continua por limpar.

Linha azul. Pergunto-me qual ser√° a regularidade com que limpam as carruagens.

title: TERRIBLE, STAY AWAY
text: As a local and user of the metro in the last two decades, I must say the metro is terrible and is currently unusable due to construction works. STAY AWAY!!

title: Disagi
text: La linea funziona discretamente e collega gran parte della citt√†. Peccato che l'accesso non sia del tutto agevole. Poche sono le fermate con ascensori e scale mobili. Chi ha un passeggino o un carrozzina prova grandissimo disagio ad accedervi. Peccato

title: Guasti perenni di ascensori e scale mobili
text: Scale mobili e ascensori guasti sono una tortura per anziani o inabili costretti a fare le scale ma anche per bimbi in carrozzina

title: Metro is a inexpensive way to travel as well as the Urban trains.
text: Transportation in Portugal was a bit of a problem since we are older and need water closet more often than when we were younger. The metro bathrooms were out of order at every station we stopped. We used the flixbus to go to Evora, the bus station nor the bus had working restrooms. We used the Rossio train station to go to Sintra, which was an organized transport system with a clean water closet.

title: Pre buy is a SCAM
text:
Metro system itself is efficient and clean.But tickets purchasing and service is a scam. I simply paid and LOST more than EUR 35.
They have a pre purchasing system at THEIR website, that redirects to another portal, afterwards understood that other company, what for me makes no difference at all as they wanted to explain me.
I pre purchased tickets for my arrival, to pick at airport up.
When I went ( and need to queue anyhow, so no benefit), machine showed expired tickets. Staff person was by chance already with me and saw it. Around 30 min and 6 metro staff members discussing and making phone calls and no solution. Just that I needed to reach Metro AND the other company to request reimbursement. So paid again for tickets. Reached in written both companies. From Metro got an automatic email reply telling they would reach me back ( almost a week now and nothing) From the other company NOTHING.
So money lost in a scam.
DON‚ÄôT use the pre buy. Queue ( and long) at the airport and buy on the machines.
Not honest service and NO replies

title: NO LIFTS WORKING ON THE METRO - DO NOT GO THERE IF YOU ARE DISABLED
text: Although potentially a good Metro system there were virtually NO lifts working on most of the system when we visited. Only a few stations have escalators and these only serve some of the levels. According to the staff in our hotel the lack of working accessability has been going on for a long time - a useless Metro system even if you are only partially disabled

title: Please, do not go
text: I've known Metro and a half for around 40 years (maybe more). It was a nice and intimate bar, a nice place to be with someone you know or friends. I hadn't been there for many years. I went there a few days ago and what a huge disappointment, the Metro and a half has been transformed into a strange thing, between the tavern and who knows what, bar is definitely not the case. Lots of light, huge tables for dining, nothing but absolutely nothing reminds you of the beautiful bar it used to be. A horror

title: Weak, weak, weak
text:
The space where the minigolf is installed is no more than an old commercial building where the pistes were installed. When we went the day was raining and the space was completely crowded. Therefore, although it is necessary to make a reservation there is no restriction of access. It is difficult in these conditions to play with children restlessly when there are 5 people in front of you on any track and when it is in your turn there are 5 already waiting.
The cherry on the top of the cake was right at the beginning when at the reception we asked for information and the lady didn't even know to speak Portuguese and asked us to speak in English which we obviously refused. We had to wait to call a Brazilian lady who apparently was the only one who spoke Portuguese in that space. Simplesmente lament√°vel.

title: Bad.
text: Completely desolating, nothing to do with the exposed on the site. Bad service to scratch the intimidating to "almost" demand the consumption on site. Site with many positive reviews because they offer shots in exchange for the same.

title: Not good.
text:
found this experience to be underwhelming and not worth the price. Many of the levels felt repetitive and basic, with little variation or creativity. While the Light Room was visually interesting, the overall design of the levels lacked excitement‚Äînothing moved or provided any real challenge.

One of the biggest disappointments was that after completing a round, the ball was taken away, so there was no chance to replay or even attempt a rematch with my partner. It felt like the experience ended too quickly, leaving no opportunity for a bit of fun competition.

Compared to other mini-golf courses I‚Äôve visited, where the stations were unique, challenging, and allowed for multiple rounds, this one fell short. For the price, I expected much more, and unfortunately, I can‚Äôt recommend it. Too expensive for what it is.

title: Nothing recommended

title: Claustrophobic and expensive!

Staff was friendly but the mini golf course wasn‚Äôt great and overpriced a few holes you just used your hands to throw the ball

The neon part was cool but not worth the price

title: Lament√°vel

Cobrar 5,00‚Ç¨ por pessoa √†s 21:00 sem informar que este roof top n√£o tem nenhumas condi√ß√µes para receber pessoas nem de dia quanto mais √† noite, acho uma roubalheira!
Uma ventania gigante; sem ilumina√ß√£o; sem um banco corrido ou qualquer outro tipo de assentos.

title: Los hay mejores.
text: Es bastante mejor las vistas desde el de Santa Lucia, adem√°s el d√≠a de nuestra visita pr√°cticamente ocupado por rodaje de TV

title: Too many people to enjoy a piece if the view
text:
Unfortunately, a large section of the viewing area was obscured by construction at the time I was there, so it's a temporary issue - I hope.
The fully occupied tables and chairs were set up close to the edge, so that standing right by the edge for a moment's view was uncomfortably close.

title: Very average
text: Made our way to this viewpoint as we were in the area. The view was ok but I don‚Äôt find red roof tiles particularly interesting to look at. A nice view of the castle but that‚Äôs sort of it. There‚Äôs a few spots to sit and rest however the tour guides and jewellery sellers will approach you. Google maps showed some ‚Äòstreet art‚Äô located down an alleyway and there was some decent stuff. But mostly it was rubbish graffiti, dog poo on the path and the smell of pee.

title: A crowded viewpoint with not much to see except people watching
text: This is a dud if you have been to any of the other miradouros in Lisbon unless you like to see tiled roof tops. But it seems to be a good place to hang out as the grassy slope behind the viewing platform was filled to the brim with people just lying there seemingly enjoying people watching. If you have other more interesting places to explore, this is one place you can safely skip.

title: Mediocre view
text: Cute "balcony" surrounded by plants and azulejos, but the view is very little. The roofs of the houses and buildings are too close and the Lisbon slit you see DA this area is nothing special

title: Just get out of here....
text: This may be one of the most beautiful vantage points in Lisbon, but if this small square is totally crowded. Souvenir vendors, musicians and lots of people by bus, taxi, tukTuks and uphill on foot. In another season it may be better and you can enjoy the beauty of the Azujelos and the magnificent view of the Alfama.

title: Very expensive for poor quality
text:
During a trip to Lisbon in July 2023, I buy each of my daughters a small pearl bracelet for 9-10‚Ç¨ each. After barely 1 week the bracelets break.

At the beginning of August 2024, I buy on their online shop, a bracelet in gold plated at 45‚Ç¨. After a month, an angle breaks. J tries to reach the after-sales department for 3 weeks, to no avail. No reply despite 3 emails sent.

The products are expensive and of poor quality. And the customer service is not up to it.

title: Not to repeat
text:
I've done several escape rooms and this one was undoubtedly the weakest.
Very few puzzles to solve and the outside support was virtually null (the person who was supposed to be following us did not even seem to have vision into the room and was solving many other matters while "accompanying us")

text:
We went to the more complicated room, the game Masters did not help almost anything when we asked for help which led to us not being able to finish the room. The room was very busy but the game masters ended up spoiling. We ended up being frustrated...
Unfortunately I do not know the names of the game Masters but in the end they ended up being super antipatic.
I've done more than 20 rooms and this never happened before, I think you should take this into account

title: Oh, bad. Not to repeat.
text: We found it ugly. 1 Game master for 3/4 rooms? It makes no sense. We made Prision Robery and there are no clues in the room, there is no connection between them when they exist... we had to ask the Game Master for help and he immediately told us what to do. The Game master was not giving clues and help and natural form throughout the game.... I was waiting for us to ask... much in the room had no logic in the way it was done. I think it was the first escape room where I felt like I was so stupid that it was that room. I won't repeat in this company.

title: Minimum effort tour

title: Cancelled 1.5 hours before pickup time
text: So incredibly disappointed in this operator. They cancelled our tour 1.5 hrs before pickup time due to the guide having covid. A company with staff should have a backup plan for illnesses. I had to ask for a refund as they didn‚Äôt offer it right away. So traveler beware - if their staff is sick they don‚Äôt have a backup plan & will just cancel it outright.

title: Ugly
text:
After previously purchasing a ticket so that we could enter the disco, they banned the entrance of 3 of our friends who were with us, and allowed all the girls to enter.
It is worth remembering that all the boys and girls in the group were dressed according to the occasion, we had all purchased a ticket in advance and we had all the age required for entry.

title: Agressive bouncers - no motion - static dance floor.
text: They kicked me out for swapping a shirt ‚Äî the bouncers are really aggressive and everyone is really static in the dance floor I‚Äôm almost glad I got kicked out. The place was really not fun at all (a lot of men just jiggling - no motion - don‚Äôt go!) there‚Äôs a much better alternative on the other side of the road called urban beach and they were much more welcoming and a better place overall‚Ä¶

title: Horrible of thieves
text: Box that robs people to flee, never go there! We had to pay even though we had free drinks! To flee !

title: A nightmare experience and a total scam
text:
A Nightmarish Experience: The Infernal Abyss of Club Mome

Stepping into the ghastly confines of Club Mome feels akin to voluntarily plummeting into the abyss of inferno itself. This venue, draped in the facade of jubilation and mirth, morphs into a harrowing phantasmagoria upon entry. From the threshold, one is ensnared within an ambiance saturated with desolation, decay, and despondency.

Let us commence with the ambiance, or the glaring absence thereof. The interiors constitute a grotesque amalgam of garish neon hues, gaudy embellishments, and an auditory assault of discordant melodies, overwhelming the senses akin to an unyielding deluge. The atmosphere is thick with the pungency of inexpensive libations, perspiration, and fragmented aspirations, as though the very walls exude anguish.

The patrons, a motley assemblage of forsaken spirits and societal outcasts, seem plucked from the deepest recesses of human obscurity ‚Äì their gazes akin to predatory specters lurking in the shadows, bereft of compassion, their motives dubious at best. Indeed, a gallery of degeneracy and debauchery unfurls before one's eyes.

Yet, the most egregious transgression of Club Mome lies in its egregious service, or rather, the dearth thereof. The attendants, if one dares to grace them with such a title, embody a demeanor of surly apathy, incompetence, and an utter disregard for the plight of their clientele. Procuring a libation resembles navigating a labyrinth of ineptitude and indifference, with bartenders more engrossed in frivolous dalliances than tending to the needs of their paying patrons. And as for locating a hygienic lavatory amidst the squalor and filth, one might as well attempt to discern order from chaos.

The libations themselves are a testament to the nadir of human misery. Diluted concoctions served in tarnished vessels, each sip a poignant reminder of the soul-crushing despair that pervades every facet of Club Mome. It is as though hopelessness itself has been distilled into liquid form, proffered to unwitting victims.

And let us refrain from delving into the realm of entertainment, or rather, its lamentable absence. The purported "performers" stumble upon the stage akin to somnambulistic apparitions, their movements sluggish, countenances vacant. They appear ensnared within an eternal purgatory of mediocrity, destined to perpetuate banal routines ad infinitum.

In summation, Club Mome stands as a blight upon the very essence of existence. It represents a festering lesion upon the visage of humanity, a testament to all that is amiss within the world. To venture within its cursed confines is to embark upon a journey of remorse, a descent into madness devoid of reprieve. One is well advised to shun it at all costs, lest they too succumb to its inexorable grasp.

title: Bad
text:
Most idiotic club I have ever been to, over expensive and have bathroom police that barge in when you‚Äôre literally on the godamn toilet .
Repetitive dumb music and too crowded. Don‚Äôt go here , especially if you are international , it is a waste of your precious time .

title: The worst experience in DISCOTES in Lisbon
text:
The worst nightclub in LISBON. I can't find words to describe the security guards' lack of education. Brutality and bestiality. Talk about respect for the "other".
The music is very bad.

title: terrible!
text:
Bad experience.
I went in alone, shortly after some friends to meet them inside. I entered through a side entrance, due to an agreement with the college. I showed my college card and they didn't give me any card, as it was my first time there and I didn't know anything, I thought that the card that other people had was only used to buy drinks. When I left I saw everyone swiping their card and I went to a security guard to ask what the card was for and he said I didn't have one. They wanted to force me to pay ‚Ç¨50 because they said I had lost a card that I never received, they searched my bag and wallet, while I told them they wouldn't find anything because I hadn't received it, I spoke to the management and the security guard who supposedly he was giving cards at the door where I entered, when he saw me he said he had never seen me but when the manager asked him he assured that he had given me a card. LIE!! Another security guard who apparently controls the exits to smoke said that I go in and out several times with a card, I never went out to smoke or even be outside. Once again LIE!!
In short, unfriendly security guards who don't know how to admit mistakes. Unapproachable, rude and incompetent staff.

title: Place to avoid
text:
At this nightclub they stole my daughter's wallet with CC, bank card, pass, money and other personal cards, as well as the drinks card that is given at the entrance.
As a result, they forced her to pay ‚Ç¨50, as maximum consumption.
She had to borrow it from friends, under threat of having to leave the case alone.
The "security guards" and management are THIEVES!!!

title: Dis-satisfaction
text: Guard are very rude when i enter in the club not helpful at all. Place is too crowed bcoz of hallowing you can beardly move people are pushing each other more over suffocated, and they give us 15 euro card per person even if you used it or not you have to pay for it. It is ridicules. I pay 15 euro for nothing no good moment like it says in online. very bad vibe it was not operated in a good way. This place sucks

title: horrible
text: rude security guards. They didn't give me a card. After entering, I noticed this and asked for it to be given to me, they rejected it and after insisting for 3 hours I managed to leave paying the stupid price of ‚Ç¨30 without consuming anything.

title: Good club but bad service
text: The atmosphere was pleasant, but you have to pay on the way out with the card you were given on entering. However, the cashier made a mistake and didn't give me the card back. I paid 20 euros, I had the receipt and the proof of debit on my account but the bouncers didn't want me to leave, 20 min waiting inside for them to look at the surveillance cameras so they could tell me there was no problem, the bouncer was violent to get me to leave the club, he was unpleasant. In short, it's a nice club, but the bouncers do a poor job and are disorganized, given that payment is made on the way out, and they don't handle it professionally.

title: Terrible
text: Security so rude, tried to detain us for not paying an entry fee that THEY HADNT SPECIFIED don‚Äôt go: lower floor was private

title: A porta √© minha entra quem eu quiser!
text: P√©ssima impress√£o. Porteiros mal educados e grosseiros, acham que podem empurrar as pessoas. Queriam nos cobrar 50‚Ç¨ a entrada depois de ficar quase 2h na fila. Rid√≠culos! Para a pr√≥xima voltamos com a comunica√ß√£o social ü§¨

title: Horrible discoteca
text: De las peores discotecas que he estado en mi vida. Caro, mala m√∫sica‚Ä¶ Haces cola para entrar y por otro lado entran los amigos de los trabajadores‚Ä¶. Muy muy mal.

title: Uma discoteca discriminat√≥ria
text: N√£o recomendo a ningu√©m. Uma discoteca cujos crit√©rios para entrar n√£o s√£o a roupa ou a idade mas sim se pertencem √† comunidade LGBT+. Na noite passada deixaram-me entrar por ser rapariga e ao meu amigo por estar vestido de forma irreverente j√° n√£o. Para al√©m disso, das vezes que l√° fui, vi pessoas a serem drogadas. N√£o apoiem a discrimina√ß√£o!

title: Service m√©diocre pour clients fid√®les
text:
Honteux et sans honte,
Je suis client mensuel et je paie 150 euros par mois (ce qui n'est pas rien pour Le Portugal)
Le g√©rant est absolument abjecte avec les √©trangers.
Le badge ne fonctionne toujours pas apr√®s un mois, je demande une place pour une deuxi√®me voiture √©lectrique (ce qui ferai 2x 150 euros soit 300 euros mensuels)
Il me r√©pond que j'aille charg√© ma voiture au dessus de Cortes d Ingles √† 1km du parkging. Alors que je suis client. Je viens pour demander un lavage de voiture int√©rieur ext√©rieur (cout : 18 euros, je laisse la voiture sur place 2 jours, j'arrive pour la rechercher rien n'a √©t√© fait ! si pour ces personnes 318 euros n'est rien ! QU'ils ne se plaignent pas de leur situation. Ils ne traitent pas bien leur clients et nous on doit payer et ne rien dire ! C'est une honte. En plus le parking √† une rampe qui va √† l'√©tage que je vous d√©conseille un 4X4 ne passe pas, les jantes rappent les bords.
Le prix est l√†, le service ne suit pas ! A d√©noncer cela au Livreto de Recalamacoes de Portugal !

title: Not particularly attractive
text: The monument is located in the Jardim do Principe Real (so known because this park is part of the neighborhood of the same name) but the real name would be Jardim Fran√ßa Borges; the latter was a journalist strongly committed to the republican cause. The work, created in 1925 by Maximiano Alves, consists of a small stone base with three levels of different thicknesses on which three roughly squared boulders have been stacked, decreasing in size from bottom to top; on the last one rests a further boulder, also roughly roughened which acts as a support for a bronze medallion with the effigy of Fran√ßa Borges; a bronze female figure rests on the pile of boulders, looking towards the effigy of Fran√ßa Borges: she represents the Portuguese Republic in an attitude of gratitude towards the journalist, for what he has done through the press in favor of the Republic. The garden is not large so it is easy to find the monument: in any case it is in a small flowerbed in the center of an open space in the north-eastern corner, in front of the famous Bu√ßaco cedar.

title: Monument of bad taste
text: Usually when an artwork is controversial, it does not create a climate of harmony or pleasure for the audience. It is the work in particular, it is of extreme bad taste , uninteresting that does not beautify or awaken in the viewer any empathy (it is the object of scorn satire)

title: It must be interpreted
text: Monument that pays homage to all those who have been persecuted for their sexual orientation, created in 2017 by Rui Pereira and located approximately halfway along the eastern side of the Jardim do Principe Real, near the Fran√ßa Borges monument (this site was probably chosen for the installation as the Principe Real neighborhood is now home to a lively LGBT community). Particular work, like almost all modern sculptures, in concrete and iron, made up of two "doors" arranged orthogonally: one is empty (there are only the jambs and the concrete architrave) while the other, inside the frame made of concrete, it contains an iron plate on which a male-looking silhouette has been cut out on one side and female on the other. Obviously the monument has its own symbolism, which perhaps not everyone (as happened to us) will be able to grasp; usually this is also a characteristic that modern works often have in common. I only learned the correct "reading" (which is not immediately understandable and/or in any case cannot be shared) until later, once I returned home and carried out specific research; At the time it just left me perplexed.

title: Very disappointed
text:
Tuktuk ride arranged by hotel (cost 220 euros) was unsatisfactory. I am very surprised to see so many highly rated reviews.

The driver Mario was very pleasant and knowledgeable; a lovely man. However, the tuktuk was very difficult to get in and out of (we're quite nimble but this would be a real problem for some people); the ride was unbelievably bumpy resulting in me feeling quite nauseous; but the biggest problem was that we could see hardly anything because of the way the vehicle roof is structured. In order to see anything at all, we had to sit bent double and even then our view was blocked by the low roof.

For a sightseeing tour this is quite unacceptable and not a great way to spend 4 hours!

title: Guide was late/poor communication/never able to go on trip/no refund.
text: Our host did not meet us at our location at the start time of 9am, we waited for 20 minutes. I reached out to confirm that we we‚Äôre still on, after I didn‚Äôt hear back we left. I finally heard from the company that the driver was running late. We were already back at our apartment by then and we asked for a refund. They refused to give us one so we‚Äôve had to contact our credit card company directly to dispute this. We are extremely disappointed. We had two other tours that went really well, the guide was there on time and gave us the experience we expected. Not only were we inconvenienced but the poor customer service is baffling.

title: A must see experience. Experience with the company needs improvement.
text: I left a previous review. We were happy with the tour guide. He was friendly, funny and knowledgeable. I mentioned that the visit to the palace and other stops was great as well. I gave a three star rating because we weren‚Äôt happy with the amount of time provided at one of the stops due to some confusion around how to enter the Regaila stop after we payed for it. My family and I were very punctual at each stop and did not hold the group up. We actually waited for the other party at two stops. After posting our opinion about the experience I received a direct text message from our tour guide saying I was unfair and didn‚Äôt tell the truth. My trip advisor comment received a comment saying I never returned on time which is a complete fabrication. The way they responded to a review they asked me to post twice prompted me to lower my score as I consider this behavior to be part of my experience working with them.

title: Not to be trusted -
text:
NOT TO BE TRUSTED!
Cancelled our tour due to a "force majeure" (whatever that means...I'm guessing they didn't fill a van).
Book through ANYONE ELSE.

title: Disrespect
text: He made me buy a ticket to the Penal Palace and canceled it without even telling me. Tremendous nonsense. I'm here at the entrance to the hotel read consulat, agreed location, and no one showed up. Now I see that they canceled it on the website without notifying me. A tremendous disrespect

title: Bad company! I do not recommend!
text: I was going to take a tour to Sintra and Cascais scheduled for 8am with a meeting point at Pra√ßa Marques de Pombal. I got there at 7:50 and the bus had just left without me. Very disrespectful towards the customer! I do not recommend! Email communication is also terrible and lacks a lot of professionalism. LOOK FOR ANOTHER COMPANY IN LISBON!

title: This was not a tour, it was an expensive ride to 3 cities
text:
I recommend skipping this tour and doing Sintra on your own. There is no actual tour. You pay over 70 dollars for the ride and to hear a sentence about each place visited which I could have received more from an Uber driver.
Overall it was acceptsble. but poor communication from operator. Instructions about purchase of tickets was not clear. The last stop Cascais felt like a bit of a scam to get us to spend money at the restaurants and shops. There is no need to be there for 3 hours. If you are booking this tour, be sure to not only ask questions but get all answers in writing, not all guides follow the correct itenerary. Lastly, ask for a guide with more than a year experience because ours did not know much history of the places we visited.

title: Lousy service to the tourist
text:
Lousy treatment of us as tourists!!! They were eager to close (before the hour we had been told by the lord of the till)
It was 20 mns before closing (which the man of the box had informed us) and they did not let us see more
Lousy service!!!!

title: Lots of queue even if you have a reserved time. Disappointment
text: We got the tickets for 12:30 but anyway you wait in line for more than an hour in the sun, or in the rain... whatever. I don't understand that they ask you for an hour and then have to wait and then it's not that big of a deal, there are much more beautiful cloisters in Spain

title: Not worth a visit/ Not worth IT
text: What a scam!! 18‚Ç¨ to visit the cloister and the refectory (which is empty). The building is huge so we think we will see a lot DE things, but the part to visit is very small. It's beautiful, but it's not worth the trip. The church is free but everything under scaffolding, so nothing to see. What a rip-off! 18‚Ç¨ to visit the cloister and the (empty) refectory. The building is huge, so you think you will see lots of it, but in reality you visit a tiny area. IT is beautiful, but is not worth the wait nor the price. The visit of the church itself is free but everything is under scaffolding so there is nothing to see.

title: Total Waste of my Money
text:
I bought my tickets before I left the uk to visit on holiday. I was sent a ‚Äú voucher ticket ‚Äú that after spending over an hour queuing in the searing Bel√©m heat, my wife and I were
turned away at the gate as this type of ticket ( that we could save to our Apple wallet ) was invalid.
What a complete and utter waste of my hard earned wages that was.
I have also bought tickets for a Tagus river boat ride tomorrow 31/07/25. After today I am not even confident that we will be allowed on that either.
I know one thing though. I won‚Äôt be buying through Trip Advisor again.

title: Impressive building but over-priced
text:
This is a wonderful building but it is a complete rip-off for the 18 euro ticket price. Literally the tour is the opportunity to walk around the lower and upper levels of the cloister once and exit. There also needs to be much more in terms if information as you progress round.
Best advice is to skip this and go to the church next door for free. Also, much better value is the maritime museum.

title: Long line despite tickets
text:
All monuments in the world now ES manage to work with timeslots, only here you can queue for 1-2 hours in the blazing sun despite a ticket...
Definitely not contemporary anymore and for 18‚Ç¨ per person you can expect more

title: Disorganised - needs real timed tickets
text: We never got into this - it was 38 degrees C heat and the queue looked about 1 hour long, the 2 days we got near to it. Went to the tropical gardens next door, lovely and cheap!

title: Lamentable
text:
We arrived with our tickets purchased online for the morning slot.
We arrived outside the monastery at 9:10 and there were already two queues.
One for people with tickets the other for people who are part of a group organised by a tour operator.
As soon as the doors opened the groups came back en masse and we continued to wait outside in the heat.
I was able to count about 8 groups of more or less 15 people passing like this, so I dared to ask a lady of the Monastery Service how it was that these people passed by.
I got a rough explanation that the groups had to be them inside and that they had a schedule to follow. She said that to me in an extremely harsh tone and said I didn't have to ask her questions, then she came back talking loudly and saying it had started badly... I guess she was referring to me.
I find this completely unfair to normal customers not going through a tour operator and Service and lamentable. Finally we waited for more than an hour watching the others pass us by.
I don't recognize my country... that it shames

title: Waiting outside in the sun for hours
text: We are waiting outside with ticket made... for several hours and only the booked enter... kilometer line bad organization

title: Disappointed - Closed due to Labour Strike
text: We disappointed that we were not able to visit on June 11 and 12 due to labour strike. Luckily, the tour company that we booked with notified us before hand and fully returned our tickets.

title: Waste of time
text:
A waste of time totally not worth the wait
Compared to other similar constructions it‚Äôs not that impressive and no long queues either

title: Bad experience.
text:
Too long waiting in line. 2:30 is a long time.
To flee....
Because the rooms are empty and not everything is visitable.
The chapel is under construction
A huge scaffolding blocks the view of the altar too bad.
Anyway, now's not the time.

title: very bad experience - paid full price however only small part was accessible
text:
very bad experience: we paid 18 Euros per person and only a very tiny part of the Monastery is currently open. Nobody informed us when we bought the tickets at the ticket booth.

muito mao, pagamos 18 Euros per pessoa e so e aberto uma pequena parte do mosteiro; e nenhum nos diz nada a biglieteria.

title: -Suck!
text: NO! Like everyone , more than an hour waiting despite tickets booked, no audio guide while he was paid.... disappointing visit and not had the heart to queue again to see the church, in short we buy a postcard and we get out!

title: Disappointing
text: Waited over an hour in the blistering heat with prepaid tickets. Got in and honestly not much to see. Nice building and architecture but not worth the $25 euros/ticket ‚Äòwith self guided audio tour‚Äô which didn‚Äôt work anyways. Save your money and enjoy views from the outside.

title: No refunds!
text:
Horrible long line despite buying tickets online for the next day.

Decided to get a refund. In the official ticket stand they let you scan a QR code that gets you a form to ask a refund.

But don‚Äôt get fooled, as per museum policy they don‚Äôt refund tickets!!

Honestly, a tourist trap as they are clearly aware of capacity issues and get extra money from tourists that don‚Äôt want to spend minimum 2 hours in the sun waiting.

Eventually we went to Sintra and don‚Äôt regret it one bit, absolutely must visit when in Lissabon

title: Overrated
text:
Mosteiro dos Jeronimos

Lisbon

Overrated

1013094270

1* only for the Lisbon Card. Why? We bought it specifically to get into the Jeronimo monastery. When we got there around 10 am, the line was at least 2 hours long. We had to go back 4 times to check the line and eventually got in line at 4.40 pm. We bought the Lisbon Card because the website said SPECIFICALLY that you wouldn't have to queue and would be fast-tracked. What a lie that is. You will stand in line with everyone else. They must have had a lot of complaints yesterday (14 June) as they have changed the wording on the site.

Grossly overrated as well.

The church is free and virtually no queue so you could go in there instead.

Watch out for unofficial sites selling the Lisbon Card as well. It's virtually impossible to tell which it is.

Also, check whether things are open and whether there are strikes planned.

title: Long wait and expensive entrance
text: Very expensive the whole for what you see. You can see it the same on the Internet. You wait an hour for entry to stay choff

title: Overrated
text:
Arrived around 12 and a large queue, decided to go for a coffee and come back. Queue half the size but didn't take too long to get in.

Completely overpriced, 5 euros would have been fair.
