text: Arrogantes,lugar sem interesse, staff antip√°tico ... s√≥ se interessam por turistas com dinheiro e estrangeiros deixando os da pr√≥pria p√°tria em segundo plano.

title: N√£o vale a pena
text: Visitei no dia 24/12/22, pois era o √∫nico lugar nos arredores que estava aberto para visita√ß√£o. N√£o vale a pena: o ingresso √© pago e foi caro pela proposta. Cont√©m artigos militares, como ve√≠culos, uniformes, armas e memorabilia, mas parece que n√£o h√° manuten√ß√£o h√° 20 anos. Os objetos expostos est√£o muito mal legendados, empoeirados e sem contexto. O ponto mais esperado, a trincheira, √© tosco. Um labirinto composto por cen√°rios com bonecos de cera (alguns ca√≠dos de qualquer jeito ou j√° se desfazendo) e um odor nauseante de coisa velha. Em determinado cen√°rio h√° um soldado "morto" nu, que mais parece um manequim da C&A largado por engano. Os ve√≠culos na √°rea externa n√£o possuem qualquer identifica√ß√£o do que sejam ou qual sua relev√£ncia.

title: Guia arrogante e rude
text: Durante a visita, a guia, de cabelo loiro n√£o me lembra o nome, foi super arrogante, rude e mal-educada. Tornou a experi√™ncia numa visita desagrad√°vel.

title: Do not waste your time
text:
I actually wanted a refund for the 8 euros paid for me and my daughter! I made a beeline for this museum, walking down from alfama while I was at the top - the handsets didn‚Äôt work properly, ended up looking at pictures on the wall. Completely not engaging for me and my daughter.

When I complained, the lady at the shop ( manager) was quite rude. Said nobody had said the handsets were not working & I prob wasn‚Äôt pressing buttons hard enough! We had two handsets so kept trying both.

You need the handsets to hear the music / commentary.

Overpriced.

title: Fado Nado
text: Staff at door were rude.5 euros- overpriced. Only 2 of 3 listening stations working so difficult to listen to the Fado. A very large auditorium with a talking heads video but wished to see mor evideos of actual performances.

title: Disappointment
text: Limited to 3 countries, the guided tour is not worth it...the guides could be better, very western view of everything. It's well organized, but the light is bad.

title: An unfinished and disorganized museum project
text: Very weak collection of the alleged Museu do Oriente, limited to three countries and even this one is so poorly represented, when it is known that they have ancient art and cultures. The museums are poorly organized, they don't even have a place to start, nor direction arrows, in that darkness, it looks more like a dark and sad labyrinth. With so much space available, there are collections that are on top of each other, like the paintings on silk manufacturing, and others are repetitive. Some interesting pieces, but sometimes without any numbering or caption of what you are seeing. It started off badly with two photo exhibitions on the entrance floor, with no relation to the East, both very weak, not even worth wasting time on. But does the museum have a curator or someone in charge who sees the pile of negative reviews and does a better job of organizing and subtitling those pieces. I was expecting much more, the culture of the East deserves much more.

title: Opening hours incorrect
text: It‚Äôs not open on a Monday as it states here. Wasted a taxi fare based on Trip Advisor information. All Museums are shut on Mondays in Europe but open weekends.

title: Disappointed
text: Disappointed. The museum had several displays about Portugal's not so glorious colonies, one gallery about the Great War and one small room about the Peninsular War against France. Tellingly, there seemed to be only one reference to Wellington and none at all to Beresford, the British CinC of the Portuguese army. The room stewards seemed ignorant and were incapable of answering any questions (in English or Portuguese). They were shabbily dressed and one tall steward appeared to be drunk. The displays were somewhat eclectic and many appeared to be "fillers". The impressive marble columns turned out to be painted wood. Very few visitors on the day we went but not value for money.

title: Inform your customers please!?
text: Said it was open from 2-5 pm on Saturdays. I walked twice around the building and tried every door but it was obviously closed. No signs. Nothing. Nothing mentioned on the website. Awful service. What a disappointment.

title: Ticket Scam once inside
text:
*BEWARE TICKET SCAM INSIDE*

Bought a ticket from the office they only take cash! ‚Ç¨3 good value i thought.

Once inside past the cannon room i was then approached by an older man that came from the direction of the desk in the next room.

The desk is manned and he was speaking with the guy on the desk so all looked normal.

He took my ticket i presumed he worked there he only spoke Portuguese normal ticket checks I presumed.

He then reappeared later on in the museum with a guy now wearing an ID ‚Äòprobably fake or provided by a staff member‚Äô i was then asked for my ticket!!

WOW!!!! SCAM!!!!

I said that the older man had taken it! The two both clearly knew each-other. Both had bad English.

This was the worst most obvious scam i have seen!!!
The two were even together!
I think one of the guys weighed me up and thought they had no chance of intimidating me.

I just told the guy with ID that his friend had taken it and they both spoke in Portuguese and i was told ok no problem!

The place only takes cash so wouldn‚Äôt of been a bank record to prove it!! I don‚Äôt know how deep this scam goes.

This made me uncomfortable and i left missing a large part of the museum out.

Avoid this place and if the museum is reading this you need to investigate your staff as they are conducting criminal activity targeting tourists that have come to see your country!

Especially investigate the guy sitting at the desk after the cannon room!! On 13/07/2023
This guy was speaking to the older man that took my ticket.
The other two are maybe not employees of the museum.

The building is part of the military and there is a military police officer at the main gate opposite the train station, maybe do your job?

I am ex military myself and had been looking forward to this museum for along time.

The place was empty large and very old if you are not very confident or alone this scam could be very intimidating.

Shame on for your pathetic behaviour you criminal scum!!

title: Closed last minute for a strike!!
text: We walked for nearly an hour from central Lisbon having checked online that the museum was open )8th December) and arrived at 10am. When we arrived we were told that the museum was not going to open today as the staff had decided to strike (which was convenient for them as it was a national holiday). What a waste of time - no notification on Facebook until later in the day.. very poor.

title: Not our thing and very unfriendly
text:
We received a very unfriendly welcome upon arrival, both at the counter to buy our ticket and the man standing at the entrance itself.
That made us go in with a sour feeling.

Beautiful space and beautifully decorated building where numerous works of art are displayed by type. However, this was not our thing at all, although we like to see (old) art, so we were back outside fairly quickly.
We have seen much nicer places and would certainly not recommend this.

title: Misleading information
text: This assessment is based on the terrible information about the schedules on the website. When consulted, it is verified that the museum will be open on December 31. In fact, it offers the possibility of purchasing tickets online for that day. Luckily we didn't. Going to the museum we see that it is closed. This happens to several people who meet at the museum door.

title: Disappointment
text:
Employee dislike. Investing in friendly, empathetic and cultured employees would be an added value.
Lighting, the spotlights are not well placed, they do not allow full contemplation of the works on display.

title: Don't go.
text: Very weak museum. Absurd value... 15 euros to see 30 old wagons. There's much better thing to do in Alistou. It's very expensive museum for the money ! Don't waste your money.

title: Be aware
text: Be aware; the title suggests it may be a museum full of wooden coaches. They are not joking: it is!! Even though it was a day filled with of heavy rain I wish I had stood outside for an hour instead of going in. Please think twice before entering

title: Not kid friendly, rude staff, AVOID at all costs
text: Horrible experience! Not kid friendly at all. Staff was incredibly rude yelling at me and my children because my daughter got too close to a display, I promptly asked her to not touch anything, but two very aggressive male employees felt the needed to scream at us as loudly. I have been to museums all over Lisbon, and I‚Äôve never encountered rude staff like this. Avoid this museum at all costs.

title: EMBARRASSING EXCUSE OF A NIGHTCLUB
text:
EMBARRASSING EXCUSE OF A NIGHTCLUB.
Why did the lady tell us ‚Äúonly allowed in with groups of 4‚Äù‚Ä¶ bro what does that even mean.
We finally get in at like 12:30 and theres legit 30 people in there‚Ä¶so dead. Dj playing house music with no lyrics. $10 cover money flushed down the toilet. No clue why they were trying to be so exclusive one of the dumbest clubs ive ever been to. NEVER GO TO THIS AWFUL PLACE SO STUPID

title: Discrimination
text: Outrageous place. If you're with a group of men, don't go. You stand in line for half an hour and they skip you. After quiet questions, Portuguese come in but others do not.

title: avoid at all costs. awful experience that motivated the creation of this account just to rate this one place poorly
text: wish I could give this place zero stars. awful and xenophobic bouncers. fueled me to make a trip advisor account just to review them poorly. my friends who got inside said it was dead and awful and terrible and in no way worth the price of entry. go literally anywhere else in the entire country of portugal. avoid at all costs.

title: Racist and aggressive security guards
text:
We were attacked by security before entering, we ended up in an ambulance on the way to the hospital and formalizing a police report.
This ends a night of partying if you decide to try and enter this place.

I've been inside the bar on other occasions and the staff is no good, in addition to it being a place with a lack of minimum hygiene measures.

Personally, I don't recommend it, there are many other great bars in the area where you wouldn't be mistreated and attacked unnecessarily.

title: Don‚Äôt recommend for brown skin.
text: They didn‚Äôt gave entry only because of our brown skin the security guards said it‚Äôs . Was very bad experience in my life to decide vocation at Portugal.

title: Racism in Music Box club.
text: I went with a friend to music box club yesterday and tried again today. There is strange thing happening, security guard letting white guys to go into club while Asian people were refused to entry. Then we observe for an hour both days ,they refuse to entry to Asian people and giving no reason. When questioned,the security guards was trying to fight and being rude. I email to managers but got no reply. I tried to talk to manager but the guards say "we are managers" . All tourists from Europe should stand against racism in this club.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time and money clubbing in Musicbox
text:
These people should be punished based on their extremely rude behavior and bad service. The bouncer was extremely rude, the receptionist did not have any patience and they did not understand english enough. I do not understand why this club is still up today and running. I am furious about this experience. Don‚Äôt go clubbing in Musicbox because they do not know how to treat people with respect. They don‚Äôt bother letting you in if you are a tourist but if you are a girl (doesn‚Äôt matter if you are a tourist or not) they will let you in 100%. They only care about the men/women ratio because that is their business model.

I thought I was going to die in this club because of how threatening the bouncer was to me when me and my friends entered the club. We got in eventually by paying 12 Euro per person which is really cheap compared to the drama that the receptionist and the bouncer spun up when we entered the club.

title: Very rude, arrogant and racist
text: The woman at the door, like the other reviews below, was AWFUL! Bordering on the illegal pretty much for being so obnoxious... the only reason we were there is because Kerala Dust was performing there. Never again...

title: Arrogant blonde lady on the door
text:
The blonde girl on the door thinks a lot of herself, very rude, condescending and arrogant.

Must enjoy her work

title: horrendous
text: The would be better if they simply did not exist. They were unfair and unpolite. Bounced us away twice. no explanation. so soo rude

title: Worse club I've been to in my life
text: Worst club I've been to. They pretend to make you wait a few minutes in line . There was nobody inside maybe 10 other pissed off people like us. So dead. The use this tactic to charge you a 12‚Ç¨ charge a piece. When we asked the door rude lady "hi, how long is the wait?" Her answer" well you're waiting in line now aren't you ?" There is a reason why you're so dead, you're rude and you can't sustain this sort of tactic. There's a reason why pensao amore next door has a line down the street and you have a fake line hold when there's only 10 people inside. Work on treating customers with some respect and maybe you can save your failing abysmal sad club

title: Terrible staff
text: They treat people like they are animals, all the staff is rude, I don‚Äôt recommend, you will find for sure cheaper places with nicer people

title: Dishonest taxi driver from Lisbon Airport
text:
You‚Äôd think that because you‚Äôre lining up at a taxi stand at the airport that their services would be legit. Think again.
The wait took about fifteen minutes and I was directed to what seemed like a large suv for one person. When I told the driver which hotel I needed to go, he pulled over to look it up telling me he wasn‚Äôt sure where it was. Really? Well the ride took around 15 minutes and during that time I noticed he rested his arm right in the vision of the cab meter which was unusually placed near the gear shift and not in sight of the passenger. This should have raised a red flag for me as legit taxis typically have the meter in clear view. Leaning forward, I noticed a few minutes into the trip the fare read just over five euros. Just before arriving at the hotel the fare was 11.15 euros. But as soon as the driver pulled up he shut the meter off and told me the total was 29 euros. I was tired and jet lagged and against my better judgement chose not to say anything and paid him. Warning others to please pay attention and not get taken advantage of by dishonest taxi drivers here, especially if you are traveling by yourself. The legitimacy of taxi drivers in Lisbon requires re-considering services. Next time I‚Äôll take an Uber.

title: Not Great
text: Not nearly as expected. Our tour began by looking at wall tiles from a contemporary artist. After looking at several of those and no hope of seeing better, we made excuses and left. The photo shown in the promo for this tour is what we expected. Fortunately, we also had a 3 hour Tuk Tut tour of the city and our tour guide took us to the LX Factory! We found GREAT street art there.

title: Staff (at checkout/entrance) too stupid!!
text:
We arrived at 17:16 (the museum closed at 18:00) . We entered to the reception (the guide even put the barrier behind us to indicate that the museum was closing). Once at the checkout, the lady REFUSED to let us in to see the museum although we had the LisboaCard (she didn't have to pay anything and she didn't have to return any change if her checkout was closed and counted). After giving us a look, she showed us her watch (it was then 5:18 pm) and she told us that the last entrance was at 5:15 pm. Really? What was it like for her to let us in when there were 3 other people who passed right in front of us. She told us that we only had access to the shop (to buy a souvenir ... of a place I could not visit!!!) and the backyard to take some pictures. Sincerely, this is exactly the kind of person who should not work with tourists! No kindness!
(and I fully understand that there must be one last admission and closing hours must be respected ... but the guard let us in without saying anything when she pouted) B I T C H

title: Not very exciting
text: I found it very disappointing. Not more than one could see in any great museum anywhere! Also, the church, which is apparently very beautiful, closes for lunch before 1pm, so we just browsed a few of the rooms. Not worth the trip if you aren't in that neighborhood.

title: Awful customer service
text: Ines on reception was extremely rude and would not accommodate us. Would not revisit due to her. We‚Äôve basically been robbed of ¬£30

title: Don‚Äôt bother.
text:
Honestly I‚Äôve been more excited visiting my local tile store in suburban USA than this museum. You‚Äôre better off simply walking around Lisbon admiring the tiles on the buildings rather than wasting your time here.
The most interesting part was the very small exhibit showing the substances that were mixed together to make the colors for the tiles. Other than that, there was no context concerning the tiles.

title: Historical tile but hard to understand in English
text: Had probably expected more and to understand more. Difficult with English info and very old history. Had probably thought it would be with the present. Cheap entrance but had not done it again. Also 25 min √ºber to get there. Drink port instead!

title: Terrible experience!
text: Despite having tickets, the museum decided to close last minute for the day without any notice and refund! People were coming and going spending money on taxis with no reason!

title: Animais mantidos em p√©ssimas condi√ß√µes
text: Na parte externa, onde ficam as mesas do caf√©, eles mant√™m animais presos e em locais sujos. As tartarugas presas em um espa√ßo m√≠nimo, em p√©ssimas condi√ß√µes.

title: N√£o vale a visita!
text:
O museu fecha as 12:45 e reabre as 14 hs, vc s√≥ fica sabendo sobre o hor√°rio quando chega l√°! Cheguei as 12:40 , portanto em 5 min o museu fecharia,como o lugar e afastado das demais atra√ß√µes vc acaba esperando pir sua reabertura,por sorte tem um restaurante,agrad√°vel,e e nele que nos resta esperar pela reabertura (detalhe se pir um acaso vc ja estiver dentro do museu os funcion√°rios pedem para que saia e aguarde a reabertura) No museu n√£o h√° nada de excepcional,em 30 min se tudo (mesmo lendo com paci√™ncia sobre a hist√≥ria do azulejo)
Conclus√£o:n√£o vale a pena.Os funcion√°rios s√£o mau humorados e mesmo observando um bom n√∫mero de turistas n√£o abrem m√£o do seu hor√°rio de almo√ßo!!

title: The vendor cancelled on us because I asked too many questions.
text: We scheduled the tour and needed to arrange the transportation in Lisbon from our VRBO to a meeting point downtown. The guide send a What's App text message saying she had too many travelers to pick up and rerouted our pickup point. It is NOT easy to rearrange transport in Lisbon as a traveler. After several back and forth text messages, they cancelled on us (they did return our money). We then went without them and found there is NO need for this tour - we took the train from downtown and purchased our Sintra tickets online and onsite. I thought they provided transport, tickets and site guides, but they do not. Rick Seves travel books outline what we did. I felt they were rude and unforgiving to the idea we had no idea how to navigate the city ... ended up being quite easy. To be clear: I did not take this tour because they cancelled on me - so perhaps the tour is wonderful.

title: The candle is only to fool
text: In the photo of the ad the boat is sailing. On the ride, only engine. I missed the opportunity (maybe the only one in my life) to sail in the Tagus.

title: Below average experience
text: Would help if they included the Vasco de Gama bridge and avoided the deserted areas along the shoreline. And please, stick to Portuguese music! Overall, overpriced mediocre experience.

title: disappointed
text:
We didn't do the ride because it was very cold. the boat was very small and there were many people.
I preferred to stay down

title: Excursion cancelled
text: The activity has been cancelled, we would like a refund. We sent an email to get our money back and for now we have no answer...

title: To flee
text:
Do not choose this airline
They stole 90 euros from us.
We asked for a Friday outing for a couple and a child.
The lady made a mistake and checked us in for Thursday.
They didn't want to know.
It's a shame our child is disappointed and we feel stolen
Choose another airline
It's a tourist catch and they're really not nice because it's the tenth reception that got it wrong
The boat is full to bursting choose another company
Shame on you for not admitting a mistake on your part.
I have the name and a picture of the person who treated us with contempt if the boss or the boss wishes to contact us.

title: Poor refund policy
text: Think twice before booking in advance. It rained all day when we were supposed to go with very low visibility, unlike the forecast the day before. I called TripAdvisor and contacted the vendor to see if it was canceled. The vendor said the ship captain would decide 30 minutes in advance and that you had to physically be there to get a refund if it was cancelled. We didn‚Äôt waste our time going to the ship, so no refund for us.

title: Bad experience, bad customer service
text: Had a disappointing experience, meeting point was wrongly addressed, after finding the right one there was nobody, when contacted the provider I didn't get an answer. After contacting Viator support they told me they will publish a ticket but they didn't, after a week I contacted them again and they apologized for not submitting the ticket and told me its past date to refund and they will ask the provider for refund. Then got email that it was my fault as the location is correct (they changed it in the meantime) and that I cant be refunded. Disgusting.

title: Misleading advertising
text: The "free-flowing" wine is falsely advertising what in reality is a strict 3 small cups of wine. When I showed the tour woman the wording she went into a rant about how she has to speak 4 languages and isn't a machine, despite her just relaxing when I simply asked is there was more wine. The boat ride itself is pleasant enough, but it was also quite difficult to hear these 4 languages from the guide, so she could have done a bit better. Disappointing really!

title: Disappointed there was no sailing
text:
We booked this trip for 2:30 on a Sunday. Saturday at 4:30 we were walking past the docks as the sunset sail was leaving. We could not see any sails bent. The boat did not set any sails as they went off down the river. I immediately went to the booth and asked to be issued a refund, if the boat would not be under sail. Since it was 22 hours before our sail and their policy is 24 hours, they refused.

This is advertised as a sailing charter. Look at the photos they post. If the vessel will not be under sail I think they are engaging in false advertising.

All that said, it was a pleasant motor up and down the river but I wouldn‚Äôt have booked a traditional sailboat just to be motored around.

title: Wet trip rarely seen
text: Had a lot of rain and missed a lot of waves, saw little, trip ended prematurely. Shame. Tour guide indicated that we will get a refund

title: Bad weather
text: Trip was canceled. It was our last night in Portugal, we thought it would be so fun, but bad weather prevailed. We are expecting a full refund. Really bummed!

title: Boat stopped working
text:
Sunset cruise boat could not safely leave the dock area so we had to dock in the emergency area.

Little to no communication during the 30-45 mins of waiting time as to what was happening.

Finally, a representative came to explain that the boat was not safely working but did not offer us a refund. We were told to go back to our third party provider in this case TripAdvisor to ask for a refund. I am now searching up and down the "help center" page to find a way to be issued a refund.

Understand that things happen but customer service on making this wrong a right is completely unprofessional.

title: They do not speak Spanish
text: The trip was short but very nice, but they promise a guide in Spanish and. Is a lie. They only speak in Portuguese, French and. English. Not a word in Spanish,,,,,,,,,,, Spaniards stick to it.

title: Communication Issues
text:
We were so frustrated when there is no response when we called on the telephone number for assistance.
We were very closed to the meeting place and to be sure to get to the meeting place on time, we took a taxi. Unfortunately the taxi driver didnot know the place and brought us to somewhere far away to the meeting place. We had an argument with the taxi driver who left us on the street and we were already late. We called on the telephone and nobody answered. We sent a message through Tripadvisor and got no answer.
Very bad communication and disappointing.

title: No reply...
text: I made a reservation through Odisseias and didn't get any response, I sent emails to " Nosso Tejo", 2 days in a row making endless calls and none were answered.

title: Disappointed
text:
Booked on strength of good reviews.
We weren‚Äôt impressed.
We were unfortunately at the back of the queue and didn‚Äôt manage to get seats on the middle benches.
Very uncomfortable narrow wooden ledges to sit on. Left with a very painful back.
Would suggest taking less passengers for their comfort.
Wine was okay. Staff very pleasant.
More information on landmarks would have been good.
Wrap up well as very breezy on the outside seating.

title: Poor Communication
text: Unfortunately, we were not advised that there was a rail strike causing traffic to double and triple the normal commute time. There was no one who answer that answered the contact # before or even after the ship had left. We even went to the office which was closed. Knowing that this is a tourist area, an update should have been sent out.

title: Cancellation disappointment
text: Unfortunately I tested positive to Covid in the hour prior to out trip. I felt well enough to complete the trip but felt it would be irresponsible to put others at risk so we didn‚Äôt go. I know it probably misses the refund cancellation period but given we are loyal TripAdvisor and Viator customers I thought we might have been given some slack. We will not be using your services again.

title: Party boat for mature. Not worth it
text:
Party boat for older people? Not worth it

Hoping for a narrated tour but after a few minutes at the beginning it was very quiet, apart from the cheesy 80's hits being pushed out.
Went past lots of interesting places but no clue what they were? Would have been much more worth it having more chat about things we passed, especially coming back on the other side of the river.
3 cups of cheap white wine didn't help.
Just felt a great opportunity missed and being treated like 18 year olds on a party boat not great. At ¬£31 each definitely not cheap either. Most disappointing.
It may suit some but I cannot recommend this for others

title: Promenade en bateau
text: D√©√ßu les images ne correspondent pas √† la r√©alit√©. Voilier √† moteur .Pas de voiles.parcours de 2h.35 euros la personne trop cher pour la prestation. Surprise rat√©e !!!Pour ce type de prestation la moiti√© du prix et du temps serait correcte et images r√©els.

title: Croisi√®re annul√©e, dommage!
text:
Impossible de noter la balade en bateau.
Le prestataire a annul√© la balade compte tenu de la m√©t√©o.

C' est domage le bateau (petit) est charmant, le site est magnifique. Vu de la mer cela doit l'√™tre encore plus.

Le prestataire a rembours√© sur place les personnes ayant command√© directement √† lui.
Il nous indiqu√© que Tripadvisor avait √©t√© pr√©venu de l anulation et que nous devions nous adresser √† vous pour un remboursement..

title: Not as advertized
text:
We booked for a ride on a sailboat and it turn out to be a motor boat. The captain claimed the sails were being repaired. When we returned to dock the
doors were closed and we have to wait 40 minutes until the Last boat arrived with the key. Several passengers Climbed the fence risking an accident.

title: THE EXPERIENCE DIDN‚ÄôT EXIST
text:
THE EXPERIENCE DIDN‚ÄôT EXIST .
We have arrived and no boat was available at the time scheduled. There wasn‚Äôt any experience available and I had to improvise a corporate agenda. Everyone was extremely disappointed. 11 people waiting to have this experience. This is unacceptable and unprofessional from Tripadvisor. Please let me know how to get the refund.

title: Not Great!
text:
Calling it an "Average" experience is being pretty generous.

There was a boat, there was a sunset, and there was white wine.

BUT - The boat was so crowded - packed in like sardines to sit on hard bench seats for 2 hours, this was not any where near an enjoyable/comfortable excursion.
The commentary identifying what we were seeing was very limited.
The wine which is described as "free flowing" was even more limited - half a paper cup in the first hour on the way out, and a second half cup in the second hour on the way back - certainly not my idea of "free flowing".
View, and opportunity to photograph the sunset was limited due to crowding.

title: Disappointing trip
text:
Disappointing trip. Boat was a little small for the amount of people so we were all squeezed in. The commentary was unintelligible as the guide spoke so fast- she was rattling through it in 4 languages which all merged together. Despite a beautiful breeze no attempt was made to put the sails up so the engine was on all the time.
However it was nice to be on the water and we saw some dolphins which was a bonus.

title: Beware if you are offered a bar tab
text: My second time here. No issues on the first night. Good music both nights. Was offered a tab on the second night which I agreed to. When I went to leave I got the bill which was way over what we had consumed. I wasn't in the place long enough for this. When I questioned this I was completely ignored and the staff were not a bit pleasant. I paid and left and most definitely I won't be back. A single error can happen but this way beyond that

title: Joke
text:
Absolutely disgusting service ordered 5 meals and it took an hour to get it right.false advertising showing celtic games ...they don't show them
..save your money and eat and drink elsewhere absolute toilet of a pub

title: Being seated next to the toilet on a very small table with my daughter. Not prepared to spend in excess of 50 euro
text: Not happy being seated next to the toilet on a small table for my dinner with my daughter. Put a shadow on the few visits we made here during the week. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend

title: Pub Doorman stamped on customers head.
text:
Don‚Äôt go here late into the evening.

Security on the door dragged a man out who was resisting but at the same time wasn‚Äôt causing harm to anyone as he was too drunk to do anything.

Security had him on the ground and punched him in the head before lifting his foot and stamping down on the guys head as hard as he could.

Guy was out cold and wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if he has permanent damage.

To make things worse, the security guard then took pride in it and started to puff his chest out and ask customers if they saw what happened
Avoid at all costs

title: Watered down drinks
text: We came to his pub on our first night in Lisbon and we had a really good night. We also arrived there on our last night and we ordered cocktails but we noticed as time went on some of them were missing alcohol even though we paid 9 euro. When it was said to them they added the alcohol which in that case it leads me to believe they were ripping us off when they thought we wouldn't notice.

title: Nothing much
text: Classic Irish pub located near Lisbon's riverside. Internally poorly maintained with hasty and not very helpful service. Quality of food not up to similar venues and beers served not very cold

title: That's not right! Every guest should be treated equally!
text:
We sat down at a table and waited
to get a menu. It never arrived and we had to get our beers from the bar ourselves. Service at the bar was friendly but we couldn't order anything to eat at the table and we couldn't reorder drinks either. Unfortunately it was different at other tables... why? Aren't all guests the same? We're used to a different (better, nicer) service from an Irish pub! The door to the ladies' room was also covered with a poster and couldn't be found. When I asked, I just got a strange look and a finger pointing to the relevant door. Not acceptable! We didn't feel welcome!!

title: No need to go there
text: There wasn‚Äôt anything good exept the service. There was a young women who did her job perfectly! But food was terrible and the place didn‚Äôt seem like a irish pub.

title: Indian Irish pub
text: This is a sham of an Irish Bar. It is run by Indian Nationals who have no inclination of Irish Culture. It may appear lively but you will be treated as you were in McDonald‚Äôs as you are just a punter. You will be ushered off your seat to make room for standing customers to fit more in. Security are rude and heavy handed with people who do not drink enough. Avoid this pub and stick to the locals for authenticity.

title: Agressive and homophobic security guard at the door
text:
On the 28th of January this year, a group of friends and I went to the pub. It's usually a great place to hang out with music and a few beers. This time, however, we were met at the door by a tall, bald and rude security guard. We said hello and were about to walk in when he suddenly stood in front of the doorway without looking at us and remained silent. We asked if we could come in and he said "So you arrive somewhere and don't say hello to the security guard?", to which we replied that we already did so. He moved up close to us and asked two guys in the group "voc√™s as duas tamb√©m v√£o entrar?" [will you two (female form) be going in too?]. This was his notion of a smart wordplay to imply they were gay? No one in the group is in fact but it made us wonder how many LGBT people felt disturbed by this sinister behavior.
We went inside the bar and it was too crowded (way more than it should) so we left after discussing all that happened. As we got outside he was giving the next group of people the same talk that we got and being aggressive and hostile for no reason whatsoever.
You guys usually have a terrific environment, you have awesome bar staff and employees from all over the world, and you even display a Ukrainian flag and show some social awareness. Don't take this lightly.
The bar needs to take responsibility for the people it is employing for security as well. Having a frustrated, homophobic individual guarding the door leaves a terrible first impression.

title: Over priced spirits....
text: Popped in here for a drink & it cost 20 euros for a double gin & lemonade! I get that's it probably imported, but that's just ridiculous. Needless to say I'm glad I didn't ask for another!!

title: Way over rated !
text:
It was so so.... Definitely not the best aquarium I have visited. A lot of space wasted for very small fish that you can see anywhere. A lot of stairs, elevators, ridiculously small for the amount of people. Only 2 cashier's wording during peak season at peak time. (Not too smart)
Very expensive for what it is.

title: Disappointment
text:
Drawn by the fame of this aquarium, we put it among the stops of our trip to Lisbon, having a child in our group.
The aquarium is structured on several floors, but they made a questionable choice: in fact, the key element of the exhibition is a large central tank visible from several sides and from each floor, with virtually all the breeds present in the aquarium.
Beautiful and scenic effect in itself, but impractical for the purpose of the visit.
For the rest there are few fish tanks, 2 penguins on the cross and the otter tank.
We had a different expectation that was dashed.
We re-evaluated the one in Genoa, which is certainly smaller, but at least has more variety and interaction.
It was a big disappointment. (expensive ticket for what we saw).

title: Overcrowded
text: Beautiful fish, but restricted space and very few species other than fish, two otters and a guillemot or two. The actual viewing tanks are very clear, but the day we visited the overcrowding was dreadful and the noise of adults and children deafening at times. Entry is by half hour slots if you pre-book (advisable). We visited on a weekday before school holidays began, so heaven knows what it must be like during school holidays in August. There appears to be no limits set on numbers as far as we could see. It was over all an uncomfortable experience.

title: Big Letdown
text:
The fish tanks are beautiful, clear, clean, and well labelled. But basically you just look at fish tanks over and over. So many fish tanks.

Other than a few birds and two otters, there were no other sea creatures on exhibit (seals, penguins, sea turtles, sea horses, and other sea life were all conspicuously absent). There was one disjointed short film about the sea. Otherwise it was just fish tank after fish tank.

Overall boring. No cohesive theme. Took less than 45 minutes for the whole thing. There was an overpriced gift shop, natch. Not worth ‚Ç¨25 per person.

title: Overcrowded and misinformed
text:
We went specifically to see the mola mola (ocean sunfish), but we were here to be dissappointed. The fish was heavily advertised but seemed to have died a while ago. We had to ask the staff to figure this out. It was heavily overcrowded and hard to see the animals. because of this.

On a positive note: the otters and manta rays were cool to see

title: Ocean√°rio de Lisboa
text:
Been here on a Friday morning and we didn't have to queue. So we thought it wasn't too crowded. Nothing could be further from the truth. There were far too many groups of schoolchildren in a row where you could wonder who were louder: the children or the counselors. The counselors tried to keep the children quiet; without success. Result: constant noise of screaming children, children running around and crawling in front. In this way we looked at the animals as quickly as possible to get ahead of the large groups. Let the groups of schoolchildren per group in every 15 minutes and have the staff keep an eye on them inside and you have divided the crowds a bit.

About Ocean√°rio de Lisboa itself:

This aquarium was a bit disappointing. Not only because of the aforementioned, but it also felt a bit small! There is a huge tank in the middle in which you can admire a different kind of animals from different heights (there are two floors). In the two circles you walk you will find even smaller spaces with other animals and also a tropical rainforest.

It was very beautiful, but it was all just not. I felt there were few animals, little time to take a good look at everything because of the crowds and we were ready within an hour and a half, so not three/four hours which many here indicate.

I personally liked Oceanogr√†fic in Valencia much better!

title: Overrated
text: Unfortunately, we have been to the aquarium in Atlanta Georgia, so after that, the Lisbon aquarium left us very unimpressed. We were especially disappointed because of the buildup, but perhaps that‚Äôs the only or the best. The good reviewers have experienced.

title: Disappointing experience ‚Äì Expensive and overcrowded
text:
We visited the Lisbon Oceanarium with many expectations, but unfortunately they were not fulfilled. We arrived around 11:00 in the morning and encountered long queues, despite our entries indicating "queueless access". The first available slot was at 13:30, and finally we entered around 14:00 because of the number of people.

The main aquarium is relatively small compared to others we have visited, and although well designed, it falls short in variety. One of the great attractions, mola mola (sunfish), was quarantined and could not be seen. In addition, the Antarctic area was also closed, which was a great disappointment as it is one of the most special exhibitions.

For the ticket price, we expected a more complete and better organized experience. With so many enclosed areas and so much waiting, we found it expensive and not worth it.

Council: If you still decide to go, buy tickets well in advance and go as early as possible to avoid the worst queues.

title: Underwhelming Experience ‚Äì Overpriced and Overcrowded
text:
We visited the Lisbon Oceanarium with high expectations, but unfortunately, it didn‚Äôt live up to the hype. We arrived around 11:00 AM, only to find long queues despite our ticket saying "Skip the line." The earliest entry slot we could get was for 1:30 PM, and we only got in around 2:00 PM due to the crowds.

The main tank is relatively small compared to other aquariums we‚Äôve visited, and although it‚Äôs beautifully designed, it felt limited in terms of variety. One of the main highlights, the mola mola (sunfish), was in quarantine and not visible. The Antarctic section was also closed, which was a big disappointment, especially since that‚Äôs one of the more unique displays.

For the price of admission, we expected a more complete and smoothly run experience. With so many closures and delays, it felt overpriced and not worth it.

Tip: If you still decide to go, buy tickets well in advance, and try to go right when it opens to avoid the worst of the lines.

title: Avoid. Extremely crowded. Not worth the time and money
text: Extremely overpriced with 25 euros per person above the age of 13. Entrance is chaotic with extremely long queues even when you buy your ticket online in advance. The guards at the entrance 1) arr clueless, 2) speak only Portuguese and 3) are chaotic as they send you from one queue to another queue with zero idea about which queue is waiting for what type of entrance. What you get for your overpriced tickets is ridiculous. A central aquarium with windows looking at it from different directions where crowds are in long queues just to ger a peek. They let in far too many people for the actual capacity of the place. 2 points max out of 10 points. Not impressive at all. Especially for this exaggerated ticket price. Avoid.

title: Disappointing
text: Queuing system was terrible. Purchased ticket online with the promise of skipping the line, but this didn't happen. Far too busy. No overhead views as seen in other Aquariums. It was over too quickly.

title: Dear for what it is
text:
Dear for what it is. A large pool in the middle and around the mini windows.
Not worth the Monaco or Nausicaa aquarium in northern France

title: Disappointed with our visit
text:
It is expensive for this place. The central basin is indeed giant, but everything is focused around it wherever you are.
I find the price is not justified even if it is very well maintained.

title: Underwhelming
text:
One big tank (very full with many different fish) but was very busy (you can see it from different angles along the way which wasn‚Äôt originally said.

A lot of little other tanks.

The whole experience was very underwhelming and i wouldn‚Äôt recommend.

title: Under-Whelming Ocean Life !
text:
1 star, very underwhelming and definitely does not portray much for real
Ocean life. Two otters, some fish, some sharks and sea life.
Short film in the small viewing room with seats was highlight cause we took a nap.
Location is out of the way and no other tourist attraction in the area.
We also did the old Expo Telecabine Cable car, another disappointment.

Epic fail for Tourist !!

title: Does not match 1 ranking
text: First place in the ranking it does not correspond to exactly , the exposure is very small , marine animals are few , no penguins , non-reptiles non-seabirds , jellyfish are half-dead, it is 10 times smaller than in Valencia , do not recommend to visit

title: Very disappointing
text: Entrance is very expensive and the price is not justified: we quickly went around and the cramped spaces do not allow you to see well (often difficult to access the windows to see qqch). It may be the largest aquarium in Europe but we had a more interesting and pleasant experience in La Rochelle (better managed spaces to circulate and observe).

title: Too expensive for the service
text:
Far too expensive. What family can put 100 euros for a visit?
Everything is focused on the central basin with sharks in particular. Around small insignificant basins with clown fish and anemones
In short, go your way if you hesitate to go
For doing Nausica in the north of France, well I am disappointed

title: IT GETS BETTER
text: The structure is nice , but honestly 25 euros is really too much for what you see . I do not recommend if of high expectations. Parking not easy.

title: It's not worth it.
text: admission to 25 euros for adults and 15 for children up to 12 years.... well it is absolutely not worth the money spent. there is only one large central tank where you go around it throughout the route and is surrounded by other small tanks, all for a ride that can last a maximum of an hour and a half unless you stop in front of the main tank for hours to pass the time. I repeat the price is really too high compared to what is offered

title: No more.
text: Full of people, it's not well organized, if you leave clothes in lockers, then since you don't end up there, you have to go back. Much better Gij√≥n's.

title: Underwhelming, not worth it
text:
Went here on a discount for the ‚ÄòBlue Moon‚Äô for ‚Ç¨15.-

To be fair, it is very underwheming, there is one tank in the middle with a 360* viewingangle, and a few small tanks. The expositions where empty and the exposition was in a small room.

ALOT of kids, without supervision in any sense. Very annoying, not worth it.

title: Too busy
text: Too busy to see anything. They let far too many people in to the point it‚Äôs almost impossible to get close to anything with a family. See the photo which was pretty much the same at most viewing areas. At 80E for a family this makes it hugely expensive too. Even without the crowds there are much better aquariums.

title: 25 euros for that? No
text:
Frankly 25 euros for a nice film, some aquariums very difficult to approach with the clumped world and a small exhibition upstairs is very expensive for the visit.
Very disappointed with what looks like a small scam well wrapped...

title: Scam
text: I booked the visit and was never sent tickets. I had to purchase on site and tickets were much cheaper. I requested a refund and am waiting for the response

title: Poor experience for disabled family
text: Extraordinarily overcrowded during our visit. We brought our young disabled daughter and she got to see nearly nothing. It was quite upsetting, as other visitors pushed in front of us and prevented her from getting to the front of a single tank. Able-bodied users used the disabled lifts, causing additional congestion. Staff tried to help when they saw us being pushed around (Literally, I've never had this experience at anything) but we still didn't get the chance to view much of anything. I've heard great things about this aquarium but this was honestly a really unpleasant and difficult day. I guess I could only suggest asking locals when it might be quietest? We went today, a Wednesday in October.

title: Visit to the Lisbon Oceanarium
text:
Although the Oceanarium is a spectacular and magical place, with a diversity of fascinating animals that really impress, the experience was disappointing. The number of people inside the space was absurd, making it impossible to observe the animals clearly and enjoy the visit calmly. At certain times, it was difficult to even walk, which made the ride boring and frustrating.
Considering the high ticket price, I expected a more organized and comfortable experience.
I just don‚Äôt give a lower review because, in fact, the animals are amazing and deserve to be seen, but the overcrowding completely compromised the experience.

title: Unfortunate treatment of the manager
text: Beware of these people take advantage of the tourists, I had a problem with the tickets and they were going to give me a return.... I keep waiting, they're all excuses, bad treatment of the staff a shameless.

title: Bof
text: Aquarium more than mediocre. A big pool in the middle where there is a diversity of fish and the rest zero. Small aquariums with 3/4 fish fighting in a duel. In addition it is indicated that it takes about 3 hours to visit the aquarium. Make it in 1:15. Avoid for 25 euros per person

title: Worst experience ever!
text: Worst experience ever!!! Animals and aquarium very well treated, however quantity of people on site makes the experience terrible and without the possibility of doing what we paid, living is enjoying the marine life!!

title: Mediocre
text: Nothing much, taking into account the cost of the ticket and the impossibility of finding the parking lot on August 12, 2024, since the only parking space indicated as theirs was fully booked. So we had purchased tickets online and had nowhere to park. We lost 1 hour searching and turning along the streets, congratulations on the organization.

title: Unfortunate treatment.
text:
They told us that we had to leave after we had bought the tickets and inform them that we carry a chihuahua in a backpack, first they tell us that without problem and after buying the tickets they kick us out... I asked for the return of the tickets and I still wait for the money back after a month... bad organization some say yes and others do not... above all they leave us as liars.... They gave us a hard time.
Nefarious treatment... AND I WANT MY RETURN NOW.!!!

title: Weak
text: horrible , very bad layout , almost not to see anything , we always see the same animals but from different sites , does not pay anything, especially for 25‚Ç¨

title: Waste of time/money/potential
text: Waaaaaaaaaay too crowded, way to expensive, and the whole was thing was done in 35 minutes. The best thing was the Japanese exhibition and even that was underwhelming.

title: What could have been a mediocre experience made worse by overcrowding and an absence of transport.
text:
This is way out of the centre of town so you have to get a taxi to it. There‚Äôs no obvious place for taxis to wait so you are left stranded hoping for a taxi that has just dropped someone off nearby to get back.

They let in about 3 times too many people as should have been allowed in and it was more like being in a packed tube train than a fun or educational experience.

They have one central tank with various places you can look in past crowds of people and a very small number of tanks with other creatures but with so many people there it was impossible to tell. After suffering about 20 minutes of this we made our escape and finally made it out after 30 minutes for 25‚Ç¨ each. For a similar experience walk up and down the aisle of a bus during peak commuting hours wearing a blindfold.

The London, Singapore and Valencia aquariums are much better. As an experience, the aquariums at Chessington or Brighton are better.

title: To be avoided. Disorganization and disrespect for visitors.
text: Too many visitors made visiting for adults torturous and impossible for children. I thought that as they announce visiting hours there would be a break in the entry of visitors and therefore space during the visit. This was not happening with people constantly coming in with absolute chaos inside and crowds of people in front of each aquarium. Horrible and certainly dangerous in terms of safety.

title: Not recommended, overpriced and overcrowded
text: Overcrowded and overpriced, not much special to see. Disappointing for everyone. It was just a crowd and no one could even get close to the aquariums. The entrance fee is ridiculous in comparison.

title: Not so great
text:
After what kind of publicity this place had, I expected something out of the ordinary.
In fact , it wasn't that great, at least not for me. It was way too crowded and there were a lot of things I didn't see because of that. There weren't much expositions, it was one large tank and more places to look at it.
I've definitely seen better aquariums and I am not sure if I should recommend this.

title: Okay aquarium, WAY too many people
text:
We had bought tickets online to avoid a long queue. When we arrived there was a really long queue, and after asking around a bit, we found out that the very long queue was actually for those who had bought tickets in advance. It kind of took the excitement out of going in and seeing the aquarium. With 2 children, we were about to give up already there, but the tickets had been bought, so we waited. It turned out that there was only a single scanned ticket at the entrance, and with a queue several 100 m long, it's just not good enough. The aquarium was ok, and the large tank was nice and you could see in from many different sides, you walk around the large aquarium during most of the visit. But the crowd and the large groups on guided tours, made it really difficult to enjoy it and take the time to see it all.
Okay aquarium, but the ones we have in Denmark can compare well with this and the amount of people, and large groups, means that we will not come again.

title: Not impressed
text:
Very not worth the price,
Don't visit on raining days as its so full with people that it is a horrible experience.
Don't buy online tickets until you are at the door, the line for o line tickets was over 100m long and the buy the tickets line was 20m. I blame management for the very slow pace of the online ticket line. A tip is to wait to buy the online ticket until you are at the door, also ignore the time slot on the online tickets it is not relevant.
About the exposition I have seen better at cheeper price's, honestly not impressed but disappointed for the ticket price, also the gift shop disappointing and very expensive..

title: Failed Visit of Oceanarium Lisbon - memorable negative experience
text: Incredibly bad organisation today 11h45, selling too many tickets with restricted number of access, waiting with baby in heavy weather & rain conditions, long waiting lines of approx. 50 m. outside without willing to give priority to family with 18 months old baby,no information from staff on realistic prognostics to get access into oceanarium, have bought tickets online during morning and finally/luckily then succeeded to give these back asking for respective credit, looks like having quite a big margin to improve organization and as well communication of some staff with customers in Oceanarium Lisbon.

title: It could be better
text:
Given that I don't like aquariums in general and knowing those poor fish closed in a tank, albeit a giant one, this one in Lisbon is nothing special: there are bigger and more beautiful oceanariums around.
No spectacular scenography:
at a certain point my daughter even got bored. The peculiarity is being able to combine the cableway ride.

title: Impudence
text:
It is a mystery to me why this aquarium is so highly praised, even in travel guides. I think they work together, have to write it, probably get a piece of the big pie, which at ‚Ç¨25 per adult is simply too high for what is on offer there. The only attraction is the sea otter, really funny, otherwise a large pool in the middle with lots of windows, cleverly distributed so that you think there are different pools.
Really sad, you can get through it in an hour, then you can watch a film about a surfer boy who thinks that just because he surfs the whole world has to save the ocean, it would be better to let the animals go free then we will have achieved something.
By the way, the people in charge at the aquarium in Palma Mallorca could find out how it really works, especially the 3D show about the whales, sensational!!!

title: It could be better
text: Perplexed, I read reviews about one of the largest aquariums in the world, a unique experience.....but where have you been, I wonder, have you visited the aquarium of Genoa, or the aquarium of Tenerife, perhaps it is better to save your money for the complete free tours which are fascinating and interesting? cheap aquarium rating 4 but only because I'm good, educational room video bellina na forsr a backrest seat?????in the Canary Islands steps in an aquarium tunnel

title: You have better things to do!
text:
So where to start ?
Don't go there!!
It's a beast 360¬∞ aquarium, which brings together fish, rays, sharks without anything exceptional... As you go around you will see two otters, a few penguins, two frogs and there you have it...
The only exceptional thing about this aquarium is the 25‚Ç¨/person at the entrance, which means that for this price there are much better things to do.
I strongly advise you not to go there!!
We were very disappointed with this aquarium and the maintenance of it, children fell in front of us because it was raining in the aquarium...
Not to mention the prices of stuffed animals at the store...

title: Scam promotion
text: There was a promotion from November 25th to December 1st! I went to the site this morning, December 1st, and it never let me complete the purchase. Suddenly in the afternoon the promotion disappeared. You could write that the tickets are sold out‚Ä¶. But instead without promotion you can buy it. It is a scam!!! It's not for the extra 20 euros. It is a question of principle and loyalty.

title: Lost time
text:
Lost time
Small aquarium with a few different types of animals, all the fish concentrated in a single tank without explanations and illustrations to understand what you are seeing.
‚Ç¨25 wasted

title: The price is too high
text:
50‚Ç¨ for two, compared to other zoos I have been to, it is quite small with fewer different species.
The ‚Äúpenguins‚Äù look really sad, with pieces of plastic that serve as their wings and prevent them from flying. They have trouble swimming and walking, it‚Äôs super sad.
For the price, size and one-armed space, it's not worth it. The store is pretty and the stuffed animals are really beautiful.

title: Way too overcrowded!
text: We were really looking forward to visiting with our baby but it was far too overcrowded to enjoy unfortunately. Over 30 mins queue to get in even though we had pre booked tickets with a specific time slot and then it was almost impossible to move around in the aquarium or get close to any of the tanks as there were so many people crowded in. They need to limit the numbers allowed in at one time.

title: Very disappointing
text:
The visit turned out to be very disappointing, we were unable to enjoy our visit because there were so many people (children screaming and running everywhere). The aquarium is expensive (25‚Ç¨/person) for what it offers: a central pool and small aquariums seen from different angles.
Go your way.

title: Could t wait to fine the exit
text: Warning! The things you don‚Äôt know before you go in is most of this is dark and extremely crowded. People, strollers, backpacks jostling in small spaces to peer into small aquarium windows. Some aquariums are larger and some displays in the light. It mostly it is very dark and jammed. together. I was In a panic to get out and I am Not usually that claustrophobic

title: Overcrowded
text: The offer of reduced tickets (‚Ç¨7.50 instead of ‚Ç¨25) during the month of September is of course going to attract lots of visitors, but the staff have done nothing to prevent overcrowding. There are two time slots, 5pm and 6pm. When we arrived early at 5:30, we asked where we would need to queue for the 6pm entry, and a member of staff said we could go straight in and the time slot didn‚Äôt matter. So there was no attempt to manage numbers. As a result, it was difficult to see many of the beautiful fish/animals without having to queue or being pushed up against lots of people. They need to keep to the time slots but also establish a capacity limit for the aquarium during September. It spoils the experience for everyone, especially for vulnerable people i.e. disabled, elderly, neurodivergent or those who suffer from claustrophobia/social anxiety.

title: Not worth it
text: This aquarium is certainly very beautiful, but when we visited other aquariums like the one in Montpellier, these ones are a little larger but almost identical. We regretted our visit.

title: VERY EXPENSIVE TICKETS!
text:
It's very sad for a family of 4 to want to visit the Oceanarium and have to pay ‚Ç¨95 to enter!
During the visit I also missed someone who could provide some clarification from time to time.

title: So many people, to the point of not seeing anything in the end, at 130‚Ç¨ for us it hurts.
text: It was so crowded that you couldn't even get close to the windows. At 130‚Ç¨ for the 6 of us, which remains reasonable, not being able to see anything remains a big disappointment.

title: A Waste of Time and Money..
text: It may be the biggest, but it was the worst we have ever been. More of a learning center for Grade School Children. Don't wast we your money.

title: Null
text:
Honestly, I'm a fan of the aquarium (La Rochelle St Malo..)
And ba c de la‚Ä¶and I‚Äôm nice

And all that for 25‚Ç¨

title: Good but disappointing
text: Everything was incredible, the animals and the environment itself, but I can't help but highlight that taking children (babies) who will never remember the visit is simply useless and disturbing for everything and everyone, people don't respect each other passing by each other. on top of others and stepping on them if it's just shameful as the Lisbon oceanarium continues without any percussion and with prices of 25 euros per person on an excursion that ends in less than 1 hour and even less if there are too many people hungry to see animals. ...

title: Service Dogs Banned
text: I arrived with my service dog and was originally granted access. However as I attempted to enter the exhibition areas I was stopped and advised that even service dogs were not permitted. I pointed out that banning service dogs was illegal but the organisers continued to say No insisting that as in some areas birds were flying around and that therefore my dog might get upset or he might upset the birds. I pointed out that I would put him a fully sealed buggy and that consequently access to him or him to birds was impossible but still was refused entry. In the event there was only one area where birds were flying around and in all other areas neither my service dog or their animals could reach or upset each other.

text: Carnaval parade is lesse crowded than this place. Barely could see any animal. If they limited the amount of visitor by half, it would still be too much.

title: Deludente
text:

A parte la grande vasca centrale (molto bella) c √® poco altro e si continua a girare li intorno. Lo consiglio solo in caso di brutta giornata.

title: Highly overrated. Sunfish is gone.
text: App doesn‚Äôt work, restaurant food tastes horrible, the main movie exhibit is in Portuguese with no English subtitles, staff are basically nonexistent with children free to bash on the tank glass, and the main attraction I came to see (the sunfish) is missing with a vague explanation by staff that it was ‚Äúin quarantine‚Äù. Frankly shocked that this aquarium is so highly reviewed. I would recommend spending your time in Portugal elsewhere. Very disappointed.

title: No crowd control
text: It was extremely crowded inside. Took about 20 minutes to get through the door the line was long. Once inside, most people crowded around the exhibit and did not make room for others. I was pushed a few times from seeing the animals. Native people seemed to have poor attitudes to travelers. I was not impressed by the exhibits. Otter was cute but that‚Äôs all.

title: Very poor/almost nonexistent customer service.
text:
Customer service didn‚Äôt work well: I had a pack that was going to expire. We marked on the website before the expiry date and gave to mark. However, by phone contact with the experience company, we were told that we would not accept the voucher and to call the Odyssey to request extension.

Well, the computer system that Odyssey has has served nothing, neither to prevent a supposed marking that is not valid, nor to let cancel, remarket or extend.

We send an email explaining the situation so that we can extend and use the package. They simply told us that it was already marked and that it did not, seeming to completely ignore what happened. Either that, or it was a robot responding or lack of will.

By phone, they do not answer (and still automatically say that waiting time is 2 minutes) and after about 6 minutes the call turns off to ask to call later, without the possibility of leaving a number.

Customer service is really bad! No advice!

title: Want punch into your face from guide?
text: Best road rage fighting tours everü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Absolutely recommend if you would like to get punch into your face from your guide üëäüí•ü§Ø

title: Feedback on Recent Experience To Sintra, Pena Palace and Cascais
text:
I am writing to provide feedback on my recent experience with your service. Regrettably, it was mediocre overall, and not a very pleasant experience.

I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this service to anyone, and I will not be booking with you in the future.

title: Terrible experience
text: I booked this trip because it had 5 star reviews...not sure how this can be rated 5 stars after my experience. I booked the day trip to Sintra, Pena Palace and Cascais. Our driver, yes I am going to call him a driver as he was not in any way a tour guide. There was no commentary, just pick up, dropped us at Sintra, told us what time to meet him at the van and that was it. No explanation of what we were seeing, why Sintra was special and what we should see in the 1.5 hours there. The same experience was repeated at Pena Palace, dropped at front gate, and told to come back in 2.5 hours...again no explanation of the history, what were we seeing etc.. Then we go to a beach for a photo stop, no explanation, then onto Cascais, again not told what we should see there, what was special etc... There was literally no interaction from the driver that was supposed to be a guide. There were 7 in the group and we all felt the same way. Considering we all paid ¬£80 per head, that is ¬£560 for the day, this was the most overpriced service for a "driver". We wanted a guide, not a driver...not impressed and don't recommend this company..

title: Customer service 0
text: Hang up the phone when i told her in portugees my english is better... weird service for a store not what im used to for a client

title: Don't book directly through their site, even if they ask you to
text: We found this tour on AirBnb experiences and reached out to book this tour, which sounded absolutely wonderful based on the reviews. We were asked by the owner to leave the AirBnB site and book directly through them instead since they only opened certain slots to AirBnB customers. So that's what we did, trusting that the tours were verified. An unfortunate series of weather and airline events led our trip to have to be postponed by a few days and we asked whether we could move our tour to a different day or refunded, but the owner refused. The company's policy is quite strict for cancellations; unlike the AirBnB policy which would have issued us a full refund for the tour with 24 hours notice. I had a few exchanges with the owner and received an angry and unprofessional reply. So we lost over $170 and never had the opportunity to enjoy this lovely tour. My recommendation to other travelers is to book through a 3rd party like AirBnB because there are more protections for the consumer and recourse in case there's an issue. Had we known this would have happened, we would have booked with a different company on AirBnB.

The tour was canceled by the company hours before. I asked if there were later tours available but was told no. Then received a call by the company at the time of sail asking if i was coming because they were waiting. No one else was there.
Later I received a message asking if i wanted the later time available.
Not good organization/communication.

title: Don't do this if you value your hearing
text:
Excruciatingly loud. My ears were ringing the next day. My friend had a mini panic attack and jumped off the boat just before we left the dock.

If you're going to get that loud, it would be good to start off quieter and let people get settled in, grab a drink, and adjust before you start in with the hearing damage. This was 0-100 before the boat left the dock.

The boat is too small for that many people. The "snacks" were an absolute joke. A disgusting bowl of chex mix that everyone had to dunk their hands into? No thanks.

This is a good idea if you:
- Don't like your friends and would rather not hear what they have to say
- Don't like being able to hear
- Like to dance on a moving boat (some do!)
- Just want to get drunk (no judgment)

The bartender was the best part of the experience. He was really nice and helpful, or maybe I just thought he was but couldn't actually hear him (or any of my friends) over the music.

title: Disappointing Experience ‚Äì Would Not Recommend
text:
We were really looking forward to this boat tour, but unfortunately, the experience started off on the wrong foot. When we arrived, we weren‚Äôt allowed down the ramp even though it was an extremely hot 36¬∞C day and my elderly grandmother was visibly struggling in the heat (we thought this tour specifically would be great for her because of the sitting down comfortably with snack and a cold beverage). When we eventually made our way down after the door was opened, the owner began shouting at us in a very rude and inappropriate manner. It was an incredibly unpleasant and unwelcoming start, and we were quite shaken by how he spoke to us.
Thankfully, the owner wasn‚Äôt the one conducting the actual tour. However, the experience itself was underwhelming. There was very little explanation or commentary during the trip, likely due to a language barrier, the man conducting the tour was a lovely gentleman.
The boat had barely any shade so be prepared to be uncomfortably hot and possibly sunburnt if you're going on a sunny day.
The listing on TripAdvisor mentioned snacks and drinks, but these were disappointing as well. The alcoholic drinks (beer and wine) were warm, and due to the heat, any ice provided melted almost immediately leaving no real way to cool down. The snacks consisted of dry biscuits coated in coconut flakes, and we expected more variety given the cost of the tour.
Overall, not a relaxing or enjoyable experience, and certainly not worth the money given the lack of professionalism, poor hospitality, and lack of basic comfort or quality.

title: We were at the meeting place to take the boat. someone came to tell us that the excursion will not have
text: We were at the meeting place to take the boat. someone came to tell us that the excursion will not take place because too much wind;. We return to our hotel about 5km by taxi. Five minutes after arriving, we receive a call saying we were expected. We explain and say it was someone else. We explained that we were not going to take a taxi again?? He said he was gonna pay us back. To date we have not received anything. Are they dishonest??

title: Cancelled on the day
text: Cancelled on the day by text message just 2 hours before start time. Asked but No immediate refund and still waiting for contact.

title: DO NOT LEAVE FOR THE LAST DAY OF TRAVEL
text:
It didn't happen. The organization contacted us via TripAdvisor that for weather reasons would be cancelled... However, it did rain until 12:00, but made a sun for each after that time and there were other and other boats sailing. Google informed of rain conditions until midday, but that it would be sunny the rest of the time. Frustrating? Yes. We were going to celebrate our niece's birthday. Hurried cancellation? Talvez!
Stay the tip to everyone! Don't leave this tour for the last day. They say it's beautiful, but since it didn't happen, I can't give a better score.

title: Anesthetic wine?
text:
For the price charged, they have poor quality drinks and little choice.
We became sick after drinking the wine, the bottle of which was already open.
Personally, I was left with almost no motor and mental control after 3 glasses of wine, which is really strange.
It's never happened to me and I drink socially.
It was worth being with my mother who protected me and brought me home practically unconscious.
She herself, who only drank one glass of wine, is in bed.
I really don't know what happened, but no more wine from that boat.

title: STAY AWAY
text:
I think that this is the first time i write a review, but i had to, as this company just gave me the worst experience ever on a tour.
I booked the tour, everything seemed seamless, the confirmation came immediately and I was really excited.
Everything else was horrible !
Tried to contact the company to understand where I could be picked up, no one ever answered until the morning of the tour itself. The tour guide, I think his name was Miguel, screaming at me, I couldn't believe this was happening, and somehow still apologized to him, not really knowing what I did wrong.
Now I know that he couldn't drive in a historic neighborhood, I had no idea.
The tour continued and it was horrible, the guide was rude the whole day, with everyone not only me and my partner, so we only did the pena palace and took a train back, just like a Dutch couple that left before us.
I should have known there was something wrong, but the price was too appealing.
Stay away

title: Tour cancelled with little notice
text: Wish I could rate this tour but they cancelled the evening before, leaving us with no other options to see the Bel√©m tower and monastery. Very disappointing. üòî

title: Cunards DOWNWARD TREND in class and service
text:
Just finished our 7th Cruise with Cunard and this time with the Queen Anne. UTTERLEY DISSAPOINTED with the service we got from the pursers and the voyagers office. To start with this ship lacked the grandeur of the other Cunard ships. The floor plan was messed up badly with the following points to note.
1) The Queens room is much smaller than the other ships.They could not host the guests on any day in that room for afternoon Tea and had to move us to the Britanua club.
2) The library seemed liked an after thought on the 12th floor in one squishy corner which quite often had no staff member there.
3) the Gym was tucked away in the bottom of the ship near the Theater with no atmosphere at all.
4) As for the casino it was nowhere as spacious as the other ships. Guests were using it as a main throroughfare to move up and down the ship.
5) Deck3 which used to be the walking or relaxing deck with deck chairs on the other ships had just small benches as all the tender boats were on that deck on both sides.
6) The quality of the food in the Britania Restaurant has dropped considerably. Most of the meat dishes were like chewing leather.
I felt they were trying to push guests to the alternative restaurants where we had to pay to get a decent meal. Even the shows in the theater were sub standard on some nights. They were sort of pushing us to pay for caberet shows in anotehr venue on the ship.

Now about the VOYAGERS OFFICE:
The staff were unhelpful and did not seem happy with their jobs. They cancelled our shore excursions before the cruise and during the cruise with no explanation or alternative options. It was a couldnt care less attitude to their guests.
When going on shore excursions on tender boats to shore we all have to take a STEP TEST to see if we can cross into the tender. I was horrified to see an elderley man who could barely walk and had to be assisted on and off the tender by 3 guest staff. On one of the excursions, the sea was really choppy and the staff chose to get him off first which took a long time whilst other guests were almost sick with the tender listing a lot. I complained to the tender staff and asked them how he got through the step test as he was really putting 90 guests lives at risk both ways in an emergency. I then went immediately to the pursers office to compalin and asked the Supervisor to contact me in my cabin. NOTHING HAPPENED. The ships admin staff just dont care enough.

THE PURSERS OFFICE:
Tucked away in another back corner of the ship.
They constantly tell all the guests not to bring adaptors or extension cords. When you ask them on board for it. They either dont have it or make it look like its is all too hard and make you feel troublesome.

Cunard send their guests a terribly long tedious survey (which they probably know noone will take the time to complete) which I have filled twice and asked for someone to call or respond to my greviances. It has fallen on deaf dont care less ears!!

This time I thought I would put it out there to the general public and make everyone aware of the quick downward trend the Cunard cruises are taking of late.

Hope this helps many cruise goers!!

Date of experience: 01 June 2025

title: THE GIFT THAT KEPT ON GIVING.
text: My daughter had her wedding on the beach and all the family members were staying at this property. There was a total of 8 rooms we rented out. Problem 1: The elevators did not work all the time and we were on the 6th floor my husband has a bad knee and it took some time for him to get up the stairs. #2: PARKING What a joke we were there over Memorial Day and people who were not staying there just came in and took peoples parking when my son went to talk to management they would not call the TOW TRUCK (like the signs says) and told them to find somewhere else to park!! #3 When we went to park there were Squatters in the parking area and having a barbeque so it made it hard for us to park.. #4 To get into the pool you didn't need a room key it was broken and who ever could go swim. # 5 If you eat in the Restaurant they will charge you 3 1/2 % to your bill if you use your card and added on quite the tip. #6 After I checked out I remember I had left my swimsuit in the dresser drawer, and I called them and the Lady at the front desk said she would look into this. My Son had stayed and he went down to talk with them also BUT WE GOT NO WHERE They never called me back she never wrote it down and my son was diligent in going in and talking to them!!! GOT NO WERE WITH THEM... # 7 OUR room was NOT READY until Way after check in!!!!

title: YUCK
text: Use this place twice a week. Tonight was just AWFUL. Inedible to be honest and we actually phoned to let them know. Won't be having anything from here anytime soon.

title: Bad.
text:
Arriving at Piazza Martim Moniz, crowded with men, some sitting others standing, urinating in the corners.
It was about 20:00 h very dangerous I do not recommend anyone to make this walk in the evening, mainly pick up in this square.
An awful place smelling urine.
The electric car is crowded, the majority of people walk, like sardine in a can, bad for tourists and locals.
