Do not book with these guys. All about keeping the cash!!

title: Replacement tablecloth never happened; No help from the shop as I sent photos of the rewoven areas.
text: September, 2022 I was so excited to find this shop as I was looking for a white tablecloth to bring back to Virginia. From the website I thought I might not be able to afford one but found one and paid cash for it. Unfortunately I got home with no receipt in my bag and the tablecloth had several rewoven spots in it plus some minute holes. I e-mailed the shop and they said they would get one out right away but it turned out they were not going to mail me one until I sent mine back at my own expense. I mailed it through Pak Mail and it cleared customs but sat in Lisbon since last November 10th, 2022. A return was requested and it finally arrived back in Norfolk, Virginia and the executive administrator for the VMFA was going to take it to Lisbon today, September 1st, 2023 as they were going back to this same hotel. However the shop owner or his granddaughter needed to pick it up at the hotel. I was not going to spend over $100.00 to send it back by DHL or Fed X. Well, they never answered my e-mails. Just a terrible experience when it was a lovely shop and some lovely linens. Beware of what you are buying and don't expect them to take care of something if there is a problem. Much disappointment for me.

title: Disappointing
text: Music was not what we expected - 80s and 90s Muzak, and whisky sour was premixed which is a no-no for a good cocktail bar. Fun quirky decor though.

title: Horrible staff
text:
What kind of staff do you want to have in a place like this one? It deserves better.
One of the waiters spent 10 minutes outside while clients are waiting talking about her lovers and screaming some dirty words.
Non professional.
What a shame.

title: NOT INCLUSIVE OF QUEER PEOPLE
text:
I've been sitting at a table with my boyfriend for an hour when the waiter approaches, claims he has nothing against us BUT tells us we have to stop the "movements" (I assume he was referring to some innocent displays of affection). He also states that he has done "much worse things" in the same place where we were sitting, but with the bar as empty as it was that night, we couldn't have such "movements" because "customers might complain" and the boss had already noticed also.
On leaving, we ask the boss for the Complaints Book, who just tells us "that's up to my colleague", leaving. He approached us to question what had happened only when the complaint was practically completed, without ever, at any time, trying to compensate us or explain the situation to us. On the other hand, the waiter tried to offer us a drink which, in my opinion, is an admission of guilt.
I can guarantee that my boyfriend and I did not go beyond occasional kisses that would also be completely appropriate in public and family spaces, which leads me to believe that the problem was that there were two boys and, therefore, an act of HOMOPHOBIA.

title: DO NOT GO. HORRIBLE!!!
text:
Horrible!!!
You are rude and prejudiced!!!
They did not allow a 22-year-old boy to be in the establishment (just because he had trisomy 21)

title: Bar not inclusive!
text: I went to this bar, which I went to many times, with a group of friends, one of whom was accompanied by her 22-year-old son. Because when we arrived we were "advised" not to go in because, firstly, she thought the "kid" was smaller and that he was very excited. He was told (the person who received us) that the so-called "kid" was not a minor and that he was actually 23. The big issue here is that, and once again, the so-called "kid" has Trisomy 21. He was accompanied by 5 adults, just like him. We tried to understand the reason for the very unfriendly and, in my opinion, very uninclusive reception, and the answer we were given, which was somewhat altered in a way, was one that had "antiquities" to protect! Moral of the story, not even the so-called "much" had changed, nor were there any antiquities to defend. Very unfriendly person. I was sorry I didn't write it in the complaints book. Everything this person can now respond to this comment in his defense is a pure lie!

title: Bad welcome, dislike.
text: Antipathy on the part of the person in charge and her husband, who treat customers badly and do not seat customers when there is a table. Bad welcome.

title: De fugir
text: Atual propriet√°ria trata mal os clientes. Empregados antip√°ticos e com p√©ssimo aspecto. Como destruir a reputa√ß√£o de um cl√°ssico de Lisboa em menos de uma gera√ß√£o.

title: Porque n√£o educar os empregados do Procopio?
text: Fui um cliente muito frequente do Proc√≥pio . A local era acolhedor, as bebidas √≥ptimas os empregados educad√≠ssimos. O local continua a agrad√°vel . Os cocktails baixaram muito de qualidade, o whiskey mal servido e os empregados s√£o mal educados , pouco profissionais e n√£o presta . Comecemos no balc√£o: um "senhor" de sotaque estrangeiro precisa de umas horas de educa√ß√£o e de perceber que todos os clientes s√£o "o cliente". A menina que serve √† mesa parece que nasceu para outra fun√ß√£o. Como devem estar incomodados o Luis e Alice Pinto Coelho ao verem esta gente. .

title: The money . The money is chic ‚Ä¶.
text:
Disappointing. Too commercial and poor contact.
Management too focused on remuneration and hasty. Time is money would be a good slogan.
The captain, in addition to his constant haste, is not very pleasant and borders on unprofessional.
Bad experience.
Too bad Lisbon deserves better‚Ä¶.

title: Mixed results
text: Below our expectations. We were a little nauseous, maybe the smells on the boat. The atmosphere was rather unpleasant. In short, we regret.

title: Do not book if you are coming from Lisbon
text:
The traffic from Lisbon to Belem is horrendous for the sunset tour. We left with plenty of time but the traffic got progressively worse and worse. We contacted the company and kept them updated but they waited 15 min from departure time and left. We ended up arriving 5 min too late. The email with the information on the depature point was unclear because the photo was attached at the end and not embedded in the email where it said ‚Äòhere‚Äô and so it was not
Obvious where the boarding point was. Doca de Belem is quotes a large area and the taxi dropped us off at the Yellow Boat area which was the wrong end and contributed to the lateness. The taxis will always assume that is the drop off area and there are NO signs for Pypas over there. Buyer beware when you are booking this tour and make sure you leave 2 hours to travel from central Lisbon if you book. You can see from the photo that there is no info on the boarding point. Don‚Äôt make our very expensive mistake.

title: Wiest company. Please be always sure there is a good company when you take a tuk tuk
text: Take care. This company seems super ilegal. The crashed a car a run away. Today at 20:00 in gra√ßa. They dont have anything in social media.

title: My experience
text:
Anyone know where I can file a complaint about this company? Today the driver hit my car and ran away. I'm calling and they're telling me I'm calling for five minutes and I'm still waiting.

Where can I do a complain about this company? Today the driver hit me and ran away.

title: Cheap Disney type of experience
text:
Not a museum as much as a cheap children's
Museum. I thought it would be about the history of Lisbon the quake and how it shaped the city. Instead it was gimmicky with cheap interactive devices. It references CA and Japan quakes ? Has a ridiculous quake simulation that is a mechanical floor just moving around. Its timed and you have to stay in a particular area for 10 minutes at a time. If you want to leave you have to ask and be escorted out

Staff seemed disinterested at best.

Waste of time and money

title: Nothing Special and Unclear When Buying
text:
I state that I am an avid museum visitor and leave a negative review reluctantly, but due.
I visited Portugal between late May and early June with my family (two adults, a child almost 5 years old and an infant). Wanting to avoid any queues, I searched for information online, and although it was not mandatory to buy the ticket in advance, it was strongly recommended, both for the presence of entrance timeslots (some already full), both for a discount in case of purchase the day before the visit, and by a nice BUY button that is the first thing you see when accessing the site.
I read that the visit was also suitable for children, so I bought tickets for two adults.
Too bad that once I arrived (a quarter of an hour in advance as always recommended on the site) I was told that access is forbidden to children under 4. Why is that? Company policy.
I asked how we could solve it and they told us that I could come in with my eldest son, and once I left my wife could come in. Comfortable, two solo visits that take up twice as much time.
I said I'd rather leave, and since I'd already paid, if they could refund me.
Of course there are no refunds.
I ended up visiting the museum only with my son while my wife waited.
Later I checked the FAQ and the age issue is explained unclearly. You see it better if you look carefully during the purchase, but it is easy to go further by simply thinking that under a certain age the price is reduced, under still it is free. I recommend putting a more visible alert.
Also you can always be wrong, I do not understand this rigidity in making refunds. I gave the money, if I leave without using a service it is quite logical and linear to return it. Also not in cash, you can refund the credit or prepaid card used at the purchase.
The museum itself consists of a semi-guided tour, in the sense that there are several rooms and you can continue in the next one only after a predetermined time has passed, so it lasts about an hour and a half with no way to speed up or slow down (you can stay longer in the last room).
There are several experiments, for example to visually explain how a tsunami arises, and the whole visit is focused on a sort of "mission" to travel through time and find lost documents. Not really my idea of a museum, but apart from my opinion, it is clear that it is aimed at children and teenagers, and for this reason I find it paradoxical that there is a minimum age to enter.
By the way, my son did enter, but he could not participate in a part of the visit, in which the earthquake inside a church is simulated during a mass. Sure, the benches were shaking a little, but nothing dramatic.
Moreover, the information along the entire route was not particularly thorough. I already knew this event well, but if you enter without knowing anything you learn little.

title: Terrible. Terrible. Terrible.
text:
Complete waste of time. Poor interaction and completely lacking in history.

Bad visuals. Scant information Rip off price for what it is.

Nothing. It is not worth visiting

title: Disappointment
text:
The idea is good, the realization much less on some workshops.
The timing is not good at all, adults would sometimes need time to spend on workshops, not up to the recommendations...
high price

title: Nice museum but really for small children
text:
Nice museum but really for primary school children. You definitely don't have to go here as an adult or young adult. Entrance fee of ‚Ç¨33 is definitely disproportionate to what you see. Everything is recreated in rooms where you are locked up for 10 minutes each time. So you are not in charge of your pace and route.
People are friendly and everything is clean but really for small children.

title: Expensive, too expensive
text:
Strongly adverized ‚Äùmuseum‚Äù is more a commercial way to show an earhquake as a story. Interesting, but totally overpriced when knowing what else interesting is is Lisboa to see.

Young persons telling the ways to go and give information speak too quickly and are used to wverything but do not understand the information is new for customers. So it was a bit difficult to follow everything.

I would not pay this again. 15 euros would be enough.

title: Disappointing
text: Disappointing, and exaggerated price for the experience. The stay in the rooms is too short to be able to explore them. I couldn't even see half the stations and felt like I was always being dispatched. The simulator was also far behind expectations. I do not recommend.

title: I can‚Äôt recommend this attraction. Kids might like it.
text: If you‚Äôve already visited all your places of interest in Lisbon, you might then consider Quake. Many people like it; we didn‚Äôt. The displays were not great and the shaking earthquake room is ridiculous. You get violently thrown around in hard wooden seats that is supposed to be like an earthquake. It‚Äôs a narrated tour with a silly theme that makes you part of a journey of discovery. It‚Äôs an attempt at Disney but not nearly as well done. Unless you want to get shaken around and listen to a contrived soundtrack, go online to learn about the earthquake. Finally, kids might it. Prepare to shell out a lot of Euros.

title: Disappointment
text:
What a disappointment!
It is defined as an immersive experience that allows to revive the earthquake of 1755 when in fact, and in short, it is an exhibition using videomapping.
I ended the visit quite disappointed.
As for the price of the ticket is exaggeratedly high for what is presented, does not justify.

title: Overpriced trap
text:
Tourist trap, unfortunately. Maybe more interesting for kids than for grown-ups even if I doubt about it as well.
The earthquake simulators are ridiculous and there are so many uninteresting info about politicians of the times of the earthquake.
I paid 24 euros for an 100 mins experience while walking around the neighborhood for free would be more entertaining.

title: This is a kids museum
text: We went as two adult couples and the word we used to describe it was hokey. We thought this would be an interesting museum and we would learn some history about the Lisbon earthquake so we went but regretted going. If you are going with children, they will probably really enjoy it but this isn't an adult museum.

title: A big disappointment!
text:
The museum can only be visited at predetermined times and then only as a guided tour. The historical settings are only suitable for the film, but not for museum audiences. Overall badly done, very long-winded and boring. I have visited many museums before, but the Quake was by far the biggest disappointment!
Admission fees are simply a boldness.
Actually, no star at all, if that were possible.

title: Disappointing!
text: This was possibly the lamest museum I have been to anywhere. Very disappointing. They could have done vastly more with the subject matter. The technology and visuals were poor, and the information scant.

title: Not for adults
text: The place is pretty boring. A bit of childish communication from employees about security. There are many decorative things cheaply made with lights and audio which are not interesting. For my point of view the price for visiting such a place is too high for the value, as it is twice as expensive than some art gallery. Do not recommend going as un adult

title: Customer experience wasted by a visit time shipped! Disappointing at that Award.
text:
Fun museum that revives the seismic tragedy of November 1755 in Lisbon.
However, the time of the visit is imposed by the museum staff, and was shipped in 1h20 instead of 1h40 sold and hoped for.
In fact, we were unable to complete all the workshops due to a severe lack of time. This is really outrageous!
This spoiled our customer experience, and it wasn‚Äôt the ability to continue the experience offline using scanned QR-codes that improved it.
We much preferred Lisbon Stroy Center, Place du Commerce, 4 times cheaper, and without time limit!
With the desire to make the museum more profitable by shortening the visit time, do not be surprised to see its Rating decrease.

title: Useless Quake
text: The staff is very prepared and super friendly. But the visit is very expensive, boring and useless. Waste of time. And in fact, nobody knows where this Quacke is, neither the taxi drivers nor the residents. Dedicate that lost time to getting lost in Lisbon.

title: Pretentious, very time-consuming and impossible if you don't like the experience
text:
Interactive museum with little interactivity, poor visual effects, slow explanations, perhaps only suitable for children, very expensive entry price compared to other incredible international museums by comparison (e.g. Expl. TEAM lab in Tokyo).
No possibility of leaving if the experience is not pleasant. Late. Boring

title: Complete disappointment
text: Big disappointment, and accessibility is zero, the special effects are rubbish, I've seen museums like this in Portugal and I've never been disappointed

title: An experience to forget very quickly
text: An experience to forget very quickly. Way too expensive for what it is. We were extremely disappointed with this museum. The feeling it tries to give of an earthquake really failed. One has to wait a long time in each room until the next one is free. It is oppressively hot and there is a lack of oxygen. This is peasant magic.

title: Poor service and personal
text: I came from far away with my family. They refused me access because I was carrying my baby (who sees nothing and hears nothing). I paid for my ticket for nothing, because of course they didn't want to reimburse me. Already 82‚Ç¨ for 4 people is excessive! No friendliness from the staff, no humanity from the manager. Not accommodating! It ruined our family time. My husband entered the museum with my two grown daughters.

title: the museum staff is very rude
text: They refused me access because I was carrying my baby (who sees nothing and hears nothing). I paid for my ticket for nothing, because of course they didn't want to reimburse me. Already 82‚Ç¨ for 4 people is excessive! No friendliness from the staff, no humanity from the manager. Not accommodating! I came from far away with my family. It ruined our family time. My husband entered the museum with my two grown daughters.

title: Too costly for what you get and needs warnings for people with bad backs
text:
For an adult who loves science, and learning about earthquakes, tornadoes etc , I was disappointed. Too much slow time doing nothing. You go from room to room and read about or listen to info about various facts of Lisbon and the quake. It was a few minutes of learning followed by many minutes of boredom in each room. It could use some editing to make it more exciting and interesting.

If we had only done the earthquake room where you are sitting in cathedral pews during the simulated earthquake, and charged 5 euros just for that , it would have been fantastic. Otherwise it was way too expensive for the experience.

Being a doctor, I agree with another reviewer about the danger of the simulated quake. It could be very dangerous for people with osteoporosis (possible vertebral fractures) and spinal degenerative disc disease. The tour guide at the front very quickly stated that if anyone wants to sit on a bench in the back that doesn‚Äôt move, they could. But she was hard to understand and the statement was made very quickly right before the experience began. A more definitive warning with signs and speech would be prudent. I would also recommend big warning signs in the main lobby and that the ticket sellers mention this to each ticket buyer , especially the elderly.

title: No warning on dangers
text:
There is no warning.

WARNING:

This is an absolute NO for someone with back problems, mobility issues, young children, autism, sensory issues, light sensitivity, pregnant, or have a history of seizures. You are asked to sit in wooden hard benches and you are shaken for a three solid minutes. You cannot leave the rooms which are built like escape rooms. There are no bathrooms during the experience which last 1.5 hours. They heat you to experience the fires then the floods. We asked twice to be let out after injuries. They did not let us out. It cost 25 euros to get in. It is not worth the pain I am in. It blew my back out.

title: Stay away - so not worth it.
text: This was one of the most sophomoric exhibits I have ever witnessed. It's a total disappointment from the amateurish lighting and poor performance of the "employee/actors" to the lack of true virtual reality technology I've seen employed to such great effect on other immersive displays. The Quake was a true tragedy and deserves a better treatment than what was done here. Plus, for the experience, its exhorbitently priced. My advice would be to go to the coach's museum next door.

title: Boring and expensive
text:
I found everything super boring considering how expensive it was.
It's not entertaining at all.
And as a tip, they should try to make the experience and treatment of customers better because you pay to have a good experience.

title: Rubbish!
text: Interactive sections are rubbish. Boring, not educational and absolutely overpriced. Stay away from this tourist trap!

title: Too much too expensive and not that interesting
text: Activity too, too, too (I can't repeat it enough) expensive for what it is. I think the people who gave it 5 stars haven't seen enough museums or countries to find this museum interesting. Even in the church room (the only one where there are supposedly effects), the only effects were the smells and the sound. At Disneyland alone, more than 20 years ago I attended a 3D show by far better where there were also tactile effects... Frankly to avoid we paid 100 euros and regretted it. If you still want to do it, buy the ticket 24 hours in advance, it will be a little cheaper.

title: Tourist trap
text: A complete rip-off, considering the absurdly high price. Just a tourist trap, do not go there. Much better places in the city to learn about the earthquake.

title: Very overpriced & silly experience
text: First off, my husband booked this and liked it. However, my 2 teenaged children and I thought it was so silly we couldn't help but laugh throughout the 1 hour & 40 minute experience. It was Euro 30 per person so was quite overpriced. The economics of this is not viable (noting the empty Coach Museum next door likely has a similar issue). We were a family of 4 & had approximately 12 people in our assigned group and you could see the venue accommodated not many more so I imagine there is not enough throughput to support this museum. Note, you are forced to pace your experience as you are closed into a series of rooms with your group. You must stay the entire 1 hr 40 minutes. This should be geared to children's school groups perhaps (but consider redesigning your lengthy stairs with no landing first). There is a flipping between space-age, futuristic rooms & historically designed sets which is confusing. Some of the information was interesting but the presentation was so overwrought & limited the experience.

title: Expensive, not interesting
text: I did not enjoy this. I am a woman with an interest in history and geography. I didn‚Äôt learn anything new here, the info on tectonics and the interactive stuff is quite dull. The historical testimonials are invented. There are two earthquake simulations and neither is particularly interesting. The one in the church goes on too long and you have to remember this was a tragic event killing tens of thousands of people, and feels odd to try and make it ‚Äúfun‚Äù like a theme park experience. Also you are stuck doing the whole 1 hour 40 minutes, you can‚Äôt leave. Way too expensive as well.

title: Big hyped up waist of time.
text:
This is the most overhyped and disappointing activity in Lisbon.
All smoke and mirrors, and NO value for money, not cheap either, and a total waist of time.
Un eganging and just plain boring, for a young ten and a adult thst are very open minded.
A big hype and not worth your time or money.
The staff was very on autopilot and disengaged, uninterested and non welcoming.
Not recommended and will not return.
Stay away much better options abd better value for money around.

title: Dececionante
text:
Forma ligeira e simplista de tratar a hist√≥ria da cidade. Publicidade espalhafatosa para a realidade modesta que o s√≠tio oferece. N√£o deve ser confundido com um museu, mas para experi√™ncia - que √© o que parece dominar os tempos e os projetos dedicados a turistas - √© pouco inovadora. N√£o s√≥ as proje√ß√µes de v√≠deo s√£o grosseiras e pouco reais como as salas onde se tentam recriar tempos antigos s√£o pouco convincentes. H√° 30 anos as experi√™ncias deste g√©nero por essa Europa fora eram bastante superiores. Ali√°s, qualquer atra√ß√£o dentro da Eurodisney tem cen√°rios mais convincentes.
Pessoalmente, n√£o aprendi nada sobre o terramoto al√©m do que sabia. Por tudo isto acho o pre√ßo absurdo. Na verdade n√£o percebo como um barrac√£o grande nas traseiras de tudo pode cobrar mais do que atra√ß√µes verdadeiramente pedag√≥gicas. N√£o recomendo.

title: Tr√®s d√©cevant et trop cher.
text: Le prix est tr√®s cher pour cette attraction. Il faut compter une trentaine d'euros par personne. Tarif exorbitant pour les portugais. Attraction d√©cevante, "effets sp√©ciaux" dat√©s, valables il y a 30 ans ! Franchement tr√®s d√©cevant.

title: A costly mistake
text:
I did not so what to expect with this tour. Was real short on time so hoped I could be in and out in maybe 45mins. I paid for the ticket with seemed a little pricey but it did come with good reviews. The agent then told me I wouldn‚Äôt be able to speed through it as I wished as the rooms opened gradually after a certain amount of time. She told me it would take an hour and a half. Realising my mistake, I apologised and said I would not be able to do it. I asked if I could have a refund. She told me this were not possible even though I had literally just paid for it. They let me just walk out the door having paid ‚Ç¨30 without any shame or effort to apologise or refund me in any way.

Its for this reason it gets the 1 star. I thought this was so poor.

title: Very nice but way overpriced
text:
It was a nice experience. Carefully made with a lot of insights. However, there are a few drawbacks:
1. The tour is organized along a storyline. You cannot discover on your own but rather you're rushed from one room to another. The story is a good fit for children.
2. Its way overpriced. Don't get me wrong, I know that all the tech that is built in costs money. But 31 Euros for adults with no student or other discounts available is way too much.

title: Tasteless, infantile and way overpriced.
text: Truly the biggest waste of 29 euros you can imagine. I can assume it would be enjoyable for anyone under the age of 12, but even then, it‚Äôs still wildly expensive. There‚Äôs about 15 minutes worth of information stretched out into a 90 minute experience that requires you to adhere to a strict timeline. Despite our desire to move on once we were done with a certain room, we had to wait. Toward the end of the tour, once we had heard for the 5th time the basic, Wikipedia-level details (actually, Wikipedia is far more informative than this exhibition) we wanted to leave the whole place early, but were prevented from doing so until it had ended. This is a ridiculously cheesy and infantile ‚Äúmuseum‚Äù that transforms one of the greatest tragedies in Portuguese history into a tasteless, wannabe Disneyland experience. Avoid at all costs.

title: Very disappointing park
text: This park is very small, the animals are parked in poorly maintained enclosures, some birds were dead, the green spaces are full of weeds, no signs, it is forbidden to touch the animals, everything is done in 15 minutes, fortunately it is is free and there is no parking.

title: Long waiting hours to visit
text: We waited for 2 hours, long queue.. even thƒ±ugh you have a city pass you have to wait with the people who have tickets. Then you have the privilege to visit a small part of monastery. On the way out there was chaple which we couldnt visit cayse you have to wait another queue .. this is unrational and time consuming.. To visit a monastery you have to wait for two queues and pay two times.

title: Could do better
text: Whilst the park is beautiful to look at, there was no information about the park, no interpretation of different areas, not disabled friendly, grumpy train driver . Dogs are not allowed on the train around the park. Bit disappointed

title: Oriented towards non-critical tourists
text: The backing musicians were very hard and professional. The singer didn't spark. She just rinsed off her program and took a break of almost 15 minutes after just 20 minutes. There was no encore either. Measured by the entrance fee, a less than moderate event; it is more touristy and with little heart.

title: Lack of punctuality
text: Good night, there is comfort inside the bus however there is a lack of professionalism on the part of the company when it comes to punctuality. I have walked several times and every time there is always a delay d and at least half an hour, a lack of respect!

title: Badly polite driver and offensive driving...
text: We returned from Nazar√© to Lisbon with this company, driver left late, started the trip with people standing, my wife fell on the stairs, another passenger sat in our place, I tried to change p/ sit with my wife, rough driver stopped the bus and made a fiasco, poorly polite. I complained at the company, they didn't give back. Choose to travel with the FLIXBUS, much better ....
Waited a full hour for the bus to arrive after its due date and there was still nothing. Ended up needing to take a different bus to my destination.

title: Alentejo - Algarve: Bad experience
text: Never take a bus from Alentejo to Algarve with this company. I had to change bus 3 times and wait half an hour in Albufeira because the driver caught traffic on the exit from Lisbon (without his fault), but I still took with a third change of transport between Portim√£o and Lagos after that. A trip that started at 17:15 from √âvora, ended in the Algarve at 23:00. Just to forget. I think Flixbus is much more direct.

"I had booked a bus ticket from Coimbra to Porto with Red Express My bus was supposed to arrive at Porto at 6:45 PM. However, due to some reason, the driver did not know the correct route or perhaps did it intentionally and took the bus to Aveiro city The bus was delayed by an hour and only reached the airport at 7:40 PM, which left me with only 5 minutes to catch my flight. Despite my efforts, I was not allowed to board. As a result, I lost the 300-pound ticket. I want to file a complaint against Red Express for this issue. I am sending all the proofs, including the ticket I purchased at that moment. Please contact me."

title: Dia 05 Julho viatura 23 09h15 F√°tima/Lisboa
text:

title: Unpleasant behaviours
text: (Bus) Drivers will never respect to passengers. No welcoming environment at all. Experienced unprofessional and cruel attitudes most of the time when use their services.

title: Delay, dirt and bugs
text: I'd put 0 stars if I could. I went from Lisbon to Madrid on a bus that reached Paris. He arrived almost half an hour late, the line was not respected when he got in, the driver only checked the tickets to some people who got in, others did not, and he came screaming to everyone because we were "late", which was entirely the responsibility of the company when the bus arrived 20 minutes after the supposed departure time. That, however, was not the worst. When I got on board I noticed that the bus was incredibly dirty, which is amazing because they won't let you eat for the entire 7-hour journey. When I sat in the seat, I clearly saw several bugs walking on the seats and through the window curtains. Three weeks later, I noticed bed bugs in my house. The bus is very cheap but it wasn't worth it at all, it's a shame you didn't read the reviews before buying the ticket. I wouldn't come back even if I got the ride. If you have the opportunity to go with ANY OTHER COMPANY, whether it‚Äôs paying a lot more, do yourself the favor.

title: Dangerous Driving
text: I traveled with my Yorkshire (2kg) to the Alentejo (Lisboa-village green of fist), the driver didn't want him to be next to me, when he paid a ticket too.The driver did not buy the schedule, was waiting for a passenger 20 minutes, with all the stunts and excess speed and various violations of the road code, we arrived with a 1h delay. It was the first and last time I already informed the authorities of what happened. I felt in danger. I highly recommend the kindness of the flixbus drivers and length of schedules

title: Physiological Needs
text:
Good afternoon.

I understand that toilet maintenance costs money. What I do not understand is that a customer of Rede Expressos has to pay for this service, since he is on a journey and paid for that trip. I have come to the conclusion that, the travel breaks, are all made in the Expressos network posts and never in service areas, as for example, it is policy of Flixbus.
With this policy, Rede Expressos "mandates" its customers, whenever they have physiological needs, to use the toilets of their stations and charges them the value of 1‚Ç¨. It's a very "dirty" game by the company.
I repeat, I understand that it is necessary to maintain the spaces, but when presenting the ticket the use should be free, as is in many establishments from the moment the customer consumes.
They are small acts, but get bad to Expressos Network, it's just a "tax" disguised.

A hug and good trip!

title: BIG FLOP NO AVAILABLE WC IN ALL THEIR BUSES
text: BIG FLOP üëéüëéüëéI don‚Äôt recommend their service is the worst ever , I always take rede Expressos to move here in Portugal but always the same problem they don‚Äôt have toilet (WC) it‚Äôs always locked in every trip even for long trips of 5hours and more and the worst is they don‚Äôt stop for a break at least to look for a public WC

title: Terrible! Bus air conditioning not working.
text: The bus was on time however the air conditioning was not working and the entire trip (3 hours) felt like we were traveling in an oven. Horrible experience!

title: Terrible Service
text:
I was visiting Lisbon and had planned to take the train to Porto, but during my trip, the trains were on strike. Locals told me the buses were actually a better option anyway, so I decided to take the bus instead.

When I arrived at the station, I was a bit lost. Being new to the country, I wasn‚Äôt sure which bus to board‚Äîthere were multiple buses labeled for Porto. I must have looked confused because someone kindly pointed me toward a machine where I could scan my ticket. It directed me to Bus 10.

Still unsure, I approached the driver of Bus 10 to confirm, but he was rude and dismissive. I hesitated, unsure if I should board. I noticed he wasn‚Äôt scanning tickets for anyone that had luggages in their hand so he was scanning tickets for people who had already stored their luggage‚Äôs. Instead of informing us he dismisses us. So I followed suit, loaded my luggage, and approached him again. This time he scanned my ticket without saying a word. I boarded the bus, hoping I was on the right one.

The ride from Lisbon to Porto is 3.5 hours. At some point, a few passengers needed to use the restroom, but it was locked. Two women had to protest and demand the driver stop so they could relieve themselves. Out of fear of being left behind, I stayed on the bus because bathroom lines were long so I had to hold my bladder for the remaining 1.5 hours of the trip.

Someone in a review had mentioned that tall people should reconsider this bus‚Äînow I understand why. I‚Äôm six feet tall, and thankfully, no one was seated next to me. Otherwise, my legs would‚Äôve been incredibly cramped.

Overall, my experience was terrible. The bus driver was rude and unhelpful, and having no access to a restroom on such a long trip was unacceptable.

I hope you all see this review before you purchase your ticket and find alternative rides.

title: Worst company in Europe
text: The worst company in Europe. Drivers without training and education to deal with people. Usually late. Horrible service to all senses

title: :/ getting worse
text: late 20 minutes and the bus seats do not correspond to those chosen when I bought online. I chose place the window, but does not correspond to the number and organization inside the bus

title: In need of so many improvements. Unprofessional.
text: Damaged seats in busses are not being repaired. Bus driver smoking a cigarette while serving clients blowing the smoke into the bus. Disgusting. Unprofessional.

title: "Experiences with Rede Expressos: Closed Toilets and Poor Service"
text: While traveling from Lisbon Sete Rios to Porto Airport, I asked the driver to use the toilet, as it was closed. He informed me that it was not allowed, claiming they only open the toilet two hours after leaving the terminal, stating this as a general rule in Portugal. However, there appears to be no such rule in Portugal requiring this. I frequently use their buses, and they consistently refuse to open the toilet. Most notably, the bus drivers are often rude. I strongly recommend avoiding Rede Expressos buses unless no other options are available."

title: Not recommended
text:
Not recommended.
On 14/02/2025 we were supposed to move from Zambujeira do Mar to Sines, via the 8:10 bus.
We were told by a girl that the ticket could also be made on the bus, so we didn't bother to do it on the internet and waited.
We found ourselves a very rude and annoyed person.
He ran me to the bar to go buy these tickets, then left before I went back.
My personal advice: stay away from it and use taxis instead.

title: Meeting schedules never happens
text: I travel almost weekly with the Expressos Network and there is not a single day when the schedules are met. Delays range from 15min to 2h! Will it be so difficult to reformulate the schedules so that at least from time to time these are fulfilled?! And the relaxation with the situation and lack of respect for customers, both from the station staff and the drivers is impressive. The staff at the stations never know anything about the delays and the drivers stop in the middle of the trips where they are already late to change the driver or put on fuel and keep talking joyfully like nothing was. No more words for the Expressos network.

title: WC Miserable
text:
I have used the terminal and express network several times.
Sometimes ask for money for a basic need, like, use the toilet others do not. Some vwzes have soap others don't. Sometimes you can unload others not. Sometimes there's paper, there's pee on the floor, others don't.
Shameful bathrooms. Inside and outside the shy bathroom bus.
At the station there are two bathrooms available and only one is that is open and shamefully representative.
FINALLY. FINALLY.

title: EXPRESS ROBE, that's what I call this company!
text:
I scheduled a trip for January 19th, and by my mistake, I scheduled the time wrong. I find it shameful to only refund the ticket within 1h, and so I lost my money altogether.

The same day, already in Porto, I bought a ticket in Campanh√£ to go to the airport, at the ticket desk. I was told the pier where I should board, but to be aware that I could change... I was sitting on the pier that was indicated to me, showing on the respective screen the bus, until 2min passed (without exaggeration) after the indicated time. I asked the security, where I was told that the bus went to another pier, and had already left. It is very worth mentioning, that that bus did not go to that bridge, because another bus was there, no... that bridge was always empty!!! Not to mention I was traveling alone with super heavy bags!

Network of Expresses, what you do is not only a lack of sensitivity to customers, but also a "smart" way to earn extra money with customers who do not catch this bus, and have to buy another ticket!! I call it theft, be ashamed!!!!!

title: Horrible experience
text: Horrible service. A shame for international tourism. I bought the ticket through the website the day before, the bus arrived late and when I presented the QR it showed that it was invalid. The driver didn't tell me why or what I should do and he pulled me out of the line. The lack of respect continued at the ticket sales counter where they did not offer me any help since they have nothing to do with online sales. In short, I lost the trip and had to buy another one through Flixbus, which left on time and without any problems due to the online purchase. Never again by Red Expressos.

title: Beaten by driver inside the bus
text:
Having traveled in the Express from 10:00H today on 23/01/2025 (matricula 76-SI-72) with a departure from Lisbon Sete Rios and destination to Torres Vedras I was assaulted by the driver (Brazilian) still inside the bus on arrival to the Torres Vedras Road Terminal with a
Cutting object having caused me several cuts in the right ear and surrounding area that needed treatment
in the emergency service of the West Hospital Center in Torres Vedras.
The assault was spotted by the fact that I pointed at him with my cell phone that I held with my right hand being
He was holding a folder with his left hand, telling him he was going to file a formal complaint for the fearful, aggressive and insecure way he was driving. It travelled the North-South Axis of Sete Rios to the end at more than 100km/h passing from one track to the other and on the descent ramp from the Grilo Tunnel to the A8 East for centimeters to hit the trace of a truck after a forced braking.
Formal complaint filed at PSP.
Think twice before you travel in this RE.

title: Rede Expressos-Not Express and No Bathroom
text:
I bought a nonstop bus ticket from Lisbon to Lagos. There were 4 stops before Lagos. There was no bathroom on the bus. Unfortunately I had the need to go to the bathroom for the entire trip of over 4 hours. It's probably worth the extra money to pay for an alternative transportation mode to be comfortable and truly travel nonstop
.

title: Security? Not with the express network
text:
Choose your drivers better
the chauffeur of the Red Express bus, with registration number 99 UB 88, who was driving the vehicle on the route that passes through Ferrel, at 17:49 on December 17, 2024. The incident occurred as follows: while I was driving along the same road as the bus, the driver of the vehicle in front of me did not seem to like the idea of being overtaken. When I reached a zone of rectitude, where it was safe to go past, I signaled my intention with a flash and started the manoeuvre. However, when I started bypassing, the bus driver deliberately started turning left, blocking me and preventing me from continuing bypassing on the straight where we were. Thus, my vehicle was forced to deviate to the lane from the left, having the wheels out of the road

title: Lack of hygiene and sympathy.
text: Very bad experience on a trip from Lisbon to the Algarve. The bus cleaning was very bad, not to say inexistent! It was very unpleasant to sit in two places so dirty (as you can see in the photographs). I have never traveled on a bus (or train) so dirty! Indescribable. The driver also owed nothing to sympathy. At a 10-minute stop at a service station on the highway, I requested access to my luggage to take out a power bank. The answer was: "If I let him do this, I'll have to do it to everybody." Looking around, only there was me and the driver himself!!! Unbelievable such evil will! It was definitely the last trip I made at this company. No doubt the train is a much better alternative. It's a pity. The trip was made on December 9, 2024, with a departure from Lisbon at 18:30 to Olh√£o, and the bus was number 93.

title: Pay to enjoy the bathroom.
text: Having paid for the trip and still not being enough to be able to use the bathroom is not reasonable. Especially in today's times, where many people already use card instead of money, asking for a euro coin is asking for no one to use the bathroom.

title: Rough and incompetent driver!!!!
text:

First of all the way he speaks to my sister was un politely and rough. When she asked him to wait for me for a minute( because first of all he got late for 10 minutes and changed the line of departure after he came) he refused and closed the door right in front of my nose!

title: Scared and Hopeless
text:
Worst customer care ever. The staff in Fatima station is a disgusting person. I got off at the station to fill some water but when I came out the bus had already left. I asked him if it had really left and showed him the ticket on myRNE app. He says "this is not a ticket!! Get a new one!" My bag will all the important stuffs were left on the bus. I called the customer care more than 20 times, no answer. Tried to ask the staff for any contact for the conductor of that bus (the bus was 50A from lisbon to porto), he was so irritated to even reply to me. (Not so irritated to grab the woman staff working there which I happened to see him doing). I bought another ticket to porto but there was no trace of 50A. Tried to ask every other conductor if they had any contact or information as there was no office of redeexpressos at porto, no help.

Its been more than 10 days since I filled out the lost and found form, as thats the only thing they could suggest, I am still waiting.

P.S. the reason I got off at Fatima was because on the same day when I travelled from Faro to Lison on rede expressos, the bus had also stopped for a break and the driver counted every passengers and made sure everyone was present before leaving. It was a mistake to trust that pattern.

title: What the trick with the tickets prices offline?
text:
I had a good long experience with Rede until today, when I bought ticket twice more expensive in the Porto's tickets office.

Used offline purchase instead of online, because Rede website blocked me with 403 error.

When I finally found the wifi and checked the website, I figured out that ticket costs the half of money I spent.
So, 2 stars because of previous fine experience.
But in the future I would rather use Flixbus.

title: Do not use this bus company at any cost -Driversü§îü§î

When he asked the bus driver if he had free seats the answer was yes,so he asked him if he could wait 2mintes while he walked 30seconds to the ticket office to buy a ticket! the driver could see he was walking to the office to buy a new ticket ,in Lagos its such a small terminal and a small office! he could have easily just shouted to the office,or even better been able to pay on the bus!! Anyway as he was walking to pay for another ticket the bus driver drove off and left him stranded!!! title: Totally Incompetent Customer Service - phone or email
text:
Booked a ticket from Porto to Oliveira do Hospital, via Coimbra.
When I boarded the 2nd bus at Coimbra, I realized I had forgotten my table in the first bus - unfortunately it was already too late...
Filled-in the the lost and found document on their website the same day.
Waited one week, no reply (only the standard automatic reply). Called their customer centre one week after, not helpful at all.
Called another week after - nothing.
Two weeks later - nothing.
Again filled-in the form.
Called again, without success - although the lady told me she would send an internal email and ask the manager to check.
Today, almost 3 months later (!!) called again and the Lady tells me I should try with their "Encomendas" department at the Sete Rios station in Lisbon.
This nice lady told me again that she would send an internal email...

Point is: does someone feel like taking care of their customers in this company?
The tablet is probably lost - but it would nice at least to hear from them.

title: Rede expressos worst traveling experience ever!
text: This is my first review ever, but I feel like I have to. Rede express has been my worst experience traveling so far. Campagnha station has the most unclear and arrogant people working there who don‚Äôt want to help you. Every bus driver I asked to help me from Rede Express said something different and now I have missed 3 busses. You would think you would get some kind of reimbursement or extra help or something after this terrible service. Worst experience I have ever had on a bus, disgusted with the service of Rede

title: Lost and found

title: Horrendous service.
text:
Without a doubt the worst and rudest staff I've come across. When looking for information the staff member didn't even look up. I had accidentally bought the wrong destination online and even though I paid more for this destination than the one I required they refused to change the ticket for me. When buying my new ticket I walked up to the window, the staff member was reading a book and did not look up even though she knew I was there. When I said hello she rolled her eyes and eventually looked up. I went to another information stand to ask where to get my bus from and the lady just started shouting that my seat number was number 10.

This treatment of customers is unacceptable

title: Driver without professionalism
text:
Good afternoon.
I come by this means to complain about the service performed on August 24. That day I got up at 6:00 to take a flight to Lisbon, arrived and went to lunch in a hurry because I had my bus ticket for 15:15. The time came and we were informed that because of an accident the bus was late. The solution was to take us to Seven Rios station to take a bus at 16h to Lagos. Until then all right, delays happen, but when arriving at the station of seven Rios the driver who was in service was very unprofessional and rude to us. The delay was not enough yet we were forced to wait for all the other passengers who were on their schedule and the bus of departure to sit and we who were late still had to wait to be able to sit in the vacant seats without a minimum apology and understanding. We were told we could sit anywhere. Me and my boyfriend (he ticket nr 5105072812) as usual we wanted to go together as it was supposed so we sat right in the front seat that was vacant. The bus followed and stopped in Almada where more passengers entered, to which a girl who asked me for the seat because I had paid to sit there. I understand that you paid but I also paid, and I refused to leave making me feel embarrassed to want to take the trip next to my boyfriend and as if I was wrong...The girl and the driver were arguing with us that she should go out for you to sit in her place. Besides this there was also a passenger who embarked wrong, wanted to go to Lamego and followed the one in Lagos, this because there was no check of the tickets, we entered without being verified anything. This customer (India ethnic) was thrown out at the gas station of Palmela and by the words of the driver ‚Äúthe monh√© that unravel‚Äù. Then we made a stop in Grandola for 20 minutes, even the customers complaining that we were already out of schedule the driver replied that it would be 20 or even could be 25 minutes...
At the end we arrived at Lagos at 22:00 where the starting time was 18:35. I could no longer get a package I needed to take on Monday morning because the store closed at 7 pm and now only Monday afternoon I can get it. A very bad experience and I will definitely not use renex / express network anymore. I will prefer to go at another time or even pay more than to use this company that in response to a delay, which I know it can be to anyone, treats customers who come from a late bus below others who are within their time, when they should try to reward them and treat them with sympathy and respect.

title: Bad.
text: Uncomfortable and outdated bus. On the ticket, it says it has Wi-Fi and socket to charge the phone, and none of the options were available. Rude and poorly polite driver who found it right to stop the bus in the middle of the highway to complain with a passenger. Bad.

title: Quality, responsibility, punctuality.
text:
Drove from Lagos to Lisbon for work. The bus was 1 hour and 45 minutes late. What was striking was that the driver, despite being extremely late , did not reduce by a minute the time he stopped - 15 minutes. It was the same on the way back. Only the stop was not scheduled, the driver got up in Portimao for 30 minutes, eventually the bus was also 1 hour and 45 minutes late. The driver just left the bus to smoke, chat, relax. We were all waiting for him. My husband met me at the bus station in Lagusa and waited 1 hour and 45 minutes.
It's incredible brazenness and audacity to provide such a passenger service.

title: Delays on arrival time
text: I have picked up hundreds of times express buses, and there is almost no time where there are no delays with respect to the time of arrival estimated by them. It's ridiculous, after 8 years riding the expressed network this continues to happen. I have already made Trips to the north, south and interior of Portugal and it is almost always the same thing. A rough estimate, they manage to meet the arrival time on 1 out of 10 Trips.

title: Buses never again. The train is much better
text:
Horrible journey, uncomfortable, with swings and with immense delay between Lagos and Lisbon. The air conditioning was not working properly, there was not enough seating space, there were passengers vomiting. The after-sales service is degrading, have no attention with the customer just despise the same.
I usually use the train mostly and none of this happens. On the train travel is much more comfortable, fast and safe. The train is a quality service.

title: Hello to be frank I did not travel with this company fortunately because when I see the behavior of
text: Hello to be frank I did not travel with this company fortunately because when I see the behavior of their driver on the IC8 road in Portugal he passes us by the right on the lane of the vehicles to after cut us the left road while I went to pass him a real crazy driver the bus number is 565

title: Unacceptable
text: Ridiculous, I don't understand how you pay for a service and still have to pay 1‚Ç¨ to go to the bathroom. After a trip that delayed 2h30, reaching 5h30, the bus never stopped at a service station to go to the bathroom. We lost the connecting bus and at the station also paid 1‚Ç¨ to use the bathroom and then on the bus that revalidated my ticket (1h30 after the initial call) also did not stop at any time and had no bathroom. I was almost 9h on the trip and hope you don't have to go to the bathroom?????? Or better, that I pay 1‚Ç¨ to use the bathroom on a service I paid for? Ridiculous.

title: Worst bus experience ever
text: Worst trip ever. Driver was racist and rude. He stopped in the middle of the road and told a couple of Nepalese guys that if they were to use their phones he would kick them out of the bus. He was yelling the whole first 20 minutes of our drive and was talking on the micrphone while driving which I don‚Äôt find safe at all for someone who didn‚Äôt let passengers use their phones because of "safety". All in all I highly recommend avoiding traveling with rede express. I felt unsafe and very uncomfortable during the whole trip.

title: Express network
text:
Although there were 3 pairs of seats in front empty, driver did not allow us to change seats (we were at 51 and 52, the last of the background).
When he noticed our presence in front of him he reacted aggressively and rude, even after explaining that he was claustrophobic, and he roughly asked if he wanted me to call the INEM. He threatened to call the police. He almost stopped the bus even after telling her we were going back to our seats.
For this driver the rules (in this case absurd) are more important than the well-being of the passengers.
Speaking of the rules, he did not announce that the seat belt was mandatory - I think that tb is a rule - and even if he had done so I was sure he would not check... since in this he is not the only one. So there are rules that are to comply even absurd and at the expense of the passenger's well-being, and others...not even involving the safety of passengers...
Another rule not met, and not exclusive of this driver is to comply with the departure time, even as all passengers are already on the bus.

title: Bad reservation system and staff
text:
I bought tickets online. When returning, I had to change the time of return trip (from Fatima).
1- Telephone support takes too long.
2- I paid the extra cost for changing return time (revalidation) but they did not send me the new ticket.
3- At bus station (Fatima) the female employee did not know how to find my ticket. She kept saying it was made online, as if she did not know how to work with the system. Finally she found the ticket, after 10 min fussing around...

title: Never again, dear Flixbus.
text: Asked very politely if they could open the toilet. The reaction of the bus driver could be more polite, in addition to that of a phone call during which one preserves on the highway.

title: Way too hot! No air-conditioning
text:
No air conditioning on the bus. One of the worst and hottest bus journeys I've had. It was disgustingly hot, everyone on the bus was struggling with the heat but the driver couldn't do anything about it.

I have been on older and cheaper busses and they have had air-conditioning above every seat.

title: Terrible
text: No wifi, finding the bus was really difficult. All in all a terrible experience. I do not recommend. You could do so much better!

title: Rede expresso - problems!
text: We bought tickets at the ticket booth for Leiria to Porto direct. The woman who sold us the tickets said she u senators my English, didn‚Äôt bother to clarify what I needed, was in her phone and looked as though I was bothering her by needing tickets and asking her to do her job! As a result, they would not let us in our bus because she had sold me child tickets not ‚Äòjovem‚Äô. I gave her all the ages of the children and asked if she understood. She said yes annoyed that I continued to ask her if she understood me. When they wouldn‚Äôt let us on the bus, they refused to help us by allowing us to pay the difference so we wouldn‚Äôt miss our bus. It was their employee‚Äôs mistake and then they refused to fix it so we wouldn‚Äôt miss our bus. The bus left without us. We then had to push our way to the front of the line to get in the next bus which was not direct. Mistakes can be made but this company did not deal with their mistake as they should have. Next time - traveling with Flixbus! Or any other option.

title: Fake 5G advertising on buses!
text: Internet doesn't work on buses. They advertise where they even mention the 5G network and not even 3G works. They have network signal, the data do not even see them!

title: Awful service
text: The service is awful. Nobody gives out information, they're all unsympathetic. Nobody collaborates, they don't speak Spanish. There are almost no screens to see where the bus leaves. It's torture. The station is full of street dwellers. Very scary. There's nowhere to sit, nowhere to shelter. Tap drag the suitcase back and forth. All terrible. I hope I never come back!!!!

title: Aggression to passengers with infrasound in the sound system. for what?
text: Isn't that Rede Expressos is sending infrasound sound (for those who don't know what the gentlemen do to get people out of the house, it's unheard and it hurts the ears) by the sound system, to the customers? What is this for?! Someone understands, gentlemen! Highly incomprehensible and liegal, an assault.

title: Horrible.
text:
Horrible. Lack of consideration for who works. I bought the ticket and they didn't send me anything to the email. I sent emails, they didn't answer me. I called a lot of times, they don't answer. When I tried to download the ticket came out a blank document. In the ticket stores it is not possible to load the ticket due to a system error.
Horrible, I do not recommend, on the contrary, I recommend not to use.
Driver also without any empathy or liking to help people, just communicate that you can do nothing and ignore what I was talking about.

title: Look at the little eur for cleaning the bathroom.
text: Ridiculous at the level of ground support. Well, Our Lady, then in Fatima and I don't even talk about the famous euro to go to the bathroom, at least miss the lady of stupid explanations, alms only in the hall.

title: Ridiculous - Express Network (customer service)
text:
In all the years that I have been using the express network, I have never before encountered so much inconsistency in the scope of services provided.
Bus yes, bus no, the bathrooms are locked and for the cost of 1 euro we can unlock the door and use the bathroom.
I mention again that this is bus every bus, because for the most part, you just need to ask the driver for the key and there's no problem.
On buses where the use of the bathroom is paid, most of them just steal the 1 euro coin they charge you and in the end, they don't give you access.
When this is mentioned to the driver, he assumes 0% responsibility and states that it is not the driver's problem, but the company's.
In the end, I had to urinate into a bottle next to the bathroom, not only because there was no functional bathroom, but also because there was no stop at a service area in the middle of a 4-hour journey.
Hopefully the bus was almost empty and I didn't shock anyone unnecessarily and maintained some dignity considering that the other option would be to urinate in my pants and down the seat.

This is to say, the lack of customer attention in a basic area such as having access to a bathroom is shameful and ridiculous.

I would have paid the euro, but the driver told me not to try because it wouldn't work and he would steal the coin.

Thankful for the driver's honesty, but I find it completely ridiculous that drivers don't have the power to open the door (if someone elderly or with limited mobility gets stuck in the bathroom, would the driver have to spend 1 euro to help? Or would they be stuck in the bathroom until you get to the next station?)

Here is what I think is a necessary complaint for a possible improvement in the services provided by transport companies in Portugal.

Once again, I repeat, ridiculous.

In the case of a pregnant woman, a child or someone like me who suffers from incontinence... this cannot remain as it is.

Thank you for your attention and happy travels.

title: If you can‚Äôt hold your pee for 4 hours avoid this company toilets always locked.
text: Toilets locked and driver wouldn‚Äôt allow us to use the public toilet he himself used halfway there. Four hours on a bus without a toilet is crazy. I now spend 300 euros on a taxi. Try FlixBus they have working toilets but don‚Äôt run as often.

title: Unbelievable to book us on a bus that didn't exist!!!
text: Bought a bus ticket from Porto to Lisbon for 10:30. Tried to get on the 10:30 bus, they said wrong bus number. Went to information. Asked if we could get on the 11:30 bus which had our bus number...they said NO. We were told our bus we booked was an "extra" whatever that means and we could wait to see if it would show up. Wait where? Wait for how long? It wasn't listed on the scheduling board. In the end we had to pay 8 euros each to change to another bus from a bus that didn't exist!!!! Unacceptable!!

title: Don't recommend
text: At the beginning was already a problem with the bags, where the driver didn't allow me to board with a backpack that wasn't completely full. Second driver said that we couldn't eat, drink in the bus and the bathroom required paying 1‚Ç¨, but the doors wouldn't open so it just ate the coin and the driver shrugged, said we need to go to the bathroom at the next stop and that the coin was lost,the driver was really unhelpful with the whole situation. The driver also said that we are required to use the seat belt however my seat belt didn't work. There is no outlet for charging. The AC didn't work but hey we had one bad light that worked at least. Wifi is slow. Also the trays were dirty. My trip was from Lisbon to Porto.

title: Terrible service!
text: Terrible company! The bus driver, miss leaded me and other passengers saying it was not the correct bus!! We end up going to the ticket office asking why the bus was delayed, since it passed already 15 mits since the departure. They returned us the ticket price without any compensation. Never travel in this company, absolutely useless

title: Horrible driver!
text:
I took the bus heading to Lisbon from Porto on the 24th of April (bus nr. 23 to be exact).
The bus driver was super disrespectful ! Sorry for using this, but I got to say like it is.
Extremely rude for not speaking/understanding Portuguese and continuing to shout at me for the whole bus could hear even when he clearly knew I didn‚Äôt understand a word. (I‚Äôm not even sure what the fuss was all about!)

Please teach this specific driver how to go around with customers. What he did was in no way professional and sets a very bad image for the company and the country!

title: Trip Beja Lisbon 23.04.2024
text: I booked a promo ticket to Lisbon for 3.90 a week before the trip, but the day before, having a lot of pain in my legs, I booked another ticket for 14 euros to have more space. The driver couldn't do it, scan the ticket, I showed the payment. I'm interested, go and complain to the ticket office, you couldn't do it either, I said - make me another ticket, the bus was leaving, I ran to show the other ticket, this one was fine, but I didn't want to sit in the bigger seat, I sat down ready to call the police if you told me came to say something, it's sad that people like that work for the public

title: Bad company
text: Ignorant driver. The bus doesn't have a bathroom, when it stopped in Fatima it only took 5 minutes to go to the bathroom (it wasn't after getting off the bus that the driver counted the minutes before people got off the bus). A journey of almost 4 hours with a 5-minute stop. I went to the bathroom when I came back and he had already started. I was lucky that I managed to catch it before leaving the terminal. Now I'm returning by Flix bus and there have already been 2 express buses counting the bus. They walk like crazy and don't pay attention to their customers.

title: Of shame
text: I would have a hard time explaining how disastrous our experience was. Of shame. I have not seen a driver as bad as the one we had from Zambujeira do Mar to Almograve on March 26, 2024 at 1630. If the company allows people like that, I will understand that it is just as responsible.

title: dirty station
text: Escalators do not work and the elevators are in a deplorable condition. Absolutely terrible, this bus station in Sete Rios.

title: Impolite unjustified manners AVOID AT ALL COSTS
text: From setubal to odemira bus n. 80 The bus driver obliged me to put my backpack in the bag store although it wasn't too big (half full 38 liters, 7 kilos, I just traveled with the airplane) and I told I just could put it on me and between my legs. Of course now aboard the bus is not so full of people and there's plenty of space. He was rude and misbehaving, it was raining and immediately told not to get on the bus. He asked in Portuguese where I was directed to (none of his business, it was clear he just asked it out of the blue) as if it wasn't clear I wasn't from here, I answered in English and he just made and awkward face. Never happened to me before in my entire life. I'm never using your services anymore, going to report it on as many reviews website as possible and if something should happen to my luggage you're going to hear from my lawyer soon. Shame on you.

title: Disgraceful company
text: Disgraceful company, dishonest bus arrival times and lost and found items are a joke. Zero effort trying to find any lost item. Shameful. Start riding the Flixbus

title: Unfriendly staff
text: Very, very unfriendly bus driver. Using the toilet costs extra and when I said that I didn't have any cash with me, the driver showed no mercy and just said that it wouldn't work. I find that pretty cheeky for a 4-hour bus ride.

title: Shameful
text: It is unacceptable to charge ‚Ç¨1 for using the bathroom! A company that earns so much charges ‚Ç¨1 for using the bathroom. Shameful. They don't stop and you still have to pay for the toilet

title: Customer Support doesn't work!
text: They haven't responded to the email with the refund request I made for weeks. When I call the customer service number I get an automatic response saying to send an email... but the problem is exactly that they don't respond to emails!

title: Worst Ticket Buying Experience
text:
The ticket buying experience in Evora was horrible. All the ticket machines were offline so everyone had to wait in a single line to buy tickets. After awhile the ticket person closed her window and all sales were halted for almost five minutes. No one could explain why. The likelihood of catching our scheduled bus diminished minute by minute.

Luckily when the window reopened we got our tickets and ran to our bus. We were the last to board as our driver flicked away his cigarette and climbed up behind us.

The bus ride itself was much a better experience than the ticket line. The drive back to Lisbon was smooth and uneventful and we actually feel asleep for part of the way. The seats were not too bad and the bus was not full.

There was a bathroom in the center of the bus and we watched one passenger approach the bus driver and came back with a key. Not sure why passengers just can‚Äôt freely use the restroom.

Overall Rede needs to improve their end to end service rider experience. Yes they have the lowest prices but don‚Äôt need to make it so stressful or difficult to use them.

title: Shameful
text: Travel with flixbus first, here you pay ‚Ç¨1 for using a bathroom that doesn't open, you get grumbles as a driver and buses from the other lady's time

title: Not a preferred travel option. Many other options.
text: We reserved ahead of time and got a great ticket rate. However, the staff were a bit edgy, intolerant, irritated. Seats were small. Driver in Evora station was intolerant, unhelpful, irritated and yelling at people. The ride was fast, driver definitely negotiated tight turns and traffic in safe manner. Felt a bit like an entertainment ride being bounced around in the chairs, offered some comedy. Station in Lisbon was absolutely disgusting, filthy. Would not chose this method in future.

title: WC 50 cent on the bus
text: WC 50 cent, ABSURD. I went by that compnay Porto-Madrid about 8 hours trip and WC on the bus coast 50 cent. If you have not coins you have in trouble.

title: A sadness
text: We traveled from Lisbon to Algarve, Albufeira. We changed bus in Albufeira to Quarteira. Unfortunately, we forgot two notebooks from my daughter's 3rd year. She was doing her homework on the way..... We went everywhere to ask, in Faro, we called customer support, we already filled out the form.....zero. Nobody helped us find the notebooks. Apparently no one left them at any station. Someone really needed the 3rd year notebooks......or the driver simply threw them in the trash. üò°

title: WC out of service. Refund refusal
text:
Bus with toilet out of service and AC too hot with the hot air outlet near the feet, boiling.
I would also like to say that it is impossible to obtain travel reimbursements even if they try to do everything within the deadline stipulated by the company.

title: Unbelieving
text:
On December 28, 2023, I took an express bus at 9:30 towards Sete rios.
Leaving the pier right outside the door at 9:31 we were stopped for 30 minutes, possibly an accident.
Standing there
It was 9:31 a man arrived. in the rain asking please to come in.
There is which both drivers refused.
Extremely rude when enjoying it, even saying they couldn't open the bus door.
"Apamha Another"
Someone appealed to their humanity, but even so, adamant to the passengers' request, they left and looked at Mr. in the rain for 30 minutes.
You were certainly 1 minute late also because of this same accident.
Both nasty arrogant..... .
Even during this festive season, which is Christmas, where empathy and care for others are more evident for these two gentlemen. nothing moved them
(I must say it was right outside the pier)
Nothing deterred these beings.
We were all in disbelief, uncomfortable with the situation.
Anyway...
A good year to you
And more humanity please

title: Never use this bus service
text: Terrible! Can't use the app without the tax number and the Portuguese mobile. Their ticket return DOESN'T WORK at all! title: Constant delays

title: I was almost scammed to pay a fee when the company's bus was late
text: I had a good bus ride from Lisbon to Porto. However, for our return trip the bus was late. The monitor first Saud it was 15 minutes late. On the PA system passengers are advised to keep looking at the monitors to find the depot number for the busses which are delayed. Long story short the bus eventually came but went to a totally different depot number from what was on monitor. We eventually found our bus and waited in line for our tickets to be scanned and were told there's an error message coming up and we need to visit the office (upstairs) to sort this out. We went and stood in a line for about 20 minutes. The attendant then informed us that our bus is late and THAT WE NEED TO PAY EXTRA TO BOARD ANOTHER BUS. I demanded to see a supervisor who reiterated the same thing. Reasoning with her that the company's bus was late and we cannot be charged. She was very nonchalant and at this point I became very irate and demanded to see someone else. She kept saying she don't work for the bus company and she can't help. When asked to see a bus representative, she shrugged " a man in a blue shirt downstairs ". We returned to the depot and kept looking for a "man in a blue shirt ". We got the assistance from 2 very nice security guards. We found the bus rep who was very adamant about us paying a fee to board another bus as we original bus already left. I was very insistent that I was paying no additional fee. I became loud and argumentative. Eventually we were allowed to board a bus to Lisbon. This was a very disturbing experience in a foreign country. I loved Portugal but this experience put a very different twist thereafter.

title: Beware of disgruntled bus driver with a bad case of portuguese halitosis
text:
Just asked this driver
if he was going to Leiria. Because I forgot to say Good Morning Mr. Driver first (I'm a 68 year old female senior), he went on a rampage and started yelling and screaming that there was still a thing called respect in Portugal. When I told him that I would complain, he dared me to take his picture so, here it is. This man needs a psychological evaluation before the safety of 50-60 Passengers is entrusted to him. Shame on Rede Nacional Expresso for allowing this type of behavior!

title: Bad experience
text:
Terrible experience in all ways.

-couldn‚Äôt book a ticket online and charged my card multiple times even though it said it failed and we got no tickets
-tried to buy tickets for us and bicycles at service desk and kiosk but neither worked, the system wouldn‚Äôt let ticket person complete the transaction. Ticket person said we could pay driver in cash
-when we tried to pay driver in cash he yelled at us and pushed our bikes then yelled more. A different driver explained that bikes needed to be in boxes, which is nowhere on website and was never expressed to us before the time of the bus.
-driver yelled at us some more. We couldn‚Äôt take the bus. We lost our money.

Not a good experience. Try a different bus company if you can.

title: Bad experience
text: Easy access to tickets but terrible lack of information! The buses were not properly identified and the information on the signs did not correspond to the bus on the track! Not very helpful drivers, especially the one in vehicle 11 at half past midnight on 25.08.23 at the campaign station in Porto, who, when he interrupted his cigarette to ask for information, reacted in an extremely rude, cynical, rude and unpleasant way. as if he were doing me the biggest favor in the world when at the same time I was paying him his salary. It wasn't my bus but as a company employee I should have been willing to provide any type of information in a polite and helpful manner! It was enough to be in an unfamiliar area, at late hours, with information errors in the system and still have to deal with this attitude from the employee!

title: Bus driver with criminal behavior
text: The bus driver, in addition to being rude, traveled late and on the journey from Covilh√£ ¬ª¬ª¬ª¬ª Lisbon, with full capacity from Castelo Branco, he stopped for just 5 minutes (information provided by the driver, he left me at Castelo Branco station, as I went to the Wc (ladies), I point out that only 1 was in operation, at least 4 days ago (LISBOA trip ¬ª¬ª¬ª COVILH√Ç) there was also a single Wc in operation, INADMISSIBLE for a station with these characteristics, and I had to walk to the BUS that had stopped at ROTUNDA SAIDA DA CIDADE!!! polytechnic students! Worse than transporting cattle!

title: Arrival at destination constantly delayed by at least 45 minutes.
text: I take dozens of trips throughout the year Lisbon - Faro and vice versa. I've made trips at different times on more than 25 trips and the bus always arrives at least 40 minutes late. Either CHANGE the arrival time so as not to mislead people or stick to the times. Delays are unpredictable but this is too much, it is constantly almost an hour late.

title: Difficult to travel with your small dog in Portugal
text:
I travel with my little dog weighing 8kg, in her bag, she is used to moving around, she is good, silent, clean. And to get around Portugal I have to take the bus, I don't have a car.
During one of my trips, the driver refused to allow me to board with the bag containing my dog, he wanted me to put it in the hold, I asked kindly and insisted, it was impossible for me to leave her in the dark, alone .
He tells me that there are police at the roundabout...so impossible.
He feels no remorse, and no kindness.
Afterwards he tells me that I can pay for her seat, so I accept.....and they charge me for a child's ticket, and there it is possible to travel with her.
As you will see, we are not seated next to each other, but fortunately the gentleman agreed to take my dog's place so that she can stay close to me, thanks to him.
In Portugal, it is extremely difficult to travel with a dog, no one makes an effort, on the contrary only "sticks in the wheels".
Portugal is for abandonment and animal suffering! This company is a shame for acting this way towards animals.
When will this country evolve?
And since they have a monopoly on transport, I didn't leave the hostel on my next trips!
But I keep my dog, I will never abandon her.

title: High cornering speed
text: Taken from Lisbon Sete Rios to Fatima Bus Station on 7 August 2023, departing at 4.30pm and arriving at 6.15pm. Hell of a trip! Reckless driver, without composure. High speed corners and cut corners. Zero responsibility.

title: Muito Dececionada com o Terminal do Oriente
text:
Terminal Oriente, sem sala de espera, sem qualquer servi√ßo de apoio, sem seguran√ßa.Tendo sido construida numa zona privilegiada como √© possivel despresarem desta forma quem viaja.Expecialmente porque a Rede Expresso tornou-se o monop√≥lio das viagens para o Sul do pa√≠s.
