He shared no info about Sinatra in general or about things we were passing as he drove A better explanation of what the tour includes and expectations would have been beneficial. We spent almost the entire tour walk to and from sites. We rarely do organized tours and won‚Äôt be rushing back to do another after this experience

title: Irish setting but not nice
text: Poor welcome, no empathy from the waitresses, no time to drink your drink, systematically removed, no smile. I do not recommend

title: Chic clothes, no VAT
text: Honestly the clothing was pretty cool. If you are visiting from abroad it‚Äôs an interesting place to grab local designers. However, ironically, they claim to be a tax free shop but they and all of their sister locations in Porto are unable to actually help with processing the refund so there will be no tax refunds for visitors so plan on pricing being 20% higher than you thought. They only tell you this after they give you your total. I still bought some stuff but definitely am not happy with them at all. VERY DISAPPOINTING.

title: Product not received
text:
I placed an order for a product on December 6, 2024. Due to logistical issues related to my address, I never received the item.

I sent multiple emails to customer service, but I never received a response on how to proceed with a new shipment or regarding my refund request.

Today is February 1st, and I still haven‚Äôt heard back from customer support

title: BUYER BEWARE!!! Awful customer service and shady practices
text:
BUYER BEWARE!!! Awful customer service and EXTREMELY RUDE employees. DOUBLE CHECK YOUR RECEIPT!! They may "forget" to include it in your bag with your purchase so if there are any issues and you need to return it they will not without the receipt.

Wanna be hipsters work at this store with over the top attitude. Definitely not worth the high cost of merchandise for cheaply made items.

title: Scam alert!!!
text:
Scam alert!!! Utterly ridiculous and terrible!! Cancelled the trip without any warning at all. They claimed that they emailed us during lunch but no emails came through, more than 10 people arrived, none of us recieved any emails at all until 19:01(the event starts time was supposed to be 19:00).

They promised there will be a full refund, however, the refund we got was only a partial refund, they kept the processing fee. When asked why it wasn't a full refund, then they just stopped replying. Message was sent on Friday, last seen was today (Monday) , two messages ignored completely!!!!

title: Skip the Pena Palace
text: Too many people long lines, best view of Pena is from Moorish castle, so simply skip Pena altogether and just hit the Moorish castle & go to Atlantic coast or Cascais

title: Do Not Book This Tour - They Won't Show Up!!!!
text: We booked this tour weeks in advance and paid for it. On the day of our tour no one ever showed up. After a half an hour of trying to call the company with no answer they finally responded said we were "outside of their area of service" even though our hotel was located in central Lisbon (even though they had our pick up information at our hotel for weeks). We did eventually receive a refund weeks later; however, not so much as an apology for being a no-show. Do yourself a favor and don't waste a day of your vacation with these people - they are completely unreliable! Not the hassle you want on your vacation!

title: The rogue tuk tuk
text: Honestly, the tuk tuk ride is something to do but you have to take the time to choose your guide because he takes great joy in pillaging tourists. We paid 240 euros for a ride that was supposed to cost 150 euros, so be careful, we took the buddy company and our guide was Jos√© after having defrauded us he asked us to give him a good serious opinion we should not take people for idiots disappointed with this walk the next day we spoke with another guide who told us that the walk that we took should have cost us 150 euros we must not rush and take the time to compare the guides and tuk tuk company I do not recommend the pink tuk tuk buddy

title: Lisbon food
text: No one showed up to the meeting place at 3PM . WILL DISPUTE THE CHARGE THRU MY CREDIT bad bad bad baby baby bad bad baby call me

title: If you want to be treated really BADLY, go to this spa
text: I did facial treatment with therapist Yara. And she removed by her father fingers, applying hard pressure on my skin. She said it's a ball of blood and she doesn't know what it is. And I couldn't even see that she is applying pressure on my mole as I waz laying down on bed with eyes covered. At the end of treatment, I saw the demage on my skin. It's right in the center of my face. I told Yara why would she even touch my mole and she answered that it was a ball of blood and she doesn't know what was that. I was hoping it will get healed and disappeared. But with few days it got worst. Sofia Pereira, the owner of Spa, admitted this situation should not have happened and asked Yara to see my face, so she would never touched someone face in such situations. And instead of solving damage to me, taking me to clinic , they left me ignored. Sofia Pereira consulted her lawyer and the lawyer advised to not help. She even convinced Yara to lie and said that she didn't even touch my face. I felt horrible as they avoid taking responsibility for their own actions . And even worst they decided to lie instead to cover their business as per lawyer suggestions. It inhuman. And they have to ashamed by their inhuman and unprofessional behaviour. I am hoping that I will find doctor myself as they refused even to help with finding doctor. I hope there will be no scar or cancer, as it's a delicate area under mole which can't be touched by facial therapist at all.

title: Spa facilities not included in massage price
text:
Apparently the spa facilities, pool./sauna are not included with massages, despite confirmation email advising you to arrive 30 minutes earlier to use them. I have never been to a 5 star hotel spa where this is not included in the massage price.

Will never come here again.

title: Very bad :(
text:
Horrible.
The animation is nothing special, it has very little about the film.
The food was awful, a little pasta with nuts (whichever dish was, they were the same), cold wine and little quantity, we all starved.
The only good part of the party is actually being on a boat.
But the space is small and there are a lot of people, we can barely move it inside.
They could keep but lower the price because it is very expensive (28‚Ç¨) for what they offer or withdraw the dinner and make only party or improve the dinner.

title: Bad experience
text: Bad experience, we took a 1-hour tour in Alfama, they didn't stop at the main tourist attractions, there was only one stop, and they still wanted to charge me 20 euros more to complete the tour. The driver was very rushed, he said the company gave them little time to complete the tour. the company only thinks about money, not customers

title: Not a local guide - Tourist trap rip‚ÄôOff
text:
It‚Äôs not a local guided tour. This is outsourced to a company that pays non-local students to take you to tourist traps. You‚Äôd be better off on your own saving your money.

Il ne s‚Äôagit pas d‚Äôune visite guid√©e locale, mais d‚Äôune entreprise qui paie des √©tudiants non locaux pour qu‚Äôils vous emm√®nent dans des pi√®ges √† touristes. Nous sommes tous capables de faire bien mieux par nous m√™mes !
A 75e/ pers ! On peut s‚Äôoffrir de vraies bonnes sp√©cialit√©s !!!

title: Rather poor
text: We had dinner here with a large group of friends on a fixed and already agreed upon menu, but none of us were happy with the choice made. Lots of kindness, pleasant surroundings, but poor and not very tasty food.

title: Not worth waiting for
text: Terrible waiting time - no control whatsoever, totally inefficient considered several times to leave the queue and find other things to experience

title: Completely overcrowded
text: Completely overcrowded. Despite booking a time slot online, you have to queue long before you can even get to the palace. The wait to get to the palace entrance was 90 minutes. The tour of the palace rooms also takes place in a caravan of people. Horrible.

title: Useless ticket system - lengthy queues!
text: The ticket system is a total farce! You go online to buy a time entry ticket to avoid queuing and on arrival are told to join the queue. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry about your timed ticket‚Äù we were told‚Ä¶..we I do as the whole point was to avoid staying in a one hour queue! Totally unacceptable.

title: Tickets not received
text: I did not receive my paid tickets. Viator could not find the tickets and the organizer was not available.I did not get any help and no one was responsible for the problem.

title: Bad experience!!
text: They never sent me my tickets so I couldn‚Äôt enter the palace because there was no room left and we had to buy tickets to enter the palace park on site.

title: False advertisement on Trip Advisor
text: The attraction on Trip Advisor was for "skip the line" tickets. Once I paid for the ticket, an on-line voucher was delivered to my email, not an actual pdf ticket. When I arrived at the attraction there was a massive line up for tickets. I asked the attendant where I could convert the voucher for a ticket. She told me that I must have a pdf ticket and that there is no "skip the line" option there. My only option then was to join the ticket line with everyone. What then is the advantage of buying the ticket on Trip Advisor? Not willing to waste time standing in the huge line. I left in frustration and did not see the attraction that I paid for.

title: Time, time, time
text: We were unable to see the palace due to time constraints and traffic. Make sure to plan for plenty of time and don‚Äôt drive, have someone drive for you. We plan to be back!üôÇ

title: No Show
text: The tour operator cancelled at 940pm the night before the 10am Tour, so we showed up via taxi not aware of cancellation. No reason was given.

title: Deception
text: You are misled by the term skip the line. You can only buy a ticket and join the back of the line. Tickets were also not available at pickup location. Eventually have to call and whatsappe to get tickets. Then they were told they were regular tickets instead of skip te line tickets. Advice: do not book!

title: Horrible Experience!
text: This company never delivered the tickets. I received the confirmation a night before, but the tickets never arrived. I got in touch with one of the reps and they said they had oversold because of system glitch which is BS. The problem that we were already in Sintra and couldn't buy the tickets to the palace directly at the gate because they were sold out. Horrible experience. Do not buy from them!

title: Trip Advisor did not send me the tickets I paid for
text: I paid for these tickets through Trip Advisor in advance. I did not receive them from Trip Advisor. Just an email that looped me back and forth between click here for your tickets and them not populating. I had to pay at Pe√±a Palace again (also is much cheaper than paying online). Other people in line had the same problem.

title: TukTuk driver didn't show, tour operator didn't respond.
text: Unfortunately, despite booking to be picked up at our hotel, our TukTuk driver didn't turn up. I tried calling the tour organiser, but the number rang out and no one answered. I tried the automated chat with the tour operator, but got no reply. After half an hour of waiting we gave up and booked through another company that our hotel recommended (who was fantastic).

title: Find a Different Tour
text: There were many different tours in this type of vehicle available. We chose this specific tour because of the time available, and being picked up at our hotel. Our tour was scheduled to start at 4:20 P.M. but we were not picked up until 5:00 P.M. The condition of our vehicle was not the best. It looked shabby compared to the many other Tuk Tuks we saw during our tour. During the tour our driver was stopped and questioned by the Lisbon police. We found this a little disturbing. Our driver told us that it was a minor problem with the vehicle registration. Since we did not understand the language we had no way of knowing what the real problem was. At the last stop on the tour our driver told us we needed to find our own way back to our hotel, which was over 5 miles away! He insisted that we should have known our tour was only for half the day. We insisted that he did not tell us this at the start of the tour, or anytime during. If we had known the tour did not end at our hotel we never would have booked it. Finally the driver did the right thing and took us back to our hotel, complaining all the way back.

title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS TOUR.
text:
Terrible. Absolutely stay away from this tour. We waited over an hour and a half, contacted the host repeatedly with no reply at all & they did not show up to our hotel pick up location. Then trip advisor has the nerve to allow the host to deny our request for a refund when we did not receive the service we expected. Spent over $129 and received this kind of treatment.

If I could leave less than a 1 rating I would. Disgusting behavior and unacceptable.

title: Don‚Äôt bother, no tour and no refund!
text: I waited over 90 minutes in total in 30 degree heat and my driver never showed up. Disaster. I rang the contact number provided and it would ring out or ever second call it would say the number is switched off. I paid ‚Ç¨95 and I‚Äôm now really struggling to get my money back because you have to have an email from the company to confirm the tour didn‚Äôt happen for Viator to refund you but they don‚Äôt have a contact email for the company! Very disappointed.

title: Vreselijk
text: Via de app hoorde ik op de dag zelf dat hij zijn tuktuk niet voldoende had geladen! Of de toer 2 uur later kon, niet dus! Zou wat regelen en kwam om 11.30 uur met een andere klant in de tuktuk aan! Heb toen gezegd onacceptabel, heb priv√© toer geboekt‚Ä¶ik wilde tien mijn geld terug‚Ä¶maar dat zou ik dan zelf moeten regelen Inmiddels andere tuktuk met Claudia gearriveerd! Heeft voor ons alles geregeld, tel contact gehad met de baas. Refund geregeld en zelfde bedrag aan Claudia betaald na een echte Portugese prachtige Tour!!!!!

title: Unable DE find a place and very noisy
text:
We are a fan DE the one DE Porto. But then... Extremely bunting, no DE outdoor tables, no DE room is an ordeal to eat with 4.
In short we will not return.
Too bad because the quality DE the food is good.

title: I do not recommend the workshops
text: Bad system. It took me over 8 months to try to book a workshop!!! Or you can't mark because they aren't on the site yet or they're exhausted... besides that prices change and then you have to pay extra. I do not advise anyone

Have you ever tried calling the number you indicated?
No one's answering and the message box is full.
The answer you gave in relation to my previous message is not correct.

title: Crowded, dirty, loud music‚Ä¶
text: Crowded, loud music that doesn‚Äôt allow you to talk (like all the bars around the area - why can people just enjoy the sounds of other people talking?), dirty tables, costumers who don‚Äôt know how to behave (not respecting lines, workers, not removing their plates). Overpriced food for tourists, not authentic at all. The food was just ok.

title: Disappointment across the board
text: unfortunately, it was not as felt by every guide touted as a top address, very disappointing. Loud, completely overpriced and not exactly very well maintained. Both the tables where to sit and the sanitary facilities leave much to be desired in terms of cleanliness. Furthermore, the music is much too loud inside and does not invite you to linger. It's a pity, it has potential.

title: Could be much better
text: Very crowded, even late afternoon. Just had beers: food looked and smelled excellent. Staff very slow to clear tables. Tables not wiped. Had to queue for ladies' toilet: toilets needed cleaning. Perceived there is an issue with pickpockets (based on conversation overheard with security guard). Card payments only.

title: Chaotic, noisy tourist trap
text: We visited early Sunday lunchtime expecting it to be busy as it is a must-see allegedly. However we were unprepared for the crowds already there. Near impossible to find a seat and queues at most of the vendors counters. If your idea of fun is trying to carve you way through a wall of human flesh then you‚Äôll enjoy this place. Not my idea of a good time though. The noise levels were off the scale. Full of people taking selfies and taking photos of their food. A real tourist trap. Ghastly place. We left without eating as we couldn‚Äôt stand the experience.

title: Over rated
text: Seriously overrated. The food is ok. Of the three dishes we had, one was good, second was average, third was a tiny portion served on a small square tray. Lots of pretentiousness around food, but very little quality. Also the space is really crowded, noisy and busy. A couple next to us set up a camera and filmed themselves eating. It's that kind of place.

title: Nice enough but lead to violent food poisoning
text: Nice place with lots of food to choose from. Unfortunately I had the seafood rice and ended up with horrendous food poisoning that was really violent. Recommend anyone who goes here avoids the fish as it was not cooked properly and certainly was not worth all the grief.

title: Not worth a visit!
text: Messy and loud. Full of people and no seats available. Impossible to get around and impossible to see the range that existed. We walked away as fast as we could!

title: Overrated
text: We went to this for lunch because it was recommended to us as a cute thing to do. It was very crowded and the few remaining seats were a little dirty. The food was ok, but very expensive by Lisbon standards.

title: Bof
text:
Very noisy place.
Cannot find a table, we have breakfast standing, so cold (for croquettes) while trying to find a table available in vain.

title: Not my thing...overpriced and overcrowded
text: I went as my friend had it on our tick list but I was not impressed. I get it is a big place but just so overcrowded, did not end up eating there for several reasons, food was over priced, hardly anywhere to sit and the noise...could barely hear yourself think. Saying that, I am glad we went, just to experience it for the short time we did

title: The market and markets
text:
Once a food market in the historic centre of Lisbon, this complex is now quite difficult to describe and evaluate because it actually includes two very different realities that coexist as if separated at home; hence my vote, which is the result of an average.

The western sector, open in the morning, has maintained the characteristics of the traditional market, with the usual supply of food, especially fruit and vegetables; overall it is interesting, for the assortment, for the not excessive prices, and for a certain authenticity; it is not impossible to see residents doing their daily shopping, which is much more unlikely instead in the equally well-known Bolh√£o market in Porto.

In the other sector, with its already very evocative name of Time Out Market, the market gives way... to the markets: a huge shack with a jumble of outlets where everything - lights, sounds, colors, writing, ubiquitous English - seems made especially to ensnare the tourist, who is manned with everything from pizza to sushi, but nothing of what the average Portuguese usually eats. Prices are sky-high, almost all outlets require only electronic payments (in a country where paying by cash is by far the prevailing option), the manner of consumption - once you have laboriously obtained the order you have to go crazy to try to perch on a piece of free bench - reminiscent of those of battery-locked chickens, or, if you prefer, a 1936 Chaplin film.

Already in the morning the crowding is substantial, but in the evening, as I was told,
turns into a bolgia from which the Lebanese carefully steer clear. Even more so in a city like Lisbon, where you can still eat in small typical restaurants for very reasonable amounts, eating your own meals here seems really self-defeating to me.

title: Super expensive and crowded
text:
Tourist too much, very expensive and too crowded even at non-canonical times, even at 16:30 difficult to find a place
There are plenty of pockets and restaurants where you can spend less and eat well

title: Portugal by van
text:
Very noisy and very expensive place!!!
You have to be on the lookout to have a free table to install because there is no reservation possible.
For me it‚Äôs a tourist catch...

title: Insta hell
text: Don‚Äôt waste your time unless you‚Äôre solo you won‚Äôt get a seat to eat it‚Äôs full of people taking photos of their food and holding seats it‚Äôs over priced go to a proper restaurant there‚Äôs hundreds of them

title: To flee
text: No room, very expensive, very poor quality... to flee. There is much better in Lisbon. I had to follow, it‚Äôs a shame.

title: Avoid - over priced, busy, chaotic, average quality food
text: Avoid this place at all costs. It a tourist trap for visitors wanting to be seen at the trendiest eatery in Lisbon. You cannot book a table, you have to turn up and then sprint around the main area competing with others, hoping to spot someone leaving their seat and then grab it before someone else. There is a constant drum of noise, shouting and machinery whirring away, relaxing it is not. There is a wide range of food choices, something for everyone, which may be enough of a reason to visit. However the prices are excessively high, and they food quality does not justify it. We paid 100 Euros for four "gourmet" burgers with not enough chips and a glass of coke. I would have been happier with four big Mac's and 50 Euro's change in my pocket. If you want a relaxing evening meal for a couple of hours, then this is the last place you would want to go.

title: Over Hyped Tourist Trap
text: This place is super hyped up and tourists flock there. We went twice the second time out of convenience only and we thought we would play it safe and have pizza. The first time was from Asian Lab. on both occasions the quality of the food was awful. The environment was chaotic. The food hall at the Colombo Shopping Centre was bigger and better. Go there instead

title: Dangerous place, bad service, I almost got stolen inside.
text: Tourists, watch out! Don't visit this place. I was the victim of an attempted theft, I was able to notice when a bastard tried to move into my backpack. I arrested the vagabond and called security, which, besides doing nothing, still let him escape. I complained to the manager, who simply told me that ‚ÄúPortugal is like that.‚Äù A shame. I will never come back and do not recommend.

title: Fast food restaurants
text: For me it was a waste of time, there are a few mini restaurants that serve a fast food style and it is close to the sodr√©. It's not a tourist Attraction.

title: Worse food of all Lisbon
text:
Worse food in Lisbon
Avoid, the food here is average to bad when comparing to the great restaurants around the city.
This is not about the best of Lisbon at all, false advertising, this is about who can pay to get the a space for easy money and crappy food.

title: No big deal, just the industrial vibe
text:
The seat itself is nice, but it's a mess to manage the seat at the table while everyone orders at a different stand.
The.pizza Margherita 14.5 is madness, of course we stayed away from a Margherita made in Portugal at that price.
Nice for young people but nothing fancy for a family.

title: Even not.
text: Stay away from this place, classic tourist place where you pay a lot and eat badly, the only time I ate badly in Portugal.

title: It's not like the beginning of its creation
text:
Too bad.
I knew this place when it started, the Awards doubled.
The kitchen is not up to it.
The staff is not competent.
Too bad again.
Philippe

title: Horrible.
text:
Horrible pass your way
Catches tourists we ate the worst cod of our 15 days holiday in Portugal

title: Fairz pigeoner shamelessly
text: 98 euros to 3 for 3 courses and two beers! It‚Äôs taking people for pigeons. The bread is paid and the service is... 9 euros!

title: Good service, regular food and too expensive.
text: Inside the Time Out is a burger joint called La Real. DON'T GO. Food is not worth how expensive it is. The potatoes were excessively fatty. The most expensive Coke I've ever had 250ml for 2.5‚Ç¨.

title: Catch tourists
text:
Attractive but little Portuguese cuisine.
Unmissable place for all tourists and therefore very high Awards!
Oversold as place
Pizzas, burgers , ham sandwich and glass of wine for over 8‚Ç¨... high prices for Portugal

title: Not recommended
text: Very crowded, difficult to find a place. Disproportionate prices for the food on offer, higher than even the most touristy restaurants in central Lisbon. Not Recommendation.

title: Massed. Looks like a barrack of soldiers eating.
text: Massy and generally poor quality food. I don't recommend it. Looks like a military barracks with the soldiers eating. From

title: Avoid at all costs , unless you like airport departure lounges
text: Stayed in here for 5 minutes. Hot crowded and just corporate. Benches and benches of people crammed in. Noisy and like a school or work canteen. Prices higher than going out to a local cafe . Give locals the money not some large corporation.

title: Che delusione!
text: ...even this "market" has been transformed into a temple of tourism where you eat and drink with a very low quality / price ratio. Peccato!

title: Very average
text: Concept is fashionable "insta", noisy and expensive for the quantities distributed. More business.... 22‚Ç¨ for these 2 dishes ... bof

title: Not good.
text:
So disappointing. The only disappointment we had in Lisbon. Was expecting a top quality food market, with places to eat. What we found was more akin to a school canteen. Monotone food stalls, bench tables the length of the hall, yet scores of people wandering around with trays looking forelornly for a place to sit. Loud, crowded, hot. All of that could have been forgiven if the food was good, but it was distinctly average stuff. Quality wise, it fell a mile below the rest of Lisbon and is 3 times the price.

Avoid!

title: Ugh
text:
Expensive compared to the quality.

Few Portuguese stands.

And loud and painful music inflicted on everyone‚Ä¶..

The place deserved better as the Spaniards were wise to do it

title: Absolutely terrible
text:
I absolutely cannot understand all the positive experiences here. It is deafeningly loud, the food is greasy and expensive, and it is so crowded that you can hardly move.
All the seats are taken and will stay that way because everyone is stuck to their seats and eating like a disco. I have never seen a culture that does something like that.
Instead, you are offered all kinds of drugs by obscure dealers outside the entrances - enjoy!

title: To be avoided
text: In a historic structure, a company has created a series of street food stands, with high prices; the tables on which to then consume the food, as well as being very crowded, are not the most hygienic.

title: Tourist trap
text:
A tipical "tourist trap".
Dirty, unconfortable and noisy.
Food nothing special, just cooked in small midern kitchen.
And expensive also!!

title: A tourist trap
text:
I was thinking it was a good way to sample local food. Mistake‚Ä¶
It is the hangout if tourists and you have to queue at every stalls‚Ä¶ I passed my way‚Ä¶

title: Tourist trap
text: The concept is nice but the bill is less so, ‚Ç¨21 for a plate of tagliatelle Bolognese or 4 ravioli fighting a duel. Damage.....

title: NOT WORTH IT AT ALL
text: Old market converted into a joint for tourists with ordinary food at delicatessen prices. It's not worth it at all. There are a lot of people, it is difficult to find a place to sit and there is simply no cleaning service, you depend on the neatness of the previous users. In my case I ate a hamburger of similar quality to those of the large chains at an exorbitant price. Possibly if they pass by and want to see it, that's fine, but nothing more.

title: Tourist Trap
text: Avoid like the plague. This is a tourist trap. There are so many delicious restaurants in Lisbon. On our last night, we were lazy and didn't feel like searching out a restaurant so we walked over to check out the market. Everything was overpriced and not nearly as good as all the other food we had while we were in the city. This was nothing like the market in Madrid, for example, or in other places in Europe. It is modern but lacks real Portuguese charm. Walk through if you like, but get your food and drinks elsewhere.

title: Boring !
text: We were disappointed with this ‚Äúmarket‚Äù. It was not a traditional Portuguese marketplace. It was more similar to a giant food court shopping mall. We found the prices to be high, seating uncomfortable, and the atmosphere sadly lacking.

title: What to avoid at lunchtime
text: The concept is nice but the whole thing is sorely lacking in organization. The flow of people coming to eat there should be controlled. Far too many people compared to the number of seats. We found ourselves like two idiots with our tray without room for lunch. People lack good manners and take your seats from under your nose and sit down and chat before going to get food, when they don't put down their jackets to save seats. To escape at lunchtime.

title: terrible
text: We tried it twice at different times. It was terrible both times. The noise level in the hall in general, and the loud music, didn't make it a pleasant place to eat. But it was obviously a real tourist hotspot, because it was always full. Some of the sellers at the stands were very arrogant. There are so many nice little cafes and bistros where you can enjoy yourself. In mid-October it's still around 25 to 30 degrees, so there's no need to sit in a hall like that :-)

title: Disappointing
text: a beautiful, well-appointed place but at what price! It's not cheap... if you want to have lunch, count on ‚Ç¨30 per person minimum... considering what you can find in Lisbon... move on if you're looking for authenticity!

title: Lost its way I'm afraid
text: We came here in 2020 pre-Covid and it was something different but sadly, 4 years on, it seems to have lost some of its best outlets and turned itself into an over-priced tourist trap. Lots of other, far more reasonable, places to eat in Lisbon so we won't be rushing back.

title: Not inclusive for LGBTQIA+ people, a shame
text:
Non-inclusive place for LGBTQIA+ people.

The vigilantes in front of the bathrooms discriminate against gender fluid people by preventing people from choosing which bathroom to go to.

In 2024, a shame

title: Expensive, crowded, and loud
text: We came, we looked, and we left. I don't get the hype. Yes there's lots of food options but it's all overpriced. You can get better food at nice small restaurants in Lisbon with a better atmosphere and lower prices. This is a commercialized market for tourists.

title: Lisbon Market. Cais do Sodr√©
text: Very crowded at lunch time, but a nice place to visit. Good location and good restaurants nearby.

title: DISAPPOINTING
text: Bad experience, they don't accept credit cards or euros, and the person who sells the payment card is completely unprepared

title: Bad experience, I don't recommend it.
text: It goes from bad to worse. The market is horrible with dirt everywhere. We went to dinner and decided to go to Henrique S√° Pessoa, we ordered 3 burgers, 2 black pork and 1 fried cuttlefish. The first ones were full of mayonnaise and so we couldn't tell if they were good or not because everything tasted the same. The cuttlefish was horrible, the dark bread was terrible and the cuttlefish had to be frozen and fried, it had no flavor whatsoever, the fries were soft and cold. It couldn't be better than this, we paid the modest sum of 55.50 euros for 3 miserable nails and 2 water. It's a shame for a Chef like S√° Pessoa to let his spaces be ruined due to a lack of professionalism. Paying yes, but eating well is necessary.

title: The Americana of the century for foreigners
text: It is one more of those that have been lavished in Lisbon lately. Queues to buy food and drinks, expensive prices and you eat at tables next to everyone. The food trays take a long time to be collected. Pitiful place

title: Tourist trap
text: This place is totally over rated. Not sure what all the hype is about but there are plenty of places to eat and drink at in the area. A lot of tourists and lot a who lot of locals.

title: Lisbon Dining Experience
text: While Time Out Market in Lisbon offers a wide variety of food options, my experience was marred by an unwelcoming atmosphere. Unfortunately, the unfriendly demeanor of the people and the uncomfortable stares from others created a less-than-pleasant dining environment. It may not be the ideal place if you're seeking a relaxed and welcoming dining experience. For example, Monte Mar, my husband simply asked for one extra fork, the cashier/server told him that one order only comes with one fork. Let‚Äôs avoid ‚ÄúFork Controller‚Äù and unfriendly customer service.

title: Too crowded. Average food
text: Too busy. No one respects people who are ordering food. People sit and wait for other when we want to find a table they are all taken. Food is okay, different options but did not feel local at all. Seen it and that's it. Prefer smaller restaurants

title: Unfortunately disappointing
text: We were there early in the morning, which was good because it was relatively empty. But we think that was one of the few good things. It is purely a tourist attraction and we had hoped for a lot more. That doesn't mean that the quality is super bad, but rather average quality at comparatively higher prices.

title: Very disappointing
text: Was very busy. Ate at croqueteria. Food was awful. Croquettes not good. Sweet potato fries and roasted potatoes stale snd unpleasant to eat. Very disappointing.

title: Be aware, expensive!!!
text: First; it appears very nice and hip. Second; extremely expensive for Portugal. Beers you pay euro 2 or less for elsewhere are triple here and food you pay as much or more for as in i.e. Manhattan‚Äôs hip areas. Sure is a tourist trap compared to the Average Portugal!

title: Aggressive security
text: The security was really aggressive and pushing me to go out. It‚Äôs a place that I don‚Äôt recommend because the security is agressivo me. Very bad place to go, don‚Äôt go to this trap. Don‚Äôt trust on the security.

title: tourist factory, to escape.
text:
noisy place. very expensive . ‚Äúinternational‚Äù cuisine, not specifically Portuguese.
a few young, trendy Portuguese people are taking a chance. Other cheaper restaurants away.
We are disappointed following the positive reviews on the forums. This has nothing to do with the food courts in Singapore for example...

title: Very expensive and bad
text:
Expensive and boring experience
Many stalls closed and the food generally boring
Probably won't come back
Otherwise, the basis for it to be really good

title: Found the prices very high 9 euro for one sardine on bread. Not worth the price
text: Very busy as was to be expected. The food quality does not match the hype. Poor quality and over priced

title: We obviously don't get it
text:
Overpriced, overcrowded, uncomfortable, average food. This place is a nightmare, the icon photo on this site had to have been in the off season. The food is ok, some good, some terrible. All of it tremendously overpriced from the 12 Euro hot dogs to the fish and chips which were basically deep fried batter on a stick with the equivalent of Lays potato strings. We escaped with some above average pea soup and a pork pie that was cold in the middle. There are places right around the corner with quality food, real service for 23 to 12 the price.
Ambience 1 - eating shoulder to shoulder, so loud it might as well have been a concert
Food 4 - just ok, being "innovative" doesn't mean good
Value 0 - too expensive

title: Good food but pricy and hipster AF
text: Great food, sure, but you can find great food basically everywhere in Lisbon. If you like the authentic vibe of a market, don't come here. Basically, there are only irritating hipster tourists and the stalls are all identical. It is a modular series of food vendors that has nothing of the real beauty of an ancient covered market.

title: POOR AIR CONDITIONING
text: We visited here late afternoon at the end of September. The food stalls were interesting and diverse, and the central bar offered an excellent range of quality wines and friendly service. Our quibble was the poor quality air conditioning. It was 30c outside, and the food hall inside was uncomfortably hot and humid. It's not rocket science in this day and age to install large ceiling fans along the length of the mall to allow air to circulate. Without this we felt staying for a leisurely few hours would not be a comfortable experience, so we withdrew and picked up snacks and further drinks from bars along the river.

title: First day in Lisbon
text: We decide to have late lunch in the Time out market area. We came across Azul offering a variety of fish. The service was painfully slow waiting almost an hour to get our lunch. The fish platter was very good.

title: Far too loud, too cramped and too expensive
text:
I can't recommend this place at all.
It's very loud here - they play very loud party music so you almost have to shout to be heard. It's very crowded so you have to go around several times to find a seat. The most spoken language here was English - so it's a place visited almost exclusively by tourists.
That also explains the prices being too high. A burger costs ‚Ç¨15 - octopus around ‚Ç¨20.
If you know the other prices in Lisbon you'll know that this is a markup of almost 100%.
And the food isn't even good - lukewarm and not well prepared.
Unfortunately very disappointing

One plus point: the past√©is from the Manteigaria are amazing (but you can get them in different places)

title: we were disappointed totally
text:
we were there as a small group of people, with much confusion, a very hot hall, no sound panels, and prices same level as a normal restaurant where you have your how table. Tourists are managed as a herd of sheep.
I was told that air conditioning wasn't enough considering all restaurants were active so they said sorry and nothing else... I didn't believe it of course because it was visible that fans were switched off.
Also, cleaning was miserable and the table was totally full with people not giving is the place (after lunch) to newly arrived clients.
In Lisbona the services must do a great evolution as they are far behind.
Timeout is an English organization (also not so popular for its
stinginess)

title: Overpriced, too stuffy and just not tasty.
text:
Unfortunately, it's not worth it at all.
The food is far too expensive (average pizza Margherita ‚Ç¨14), it's far too loud and the ventilation is also very poor, so it's warmer than outside. Unfortunately, you spend a long time looking for a seat in vain.
And if you do have a seat, it's not private, you're sitting opposite strangers.
In general, it makes more sense to just eat locally because it's much cheaper, more pleasant and better.
I wouldn't recommend visiting.

title: Lack of seating
text: The food looked great but it‚Äôs so over crowded and not enough seating. Visited twice and gave up both times trying to find a seat. Not worth the effort.

title: Poor
text: High prices, very low quality. There is only the possibility to choose the food but then the rest is not at all good and plentiful. I didn't like it at all.

title: Tourist trap
text: Go there if you want to eat in a sauna, wait a long time for your meal and pay thousands and cents for nothing. Definitely not worth the price.

title: No pet friendly
text: Lugar muy completo para comer, pero no se admite entrar con un perro en brazos ni siquiera para poder pedir comida para llevar.

title: Worst food poisoning ever
text: This market seemed super cool but, sadly, I got the worst food poisoning from a burger there. Definitely e-coli based on the symptoms. Spent 24hrs in absolute hell. Only afterwards did I see the food poisoning reviews. Proceed with caution!

title: Overpriced and overrated
text: The market itself is such a good space and building! However, the prices are way too high for the food that you get. The options are very limited compared to other food markets in Europe. The food was okay but the prices for everything was too high. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it personally

title: Perda de tempo!
text: Pior bolinho de bacalhau da minha vida! Servido frio e duro no "chef" Miguel Castro e Silva. Fujam daqui. 2 euros por bolinho, horr√≠vel. Fomos l√° s√≥ para experimentar pelos elogios que vimos no YouTube. N√£o se encontra lugar para sentar e n√£o aceitam pagamento em dinheiro, s√≥ cart√£o. Come-se muito melhor em qualquer bar ou boteco de Lisboa!

title: Not worth it
text: Overpriced, crowded, hot, looks like an American tourist food court. I can‚Äôt believe I actually wasted time walking here and coming here. Not recommended.

title: Attrape touristes
text:
Si vous avez envie de manger quelque chose qui n'a rien √† voir avec le Portugal, et qui co√ªte tr√®s ch√®re pour rien du tout dans votre assiette, vous √™tes au bon endroit.
Une pizza Marguerita √† 15,50, un burger 18‚Ç¨. On se croirait en plein c≈ìur de Paris chez les attrapes touristes.
Je vous d√©conseille vivement cet endroit, faites plut√¥t marcher les restaurants locaux, qui vous accueille avec le sourire et qui vous serve des assiettes deux fois moins ch√®re avec deux fois plus √† manger √† l'int√©rieur !

title: Condividi
text: Il posto ci √® piaciuto ma non √® a mio avviso organizzato bene x la scelta del cibo, onestamente √® un po‚Äô confusionario ma √® un posto con differenti proposte di cibo, drink e costi. Sicuramente la condivisione √® l obbiettivo del luogo

title: Ristorazione da polli in batteria
text: Reduci dal bellissimo mercato centrale di Porto visitato due giorni prima, il mercato di Ribeira √® stato una delusione pazzesca. Un girone dantesco dal rumore di fondo insopportabile, dove i turisti vengono letteralmente massacrati da varie proposte culinarie oscillanti tra il banale e l'insignificante, il tutto a prezzi folli per Lisbona. La buona cucina portoghese √® da un'altra parte (a prezzi decisamente pi√π contenuti). Bocciato!

title: Overpriced and not worth the hype.
text: We went here because of a recommendation. There is a wide variety of food available, but everything is extremely expensive. The portions are small (a few pieces of lobster and rice cost 23 euros), and the place is crowded. You will be lucky to find a seat. During the summer, the indoors become extremely hot, almost like being inside an oven. You should not bring your children here. If you walk a little further down, you will find plenty of places to eat better and cheaper food. It's a tourist trap. Avoid this location and the nearby park late at night because there are a lot of drunk people.

title: Giod food - super rude service.
text: Unfortunate that the food is so good - but the service is so bad. I‚Äôve been to this market 4 times and each time had the rudest service. Not worth it. I would check out the other amazing restaurants in Lisbon with both great food and service.

title: Too Big Too Busy Too Noisy
text:
I just don‚Äôt get the hype surrounding this place, I seen many people standing or wandering around with trays of food looking for somewhere to sit down and eat. Sure there are plenty of eateries but that also means it gets very crowded.

Sorry not for me, too big, too busy and too noisy.

title: Not worth it
text:
Everyone talked up this place. But unless you want to spend time fighting over a place to sit, skip it.

We saw two grown men literally push a woman out of a chair because she got to the open seats first. And then another couple hassled a woman with a baby to leave after the person next to her left.

At least the beer was easy to buy.

title: Worst pasta ever tried to eat
text: Tried Liberta for pasta. Pasta looked ok but to taste was hard (not al dente, actually hard) sauce tasted of nothing. And when I couldn‚Äôt eat it, server didn‚Äôt even ask if all was ok. Avoid this place. Expensive mistake.

title: Laut, trubelig, teuer
text: Gro√üe Auswahl an Speisen und Getr√§nke, Selbstbedienung, Markthalle mit entsprechendem Ambiente. Zur Qualit√§t k√∂nnen wir nicht s sagen, da wir keinen freien Platz bekommen haben.......ist vielleicht auch besser so......

title: Just a huge food court.
text: A giant crowded food court with zero views. I mean, this pretty much sums it up. We spent 30 minutes there trying to fight the crowds and left to eat at the real open air restaurant. The atmosphere there was like that in a big mall before Covid...noisy, crowded and the prices were on par with the top notch restaurants in Lisbon.

title: Not what we expected!
text: Very disappointed! My wife and I looked forward to visiting the market on our resent trip to Portugal. We found it to be much too crowded to enjoy and the food looked like bar food. Seating is very limited and on a day like we had it was quite warm. There are much better restaurants in Lisbon for much less! Made for a nice picture though.

title: Attrapes touristes
text: Attrapes touristes mauvais rapport qualit√© prix pour Lisbonne et par rapport au concept du d√©jeuner sur le pouce‚Ä¶ nous avons d√©jeuner au sea me au Susana f√©licitade ou l impression de manger un repas en boite, pour le bar √† p√¢tes le service ne d√©bute qu √† midi pile le personnel de cuisine y est d√©sagr√©able

title: Bello da vedere, prezzi troppo alto!
text: Il mercato √® bello , invitante e con prodotti mi auguro di qualit√†, visto i prezzi esorbitanti: della serie guardare e non comprare! √à la classica trappola per turisti, mangiare al ristorante costa meno a Lisbona!

title: Precios caros. 2.5‚Ç¨ por un botell√≠n de agua. 19.90‚Ç¨ un filete. Est√° muy bueno, eso s√≠, pero muy caro
text:
Hab√≠a mucha gente y todo muy caro. Una hamburguesa 13.5‚Ç¨ y un filete 19.90‚Ç¨
Estaba muy bueno. Pero muy caro.

title: Not Bally
text: No seats, pretty average, Ground Burger was a 6/10 at best, burger sauce was okay not great. Again no where to sit. Spent ¬£30 on a meal, stomach in pieces not worth it. Better burger places. You know Byron Burger? That‚Äôs pretty good, basically the same for half the price.

title: para ingl√™s ver
text: caro e sem alma, bom se n√£o tivesse nenhuma op√ß√£o mas numa cidade com t√£o boa oferta n√£o vale a pena perder tempo aqui

title: No lo Recomiendo
text: No lo recomendar√≠a.... Es un mercado con much√≠simas opciones para comer, pero hay mucha gente, no es nada barato.. ni es c√≥modo. Muy orientado el turismo, recomendar√≠a verlo , pero con la variedad y calidad de restaurantes que hay en Lisboa, no me quedar√≠a a comer en el.

title: Verstehe den Hype nicht.
text: Auf Empfehlung des Reisef√ºhrers und verbleibender Restzeit sind wir dort hin. Um es kurz zu machen. Gute Auswahl an verschiedenen lokalen Speisen zu teilweise sehr √ºberteuerten Preisen. Es ist laut( bitte lasst kleine Kinder daheim) und Sitzpl√§tze kann man suchen. Wenn ein Freund mich fragen w√ºrde, w√ºrde ich ihm sagen: Lass es bleiben und nutze die Zeit in Lissabon anders.

title: AVOID: Cafe de Sao Bento
text:
First visit to the Time Out market and ordered x2 Bitoque PRT from the Cafe de Sao Bento. Everything seemed fine, I paid and it was only when I checked my receipt that I noticed the operator had added items to my order which I hadn't ordered or agreed to. When I queried why they were on my receipt I was told that I had ordered them and agreed to them before I left the counter. Insisting that I hadn't ordered the items, the assistant decided to take back the food items from my tray but refused to give me a refund. I took back the unordered food after all I had paid for them and sat down to eat.
A group of men who had also ordered from the same stall said this was a common occurrence and pointed out that they too had items of food added to their order which they hadn't ordered, and did I know that the Bitoque that I ordered should have a small salad also...it was missing.
Staff at Cafe de Sao Bento are crooks and liars, happy over charge and not deliver what the menu says.

title: Very commercialised
text: I appreciate that the market is the creation of TimeOut, but it still feels very commercialised and lacks an independent feel of other food halls around the world. The cocktail bar has some great cocktails that are expensive but in line with other capital cities. My biggest issue is that there isn't a single vegan vendor in 2023.

title: Tourist trap
text: Do yourself a favor and stay away. Overcrowded, overpriced, and full of impolite drunk. Fallen over under the weight of its own past success.

title: Packed, noisy, extremely commercial - no thanks
text: Packed, noisy, extremely commercial - no thanks. We did intend to eat here in the evening but popped by at lunchtime to see what it was like. I am relieved we did. There didn't seem any seats available on any of the very very VERY long communal tables, complete lack of any authenticity. Couldn't close to any of the kitchens to see what was on offer as the walkways were also crammed with people.

title: impossible d'y manger
text: que de monde...vous √™tes coll√© les uns aux autres et impossible de trouver une place pour manger. Les prix sont plut√¥t √©lev√©s.on a m√™me trouv√© des √©clairs √† 6.5 euros!!! je pense que l'endroit est victime de son succ√®s

title: Pretty average food at high prices
text: Order seafood pasta - very few pieces of seafood and lots of mediocre elbow noodles. Not worth the 20 Euro pricetag. Convenient and lots of choices. Traveling companions had 20 Euro hamburgers. Just not good value or exceptional food.

title: Ordinary market hall
text: Whilst maybe a cool place to see we weren‚Äôt very much amazed but what was for offer. Definitely can find better places elsewhere

title: Incompr√©hensible!
text:
Apr√®s avoir mang√© un excellent alfeijado, nous n‚Äôavons pu rien commander d‚Äôautre. M√™me pas un caf√© ou un dessert. Il n‚Äô√©tait pourtant que 13h55 et tous les stands fermaient simultan√©ment.
Grosse d√©ception de ne pas avoir pu profiter davantage de ce lieu et de se d√©lecter encore plus de la diversit√© des plats propos√©s. Et le comble est qu‚Äôil nous a m√™me √©t√© interdit d‚Äôaller aux toilettes parce qu‚Äôelles √©taient √©galement ferm√©es!!!!

title: ristorante "O frade"
text:
Entrato in questo market molto nominato in Lisbona, mi sono subito imbattuto in questo ristorante che all'apparenza sembra invitante, da evitare assolutamente, ho provato la tavola di formaggi ed il risotto con funghi, che era oltre che avere molto pepe, era inondato di vino che non hanno lasciato ridurre, pessimo!!
√önica nota buona il vino Bianco fatto in casa, non male.

title: V√©g√©tarien d√©√ßue
text:
J‚Äôai entendu parler d cet endroit plusieurs fois
Il y‚Äôa un assez grand choix de restaurant
Mais pour des personnes v√©g√©tariennes il n‚Äôy a presque rien
Une pizzeria et c‚Äôest tout
Un peu d√©√ßue car nous n‚Äôavons presque rien manger

title: Lugar lotado, pessoas mal educadas e sem nenhuma organiza√ß√£o.
text: P√©ssimo. Ap√≥s quase 1 hora na fila para pagar uma refei√ß√£o fui informada pelo caixa que n√£o aceitam dinheiro. Eu disse que ia procurar outro restaurante e a caixa informou que TODO o Mercado s√≥ aceita cart√£o. Estou como turista, n√£o trouxe cart√£o. Ent√£o ela resolveu aceitar o dinheiro e ap√≥s pegar meu prato fui buscar um local para sentar e fazer a refei√ß√£o. S√≥ que n√£o encontrei, as pessoas reservam todos os bancos e fui obrigada a comer de p√©. Nossa ! Que pesadelo !!! Nunca mais retorno e nem indico a ningu√©m. P√©ssima experi√™ncia.

title: Chef Miguel Castro disappointment.
text:
We tried the tasting menu in the chef Miguel Castro e Silva place. It was 26‚Ç¨.
After waiting for 25 minutes we got the food which not only looked bad was
Inedible!! We were shocked to find out that in a place like this something like that was served. We will not comeback and will not recommend this place!

title: Confusione
text: Mercato trasformato in una grande struttura moderna con diversi venditori di cibo, tutto molto confusionario e sovraffollato, offerta molto commerciale e turistica tutt'altro che tipica, code lunghissime.

title: Carnival party for children
text: The idea of the carnival party for children was great, but the execution left much to be desired. There was only one inflatable mini, which was not enough for the amount of children present. It was practically a war zone ‚Äì too many children, less space, and no one to organize! There were missing animators to keep the child entertained, and in the end, what we paid was basically just for the space. For the amount charged, we expected more structure and fun for the little ones.

title: Attention!!!!
text:
Bad experience not to mention the safety of the Titanic Sur Mer

My experience in this place was definitely negative due to the behavior of the security personnel. Instead of ensuring a safe and pleasant environment, they seem to act aggressively and unprofessionally.

I have witnessed incidents of abuse of power by bouncers, who treat customers with arrogance and, in some cases, with unjustified violence. In addition, I noticed a suspicious attitude towards some questionable activities within the venue, which raises serious doubts about the integrity of the staff.

I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to spend a quiet and hassle-free evening. Lisbon offers many better alternatives, where safety is guaranteed by real professionals and not by people who seem to be taking advantage of their role.

title: Worst place I've ever been in Lisbon
text: We went with a friend to see XL Garcia on November 1 at 6 a.m. We bought the tickets on the website and arrived at 6 a.m., in a queue that never advanced. People began to gather at the entrance. They only let in the friends of the entrance guards, who were also very poorly educated. We were treated like cows. We spent two hours waiting to enter, crushed in the middle of a crowd of pretty violent guys. We ended up leaving because the environment was very aggressive. In addition, at the entrance there was an umbrella that began to fall on the people who entered. We'll never go back there.

title: The girl with the armpits
text:
I went in with a group of friends when we went to order a ‚Ç¨10 glass or drink an imperial in a 15 cl glass or drink a white drink as thin as you can get, worse only 2 people serving at the bar, a girl and a boy and 100 people ordering a drink, and a girl in the middle of pouring the glasses stops everything and puts deodorant on her armpits right at the counter.
Very modern bar‚Ä¶

title: Desagrad√°vel
text:
The place is unpleasant, the girls at the bar are not
not professional and also super poorly placed
I'm not telling anyone to go!üëéüëéüëéüëé

title: horrible
text: The most worst bar bar in lisbon they want to sell glass and have bad staff is not good pl;ace.. tha forro band is very good

title: Horrivel
text: Horr√≠vel bar! Querem vender o copo al√©m da bebida o que √© pr√°tica criminosa! Algu√©m devia ensinar eles que quando voc√™ paga caro como √© o caso num drink o bar ao menos tem copos decentes para servir

title: Not As Good As The Reviews Say
text: I booked an airport pickup in Lisbon for 4 adults and chose a vehicle with 6 seats plus space for all our luggage. I received the driver name in advance and when we arrived at the airport, I messaged him twice to find him but received no response. At the general meeting point (for all airport transfers), I found my name and a few minutes later, a representative phoned me. She came to meet us and said the vehicle was at least 20 minutes away, so she secured another vehicle - with 4 seats - and sent us on our way. We were cramped and warm. Sorry we spent the money when an Uber would have been better.

title: Don't get ripped off like I did.
text: Take Uber instead. Hostess was rude. There is no one waiting for you with your name on a tablet. Waited over an hour for my ride. Another employee thought that was funny.

title: Don‚Äôt bother with this company ‚Ä¶book an Uber!
text: Terrible service. The issue was with the airport security which took far too long but they were meant to wait 45 minutes and didn‚Äôt. I tried to contact them via the WhatsApp message they sent but they didn‚Äôt reply. They have ignored all other messages and just said they couldn‚Äôt come back for us so left my daughter and I at the airport to make our own way to our apartment. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend at all.

title: SCAM DON'T LET THEM STEAL YOUR MONEY!!!
text:
SCAM DON'T LET THEM STEAL YOUR MONEY!!!
I paid for this 3 weeks in advance along with another tour. I scheduled it for Friday morning pickup. No one even showed up, I called and they asked to pay cash and that I would be refunded for the payment I already made. Unfortunately they are now not responding to my emails, texts or calls. I will have to fight this with my credit card company.

title: PLEASE READ BEFORE BOOKING!!!
text: DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE YOU ARE OVERCHARGED AT LEAST 3X higher than UBER. It is not even a black car service just a regular car. Please don't waste your money with this service UBER is right outside the terminal and very inexpensive.

title: CANCELAM SEM MOTIVO EM CIMA DA HORA
text:
CUIDADO!!! Essa empresa n√£o tem nenhum respeito pelos clientes e nem compromisso com servi√ßos que prestam.
Contratei duas vans com motoristas em abril 3 (meses de anteced√™ncia) das nossos ferias de julho. Foi exigido pagamento adiantado de 4.500 euros. No segundo dia de servi√ßo Essa empresa mandou um e-mail a meia noite cancelando todos os servi√ßos. Ficamos literalmente na m√£o. N√£o pediram desculpas. Bloquearam meu celular. Tive muito trabalho para receber meu dinheiro de volta sem nenhuma indeniza√ß√£o.

title: Worst experience in Lisbon - Avoid!!!
text:
Just had a message from our driver to write a review, so thought I would! What an awful company, would never use these again, so unprofessional and gave us such a bad start to our holiday.
Arrived at the pre- arranged meeting point, had to try and find someone to assist as it was an unorganised mess. Found our driver Mike, he told us to wait while he faffed around for ages on the phone. Took us off to the van, we had to wait another 15 mins while he went off to faff about a bit more, then he spent most of the journey on the phone, being rude to other customers.
We do like to tip for good service, but as it wasn't great, we just wanted to give a few Euros. I had some change, about ‚Ç¨5 which I gave to Mike.....just to note, its about a 10 min drive from the airport. He looked unimpressed so my husband said sorry but he didn't have anything smaller than ‚Ç¨20. Mike said it was OK, he had change. Off he went back to the van, came back with ‚Ç¨10 then legged it with a) ‚Ç¨10 and b) the change I'd originally given him before we could call him back! So he got a tip of ‚Ç¨15 when we could've got an Uber for ‚Ç¨6. We were so angry.

There are other issues with this company, but not going to go into that here.
My advice, take an Uber from the airport, they are readily available, cheap, the drivers are kind and cars are clean.

After that bad experience, I can happily confirm everyone else in Lisbon is lovely, our holiday was amazing and we will be back, just never use a private transfer company in Lisbon again!

title: Worst Service!
text: The driver did not show up. I even called the driver and he said he was at the airport. Very disappointing. I emailed the company and not even a single sorry. Very disappointing.

title: Poor
text: Pick up was fine from Lisbon airport; ( 2 separate days, for 2 family members). When picked up to return to Lisbon, car sent was too small for 3 of us plus luggage. Car returned without us and we had to pay for an Uber ( which was able to take all 3 of us). I prepaid and no refund was offered, nor any apologies for sending a car too small. Funny as they drove us there knowing how many and how much luggage. A simple email to inform us o bigger car was needed would have been the thing to do.

title: Lousy Way to Start in Lisbon
text: On landing in Lisbon I got a text from my driver, Nelson Leong, with directions and ending with the words "see you soon". Nelson bailed with no notice and would not answer several calls to his phone. We waited close to an hour for the hostess to find us another driver. Text exchange with the driver was complete with Nelson typing in a series of flip-off emojis, just completely unprofessional, rather than any sort of apology. When conveying our experience to the hotel, Top Tour management backed the driver and claimed I had threatened him which was completely untrue. I have kept the entire text exchange as the management denial was as bad as being left high and dry. If you have an alternative way to get to town, I'd encourage taking it. I can produce the entire text exchange as any response to this review by management is entirely predictable. As an aside, the hostess confided in us that the Top Tour system of assigning and providing drivers is a hot mess.

title: Take an Uber!
text:
Unfortunately our flight was delayed and then we endured an horrendous queue at passport control. All the while we were communicating with Marco Aulette, our driver to let him know the situation. He then messaged to say he had been waiting an hour and I told him we were on our way. Sadly a couple of minutes later upon getting to the pick up point, he‚Äôd already gone. I called him twice and he declined to answer. Another friendly driver called him (funnily enough he picked that call up) - told him he couldn‚Äôt wait any longer.

After paying ¬£14 for that trip, we then took an Uber from the airport for ‚Ç¨7 - more than half the price. Do not bother using this service, it‚Äôs overpriced and completely unreliable, and employs rude drivers.

title: Delays in bag delivery of more than 2 hours
text: Lisbon airport is a disgrace for so much talk about tourism, having employees who don't cooperate or respond to people's questions, endless times for luggage delivery... a very sad business card. Very bad. Waiting time 2h and carpet broken...or...

title: Trip advisor failure
text: Within minutes of booking our booking was cancelled telling us we would receive a refund in seven days.. no explanation. A chat with TripAdvisor could not explain nor assist us with rebooking. We took an Uber, one third the cost of trip advisor and easier with less hassle

title: Terrible service!
text:
I want my money back. I was stood up and the driver left without us.
I want my money back. The driver left without us. Terrible service.

title: Bad experience
text:
Our flight arrived on time, the driver sent us a message as soon as we landed telling us that he was waiting for us at the meeting point, we responded that we were already on the ground and were heading there. 10 minutes later we were at the place he indicated to us, but the driver was not there, we tried to call him without success and after sending him several messages he answered that he was with another service, after a long wait and asking him what instructions we should follow, 35 more minutes Later he sent us a message telling us that he could pick us up in 30 minutes. We undoubtedly told him that this was not a solution. Finally we had to take a taxi to get to the apartment.
I cannot recommend this service.

title: Never showed up for my airport transfer! No answer on the phone!
text: They never showed up, 15 minutes late and were not answering the phone. They had confirmed the pick up the day before. Just be careful if you use them, obviously they can be unreliable.

title: Canceled by Toptour with no explanation. Be careful
text:
We booked this trip in July and paid in full; date of trip was 9/29/23. There is eight in our group. Received another confirmation three days ago and then today they canceled the trip. We noticed the same trip was available on 9/27/23 and went to book that but it now costs about $1000 more for the same exact trip.

This tour was booked on Viator. I chatted with Viator representative who said there was nothing she could do and to reach out to the company. I did email Toptour and still waiting for a response.

This is not fair or good business. I recommend you take them off your platform. With only days before we depart, this is very frustrating.

title: To be avoided
text: Absolutely to be avoided... my flight landed at 3.32pm in Lisbon... We waited for the suitcase to arrive... We showed up after 43 minutes and he had already left, leaving other people stranded... I sent everything to booking .. They replied that they had tried to contact us but we hadn't replied... Which I can prove is not true.. However they didn't refund us anything and with this excuse they cheated other people. We took another taxi on site which cost the same... It's not worth booking it in advance.

title: Inaffidabile
text:
Ho prenotato con una settimana di anticipo e regolarmente pagato un trasferimento privato dal centro di Lisbona all'aeroporto per le 3 del mattino per 6 persone (4 minori). Non si √® presentato nessuno.
Non ho ricevuto nessun avvertimento, nessuna scusa e nessuna motivazione.
Ho dovuto, in piena notte e in tutta fretta, trovare una soluzione alternativa per portare la mia famiglia in aeroporto.
Dietro richiesta, mi √® stato restituito quanto avevo pagato.

title: Unpleasant concierge with visitors Canaries
text: The concierge did not want to attend us in Spanish only attended in English and Portuguese very unpleasant with who comes to visit your city, we wanted to bring an image of Fatima but there stayed thanks to the concierge

title: Avoidable
text: Nice view from above, Lisbon always deserves, beautiful bronze bells. Very rude staff, especially outgoing.

title: Give it a miss
text: Suggests great views of the castle, but you can get much better views from a number of free viewing points. We were encouraged to walk around with the drink included and they even poured them into paper cups as we came down from the tower and pointed us in direction of the exhibition in the church, only for us then to get a telling off from a different employee in the exhibition for carrying our drinks. I‚Äôd definitely give it a miss.

title: Tourist rip-off
text: If you want to buy an overpriced drink - the 5 Euro entrance fee includes a drink - then it's OK. However, if you want a nice view of the city or the river, you should choose one of the other (free) viewpoints of this beautiful city.

title: Covered up for restration
text:
Unfortunately the beautiful tower was covered up and we couldn‚Äôt enjoy it.

We will have to go back in few years for full view, you could see through the cover now.

title: UNDER CONSTRUCTION - NOTHING TO SEE
text:
Obviously a very nice construction but to avoid because under construction. Scaffolding and nets are the only visible elements.

The park is very dirty like many sites in Lisbon. We are not yet at the level of uncollected waste or unemptied garbage only in Paris but we are not far...

title: Closed for retirement.
text: Unfortunately the tower is closed for renovation. I didn't find any information on the Internet about it. She's surrounded by seats. According to the locals, the works in Lisbon have only a day to begin.

title: Disappointing
text: Very disappointed, total waste of time. Tower is surrounded by scaffolding and some type of transparent covering. Also vendors walking up to you to sell jewelry and sunglasses.

title: Disappointed, stay outside.
text:
The historical side is indisputable but it is not worth spending 7.8 e to enter with a long enough wait.
The stairs are very small and apart from qq guns exposed, the rooms are not decorated, furnished or explained.
The site is overexposed touristically ...

title: Disappointment
text: The tower was closed for construction. Very disappointing. We took photos from the outside but wished we could have entered.

title: Wasted time travelling only to find site closed
text: Checked the website for opening times and arrived to find a handwritten sign to say that the Tower was closed. Nothing at all on website and no explanation. Not impressed!

title: A tail not possible to see nothing
text:
As there is nothing to see inside, it is better not to book in advance. We will avoid two hours of queuing and a quarter of an hour of visiting... aren‚Äôt the organizers able to issue half hour and half hour time stamped tickets to better regulate the flows?
It‚Äôs true that selling tickets without limit makes money ... but it‚Äôs no match for Portugal, a nation that has a reputation for being organized

title: Tourist trap!
text: Dirty surroundings, unjustified waiting because nothing to see, queues accumulate throughout the visit, to avoid, nothing to see, just business!!!

title: If there is a long queue, don't bother. Staff are useless
text: Long queue and ridiculous management of it. Waiting over 1 hr 15 mins. Managed to get in and 10 mins later was told to leave because they are closing. Don't be fooled by the 17.30 close time. The building is partly closed by 5 pm. The wait time was not worth the visit.....could easily been in and out in no time

title: Waste of time and money
text: 15 euros to queue outside and then queuing again inside to see a view. Like alot of other people we gave up and left. So advise would be don‚Äôt bother going in. Do not recommend

title: Visit with buttocks
text:
Entry to the tower was not possible vs due to flood and risk of flooding the bridge to the entrance. It's not in any guidebook that this can happen. If you make ways of thinking away from Lisbon, that's not nice. 2 points because the tower is very pretty from the outside.
Please be careful, the taxi drivers waiting near the tower have ripped us off with the price. Please negotiate price before departure.

title: Nice for a Photo, But Not Worth the Long Wait
text:
Atmosphere and setting: A beautiful historic landmark with great photo opportunities. The tower itself is impressive, and the riverside location adds to the charm.

Tour/Guide: While the exterior is stunning, the long queue to enter the building makes it a less enjoyable experience. The inside isn‚Äôt particularly remarkable compared to the wait time.

Value for money: Not worth the time spent in line. The best experience is simply admiring the tower from the outside.

Comments: If you‚Äôre in the area, it‚Äôs worth a quick visit for a photo, but unless you have a lot of patience, skipping the interior is a good idea.

title: Prefer the Aperol spritzer option
text:
Ticket office is situated well away from the attraction so check the que length before you decide to buy the 15 Euros per person ticket (7.5 euros if youre over 65). We had to que for 1 hour in sun (no seats) - in July would be horrendous.
Once inside, you have the pleasure of climbing 92 steps which is a medevil tight narrow circular staircase split into 3 sections without hand rails and then coming down the same steps again. If you have any slight leg, hip, ankle or foot problem before you ascend then you will know you have one after your descent. Not for the infirm or disabled.
Inside their is nothing to see except the view over the estuary which is the same as the view standing in the que. A few peashooter cannons which I'm not convinced are genuine.
Overall a waste of time and money - far better to go and buy an Aperol sprtitzer and view the attraction from outside in the shade sipping your drink and ending up in profit.

title: Suffice to see it from the outside
text:
Fortunately included in the Lisbon Card.
We waited an hour at 2 p.m. on Sunday to see practically nothing. Besides looking out from an interior balcony there is nothing else, the rooms are completely empty. From the outside, however, it is very beautiful.

If you have it included in the Lisbon Card and there is no queue then it is worth entering. Otherwise absolutely not.

title: Watch the Tides: Do not take tickets in advance.
text:
If the tide rises, they close the Tower of Bethlehem without warning and do not allow you entry even if you have paid it. Many tourists were prevented from entering the Belem Tower with entry in hand by a rising tide. They don't warn you, and all of a sudden they stop you from entering. I do not recommend taking tickets in advance for this reason.
The outside of the tower itself is fine, but it's not otherworldly either. I can‚Äôt have my say on the inside because I was prevented from entering even though I had paid for it.

title: Wait times grossly underestimated
text: Bought a ticket when wait time was 1H. I‚Äôve been waiting 2+ hours & still a long way from the front of the queue. I‚Äôve no issue waiting but if an estimate is provided, it should be sensible.

title: No interest
text: From the outside it is pretty, from the inside there is not much to see. 3 small bare floors. The regulation of drip entries made us wait 2 hours for just 20 minutes of visit. Tourist friends do not waste your time, spend your way. For example, prefer the National Palace of Sintra, which is a marvel of architecture, or the castelo of San Jorge, which offers breathtaking 360¬∞ views.

title: Outside a marvel, inside not worth it
text: The inside visit is not worth the 2-hour queue under the sun to get in. Beautiful on the outside. That was enough. Rooms are bare and small

title: Horrible and useless
text:
2 hours in a row for the cosmic nothingness, maybe the top floor would have been at least a more interesting view, but it is closed.
Time wasted

title: Torre de Belem
text:
Very long que and still had to wait when finally made it inside.
I would recommend visiting for photos if in that are but not worth the 2hrs to look inside!

title: Zero stars if I could.
text:
Not worth the wait in line. So many other things to do instead of wasting 2 hours of your life in line and inside. Views, even from the top, are unimpressive. No real cognitive history information.
Not worth your time and energy

title: A Long Way from ‚ÄòAll That‚Äô
text:
I visited with my wife in October. A reasonably modest queue took 2 hours to clear for no apparent reason as it was no particularly busy inside.

Bel√©m Tower is a gorgeous piece of architecture from the outside and I‚Äôm sure there are many interesting tales to be told about it seeing as it‚Äôs 500+ years old. Sadly you wouldn‚Äôt guess that is the case as there‚Äôs next to no information inside and all the space is empty save for the lower battery which houses some small cannons.

I love history and I‚Äôm happy to wait in line but this was a big disappointment. Unless the queue is very short spend your time in Lisbon elsewhere.

title: Waste of time
text: Yes, do go there. But viewing it from the outside is sufficient. Spending 1 hour in line (around 70 ppl ahead), then more queueing inside the tower to find that only the lower levels are open to visitors, was enormously disapointing.

title: an endless queue
text:
Nice place but...
Management of the visit and the waiting poor or non-existent to choose. Ticket purchased but forfeited after 2 hours and with a minimum of 1h30 still waiting. We'll be looking at photographs from the inside on the Internet.
To be outlawed solely for this reason

title: Too long a wait
text: We visited but decided to to proceed when we saw the ticket office advertised a 2 hour wait for entry. We looked at the outside and were glad we had not bought tickets when we saw the poor people in the queue waiting for all that time in the blazing sun.

title: Not worth the wait
text:
It's a great tower to see from the outside. As for going inside, for 8 euro, it's not worth it. There's very little information and it's basically empty.
We made the mistake of waiting 2 hours in 30c heat to go in, please don't waste your time, especially if there's a long line.

title: Lovely BUT not worth the 2+ hour queue in blazing sun
text: While a stunning historical monument with some pretty views - the 2+ hour wait in a slow moving queue (they were letting about 24 people in every 20 mins) - with similar queues at the nearby monastery- AND more queues inside to get up and down between the floors make this a no go in peak holiday times. Moreover there was very little by way of historical information offered.

title: Beautiful from the outside, but beware the line.
text: We got here 15 minutes after it opened and the line was already 3 hours long, in full sun with no shade whatsoever. There is no timed entry.

title: Attractive visit but lost half a day by the queues and terrible organization
text:
Lousy organization to visit the Belem Tower, which after going twice has been impossible.
Last Sunday we went and the Tickets were sold out, we had a Lisboa Card so the ticket had to be redeemed to access, when we asked for tickets for yesterday, they indicated that they could not be given in advance and we had to go the same day for the redemption which was no longer possible because of the validity of the card.
Still, we decided to purchase them online and so we did, the Reservation told us that the time was at 10 a.m. Upon arrival yesterday and after 20 minutes from opening, the queue was 2 hours and about 40-50 people ahead in the queue. Due to our limited schedule, we could not be 2 hours waiting to enter and less in full sun after 8 days traveling, waiting for buses that do not end up passing or that pass more than 30 minutes late and walking 14-15 km daily.
We have travelled all over Europe and had never found ourselves in a situation of having paid to not be able to visit something. The information and organization for this visit to the Belem Tower is dire and is a pity because the monument has appeal.
I've really felt ripped off and the staff is very uncut. I understand that space may be limited inside so giving a maximum time of stay inside and hours of entry for the visit would solve tourism to be able to organize your visit without having to go several times and with such long queues.
I have been to the Colosseum in Rome, the Vatican, the Eiffel Tower, London Eye and other busy places and the organization and information is much better and I have always been able to visit what I have paid for.
Finally, for the claim there were no papers, I have been provided with a post because they no longer had a claim book. The mail provided by the girls at the entrance of the Tower was wrong, consequently my opinion cannot be more negative in terms of organization and service, regrettable in my understanding in an EU country.

title: Don‚Äôt go, had to stand for 3 hours for nothing
text: So basically we got and joined the queue, we then had to stand in it for for 3 hours! In 34 degree heat! There was a cafe witch was a 2 minute walk away, witch would be good but you can‚Äôt go unless your there with a good couple of mates to hold your spot in line. And after the 3 and a bit hours of heat and queuing, it kinda sucked in there tbh. Nothing to read that actually tells you about the place.
