There is a tour in there and some good sea views but other than that bit boring.

title: Trash all the guided Bel√©m tours ‚Ä¶
text: Forget all the experts & secret tip of overrated & extremely expensive guided tours. Travel with your friends and/or family to Bel√©m. From Lisbon the easiest one is the CP Train every 20min @‚Ç¨1.4 per trip. Talk a walk on the promenade between Discovery Moment and the Tower with plenty of bars, place to eat and music to listen too. Even on sunny hot days the wind will cool you off. Otherwise you picknick in the park in front of Monastery. You no doubt will have an enjoyable 1/2 day you will remember instead of wasting money on waiting. A warend ‚Ä¶ at least counts for 2 üòú

title: Poor visit management, flying!
text: The site itself is very beautiful, a beautiful view of the rear "terrace". However, a deplorable visit management to the point that we could not visit the entire site we were kicked out because it was time to close!!! Learn to manage your time rather than stealing from people... a shame!

title: Nice monument but do not buy long lines
text:
Belem Towers
The monument is nice to see but the place is just a tourist trap. Apps like Headout and others are selling expensive tickets for seeing this monument. But as tourists you can see it as is and take all photos you need and no need to buy tickets.
You can buy the expensive tickets and wait in line in the scorching heat for 2-3 hours, if you want to walk another 20ft and get closer to water and 20ft higher view. It‚Äôs just sad that which can be made available for free to tourists is being charged for same view. Very deceiving and waste of money.

title: Worst experience in Lisbon
text: 1 hour in line, in the sun. You pay 8 euros each adult to have no structure. It only comes in slowly, so you have to wait for someone to come out (as you can stay inside as long as you want), in order to get in. They should hire the boy who was playing the violin in front of the tower. He was ‚Åá the highlight of the experience

title: Advance tickets don‚Äôt avoid the 2 hour queue. Not worth it on that basis
text: Even if you buy your tickets in advance, you still have to join the queue which at most points is at least 2 hours long and in full blazing sun. Gave up so the tickets were wasted

title: BEAUTIFUL VIEW-WITHOUT INTEREST INSIDE
text: Very interesting from the outside. On the other hand the interior is very small and without particular interest. Nothing to do with it except a few bombs. Especially since the line is 1:30. So admire the site and continue on your way without wasting any time.I still don't explain the waiting management. A few people enter during the hour thirty waiting and then everyone enters at once?????

title: Absolutely not worth the wait. Avoid.
text: Avoid at all costs. We do not recommend unless you like to wait long in the hot sun with kids. First of all the workers told us the wait would be 2 hours but it ended up being 3 and a half. Security guard left mid job and we had to wait 45 minutes for a replacement. It was also very disorganized as the workers let random people in and people cut the line. When we finally got in it was not worth it with little to see and they didn‚Äôt even let us got to the top. There was also more lines when we got in where the employees were rude and weren‚Äôt paying attention because the they were on their phones and reading books. Don‚Äôt have any other activities booked as we got here in the morning and didn‚Äôt leave until 4.

title: Far too long queue and poor regulation
text: Standing in the sun for more than 30 minutes and not even in half pushed forward. We then decided to leave and saw that the traffic jam lasted 2 hours. Bad arrangement because we had to wait a very long time and hardly people were let in.

title: Top Level is closed currently
text:
Unfortunately, we were not informed when we bought our tickets that the top level was currently closed. If I had known this beforehand, I wouldn't have queued for an hour and I wouldn't have bought a ticket for ‚Ç¨8.
When I was there for the first time a few years ago, the view from the top was very nice.

title: Overrated
text: Travelled 40 minutes to get to the tower having bought tickets in advance . Waited in a long queue for half an hour and we didn't even move. Made the executive decision to not waste our day and left, and even as we walked away they weren't letting people in!

title: DON‚ÄôT GO INSIDE
text:
Don‚Äôt waste your time by going inside!!!!

The tower is extremely simple inside - hardly any information to read or anything to look at. A nice view but not worth the waiting or money. Take a photo outside instead and then leave!

We queued for 1hr 10mins and you‚Äôre forced to buy tickets before queuing so you can‚Äôt leave the queue without wasting money. The system they have for letting people inside is incredibly inefficient as there are only a few people allowed inside at one time which causes the massive queue.

title: Disappointing
text: We had reserved our tickets in advance, but once we arrived in front of the monument, we waited more than 2 hours. We didn't want to waste all this time, we preferred to visit something else.

title: Not to be recommended
text:
Absolutely not recommended, the visit is not worth the queue.
There is absolutely nothing to see in the tower, it is completely empty apart from a few fake cannons.

title: 2 hours of waiting in full sun to at the end see a fortress with a few cannons of which there are many
text: Definitely not worth the 2 hour wait in full sun and low season!!! A fortress with some cannons!!

title: Way too long of a line
text: The wait for this is ridiculous for what you actually see inside - the outside is much cooler. Once inside, it is pretty squished and slow moving (you need to keep lining up to wait to go up/down the stairs). Worth seeing, but not the best thing in the Lisbon area.

title: What a tourist trap
text: You have to queue for 1 hour to finally be able to enter. You see a number of cannons and you can move up 1 floor every 5 minutes. But on the top floor with the view? You're not allowed to go there!

title: Little point in doing
text: If I had read the other reviews I would not have done this tour. Very disappointed because inside there is nothing special to see, the views are nothing more and there is even a queue inside to get on and off.

title: Manage your expectations
text: Manage your expectation. Queued for over an hour., not sure what I expected but this literally is a tower with three identical empty floors and no information about the building and its heritage. To get to the top you have to climb 92 spiral steps. Save your money and time.

title: Not worth the wait
text: Not worth the wait! Walk on the sand, by the bridge and take beautiful pics from there. The inside is empty and there is nothing to see. So annoyed with ourselves that we waited 2.5 hours for this. Cannot believe they only let a few people in as a few people come out. Surely there can be a better set-up.

title: There's no point in buying tickets online
text: Terrible organization, we bought the tickets online, but when we went to visit, the line of about 50 meters that appeared seemed manageable, but after 1.30 hours of waiting and a few steps forward, we gave up. Entry was allowed for a maximum of 5 people at a time, with a wait of at least 15 minutes between one group and another.

title: Go for the exterior view only
text: Lovely building from the outside. Even with the Lisbon card we had a 2 hour wait. Best part was chatting with other frustrated but amusing visitors. Inside the tower is nothing exciting. Save your time and explore the Belem area instead.

title: Don't waste your time!
text: Queued for 2 hours. The most interesting bit was the outside of the tower which we had spent all morning looking at. There's nothing inside, just bare walls and more queuing to go up the tower where you won't even get a good view out as the top floor is this empty, dark chapel

title: Great to look at but not worth going in.
text: From the outside this is a five star attraction and well worth seeing. We bought tickets on line but were told we could not enter the long queue that day as it was shutting early due to high tide - come back another day we were told. That is not so good for tourists with limited time apart from the fact that it takes a bit of effort to get here from Lisbon. So turned up the next day and stood in queue for about 45 minutes (this was morning, queue may be worse later on). The last time we bought on line tickets, in 2018, we were able to skip the queue. So, first message is, do not bother with on line tickets. When we got in there was little to see - the best bits such as the roof are now out of bounds - glad we got there on previous visits. So great to look at but not worth going in.

title: so-so
text:
All that for this‚Ä¶.
Queuing so much for a tour that is neither worth the price nor the time spent.
Unless you have the Lisboa Card and be there when it opens.

title: Belem Tower 4-15
text: The tower is very pretty to look at from the outside, but there is absolutely nothing inside. The line was long and it was very crowded. Go to the Monastery instead.

title: No need‚Ä¶
text: The tower is very pretty from the outside‚Ä¶. And that's enough! The interior is empty and uninteresting, especially since after an hour-long queue in full sun, you still have to queue on each floor, to go up or down!! No interest, look at it from the outside, it‚Äôs perfect!

title: A Big Disappointment
text: We had purchased a Lisboa Card that advertises skip the queues!!. However, when we arrived at the tower there was already a very long queue. We were in the queue for about 10 minutes when a man came along checking tickets. He told us that we should have gone to the ticket office to get our tickets even though the tower is on the list of free entry with the Lisboa Card. The queue at the ticket office was also long. We decided to give it a miss as did not want to stand for 2 hours in line.

title: Bad organization
text:
It's a shame the organization isn't more efficient. Queues lasting more than 2 hours, which is even worse when we have children with us and the weather doesn't help.
They should sell tickets at scheduled times, which would avoid these inconveniences and the bad image of putting everyone out in the open.
Result, I bought tickets and spent more than 1h30 in the cold, wind with children and had to give up when the rain got worse.
God awful‚Ä¶

title: Disappointing in context with other things nearby
text:
Perhaps it was because we‚Äôd already done some other wonderful things in the area, but the wait was very long (worsened by the fake violinist right next to us) and the castle very plain‚Ä¶but we were disappointed. The single staircase meant many queues to ascend, and limited views from the window openings.
It was out least favorite visit of the day.

title: Total waste of time and money
text: Not worth the cost. Very basic on inside. Hardly any signs with information. You can‚Äôt access the tower at the top so views from the three floors is limited through the windows. Totally inefficient way of getting up the steps to see three rooms exactly the same. One of the worst attractions we‚Äôve ever been too.

title: Go and see the Tower and Belem‚Äôs other sights. BUT DO NOT PAY AND WAIT TO GO IN THE TOWER.
text:
Definitely go to the Tower and take some great pictures outside and enjoy all the other attractions and waterfront nearby.

But do not, I repeat do not, pay and wait to go inside the Tower. This is for four reasons.

Firstly, the queue is horrendous. We arrived 10 minutes after opening to see the entry wait sign estimating 30 minutes. Ok, I know they limit entry numbers so fair enough I thought. One hour 40 minutes later at 11:50 we entered. And this was on a cloudy Thursday morning in February. I dread to think what would happen in high season.

Secondly, and more importantly, when you get inside, THERE‚ÄôS ABSOLUTELY NOTHING TO SEE. I‚Äôm not joking. Two small completely empty rooms in the tower with one small information board in each. Nothing about the history or architecture. And a lower floor with a dozen small cannons. That‚Äôs it. I‚Äôve attached two pictures. If you look at these you will have seen everything there is to see inside the Tower.

Thirdly, the views are nothing special. There are much, much better vantage points along the river.

And finally, and which is not nice to recount, we found the staff inside to be officious bordering on rude. Once inside, there‚Äôs another queue to go up to the first floor of the tower. And another one to go up to the second floor. Despite there being so few people inside. The ‚Äòguardian‚Äô of the first staircase ignored the lines of paying customers politely waiting and just played social media posts aloud on her phone for 10 minutes. Then she deigned to let us go up. It‚Äôs not like there was anyone else already up there. Absolutely unbelievable.

So I say again. Save your money and, more importantly, time. Enjoy the exterior and environs.

Spend the hour or more you would have spent queueing in the Museum Do Combatente right next door, especially if you have children or want the potted guide to 20th Century Portuguese history (informative and succinct.)

But avoid the Tower.

title: Disappointing
text:
Purchased a ticket through the official website. Arrived to find that it was closed all day. I've emailed and called but am yet to receive any refund.

Aside from that, it's fairly unexceptional from the outside and there's a lot of rubbish and litter on the beach. Not worth the journey unfortunately.

title: scam
text: We had bought tickets on the internet for a visit on December 31st, what was our surprise to find that the site was closed even though it was mentioned as "open" on the internet. What a scam!

title: To do but without taking the ticket for the interior visit
text:
Superb exterior but the interiors are not worth the cost of the ticket and the wait at the entrance and to mob at each level.
The belvedere is not accessible
The windows are not cleaned and do not allow photos to be taken from each floor

The exteriors and the history of the monument are however imposing and majestic and are worth the detour in the neighborhood

title: Disorganized and not worth the wait.
text: Very disorganized place to visit and not worth the wait. Total waste of time. And by the way, if you have the Lisbon card, you still have to queue up at the kiosk in the garden to be given another ticket. I can‚Äôt see the point of doing the Lisbon card if then I have to wait in line for another ticket to get into some of the attractions around the city.

title: Not worth the visit inside
text: As other people already mentioned, there is really nothing to see inside the tower while there is a long queue to go in. Also you need to queue when inside to go up a narrow staircase leading to empty floors (!). Just go up and down the rooms, you are not allowed to go to the top of the tower‚Ä¶ Not worth a visit (at least inside) especially if you don‚Äôt have many days traveling in Lisbon

title: Not worth the tour
text:
There is no point in paying to go inside the tower. Basically nothing to see but square rooms- guests not aloud around the tower outside. Also - they only allow one way traffic on the spiral staircases- which takes a VERY long time. Take photos in front of the tower and save your money for the Jeronim√≥s Monastery.
We have a new saying with the kids- on a scale of Bel√©m to 10. Enough said.

title: Not much to see
text: If you think you will get to go to the top, you‚Äôre wrong. You can go up about the floors through a tiny spiral staircase which in high season I imagine you will wait hours to go up. In each floor there is basically nothing and only one short description. The bottom floor has a bunch of canons but like the wire there is little description of anything. If it wasn‚Äôt for the queuing at each floor you could see it all in 5 mins. In high season it might take you 2 hours.

title: Very complicated visit
text: Both the Torre de Belem and the Jeronimos Monastery are very poorly managed and create endless queues that tire you out and don't make you enjoy the visit. A system of access at set times is necessary, one cannot waste a day to see just two monuments. A very complicated visit.

title: Disappointed, stay outside.
text:
The historical side is undeniable but it is not worth spending 7.8 e to get in with a fairly long wait.
The stairs are very small and apart from a few cannons on display, the rooms are not decorated, furnished or explained.
The site is overexposed touristically...

title: From the outside only.
text: From the outside the site is very beautiful. However, there is no point wasting ‚Ç¨8 going up to empty rooms. Only the RZA on the roadway of the tower is worth it. The rest is just cramped stairs, waiting between each rise and each descent, in short, wasted time and money.

title: Not worth a wait.
text:
Awfully organized.
Staff rude and reluctant to answer questions.
Left the line after 30 minutes waiting and spoken rudely by staff.

title: Waste of time, effort and money.
text:
Don't bother.

Absolute waste of time and money. Despite pre-booking at a specific time slot, we still had to stand outside and queue for 45 minutes in the beating sun before we could go in.

Inside, there's barely anything worth seeing on the ground floor, at which point you then get to climb up a few floors inside.

And that's it. No rooftop view. Just a few narrow staircases and a view that, by Lisbon's standards, wouldn't make the top ten.

Don't waste your time or money.

title: Overpriced
text:
Not worth the $$$
Staff are unfriendly and not helpful
Spent most of time going up the stairs and can be challenged to average people. No warning and no help along the way. Be careful if you are not physically fit

title: Closed depending on the weather.
text: We had met two couples who had experienced the disappointment of not being able to visit, one of whom had experienced the queue..., and today 17-10, it was our turn. The transport time could have served us to visit another interesting point, but it was once we arrived there that we knew that due to too much rain (and wind) the site remains closed..."A couple forewarned is worth it. two"!...

title: Lack of respect and seriousness
text:
We booked a free tour in Belem, there were 12 of us, we waited 30', under moderate rain, and the guide never showed up.
Buendia free tour, never responded

title: Don‚Äôt Trust Headout!
text:
I was in Lisbon for one day and saw online that Headout offered priority tickets for Belem Tower. They actually had me enter the date that I wanted to visit online.
When I arrived, the Tower was closed due to a National Holiday that day. I was disappointed but understood the error. I contacted Headout requesting a refund of over 50 Euros and they refuse to comply. Certainly they must have known about the National Holiday and should have never sold the ticket.
They told me to go another day as the tickets will be good for a year.
I was in Lisbon for one day! and have no plans to return.
Beware of Headout!!
Do your research before buying anything for them as they have horrible customer service.

title: Lisbon
text: Don't waste your time! I imagined a huge deal, it was just a tower, with a huge queue to get in. And it's far away, take the train and go to Caiscais, it's worth it.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time!
text: What a joke. Bought a timed ticket on line for 9.30am entry and then waited in the hot sun ( no shade unlike the wait to enter the Nazrid palace, Alhambra) for nearly an hour. They let people in pretty much ‚Äò one in, one out‚Äô. I asked the ticket person about the point of buying timed tickets as it didn‚Äôt seem to make any difference. She said that it was a ‚Äòmistake‚Äô that they do it this way. We ended up just giving up and leaving! I sincerely wished I had read the reviews about the queuing prior to purchasing tickets!

title: Watch out for the tide!
text: We booked our tickets online with today's date. Arrived on site, site closed due to bad weather! 35 degrees... In fact we learned that it's because of the tide! Rising... and the footbridge in this case must be covered... So be careful before booking! The response from the person monitoring told us that the tickets were valid for 1 year... Attention ‚ö†Ô∏è

title: Look but don't enter
text: We bought the ticket for the tower online more than a week in advance and arrived on site half an hour before the opening, but still all this did not save us from the very long queue of almost 2 hours that we had to stand in the sun and then complete the visit of a tower, pretty on the outside but absolutely bare inside, in about 15 minutes. The view is also nothing special. Walk past it, but don't waste your time (and money) trying to get in. Much better is the Ajuda Palace which is quite close.

title: To be seen only from the outside
text: The queue to enter the tower is devastating‚Ä¶. 2 hours under the sun for a 10 minute visit‚Ä¶. Where there is practically nothing inside... it is worth taking the photo only from the outside and avoiding wasting time... there is much more to see in Lisbon

title: Look at it from the outside
text:
If you can avoid it: looking at it from the outside is enough. Over two hours in line. Ticket to buy but without time reference. They let in 2 people at a time for every 10
Minutes and often there is no one to let in. Unjustified wait.

title: Completely overrated, not worth the visit
text: The area itself is nothing special, a mediocre view. It attracts people only for the Bel√©m Tower and the Dos Jer√≥nimos Monastery which are borderline scamming: the only way to get in is to queue under the sun for 4 hours with the risk of getting sick. There's no point even buying a ticket online, the timetable isn't respected and you have to queue anyway. Some people felt bad and many refused to enter by giving away the money for the ticket already purchased. Thieves

title: Huge disappointment
text:
Don't waste time on the interior!
We queued for 1h30 under the sun for a total visit of 20 minutes (including the wait to access the successive stairs)
All this to see a few empty rooms, without explanations with just windows to certainly benefit from a beautiful view but what a disappointment
The interest therefore lies on the outside and the interior has little or no appeal.

title: The capacity is not commensurate with the people who would like to see it.
text:
Visit poorly managed.
The capacity is not commensurate with the people who would like to see it.
Many go out, many come in, but there is no pressure on those inside to go out. Result: 2 hour queue under the sun. But would a shed be so difficult to put up?
A mandatory path would be needed.
Not recommended.
Go and see other things in Lisbon, there are many...

title: Meglio fuori che dentro
text:
Posto suggestivo e romantico. Andateci √® molto bello MA NON ENTRATE NELLA TORRE. Biglietto inutile. Soldi persi. Vi spiego: un ora x entrare; poi fila x salire ogni livello; perch√© la scala a chiocciola √® strettissima e si va a senso alternato con chi scende. Tutto gestito ottimamente dalle guide, ma x vedere cosa? Uno stanzone letteralmente vuoto ad ogni piano! Una beffa se considerate che le prime due file le fate sotto il sole cocente.
Credetemi: il meglio √® l‚Äôeffetto che fa da fuori nel contesto del panorama in cui √® inserita

title: Not worth the price
text: Felt like wasted time and cash really. The view from outside enticed me to find you spend most of your time there queuing to either get up or down it. The rooms are bland with little to no history/information and I felt I hadn't really got a grasp of the point of the tower.

title: Queue and queue some more
text:
If you enjoy queuing this is the attraction for you. Queue to get in. Queue at each landing within the tower. Queue. Queue. And queue again.

The viewing platform is halway up and the views over the river are nice enough. But not worth the queuing.

title: Not worth the price, not worth the time
text: Only book this 9‚Ç¨-visit if you have one and a half hours of your life time to spend for three naked stone halls and a narrow stair where you have to spend your time waiting for the ascending and descending.

title: Attente ‚Ä¶
text:
Beaucoup trop d attente pour pas grand chose !
On peut contempler le monument depuis l ext√©rieur et c est bien suffisant.

title: If you want to waste your time queuing‚Ä¶.
text: This attraction was entirely ruined by their logistics. Even with having bought tickets online, you have to queue for up to an hour to get in. Then once inside, you have to queue to get to each floor (and there are four floors) - do the maths. We wasted 2+ hours at this place for essentially the same view from each floor. It‚Äôs not a guided tour, there are a couple of signs in English and Portuguese on each level. I wouldn‚Äôt bother

title: Inutile de visiter l'int√©rieur
text:
Je vous conseille de faire une photo de la tour et de faire autre chose
On a fait 1h30 de queu au total pour visiter une tour vide ( queue a l'entr√©e, queue premier √©tage, queue deuxi√®me et queue queue tout le temps) on avait qu'une envie c'√©tait de s'√©chapper de cette tour
Y a d'autres choses plus int√©ressantes
Ce n'est que mon avis bien-s√ªr

title: If you have a life to waste ‚Ä¶
text: If you have time to waste, queue here. Because you queue for tickets, queue to get in, queue on the first floor to get to the second floor ‚Ä¶ and even if you decide you‚Äôve had enough - you have to queue to get out. My advice? Definitely read up about it, go and admire from the outside, take pics and then don‚Äôt waste your life, queuing.

title: Dommage
text: Apr√®s une attente de 45 min, alors qu‚Äôon a pay√© pour un coupe-file, on nous dit que le billet n‚Äôest pas valable et qu‚Äôils ne connaissent pas tripadvisor‚Ä¶ donc on n‚Äôa pas pu y rentrer

title: Inseguran√ßa
text: A hist√≥ria √© muito boa. Mas as escadas s√£o muito estreitas e o piso desgastado! Um funcion√°rio comentou que n√£o √© permitido ter corrim√£o pois no passado n√£o havia tal apoio. Concordo. S√≥ que era usado por guardas e as pedras dos degraus n√£o estavam lisas.

title: Belem inefficient visit - just have a look outside
text:
Very bad experience...totally inefficent organization! Other queues inside for every level.
No priority with Lisbona card, totally useless.
If you buy single ticket you can book the time schedule.
15min visit and 1h.30 of queues and we were few people waiting.
Better to see outside since inside nice view from the terrace.
Staff not friendly and also difficulity to speak english.
Just have a look outside and spent better time in old town

title: Not worth the visit
text: I was very disappointed to find out that you can‚Äôt enter the tower. Don‚Äôt make the effort to travel all the way to here. However, if you find yourself in its vicinity, you might enjoy passing by.

title: Nul
text: Il n‚Äôy a rien a voir‚Ä¶ sauf la foule‚Ä¶ nous avons fait le tour en 5 min! Lisez l‚Äôhistoire du site et restez a l'ext√©rieur c‚Äôest largement suffisant

title: Do not enter
text: LET'S BE REALISTIC: this is not a visit, it's torture! Queues to buy a ticket, to enter, to go up each flight of stairs, to go down each landing, to go to each balcony, to look through each window. An authentic procession where you spend the whole time waiting to see completely empty rooms. Access denied to upper terrace. Appreciate it from the outside, it's beautiful and avoid a wasted morning. Tourists are well exploited with 6‚Ç¨ entry :)

title: P√©rdida de tiempo
text: 2 horas de cola para ver 2 estancias vac√≠as totalmente, en concreto pagas para hacer colas, las vistas son las mismas que desde fuera de la torre.

title: ÊéíÈöäÈÄ≤ÂéªÁúãÁ©∫Á©∫Â¶Ç‰πüÁöÑÊµ™Ë≤ª
text:
Âª∫ÁØâÁâ©ÁöÑÂ§ñÈù¢ÊòØÈùûÂ∏∏Â•ΩÁúãÔºå‰ΩÜÂÖßÈÉ®Á©∫Á©∫Â¶Ç‰πü„ÄÇ‰∏çÂè™ÊòØÈÄ≤ÂéªÂ°îÂÖßÈúÄË¶ÅÊéíÈöäÔºåÂ∑Æ‰∏çÂ§ö‰∏ÄÂÄãÂ∞èÊôÇ‰πãÂæåÈÄ≤ÂéªÊØè‰∏ÄÂ±§‰πüÈúÄË¶ÅÊéíÂæà‰πÖÁöÑÈöä‰ºçÔºå‰ΩÜ‰∏äÂà∞ÂéªÔºåÂÖßÈÉ®Ê†πÊú¨Ê≤íÊúâÂÄºÂæóÁúãÁöÑÊù±Ë•ø„ÄÇÂØßÈ°òÁôºÂ§ö‰∏ÄÈªûÊôÇÈñìÂéªÁúãÂ§ñÈù¢ÁöÑÊºÇ‰∫ÆÂª∫ÁØâ„ÄÇ

The exterior is very nice while the inside is a little bit empty. The queuing time to enter the tower already very consuming, but you still need to queue to different floors inside the tower, which have nothing worth to see inside.

The queuing time in total composite more than 90% of the visit time of the tower. If we knew, we should save the money and spend the time to enjoy the beautiful exterior.

title: Non giustifica la coda
text: 1 ora e 10 la coda prima di entrare e altri 40 minuti per accedere all'interno del palazzo. Bella ma quello che si vede all'interno non giustifica la coda fuori.

title: √Ä visiter de l‚Äôext√©rieur
text: La tour est magnifique de l‚Äôext√©rieur, cependant au vu de la file d‚Äôattente interminable je vous d√©conseille de visiter l‚Äôint√©rieur. Nous avons √©t√© d√©√ßu, il n‚Äôy a pas grand chose √† visiter √† l‚Äôint√©rieur hormis 2 escaliers √† monter.

title: Tr√®s d√©cevant !!
text:
C‚Äôest joli de l‚Äôext√©rieur, mais ensuite, c‚Äôest la d√©ception‚Ä¶
On fait la queue √©norm√©ment, pour ne visiter que des salles vides et sans le moindre int√©r√™t historique ou esth√©tique.
Totalement nul.
L‚Äôattrape touriste par excellence‚Ä¶

title: Sort out the ticketing!
text: Pleasant if unspectacular attraction. Needs to sort out how to buy tickets - great queue at (unadvertised) kiosk some distance away. One person selling tickets- some people giving up, so custom lost needlessly.....

title: A fuir absolument
text:
La photo ext√©rieure suffit pour la carte postale : le circuit int√©rieur est pauvre ( rien a voir de sp√©cifique), on patiente comme des moutons entre chaque niveau (normal, un seul escalier‚Ä¶on y peut rien la construction est faite ainsi pas pour accueillir des milliers de touristes par jour)
Il y aurait bien les photos de point de vue mais pour cela lisbonne dispose d‚Äôune quantit√© d‚Äôautres points de vue
Bref, √† √©viter

title: No
text: You pay for the tickets and think 100 people in front of you will be quick. An hour wait, 10 people were able to get in. The guards twirl their thumbs and only let one or two people in. People are leaving the line. Sincerely keep your money.

title: too much tail
text:
queue of 2 hours and then enter and redo 3 other things to climb the whole tower, beautiful but also avoidable.
advisable to go in the week

title: Biggest touristtrap ever!
text: This was certainly not worth queuing up for 2 and a half hours. The inside is gwn completely empty. Don‚Äôt waste your time and money on this and do something else fun with your time. Biggest tourist trap ever!

title: Theft and mockery under the Lisbon sun
text: Terrible! Purchase of the ticket made days before online to queue in the sun for 3 hours!! This is crazy!!! We went go after an hour because they could not resist standing and the heat. Absolute fraud stuff!! Better to look at it from the outside but it's a steal!!! Shame on you

title: Penal organization
text: Painful organization. Tickets bought online and - once you arrive - hours and hours in a row under the scorching sun, because admission is contingent on groups, with extremely slow entries. It doesn't take a genius to realize that maybe it would be better to sell tickets at timeslots to avoid this torture. Zero respect for tourists and visitors. Ah, obviously non-refundable tickets. Of course not.

title: That's bad.
text: Bad management, mockery. Beautiful but doesn't deserve all that wasted time. People who run it rude and disrespectful.

title: Horrible.
text: 3h20 of tail, they make go back to the drop, and waiting in full sun, inside no explanation and no interest in the visit. Take the photo of the outside and enjoy other places to visit.

title: Overrated...
text: Never again, bad management! Despite having the Lisboa Card we had to queue for two and a half hours under the scorching sun for a visit that lasts up to 15 minutes. Despite the endless queue outside, there were very few people inside the tower. They could definitely let more people in at the same time without letting them die and burn under the August sun. From the tower you can certainly enjoy a beautiful view, but it is the same as that seen from many other vantage points. My Recommendation is to just see the tower from the outside, all that waiting is definitely not worth it!

title: Just look
text: Beautiful monument to see from the outside but the organization was terrible, too much waiting, more than three hours in line, no priority queues and what's more, everything was under the sun. The tower inside is absolutely not worth it

title: Disappointing and exaggerated, certainly not a must see in Lisbon!
text:
The Tower is one of the must-sees in Lisbon and was therefore also on our list. From the outside this is a very beautiful tower, which is located a bit on the side of the Tagus since the earthquake (before it was in the middle of the river)

We waited in line for more than 3 hours to get in and in our opinion it was certainly not worth it.
Inside there is a "courtyard" with some viewing holes, if you want to go into the tower itself, this is done in shifts. The stairs are so narrow that you have to alternately go up and down, and this is done under the supervision of guards standing at the stairs.
at their command you go up or down in a group.

In our opinion, the tower is overrated, very disappointing for us and we would certainly not do it again or recommend it. It's a shame that it is so strongly promoted as a must-see in Lisbon.

title: Beautiful even just from the outside
text: Another disappointment with Lisboa card! 2 hour queue to enter the tower and no advantage for Lisboa card holders. They could at least release an entry time slot so as to allow other visits to be organised. We honestly preferred to give up....

title: Eternal row
text: The eternal line‚Ä¶ if you have little time it is not worth it. The visit to the tower is around 1 hour but it only took us 1:30 in line.

title: so much queue for nothing
text: Perhaps expectations are too high, but after 2 hours of queuing to enter and an equal wait to go up the stairs, you arrive at a first terrace where the view is the same as from the adjacent terrace. The top floor, at the top of the stairs, is closed. The visit was included in the Lisbon card and was really disappointing.

title: Nothing special
text: If you have little time you can easily skip the visit to the tower. Maybe you see it from the outside. Queue too long in the heat, it doesn't matter to buy the ticket in advance because there is only one queue. Nothing special.

title: Absolutely not. I do not recommend. Overrated.
text: WASTED day: thanks to the disorganization of the Lisbon administration we waited to enter for more than 3 hours under the scorching sun, causing a first degree burn. To see something that can be found anywhere. Buying tickets before leaving was of no use since the entrances are not managed nor scheduled. They tell you you will wait for 2 hours but then it's 4. Unacceptable.

title: No vale la pena pagar
text: 9‚Ç¨ la entrada para ver la torre vacia, las misma vistas que desde fuera, los controladores muy desagrables, no puedes salir cuando quieres, tu imoa que llamar a la policia por los gritos de los dos energumenos que tienen alli. Enga√±o total.por fuera preciosa hacer la foto y poco mas.

title: WAIST OF TIME
text: This might be the biggest waist of time in Lissabon. The belem Tower i very beautiful from the out side but that is it, I will only say this ones DO NOT GO INSIDE, we spend about an hour getting tickets and getting in, ones inside we saw the artillery room where a couple of Canon stood, and there were little to no historical information, afterwards we went upstairs to see the tower it self, there we stood in line for an additional 25 minutes just to get in side. When we finally got in we walked in a room witch had almost nothing to see the we stood in line for another 10-15 minutes to get to the next room and we did that for three rooms in a row. But we staid because we thought it would be worth it to get to the top of the tower and enjoy the view... To our surprise, we couldn't even get to the top, we got to the third room and saw that the stairways to the top were closed for visitors. All in all gaint disappointment, and wouldn't recommend it to others.

title: No merece la.pena entrar dentro
text: Por fuera est√° curiosa, pero la cola de mas casi una hora para entrar...no merece la pena en absoluto por dentro. Solo fotitos por fuera.

title: Do not recommend. Failed to arrive. Dishonest. Expensive.
text:
Terrible - this is a company to avoid. They failed to pick us up for a private tour. Then blamed me for getting the wrong day when the voucher i sent them showed it was correct.
The tour was sold as private with an experienced guide in English. However, our guide had limited language, did not accompany us to any of the palaces and only pointed out some trees.
There are many companies that offer tours to Sintra from Lisbon - private lovely experiences - but this is not one of them. Avoid so you can have a good day.

title: Self-Guided Tour not up to Par
text: The self guided tour did not meet my expectations. It was too confusing and hard to follow. I have used these in the past, but this one was nowhere near as good. the info was good, but finding the sites was too difficult. You had to have a working knowledge of Lisbon first for it to be effective. Even using my GPS, we could not find some of the sites. Eventually, we had to give up and just set out on our own. What is needed is better instructions and descriptions of what we are looking for. Also, you need to make it easier to reverse the journey as we were at the end of the tour when we finished an earlier tour. It was just not what I expected from my previous experiences with TripAdvisor.

title: POOR
text:
We thought we had a private tour with French Guide; now a taxi picked us up at our rental, which did not speak French but very nice.
He left us at the Sanctuary, and there nothing more. We called him as we had to know where the Guide was. And there the answer was no Guide the taxi brings you , it waits for you it is no other service.What a stunner, a car to go to the sanctuary we had one. We consider it a scam. We would like a commercial gesture of compensation for the absence of a Guide.

title: Afrader, not worth the money
text:
DE tour turned out to be different without communicating.
Booked was a small group tour in small bus with tickets to Pena gardens entrance. Didn't get all that. 54 people in large bus and DE Pena gar DE ns and palace were changed to visit an unbeautiful and small summer palace which was in the renovation, also internally furniture and paintings were in plastic. Furthermore, the e EN mess was gathered together furniture and attributes. The towns were little typical EN fully equipped for mass busloads of tourism The guide and driver did otherwise excellent

title: Not a small group, but full of big buses
text:
The tour should have a maximum of 16 people. In the end there were 27 - there would have been over 30, but some couldn't find their way to the departure meeting point. We booked the tour especially because of the small group size and that was not fulfilled. The bus was large and full, there was a continuous sound system from the tour guide and the palace in Sintra and also Cascais were simply overflowing.
The guide in itself was good and everything was driven off, but we didn't get what we booked.

title: Terrible travel agency
text: I lost the tour. We were at the meeting point at 8:10 and we never found the driver. We pretended to contact him for 1 hour and a sleeping gentleman answered. He told us to go to Sintra with Uber and find the rest of the team. We went again. The team was gone. Unacceptable and unprofessional behavior. I don't recommend it to anyone.

title: Sent to wrong location and missed tour.
text:
We booked on a Sunday for a Monday tour and arrived 15 mins early at designated location of Pra√ßa Dom Pedro IV ( a large statue) We received a message at 0810 that tour had departed and that we were not at correct location of a Starbucks which was across the street. Am guessing that operator may had emailed all other guests with updated meetup point but since we booked late we were not included in email.
I see that TripAdvisor meetup location for this tour has now been updated to reflect Starbucks location.
Disappointed to have missed this tour, more disappointed that operator only sent message after tour had departed, and not before as we were only across the street.

title: Lack of communication
text: According to a misunderstanding which could be fixed if the tour guide would have informed us by calling instead of emailing, caused us to miss the tour, even if we were 2 min walk away from the meeting point at the time of 8:05. So I would not recommend this tour since they would not try to reach their customers in case of that kind of situations. They did not give proper reaction at the proper time.

title: John and Daniel of Civitatis are unpresentable, ill-educated and devoid of all empathy to their neighbors.
text: On 6/12/24 we had a free walking tour of Sintra with Civitatis. We made two separate reservations with different names, in total it was a 6 person reservation, and the other reservation for 2 people, that is, we had confirmation of both reservations in two different mails. At the meeting point we were poorly received by a certain Juan who asked us how many we were, we answered that 8 people, ipsofacto replied to us in bad manners that groups of 8 were not allowed and his last words were stoned saying ""And I have nothing more to say"". We tried to explain that they were two different bookings only we met there, we asked you on several occasions to check the emails in which Civitatis confirmed these bookings. There was no way for him to look at anything, because, he had us after him and did not answer us but turned his back ignoring us, we asked him to let us see his accreditation to check his name and others to put a review, complaint or claim and he reacted by storing said accreditation inside the coat he was wearing. We insisted to him until the moment that he became violent and threatened us by saying ""Not to continue looking for him because we were going to find him"" in a defiant and threatening tone. This poorly educated, rude and violent character is not worthy of representing any kind of company through which he has to relate to the public. His partner Daniel, a Chilean who witnessed everything, initially did not mediate at any time, until a group of a total of 9 people arrived in our same situation, that is, with two different and confirmed reservations and to this group Daniel asked for their emails and there we already managed to get Daniel to do the same with us and we were able to start the tour. We felt helpless, ignored and abused by both guides, since, the second, Daniel, at the end of the tour politely indicated that we would not give any money, because he also did nothing to solve our situation and that it was as simple as having asked us for the emails confirming the reservations, this showed like Juan his bad manners and no education even telling us openly and hand aloud "get out of here, I don't want to see them"". Anyway Civitatis should take much more care of the selection of the guides he chooses to represent them, since, they gave us a bad day ruining our stay that day in Sintra.

title: Do not recommend
text:
Do not recommend. It felt like we had a driver instead of a tourguide.
Just rent a car or take a train.very professional and rude driver.

title: Disappointing Service
text:
To clarify, we booked a tour but weren't able to go because my husband got food poisoning the night before the tour. I suspect the tour itself would have been great, but we weren't able to find out.

My complaint is the service afterwards when we were trying to cancel our reservation and discuss a refund. After a number of phone calls I was able to reach someone and he assured me that he'd process our refund when he returned to the office (he was currently leading another tour). Since then I haven't heard anything from anyone in the company, nor have we received our refund.

I'm still hoping to talk to someone and sort this out but at the moment I can't recommend this tour company.

title: Irrespetuoso y falto de competencias profesionales
text: El gu√≠a, irrespetuoso (me arrebat√≥ el tel√©fono para tomarme foto sin que se lo solicitara) ,sin una camioneta funcional (sin cinturones de seguridad, sucia y sin aire acondicionado adecuado) , con errores en la narrativa hist√≥rica (datos falsos y fuentes no confiables) sin control emocional (nos enteramos de problemas personales y divorcio) y sin yo escribirle antes un comentario hizo alusi√≥n en una retro en ingl√©s no m√≠a que era yo quien le escrib√≠a cuando eso es imposible dado que no s√© ingl√©s, en ese comentario de manera sutil me ofende utilizando mi f√≠sico como excusa, lamentable, por eso me tomo el tiempo le retroalimentarlo objetivamente dejando al lado su f√≠sico que de igual forma podr√≠a ser criticable

title: Didn‚Äôt meet what I expected
text: Joaquim Lopes was a kind person. Nevertheless, when I purchased the trip it was promoted as being given in Spanish, it wasn‚Äôt, he offered to translate from English to Spanish, but the time made it impossible to have the same quality of information. Moreover, we were forced to be seated at the front of the van just beside the driver which made it very uncomfortable; we couldn‚Äôt even wear seatbelts.

title: Disappointment free tour Lisbon SARA
text: Hello, I visited Lisbon for the 3rd time with my family and we took a free tour. We chose Tour of my live and we had the tour with SARA. We were very disappointed with the free tour, the worst I have ever done without a doubt and I have done quite a few. It skipped super important things about the city of Lisbon and didn't tell anything of interest, only history, which made it very boring and boring. Very sad and disappointed, I would not do it with them again and that is why I write this review so that no one wastes their time and the same thing happens to them. I hope it helps you Carmen, Granada.

title: Unexpected
text: I had booked some time before I arrived in Lisbon, of course I had made itineraries. Just landed in Lisbon, the next day we should have gone with them around, I get a message with the cancellation because they had had an unexpected, ok, happen to all the unexpected but in this case it was enough to get replaced to not create inconvenience to the person who booked well in advance! Good thing I found guru walk who were super!!!!!

title: How to get plucked...
text:
Unfortunately I have to express my negative opinion about the organization: After a mishap for people who had missed the train the day was a succession of various unexpected events and failures because I believe that a group of more than 60 people can not be managed with only 2 guides, moreover wasting more than an hour of time for a break in the bakery at the expense of many other things to visit is very disappointing.
Spending 45‚Ç¨ so I do not think it is correct.
As is not fair the figure of 25‚Ç¨ for the extension to Cabo de roca and Cascais that is nothing more than a simple car ride without a guide (if I called Bolt or Uber I spent less than half... to know before...)
Thanks anyway for the preparation and explanations of the guides.

title: Not a good experience. Improvisation in its pure state
text:
That's a shame. 70 euros per person can also be spent but not in this way.
Two guides for 64 people, endless waste of time and management unexpected by amateurs. We stayed in a bakery without having typical products with endless lines (but why right there????) but the worst thing is to stay on foot in Sintra because there was no guaranteed pick up on the way back for everyone.
The only positive thing Antonio who illustrated Sintra in an attractive and interesting way.

Just an apology whapp is not enough for the inconvenience created today. That's too bad.

title: Nice but a little shallow
text: Cute but nothing memorable. The Guide nice and willing but the explanations a little superficial. Maybe the hot day didn't help.

title: I do not recommend this tour with this company.
text: Pick up a few steps from my hotel. Adolpho the guide started us with Cabo da Roca , then the town of Sintra only 45 minutes, to visit 2 sites it is ridiculous. Then we went to the Palace of Sintra, very beautiful site but waiting 2 hours to visit the interior????? Then visit Cascais, dinner that I refused because no indication that we were having dinner in group and back to Lisbon. Ticket for Sintra not included but Adolpho the guide charged us 20 euros when we could buy a ticket for 11- to 13 euros,???? Next time I get an Uber, and I buy my ticket at the ticket office. I do not recommend this tour. Take a taxi and buy your tickets online and especially arrived very early.

title: Misleading Tour Company
text: I booked a tour with this company on GetYourGuide and it was such a poor and misleading company. Never ever book with them. On the day of our tour, the tour guide Sara started off with a rude tone saying we are impossible to reach. Ok, but what‚Äôs with the attitude. Not even a hello first. Then when she said there are two people waiting in the car, I asked why is that when in the GetYourGuide activity details it says limited to 6 participants and she even admitted it too. However, when she called her manager, her attitude changed and became so nasty and argued with us. Said it is up to 6 can be book but it‚Äôs a van of 8 people. If it was for 8 people, then put limited to 8 participants on the activity details! Such a mislead and she kept arguing with us and saying we don‚Äôt understand. No, we understand clearly and we contacted GetYourGuide and they said we were right, that it should be only 6 people according to their website and activity details. After this whole ideal, why would we want to spend a day with this nasty woman and scam of a tour company so we canceled right there. We did a self tour and it turned out to be a great day and saved so much money and headache.

title: One of the worst for a supposed guided tour
text: The tour was advertised for an 8 hour trip in an air conditioned vehicle that ended up 9 1/2 hours with the air conditioning not working. The only air in the vehicle for 8 passengers were the two front windows partially down as the rest of the windows would not open. There was no mention of the excessive walking on cobbled streets/roads with extreme inclines. After 6 hours we stopped for lunch only to be told to pick the restaurant we wanted and be back to the non-air conditioned van for the return to our respective hotels. The host‚Äôs directions were not made clear and resulted in the group being separated causing excessive delays for every stop.

title: Avoid at all Awards for a Breakfast
text:
We had breakfast in this bar
for 19,90 euros, we had 2 americano coffees, 1 chocolate bread (not fresh) 1 kind of grape bread (not fresh) bread rolls (of course not fresh)
It was a Monday morning... it was probably Saturday leftovers...
Anyway, don't go.
Elsewhere it will necessarily be better and cheaper

title: Save your time
text: There was no line for tram 12 compared to tram 28, although it‚Äôs kinda a pointless experience. You can easily walk and see the same sights. Nothing special, wouldn‚Äôt recommend.

title: Tram wasn't running, wasn't communicated
text: Standing in the sun for an hour waiting for tram 12, but he never came. It was indicated on the sign though. Nowhere on the website did it say he wasn't driving. What a disappointment, especially for our 3 children, and what a waste of our time.

title: a real chaos/disaster public transport in Lisbon
text: They do not meet schedules, they treat you like merchandise, without any respect to those who visit Lisbon and we make an economic expense in the city that is not much for the service that is received, the information is skewed or they do not tell you the truth, they lie to you with schedules the same employees of the service or they simply do not pay attention to you, a disaster, I recommend as far as they can, not visit Lisbon, let alone climb even tram, one of my worst experiences in public transport.

title: A disaster of service
text: A tram wreck, they're nowhere near meeting schedules. The locals pay almost none. We've taken several lines and they all work terrible.

title: Didn't ride the tram
text: On April 26, 2023 noonish, we wanted to ride Tram 12 from Martin Moniz plaza, but the line was almost as long as the block and you have to wait in the sun. It seems the line was for either 12 & 24 and there has been "construction" causing delays on arrival of trams. Ditched this plan in a jiffy and just went shopping instead.

title: Bof bof
text:
Excruciating driver, we wanted to take the tram to its 1st stop... after an hour walk to get there the driver tells us he stops halfway, all for 3.20 per person....
I do not recommend at all

title: Another tourist trap.. save yourself two hours..
text:
An endless queue to get you half an hour on Lisbon's iconic tram. Beyond the vintage aesthetic aspect, it is a public transport in all respects .. people get on and off like a normal tram (so it is also crowded).
But it does give you the chance to see a part of Lisbon that you wouldn't see on foot.. and you could easily do without it.. it's one of Lisbon's main attractions.. which is all to say....

title: Anti Climax
text: Totally overated. Having experienced the 45 minute wait, and suffered the smirks of local taxi and tuk tuk drivers instructing their passengers to look at the fools queueing, I have to agree with them. An anti climax to ride in it. I was lucky enough to get a seat but in all honesty even with a window seat there is not a lot to see. It is a marvellous piece of history but as many have said, enjoy the sight of the tram meandering through the narrow streets from the comfort of a bench on one of the many viewing sites along the route. Judging from the route map the tram 12 does more or less the same journey but without the queues.

title: Blahh
text: I mean long wait to get crammed into a can where you cant see anything very anoyed driver not worth it. You can walk 10 min to the next stop to skip all the waiting by the way.

title: Too much waiting..... we're not done giving up
text: I can't tell you what the view of this tram is because we gave up to borrow it in view of the quest whatever the time... mythical but...

title: Attention! Electric 28 is over!
text:
Attention!
The line of tram 28 is off!
Due to renovations there is no more electric 28.. the journey is made only by buses and vans.
There are electric cars on other lines, with other routes!
Pay attention!

title: Awful huge wait more than 2 hours, no crowd control terrible service don‚Äôt bother
text: We rated more than 2.5 hours to catch the tram literally we think there was only 4 running as we saw the same driver turn up. There was a queue of about 200 people right down onto the road and only around 20 people were able to get on each time. The crowd was getting very annoyed with the wait and the numerous people who just pushed in as there‚Äôs no crowd co trip either it was actually ludicrous I don‚Äôt know what we waited

title: Too Busy to Enjoy
text:
This was sold to us as a 'must do' tourist attraction so of course it was going to be busy however tI felt like they let too many people on the tram. We ended up stood up in the middle, not being able to see anything through the windows. We gave up after two stops.
There are lots of the traditional wooden trams in Lisbon on different routes. I'd recommend finding other ways around the tourist spots

title: 2h20 waiting...
text:
What a great scam.
An impressive one leads us to believe that in terms of all the glowing comments it was a must-see in Lisbon. Like naive young people, we are engaged in this queue. After one hour the most lucid of our tells us whether to continue or stop. Always so naive we continue our queue which will last an hour longer to finally get in this car after 2h20...
Finally we leave to stop what 200 m further at a stop where this time no one was waiting, the first scam begins.
And it goes on and on every stop people get on we're packed on this tram. And in one fell swoop after 20 minutes of travel we are asked to go down the story is over. So effectively if you have more than 2 hours to lose queue like this band of french that we have been relying on all these guides recommending this excursion

title: Longggg wait badly organised
text: Massive queue. Very inadequate service to the demand . Badly organised . Would never do it if I knew it‚Äôs so slow as such to get on it .Tram itself maybe is good I guess.

title: Avoid
text: Avoid. This is promoted as a scenic cheap tour of Lisbon, when in fact you will queue for hours to be crushed in a crowd and not see a thing. Really unpleasant journey. Hot, crowded, long wait, for nothing. Better to walk or take a taxi.

title: Bonde Lisbon 28
text: Bad, they're slow to board and land. In line for hours and when the tram finally appears, the driver says that no one will be on board and that it is to wait for the next tram that never arrives. My first well in Lisbon, I do not recommend wasting all this time in the disorganized public service.

title: Mal
text: I don't think it's normal that after two hours of waiting and having their mother sit on the tram they'll be kicked out because it's not wheelchair-friendly first for not warning sooner later for not having it powered

title: More hype than highlight
text:
We‚Äôd heard so much about Tram 28 that we figured it had to be something special. Spoiler alert: it wasn‚Äôt. Honestly, you can go ahead and cross it off your bucket list‚Äîwe didn‚Äôt even rank it in our top 100 things to do in Lisbon.

After waiting over an hour in a line, we finally boarded ‚Ä¶ just a regular tram. Crowded, noisy, and constantly stopping to pick up more passengers. It felt more like rush hour than a scenic ride.

The atmosphere wasn‚Äôt exactly relaxed either. Between the warning signs and fellow tourists whispering tales of pickpocket legends, we spent most of the ride scanning the crowd, half expecting someone to lift our wallets while pretending to admire the tiles.

In the end, it felt more like a stressful commute than a cultural highlight.

Our recommendation? Skip the tram and treat yourself to another pastel de nata or a refreshing beer instead. You‚Äôll probably enjoy Lisbon a lot more with your feet on the ground and your valuables safely tucked away.

title: Uncomfortable and unnecessarily crowded
text:
According to the main city guides, this tram would be one of the "must-see" things in Lisbon. We walked around many parts of the route, being able to appreciate (and photograph) elements that on board the tiny vehicle we could not even see in passing.
The only short stretch of the route in which we climbed, in the absence of free seats, we did standing, trying to hold on to the supports so as not to overwhelm the other passengers comfortably seated to consult each their smartphone, disinterested in everything else.
You know the old charming trams of Milan with shiny painted wooden seats and bolts? These Lisbon ones will have 2/3 the capacity, maybe even less, because they are designed to fit into the narrow alleys of the old town, whose rails must necessarily have reduced curvature radii.
The experience in my opinion is recommended only to true admirers of city public transport by rail. For all other tourists healthy walks are far preferable.

title: Tram disaster
text: Absolute disaster! More than two hours of waiting. Timetable is good for nothing. Should drive every 10 min, in reality drive 3 an hour....

title: Tram 28 - not worth the wait
text: Waited 1.5 hours in line, they are sooo slow to pick up and drop off!! We got on (having never been to Lisbon before) and checked that we could do the round trip. Got to somewhere where we had no idea where we were and the driver stated ‚Äòthat‚Äôs the end, all need to get out‚Äô!! It was dark and we asked him for directions back to main road, all of a sudden he couldn‚Äôt speak any English and would not communicate with us!! Be careful of this extremely slow and ends wherever the driver has had enough!

title: Not worth the wait
text: Our travel guide wanted us to do this. We waited for an hour (3:45 in the afternoon in a Sunday) and got on the tram and went through the neighborhood. It was pretty, and the cost is great, but so not worth the wait. We could‚Äôve started walking through the neighborhood on our own. Even if you don‚Äôt want to walk hills, there has to be a better way.

title: Waste of time and money
text: We arrived at MM at 11.30am, waited 3 hours for the 28. What they don‚Äôt tell you‚Ä¶.1. Trams run in a group of three. 2. 50 mtr line takes 2 hours. 3. The extra hour we waited was for the drivers to stop for lunch as we waited 1 hour before we sighted the next tram. 4. It is NOT a round trip, got to the half way point and told everyone to GET OFF and get in line again to get back on. 5. Drivers are arrogant and don‚Äôt respond to questions, they just walk away. 6. The 28 tram picks up locals along the way. Obviously run by the government or local council as it was appalling.

title: Account of the Vicar
text:
We waited for 50 minutes and appeared in the place of the traditional tram a mini bus that was crowded with a lot of people standing and a bad mood driver
We descended prox the Augusta street disappointed.

title: Awful
text: This experience has made me question any other recommendations. We waited 2 hours at Martin Moritz ‚Ä¶ we were seated and they did not let anyone get on and stand. The next stop, loads more folk got on and just stood. They were the locals, not the dumb tourists like me who waited 2 hours for a crotch jammed in my back and tour of Lisbons waste bins. Total waste of time and energy. Just walk.

title: Bloggers and Influencers have killed this experience.
text: Tried at 10 am midweek on a rainy day to board the tram 28 in Martim Monez, the start point. The queue was massive, working out the number of people waiting it must have been 8 car loads. Trams run to a timetable obviously, as one tram was pulled up short and the driver was reading the morning paper. So it would have been 90 minutes before we could possibly board. Goodness knows what it is like in peak summer months.

title: Never again
text: Ignorantly we wanted to try tram 28. Time wasted. Terminus in Muniz Square, horrible. Column to take 28 and return. No chance of finding other means. At least you, avoid... ill-advised. Many angry people, no one expected to have to go down to a dispersed area!

title: The worst experience
text: We waited on line for 45 minutes, which wasn‚Äôt the issue. We get on and after a few stops the driver told us to get off without any explanation. I find out through locals there are disgruntled employees that want to go on strike due to unfair wages (you can‚Äôt use the metro card to get on), because it‚Äôs touristy they want more money

title: Waste of time
text: Waited an hour and half for this experience. We knew we would have to queue which is fine. However, when it came to our time to board the 28 we were ushered onto a tram that had been sat idle whist the driver went to lunch. He changed the number and destination on the front of his tram and assured the passengers that it was Tram 28. Off we went, looking forward to the , supposedly, 45 minute scenic ride. However, after 10mins he stopped the tram at Alfama and told us all to get off. When questioned by other passengers he just retorted in a grumpy manner that that was that and all off. What a total waste of a few hours.

title: Very bad experience
text:
We waited more than thirty and no tram passed from the terminal
No one notified people and almost everyone left the long queue more than 2 hours ago

title: Bad experience
text: Bad treatment from the truck driver. We pick up the tram at P√ßa Martim Muniz dps from a line of about 40 minutes. I had already made this tour last year, 2023, and it was wonderful. This time, left Martim Muniz and the conduct left us at P√ßa Luiz de Cam√µes ... did not take us to Campo de Ourique. I was horrified because, she was yelling "the end" "finish" and even yelling if she was speaking Chinese. Poor driver q pena q didn't mark her name üòÄ

title: Tram 12 is better
text: Waste of time. Only goes for 10 minutes as building new track . Route nothing special. Avoid queue and go on tram 12 from stop next to it

title: Avoid. Complete scam
text: Avoid. They are currently digging up the best parts of the route so the tram takes you a 10 minute journey through the worst parts of the city before the drivers rudly and without explanation kick you out in a complete dump part of the city. Incredibly none of this is explained when you buy the full price tickets. A complete scam. Avoid if you have any sense.

title: Incubo
text: Crazy thing, more than nn now to make a very short route in which you see absolutely nothing typical or that deserves ! Waste of time

title: The Tram is a huge hoax!
text:
We did 1/2 hour in a row at 5.30 pm, the driver after making us travel 5 minutes by rail, unexpectedly stopped and let everyone off without specification or reason or offer alternative solutions. Other people had told us about the same problem but we didn't want to believe it.
The driver after taking 18.6 euros to make 3/4 tram stops after dropping us off and being obviously insulted without giving any explanation or any refund had remained sitting in his driver's seat playing video games on the smartphone.
INCREDIBILE!!!!
In addition, the little path taken does not offer anything tourist as it once did.
DO NOT TEND IT, ONLY INSURED!

title: The tram does not go through the whole route now
text:
Since July 2024 tram 28 route is only 10 min long as there are some roads constructions and the whole route is not available. It's not worth to stand in queue for 30 min-1h just to be told that by the bus driver. If you'd like to go though, watch out for people who do not respect there is a witing line and they just try to enter the tram without waiting (especially elderly tourists).

I am sure this is worth waiting when the whole route is available.

title: Not worth even trying
text:
I have read about this tram is getting quite packed and didn't have much hope getting on - when I saw the queue, I had no doubts I'm skipping this.
A lady in a queue advised they ran around every 20 min, not sure if it's true, we didn't bother waiting.

title: Queues...
text: Like everything in Lisbon, the queue to ride this tram is longer than for most rides at Disney World. Don't bother, it's not worth it.

title: Deception
text: 1h30 waiting under waterspouts for the driver to refuse access because we had a Chihuahua in a belly bag. Very disappointed as for visiting this dirty or disgusting city of your choice.

title: TRAM 28 EYE WITH DESTINATION SIGN
text:
OVERRATED.
If you want to live the experience of traveling by tram you have other options not to wait more than an hour and a half. You have to notice the sign at the head of the tram that tells you what the end of the journey is, since not everyone makes the complete line and you can find the surprise that leaves you three stops from the beginning, as we passed. We waited for the next one, which came full stop, we paid again and this one left us in Camoens, which is not the end of the line either. I would have liked this to be explained in the guides or some travel page.

title: Queueing for 2:30hrs for 15min tram ride!
text:
worst advice to go here...
2.5 hours queueing = 15 min tram ride!

road works shut off the full route. it didn't go very far, the tram was rickety and packed with people after the first stop (it is a public tran, not a tourist transport but it was crap only seeing one way out as the middle was stuffed with passengers)

the route we saw was fine, just definitely avoid doing this in October/November. or at all really

there's other trams to use, which use largely the same route!

1/5
terrible for families with young children

the queue started on the main section of pavement, by the yellow bins before the smelly bins. be warned it wasn't worth the wait

title: A NICE EXPERIENCE WITH LITTLE SECURITY
text: A LOT OF PICKPOCKETS WATCH OUT... PREFERABLE TO TAKE THE TRAM 12 IF YOU WANT TO LIVE THE EXPERIENCE... THEY ARE WELL-PRESERVED RELICS

title: Dissapointing
text: Waited 2 hours to go on this, short half hour trip then it terminates in a totally different area. It is not a round trip, be warned!!!!

title: Tram 28 a tourist trap
text: The waiting huge (2 hours in advance) I was expecting to see a wonderful route.Neither even 20 minutes screw shit. I would suggest instead this overpriced experience and kindly say so. Take the 737 will take you to the same place in half time and leave you at the entrance of the castle

title: No point!
text: No point! An endless queue, plan 2 hours of waiting! It‚Äôs nothing more or less than a tram ride like any tram in the city! It‚Äôs just a myth!

title: Visit to the ghetto
text:
After watching Michael Portillo in Lisbon we thought we must get the 28 tram . We waited for over an hour at 6pm and when we eventually got on it was crammed.
It took us to places that looked like the worst towns that you would avoid in your own country. I felt unsafe and was worried about where to get off . Please don‚Äôt fall for all the hype it‚Äôs really not worth it

title: Total disappointment
text:
The worst experience in Lisbon. Tourist trap.
Surely the 28 is an institution but make a very long thick queue (at least 1 hour) for such a short ride (because at Largo da Graca the driver shouted to us to get off... Is it the terminus?) without having seen anything other than city traffic, it was a disappointing experience to say the least.
Useful only if you want to climb the miradouro from Graca and Santa Luzia without making the piece on foot uphill.
A Tour Guide told us that tram 12 currently runs the same route as tram 28 (which is limited by roadworks) but we could not find the stop.

title: Cram The Tram sod the paying passengers! Avoid yellow bus tour
text:
We bought this tram trip as part of the Yellow bus 72 hours bus/ tram/ boat/ funicular tour/ ticket.
We queued for one and a half hours to get on a tram which was then rammed with an overload of fare paying tourists like us. Although we had a seat which is as well as I am disabled we could not see a thing as the isle was crammed with standing people whose rucksacks were basically in your face. It was an horrendous and uncomfortable experience! The driver threw everybody off at a stop we didn‚Äôt know. Tempers we‚Äôre frayed. Kids were crying and I am as aware of intricacies of the historic quarter as I was before my knowledge being nil. It was awful .it was unsafe! it was anxiety provoking and distressing. Advice is damn the tram avoid avoid and get a Tuk tuck more expensive but at least you will see something.

title: Waste of time
text: Queued for two hours just to sit in traffic for an hour with an angry driver, you‚Äôd be much better off using one of the many tuk tuks

title: Feel like sardines in the moving yellow can
text: A long time ago it was nice to take the tram line 28 in Lisbon romantically and informatively. You'll have to wait in line for hours. We saw the long queue behind Rossio Square. We're not in this! Again and again the squeezed tram 28 passes us and we think of sardines in the yellow can.

title: Nehmt irgendein Tram
text:
Heute 3 Stunden angestanden f√ºr eine Tramfahrt ... na ja ...
Die Tramfahrerin war toll, aber das Warten hat sich nicht gelohnt.

title: Don't bother
text:
We rode the tram on a Saturday afternoon, maybe this was a mistake.
We queued for over 2 hours to get on the tram then the driver kicks everyone off half way around the circuit expecting you to queue again for the return part of the trip.
The tram was rammed with people, most were standing.
Yes it was a historic trip on a period tram but no way was it worth the queue or the discomfort on board.
This was the worst activity of out visit to Lisbon.

title: Tram 28 poor service
text:
Don't bother with trying to get on tram 28
The queues are very long and when the tram arrives it is usually full
The service is not very frequent

title: DO NOT BUY THIS TRIP!
text:
DO NOT BUY THIS TRIP!

This item is a complete scam. All it is, is a regular Lisbon tram ticket and a link (which ended up in the junk bucket!) to some kind of guide - which we never opened.... The "guide" that met us was just planning to show us the queue for the tram - and the 28 tram is always full!!! This is NOT the Red Tram - which we thought it was going to be. complete waste of money and it is not possible to complain to Viator or Tripadvisor.

DO NOT BUY THIS TRIP!

Go to the Pra√ßa do Com√©rcio and find the stop for the Red Tram - which is a great ride and the audio guide is pretty good as well.

title: Tram 28 is overrated
text: We stood around 1.5hr in the queue for this tram and it was over in about 30 minutes! We were gob smacked to find a local getting on no bother at all at stop 2‚Ä¶locals clearly know the best way to ride it! My advice, go to stop 2 or 3 or if you want a tram experience, get another one!

title: Disappointment
text: Line 28 is the most famous in Lisbon being the oldest, so it is taken by all tourists, but our experience was very bad because in one of the stops that made the tram a Portuguese entered through the window and tried to remove the mobile that thank God we carried hooked to the neck, still left us the pull of the neck that left us the burn and the great scare, the best of all was that we notified the police, so that they were aware of these things, that is the safety of the tourists, but told us that they could not do anything that was usual, a very bad penalty and experience

title: 2 hours I'm never getting back
text: It was not worth queuing over 2 hours. Admittedly, we only joined queue at 11.30 so the queue was already long. After 20 mins on the tram, driver said 'end of journey; all off'. It didn't complete the full journey. Not worth it.

title: Too much waiting and little yield
text: Waiting in the sun in the queue for over an hour actually made the experience negative. The problem is that if the activity is tourist, then to the ordinary citizen you have to give alternatives, otherwise, if along the way you make everyone rise the result, as happened to me, and have to go down halfway because you were all huddled and standing. Nothing was seen. Too bad!

title: Do not bother, farcical but BIG TIP !!
text: Horrendous experience, queued for hours no info on routes on fares, most people think No28 tram is going to the Castle , it doesn‚Äôt ! It passes nearby and no word from driver to get off there . Tram gets packed so you can‚Äôt see anything. Suddenly arrive at huge roundabout and driver shouts ‚Äú that‚Äôs the end ‚Äú ! BIG TIP‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..politely walk past mile long queues for No28 , stand by bus stop for No 12 tram three yards ahead of No 28 stop , GET ON No 12 TRAM IT‚ÄôS ROUTE IS ALMOST IDENTICAL TO THE NO 28 PASSES BY THE CASTLE AND ENDS IN THE SAME PLACE AND TRAM IS NOT PACKED !

title: Tram 28 IS A TOTAL WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY!!
text: Do not waste your time and money! It is NOT worth the wait! We waited for 2 hours and there was confusion around tram 12 and 28 with no one to ask or share information. Also no consistency in the frequency! One tram 28 just waited some distance from the bus stop for 15 mins while the tourists were baking and melting in the sun!!! It became full pretty quickly. Another one after that did not stop at all!!! And finally we got into the next one, which just went narrow lanes with buildings on both sides for the entire journey except for less than a minute when it touched the coast line. It was an absolute waste of time¬°!!!!!

title: All the fault of social
text:
All the fault of social media, alas.
Tram always overflowing and with practically no view.
If you want to get rid of the whim of the round well come, but otherwise forget it.
Unfortunately, the great videos on social media make you think who knows what, but you can avoid it.
It's nicer to see it pass than to stand on it.

title: What a disappointment
text:
On arrival there was already a huge queue waiting, unfortunately the queue only got longer and only occasionally a tram arrived. Because few people go on a tram we waited for almost three hours.
Once on the tram, the fun was quickly over. Halfway through the ride everyone suddenly had to get off because the tram didn't continue?
What a disappointment

title: Not worth queuing for ‚Ä¶
text:
Act of self harm - we unfortunately got to the Martim Moniz Plaza set off point way too late in the day ‚Ä¶ 11:40am ‚Ä¶ and queued for 2.5 hrs to finally get on (!!). The ride itself was good - we had seats ‚Ä¶ but it then gets crowded after the first stop or two so you only end up with a one sided view. Fortunately, we sat on the left side of the tram so probably had the best of the view.

The ride then seemed to cut short as we stopped half way through after about 25 mins (at the Pra√ßa de Lu√≠s de Camoes) and we were all told to get off as the journey was over ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Only way this is worth doing is if you get on early in the day or late. Not worth waiting in a queue for - life is too short !

title: Bad tram experience.
text:
I haven't had a good experience with the tram. Because nobody explains anything.
We stood in a two-and-a-half-hour queue at the iconic square, in full sun, and then got on board and watched them stop at other places where people didn‚Äôt expect much. You pay almost ‚Ç¨3 for a fairly short tour. They say you see things but you can hardly see anything because the train as it stops gets crowded, which makes your journey rather uncomfortable.
The idea at the beginning is to be a tourist tram and not a public tram.
For me it's a hoax and a mismanagement of the "town hall". In the end everything is a saccharine.
So in conclusion of this experience is that do not queue, but go to any stop of the tour and take out a bonus that is cheaper.
From where the tram leaves you, when the tour ends, to the square where you take it takes 16 minutes walking.

title: Don't take it if you think you're gonna see something of the city
text:
We caught him for walking around the Alhama neighborhood and a mess. We waited an hour and a half in a horrible queue in the sun and then a lot of people started to stand and we could only see the people who were riding because they kept getting crowded.
It is rather a mode of travel as if you ride a bus but do not expect a nice and beautiful walk to see anything of the city

title: You can do without it
text: He waits for hours under the beating sun to try to get on the famous tram but the wait is not repaid by the (short) journey.
