The tram runs along streets that are not suggestive and, given the crowding, little visible. You pay more than ‚Ç¨3 to make only one route and then you have to queue and pay to take the return one. Discontinuous and badly organized service.

title: To avoid
text: She's a scumbag. Very overrated. You should better see the tram from the outside at specific points. Getting into it doesn't bring anything. Crowded, no interesting views. Unpleasant premises.

title: The worst
text: Dire experience, after waiting more than an hour and a half another catch it at no time report where you are and the very unfriendly drivers. You can take the tram 12 that the route is shorter and with less crowding

title: Time Saver Tram Ride or Time Wasting Unfairground Ride
text:
As you may guess, the tram is old and offers only so much comfort. Air conditioning? Try sticking your head out of a window.

It is possible to turn up on a busy day and find it oversubscribed. Not great when most of the country is in the midst of a heatwave. Also not great for those with limited mobility.

You should be able to jump on and off at any point, unfortunately drivers will not offer any common sense to the above, even if you join the tram before the terminus and it starts up 1 minute late. Rules is rules, so dont think you're getting a round trip, they'll tell you to go wither in the heat with the next bunch of bargain hunting tourists, or go seek more accompanying transport elsewhere.

title: Avoidable
text: Overcrowded, hot, smells and afrori indescribable,... if you just can not help it take it at the end and not at rush hour, you have at least maybe the chance to sit down. Allow about an hour to reach the other terminus.

title: Get a grip people, its a tram.
text: Seriously, do not waste your time. Queue was 1.5 hrs, crammed onto tram and couldn't really see much as like a tin of sardines in the tram. Got tuk tuk for 1 hour, same route, much better. OK iconic but needs to be put to rest now. Oh, it makes lots of money for the system but they still moan tourists take up seats. One or the other guys.

title: Terrible Tram 28 experience - just take a picture of the outside of the trams
text: I will not do Tram 28 again. Over an hour long line up at the main stop of Praca Martin Moniz and a complete waste of time. They are supposed to run every 10-15 mins. Nothing really special about riding on one except that they do have an old world feel to them as they are all wood on the inside. However, they are so packed with tourists and locals (since they use these trams for their daily commute), its hard to appreciate the inside of the tram. The drivers are miserable sods no matter what type of transportation you take, as both the city but and tram drivers scowled when you get on. You do get to pass many attractions along the way, but unless you know what you're looking for, it would be easy to miss them. Plus the bus is so crowded, you're also watching your belongings for pickpockets. It's challenging to read the posted schedule as it's all in Portuguese and no one seemed to know what was going on in the line up. There were also no guides at the tram stop, which for a major tourist attraction, is unfortunate. I'm sure if they had someone directing people, it would make things less chaotic. We could have taken tram 12 to get to the same place, but didn't know that while we were there. Cost is 3.10 euros. There are tips online to what trams are the better choices and where to get on and I'd recommend checking these out before embarking on a Tram 28 experience.

title: Good to use to go to work or visit grandmother
text: This is not a tourist attraction/ experience. This is a daily, common public transport like the underground/metro/bus. Stop advertising for something else.

title: 1 hr and a half wait, packed like sardines, can‚Äôt see out, my view is peoples midsection employees need anger management
text:
Bad experience! The line was 1 1/2 hours long even though I arrived at 10:15. Ok. But‚Ä¶. After standing in that hot line that line, people rushed! I walked to the side and kindly ask the guy checking tickets could I please get a seat, I‚Äôm 70 heart patient. He said NO really nasty. I went back and could see all seats were being taken, asked again, he shouted NO! I managed to get the last seat that faced the center of the bus.
As the bus left, he shouted out, YOU NEED TO CALM DOWN! What? I asked quietly and you embarrass me shouting and with a look of disgust!
It gets worse. They pack people on this bus standing and now you can‚Äôt see out in front of the bus or to the right! My view is everybody‚Äôs midsection! Unbelievable!
I try to take pictures holding on to the bar with my left hand and hanging my right hand out the window.
The lady driving the bus was so agitated when a car go in the wrong way down the street meant for the bus, she screamed and flowed her arms. I thought she was going to explode! This happened twice.
When I got off the bus since I was next to the last, I tried to tell the tram driver. I hope she had a nice day. She did not acknowledge, her fury was still boiling over.
Their employees need anger management And those standings should be limited to not obstruct your view. After all, that‚Äôs why we paid our money and spent our time for this experience.
If I could rate this a minus star, that would still be too much! My ride was June 18, 2024

title: To be avoided
text:
A delusion. We queued for two hours under the scorching sun... Left from the terminus... Went through two stops... Got off without too many explanations.

I would say to avoid

title: Horrendous, chaotic experience.
text:
Lined up in the morning where the tram begins to avoid the crowds, long after the trams should have been runnning.

After waiting 1.5hrs with the kids was told by a grumpy tram worker that they were cleaning the streets and he didn‚Äôt know how much more we needed to wait. Told us it was ‚Äòour choice‚Äô though it could be a 2-3 hour OR LONGER wait.

We came back the next day. Waited the long wait (approx 1.5hrs) and finally got on the tram. After 5 minutes on the tram we got to the top of a hill and the driver told us the road was closed ahead, and arrogantly stated we had to get off. We and all other passengers asked for our money back, he refused and told us the money we gave was for his wages and no refunds would be granted to anyone. He didn‚Äôt care, just demanded we get off, and didnt respond when we asked if he was aware of the road being closed prior to us boarding and paying. We had to get a taxi back which cost more than the tram itself.

Aside from this the queue is that disorganised locals and tourists can be found pushing in at every opportunity causing complete chaos and frustration between the entire queue.

Tried a 3rd time on the last day. Waited 45 minutes and didn‚Äôt see a single tram. The line was ginormous.

For us, it was nothing but a waste of time. The timetable states the trams come every 10 minutes. For a system that brings in so much revenue for Lisbon perhaps the Government should put their hand in their pocket and sort out their broken Tram 28 system.

title: JUST DON'T DO IT!
text:
Has some social media influencer rated this as a must do? Has the world actually gone mad and we're all coaxed into doing "things we must do" and if you don't you're missing out.

Honestly, there are loads of these trams in cities across Europe so Tram 28 is nothing special. In fact if you get Tram 11, which is less busy, it does the same route with less stops.

It was so crowed to the point that you would think there's no way anyone else can get on, but no, they just kept piling in.

You're lucky to get a seat so most passengers are standing....you won't see anything else other than the back of another passengers head!

To add to the whole pointless experience it's not a round trip...you're kicked off at the top of the hill and you have to wait and pay to get back down. Fortunately I don't have mobility issues so could walk back down but this would be a challenge to anyone who did.

I'm angry with myself that I was caught up in the hype around Tram 28. I didn't hear anyone say "oh that was amazing!" Everyone just looked happy to get off it.

title: Dramatically disorganized
text: Stood in line for over 2 hours, many tram 28s that just drive by and don't stop. When they arrive, they first wait ages to get to the stop and then they leave the door closed for a while. Waiting in the scorching sun without any facilities is torture. The drive wasn't even worth it. Better to take an Uber hourly and drive the route (just as expensive if you share it) or just be in Lisbon for a few days and you'll walk past it too. Complete waste of time. During this waiting period you can walk the entire lap yourself. DO NOT DO THIS!!!!

title: USELESS
text: You queue for two hours to take the tram, you're packed in like sardines (speaking of Lisbon) and you see practically nothing due to the crowding. Useless

title: Terrible. Avoid.
text:
Terrible! We queued for over an hour to be able to board a tram. Once boarded they became over crowded very quickly so you were unable to take in the city, culture and the beautiful views. There didn‚Äôt seem to be a maximum occupancy so it was an uncomfortable experience which we cut short and certainly would not repeat.
My 77 year old Mum and her Sister were yelled at several times by ‚Äúelderly‚Äù Portuguese travellers who expected them to give up their seats and at one point, one lady kicked my Auntie.
Avoid! Find another way to see the city!

title: Horribly crowded, bad experience
text:
To start with the cost is very reasonable, we had the transportation pass and the tram was uncluded so it only costs us round 1,70 euros each.

However the experience was not even worth that much. There was not the sightseeing experience we had anticipated. It was really a tourist trap, at least when we were there, around 4:00 o clock on a Wednesday in April, not even the high of the tourist season.

We had to wait in line for over one hour to get in one of the trams, once in they keep on taking more and more passengers at every stop and it was so crowded you can only see out of your window, if you were lucky enough to get a seat. They kept on asking passengers to move to the rear of the tram to make roomfor some more and it was horribly crowded, body to body solid, We got off before our stop because we just couldn't stand it.

title: Absolutely insignificant
text: This tram that you find represented everywhere in all the shops of the city really has nothing fascinating or particular about it, other than the old conditions of the carriages. Really little thing.

title: Disappointing !
text: We waited 1h30 and the experience wasn't crazy. The journey is not sensational. Fame does not correspond to reality! We do not recommend it.

title: Waited for 2 hours !!!!!
text: Currently 11 15 am, been in the queue since 10 am. Seen 2 trams since we got here and probably another 45 mins based on timings. Don't bother

title: Just an old tram
text:
Absolutely not a highlight and massively overrated...
Just an old tram of which there are several in Lisbon with other lines that is not overcrowded...
Huge crowds because everyone wants to take a picture...

title: Better 12E in Mart√≠n Moniz.
text: Not worth it. Completely overcrowded, it is still in operation by tourists. It is better to take the 12, which leaves from the same stop, Plaza Mart√≠n Moniz, you do not wait in line. At this stop, you wait for 12, in front of the entire line, not wait in line. The 12 makes a circular path, you sit down and you can return to the same place Mart√≠n Moniz for ‚Ç¨3.

title: To avoid
text: Crowded, no view, drivers as smiling as a Parisian taxi driver. In short, a magnificent tourist scam, for which we wait hours. To flee‚Ä¶

title: Overcrowded
text: We spent an hour waiting to get on, it's very crowded and you don't enjoy it, they keep putting people in until we're all like sardines in a can.

title: For tourists
text: Very uninteresting experience. Crowded tram and no view of the route. It is much better to explore the neighborhood on foot.

title: Awful
text: This is listed in many guides as a must-do tourist experience. We found it absolutely awful! We got in line at 10am and waited almost an hour to get on. The line grew exponentially behind us and I‚Äôm sure some people waited multiple hours to get on. When we got on, the tram traveled approximately 250 yards and stopped at the next stop. Apparently this is where the locals know to get on. There was no line there and quite a few people boarded. Among them were old people and a pregnant lady, so the men who had waited an hour in the tourist line for a seat, had to give them up to a local who didn‚Äôt wait at all. The trams go on the same road as the cars, so when there is a traffic jam, you just sit. And we sat for quite a while. The tram makes many stops and it gets more and more crowded. If you‚Äôre a tourist, I recommend doing a tuk-tuk tour. You‚Äôll get to sit, you‚Äôll get narration about what you‚Äôre seeing and you won‚Äôt be squished in.

title: Disappointment
text: After a long wait due to the queue we managed to get on the famous tram 28. Packed like sardines we saw practically nothing. At a certain point the ride reached the end of the line and they made us get off. We didn't know what to do, but the tram only moves about ten meters and then we can start again.

title: Bad experience
text:
We took this historic tram to go to a viewpoint of the upper city, covering much of Lisbon.

It was not a good experience, although the tram is historic and very interesting, the driver was not friendly at all, it was very full so you could hardly see the places it passed, we ended up a little dizzy after a 30 minute trip .

Preferable to see them from outside or take another line that is emptier.

On the other hand, each ‚Ç¨3.10 ticket is expensive for a trip of a few km, an Uber would have cost ‚Ç¨1 more per person.

title: Chaos
text:
Designed for tourists from northern Europe or Asians and pickpockets from eastern Europe.

It's not worth waiting in line to get on it. It's also not worth going to the first stop and waiting in endless lines.

We got on at an intermediate stop to avoid a hill that we didn't feel like walking up. One stop and down. It is already validated for having gone on tram 28.

Seen from the outside, it is beautiful. Except when you see the typical ones hanging outside, we already know what they're up to.

Everyone notices it. So be careful with them.

title: A total waste of time
text: I simply do not understand what all the fuss is about. We took this tram on a Friday morning at the end of February and had to wait 45 minutes to board; I've read that some people wait in line for 3 hours! Absolutely ridiculous and not worth the time at all. The first 20 minutes of the ride actually go through one of the ugliest parts of Lisbon - nothing but crappy shops, derelict buildings, graffiti and garbage to look at. Then it goes through Alfama, but we could have just walked there (and I wish that we had!). There are plenty of other cute trams in the town centre if you just want the experience of riding up and down a few hills; I would recommend taking a tram through Chiado instead.

title: Absolute scam
text:
I totally subscribe to Freddy B.'s opinion on the subject because it totally reflects my experience with that tram. After waiting for 1 hour and three quarters, a time that no one gives you back, we decided to leave the queue, as disgusted as we were since we were trapped for about 3/4 of an hour more and we finally went up the automatic stairs that are right there. sidewalk of the stop and next to the pharmacy. On top of that, the noise is that at the stop it indicated that the 28 ran every 8 minutes at that time. Worthy of a third world country.

I liked Lisbon and my idea is very positive, but I think this treatment of tourists by Carris, the city council or whoever is responsible for transportation issues is shameful and disrespectful. Many people ended up getting into one of the tuk tuks that sit in front of you while you're in line, who knows if it's all a municipal fix so that people leave their money in those vehicles instead of using a simple ticket.

If you don't want to get bitter, skip the tram. In the end, with the help of the escalators, you realize that it's not that big of a deal, unless you have health or walking problems. If I find out, I won't even consider the tram.

title: Fatal experience Tram 28 Lisbon
text: A real trap for stupid tourists, it is incredible that such a system works so poorly in a city as touristy as Lisbon, more than 2 hours in a line of which more than 40 minutes no tram came, not even the 28th (which is the most famous) nor 12, an absolute disappointment, I DO NOT recommend them, don't fall for it! I am surprised by so much fame on networks and how they call everyone to use it when it is a real pain to wait in line at the Mart√≠m Moniz header, and the route is overrated, it is NOT worth wasting more than 2 hours in a line, They have to put more frequencies and not treat tourists so badly, the people of Carris and I don't want to imagine the chaos in Summer, first and last for me, very bad Lisbon in this, failed!!!

title: Endless waiting times
text: A disaster, more than 1 and a half hours of waiting and then not passing. Any other tram in Lisbon is a better option to take it

title: Not recommended, bad experience.
text: It is advertised as a panoramic and tourist tram, however after 30 minutes of queuing to get to the terminus and having paid for the higher fares compared to the other means of transport we discovered that at each stop dozens of people get on and off with shopping bags who stop standing and they crowd together, they don't allow a view at all. Unpleasant odors due to gatherings. Tested at the end of January on a midweek morning. Absolutely negative experience.

title: At the head of the customer
text:
To do for folklore, be careful if you do not speak English or Portuguese, the drivers are very unpleasant, even insulting, there was one on Thursday January 11, 2024 in the morning who made it clear to us and was not shy about it. say it loud and clear from the tram that we were having fun... not speaking both languages and that we didn't have the extra for the ticket,
It hides the image of the Portuguese

title: painful, fatal, shameful
text:
We had a pretty good plan, this tram ruined our afternoon and our plan, 1 hour waiting at least, a total disaster, it is true that the trams pass quickly at specific times but when they have all passed you just have to wait, wait, wait and wait until the next ones arrive

Seriously, don't waste your time on the tram, you can spend 2 hours in the cold waiting for the tram to arrive.

I didn't even take the tour so I can't talk about it, but you completely lose the desire to see Lisbon because of all the waiting time

If you have a plan to do the tour and you are short on time, don't do it.

A total shame.

title: Many waits...
text: Don't waste your time, waiting more than two hours, you have to stand, the frequency of time is not respected, in short, don't even consider it

title: Don‚Äôt bother unless you like being herded and cramped conditions
text:
We had heard good things about Tram 28 but were sorely disappointed with the whole experience.
We joined the very long queue and waited for over an hour to be herded onto the already packed tram. The driver made my friend and I move from our seat for a local to sit down when she had already declined the offer of another seat.
It was a bumpy journey trying to hang on to the hand straps and not fall into anyone as the driver had so many passengers on board.
After 10 mins we wanted to get off and the driver wouldn‚Äôt open the rear door to let us out. If you are of a nervous disposition, please don‚Äôt ride this tram!

title: To be done but not under these conditions
text: Tram 28 is an experience worth having in Lisbon but not under current conditions with queues, waiting, continuous disruptions. Like all the attractions of this city, disorganization ruins any type of visit.

title: Meh
text: It was a long wait and an uncomfortable ride. Views aren‚Äôt great. There are much better things to do in Lisbon.

title: Tram 28- dont do it!!
text: Avoid this at all costs!!! Unfortunately had high expectations of this and definitely not worth it. Firstly, the wait to get onto the team was little short of 2 hours‚Ä¶ very challenging if you have young children and point is not the safest and like many, we decided to head to the end point. Managed to finally get onto v a team standing. Could not really see much- team kept stopping for instructions. Probably better to ride one of the other lines for the experience. Buses are great and actually way more convenient. If time is limited‚Ä¶ give this a miss. In the end, we got off early as it was not worth it!

title: What is the big trama
text:
We waited over an hour to get on in the heat of the day. We also had to stop people queue jumping every time a tram pulled up but thankfully most of the queue joined in.

If you have been in Lisbon for a day or so before it is almost certain you will have been to the places on the trams route. If you just arrived then there are many better things to do and the chance to walk the beautiful city is better than sitting being shoogled on a tram.
How this is Hidden Planets No1 thing to do in the city is beyond me. Saving grace was the daily ticket covers the ¬£3 cost

title: Not a tourist attraction. Waste of time.
text:
This shouldn‚Äôt not be advertised as a ‚Äútouristic attraction‚Äù or ‚Äúsomething to do while visiting Lisbon‚Äù. I‚Äôm especially annoyed at TripAdvisor, because usually I get very good suggestions there.
It‚Äôs a tram line. That‚Äôs it. Never, in a million years would I (or anyone else for that matter) have thought about treating a Tran line as a tourist attraction if it wasn‚Äôt for all those reviews and suggestions online.
First of all, the trams are tiny and get packed to the brim, I‚Äôm talking London Central line in peak hour packed. No space no breathe, let alone to enjoy the scenery or taking pictures. This is a busy transport link amongst the central parts of the city. The locals use it daily to go to work but thanks to the overwhelming amount of tourists, they can‚Äôt even board the tram for hours.
If you are hoping to get a seat you will need to board the tram at the first stop, where you will find a queue 40 meters long. And you will be thinking ‚Äòoh it‚Äôs not that long, this will be quick‚Äô but it‚Äôs not, it‚Äôs anything but quick. As I already mentioned the trams are tiny and the drivers only allow 22 people in on the first stop (the amount of sits available on board). The trams come by every 12 min or so, therefore you will be stuck at that stop for more than 1 hour in scorching heat, wishing you never thought of doing this.
Finally, you get to board, rushing inside and take a nice sit next to an open window, preparing to be amazed by the great views described all over the internet. Wrong again!!! The streets in Lisbon, especially the one where the trams go, are very narrow, the buildings are tall and the tram sits low, therefore all you can see is the bottom of the building rushing by you, sometimes as close as 3 feet away. No chance to see anything that close or take a nice picture. You could stretch your arm outsides the window and try and make a video, risking a passerby to snatch your phone from your hand. Same thing goes for every stop the tram makes, you need to hold on tide to your belongings because everyone walking by could reach inside and grab your stuff.
The tram gets packed by the 3rd stop so you can‚Äôt see around you anymore, only out the window. And if an elder or disabled person enters the tram, you will have to give your sit up, because at the end of the day this is public transport and not a touring bus with reserved sitting. The sit you waited for more than one hour is now gone and if you thought your view was bad before, wait until you have to stand, because the windows do not go all the way up so all you see is out the window at this angle is the pavement rushing by.
If you do get to keep your seat you can make a couple of short videos when the tram turns to the same side you are sitting on, but that‚Äôs all.
The only good place on the tram is either standing right behind the driver, but they do not let you stay there long because the ticket device is there and people need to use it on their way in, or all the way at the back of the tram, but the exit is there and people are constantly pushing and squishing you on the way out, plus the windows there are different and the pictures come out bad.
Overall experience - terrible.
People who tell you they had a great time on that tram are either lying to you because they are ashamed of wasting 3 hours of their expensive holiday on that horrible experience, either have never been on a tram in their life‚Ä¶
The End.

title: ok i guess
text: waited 2 hrs in the rain for this and definitely not that amazing, i‚Äôve been on it before and previously it was much more fun. recommend going early in the morning rather than evening. but we did get a seat in the evening as they don‚Äôt allow people to stand when u board at martim moniz.

title: VERY BADLY.
text:
WASTE OF TIME. THEY ARE DEFAULTERS. THE FREQUENCY OF STEP IS NOT REAL AND WHEN IT HAPPENS, IT GOES COMPLETE.
VERY BAD MANAGEMENT.

title: A shame
text: The very long lines are a big waste of time. There are so many people that you don't want to get on the train üëéüèª

title: Nice but an odyssey
text: I won't go too far in saying that the wait is exhausting because I saw the queue that was there. It's definitely a nice ride but I hope this review is useful so you don't find yourself in a situation like mine. I thought the tram would return to the point where I had taken it, but no. The terminus is in Campo Ourique where you either pay ‚Ç¨3 for the ticket again by queuing again or you have to find out which bus you can take to return. Figuring it out on the spot was a bit tricky

title: Nothing special
text:
In other countries they would be exhibited in some museum, but here they circulate daily essentially only for tourists.
Except for at the first light of dawn even at the terminus you have to stand in biblical queues to get on (there are only 20 seats) and furthermore the entire interval of the journeys seems to be essentially at the free will of the conductors.
On board the ticket costs three euros (!), while using the rechargeable card half of the tax is deducted.
A good part of its route is carried out through very narrow alleys in a continuous ups and downs, passing over everything even to the side of where we were hosted: the rattling, however, did not disturb our sleep too much.
Overrated

title: Horrendous
text: If you ever feel the need to squeeze yourself into a 100 degree furnace that's dangerously overcrowded then this tram is the very fellow for you. Waited for ages before it arrived. Got on, obviously no seats but surprisingly, no standing room either. Tram driver didn't think so and started screaming MOVE UP MOVE UP. She wasn't the most pleasant person I've ever come across. So, the rickety old box took off. People were barging into you, the whole think stank of BO and the train driver kept screaming. It was basically a large coffin on wheels. With a worse stench. Avoid and get an uber.

title: Terrible.
text: The wait was 2 hours 40 minutes. No one was managing the queue and locals jumped the queue. Some trams left with seats not filled. What a waste of a day!

title: Bad experience definitely not worth it
text:
Absolutely not worth it: unfortunately we didn't read the reviews first (serious mistake) and on 13 August 2023 at 12.10 we queued to get on tram 28 (arrived by setting Google map). The queue seemed "short" since it was no more than 150m. We only managed to get on at 2.35pm mistakenly believing that it was a sort of "round trip" but instead after a few hundred meters it makes a stop where NO ONE WAS THERE so if we had walked perhaps 300 meters we would have got on without queuing (obviously we wouldn't have sat down) and we would have avoided more than two hours of queuing.
The tour is very long (50/55 minutes) and does not go back but lets you get off at the opposite terminus where, if you want to return to the departure point you obviously have to go through the queue all over again and another 55 minutes.
Total? 4 and a half hours of time thrown in the garbage...
Avoid it or take it along the way (there are many stops and all without queues) to be able to say "I got on tram 28" but nothing more.

title: More than Terrible.
text: Three-hour wait, chaotic route, I had very high expectations and it was a total disappointment.

title: Honte au tram 24..
text:
Je d√©conseille fortement le tram 24.
La personne aux commandes du tram 24 s‚Äôest arr√™t√© pou ne laisser qu‚Äôentrer une pr√©sentatrice t√©l√©, et est ensuite parti, nous avons d√ª attendre 50 minutes suppl√©mentaires assoiff√©s.

title: Presset af mennesker og voldsom k√∏rsel
text: Det var meget sammenpresset som man sad og stod i team 28 og s√• er det meget forvirrende hvor de k√∏rer hen og ikke k√∏rer hen s√• det smart at sp√∏rge flere forskellige da de ikke alle siger rigtigt.

title: Sopravvalutato
text:
Viaggio da dimenticare tra strattoni, malviventi e aria irrespirabile. La vista √® praticamente nulla e le persone ‚Äúnormali‚Äù si innervosiscono.
Meglio visto da fuori per il design vintage.
Fate altro se potete.

title: Didn't work for us....
text: We went there but didn't have a ride, two reasons: nobody to give info only the people on line, and in a very sunny day it was really annoying to wit such a long line in the sun just to get on the tram for the adventure of it but not really for the info that the ride will give coz we did almost the same by foot. For those who brought the all in cards, still have to stand in line..... long line

title: Waste of time!
text: Waste of time. We‚Äôve been waiting in line at the first stop for one hour and 20 minutes! It was over crowded and we couldn't see anything because people were standing. Better take the metro to get to city center.
