title: Nul, horrible exp√©rience !
text: Si j'avais pris la peine de regarder les avis (comme j'ai l'habitude de le faire pour beaucoup d'activit√©s), je n'y serais jamais mont√©e dans ce tram 28 ! Nous avions visit√© la ville √† pied les jours pr√©c√©dents, mais pour notre dernier jour, nous avions d√©cid√© de faire un tour √† bord de ce tram soit disant mythique. Mais, apr√®s 50 min. d'attente, visiblement cela arrive tr√®s r√©guli√®rement, nous avons r√©ussi √† monter dans un tram avec mon fils de 15 ans. Puis juste avant qu'il ne d√©marre, une locale √¢g√©e nous a litt√©ralement aboy√© dessus en portugais. J'ai alors bien compris qu'elle souhaitais s'asseoir, mais au vu de sa gentillesse, je n'ai pas agit imm√©diatement. Cependant, j'ai tout de m√™me demand√© √† mon fils de se lev√© et de s'asseoir sur me genoux pour lui √©viter de rester debout. Elle a malgr√© tout continu√© √† nous crier dessus et √† postillonn√© en plein sur mon fils par la m√™me occasion. Bref, malgr√© le fait que nous avions lib√©r√© une place, elle n'√©tait pas contente et me poussait avec ses fesses pour que je d√©gage ! N'importe quoi ! Je comprends bien que c'est un transport pour les locaux, mais l√†, on s'et fait agresser d'une mani√®re assez incroyable. Franchement, j'ai pas mal voyag√© dans passablement de pays, mais je dois dire que je n'ai jamais vu autant de m√©pris. Mais cela aurait pu √™tre encore une bien pire exp√©rience au vu des nombreux commentaires de personne s'√©tant fait voler par des pick pockets ! et les conducteurs de ces trams ne sont visiblement gu√®re tr√®s agr√©ables.Nous sommes descendu apr√®s quelques arr√™ts car de plus en plus de monde montait et on y voyait rien. En gros, ne grimpez pas √† bord de ce tram. J'ai vu qu'il y a des trams rouges pour le touristes. C'est plus cher mais j'imagine que l'exp√©rience y est plus agr√©able.

title: Three hour wait in the hot sun.
text: While the ride is neat, the trams only run every 30-45 minutes, not the 9-12 claimed on the various websites. So with 4 Tram cars sitting there none would take on passengers until 30-45 minutes had passed. This made the line to get on three hours.

title: Don't bother
text: Honestly, I‚Äôd recommend booking an actual tram tour rather than trying to use this tram. We arrived 10:15am on a Monday and queued for 90mins to get on. However, we drove past it at 5pm and no queue, so perhaps try then! You can‚Äôt really see the sights if you‚Äôre stood up anyway.

title: Skip the experience
text: Fell for the advertisement online and went twice to the starting point of this tram. We finally managed to take it but were sadly disappointed. It is crammed, not worth while and strongly overrated. Also it stopped halfway and had is all descend.

title: No recomwndabel
text:
La mayor parte del tiempo va a tope, tiene muy pocos asientos, si te quedas de pie no ves nada, muy inc√≥modo, donde los carteristas y otro tipo de aprovechados, sin ninguna tipo de verg√ºenza, hacen su agosto.
No lo recomiendo, menos con ni√±os.
Mejor coger los autobuses de city tour.

title: Waste of valuable sightseeing time.
text:
Having read how this was a very popular tourist attraction, we agreed to queue, for over an hour!
And like buses, none came along, then 3 at once! Began to realise that the ‚Äúiconic‚Äù number 28 tram was more of a public service tram, with many pick up stops along the way - than a special experience. It took quite a boring, non descript route that seemed to take forever! Uncomfortable too! There was no information given at all about the route, or which stop we were approaching. And then we were all told to get off at Prazeres (ie the terminus - that we weren‚Äôt told about ) and had to queue again to get on another tram for the return journey along exactly the same route. Needless to say, we got off at at the first stop en route back! Couldn‚Äôt go through that unpleasant experience again!

title: Tranv√≠a 28 de Lisboa una desilusi√≥n
text: La ilusi√≥n de tomarse un tranv√≠a en Lisboa else me fue enseguida . A pesar de haber pagado el pase de 24 hs la disponibilidad de los mismos es casi nula . Hay colas de hasta 100 metros, mas de 1 hora esperando . Y cuando llegas a tu turno la mala educaci√≥n de los choferes es espantosa , te destratam . Vayan directo al Uber que ahorran dinero y tiempo

title: Servizio pessimo.
text:
Peccato non poter dare meno di una stella.
Il tram viene dal passato e la sua organizzazione l√¨ √® rimasta. Un servizio pubblico che non accetta carte/bancomat e che di fronte a un foglio da 50‚Ç¨ sostiene di non poter fare il resto a banconote di taglio superiore a 20‚Ç¨. L‚Äôazienda che gestisce il servizio ha trovato la gallina dalle uova d‚Äôoro ma come sempre in certi casi mi sentirei di consigliare cautela: al pollo ingordo scoppi√≤ il gozzo. Pessimi, arroganti e sopravvalutati.

title: Waste of time
text: Don‚Äôt waste your time or money. Not much to see on the jam packed tram. Were made to leave the tram at the half way round trip and pay again to board another tram 28 for the second half of the round trip.

title: Tourist trap, don‚Äôt do it
text: Don‚Äôt do it. You stand in line for over an hour to catch a tram that gets loaded up to the rafters, you see nothing from the loaded tram, no commentary or advice from the drivers who are extremely rude. They thrown you off at the end of the line in the middle of nowhere and then you have to pay again to go back to town. TOURIST TRAP‚Ä¶.

title: Delusione
text:
Domenica 15 dopo 1 ora abbondante di coda, veniamo a sapere da altri turisti in coda che quel giorno il tram non avrebbe iniziato il servizio fino alle 13. I turisti in coda dalla mattina non erano stati informati del disservizio.
Il giorno dopo, di nuovo un'abbondante ora e mezza di coda. Finalmente saliamo. Al quartiere Graca di ferma e fa scendere tutti dicendo che pi√π avanti c'era un camion ribaltato e non poteva proseguire. Andiamo a piedi, e del camion non troviamo traccia. Ripassando ore dopo alla stessa fermata, ci siamo resi conto che stavano ancora facendo scendere i turisti senza completare il giro.

title: Not worth waiting for
text: Waited almost an hour. Line up overwhelming. Not worth the wait. Took a private tuk instead and saw the same areas.

title: A faire mais sans plus
text: Prendre le tram au point de d√©part pour √™tre assis, donc arriver pour 9h, tarif 3e. Trajet de 40mn, au fil des arr√™ts, il est blind√© et on ne voit rien...

title: Veel te lang wachten
text: We hebben ruim twee uur gewacht totdat we in een tram 28 konden. Het wordt gepresenteerd als een highlight maar met jonge kinderen is dit geen aanrader.

title: Avoid at all costs.
text:
An hour and a half queue to experience being a human sardine in a little tram jam packed with tourists all rubbing up against each other.

The only view is of other tourists.

This may have been good 20 years ago, but avoid at all costs these days.

title: My Visit
text: The queue just simply scared me away. I just took a photo of the tram, and it is it. I hope they have a skip-the-line ticket.

title: Œ•œÄŒµœÅœÑŒπŒºŒ∑ŒºŒ≠ŒΩŒø œÄŒøŒªœç
text:
ŒöŒ±ŒΩŒ≠ŒΩŒ±œÇ œÉŒµŒ≤Œ±œÉŒºœåœÇ Œ±œÄœå œÑŒ∑ŒΩ ŒµœÑŒ±ŒπœÅŒµŒØŒ± Œ¥ŒπŒ±œáŒµŒØœÅŒπœÉŒ∑œÇ œÄœÅŒøœÇ œÑŒøœÖœÇ œÑŒ±ŒæŒπŒ¥ŒπœéœÑŒµœÇ !
Œ†ŒµœÅŒπŒºŒ≠ŒΩŒ±ŒºŒµ 3 œéœÅŒµœÇ Œ≥ŒπŒ± ŒΩŒ± ŒºœÄŒøœçŒºŒµ Œ∫Œ±Œπ Œ±œÖœÑœå œÑŒø ŒªŒµœÇ Œ¨ŒΩŒµœÑŒ± ŒºŒπŒ± œÑŒµœÅŒ¨œÉœÑŒπŒ± œÑŒ±ŒªŒ±ŒπœÄœâœÅŒØŒ±‚Ä¶
Œó Œ≤œåŒªœÑŒ± œåœáŒπ Œ∫Œ¨œÑŒπ œÑŒø ŒπŒ¥ŒπŒ±ŒØœÑŒµœÅŒø !

title: On your head !
text: If there is competition for the worst tourist activity/attraction then this is a contender. Lengthy wait of over 1.5 hours for an uncomfortable and unscenic ride in an old tram through back streets. Then you are dumped off and have to wait for a return tram which may or may not take you where you want to go.

title: Horrible ! √Ä √©viter
text:
Tr√®s mauvaise exp√©rience avec le tram 28 puisqu'apr√®s s'√™tre lev√©s t√¥t pour y arriver d√®s 8h10, avoir retir√© expr√®s du cash puis fait la queue avec un petit bout de 2 ans, on nous a refus√© l'acc√®s au tramway car nous n'avions pas de petite monnaie pour payer les tickets.

Nous n'avons pas eu le courage de chercher un commerce pour faire la monnaie (peu sont ouverts √† cette heure ci) puis refaire la queue qui depuis √©tait devenue cons√©quente (1h au moins pass√© 8h30).

Une matin√©e de flingu√©e, et une grosse d√©ception pour un petit bout de 2 ans

title: avoid at all costs
text: This is a real rip off and thoroughly unpleasant experience. This tram takes you to a far off suburb of Lisbon and you have to buy another ticket to return to the centre. You're crammed into the tram with the worst kind of tourist and you can't actually see anything unless you are able to hang your head out of the window. I got physically assulted by a fat German Hausfrau who wanted a better seat even though I didn't have one. There are better ways to experience the city.

title: Not worth the time
text: Not a sightseeing opportunity. It's just a commuting line that's super busy. If it's helping you get somewhere, great. Otherwise, you won't see much as you wiz by, even if you're lucky enough to get a window seat and not stand. Take a picture of one, sure. But riding one is something you can avoid and not miss a thing.

title: Tempo perso
text: Le guide parlano del tram 28 come esperienza irrinunciabile. Grandissima ca..ta! Lunghe file per accedervi per poi ritrovarsi in mezzo alla calca. La visuale √® ridotta, quasi nulla. Se proprio volete provare l'esperienza, cercate qualche fermata pi√π in la del capolinea, eviterete lunghe attese inutili.

title: Se volete perder tempo ‚Ä¶da evitare!!!
text: Andate alle 8 del mattino al capolinea, se proprio ci tenete a salire sul tram 28, altrimenti preparatevi a fare almeno un ora di coda, con persone maleducate che cercano di passarti davanti ( nel mio caso 2 turiste francesi alle quali ho rivolto paroline dolci e affettuose‚Ä¶) per fare un ‚Äòesperienza a mio avviso poco interessante, a parte qualche curva dove sembra di urtare i muri delle case e un paio di discese stile montagne russe! Molto meglio gustarsi la citt√† a piedi sia in salita che in discesa! SCONSIGLIATO come l‚Äôelevador di Santa Justa!!!!

title: Non ne vale la pena
text: 1h30‚Äô di fila per fare un giro che a piedi avevamo fatto in meno di 2 ore molto pi√π affascinante fermandosi in ogni posto tipico. Il tram a mala pena li vede da lontano, rallentato dal traffico. A conti fatti 3 ore perse. Salite alle fermate intermedie che anche se starete in piedi almeno non fate la fila

title: Delusione
text: √à solo tempo perso, non aggiunge nulla alla bellissima citt√† di Lisbona, solo una delusione. Porta via tre/quattro ore al tuo viaggio e se poi sei all'impiedi non vedi assolutamente nulla. Fortemente sconsigliato.

title: Only worthy his you love to queue
text:
We were in line for more than an hour even though the line was barely 20 meters.
One tram departed every 30 min. If you don't like to queue this is not a great attraction.

title: Lang wachten op eigenlijk niks
text:
Overgewaardeerd.. Lang lang lang wachten, rijdt vervolgens aantal haltes waarna je eruit moet. Terugweg maar gaan lopen, geen zin om weer anderhalf uur te moeten wachten.
Jammer.

title: Tram 28....... niente di che!
text: Parto col dire che Lisbona √® meravigliosa e assolutamente da visitare! Una delle attrazioni pi√π decantate e consigliate era appunto il giro sul 28, e finalmente dopo diverse volte che siamo passati davanti (vedendo code lunghissime al capolinea) decidiamo di fermarci, attratti dal fatto che le persone in coda erano veramente poche! Ma a tutto c'√® una spiegazione.... un incidente d'auto poco dopo non faceva passare il tram sui binari, ma decidiamo comunque di fermarci visto che avevamo guadagnato un ottimo posto nella fila. Dopo circa 50 minuti sotto il sole partiamo e riusciamo a sederci. Le fermate dopo erano strapiene (ovviamente, era diverso tempo che il tram non passava per via dell'incidente) l'autista continuava comunque a far salire persone e chiaramente, quando si avvicina un anziano, non si pu√≤ fare altro che cedergli cordialmente il posto. Risultato? Dopo quasi 1 ora di attesta, tram strapieno, in piedi e senza vedere neanche la bellissima Lisbona che c'era fuori. Io consiglio banalmente di visitarla a piedi, cosa che noi abbiamo fatto macinando chilometri in 4 giorni. Oppure per raggiungere determinati posti utilizzare la metro che √® comodissima, puntuale e ovviamente veloce! Come anche i tram e i pullman. Questa √® l'unica esperienza, che anche se caratteristica, non ripeterei a Lisbona.

title: Nulla di che
text:
√à un tram, semplicemente.
Ci hanno decantato molto questa attrazione come assolutamente da fare, probabilmente ci hanno alzato talmente tanto l'hype che ci aspettavamo tantissimo.
Ovviamente da prendere al capolinea perch√© se no non ti siedi manco a morire. Al capolinea coda molto lunga per√≤ abbastanza veloce tutto sommato. Devo dire che non ne vale molto la pena... Sono rimasta molto delusa, sinceramente.

title: Not worth the wait
text: I had an unlimited transit card and a little spare time my last evening in Lisbon so I decided to see what the hype was about. The line was extremely long. I was at the first stop so the line moved in bursts when an empty tram arrived, but there were long wait times in between. Tram 12 also loads at the same stop so once it started to rain I decided to hop on that instead. I was able to skip most of the queu and even get a seat on the tram. It was night time and raining so I couldn't see much out the windows. This may be a fun, unique experience if you've never ridden a tram car before, but otherwise it pretty much just seems like a really long line to ride public transit. I didn't end up making the whole loop and instead jumped off when the tram stopped near my lodging.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time
text: Long queues and wouldn‚Äôt recommend. The main sights are in the city centre and within walking distance. I would not waste your time doing this.

title: Storia ma da evitare...
text: Storico e molto discusso.. Tram 28 preso d'assalto da i turisti a ogni ora e in ogni modo!!Sicuramente attraversa part6e storica della citt√† e arriva in posti dove dovresti andare a piedi... ma ormai √® diventato impossibile!!Meglio magari vederlo passare e vedere la gente compressa all'interno.. meglio stare con i piedi a terra tranquilli e godere di questa bellissima citt√†

title: Please dont waste your time not worth it .. queue is too long .. Lisbon should have tram wait time information
text: Queue is very long over 90 minutes, one tram 28 just sat there doing nothing for ages then reversed away ! Then you have the rude people skipping the queue from the top thinking others won't notice. Driver kicked everyone out early at Graca. There is no information at the stop on the expected wait time. Lisbon is supposed to me a high tech city, seems like a simple thing to do..

title: Esperienza sopravvalutata
text: Sicuramente tutto il favoleggiare sul tram 28 e‚Äô molto esagerato. Il tempo di attesa per prenderlo non √® giustificato. Bello solo un piccolo tratto e vi consiglio di fare solo la parte che dalla cattedrale porta al castello.

title: Assolutamente sconsigliato,molto decantato ma la realt√† √® diversa
text: Esperienza pessima:tram preso davanti al caff√® ‚Äúa brasileira‚Äùdopo aver speso 3 euro a testa ci fanno scendere solo dopo tre fermate per poi riprenderne un altro e spendere ulteriori 3euro a testa ma la cosa che pi√π ci ha sconvolto √® stata la scortesia √® la maleducazione del conducente il quale ha trattato tutti i passeggeri come bestie da trasporto chiedendo in maniera prepotente di scendere ‚Ä¶mai pi√π neanche se mi pagassero

title: Not worth the wait
text: After queuing for almost 3 hours in the baking sun, this was a disappointing experience. The tram was so packed that you can't really see much, it was difficult to take any photos without someone's arm in the way and the tram was quite fast so you can't really enjoy the sites.

title: Tram 28 ci lascia a piedi!
text:
Purtroppo abbiamo cercato pi√π volte di prendere il tram 28 senza mai ottenere buoni risultati, abbiamo atteso fino a 40/5 minuti per poi vederci passare davanti il tram pieno di gente senza neanche fermasi.
Dopo vari giorni che cercavamo di salire ci siamo riusciti ma eravamo tutti attaccati che quasi non si respirava.
Esperienza bocciata!

title: Una perdita di tempo
text: Ho gi√† detto tutto nel titolo. Un sacco di gente tipo sardine in scatola e da vedere non c‚Äô√® poi cos√¨ tanto. Se avete poco tempo a disposizione evitare questo giro

title: Esperienza terrificante
text:
Abbiamo fatto due ore di fila alla fermata ‚ÄúMartin Moniz‚Äù per poi ritrovarci stipati come sardine senza riuscire a vedere i luoghi di passaggio della linea.
Siamo scesi subito.
√à meglio andare a piedi al Castello (la salita √® meno ripida) e vedere il quartiere a piedi!

title: Bad service
text:
Bad service, insecurity, irresponsibility, failures in schedules, to avoid to the maximum.
Very old boats, lack of safety, total non-compliance with schedules underestimating passengers

title: Hand working
text: Another day and I'm not following the schedule, namely the 7:45am service. It left 4 minutes later, which forced me to miss the next transport in Lisbon.

title: Career Supplies
text: It is unacceptable that there are disruptions and interruptions in careers every day. The aging fleet, outdated, damaged doors, toilets, bar, TV's, wifi, everything out of service.

title: Unclean and underwhelming
text: Sadly, this cooking class did not meet our expectations. We knew it would be different in someone's home vs. a commercial kitchen (something we were looking forward to). Unfortunately, it was unsanitary, including a litter box a few feet away that was used during our class. The cooking for the main dish was basic, mostly involving chopping, making a rue and tossing in frozen ingredients. We did not make a starter dish. The recipe for the Pasteis de Nata had been altered to be less sweet and non-traditional. We had hoped for more authentic portugese cooking. Despite the positive reviews online we left feeling disappointed.

title: Terrible tour operator. Did not show up or give appropriate information on how to find the operator on site
text: I booked a tasting tour with this operator in December. I showed up a few hours early and was waiting around the area ahead in anticipation of this event. They only gave information in the reservation to look for an operator with an orange umbrella at a very busy square with no other information on name/gender/who to look for how/where exactly to look for an operator/what sign (other than that stupid orange umbrella to look for). When it was time of the tour, I looked and did not find any operator with an orange umbrella, and missed the tour. I let them know to refund me and disputed the credit card, but they refused to refund me. BEWARE! Take notice of this terrible operator. I did other tours in Berlin with other operators and many other places and this is a terrible one that I would absolutely not recommend.

title: Skip it
text:
It is an over priced tour that can not be justified. You can eat good local food with a better experience and far cheap in any of the small local restaurants in Lisboa.

For Bifana -& chouri√ßo checkout Cervejaria O Trevo
For sardines and bachalau - Lisboa Tu & Eu

You can get local cheese and local wine at any place

Pastel - de - nata can be found every where and it is much fun to eat it in a cafe / bakery instead of eating it in a gift shop like we did.

title: Disappointing Experience ‚Äì Not Worth the Price
text:
We were really looking forward to the Lisbon Small-Group Food Tour with 18 Tastings in the Alfama District, but unfortunately, it fell far short of expectations. While the guide was very friendly and engaging, the food itself was quite underwhelming for the price they charge.

The sardine tasting was nothing more than a canned slice, the sausage offering was extremely ordinary, and the bifana sandwich was below average. For a tour that markets itself as a way to experience authentic local flavors, the food felt uninspired and lacked the quality we were hoping for.

Thankfully, we had a travel guide earlier in our trip who introduced us to truly authentic local cuisine‚Äîbetter quality and often at a fraction of the cost. In hindsight, those recommendations outshined anything on this tour by a long shot.

While the guide‚Äôs warmth and enthusiasm were appreciated, they couldn‚Äôt make up for the lackluster food experience. Unfortunately, we would not recommend this tour, especially given the many other excellent and more affordable food options available in Lisbon.

title: Worst RipOff Food Tour Ever
text:
Worst food tour ever. The guide took us to 5 different cheap restaurants with no AC, where we were offered ridiculous small and poor quality tastings to be accompanied with room temperature tap water and one or two (maximum) glasses of wine. The whole deceiving experience ended up in a gift shop trap where we were 'honored' with a tiny chocolate made cup of ginjinha, apparently home made but coming from a commercial bottle kept in a small fridge on a corner of the souvenir shop.
Knowing Lisbon pretty well, it' was painful to our pockets and extremely disappointing to our expectations. We have done a food tour recently for half price and the guide was well experienced. He introduced us to restaurants with either character or some history behind . A total pleasure that made us choose a more expensive tour this time expecting to get even more and better.
We highly recommend NOT TO CHOOSE this food tour.

title: Canceled our reservation twice without warning. Now our backups are sold out. Very frustrating.
text: We booked this tour because it sounded amazing, only to have them cancel a week later saying it was overbooked! We booked again for a different date a week apart, only to have them cancel AGAIN a few days later! Now our backup options are already booked, and we are stuck finding alternative activities. Very disappointing! Book, but not with confidence. Or, choose a tour that will honor your reservation to begin with so you don't miss out.

title: Disappointing
text:
Sadly, it did not meet our expectations. They were aware that I am a pescatarian from the questionnaire we submitted when reserving the tour. When I asked for a substitution to the meat samples I was made to feel was a nuisance and was given a cold fish cake. It was uncomfortable and unnecessary to be treated this way and disappointing for the cost of $95. per person.
I would not recommend this tour.

title: Last minute cancellation with poor excuse
text: They cancelled on us 10 minutes before the tour was due to start. I booked the tour through Viator over 30 days prior and received a confirmation email that the payment had processed and received the electronic tickets 24 hrs before, so I felt pretty good about this happening! We got to the pick up location and after waiting around for 15 minutes I started checking my phone to see if I had received any messages. They had sent a cancellation email 10 minutes before. In fairness, I later discovered an email from 3 hours before (buried among numerous work emails) with a poor excuse that their vehicle had broken down and needed to go into the shop (what sort of vehicle were they using anyway?). Why they couldn't have texted or called as they had my phone number...I don't know about you, but I am not checking my emails frequently while on vacation! I thought that it was pretty poor that they couldn't beg or borrow another vehicle if they really had a guide ready to go...I am giving them 2 stars only because the guy at the end of the phone seemed empathetic if nothing else.

title: Skip the tour‚Ä¶do the castle on your own
text: Our guide was a no show. I called the tour operator and they had no record of my booking even though I had a printout of the charge to my credit card. Terrible company

title: No way of contact
text:
It was raining too much in Lisbon, so I delayed for a few minutes and when I arrived, no one was there.
My disagreement is that on the only phone number they give they never answered, nor did they communicate with me by any means, in case there was any option that came by another means and reach them.
Communication after purchase is not good, it does not exist, compared to other tourism companies.

title: Pena - never when it rains!
text:
We were unfortunate to visit Pena Palace on a cold, rainy day. It was nobody's fault, however reception could have been better than the weather. After having bought our tickets using a vending machine at the entrance we have walked for some time uphill in the rain, as the courtesy bus shut it's door in front of our noses.Our entry time was scheduled in one hour. We had to queue inside of a tunnel leading to Pena Palace. We were asked by staff to move on outside and the queue was not moving for another 15 minutes while the rain was pouring on us. Why couldn't we wait in thetunnel and be asked towards the entrance in time to get in?
The staff were not trained neither instructed and frankly rude. This treatment has ruined our visit to a quite spectacular interior of the Palace.

title: SCAM!!!
text: INADMISSIBLE!! Contrary to what is stated in the title, we did not visit Pena Palace. Already, the ticket is not included in the excursion (what interest for a guided tour??), so we paid extra 10‚Ç¨/pers to the guide on arrival and what was not our surprise when the guide told us in front of the Palace that we could not enter and that we had access only to the gardens!!! Moreover, we spent hours on the bus to finally have only 30min to the palace. Big SCAM; A FUIR!!

title: FALSE ADVERTISING!!
text:
INADMISSIBLE!! We had booked this guided tour which included that of the Palace of Pena, as stipulated in the title, at the price of 72‚Ç¨/person.
What was not our surprise when the guide asked us again 10‚Ç¨/person to access the site, when in the end we could not enter the said palace (only in the garden). BIG SCAM; TO FLEE!!

title: DO NOT USE HEAD OUT TOUR OPERATOR
text: I booked my ticket VIA Head out: time slot was incorrect, false advertising since there is not such as Skipping the line and ticket were doubled the price at the venue.DO NOT USE THIS TOUR OPERATOR!The location are great and worth it

title: They don't warn of changes
text:
Reservation: Sintra, Palacio da Pena, Quinta da Regaleira and Cabo da Roca.
This activity was booked with Civitatis for 20 days, and was completely modified due to the risk of fire. However, this notice was already received by the Portuguese government a long time ago, so they should have warned us to cancel this activity, since the palaces we visited (Queluz Palace and Sintra National Palace) were not of interest to us nor was it what we had reserved in the beginning.
After arriving at the meeting point after a great early morning we were informed there that the Palaces of Pena and Quinta da Regaleira cannot be visited. Our reason for making this trip was EXCLUSIVELY to visit both Palaces. These companies were already aware of the fire risk and should have advised of this.
Moreover, the coach we were travelling in was not suitable for a day with more than 30 degrees: the air came out hot and was all glass, like a greenhouse. Tickets to these palaces are cheaper than the ones we had hired, and were very crowded due to the influx of people during the visit.

title: I wouldn't recommend it.
text: Poorly organized in terms of timing and language. We had a bilingual group so those of us who knew English had to listen to the explanations twice. In English it was better understood than in Spanish and we were not given too many explanations or historical details. Plus there was no time to watch Sintra quietly. A nice Guide but not well organized

title: Do not book with this company
text:
Do not book with this company!!
Today I have had a deeply disappointing experience with GetYourGuide that left me both frustrated and out of pocket. I booked tickets for several attractions in Sintra through their platform, but unfortunately, I sprained my ankle and was unable to make the ticket times.

When I reached out to GetYourGuide to explain my situation and request a refund, I was met with a shocking lack of empathy and flexibility. Despite providing evidence of my injury, their customer service was utterly unhelpful and refused to offer any form of compensation.

This company‚Äôs rigid policies and poor customer service have turned what was already a distressing situation into a complete nightmare. It's appalling that GetYourGuide prioritizes their profits over genuine customer care, especially in situations that are clearly beyond the customer's control.

I strongly advise against using GetYourGuide for any bookings. There are plenty of other companies that offer better customer service and show more understanding and flexibility towards their customers. Save yourself the hassle and avoid GetYourGuide at all costs.

---

title: TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE
text:
Bait and switch. Terrible UNFRIENDLY tour guide.

1) This tour was terrible because the first stop was a beach town at 9 AM for ice cream where most businesses were closed. This was opposite of this published schedule. I asked myself, why are we even here?

2) The tour guide, Leonor was more interested in chatting with the bus driver rather than engaging with a tourists on the bus. She seemed almost irritated that someone could ‚Äúbother‚Äù her with a question. I‚Äôve been on TripAdvisor tours in other countries, which have been fantastic. This tour doesn‚Äôt measure up.

3) This tour consist of mostly pick ups and drop offs. With the exception of the palace tickets, this is something you could achieve with an Uber.

4) This tour is mostly UNGUIDED ‚Äì NOT AS ADVERTISED: here‚Äôs what they wrote: ‚ÄúOur guide shall accompany you along the way, sharing stories and curiosities about the visited and seeing places.‚Äù THIS IS NOT THE CASE except for drop offs and pick ups.

With the exception of the palace tickets, this tour was a waste of money and a terrible experience.

title: Do NOT book this tour.
text:
I would NOT recommend this tour. It's "BAIT AND SWITCH."

1) They switched the schedule. First stop (Cascais) was supposed to be the LAST afternoon stop. As a result, we were dropped off at 9:00 AM for ice cream in a beach town where most business were closed. I asked myself, "why are we even here?"

2) The tour guide, Leonor F. was more interested in chatting with the bus driver as we passed beautiful sites. She gave us minimal info as we entered town. She made almost LITTLE / NO EFFORT to engage with the tourists on the bus. Leonor seem irritated that a tourist would bother her with questions. I've been on other tours in other countries, and she was the absolute worse!

3) The entire "tour" consisted of Leonor doing mostly drop-off and pick-up. She was a terrible tour guide and did not "accompany anyone along the (entire) way, sharing stories and curiosities about the visited (and seen) places."

I would NOT book a tour with this company again. Low quality tour guide and bait and switch schedule. I might as well have taken an Uber. Except for the included palace tickets, this was a waste of money.

title: Unhappy
text: The tour operator cancelled our trip close to the day (saying it was overbooked) and, when we tried to book for next day, found that the cost had doubled.

title: A TOTAL SCAM
text: AN ABSOLUTE SCAM. 2 hours before the visit they tell us that there is no guide in Spanish, that the visit will be in English and Portuguese without giving us the option of refunding the money, changing the day/time...nothing. Even so, we are going so as not to lose the money we had paid. The guide who was there did not even have the flag color agreed upon in the messages. It started more than half an hour late, which later did not increase during the visit. The language didn't matter because the guide DIDN'T SPEAK FOR MORE THAN 5 MINUTES, he didn't explain ANYTHING, amazing, something truly unheard of, he took us from one place to another without explaining anything, a shame, a scam, a scam. The feeling of feeling cheated was tremendous. I hope that no one contracts with this company as there are so many others like we saw there that are cheaper and have real guides that explained the Quinta. He didn't give us a single piece of information, no dates, nothing at all... incredible. A disastrous experience that I hope no one else has to endure.

title: Very poor explanation
text: The place is beautiful and worth visiting, but our guide did not make it an enriching experience. He didn't introduce us to anything about the place, he didn't explain who the Masons were or link one thing to another. Furthermore, what it says in the tour description is not what is actually told. Much lack of detail and explanation. In the end we learned more from what we later searched on the internet than what the boy told us. You don't see everything there is there, and you are left with many areas unexplored. IT DOES NOT COST THE PRICE THAT THE GUIDED TOUR PRICES FOR WHAT IT IS, VERY EXPENSIVE FOR WHAT THEY GIVE YOU AFTER.

title: Do Not Book
text: This tour was so disorganized. The tour guide started off by saying our tour did not include tickets to Pena Palace, so we had to give the tour guide money for tickets if we wanted to go. When I said we didn't have enough cash on hand, he suggested we go to an ATM (pulling out money abroad incurs transaction fees...) When I said we'd prefer to buy tickets online instead, he made it seem like that was a difficult and undesirable thing to do (it wasn't). I wish we had been reminded in advance to buy entry tickets for a certain time so we wouldn't have been scrambling the morning of the tour (with no Wifi available) to buy tickets. Then, we were dropped off in downtown Sintra to "get coffee." By the time we finally went to Regaleira, there was already a huge line to go down the staircase. We should have lined up early at Regaleira instead. Furthermore, the guide told us he was not able to enter certain places with us and give a tour...so I'm not really sure why we had a guide to begin with. Apparently just to get us from point A to point B. At Pena Palace, he told us to "take pictures of things and ask questions later...." Finally, the tour guide and driver were talking about inappropriate and unprofessional things in Portuguese (my husband is a native Portuguese speaker). Overall I would not recommend this tour to others. It was overpriced for the services rendered.

title: Tour operator bails last minute
text:
Tour operator cancelled trip 16 hours before it was to happen middle of day before due to me being only one that booked.
They had my money since July and due to them cancelling trip cost me $45 more to rebook yet they get no punishment but th customer does.

Fair to see why customer should pay the price for vendor failure to get business.

Will never us them again

title: Over tourism spoiling it
text:
My wife and I went late October to hopefully miss the summer crowds. It was not the case. We were told by a few different friends this is a must see. So we went on our way from Lisbon to nazare. Biggest mistake ever. The crowds were insane, took us 3 hours to heard through, like sheep, 3 hours that should have taken 30 minutes. Over tourism plain and simple. A joke. No wonder Europeans are getting g fed up with it.
I do not recommend going

title: The worst place in Portugal
text: Imagine shopping for deals on Black Fridays in the 90s, only completely disorganised and with zero regards for you. Bullied left and right, charged for transport that doesn‚Äôt come, lines 100s of metres long for a minibus that transport 20 people at a time, but if you don‚Äôt get there on time you are denied entrance. Place is full to the brim, they just want to rake as much cash as possible. Do yourself a favour and skip it. There‚Äôs way better in Portugal

title: Bad information
text:
The place is spectacular, the shame is the poor indication and little information there is and the unfriendly staff.

Firstly, if you buy the ticket at a machine, you have no information about whether or not you can enter. There are some booths with staff that you don't even see when you arrive, because the first thing there where the transportation drops you off are the ticket machines.
The problem with buying the ticket at a machine is that it does not give you any information.

They made us wait for an hour outside the enclosure, which you think may be the entrance to the palace, so you wait outside when the time arrives, but it is not like that. When we arrived at the palace it was past our hour and they did not let us pass. When going to the ticket information, we had to wait because there was no staff because they had an hour break for lunch (in such a touristy place that there is no staff rotation is outrageous). The queue demanding the same thing as us was considerable but unfortunately the vast majority, if not all, accepted to wait 2 hours for the next entry, having to pay a supplement of ‚Ç¨6.50 after having paid your entry!

title: Amazing locations ruined by bad management of the groups
text: Even though we selected an english guide, we were placed in a primarily spanish group - even though there were plenty of other english-speaking participants. The guide spoke very bad english. We also realized that the guide provided much more info in spanish than in english, and of course we had a lot of idle time during the spanish parts.

title: Feeling cheated with a disappointing trip
text: The weather was horrible with a rain storm. My trip was supposed to be for the following day, but they changed it to the day before for whatever reason, with my consent. I would think that these bus companies would be very well informed of the weather. We traveled in a small mini van which made the trip uncomfortable for 8 people. First, we made a stop in Cascais from Lisbon to pick up a couple so half an hour went towards that. So it took us two hours to get to F√°tima. The guide Daniel was very nice, but didn‚Äôt seem to be too knowledgeable. For the entire two hours to get there, he did not say a word, until we got there, and I asked him to please enlighten us with information.. He left us at the place for 3 1/2 hours and then met up with us at the end. So we were on our own basically. It really wasn‚Äôt a ‚Äúguided‚Äù tour. There was a lot of stuff we didn‚Äôt get to see, but some of it had to do with the weather. If they wouldn‚Äôt have changed the date to the day before, it would have probably been a nicer trip of course. The guide dropped everyone off where they were picked up from. It was a rain storm, so I was expecting for the guide to at least drop us off in a taxi stand. We paid 170+ dollars to Tuga Tours and we feel cheated.

title: Sintra Experience
text:
Sintra faces mass tourism and the municipality does not know how to manage this influx of tourists. Complete disorganization to move between sites whether by car or public transport. The latter are very expensive, more than 4 euros/person, so more expensive than taking an Uber with the family. Plan very very widely to move from one site to another and cash because credit card cannot be used on buses‚Ä¶
The sites are beautiful but you are overwhelmed by the waves of tourists. For the price, the sites are not well maintained enough
.

title: Very unhappy with the guide
text:
Our guide was called Adri√°n F. The tour was very express, it gave very little historical context to understand the place. We feel as if he had read Wikipedia and told us. He only focused on explaining what can be seen with the naked eye and not even that because in one of the chapels, when explaining the exterior reliefs of one of the doors, he said: "Here there are reliefs from the Bible but since I have not read it I don't even have idea" which surprised us.

In general, the visit lasted very little, about an hour later, we were halfway done. We were also surprised that when he said goodbye he told us that he was leaving because we weren't going to want to listen to him talk for two hours, but it's just what we wanted and what we had paid for, we thought.

These are just some of the atrocities he said throughout the tour. In summary, we believe that it is a place that deserves a guided tour but for us specifically with this guide things have gone quite badly (with this we do not mean that the rest of the guides or the company are bad since we have only had this one experience, not We consider it sufficient to give an opinion on the matter).

title: Find another tour company.
text: Read the bad reviews and believe them! The reason to book a trip like this is to get the timed ticket for an inside tour at Pena Palace. Our tour guide, who has other bad reviews on this site, still leads this trip. He got us to Pena Palace more than 1/2 hour late so that we were denied entry. We also spent an hour at Cascais at 9 in the morning where there was nothing to do. He does not guide people around there, or really anyplace else and provides little to no historical information about places you do go. Other reviews mention a guide who advises people to get a gelatto at Cascais at 9 in the morning, and who talks when the bus driver has the radio on and has to be told you can't hear him, repeatedly. That person or other like him are still leading tours. This is nothing but glorified transportation between locations, and even that they could not do on time.

title: Bad experience. Not recommendable.
text: There were hardly any explanations from the guide. It only provided basic data that can be found on any simple web page. I do not recommend this company for the guided tour. There were other guides who explained much more and better. It would have been better and cheaper to take the audio guide.

title: Shame
text: Just before departure we were told that we were not allowed into Sintra (heat) and that they had an alternative plan. While it had been so hot for days... So they chose not to tell us. Afterwards I asked for part of the money back but no response.

title: Disappointed Experience with Tugatrips to Sintra, Cascias & Pena Palace
text:
The Tugatrips meeting point was very disorganized. Hard to know what was going on within a mob of over 500 people, and there was no signage or guidance from the staff.

Once we boarded our bus, the narrative from the tour guide was lame.

Upon arrival, we entered the castle as a group, and as instructed by the tour guide, we had to meet at a certain time at the exit of the castle. The time came, and no tour guide was in sight; she did not give us her number to contact her. We wasted one hour looking for her and finally called the company to locate her. This was very disappointing and unprofessional on the tour guide's part, and she had apparently lost the 22-person group.

At lunch in Sintra, the restaurants the tour guide gave us were not good.

Our time in Sintra and Cascais was rushed.

I do not recommend Tugatrips. Overall, bad experience and, unprofessional tour guide and for what we paid it would have been best to take the bus into Sintra and pay a local tour guide.

title: Horrible
text: VERY displeased with this tour. Organizing everyone into groups was very unorganaized. Hugo was not a good tour guide. He talked too much and gave too much information at once. He was not able to assist with getting Pe√±a Palace tickets. He then argued with me about it. He was also not considerate of others in our group with knee problems and made them climb stairs for no reason. He was not patient and blamed everything on the ‚Äúchaos‚Äù. The wait was over an hour to see the well at Quinta de Regaleira. Hugo just left us in line. It took over an hour to get to Pe√±a Palace. Then we had to wait on the 5 people whom did have tickets to the palace. Just was not a great experience at all. Very frustrating and a waste of my day. Would not recommend. 0/10.

title: Would not recommend Tugatrips
text:
Firstly, would like to say that none of this review is due to the tour guide Elder who should be proud of how he handled a tough day at work. He was a fantastic tour guide. However his company let him down
Was a very poorly organised by the company Tugatrips.
- Bus was over booked meaning there were not enough seats for everyone. This lead to people being removed from the tour and starting an hour late
- We were to catch a bus from the Moorish Castle to Pene Palace. However on the way to picking us up the bus broke down with no indication of how long a replacement would be.
- The ticket into Pene Palace was not included in the tour. However this was asked to be paid before leaving the bus at the end of the day in cash without warning. With most people carrying cash the Tugatrips boss asked poor Elder to make everyone go to the ATM to get cash out where this should have been compensated for the lateness of the tour. 8 hour tour turned into 12 hour tour

title: I paid a lot for sitting in a van and waiting in long lines!üò¢
text: Perhaps my expectations were too high. We let an hour late because there wasn't enough seats in the van for everyone. The tour guide couldn't get any support from his office and I felt bad for him. We waited in long lines at the first castle because we were late and only had 49 minutes at the last one because our van broke down on the way to drive us. I would not book with this company again.

title: Will not recommend
text: Tour operator needs to maintain scheduled time. Due to a delay in arrival to Pena Palace, the entire group was not allowed entry.

title: My trip was overbooked and I was told to get off the bus!
text:
Dear TripAdvisor agent,
I booked a trip to Sintra today through your website. However, when I arrived to the pickup place in the morning, I was told by the tour guide the trip was overbooked and that there was no place for me on the bus.
Therefore, you can imagine my disappointment with this vendor.

title: No guided tour - just expensive bus trip
text:
The trip was unfortunately a bit of a disappointment. We were unlucky that the sights in Sintra were closed due to the high risk of fire, so we did the alternative program. This wasn't really a problem for us - but it was for our guide.
First we looked at the Palace of Queluz. Beautiful grounds, but the organization on site didn't work at all. In other words, we waited for over half an hour in front of the entrance. We were supposed to download an app on our phones so that we could start the audio guide for the palace - but unfortunately this didn't work for anyone because of the high number of people. Our guide was unable to give us any information about the palace, so the trip was pretty pointless. She apologized to us several times and explained to us that she didn't know anything about the palace - because the palace in Sintra was her main concern. This annoyed me quite a bit, because a guide had to be prepared for the alternative tour too.

Lunch break in Sintra town was fine, organization and information from the guide was very scarce. Getting there takes forever and we sat in the bus for over an hour (traffic jam)

Then we went on to a lookout point. It was OK, nothing spectacular.

We ended up in Caiscais where we were dropped off again and picked up by the bus an hour later.

Overall, a bus tour without much information from the guide, which could have been done much more cheaply by train. A shame to spend money unnecessarily!

title: Terrible
text:
Scammers! Stay away

I booked this tour through Expedia, showed up at the meeting spot and no one was there. I called the tour company, no answer. I called Expedia and they confirmed the tour company canceled the tour and didn‚Äôt notify me. Then they REFUSED to refund me my money even after Expedia got involved . Stay as far away from them as possible.

title: TUGATRIPS is a SCAM
text: Do not use this company. It's a scam. I bought 4 tickets for a guided tour for Quinta Regadeaira. I got instructions on where to meet with the guide. I waited for 40 min with other people who also bought tickets from them. They claim I didn't show, but I have proof I was there on time. It's a shame because I'm sure these kinds of experiences will make people hesitant to visit a beautiful country like Portugal. DO NOT BUY FROM TUGATRIPS

title: Total scam.
text:
In the first place there has been no tasting of
Sweets. I booked a 3 hour tour for three
people: 72 euros that included a visit to Sintra.
Nobody told me that it was mandatory to get an entry
to Quinta da Regaleira (11 euros per person).
They picked us up next to the station giving a
walk through Sintra with few explanations.
We waited more than 30 minutes for them to arrive.
20 people who had hired for 25
Euros 1.5 hour guided tour with entrance
included. In the end my visit lasted 2 hours with
30 minutes of waiting, or almost the same as the
group that had paid 25. I paid 35
There were 3 of us, that is 105 for 1.5 hours. a stay,
No tasting. What would the guide have done?
If I had not wanted to get the ticket?
Where is the guided tour of Sintra?
Very disappointed.

title: Not recommended, just go for a freetour
text: Our guide only explained a few places while Quinta da Regaleira has a wide variety of places to visit, he didn't explain to us really important points: the palace, the church, the lake and many other, we had to visit all that places on our own. The quality of the explanations was very poor and short and, when asked about other places, the guide would told us that those places were not important, when that is simply not true. Also, we signed up for a tour in Spanish and it turned out that we were mixed with the tourist that had signed up for a tour in English so the guide would explain first in one language and the repeat the same thing in the other language so the short explanation turned out to be even shorter (half of the time, actually). Really bad experience, all the Spanish tourist were talking about this and we all felt dissapointed. I recommend signing up for a freetour rather than this.

title: Poorly organised tour to Sintra
text:
Poorly organised tour, bus was hot with warm air on, had no windows and driver tried selling us over priced water.
Tour operator failed to purchase tickets for the entire group to go inside Sintra castle and requested we pay cash. Left us waiting outside the castle for over an hour with no explanation

title: The guide was late with poor English
text: Our guide turned up half an hour late, none of the group received correspondence to let us know and the trout group were not responding. After waiting we bought more entry tickets as the crowds were getting out of control. As we were so late the wait line to see the well had got so long the guide said we would have to wait for about 40 minutes in the queue and then there would be half an hour left of the tour. His English was poor and difficult to understand. I think he was filling in for a staff member that didn‚Äôt show so felt sorry for him. Really disappointing.

title: Poor.
text:
We waited with a group of around 25 people at the arranged spot for nearly an hour. No guide turned up and half the group had to wait in line to buy new tickets.
Guide eventually turned up and we did the tour but it was a bit lifeless as half the group were late for other things and fed up.

I emailed and raised a complaint which I got a reply saying they would look into it and respond in 2 days. They then closed the complaint and asked me to provide feedback. (this happens when they close the response from their end. I work in customer service)

Did not gave a response at all from them. Wasted 3 hours.

title: Worst tour ever!
text:
It was the guide‚Äôs 3rd day on the job. His English was quite poor (English tour), he did not organize the group well, and his ability to provide information was terrible. A paraphrased example: ‚ÄúThis is the Sintra town square. Sintra was founded by the Romans. It changed names several times over the centuries.‚Äù That was the sum total of the information we received standing in front of the Sintra National Palace.

Due to the lack of organization and direction, we spent a LOT of time standing around waiting - for the guide, for tour members arguing with the guide, for lost tour members‚Ä¶

I place most of the blame for this debacle on the tour company, Tugatours. The guide should clearly have been partnered with a more seasoned guide. Additionally, many in the tour were confused and thought that tickets into Pena Palace and grounds was included. It was not‚Ä¶ but the guide offered that if you wanted those tickets he would have the office reserve them and we could give the guide cash. Good grief! Simply build the ticket into the tour and avoid all the confusion and extra work (that detracted from our available time).

title: Unethically charged me
text: I never received any confirmation of this reservation nor did it show up in my Trip Advisor or Viator profiles. Therefore, I thought the reservation didn‚Äôt confirm so I made other plans. I was surprised to receive a confirmation text from the company 23 hours before the trip was to begin but was unable cancel because of the 24 hour cancellation policy. The company unethically charged me anyway despite my multiple attempts to rectify the problem with both the tour company and Viator. When they say 24 hour cancellation policy, don‚Äôt believe them. They might just take your money.

title: Waste of money
text: The way you advertise Pena palace is included , very misleading. When you train your staff they need to have been trained better . Our guide knew nothing, didn‚Äôt know how to keep the group together lost 5 people for an half an hour . Waste time, waiting for him to figure out what to do next. Asking for my money back. Terrible

title: Poor experience
text: Our tour guide had no idea what he was doing, we asked questions about the place and he did not know the answers or gave wrong information. You have to pay extra for Pena Palace or you will outside the palace for about 90min doing nothing.

title: Not worth it and badly organized!
text:
The guide was on her first day and she was very nervous, confused and even provided wrong information! Her English was not even good. I understand her pain on the first day of job and we all tried to help her, but it's not fair that the customers have to suffer from this, especially considering how expensive is this tour!
To be honest, regardless of the quality of the guide, 80‚Ç¨ is just a theft! Cascais is just not worth the visit, Cabo da Roca was nice but it was just 15 minutes of walk on a small cliff with some pictures. Information provided about Pena Palace is easily readable on the panels in the room. The only comfort was the private shuttle to easily move between locations, and the option to jump the queue in Pena Palace. With good planning, you can save a lot of money.
Lastly, I didn't like that:
- The order of visit was inverted compared to what described on the website (Cascais, Cabo and Sintra last). The tour was supposed to finish at 16:20, but we came back to Lisbon almost one hour later. This is not good for people that might have made other plans for the rest of their afternoon. If this is because we couldn't find entrance at Pena palace before 14:30, then I'm sorry but the organisation of the tour just sucks. And they could have at least informed us in advance about the change of itinerary and end time.
- The radios used for the guided tour had a tolerance of just a few meters, afterwards the signal is lost. When the guide was in one room, people in 1-2 rooms behind couldn't hear anything! Considering the small spaces of Pena Palace, it might be worth to restrict the number of attendants to 10-15 max (we were 20). And the guide was not using the microphone at right times, so there was a lot of background noises, while important information was being missed.
- The flag wasn't used in an appropriate way to guide the group, some people also got lost.
- Information provided in the bus was fragmented and confused, we were just being bothered in the middle of our power nap for no reason. Comprehensive information should be provided at the beginning or end of the trip, not one piece of information every 10 minutes!

title: Worst Tour Experience Ever!
text: We booked an all day tour for June 6 from Lisbon to Sintra and Cascais. My husband and I arrived at the departure point we had been told when we booked the tickets. There were ten other people at this same place waiting for the tour guide and bus. They never came. Apparently the departure point had been changed. The emails I got about it were full of internet gibberish and were very unclear for such an important detail. There was no local contact number for us to call. We finally got through to a customer service agent who was not very helpful. All 12 of us were early for the tour and we had all prepaid. We lost $172, which Tugatrips has refused to refund. If you multiply that by 12, they made over $1000 off of our group that got stranded. If it had just been my husband and me, I would have said it was our mistake. We explained to them that there were 12 people waiting at Palacio da Foz Tourism Office. We were all disappointed to miss this tour, and we were frustrated that they issued no apology and have refused to refund our money. I almost never write negative reviews, but people need to know how unprofessionally this was handled. We took two other tours in Portugal with other companies and they gave us a local contact number and accurate information. Please think twice before you book with Tugatrips!

title: Terrible, did not get picked up for tour
text: DO NOT USE THIS TOUR GROUP. They change pickup location without notification. There were 10 people, of different groups, waiting for the tour bus that never showed up to pick us and now the refuse to give a refund for their mistake. 0 stars if possible. DO NOT USE THIS TOUR GROUP.

title: tour OK guide BAD
text:
The place was ok, it was super crowed and it is just a rich dude from the 1800 house. They should advertised that more.
But the part I really dislike is the fact that ours guide was telling a bunch of non sense about the illuminati, the freemason and so forth. Yeah their is a symbol of freemason . But they never bath in the blood of goat and stuff like that. when the stuff he was telling was completely false it was mostly fabricate for giving the tourist a sense a wonder or something like that...
i try to ask him question in English (ours tour was in English) and he didn't seen to understand English very well.
So sorry the guide was just not that good.

title: Very dissappointed
text: We were very dissappointed with our experience. First our itinerary was not done in the advertised manner. We started in Cascais when this was advertised as the last stop. Our guide suggested swimming, gift shopping or getting a Gellato at 9.30 in the morning on a Sunday. As you can imagine not much was open. My partner and I had brought swim gear thinking we would have a quick dip at the end of the day. Our othe dissapointment was in the quality of the guide. He was friendly but he told us it was his first tour and it showed. He was so nervous his voice did not carry to the back of the bus and his English was only at an intermediate level and had a limited knowledge of the info. When I pay for a tourguide I expect a knowledgable one otherwise I could just get an audioguide and organise my own travel. Maybe a different guide would have improved the experience but I cannot recommend.

title: Avoid Tugatrips at all costs
text: AVOID TUGATRIPS! we had booked in a tour to Sintra and Pe√±a Palace on 2 June 2023. I booked through Trip.com and received a confirmation email with the booking details. Myself and my partner attended the pick up location at 8:10am as instructed for an 8:20am departure. Tugatrips never showed up. There were 10 of us waiting, one woman called the provider and they said that the pick up location had changed and they sent an email with a new location. None of the 10 people had received the email. We were left stranded and Tugatrips refused to come pick us up. I called Tugatrips and they advised that I could request a refund through Trip.com. I contacted Trip.com and they followed up with Tugatrips who then advised that I had cancelled the booking, which was a lie. They are scammers, and I lost out on $220 Australian. They would have made quite a profit off the poor people who missed out that day. I would give them a 0 out of 5 if I could.

title: Go to Pena Palace in the morning/ forget Regaleira
text:
The trip was full day Sintra: Regaleira and Pena Palace
Daniel, the Tugatrip guide I had clearly wasn't interested in really giving us any meaningful commentary. Too many, "You know"- especially at Regaleira. Made vague references to the Masons but never clarified what he meant. Had trouble keeping track of how many people were in the group.
Pena Palace was disappointing. The head phones were useless. Daniel rushed through rooms. Couldn't give us details as "A commentary isn't allowed in the Palace" yet other groups were getting information. Anything I learned was from hearing other tour guides speaking. We were told, "If you have a question about something, take a picture and you can show me after and I'll answer your query." Pena Palace is a dead loss after 2:00 as the position of the sun meant you were always shooting towards it for palace pictures.
You'd be better off making your own travel arrangement and forget this "guided" tour.
At ‚Ç¨68 + the ‚Ç¨20 Pena Palace entry, it was a poor use of my resources and holiday time.
I went back to Sintra 4 days later and had a much better experience...but not with Tugatrips.
Photos show a dark Palace of indistinct colour due to angle of the sun at that time of day.

title: Some issues
text: Very inconvenient that the ticket to Pena Palace is not included. The agency helped with the tickets, but they only accepted cash and no card payments. Also, long queues were a nightmare

title: It felt like a scam
text: We took the Quinta da Regaleira skip the queue tour guide. When we got there, the guide bought then our tickets online (it only costs 11‚Ç¨) when we had to pay 23,5‚Ç¨ per person when we did the reservation. The guide did not seem to know about the topic and we had to queue regardless for the famous spots. He basically walked us through the garden but did not add anything to the experience. We felt it was a scam. Go there by yourself and get the online ticket.

title: Esque√ßam a Regaleira por agora
text: Reservamos com muita anteced√™ncia o tour, um dia antes dizem-nos que n√£o havia em portugu√™s. O guia era espectacular, muito simp√°tico, mas n√£o tem a culpa de n√£o estar formado para ir a todos os cantos da Quinta, ainda por cima, dentro do Pal√°cio nem guia tivemos. Muitas das coisas est√£o interditas, e o pre√ßo n√£o √© mais barato por isso. O local √© fant√°stico mas parece um pouco desleixado. O esp√≠rito √© fazer dinheiro com o muito turismo que acolhemos. Fic√°mos desapontados num dia que deveria ser m√≠stico

title: Tugatrips: Poor Tour of Quinta da Regaleira
text: We went on Tugatrips's Quinta da Regaleira: Skip-the-Line & Guided Tour. It was the worst walking tour we have ever experienced: (1) the tour group was too large, about 26 people speaking 3 different languages; (2) it started 20 minutes after the designated start time, and we still had to wait in line to get in; (3) the guide failed to give an introduction to the site, talked forward while walking so no one except people next to him could hear him, and his English was mediocre at best - to this day, the history and meaning of this palace and grounds remains a mystery; (4) the guide did not tell us what to expect, so when we climbed up the hill (a long way) to the end of the line to enter the initiation chamber, only then did we realize that we would be standing in line about 40 minutes; (5) when we got to the end of the line the guide left to take someone to the bathroom, at which point 8 people, including the 2 of us, ditched the tour. We explored on our own. On our way out we ran into the tour and there were only about 6 people left - meaning that about 20 people ditched the tour before its completion. Some of the problems were due to to the company (e.g., too many people on the tour) and some due to the tour guide (e.g., too inexperienced).

title: Not worth the visit.
text:
Booking online was ok. We arrived and found the guide but waited over 25 minutes for the tour to start, because he had to get tickets and there was a group complaining about the tickets/tour. We spent most of the time in the garden, which was interesting but we really wanted to see the house. The tour should have started at 1600 so we had to rush round the house. Inside was a real disappointment as there was only one floor to view and most of the exhibits were not there - just pictures of them.

I felt the tour - at that price - was a waste of money. We could - and should - have just bought tickets and gone on our own - the guide was nice but as he was not allowed into the house, you could hardly call it a guided tour.

Advice - there are much better places to go in Lisbon.

title: Not worth it
text: I thought my 70 euro ticket to Sintra was overpriced. It doesn‚Äôt include a ticket to the palace. Basically, you pay 70 euro for a glorified group taxi via van with a tour guide that makes several stops.

title: Disappointing
text: Lots of standing around waiting and in ticket/entry lines. We had hoped a tour would allow us to skip lines. Only saw 2 sites in a full-day. Guide was friendly but non-informative, providing limited insights in an off-hand manner. And the info he did give was often difficult to understand. Pena Palace does not need a guide, as the path thru is well marked with good info on signs in each room. Quinta Regaleira was all outside, walking thru the grounds -- again, didn't need a guide for that. He gave us a few minutes at the end to go thru the house without him (supposedly he's not allowed.) Again, the interior had lots of info on signs. We recommend taking public transportation to Sintra, then hire a taxi or tuk-tuk to get from site to site. If we had done that we would have saved money, plus had time to see the Moorish Castle and National Palace. Best part of day was a nice lunch we found on our own.

title: Improperly managed expectations.
text: Our group arrived early to the pick up point as instructed but it took over 30 minutes for us to leave. We were told our bus was in traffic only to discover it had been there the entire time but the guide did not notice it. We were told in advance that the workers at Pe√±a Palace were on strike so we‚Äôd be going to Quinta De Regaleira instead and we‚Äôd be able to see the famous well and should get right in. When we arrived, we were placed in a long line and left there by our tour guide who told us to wait there while he confirmed which line we should wait in (ticketed or non-ticketed). During this time, several large tour groups passed us in line (despite being told earlier by our guide that there was no priority today). As we made our way closer to the line, our tour guide asked us to block others from skipping the line, which resulted in hostility from other guests who felt entitled to skip. We ended up waiting 53 minutes to enter the castle. Once we entered, the guide gave us a tour which was mostly well paced. At the end of the tour, he told us we had one hour left which we could use to go get lunch (not enough time to do that in busy Sintra) or wait in line for 1 hour to see the well that we were told we‚Äôd all be able to see. We settled for looking at a smaller well and walking through the caves. We left to get some snacks as he told us we‚Äôd have some time to also eat in Caiscas which we assumed would have more time for dining. After leaving the castles, he took us to the westernmost point of Europe for about 30 minutes and then went to Caiscas for a total of 45 minutes. We got lunch but didn‚Äôt have time to see the beach and were rushed back to the bus. Overall, the tour is not well paced, it all felt very rushed and there definitely was no line skipping involved. I understand that the tour guide was doing the best he could but the lack of communication and inconsistencies were frustrating to navigate. We all felt we would‚Äôve been better off just renting a car and going to those places on our own.

title: Sintra
text: La salida ha sido 30 min despu√©s de lo previsto. Tras un trayecto de media hora se para en el pueblo de Sintra para hacer una pausa de 25 min. Tras dirigirse hacia el Castillo de Pena con un trayecto de 10 min, se vuelve a hacer una pausa de 15 min. En el Palacio de Pena el gu√≠a no pudo hacer la visita por un problema con los auriculares por lo que la entrada ha sido de 1 hora de forma libre. En ese momento te dan hora y media para comer. Finalmente se ve el Palacio de la Regaleira. En definitiva es una excursi√≥n que se podr√≠a hacer en 3 o 4 horas si no se perdieran tantos tiempos muertos. El conductor del bus era bastante temerario en su conducci√≥n. La reserva era en Espa√±ol pero el 90% de la excursi√≥n ha sido en ingl√©s. Hasta el punto de decir que mejor segu√≠a todo en ingl√©s. Por el precio y dado que no hubo visita guiada compensa ir en Taxi desde Lisboa y pagar la entrada libre a los Palacios.

title: Get a tour through another guide company
text: We were only given a tour of la regalar√≠a and were not taken to Pe√±a palace, which was the big attraction of the tour. They used the excuse that they were not able to get tickets on time, which is not a good excuse if you do these tours all the time. Very disappointed and was not given a refund. They took us to another sight instead, casacais, which the town is underwhelming and I would advise skipping. Just buy a ticket online and take the train to Pe√±a palace yourself instead of touring with them.

title: non vale la pena
text: la guida parlava inglese, credo che non fosse specificato e visto che il tour era pubblicizzato su una guida italiana e descritto in italiano ho dato x scontato che fosse in italiano.io parlo inglese ma il mio compagno purtoppo no ma in ogni caso non mi √® piaciuto per niente.

title: Worst experience! Do not book!
text:
Worst experience ever. They insisted we pay after just the 2nd stop of the tour, we were promised 90min tour to 4 different locations. After we paid (50min in) he started saying tour is finished. We stopped somewhere for 5min, we come back and he had left! He just left us stranded , we only visited 2 places, and finished the tour after just 50min!
We called and called and no one answered!
They dishonest and crooks! Driver name is Mia.

Do not book!

title: Average tour
text: Overall below average tour. Our guide Bruno didn‚Äôt share as much information about the city as we would have liked and on multiple occasions had no clue regarding simple questions about Lisbon. We did get to see a cool viewpoint of the city!

title: The idea is great but the performance not so much
text:
The tour was recomended by our hotel. The idea is great but the performance not so much.
We took a 3 hour tour.
The traffic was terrible, everything was crazy loud so there was no chance to even hear the guide talking during the drive, even though she tried.
The pavement of the streets is really uneven and therefore the ride was really bumpy and uncomfortable, especially if you have some back problems.
Even though it is probably the fastest way to see the town, especially the old city center with its narrow and steep streets, but you still just drive past the sights, so there is also very little/no chance to take any pictures.
Price/performance not so good.

title: Wir hatten die TukTuk Tour ‚ÄûLissabon: Von Ost nach West Private Tour mit dem TUKXI MADEIRA - TURISMO, UNIPESSOAL LDA‚Äú ..
text:
gebucht, die ich wie folgt bewerten m√∂chte:
P√úNKTLICHKEIT sehr gut

title: Insvvicinabili
text: Costosissimi e non hanno nulla di pi√π dei tram. Da 50 ai 70 euro in un ora. Un vero furto. Da evitare per chi non vuole buttare via i soldo

title: Reckless driving, serious accident and escaped
text:
Reckless service with accident and escape

A year ago this company made us a trip and the driver had a reckless drive and hit a wall. 6 people injured and escaped. All hospitalized with serious injuries. After one year neither the company nor its company (Generali) takes care of the personal and physical damage. All documented with police, firefighters and witnesses. THEY'RE A DANGER WITH RECKLESS DRIVERS AND THEY RUN AWAY. Irresponsible company and its two managers of Sintra and Lisbon a few faces, scoundrels and endanger customers with bad vehicles and reckless drivers. Do not use his services if you want to stay alive. Theme in the Portuguese courts for the lack of responsibility, professionalism and dangerousness of their vehicles and their managers.

title: Scammers
text: A total scam. Said they bring us up AND down the mountain to Pena Palace for 50 paid up front. Once we wanted to go down they wanted to charge us 25 more. Saying we understood it wrong, when they cant even properly understand basic English. Dont go with these guys

title: Inconvenient
text: Nice but I do not recommend it because it is expensive but especially uncomfortable given the road cloak made of stones.... better taxi also costs much less

title: Too expensive
text:
This was the only Tuk Tuk company as you came off the ship. The lady at the counter was not very approachable and although agreed a small discount, the overall price for a 3 hour tour for 4 adults and one child was over ‚Ç¨400.

We booked at 10.15am and the driver did not arrive until over an hour later!! The driver was very good and accommodating and took us to as many places as he could possibly fit in. He was pleasant and helpful. The price for this tour was definitely not worth it.

title: Buyers beware of price switch
text: We were asking for a couple of quotes for the Tuk Tuk ride tour and Rogerio from this place gave us an incredible deal we couldn‚Äôt turn down. We set up a day and time and I reconfirmed the price on text the day of the tour. He came to pick us up, had the kids take pictures on the Tuk Tuk and we were on our way. He was extremely nice the entire time, checking on us and giving us history of the city. Came the end of the tour when he dropped us off, he said he has bad news and that his boss said he can‚Äôt offer the ride at the price he quoted us and charged us ¬£70 more. We would‚Äôve given him a good tip if we were not being ambushed like that. I just feel it should‚Äôve been disclosed beforehand when he picked us up and there were many times he could‚Äôve told us. It was really unexpected and shocking to have to pay the additional even though I had the confirmation on text. Rogerio worked for the company for many years, no way we were the first family he did this to. What he did just make the entire trip sour so anyone book with him just beware of this. Make sure you ask him before the ride and even during the ride. I hope no more family will fall into this trap.

title: A quite a good experience, but too expensive
text: I liked the idea of sitting in a TukTuk and with a teenager, who wasn‚Äôt keen on walking, this seemed to be a really good way to get around town. The driver and everything was OK. But found it ridiculously expensive. I shouldn‚Äòt have pre-booked the tour probably. As I didn‚Äôt know Lisbon and we only had a day, I thought it might be better to pre-book, but there are hundreds of them, so there was no need really. The driver did point out things and talked to us, but it was really difficult to understand, as you have the noise of the engine, all the traffic around (city noise) and the wind in your ears‚Ä¶ It was nice to be able to access parts of town like this, as you wouldn‚Äôt be able to by car and definitely worth an experience, the tuktuk drivers yelling at each other and you‚Äòre inmidst it all‚Ä¶ you cannot see buildings really well, as you have the sun roof. So all in all‚Äî I wouldn‚Äòt say to my friends, that they absolutely should do this.

title: Dangerous Vechicles!
text: Would never recommend. They drive to fast. We went around a corner so fast the vehicle flipped on it's side. We slide across the street and hit a tree. I cut my head open and my husband broke his shoulder (which the hospital didn't detect after having a ct scan of his head and chest.) Once he was home and had xrays they detected the fracture . I think driver's in Spain think stop lights and speed limits are suggestions.

title: Uncomfortable and poor guided tour.
text: We booked this through our hotel. The ride was incredibly uncomfortable. The vehicle has no shock absorbers on an extremely bump terrain. Our backs were in pain and it was extremely difficult to get on and off. The visibility was subpar- the roof covering blocks views so you have literally very little photo opps. Our guide did not have an enough knowledge and English communication skills to provide a proper "guided tour". This cost us $160 euros and quite frankly, we should have just booked a private tour with a proper vehicle to get more value. We have taken MANY guided tours on travel, and this was the worst one.

title: Unfortunate Tuk Tuk Experience
text: We traveled throughout Spain and Portugal and had many experiences with numerous guides and even a Tuk Tuk tour in Porto. Unfortunately, this was not a good experience. We learned virtually nothing about the city of Lisbon on this 3 hour tour. Our driver/guide was a nice man but he was from Bangladesh and did not speak clearly enough for us to understand him. Most Tuk Tuk guides will talk and tell you information throughout the tour so that you walk away feeling like you know the city. Our guide only spoke if we asked him about something or when we arrived at a certain location and when he did speak, we barely understood what he was saying. After a 3 hour tour and $225 + tip, we should have walked away with a very good amount of knowledge. Instead, we knew only the very minimum. It was a very disappointing experience and for those reasons we would never advise booking with this company. One last minor thing, he was 30 minutes late for the tour as we waited on the street.

title: Pas de chance ?
text: J‚Äôai r√©serv√© cette activit√© bien √† l‚Äôavance apr√®s consultation des avis √©logieux de Tripadvisor alors je me dis que nous avons jou√© de malchance‚Ä¶ 48h avant le rdv, j‚Äôenvoie un mail pour confirmation du point de rdv. Pas de r√©ponse. Idem 36h avant. 24h avant nous passons √† pied au lieu th√©orique du rdv et ne voyons rien. J‚Äôessaye d‚Äôappeler au num√©ro indiqu√© dans la r√©servation. √áa sonne dans le vide. Je contacte l‚Äôassistance Viator. Je passe 1h en ligne avec eux. Ils me confirment que l‚Äôexcursion aura lieu. Dans la soir√©e je re√ßois sms m‚Äôindiquant que le guide pr√©vu s‚Äôest bless√© et qu‚Äôil faudrait d√©caler l‚Äôheure de notre rdv ;impossible puisque nous avons pr√©vu autre chose . Encore beaucoup de messages √©chang√©s pour finalement d√©cider d‚Äôannuler l‚Äôactivit√© puisque aucun arrangement n‚Äôa pu √™tre trouv√©. Il a fallu que nous trouvions une autre soci√©t√© de Tuktuk au dernier moment. En bref plusieurs heures perdues pour ne pas faire le tour avec eux.
