Predatory business practices. They make you sign up for 6 months minimum or charge a 70 euro cancellation fee. This was never made clear to me verbally, only written down on the paper they make you sign. We were looking for a month to month membership and didn't realize we had committed for 6 months. There's also an initial fee of 35 euros to register. We only stayed for one month and had to pay an exorbitant amount in initial fees and cancellation. I would NOT recommend this place at all.

Definitely not ideal for travelers in Lisbon for a short period of time.

title: Disappointing, the outside view is better
text: Among the 11 towers of the fortress of San Giorgio, the tower of Ulysses is easily recognizable because a sort of cylindrical metal structure emerges from its terrace. In fact, it would not differ from the other towers that can be found along the walkways of the walls if it were not for the fact that a dark room has been created inside: the interior of the tower is completely dark and the light from a telescope which, via special rods operated by the guide, is oriented in various directions so that the projected image changes continuously, offering an enlarged 360¬∞ panorama of the city. However, the image is not defined, I would even say almost blurry and this experience, which lasted a few minutes, told me nothing. I think it is preferable to enjoy the natural panorama that can be seen from the stands and which, by following the entire walkway of the walls, still covers an angle of 360¬∞. The visits, in small groups, begin at 10 am and continue every 15 minutes alternating in different languages (Italian is not available). In my opinion, this attraction can easily be skipped when visiting the castle of San Giorgio.

title: Disappointed
text: The visit to the dark room of the Tower of Ulysses was quite disappointing. Even the visit to the castle I don't think is worth the ticket price.

title: Very disappointing
text:
Had booked a trip for today. They were no shows and didn‚Äôt answer the phone
‚Ä¶ website also appears to be gone? Very disappointing as it was. Birthday celebrant not cheap

title: Good food, fun, one very rude staff member.
text:
18/05/2025

3rd time going to this place always have a lot of fun but this time there was this member of staff who was very rude and unpleasant i didn't get her name but while teaching the axes and serving she was rude and seemed like she was at the wrong job.

Love the axes
Love the food

title: Bad experience
text:
It was the worst restaurant I've ever been to.
Table of 25 people, the arrival difference of the first and last hamburger was 30 min. The employees are not very concerned about the service and the tickets arrived after the last hamburger arrived.
The hamburgers know well, but they don't have meat (they looked like two slices of lime. I risk saying that the two together do not add 90g of meat)
Group menu entries were insufficient to divide.

This service was accepted if it costs 15/20 euros, but not for 30/40‚Ç¨ which is what they ask.

I do not recommend.

title: You walk a little further and you will find other establishments where YES
text: We were conned. They said there was happy hour where the cubalibres and mojitos were at 5 ‚Ç¨ and when paying we did not apply the discount CHEATING ADVERTISING!!

title: Misleading advertising
text: On the blackboard outside it said that there was happy hour at 5‚Ç¨ mojito and cuba libre and it was misleading advertising, only included a drink called cuba libre and only the normal mojito, gin and tonic and strawberry mojito charged it at the original price, still the normal mojitos on the ticket we have had to tell them to apply the discount, the super small glasses. We've felt cheated, and the super expensive axe games, I'm not coming back.

title: Nope and nope.
text: My husband and I went to USAXE as it was my husbands birthday and he really fancied a burger! The service was lovely (very polite and friendly) but, the food, not so much. No one else was there so it wasn‚Äôt a ‚Äúbusy‚Äù thing. Hubby had a bacon burger and an oreo milkshake. Milkshake was great although a lot of Nutella. His burger was ok. My burger wasn‚Äôt cooked. I had the plant burger. I called for it extra crispy as I just love a crispy patty but it was the opposite and has hardly touched the grill. It was inedible. No one came to check if we were ok after food has been dropped off so I couldn‚Äôt address it. Yes, I could have been more aggressive and found someone, kicked up a drink etc but I feel I shouldn‚Äôt have to.

title: Bad service experience!
text: Bad service experience! My request came incomplete and I was completely disrespected by the lack of solutions. This implied my appetite, anyway... I won't eat again, I won't recommend it to anyone. Don't be fooled by the attractive place! If you want a quiet meal, ASAxe is not an option!

title: NOT a shooting range
text: THIS IS NOT A SHOOTING CLUB. How can it POSSIBLY be listed as "the best central Portugal shooting Range?"

title: No to be recommended
text:
The app gives you 2 download site. One is Soundcloud (that I do not use) and the other is to Google Maps that simply gives direction from your current location to a Point of Interest. No details are provided of the attractions you visit.
Quite frankly I cannot recommend.

title: Very disappointing experience ‚Äì poorly organised and unprofessional
text:
I am very disappointed in the service of this organization. First I received a message that the tour was being adjusted because the group was too small. Then, two days before the planned activity, I was told that the tour was completely cancelled due to problems with the bus. It is strange that an organization like this apparently has only one bus available, without any backup option.

They themselves suggested to do the tour on Tuesday. To make that possible, I had to cancel and reschedule appointments, for which I also had to incur costs. When I then asked for compensation, I received a rude and unsympathetic reply. They said there was nothing they could do about it and simply suggested that we choose another day ‚Äì which was not a viable option for me, with only four days in Lisbon and a tight schedule.

On top of that, I was eventually told that the tour on Tuesday could not be arranged after all. All in all, I found the service particularly bad, and I therefore advise against booking through this organization.

What I can recommend is the bus company Buend√≠a Tours. I had a fantastic day with them ‚Äì everything was well arranged and the staff were extremely friendly.

title: Ghosted
text: Don't book this! The local guy Francisco never showed up nor andwered on call/text... So dissapointing!

title: Guy never showed up
text: Absolutely do not recommend. No specifics on when the pickup would happen, trying to get ahold of the guy fri 2 days, never replied to us or showed up to pick us up for the tour.

title: Very disappointing
text: Very disappointing. You pay 10 euros entrance during the day. Upstairs is a bar, but the drinks are quite at the price. The view over the bridge is beautiful, but otherwise it is not very spectacular. I didn't think it was worth it at all.

title: Careful. Always request paper invoice at HORA. Para tudo. And ask with NIF.
text:
I went with my daughter to visit and paid with a Revolut card at the entrance (machine) but the receipt did not come out and the payment was pending.
Inside the building, I spoke to a poorly mooded lady and told her what was going on, which she didn‚Äôt help or even moved to the machine to check.
Said that if he wanted to go in he would have to use the portable terminal to the counter. This time I used another card since the Revolut apparently did not work.
I paid again and no receipt again.
I went up and consumed and paid with the Revolut card and it worked.
I complained by email sending all the justifications issued by the 2 banks.
They don't answer or return the money.
This has a name.

title: Weak... only worth the sight
text: The view is beautiful... but I wasn't a fan of the bar... uncomfortable, cold, uncomfortable service, weak and unprofessional...

title: Don't go wearing sandals
text: I went at 5pm and lady explained I could pay ‚Ç¨10 for Entry or wait until 6pm and do the ‚Ç¨15 minimum spend. So I decide to go back at 6pm only to be told I couldn't get in at 6pm as I was wearing sandals!!! The same sandals I had on one hour before when I first arrived.

title: Overpriced greenhouse to die from heat trying to make a photo through a dirty window
text: Only negative feelings. They are selling a greenhouse tickets at 10 eur. It is damn hot inside, no aircons, not even fans. We wanted to sit and have a drink with a view but once we done the circle, we were so wet that we happily rushed down. Not to mention dirty windows that spoil your photos as there are no way to get outside (no balcony or outside deck).

title: Sexist dress code beware
text: I waited until the last night of my vacation to see Lisbon at night from the tower. I got there just after sunset. In fact we stretched out dinner to arrive at the perfect time.. I was refused entry due to my attire. I was dressed in cotton capri pants which were deemed by the two young women at the entrance as work out gear. The pants were not clingy nor were they like yoga pants. They would have allowed my son in who was dressed in cargo shorts and a tee shirt to enter. I watched as several men similarly dressed allowed entry. No requirement for men to have a collared shirt. In fact, they all looked like they were dressed for a run. I have had a wonderful time in Portugal and it‚Äôs too bad my last night was ruined by a sexist evaluation of my attire.

title: I felt robbed.
text:
I thought we were tricked.
It does not specify anywhere that there is a time limit for entry with consummation included.
We entered paying the entrance fee of 10 euros per person, and we thought that this amount would be reversed in consummation, and that was not what happened. Finally, when it was time to pay the bill, the amounts were increased. Because of the schedule. We entered at 5:30 pm and the drinks were a great value, when we left at 7:00 pm the prices were 50% more expensive. I thought it was absurd. I felt robbed.

title: Bad service,
text:
The service leaves something to be desired, the place is beautiful, cozy
However, I felt extremely deceived because I went in at 5pm, paid 10 euros, ordered some beers for 5 euros and when paying they charged 7.50 as the price increases after 6pm.

title: We were not warned and we paid a non-consumable 10 euro ticket at 5:20 pm and at 6 pm it was consumable, worse the value changes
text: We felt cheated from the start. There was no clear information that from 5 pm to 5:30 pm we could go up but without consuming the entrance fee.

title: Cold bar from the people to the place
text:
It's too cold, even with blankets and heaters available.
They added drinks to a card wrongly and didn't want to admit the mistake by being rude.
You pay a ridiculous elevator fee.
Exaggerated minimum consumption of ‚Ç¨15
It is not possible to smoke in the premises or go downstairs with glasses and return later.
It's basically a hallway with a bar.
Imperial at ‚Ç¨7.5.
It perfectly represents the SANA group.

title: Absolutely overpriced...
text:
So the view is great but it can get hot if you're facing the sun, it does not seem to be air conditioned. But the worst is the prices: in the afternoon you pay 10 euros/adult (5 for kids) for the privilege to go up to the bar. But then they charge you in addition 17 euros for a Mojito and 4 euros for a coke.
WTF are we? in New York or Hong Kong? Only went to show the view to my kid.

title: Complete disrespect for guests
text: This is a complete scam and a divorce of people. When we bought tickets on their website, money was debited from me, but the ticket did not come to the post office. I called them on the phone and they said that I should write them a letter about it and come with payment confirmation and that they would certainly let us in. OK When we arrived, we were told that no one knew anything and in general we should buy a ticket for 15 euros, not 10 euros. There is no such option on the site at all! OK. Return the money ! They say no - you can come later within a month, but now they won't let us in - they have a "dress code". What's the dress code? There is nothing on the site about it! But they say, and point to the wall with a finger where some piece of paper hangs. With us, they didn‚Äôt let another tourist in - something didn‚Äôt suit them in his clothes either. The result - money was spent that no one returned, time wasted and the mood was spoiled. By the way, there is no book of complaints. The law does not dictate to them. Don't waste your time and money!

title: Discriminado, humilhado a entrada
text:
Eu e a minha esposa fomos visitar a torre Vasco Da Gama. (19h)
Quando cheguei informaram me que era 15 euros por pessoa e pediram me para esperar 5 minutos para o elevador poder descer.
Enquanto espero um grupo de pessoas v√£o se juntado (6 a 8 pessoas)
5 minutos depois vem o seguran√ßa e diz que n√£o posso entrar por causa do dress code.
Todos entraram menos eu e a minha esposa.
Como africano ficam mts d√∫vidas
Fico triste, frustado de n√£o ter o poder mudar a mentalidade das pessoas.
Fui discrimina√ß√£o e humilhado.
Mas infelizmente aconteceu.

title: Have to pay to access bar
text: We had planned to go up here for the view and a drink after taking the cable car. Note though that the ‚Ç¨15 entry redeemable against drinks referred to in another review is only after 6pm. Would have happily done this and enjoyed a few drinks. But prior to 6pm it is ‚Ç¨10 each just to access the bar and viewing platform, which feels overpriced in comparison.

title: The boat ride was canceled
text: The boat ride was canceled . Apparently they tried to get a hold of me but I didn't know until I showed up. They do have a disclaimer on their excursions that they can cancel if they do not have enough people.

title: Unreliable Company
text: 5 minutes before we were due to get on the boat we were informed that the boat was having issues and they had to cancel the trip. It was very disappointing with no alternative offered, just avail of a refund. It was our last evening in Lisbon so we didn‚Äôt get the opportunity to do it another day. My advice would be book with a more reliable company!

title: Not friendly
text:
The day before, they notified me that there was a problem with the boat, unfortunately my schedule were set for the future and not able to be re-scheduled.

The lady at the counter was not really friendly, maybe because I don‚Äôt speak Portuguese, so my partner took it over. Even he desks it‚Äôs she seemed very annoyed for the entire conversation.

We went to the booth next, she was very helpful and we enjoyed their cruise instead.

title: No free drink
text: ‚ÄúWith a drink‚Äù Bartender did not know about the free drink even after showing, had to pay. Don‚Äôt think I saw anyone else get one either

title: Navio Prec√°rio e velho!
text:
O passeio √© bem b√°sico, n√£o chega a ser perigoso mas esteja preparado para uma partida com bastante balan√ßo. O navio √© bem velhinho, com banheiros prec√°rios, assentos decentes na parte interna, mas no deck superior a estrutura √© bem ca√≠da.

O passeio em si faz uma rota eficiente, com boa velocidade e seguran√ßa.

Com mais 20 euros um casal pode ter uma experi√™ncia muito mais confort√°vel num saveiro ou outra embarca√ß√£o mais sofisticada.

title: Disappointing Experience - Not Worth It
text: We took this cruise on our first night and were really disappointed. No commentary onboard ‚Äî the app didn‚Äôt work and there was no WiFi. Outdoor seats were all taken when we arrived. Indoor windows were filthy, so the views were poor, and the boat itself felt unclean. Wine was okay, but snacks (especially the olives) were low quality. Overall, not a great experience and wouldn‚Äôt recommend.

title: An unromantic and over capacity shambles‚Ä¶
text:
Disappointing!!!!

Definitely didn‚Äôt live up to how this was advertised.

A ‚Äòromantic sunset cruise perfect for couples‚Äô was actually an ‚Äòoverbooked, unromantic and very disorganised shambles‚Äô

The queue was huge when we arrived at gate B and we were anxious the boat couldn‚Äôt accommodate that many people. Sure enough we were right.

There were not enough tables for guests so a number of us, including ourselves had to either find a corner to stand in, or sit indoors on inward facing chairs (with no tables) in what felt like a dentists waiting room. This provided a challenge when the snacks came out (a tray of bread and butter, peanuts, olives, chocolate cake) as we had to stand holding our drinks and a tray and take it in turns to eat or drink something.

Lots of guests were complaining and apart from one guest with a baby who were given a table, everyone else had to make do with any spare bit of space we could find.

Also worth noting that the boat had one very small upper deck (open air), a decent sized middle deck (also open air) and the third deck which is where we were confined to is an inside deck which is made very dark due to the tint on the windows.

Given we booked this for our 1st Wedding Anniversary evening, we left very disappointed and would not recommend. Definitely not worth the money.

title: To flee
text: Boat, Sao Jorge, dilapidated and filthy, good for scrap metal, undrinkable coffee. 18‚Ç¨ per person, a real scam. Only interest: the city seen from the river. To be avoided absolutely, a tourist catcher.

title: Poor communication, cancelled at last minute.
text: Booked and paid in advance of travel, arrived 30 minutes pre departure but no boat in sight. Was told would be late as refueling. Waited until 15 minutes after scheduled departure and then advised trip was cancelled. Poor communication and little staff around to assist.

title: Very disappointing experience
text: This was an absolute was of time. No narrative was done to point out any point of interest. Snack of dry bread and jam and Olive‚Äôs was poor at best. Boat looks tired and crew un interested in their passengers. Don‚Äôt waste your time or money.

title: Don't bother with Blue Cruises. Total rip-off.
text: We did the afternoon Tagides Brunch cruise. Only found out on board that the only drinks provided were orange juice and water. Food was garbage and service non existent. Don't waste your money on this rip off of a boat cruise. 70 ‚Ç¨ not worth ‚Ç¨10.

title: Not worth the money.
text:
One star just for the one staff member who was polite.
We were looking forward to this boat trip all day after the hottest day of the year (39 degrees). Showed up early as we wanted a good seat and waited in the lovely station as it would be stupid to stand in the sun with no cover for 15 mins.
Then we went to queue up, the boat trip before us got off on time but we were all left waiting without any information as to what was going on for nearly 40 mins.
Once we got on we were greeted with a sigh and a nod. Sat down, only a few of the windows opened so we had to choose whether to be cooked under the sun for 2 hours or cooked in the indoor heat with no air con?
We received lovely refreshing orange juice with ice or wine. We waited for snacks, as advertised, but apparently that was only available for sunset cruise passengers.
As we set off late on the trip we just assumed we would arrive back 40 mins later than planned. However we arrived back exactly in time for the next boat trip‚Ä¶ sooooo how do we get our money and time back‚Ä¶ you don‚Äôt I suppose.
The other boats in the dock looked a lot more appealing, clean and friendly so if you are looking for a relaxing boat trip‚Ä¶ maybe try somewhere else.

title: Cannot be recommended
text: The boat is very old. The benches lack rungs, upholstery is torn open, chairs partly completely weathered. No shadow spots on the upper deck. The wine is only available from the tour at 3pm. Wasn't so communicated online. I can't recommend the tour. Value for money is not right at all. 1.5 hours is very long when it's so dirty and scruffy.

title: Waste of time
text: Broken rusty chairs. Smelly toilets. No guide. No idea what were looking at. The free drink is tap water or orange. A waste of time.

title: Don‚Äôt bother‚Ä¶. Waste of two hours.
text: Paid 18‚Ç¨ to sit on a rusty old chair for a couple of hours on a tired tatty boat. Commentary was non existent so had no idea what we were looking at. Found a QR code on way off hidden on a table that supposedly linked to an online commentary. No one else on the trip had found it so we were all in the dark. Sat on starboard side so we‚Äôre basically the whole river distance away from shore so the sights of Lisbon were just a blur in the distance. Not recommended and a waste of two hours in Lisbon.

title: Not recommandable!
text:
The first part was okay. You see a lot places of interest from a nice perspective.

The wines were awful, I would recommend to take a beer or water because the ones from those mini bottles are terrible. Portugal has so much good wine and with 50+ people on board you should pour at least an okay wine out of a 75cl bottle. The worst part was the arrival at the gate again. It took over an hour (!!!) for the so called captain to bring the ship close enough to the jetty in order to let the passengers leave the ship. No information was given by the staff. I had to approach them myself and got told, that they have a new captain who is inexperienced with the ship. How can you do that?! I've been on ships in several countries and I never ever experienced anything like this! Horrible! Over one hour to late we were finally able to leave the ship. Not recommandable!

title: Left something to be desired
text:
Boat poorly maintained and with poor hygiene in the women's bathroom.
What was served was bad (peanuts not even 100g, olives, two fillets (really fillet) of three types of bread and a 200ml drink (water OR wine OR juice), ONE unit per person. I felt cheated.

title: Disappointed.
text: Cruise departed very late. No ‚Äúhello‚Äù welcome on board, no safety information about lifejackets etc. No Audio/commentary as advertised, included drink was orange juice from a carton, which you had to go and find, staff looked pretty miserable, no guide leaflet received with tickets, so an uninformative two hours. No goodbye or thanks for using blue cruises. Weather and scenery amazing.

title: Nop
text: Terrible experience. The wine was bad and the ship moved too much. They should rethink this whole tour. It may have worked a while back but not anymore

title: Not as advertised, what a disappointment
text: Don't be fooled by their pictures... We were shown photos and told which boat we were going to get, the picture had couches and looked quite nice... Expectation vs reality was a joke...

title: Still on the Dock as the Sun went down!
text: Was a little concerned that the meet time was pretty close to sunset. Even more so as we were stood on the dock as the sun was going down. We got onboard just as the sun disappeared over the horizon. Not really a sunset cruise! The cruise itself was ok, despite being dark for the majority of it!

title: Long, tiring and unattractive ride
text:
Old boat, but well preserved internally. Long and tiring ride‚Ä¶ by the end, almost everyone is asleep or bored.
Not worth it!

title: Strongly advise against this company
text:
10/10 would recommend a sunset cruise, but 1/10 with this company.
No commentary or guidance on anything you were seeing, the wine was awful, had to go and find the food if you were paying attention, the staff were not friendly, and the boat was not safe

title: Left at sunset, still on the Dock 7.30pm
text: Absolutely waste of money left at 7:30. You could see sunset from the dock. pitch dark couldn‚Äôt see anything apart from lights wasting time going round to make up time this Cruise leave too late?

title: Beautiful views but disappointing boat and facilities
text: We went for this sunset cruise and we were told by the booking staff there would be a guide, music and lights displayed. There was nothing of that sort. The snacks offered looked like they have been opened for a while. Alongside this, the sofa‚Äôs looked quite dirty, the windows were very dirty and some of them did not open at all. Furthermore, my mum had slipped down the stairs and they had no plasters in their first aid box which was quite concerning. For the price we paid, it was certainly not worth the experience. I would definitely avoid this!

title: Avoid !
text:
Booked the tour with brunch. Brunch was obviously left over from breakfast and was dreadful. One staff member said we could have water yet the barman with the dreadlocks refused us. He spent most of the time looking bored and talking in his mobile phone.
No commentary and no instructions how to get it.
Very poor.

title: Sehr entt√§uschend. Ist das GELD NICHT WERT!!
text: Total farblose Boitsfahrt. Keine Ansprache. Keine Musik. Die Crew wirkt lustlos. Viel zu kleine Fahrtstrexke. Um die 2 Stinden voll zu kriegen, d√ºmpelt er auf dem R√ºckweg noch ewig vor der Anlegestelke rum. Schlechter Wein. Man kriegt auch nur das eine 25cl-Fl√§schen. Will man dazu ein ebenso kleines Wasser haben kostet es schon extra 2 EUR.

title: Lovely cruise, terrible food
text: Four stars for a beautiful cruise around Lisbon. But minus three for a totally inedible brunch option. Not appealing to begin with but bread was stale, scrambled eggs burned etc. Top tip ... take the cruise but bring a sandwich

title: Horrible
text: We did a brunch cruise, got on the boat, and the boat was out of almost all of the drinks including bar drinks. Food was awful and employees did not care to help anyone who had questions. It was supposed to have an audio guide as well, but it was not working. So we sat for two hours, not knowing what we were looking at. If I could, I would get this tour zero out of five stars unless you were just looking for a lazy boat ride to see the shoreline.

title: Choose an alternative cruise.
text: Disappointing and uncomfortable experience. No commentary given despite passing many landmarks. 90% of windows closed inside despite scorching heat. Why?? No shade on top deck. Left 20 minutes late and had to wait in blazing sun to board. Would not recommend.

title: D√©√ßu du staff
text: Croisi√®re sympa avec boisson offerte et snack Malheuresement le crew n‚Äôest pas √† la hauteur lors de demande importante, il n‚Äôen a rien √† cirer surtout le barman qui pr√©f√®re tout bonnement continuer de nettoyer et vite rentrer chez lui plut√¥t que de s‚Äôoccuper des clients.

title: Pathetic service
text:
Pathetic food and wine, kind but confused personnel, nice views.
The pictures shows an elegantly refurbished casilheiro boat with some sort of rich buffet. In reality, clients are handed a tray with 20 olives, half a slice of bread, a pastel de nata and a glass of very bad wine during the 2 hour cruise between 7 and 9 pm. In case you want more, the cafeteria provides the same things but at extortion level prices.
The views are nice and you will be enjoying the cruise overall, but you may want to bring your own food and forget the implied disrespect for customers that their pathetic offer implies.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time of money. It‚Äôs a joke!!!
text: The worst boat cruise tour I have ever been on. Been on many and used to even work for a harbor cruise company. They has the boat loaded with guests. Only had two servers to serve the ‚Äúsnacks and beverage‚Äù(snacks were some peanuts, gross olives, two slices of sandwich bread w/butter packets and a pastel de Nate. Drink was the smallest bottle of beer in the world lol). Many people didn‚Äôt get their snack plate at all while many got it toward the end of the cruise. The person working the bar was not a bartender and seemed to have been awoken from his sleep in a geriatric ward. It was impossible to get a second beverage. If you go to the bar he will just stare at you and you‚Äôll wait until one of the two servers for 300+ people tell you to have a seat and when they get to you then you can order a beer‚Ä¶ which when they do, they will tell you in a minute because they are busy haha‚Ä¶ most people chose to take a nap during this awful cruise lol don‚Äôt waste your time or money.

title: P√©sima atenci√≥n y trato al cliente
text:
En lugar de un paseo en barco parece que contratamos una Gymkana, ya que estuvimos m√°s de media hora intentando localizar el mostrador donde recoger los tickets: nos mandaron a una ubicaci√≥n err√≥nea a 1km de distancia, nadie nos descolgaba el tel√©fono pese a llamar m√°s de 5 veces y cuando finalmente encontramos el mostrador (tapado con unos carteles publicitarios), se lavaron las manos diciendo que era nuestra culpa haber perdido el barco, el cu√°l sali√≥ 5 minutos antes de la hora contratada. La chica de recepci√≥n se excus√≥ diciendo que su compa√±era era nueva pero no nos devolvieron el dinero y la √∫nica soluci√≥n que nos dieron fue cambiar la reserva al d√≠a siguiente, que ya no est√°bamos por Lisboa.
P√©sima atenci√≥n y trato al cliente. Nada recomendado!

title: Valentine's cruise is Lisbon
text:
We went to the Valentine's Day dinner cruise in Lisbon. I got the tickets at Get your guide, as a valentine's gift to my boyfriend. It said the cruise would have relaxing music and romantic setting. I emailed the company to reserve a window table (as I didn't have the tables map, I couldn't see the tables, so I only chose a random number from the ones offered to me). Arriving at the boat, we were greeted with a small glass of champagne. And that was the whole romantic setting during the whole cruise. We were taken to the upper deck and shown our table. The table was set against a wall between a window and a door. We couldn't see anything, unless we leant back. Also, to our surprise, there was another couple sat at our table, which completely broke the atmosphere. Also, nothing in the boat reminded us of a romantic atmosphere, no decoration or flowers or even candles around. There was only a very small red candle at the centre of the table. The music was also far from relaxing, we felt like being at a disco. When it got to a more romantic selection, mostly based in the 80s, the songs wouldn't be played in their entirety, they would only play the beginning and cut to another song. We were served the food and had a choice of 2 wine types - red or white. The wine was nor paired with the type of food being served. Also, the waiters had to come to your table to top up on the wine, however, for some reason, they went to the same tables but skipped ours, which was really frustrating. For a good part of the meal, we ended up drinking only water. We tried to get the atten5of the waiters, but they always seemed very bad tempered and paid little attention to us. After getting up and chasing a waiter, they finally came to top our wine up.
The food was average and the soup was nor very warm. The dishes from previous courses were not collected and they only fully cleaned our table near the end.
The bathrooms were also very awful. In the women's bathrooms, there were only 2 stalls. One was very wet on the floor, with puddles everywhere and it smelled bad. The second one was not flushing.
Overall, it was a very underwhelming experience, and I don't recommend.

title: Friendly but small
text: Friendly staff, but the entrance fee is with 10‚Ç¨ a bit too much regarding the two small walls to climb. The entrance is a bit hard to find. Important to know ist that they only allow the use of liquid chalk, which you can purchase from them. The route difficulty is questionable

title: Vestigios bar - Lisbon
text: Very weak. Bad view of the river. The music is very messy. You don't understand any rhythm. Coffee and cocktail from middle down.

title: This place is a mistake
text: Terrible place, very unpleasent staff (especially owner ) really You should avoid this place. There is a lot of very nice places arround.

title: I regret I booked with this company.
text: The driver never showed up or communicated with me. We waited, searched called, texted. No customer service. We had to take Uber and had to request a refund .

title: Avoid this agency at all costs!
text:
I booked an activity with this agency on GET YOUR GUIDE carefully planned my trip, and even took days off to enjoy the experience. Less than two hours before the scheduled time, they cancelled everything ‚Äî no real apology, no responsibility, just a cold ‚Äúwe are overbooked‚Äù message, as if ruining someone‚Äôs plans was completely normal.

The person handling the communication showed zero professionalism, zero empathy, and absolutely no sense of customer service. It felt like dealing with amateurs playing at running a business, not serious professionals‚Ä¶.This agency is chaotic, unreliable, and disrespectful. Trusting them with your time and money is a huge risk ‚Äî you could end up with ruined plans and no solutions, exactly like what happened to me.

There are many serious agencies that know how to respect their clients.
This is not one of them. Stay away if you value your time, your money, and your peace of mind.

title: Disappointed cancellation
text: My tour never happened as it was cancelled at 8pm the previous evening when I was advised the guide had called in sick. Very disappointing. Luckily I was able to find another tour company with one spare ticket!

title: Nie wieder!
text:
Besteck der Luxusklasse gekauft. Im Gesch√§ft alles top. In die Schweiz geliefert wurde 2. Klassware. Nicht poliert, mit Kratzer. Nach Reklamation am Hauptsitz keine Antwort. Dann eine Abholungseinladung f√ºr das Besteck von DHL. R√ºcksendung des teuren Bestecks an Vista Alegre. Seither nichts mehr geh√∂rt. Das sind jetzt 8 Wochen... Bis heute keine Antwort auf die verschiedenen Mails, noch wurde der bezahlte Betrag zur√ºckerstattet.
K√∂nnen Vista Alegre √ºberhaupt nicht empfehlen, auch wenn sie bald 200 Jahre im Gesch√§ft ist.

title: P√©ssimo atendimento!
text: Sempre passo na Vista Alegre quando estou em Lisboa e compro uma louca. Desta vez peguei um bowl, pelo balan√ßo da prateleira o suporte de prato balan√ßou e o prato caiu na prateleira, fez barulho mas n√£o quebrou nada! A vendedora veio perguntou se tinha acontecido algo, eu disse q estava tudo certo mas q o suporte era fr√°gil e ela grosseiramente nos disse que dever√≠amos ser mais cuidadosos e nem foi ver ou colocar o prato no lugar. Atendimento p√©ssimo! Resultado perderam a venda e a cliente.

title: Vodafone not an option for roaming in Europe
text: Bought a 30 day/20 GB card at Porto airport, good service. Card supposed to cover Europe incl. Turkey and now 13 days into the 30 days, no connection. Can't ring English speaking Vodafone Portugal as the line for English when ringing from outside Portugal can't be used when card is not working...hello?? Local Vodafone rep in Istanbul unable to assist as different company...??? So in short, don't use Vodafone

title: Sleight of hand
text: Be very wary when getting your SIM card, that it actually carries the advertised 10GB/30 days. The SIM card I was given only had 2GB. When the attendant inserts the SIM card at the Kiosk, check your phone's mobile data availability to ensure you have received the correct SIM card GB amount before paying and leaving the store.

title: Bad experience with the tour
text: I'm not happy with the walking tour I choose since it's difficult to find out where the tour group is, even I already stand by there.

title: Some cool pics, a lot of shaking
text: It was shaking us the whole time to like simulate flying or something? Good way to see some views but nothing super special. Was so nauseous after for the rest of the day. Would not do again

title: terrible experience
text: I started with high expectations, but unfortunately I was disappointed. It was not a flying experience, but a shaking. I was nauseous and couldn't wait for it to end. It could have been so much better. The image was blurry, people with glasses get VR glasses fogged up. Sound quality was not good. Would not recommend.

title: Bad experience in Serra da Estrela
text: Bad experience. I do not recommend. We paid a lot for a 10 hour tour in Serra da Estrela, leaving Porto, and the itinerary sold is not compatible with the time, as it is 5 hours on the road including round trip and it is not possible to do everything promised (Covilh√£, Torre, Sabugueiro and Seia) and have lunch at 5h. Even more so with the unfavorable weather of rain and fog that we experienced. We were misguided and ended up disadvantaged, only making the first two stops. Very frustrating!

title: Just a car service with poor guidance!
text: I can not say the tour was terrible but there was very little guidance. We found ourselves being dropped off at locations and on our own to figure things out. It was basically a driving service to these locations and just for that it was overpriced. I would not recommend this company.

title: Racist, Rude.
text: Racist and rude at the same time. Stay away from his tours, very racist and rude he openly talks about how the people he makes money of are ruining the city and makes you feel uncomfortable.

title: El gu√≠a NO acudi√≥ al tour reservado
text:
Vergonzoso. Reservamos el tour con antelaci√≥n confiando en RagnarokTour. Al llegar al punto de encuentro a la hora indicada, nos encontramos que ning√∫n gu√≠a acude. Tras llamar y poner varios mensajes nadie responde tampoco, por lo que los planes que ten√≠amos se cancelaron sin que tuvi√©ramos forma de encontrar alternativas ni recibir explicaciones.

Sin Duda una experiencia p√©sima que dejan una sensaci√≥n bastante amarga

title: Bad experience
text:
Bad experience. I do not recommend.
No customer care, no common sense, they just follow rules without any critical sense.

title: Dirty and gloomy
text:
This place is deplorable and very dirty
There was hair everywhere on the floor received by a not very friendly person. I asked if they provided towels and they told me they never made the bed.
I find that this is misleading advertising, received a lottery gift card with 1 night included, breakfast and dinner.
You had the impression of being in a dismal place. I will report this to the regional prefect because I, myself, a tourism staff, would not dare offer this to my guests.

title: Not as advertised
text:
There must have been an error. Our airport transport to our hotel did not come. We called the service on our confirmation but they said they did not get that order number and did not come. We had to beg other services to get us a car to take us to our hotel.

We tried to get a refund from Expedia. After several emails they refused to give us our refund citing that they gave our money to the transportation company and could not get a refund from the company. Too bad. Thankfully our credit carrier guarantees our payment and refunded us the money

title: Imperia urban transport
text:
Public transport is third world!!!
They don't run at the scheduled time, no one can give you explanations at the terminus in Piazza Dante. Tourists are left waiting up to an hour to travel through the city.
A shame!!!

title: Spammers at the airport
text: CAUTION: if you need to get from the airport to anywhere in Lisbon, beware of scammers. Someone will ask you if you want a taxi. They take you to a private car with no metre. At your destination, they will tell you it costs more than ‚Ç¨200 which should cost about ‚Ç¨20. Lots of yelling involved. Not a good way to start your trip. Take a licensed taxi or public transport.

title: Better change for walking tour
text: I was very disappointed with the tour of Lisbon. We visited in a van, almost didn‚Äôt stop anywhere and I had trouble understanding the English of the guide.

title: Not helpful.
text: We‚Äôve booked a trip trough e-mail. The mails were helpful and friendly. We also payed in advance trough the website-link in the email. At the start of the tour nobody came. After 20 min, I get a response that I didn‚Äôt booked a tour. Although they confirmed by email and the money was transferred. ( I could see this on my account). We‚Äôve contacted the company but there was no initiative to sort this out because the system didn‚Äôt send a confirmation so they couldn‚Äôt do anything, We had a stressful afternoon calling their booking firm and our bank to sort this out. We really regret that WHTT was not helpful to sort this out. Would have been nice if they tried more, they really made us feel like scammers.

title: Just your average free walking tour - but for 40‚Ç¨!
text:
Unstructured, false facts, and no sight of the promised socio-political discussions. Especially towards the end it just turned into an enlistment of places: "This is the university. This is the hospital. This is a nice sunset view.", all without additional info. Most questions that would lead to a deeper discussion were turned down with a quick superficial answer by our guide Teresa.
Still two stars, because I think the idea of stopping for some traditional drinks and snacks is a good idea.
Otherwise I definitely felt like we wasted 80‚Ç¨!!! and 3hrs on a loop that we could've walked by ourselves.

We might've just been unlucky with the guide, but the tour was far from what "We Hate Toursim" promises to be special at.

title: Disappointing Day with David
text:
David was NOT a good tour guide. Firstly, he did not the follow itinerary as outlined on the website. In addition, we did not attend all of the sites that are listed. He did not know how to drive the van, which made me carsick. Most disappointingly, we spent only 30 minutes at Palace of Pena and were discouraged to tour inside.
We were seated in the third row of the van and struggled to hear any of David‚Äôs instructions and/or commentary. This led to us being confused the ENTIRE day. On top that, at each stop we were left to wander without guidance. His restaurant recommendation, Tasca do Xico, was underwhelming to say the least.
Maybe it was an off day for David, but this was a waste of ‚Ç¨69 and 8 hours of my day.

title: Small car and air conditioning off!
text: Unpleasant experience with the guide Carla/Karla, the route is beautiful, but I suggest other tourists to look for another company that does the tour. I felt going for military enlistment not for a tourist tour. Small car to accommodate with comfort the 8 people (5 were fat and unfortunately need to suit the current needs of the population), to turn on the air conditioning we had to ask (because the guide was only with her window open, the passengers who were in the last benches were mainly the ones who suffered the most from the heat.

title: Fatima tour
text: We booked this as a small tour group. We were lumped together as a group of 4 mini busses on the day of. After a delay of 1 hour and another delay for a flat tire we arrived at our first stop. This was the gift shop outside Fatima which for some unkown reason we stayed there for over an hour despite all the delays. We arrived in Fatima around noon and then were ushered to lunch at a restaraunt we did not pick and had a meal of fish with the rest of the group which by this time we realised they all knew each other. The rest of the tour was kind of rushed because of all the dalys and a lengthy luncheon. While we did enjoy the stops we made we felt that we did not get what we had booked for.

title: Disappointment
text:
Started the trip where it would end according to the brochure.
Brochure shows pictures of places wich aint part of the tour.
No information in the brochure or on website about duration for the places to visit.
At 10.00 we had to pay the entrance fee cash for the Pena castle...then tickets could be booked for a visit at 15.00.
Lot of traffic delay on the way to Sintra and spend 1,5 hour for lunch and a little walk.
Extra money for bustransfer with a waiting queue and no information about this in advance.
1 hour only left to visit the castle... no
time for the park.
The Pena castle a UNESCO site would be the highlight of the
day...but became a disappointment due to a badly organized program.

title: Terrible experience
text: My family and I took the tour "full day group tour to Sintra, Cascais, Estotil, Cabo da Roca and Estoril" by Whereto.pt. our experience is so bad that my husband and I can't calm down for two days now. I have never experienced such a bad organization for a visit to a national UNESCO site. unfortunately Pena Palace in Sintra was just a "hello and bye" visit for us. an hour or even less time to visit such a site is ridiculous. wasting an unnecessarily long time in souvenir towns and restaurants. coordinating the tour with the wishes of the group participating in it was unfortunately out of the question in our case.

title: Terrible experience
text:
Our experience is terrible. Not enough words to describe this bad trip.
Poor driving style of the driver. All the time chatting about everything but else the sights.
Reverse order of the tour.
No entrance tickets pre-booked to the most visited place in Portugal Sintra Palace. Therefore too little time to visit the park and castle. We almost had to run through the palace to see the castle from the outside and take a few pictures.
Asking for cash to make a reservation without explaining the price structure. Not return change. Paid a lot of money for minimal experience.
I will definitely not recommend this provider

title: Rude Carla
text: Carla was the most unprofessional and rudest driver and tour guide I‚Äôve had in my 35 years of traveling around the world. She spoke to all of her Guest rudely and dismissively, and continued to take calls from her family when she should have been telling us about the trip. It was inexcusable. I would not recommend her to anyone.

title: Poor service. The driver blamed us for leaving the group when he told us to get out and catch the Metro. An absolute lie
text: The vehicle was not appropriate. It was uncomfortable - not enough leg room or body room. We were both squashed in the front seat. The air con did not work in the back. We paid the driver cash to purchase tickets to Pena Castle. We gave him ‚Ç¨35 and he told us he didn't have change on him, but would give it to us later. He never did. The driver's skills were poor and he was doing 120kph+ on the highway in 100kph limit. At the end of the tour the driver told us he could not return us to our hotel because the roads were closed for the parade. He told us to get out and catch the Metro and go 2 stops. We had difficulty buying tickets as we only speak English. Locals helped us buy them at our cost and it was 3 stops then a 15 minute walk to our hotel. Very poor customer service. Would not recommend to anyone.

title: Too bad...
text:
I liked the place and the music. Our Guide Antonio was very friendly. But I did not understand in the experience what could justify the Award of 45 ‚Ç¨ (...?)
I think the concept needs to be revisited because many of us feel we've been ripped off with this activity. We were served 3 olives and a piece of bread as tapas then a dish that barely satisfied us, no dessert... I stay on my end

title: Too expensive
text: Faro evening is far too expensive and can easily be done WITHOUT a guide - for half the price! It's a shame because the guide made a lot of effort.

title: Not Professional tour leader.
text:
I would like to send a email of complaint from the recent Fado tour experience, on January 4th, 2023.

I found the guide not very professional and as a tour guide needs to be reviewed.

The food I found of the restaurant to be very average, as well there was an incident with another gentleman on the tour who was taking both videos and photos of both the group and the restaurant. He didn‚Äôt even ask permission to take videos and pics of the group, I found this very offensive, and I asked the guide to speak to the gentleman, but refused and said it was my responsibility.

I found that as a tour guide is responsible for the group, and take action when required.

I would like a follow up with both him, is name was Marco, and your company.

I think some sort of compensation from your company for my bad experience.

title: Go to O‚ÄôGilins Irish pub instead
text: Worst pub crawl I‚Äôve ever been on. The workers did nothing to get the crowd interacting together. Don‚Äôt book

title: Keep on walking
text:
Food:
The food was average at best‚Äînothing to write home about. The plates came out at different times, which made the meal feel disjointed.

Atmosphere and setting:
Located next to a bus and tram stop, the area is quite noisy, which detracts from the experience.

Staff:
Service was slow, with a 15-minute wait before we were even served. The staff were unfriendly and unwelcoming. P

Value for money:
Overpriced and feels like a classic tourist trap.

Comments:
While it‚Äôs worth a quick visit to see and taste some wine, I‚Äôd recommend skipping the food. There are much better options in the area.

title: Cheese board without bread
text: Cheese board of 19 euros. Without bread. Ask for some bread. Are the sandwiches for 8 euros on the bill. You can't eat olive oil and cheese spread without bread.

title: A WALK IN THE WOODS
text:
Where to start ???
Between waiting for a smile from the waitress and the arrival of the dishes, don't be afraid of getting older,
First of all, my partner thinks it‚Äôs an excellent, or I say brilliant, idea to order a sangria,
The most disgusting one of his life, he told me!
(and God only knows how much he drank)
Let's move on, he almost choked on a bark or rather a tree trunk that was in the glass (supporting photo)
We order our dish, a salad for me and a plate of Iberian ham for the gentleman
The shock was terrible, when the plates were placed on the table we were left speechless!
4 VULGAR SLICES OF RAW HAM, which were chasing each other on the plate (more than 13 euros) and regarding my salad, a huge joke as it was so livid, my husband raised his head for a long time thinking that it was tree leaves around, Surprise there was no tree in sight!
We won't talk about all these beggars coming to spoil this splendid feast, can't the monk from the monastery opposite accommodate them?
I therefore give the rating one star because zero being impossible to my sad regret,
ESCAPE AT ALL COSTS, EVEN RUN AND LOSE YOUR BACKPACK.

title: Much better to find
text:
Restaurant without much interest. For us it is a tourist trap with a view of the Monastery.
Be careful about billing for the blanket even when you are on the terrace in full sun without using it!!!

title: Filthy, rude tourist rip-off
text: Awful and surly service. Absolutely filthy table, and swamped by flies. A homeless lady pestered customers constantly and the staff did nothing. Worst of all, they brought what we assumed were complimentary olives - which we didn‚Äôt order and didn‚Äôt eat - which they then charged for. When I complained, they refused to refund us and said we should have sent them back

title: Bad service
text: Should have had a simple lunch. It took a very long time to get it and some of what we ordered never arrived. The guests at the next table asked for salt, which never came either. There were three young girls who worked there, they probably thought it was more exciting to talk to each other than to serve. I don't think they thought about (or cared about) that we could see from the outdoor terrace, that they just stood there chatting the whole time. Several customers left when they were not served, or did not receive their food. Probably should have done that too. Also had to run after them to get paid. The food was decent when it finally arrived, but eat somewhere else.

title: No personal service!
text: When tasting wines, I expect personal service with advice on what I might like. This place has two vending machines (I kid you not). And they ‚Äúweren‚Äôt doing flights,‚Äù the Saturday we stopped in.

title: Mostly Out of Order
text: 3 of the 4 tasting stations were out of order. The 1 working station had 5 choices, ranging from 2.5 to 4 euros for a tiny pour. Displayed wine seems disorganized. Don't bother.

title: Call first!
text: In reality it is not a review because for 2 consecutive days we showed up at 5.30pm and found it closed with a sign warning us that the place was occupied by a private event. Note that they only put up the sign a few hours earlier. It's best to call first to avoid unpleasant surprises!

title: False advertising
text: They sold us tickets while aware that they would not be able to fulfill the contract on New Years Eve leaving us making other last minute arrangements

title: Cancelled right before the tour, no alternative.
text: Our guide Silvia first didn't want to make an invoice for us then stopped replying all together (after we already paid), then a couple of hours before the tour she cancelled without as much as a chat or message. When I chatted her, she answered saying: I have Covid. No other hosts were available and now we need to find a different activity with only hours to go. When I asked if she could send us the list of restaurants etc. so we could do the tour ourselves she send 1 option. Ofcourse if she indeed has COVID she could have cancelled in the morning straight away, or at least send a message with the cancelation. I do not recommend, and we do not feel like this host was in any way honest, authentic or helpful. Terrible, be careful booking Silvia in Lisbon.

title: Unreliable
text:
They cancelled our food tour at the last minute. The cancellation reason given was that it was due to the guide having "personal reasons".

They did not offer an alternative date/time for the tour.

title: Tour cancelled last minute
text: Booked the 6:30pm food tour months in advance with tour cancelled via email at 2:42pm. Reason given was that it was a public holiday and there were lots of parades. The parades for Freedom Day were concluded that morning. I now question the professionalism of this tour group as this could have been avoided...lucky I just happened to look at my emails. I also wonder how often this has occurred.

title: Was cancelled
text: Unfortunately the tour was cancelled at the last minute by the service provider, due to personal reasons. Luckily we got our money back fast.

title: Tours are good - tsunami of review requests afterwards is really annoying
text:
Unfortunately, I wouldn't use withlocals again. After the tour, you get a tsunami of requests for reviews. It's fair enough that the tour guide asks once but the company becomes insistent. They ask you to review on their platform, then Trip Advisor, then Trust Pilot. Even after I asked them to stop, they emailed twice again tonight asking for reviews here on Trip Advisor, which I had already done.

It's a shame for the tour guides. I would simply contact them individually if I was back in their cities, and cut withlocals completely out of the transaction.

title: Lisbon Day 1 - Private Kickstart tour.
text: Very Disappointing. We booked a private guide for a 90 minute tour of the key sites and history of Lisbon through Tripadvisor, rather than the free tours. Our guide Amanda, changed the meeting location of the walk an hour or so before the start to Miradoura Sao Pedro de Alcantara. Ok we thought a different route and more to see. We climb to the start, the guide is 10 mins late, but did let us know and was very apologetic. We set off on a winding walk through the streets of Biarra Alto, Chiado and Biaxa, ending up at the waterfront. whilst the guide was chatty, there was no real structure to the stops, little information on the history etc. Some nice info about current shops and restaurants, but we had to ask to get info. She then finished 15mins early and didn‚Äôt go toward the castle where we expected to finish. We learnt more going into the Lisbon Story exhibit at the square for 7‚Ç¨ afterwards than on her tour. For ‚Ç¨44 each we would have an expected a more informative guide.

title: Worst food tour ever!
text:
We were so disappointed by this tour! Firstly, Ana showed up in messy stained clothes that didn't make us feel like this was a professional tour guide at all.

Secondly, while she did show us a couple of nice sites and knew the history a bit, this was a food tour, not a city tour. We only got our first dishes an hour after we met her and it felt like she just randomly chose a restaurant and had us walk in.

When we got there she wasn't sure if the kitchen was open or closed, they initially told her it was closed. She didn't know how to order the food either, we sat there for 20 mins before she realised she had to go to the bar to order food.

She ordered us four tapas, but she never showed us the menu. I saw the receipt when she got it, it was 30 euros.

We were both very hungry after still and thought she'd take us somewhere for a main course. But she informed us it was the 6 tasting tour, but I checked my receipt and said it was the 10, but she said no it was the 6.

I paid ¬£150 for two of us and to get 4 average tapas and then for the apparently '6th' tasting was a pastel de natas from the main shop near Baxia, the one that literally every tourist goes.

I felt like I wasted so much money on this tour. I had done food tours in other places (Venice, Paris etc) and they all cost less and I got way more and way better food!

Imagine a food tour that takes you to one average restaurant for a few starters and for a ¬£1 pastry at the end!!!

That's absurd!!

title: Bad weather alert
text: On the day of the tour a bad weather alert was issue, and the tour guide contacted us to propose postponing the tour. While we agreed with the proposal, we couldn‚Äôt reschedule it due to our tight itinerary; hence we had to cancel. Now VIATOR said that we are responsible for the cancellation and they won‚Äôt do the refund. It is surprising that we are able to manage the weather, I didn‚Äôt know that I had that superpower.

title: Disappointing tour- only 3 food stops and guide was late
text: Our host was over 30 mins late due to a family emergency. Although she added in a trip on a tram it meant we were running late for our evening reservation and had no time to change in between. I‚Äôm not sure it is really a foodie tour, we learned about local history and saw some impressive churches but it wasn‚Äôt so food focused. With 6 ‚Äòtastings‚Äô I was expecting 6 different stops for food/drink when in fact there were 3.

title: Awful experience
text: Guide over booked. Said he would be an hour late. We waited, never showed up. Sat on steps while trying to connect trip advisor or the local company or the guide. Avoid !

title: Short cancellation notice.
text: Short cancellation notice. Based on reviews, think we would have really enjoyed this - but sort of left us in a lurch at the last minute and was notified by email- no phone call.

title: Cancelled the tour 2 minutes out
text: They cancelled on me 2 minutes before the tour began. My party and I were already at the meet up point and had planned our whole day around this event. They didn‚Äôt provide any notice, explanation, or offer to reschedule. I understand emergencies happen but there was no follow up which was pretty unprofessional.

title: Guide cancelled the morning of our tour on our first day in Lisbon with no effort to rebook us.
text:
Our guide cancelled the day of our tour with no reason. Found out as soon as I checked in the hotel and had internet. Not a great welcome to lisbon. And no effort at all to have us rebook a tour. We were so looking forward to a private tour and we were willing to pay the extra money.
Why did another person not step in? Why not try to add us to another tour?

title: OUCH
text: I wanted a private Tuk Tuk tour of Lisbon but I informed the tour guide that I have Parkinson‚Äôs and heart problems. The tour guide continued with the tour, driving over cobblestones and pits in the road. She knew I had medical issues but continued with the tour. Zero out of ten for human concern.

title: Do not take this tour!
text:
This tour was advertised as 3 hours with a ‚Äúhistoric tour of Alfama ‚Äú along with the food. Instead it lasted 2 hours ( at 6:30 pm our guide announced it was over- we had started at 4:30). Actually the tour started 20 minutes late because we could not find our guide at the meeting point. We walked all around the Praca ( which was the most unsafe area we felt since being in Lisbon) looking for her or him. We did not receive any communication from her or indication in the instructions how to identify her. I tried messaging her through trip advisor. We finally approached a woman standing alone. She said she tried to telephone us but we didn‚Äôt receive anything.
Later, after the tour, on a message came through.
The tour took place near the square and Chiado area, not Alfama! We explained to her we were disappointed in this so she was kind enough to escort us to Alfama after the tour. The food and drink was authentic ( 3 tastings each) but cost about 20 euro and we paid $155 for the two of us!! A complete rip off!

Our guide was lovely and informative but overall this was the worst Trip Advisor tour we have ever been on over the years! Not worth our time or money! We had just done the Guru Walks tour of Chiado, Baixa and Barrio Alto that morning and it was fantastic! Very professional! Plus we didn‚Äôt need to be touring around the same area once again in the evening for this food tour.

title: Let Down at the Last Minute
text: We were really looking forward to this tour and were hugely disappointed when just over an hour before the start our guide said she had to postpone because she was not feeling well which effectively meant we had to cancel. I understand people get ill but surely for a premium price a) we could have had a bit more notice and/or b) there could be a contingency plan. Lisbon is a lovely city with great food though.

title: Awful service, last minute cancellation
text: Our guide did not turn up and I totally would not respond to our messages or phone calls. When he eventually did respond, he informed us he had transferred the booking to a colleague and provided his details. We then couldn‚Äôt get hold of this colleague either. We have requested a refund. Awful service and we were only able to stay in Lisbon for 2 days.

title: Extremely disappointing and NOT a ‚Äúfood‚Äù tour
text: We had such high expectations but were sorely disappointed. First the tour company asked us to move our tour time up by an hour which we agreed to accommodate. But then the guide showed up half hour late making us wait. The first hour and half of the tour was walking around the Mouraria historic district which was nice, but not the purpose of the tour. We wanted a food tour. We were expecting 6 tastings at 6 different spots typical to our experiences with other walking food tours in cities like Miami, Chicago, Shanghai but she just took us to 2 spots and all we had was a pork sandwich, a beer, some cheese and bread and scrambled eggs. I‚Äôd booked this tour for an ‚Äúaward winning‚Äù experience and was hoping to at least sample some seafood and pastel de nata or samosas like we read about in the reviews. I guess it really depends on which guide you get. The experience is not consistent. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this company.

title: Totally disappointing!
text: This tour was a waste of money and time. We basically had a pastry, an ice cream, a shot of cherry liquor and a barely edible piece of overly salted, half burnt chorizo as award winning food tour. Our tour guide, Rodrigo, was overly opinionated and not accommodating. He started with telling us how many languages he spoke and where he studied which were totally irrelevant to the tour. When at 12:30 noon he started with pastry and I asked him that we preferred food before dessert, he just continued with the sweets. The next stop after pasties de nata was ice cream and then cherry liquor. The only food we were offered was the chorizo, half of which we did not touch due to being very salty and burnt. He stopped at two hours, despite my ticket clearly stating a 3- hour food. We have had award winning food tours in Barcelona by Withlocals and in Madrid with Devour food and loved both of them. This one was like a bad joke and a true waste of time and money. I am disappointed since it was a tour by Withlocals and we had a great experience with them in Barcelona. I warn travelers to avoid this tour.

title: A scam
text:
This tour was a scam
We did not get contacted by anyone leading up to it. We arrived at the designated meeting spot 10 min late with no one in sight .
Sadly , a follow up was also not initiated .
Our advice , avoid prepaying ‚Ä¶

title: Did not live up to the review.
text: The guide asked to delay our tour for one hour, which we agreed to, and then was 40 minutes late on top of that. She took us to a few spots that anyone could easily find and did not add much value in terms of knowledge of the city or food. Overall the tour was overpriced and not for a foodie.

title: Worst experience in all of Portugal
text: Terrible and boring. Went to one restaurant where our guide ordered a little bit of food for us to taste and the. She asked us where we wanted to go! Worst experience and huge waste of money and time! Do not use this company. They are a huge fraud.

title: WITH LOCALS tour operators are terrible
text: I was stood up for this very expensive skip the line with ticket tour. The tour operator, With Locals, never showed. After I texted, called and left a message they finally responded. They could not find a substitute guide. This was the second time in Portugal that we were stood up by WITH LOCALS. I received a message thAT I will receive a refund IN THE FUTURE but I was unable to enter the museum on our last day and our half day was ruined.TripAdvisor would not answer phone.

title: Never Use This Company
text:
We booked a private tour with Alexandra M for our group of 8 adults for an all day trip. Our guide was not great at communication but I talked to her while in town so thought all was good. I emailed with her the day before asking about pick up location, but no response. So at 11:00 pm the night before our trip I emailed again. Within minutes I got a cancellation email with no explanation. I emailed her asking what was going on but never got a response.
This company ruined our vacation, we had to try and piece together a last minute trip without any help.
Reached out to Withlocals and they said her car broke down and she couldn't rent one, which is a lie. There was a van available to rent, had she contacted us we would have rented the van and we could have gone on our trip.
Withlocals said sorry and offered me a 20% discount, what a joke.
Would never use this company, especially Alexandra M

title: Citt√† Patrimonio UNESCO üôÑü§îüò≤
text:
Nulla da disquisire sul patrimonio artistico e naturalistico. Complimenti a coloro che hanno saputo valorizzare al meglio ogni Pianta ed ogni Pietra

Complimenti anche a coloro che hanno trasformato questa cittadina in una efficientissima macchina x mungere soldi ai turisti che la visitano.

title: Stay Away!!
text: We had a group of eight booked for an entire day van trip with a local name Alexandra M for almost a month. At 11:30 PM the night before our trip sheet canceled without any notification or further communication. Completely unprofessional, completely worthless the company. Stay away and never use their service.

title: Tours Cancelled
text: Host cancelled 2 tours with very little notice and only after I contacted them to confirm pick-up details.

title: Short Notice Cancellation
text: Cancelled with 90 min notice. Finally offered another tour 6 1/2 hrs later. We canceled and toured on our own.

title: COMPANY NOT CUSTOMER ORIENTED
text: During my stay in Portugal I planned three trips with this company. The guides were lovely and I enjoyed my time. However, I felt the company lacked any sense of customer service and will never use them again. I had to cancel a tour days in advance because of a train strike, so I asked for a refund. I was disappointed that they would not provide one given the circumstances. However the truly awful part is that the guide agreed to refund his portion. With locals.com suddenly changed their policy so they would not facilitate his portion of the return, despite they take the money and handle the economics. My guide was left struggling trying to figure out how to make the refund happen. Terrible customer Orientation. I no longer trust this company and instead will use airbnb experiences or other competitors

title: They cancelled last minute
text: Tour company cancelled last minute. Wasted my time and my getting ro the meet up point. They posted the tour was available on the day.

title: We have not received the tiles
text: Although Marie Caroline made an effort to attend us on a different date than we had hired, it is also true that she promised to send us the tiles we painted, but it has been three months and we have not received anything yet. Tiles for which we previously pay an extra for having decorations: cork, hanging rope and frames. We have sent several messages and every time we have contacted her she has promised to send them. We feel cheated and ripped off by Marie Caroline. With this comment we just want to draw attention and simply send us what is properly ours. Our next step will be to contact consumer support to reach a more serious claim.

title: Yes to 2 conditions only!!
text: The workshop itself is really good. The big problem is after... if you are able to pick up your tiles w days later, everything is fine. If his oven works, everything's fine. If you answer no to one of his conditions... FORGET IT! Run... because you'll be waiting for your tiles a very, very long time. It took months in our case and we had to involve Airbnb because it was part of their experience.

title: Too much time in the bus, too little time in cities
text: First off, the tour guide Gui was great, knowledgeable, and very friendly. He was not the issue. The issue is that this tour is completely ill conceived. You'll have 45 minutes in each place, an hour for lunch, and the rest of the day in the bus (which starts at 8am and ends around 8.00-8.30pm). Nazar√© isn't even worth seeing unless it's in the winter because the waves are small and oftentimes you can barely see then because of the mist. Obidos and Porto were very nice, I just wish we could've had more time there. My advice: go on a day trip to Porto (or Obidos AND Nazarey if you want), and spend some quality time there. This tour is great if you want to see as much as possible in a superficial way. If you really want to see or experience a place, it's not the best choice.

title: Worst experience ever
text: I was probably late for max 5 mins back to our last meeting point in Porto and the guide, the tour, the bus, everyone was gone. I couldn‚Äôt reach out to anyone, contact number put me on a voice machine saying not available during non business hours (it was a weekend). So just like that I was left in Porto without any support, no one tried to reach out to me even if they had my numbers and my phone had been available the entire time. And I had to figure out a way to come back to Lisbon. So it‚Äôs really a terrible trip ever. I went on many tours everywhere and never had an issue.

title: This is not what we mean by a "flight over Lisbon"
text:
What is meant by "helicopter flight over Lisbon"?

We actually assumed that the flight would take us over the city.
However, it went along the Tagus River towards Ponte 25 de Abril. Shortly before the bridge, the pilot swung to the right and flew back on the other side of the river, facing away from the city.
The pace was very slow, we could see the gas and concrete plants well and for a long time. But not the city.
Well...

title: Money thrown out
text: The guides were excellent, but the tour does not explain how little time is in Nazar√©, obidos and Porto. We picked Obidos almost all closed and was super rushed to such a beautiful town. Nazareth was open, but also run d+ 45min is nothing of time. As for Porto the logistics very poor tb, 1hr walking tour for 20 to 30min for shopping does not roll. Outside the end of the tour is in an area with far fewer trades than the beginning. The lunch time is short too. I repeat, my critic is the company that created the tour! The guides were some loves.

title: Unprofessional!!! Customer service
text:
Unfortunately really bad!! Customer service unprofessional!!!!!! If you use this trip you gotta watch your guide if not they leave you, they worry for you money no for give you a tour. I waited on time in the same drop off location and they leaves me with my family in ovidios town. thanks god for the lady in tourist office help us to come back Lisboa, because the customer service's guy from world experience company, he didn't try to help us with information. He only said it's your fault, you have to come back to Lisbon, And hung up the call.
We are tourists, we don't know your language and we pay for see your culture at least have manners with customers!
Very very unprofessional!!!

title: Do not reccomend
text:
The guide was good, but the trip to Porto is not well organized.
In the most beautiful part of the city, where the bridges are, we spent only 5 minutes, while we crossed the bridge in a hurry!
The tour may be suitable for older people, but for those who can, I recommend visiting Porto on your own (possibly a free local tour).

title: Good knowledge but poor tour route planning
text: The tour guide was very knowledgeable, kind and considerate however the structure of the tour was not good. We missed the most beautiful and scenic parts of the city to accommodate older members of the group. Long bathroom breaks again focusing on the comfort and pace of the older members. The trip should allow all to enjoy the what the city has to offer and give recommendations of a more scenic route. If the group consists of many older members who find it difficult to go up hill, then the tour ahould be split to allow other to also visit areas they feel will offer the the full expereince of the city. Honestly i only experienced porto in the last 20 minutes of the tour.

title: An Expensive Bus Ride
text:
Unfortunately we did not have a good time on the tour. Both operators we nice but the entire tour was set up poorly and was not worth the price. So the whole tour takes 13 hrs start to finish on a bus. From Lisbon, you drive an hour to a small village, you have 40min to walk to a castle and back, really no time to even use a restroom.

Second, you drive another hour, you stop at a fishing village with large waves, another 40min stop where by the time you see the waves you are almost out of time to find a snack or use restroom. Next your are on the bus another 2.5 hrs straight to Porto. This stop you have an hour on your own for lunch at 2pm -3pm. Then about 2 hr walking tour that is nice but no entrances covered or times to go into the sites. So you see a bit of downtown Porto, walk a bridge, and get back on the bus for what is a 4 hr ride back to Lisbon. Out of 13 hrs, you are out of the bus a total of 4.5hrs. Of which there is active instruction while out of the bus for 1.5-2hrs. For the money, it‚Äôs essentially a super long round trip bus fare. Just take a train to Porto if you want to see it, maybe stay a night. Its transatlantic amounts of travel (NYC to Lisbon is 8 hrs) and no activities for very high tour price

title: horrible experience, don‚Äôt book if you want to be treated with respect
text: I have been on a lot of tours in over 20 countries and never have I been treated in the way this tour has. I‚Äôve been on rushed itineraries sure‚Ä¶ our group was late to the meeting point once by no more than 5 minutes and were threatened to be left behind in the middle of Portugal because we got slightly lost on the way back. We were again threatened to be left behind because I was in the bathroom for one more minute than they liked after never clearly communicating what time we were supposed to get back on the bus. I understand we have a lot of spots to hit but a lack of basic respect for paying customers after very human and minor delays is unacceptable. I genuinely felt like a 10-year-old on a school field trip rather than a paying adult.

title: Injustice to all 3 cities.
text:
Our experience with this tour had several challenges that could have been avoided with better organization and communication.

Firstly, the tour operator canceled the tour on our selected date due to low attendance, which was understandable. They kindly emailed us with alternate dates, and we selected a new date. However, we never received a confirmation email for the updated booking. Throughout the process, we continued to receive reminders for the canceled date, and our tickets also displayed the incorrect date. This caused unnecessary confusion and anxiety. It would be helpful if their processes were more streamlined and accurate.

On the day of the tour, the bus was equipped with Wi-Fi and charging ports, but these amenities were only mentioned at the end of the day when the guide asked us to leave a review. Such details should be communicated at the start of the trip so participants can come prepared with necessary items, such as charging cables.

The itinerary also had its flaws. Our first stop was in Obidos at 8:45 a.m., but most places were closed at that time, making the stop feel pointless. In Nazare, we were given very limited time, which meant we couldn‚Äôt fully explore the town or take a walk to the beach. Additionally, many stores in Nazare accept cash only‚Äîinformation that would have been helpful to know in advance.

In Porto, the guide walked us through the downtown area and discussed libraries and bookstores. While informative, it would have been better if we were provided with maps highlighting key attractions so participants could explore based on their interests. For instance, there‚Äôs a scenic riverside walk and vibrant markets, but we didn‚Äôt have enough time to visit them. We also missed the opportunity to enjoy the beautiful sunset because of the tightly scheduled itinerary.

Overall, while the destinations were wonderful, the tour‚Äôs organization and time management left much to be desired. For those planning to visit these towns, I would recommend renting a car and exploring at your own pace to truly enjoy what each location has to offer.

title: Poor, since you cancelled the tour and did not notify me.
text:
This trip was canceled, but we were never informed. I only discovered it was canceled when they did not complete our payment the day before the tour.
Very disappointing.

title: Not to repeat
text:
It was an excursion in Spanish. When we reach the meeting point we see many English speakers. It turns out that they have made a mixed group with the two languages, but the guide Rui had a very low level of Spanish and throughout the day (13 h) has completely ignored the Spanish-speaking group. It's been really nasty.
On the other hand the stops of Obidos and Nazar√© have been very uninteresting and in Porto although we have been received by another guide (Francis) for the Spanish-speaking group we have been only two hours, to everything run and without time for anything.
13 hours listening to conversations in English, not understanding anything, having paid for an excursion in Spanish.
