title: Improveable
text:
Visit very quickly. If I had thought better I would not have bought it.
The Rui guide has perfect command of English but his Spanish makes him feel uncomfortable. The English speakers may have been fine, but I'm not so good.
With them complicity and great paraphrases summarized in little Spanish.
Francisco fine, but visit cuto jogging.
Without acrimony, you can improve with two independent guides and transmitters.

title: PAINFUL
text: We have had our booking cancelled a day before travelling to Lisbon, not least to make this excursion. The excuse, which they have not provided until we have called is painful: helicopter check. All ??? two days before the booked date ??....

title: Too rushed. Not enough time to enjoy the day
text: To much to enjoy in one day. Should make it shorter or extend the time..... maybe two days. Too much to do in one day. Maybe Porto only.

title: Excursion to Porto City
text:
We lacked the emotion of the city of Porto. 30 minutes to visit one street is nothing at all. You shouldn't go on a trip like this. Waste of a day.
On the plus side, the city is Nazar√©. Unusual beauty views.

title: Not great, not terrible
text:
The tour from Lisbon to Porto had a few strong points but also some notable downsides.

Positive Aspects:

‚Ä¢ The guide, Ruy, was knowledgeable and answered all the questions thoroughly, explaining the main attractions in detail.
‚Ä¢ The bus driver was polite and drove carefully throughout the journey.
‚Ä¢ Ruy was attentive to tourists‚Äô safety, reminding everyone to keep track of their belongings and be mindful of their seating to avoid disturbing others.
‚Ä¢ He provided useful information about restroom stops, which was helpful during the trip.

Areas for Improvement:

‚Ä¢ Unfortunately, Ruy was hard to spot during the tour as he didn‚Äôt wear a distinctive outfit, hat, or carry anything like an umbrella. This made it easy to lose track of him in the crowd.
‚Ä¢ He tended to focus more on engaging with the American tourists, which made others feel a bit overlooked.
‚Ä¢ There were instances where tourists were inconsiderate, such as sitting with their feet outside their seats and eating with their hands during the lunch break in Porto. This wasn‚Äôt addressed effectively.
‚Ä¢ The guide at √ìbidos was just average, and the same could be said about the Nazare stop. There was nothing particularly special at these locations, and the lack of toilet access without cash was inconvenient.
‚Ä¢ In Porto, the guide moved too quickly, making it hard to follow him, especially with no water breaks. He relied on hand gestures that were difficult to understand from the back.
‚Ä¢ The lunch provided in Porto was quite disappointing. For a group of five, the portions were meager (one sausage, five calamari, small chicken rolls, olives, and stewed chicken gizzard that went untouched). You were only offered one drink, and if you expected both wine and water, you‚Äôd be disappointed. With just an hour to eat, it would have been better to dine at a nearby restaurant for better quality at a similar price.

Overall, while Ruy‚Äôs efforts were appreciated, there‚Äôs room for improvement in how the tour is conducted and the overall experience provided to guests.

title: Pretty Disappointed
text: We showed up 30 mins early. 2 other couples also waiting. No email from the tour operator. No texts from the tour operators. Cancelled due to wildfire smoke. Had to go to the messages section of our booking to find out. No answer on the phone line. No answer on the messaging system. No information on refunds. Very poor communication.

title: waste of time and money
text: I chose it to get to know some places outside Lisbon, learn some history and decide whether to visit those cities more in depth later. But the history was not actual history (eg "that book shop was in a Harry Potter movie", "there is a McDonald's with an eagle statue on it"). We were supposed to have a pre-organised lunch but the guide forgot to organise it in advance. He sent everyone to find a restaurant, get & each lunch within an hour. It was impossible with a bus load of people, who basically chose the same 4 small restaurants in the square, thus overwhelming the kitchens -- some of us didn't even get served and had to have no lunch for such a long day. There was no visit of anything remotely port-related in Porto. No seeing big waves nor the fort in Nazar√©. Bad translations by the guide. A rip off. √ìbidos was pretty and we went early, missing the crowds, so I give a point for that

title: Too much for one day
text:
I will start by saying that I did not read the details as tours were booked by another in our party.

If you wish to drink Port in Porto or experience the city, this tour is not for you. My personal opinion, trying to do three cities in one day is cheating yourself of truly enjoying the city.

Porto needs more than 3 hrs to enjoy, Nazare needs at least 2 to 3. Same with Obidos.

This is a very rushed walking tour. Our guide was almost militant, but I guess he had to be to manage a group of 25 in a busy city. Yesterday we did Fatima, Nazare and Sintra with the same guide, 9 folks total, and he was much more laxed.

Obidos is a beautiful town, the castle is underwhelming, but something you can skip if you are pressed for time.

Nazare, large waves are Nov to Mar. Any other time, you are visiting a quaint beach town with some historical value. Be warned, the same guy who manages the public restroom, works in the church, so if you have to go, you may spend all your time in the coffee shop to buy something so you can use the bathroom.

2hr drive from Nazare to Porto, get ready for some zzzs.

So, the food upgrade (i don't recommend it)...staff was friendly but some guests were not necessarily comfortable with sharing tapas with strangers. Maybe something for the planners to consider when picking restaurants. We had two vegetarians in our party and their food was extremely disappointing. Food should have included port tasting (THIS IS WHAT TOURIST COME HERE FOR)

The walking tour was rushed in my opinion. I spent too much time concerned with not keeping up, rather than enjoying the city. I also noticed we did not go into anything with an entrance fee.

I learned that this is rushed because the driver cannot work for more than 12 hours. If this is true, would 2 drivers work? One to head up, one to head back. Add at least an hour to Porto, so folks can relax and enjoy port tasting and the city views (which are beautiful)

Maybe something in here helps those who are trying to decide yay or nay.

title: Unreliable, cancelled a few hours before the activity.
text: Cancelled the day before 2pm. Unreliable. After having many plans in coordination with this activity, we had to spend a lot on reorganizing the agenda.

title: Don‚Äôt build your hopes up
text:
I must start by saying ‚Äúdisappointed‚Äù. To explain this, well the itinerary is not what we actually got.

Firstly, we stood around the meet point with no sign of the guide as he wasn‚Äôt identifying himself well, turned out he was sat at a table by McDonalds. Ok so once we got the group together we moved off on the walking tour part, not really informative unless you count here‚Äôs a church that burnt down, this is a nice restaurant, and more randomness. I will add there was some history included but at a minimum. Where was the famous Elevador da Gloria, Calcada da Gloria - oh yeah we were told it‚Äôs over there but we‚Äôre not going on it and because of that we didn‚Äôt see the Miradouro Sao Pedro de Alcantara. Next we‚Äôre was the Church of St. Roque - who knows because we certainly didn‚Äôt see it. Then we didn‚Äôt see the Convento do Carmo.

Next we head to the main square to go on the boat which the guide sat in silence throughout not pointing out anything!

Off the boat and a brief walk to a minibus to take us on the helicopter. Well that was following the theme of the day. Literally take off left, head over the river, see the bridge land. If we were airborne 4 minutes I‚Äôd be surprised so no fantastic pictures of Lisbon to be had.

Once on the ground, ushered into the minibus before being asked where we wanted dropping (thought the decision was actually made for us after the guide kept saying you should see the monastery) so everyone was dropped there and that was that.

Very disappointed as we were both looking forward to the trip as it ticked (according to the itinerary) what we wanted having only 2.5 days in Lisbon. I‚Äôm guessing the day comes down to which guide you get as to how informative, close to the schedule and generally good it‚Äôll be.

title: On a tour in minimal Spanish!
text: We booked a tour of the three cities for two, a friend and me, the tour was in English and Spanish, the guide Rui was very friendly, but unfortunately the contributions in Spanish went from being very few to almost nothing! Sadly, this frustrates the experience of a tourist who hopes to get closer to the culture, preferably in a more familiar language.

title: Trip to Porto
text: The places were amazing. There was not enough time in each place. I felt rush and could not enjoy what each place has to offer. For these long trips, please have the option to use a bathroom

title: Cancelled without apology or explanation
text: Our tour (scheduled for 13 April 2024) was suddenly cancelled at 7pm on the evening before, with no apology or real explanation given. (The email said "unsuitable or dangerous weather", but it was actually a perfectly nice spring day.) They are only reachable by phone until 6pm, so we could not even contact them to ask for an explanation and to inquire if there are any alternative options. We understand that tours might have to be cancelled for various reasons, but in such cases we expect much better communication!

title: Very bad experience!
text:
The event that was specially arranged for Valentine's Day was simply cancelled the day before - reason: bad weather! I'm not a pilot - but we had very nice (not windy) (flying?!) weather here!

We were extremely disappointed!

title: Total letdown
text: So very disappointed! Booked to go to Lisbon for Valentine‚Äôs Day, flights & hotel, bought this excursion, a bucket list entry with the helicopter ride & for the perfect Valentine‚Äôs. They cancelled last minute. No option to do any part of the tour.

title: No Guide no Flight‚Ä¶
text:
Check In 8.45 AM - at 9.45 AM still no guide and no information by the operator. 16 people waiting in front of a McDonald on 31st of December ‚Ä¶
At least a very quick refund confirmation.

title: Great spots to visit, not happy with tour company
text:
We visited some beautiful places but the bus driver drove way too fast-I know he had a lot of ground to cover but we started off about 45 minutes late as the bus didn‚Äôt arrive and we all wondered if they had forgotten about us!! The tour leader was nice but not good at handling a crowd of people or even one on one. Possibly he was new-or having an off day-he had potential but too wimpy.
We were actually frightened by the bus driver. He was snarky and drove way too fast in the rain-it was pouring! And he drove the bus weaving in and out of traffic on the freeway in the pouring rain. We asked him to slow down but he didn‚Äôt and told us he was a great driver and the tour guide did not help us-just said we have to get back in time! We felt that it was dangerous and we were definitely scared with our eyes pressed shut and stomach in knots!
The biggest problem for our group and all the others we spoke to was the place they dropped us for lunch. Here we are in Porto-a city full of fabulous restaurants and they drop us in a weird area with 2 cheap and really horrible lunch counters and nowhere else to eat-also given 35minutes to eat. The food was cheap and I travel all over the world and I can usually find something to eat anywhere-but this food was just horrible. I ordered 2 things-a sandwich and a soup-both were so bad I couldn‚Äôt eat them-and this was a long day with no food. I ended up eating a choc eclair -that wasn‚Äôt very good either! I was not alone in my experience and both restaurants were equally bad. I asked the tour guide why they picked this corner and was told that this location worked because of our next activity and bus parking. I actually contacted the tour company with my concerns and suggestions for a couple of restaurants that were on their route which would work better. (Which I looked for while we there and ran past the tour guide and read their reviews hoping to help the next poor group have a decent meal!! I have led a few tours myself.) No response from the tour company to this day! He didn‚Äôt even care enough to answer me.

As I said-the places we visited were lovely, but I would suggest taking a train ride and doing your own tour. The walking tour in Porto was pretty good.

I would not recommend this tour!

title: Appalling
text: Too bad, because I can't give it 0 stars, otherwise I would. We paid for a tour in Spanish and it was in English, my parents don't know English and they didn't know anything. After insisting to the guide, he translated something into Portuguese, which is also not Spanish and my parents still didn't understand... The guide's explanations (in English) were simple and without any kind of interest, it is as if I, without any kind of knowledge , I started to take a tour, he said things that were obvious and without any type of historical value. The tour was very uncoordinated, we did not visit Sintra, but instead we went to spend 40 minutes at his friend's bakery. As a positive point, at the winery the girl who gave us the explanation was doing everything possible to make us feel comfortable (although she didn't know Spanish and everything was in Portuguese, so we still had the same handicap). On the way back, the guide intended to leave us with the bus at the other end of the city, although it clearly stated that the arrival location was the same as the pickup location. I do not recommend it at all, it has been very disappointing and very expensive for the service received.

title: DO NOT TAKE THESE TOUR
text:
Nothing like in the description
We were in Porto just 2 hours
No free time at all in Porto
Tour guide 1 hour and 15 minutes only
I wish I can get a refund
The worse tour I have ever taken

title: Not recommended - cancellation risk
text:
This trip was booked in advance and payment taken. Confirmation was received that the trip would go ahead the day before so everything looked OK.
Then I received a What‚ÄôsApp message from the company asking if we could move to another day as ‚Äòthere was a logistics problem‚Äô on the day we wanted to go (a Saturday morning). Evidently the problem couldn‚Äôt be resolved that day but would definitely be resolved the next day if we wanted to change. This wasn‚Äôt possible as we were leaving the next day so cancelling was the only option given to us.
This was the second time that this happened while on this trip in Portugal (last minute contact from the tour operator via WhatsApp saying there was a problem but it would be OK the next day - after taking payment AND confirming the day before and tickets being issued) and is most likely the operator having an offer to take more people (we are a couple travelling) so dumping our trip at the last minute leaving us with little option to find a replacement.
Be cautious when booking with this company if your plans are not flexible or if you are a couple!

title: √â um desperd√≠cio de tempo e de dinheiro - podia antes fazer algo de bom na cidade.
text: Infelizmente, fiquei muito desiludido. Tudo come√ßou com o facto de n√£o podermos ir de barco e de n√£o podermos ver a praia. Depois, houve tamb√©m o facto de s√≥ termos estado na praia com os cavalos durante 5 minutos e n√£o termos podido tirar fotografias. Tir√°mos fotografias, mas quiseram cobrar 15 euros por fotografia. Tinha de se estar sempre em fila e n√£o se podia andar muito afastado da barraca. N√£o me pareceu que as pessoas que l√° estavam soubessem realmente o que estavam a fazer. Eu sentei-me no cavalo mais r√°pido e tive de andar atr√°s de todos os outros. Por isso, foi muito cansativo para mim e nada divertido. Depois fomos ao mercado do peixe, onde n√£o pudemos comer nada porque tudo estava a fechar lentamente e n√£o havia muitas op√ß√µes. Tamb√©m fomos a um castelo onde ningu√©m nos conseguiu dizer nada. Em suma, foi um desperd√≠cio de dinheiro para mim.

title: Don't bother!
text: This trip was unsatisfying and also misrepresented. We had an extremely punctual group, and the trip extended to 13.5 hours. I doubt it actually ever finishes earlier just based on doing the math of where we went. We didn't grasp the very limited itinerary of this tour (our fault!) but we were in a bus for over 9 hours to see three places for 45 minutes, 45 minutes, and then two hours in Porto that included a 30 minute lunch, a one hour walking tour, and then 30 minutes at the end to try port.. The tour guide gave us only 30 minutes for lunch at a terrible area for food - the food equivalent of a crappy gas station. It was highly unsatisfying because we didn't have time to appreciate anything, the bus air condition was unreliable, and the food was awful. The one redeeming quality is the tour guide did dispense some good historical knowledge on the bus and on the walking tour, but the tour overall was of cheap quality. If I were to do it again, I would simply go to Porto for an overnight at least. Not worth it for the price!

title: nice personell but "m√§√§√§√§h" experience regarding the monuments
text:
The offered trip (7 Minutes) obviously is very short.

If you expect anything as shown in the advertised pictures of this trip or written in the description ( Bel√©m Tower, Jer√≥nimos Monastery, 25Th April Bridge, close view of the Christ King Monument ) you have to bring binoculars.

It is basically a lift off, flying a couple of 100 m to the middle of the river and then going down again. no close view of the Christ, not even flying nearby the bridge.
If I'd be mean I'd say "luxurious elevator".

So you see everything in distance - but nor really. The only thing you see is the industrial harbour.

you should def. book a longer tour (15 min).

The pilot and owner of the business are very kind and funny people though, that's worth the 2 stars :-)

title: Exceptionally poor communication and horrible experience
text:
I'm not sure where to even begin to say how disappointing this experience was that I never actually even got to go on.

I had bought three tickets for myself, my wife, and my infant son, my confirmation explicitly stated two adults and one infant. On the day of the tour we painstakingly got my son ready for an 8AM departure, we got to the bus, only to find that there was no car seat for my son to sit in the bus. After some back and forth, we were told they could not accommodate us. We offered that we had our own car seat available at the hotel we stayed at a few minutes away. We were told the driver was not willing to take the risk.

Fine. Thoroughly disappointing on its own, but mistakes happen, I get it.

I wrote to the tour operator about how disappointing it was to have an entire day of your vacation ruined, at a time where it's far too late to even book another tour for the day to be salvaged.

Late afternoon that same day, I was offered by text message either a refund, rebooking the tour at a later date, or a different tour. Of course, time is of the essence, these tours get booked up and I didn't want to miss out on a chance to go on a tour, I responded within 30 minutes to rebook for a day later in the week.

I didn't hear anything back for the rest of the day, I didn't hear anything back the next morning. I messaged them myself almost 24 hours later saying I received no correspondence, and that I booked another tour elsewhere. Only then did I receive a response saying sorry for the delay.

I asked for a refund, and for once in this whole ordeal, something was done promptly and properly - I received notification of a refund being processed.

Folks, vacations are short, and having an entire day ruined and missing out on an experience is not a headache you want to be dealing with.

Based on my own horrible experience, I accordingly strongly caution anyone that is considering booking this tour.

title: Not happy at all
text:
We buy online and then they cancel. And messed up our 3 days vacation.shame on website.
And there is no more explanation

title: Last minute cancel
text: Canceled half a day before by operator due to ‚Äúhelicopter maintenance‚Äù. Boat trip and city tour canceled as well. Alternative presented was a trip to Porto‚Ä¶ No time to book alternative.

title: Left us high and dry
text: The tour company canceled 2 days before our visit due to maintenance/mechanical issues with the helicopter. Instead of offering a partial tour, they left us without a boat cruise or city tour. We were unable to schedule another tour due to the short notice.

title: Remanejamento de tempo!!!
text:
Com mais tempo em alguns lugares. 1h de almo√ßo sem conhecer a cidade? N√ÉO ALMO√áAMOS!!!
Mais informa√ß√µes que o desagrado n√£o h√°.

title: Not worth the money
text: The tour guide took us to the most boring parts of porto including a McDonald‚Äôs she thought was really pretty. She clearly wasn‚Äôt knowledgeable about the history of Porto. It is not worth the money. If they were to do one stop before Porto instead of two and gave us more time in Porto it would have been more worth it‚Ä¶. Plus having a knowledgeable tour guide would have helped too.

title: Uncomfortable for hours!!!
text: I loved the 3 places, our tour guide was ok, but what made the day awful was the 16 person tour van. You could not see out any windows, it had zero shocks I knew the driving time would be long.. that being said the seating on the van was sooooooo bad. The four of us are average sized adults, all 6‚Äô and under, less than 180 pounds and we were stuck in the very back 4 person row. The seats in front of reclined, ours were straight and tilted forward. I am not exaggerating when I say we were slammed completely up against the seats in front of us. You could not move or adjust to get comfortable. On a city tour where you are in and out, moving it would be fine but we were in the van for 2hrs, another 2hrs and then the 4 hour trip from Porto back to Lisbon. This was waaaaaaaay to long for the back row seating. This tour should not be done in this vehicle. I would NOT recommend this tour at all! 45 mins in Obidos, 30 mins Nazare and 2 1/2 hours in Porto. Lastly I wish we would not have gone on this tour. I guess I can say I have been to these places but definitely did not really experience anything.

title: The boat with no return
text: Very dissatisfied. Apparently, there was priority boarding for large groups with a guide, which meant we couldn‚Äôt get a seat on the upper deck ‚Äì all seats were already taken. As a result, we were forced to sit inside. Unfortunately, the view from inside is significantly worse than from the upper deck, partly due to the dirty windows, which made it difficult to enjoy the surroundings. When we got off in Bel√©m and wanted to return at 5 PM, the boat didn‚Äôt stop to pick us up, despite earlier information from the info kiosk indicating otherwise. Upon inquiry in Bel√©m, we were informed that the boat would not be stopping there at 5 PM that day. Fortunately, the train was still running, and we were able to return that way.

title: Disappointment!!!
text: It's not worth it! For what it costs and don‚Äôt bother, the boat is old, and all it does is take a walk along the river for 1 hour with little explanation and stops you in belem. It doesn't meet expectations at all.

title: Don‚Äôt Bother
text: Very disappointing particularly the so called snacks & drink. The snacks were 4 small crackers & dodgy fish paste, ended up being ill during the night & I can only attribute this to the fish paste. The wine was one very small plastic glass from a wine box.

title: Watch out if you're not a priority
text:
Exclusive schedules are saved to go with Guide so if there are already few options all counts that they are even less.
Disappointed üòû

title: Very bad
text: Very bad. We were first in the queue to go up and they let "their" groups go first... and sit in the best seats... We all paid the same amount... and when we asked for clarification... the answer was that they didn't know anything. NOT recommended..

title: Don't do it. There are better providers
text:
Absolute rip-off. You get a small glass of port and a bad sweet pie. A joke for the money.
The solo entertainer was the only thing that made the tour enjoyable. He sang nice songs.

title: Very sad trip
text:
Our only dissapointing experience in Lisbon. Windows were filthy (it had been a few days of beautiful sunshine previously so no need for dusty rain marks).
Loo bins overflowing with rubbish.
Audio guide played in multiple languages in succession so not a great deal of info as you had to wait for your language to come back round.
Overall just a sad and tired experience which we wished we hadn't wasted a couple of hours on.

title: Poor experience, not enough buses.
text:
Very poor experience. Be aware buses are not every 30 minutes (approx). They only had 2 buses running, and when both were going the other way, I called support and after stating my situation, no bus my way for 1 hour, I didn't even get an apology.
Ask how many buses are on route. Red bus tour we saw quite a few, seemed to have more buses. I do not recommend.
Canadian.

title: Too bad.
text: Terrible. They take a long time to pass, it has no air conditioning so the heat was hellish, and the tour leaves much to be desired. The biggest waste of time and money.

We were very disappointed. Hardly any information, and with a city that has so much history. In some cases, the scant information did not come in the right places. All in all, very skinny. Not recommended

title: Bad option
text: Very bad option. Really long time waiting for each bus. The red bus is much better. I don‚Äôt recommend yellow bus at all. In one of the stops we waited almost one hour in a really Hot day.

title: Too much waiting was painful
text: Very few buses , too much waiting we wasted our time waiting for the bus more than 50 minutes to 1 hour of wasted time under the July sun. I strongly advise the other company the red bus was quite the opposite the red buses run every 15/ 20 minutes

title: Bad experience with Yellow HOHO at Lisbon
text:
We did not have a nice experience. On 29/5/25(booked 15/4/25) , I had booked for self & my wife for 48 hrs - with Tram & Boating.
In effect, we could do just 2 tours --same Belen Tower route.
At the Terminus, there was none to guide,,no displays & a driver misguided into taking the same route book, after waiting for 25m in Sunday..
There's no info counter to check on Boat or Tram.. As a tourist from different country who has toured the globe, I didnot relish the experience and wish you to take collective action..
And stops to be displayed prominently. We took a Cab , went to j. Monastery. After that, it took 20 mins to enquire & search for a yellow bus stop.

title: Yellow bus . Use competitor as this is so bad..
text: 1.30hr wait time, then had to stand. 22e. Do not use. Other similar bus services far more regular. Stay away.. plus bus kept letting people on.. why.. no one could use audio, plus just made more already squeezed people more uncomfortable....

title: Terrible terrible experience
text: The only reason it got one star is because I couldn't give it zero. This is an absolutely awful experience. You see very little of interest in lisbon. Plus on the bus we were on the audio did not work so there is no actual tour. You didn't know where you were or what you were seeing additionally the driver was so poor that it ended up taking nearly an hour longer than it should have. Avoid at all costs

title: Terrible tour
text: Terrible tour. How could they not have know the downtown core had a major bike race ! Had to be rerouted, missed a lot of attractions. Commentary recording was so off, talked about a fountain that never came into view and numerous other sites of note. Very disappointing!

title: Don‚Äôt bother
text:
We first did this trip in 2024 and really enjoyed it. Back in Lisbon in 2025 we thought we‚Äôd do it again - big mistake.
This year it is about half the length of last year - the whole second section is missing. Also, the trip operates in reverse, so you approach the cathedral from the back, not the front, for example.
Such a shame, don‚Äôt waste your money, we wish we hadn‚Äôt.

title: Disappointing Experiance
text: The driver we had sped around the town. Stopped for a very short time at the stops. No good photo opportunities. Very disappointed.

title: Worst European city bus tour ever
text: This bus tour was terrible! Avoid the RED GRAYLINE tour-the tour information is poor quality & quantity & it often told us after the stop what was at the previous one at which point it was too late to get off & explore! We also waited >1.5hrs at the castle & no bus showed up despite it apparently being every 20mins. Rip off for what it was. Worst bus tour in a European city I have ever done

title: Very bad
text: Totally useless experience. 50 euros for two people thrown for a ride on narrow streets in the middle of social housing. The basilica of course you can see only the lower part being inside a vehicle. Not recommended

title: Worst experience ever
text: The route was terrible, there was nothing interesting but garbage and wood... As Portuguese it is shameful to show this route to tourists because those who do not get Lisbon with this route continues without knowing it. It was terrible.

title: Beware of the queues
text: Once we go on the bus it was excellent but we had to queue at the main pick up point at Parco da Figueira in the heat for 30 minutes and not be able to get on the bus which was full. We were then told it would be a further hour for the next bus as there had been a breakdown. Staff were not especially helpful. We came back much later in the day and that was fine.

title: Very very bad. Standing tall in the aisles is your destiny when you book this tour.
text: A wait of half an hour was no exception. Once the bus arrives there is no room on it. Definitely NOT worth its money

title: Do NOT trust this company.
text: Total scam. We were on a cruise ship and upon arrival at port the yellow bus flag was up however the bus did not show up. After waiting more than a hour we made several calls to the company however the calls were forwarded to Porto. We eventually reached out to the local police officer her confirmed that the company was on strike. We were only at port one day so we had to purchase on another bus line. The bus line was overcrowded, overbooked. It was a horrible experience. After several calls to the yellow bus company they said we would receive a refund but would need to request it through Viator. We requested but they refused the refund stating they opened back up at 2 pm. We knew at 3:30 pm they had not reopened however even if they did open at 2 pm how could they provide a 24 hour tour? Do not trust this company

title: Cancellation
text: I was unable to use the ticket as my mum was unwell. I have been in contact many times aa it says you have a 14 day cancellation policy on your website but am yet to hear back.

title: Waste of money
text:
A joke and complete waste of my money and time. We were waiting for more than 2 hours.
disaster, the bus is full, there is no bus in sight for an hours. ADVICE, DO NOT BUY YELLOM BUS TKURS UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES. It's ist disaster. Bye

title: A disaster - ‚Äúhop on‚Äù impossible!
text:
We were so excited for a day in Lisbon with our children who are 7 and 4. We thought that the yellow bus would be the perfect way to get around so we could see lots and the children wouldn‚Äôt have to walk very much.

We got to stop 5 and up until that point enjoyed the bus very much. However after 30 mins in the park we couldn‚Äôt get back on the bus when it arrived as there were no seats. The driver told me I needed to wait 30 mins for another bus - but with no guarantee we would get on that. We ended up walking two tired and hot children all the way back to the start without seeing what we had planned. Everyone is so disappointed and what a complete scam and waste of money!

title: Unpredictable schedule
text:
The buses were extremely late, and there were no seats for elderly in the bus stop
Stuff was friendly? But the service is unoresictable

title: Beware Lisbon traffic
text:
Unfortunately the current traffic chaos in Lisbon makes the tour bus impractical to use on a day visit (e.g. from a cruise ship). We opted for this trip from the terminal which required going to the bus tour hub at the top of Lisbon.

We changed buses to pick up the route and left fairly promptly, but an hour in we were only 3 stops around the 28 stop route, and would have been tight for the 1600 back aboard, so we abandoned at stop 5 or 6. We had a short stroll to the river and the ship was only 300 metres away. We then had a lovely coffee and a pastel de natal and stroll around the immediate area with its lovely squares.

title: Terrible service, dreadful experience.
text: This tour was the worst bus ride I've ever been on. The journey was boring the driving horrendous. We were charged for a 48 hour ticket and were only in port for several hours. I would like to deter people from taking this tour as when I contacted the company to complain I was ignored.

title: Yellow bus sucks
text: Unfortunately, this was a terrible experience. We found the bus stop after buying our tickets, then waited for over an hour. More than 12 Red busses came by, but there were no yellow busses. I called the company and was lied to. The representative said that the busses were all delayed, but it didn't seem to bother the red bus company. He said that the bus would arrive in 9 to 10 minutes, but it didn't show up for over 20 minutes. We wasted 2 hours of our vacation time.

title: Do not do the 'Modern' Tour.
text: Whatever you do, do not pay for the 'modern' tour-it's just a bus ride to the airport and all you see is shipping containers. Just pay for the Belem tour, which is nice. It's a basic, pre-recorded audio so you won't learn much. Just use it as a convenient, flexible way to travel.

title: Don't get off 'cause then you can't go back
text: Even though they say you can go up and down, it's a lie. We took the boat at 11 a.m. and went to Belem, for the return there were no boats to stop, we were told that we had to return by bus, metro, train or other means. Come on, it was a hoax. You just have the one-way boat trip and then I'll look for life to come back. By the way the QR that is supposed to get you for Carries transports for 24h, the drivers of that company do not even know what you talk about when you show them the ticket, but because they are so kind they let you pass. Not recommended the tour, unless you don't get off

title: Just don‚Äôt! Go with red Hop on hop off.
text: Sold us two day tickets without me anything about routes being interrupted due to holiday. Ended up walking 1.5 miles up hill to get to the first operational pickup spot. Music was pretty terrible and guide less than informative. Only stop if you hit the red button (none upstairs). Was quicker to get downstairs and let the driver know. All together very disappointing!

title: Bad services
text: The experience was very frustrating and disappointing. The bus was supposed to run every 30 min. However, we had to wait for the bus for almost 1 hr on the way to Belem. The driver didn't inform us that stops 11, 12, and 13 were closed due to construction. We along with some other people were waiting for more than 1 hr at stop 11 for the bus to come on the way back to Lisbon. The bus never came. We finally decided to go back to stop 10. We waited for the bus for another hour. It was a very frustrating experience, as we were tired and lost about 3 hrs of our day.

title: Not recommended
text:
Not recommended! Unimportant information while driving on shopping and hotels.
Important stops in Belem 11, 12, 13 are not served without notice. Only a small note on the bus and when scanning arrival times knows.

title: Poor information dissemination and management
text: Very poor information. We bought the tickets but were NOT told that the bus would not stop at what were stops 11, 12, 13, 14 on the blue route. Only when we asked the bus driver were we directed to a sign pasted on the bus window downstairs, facing outward, with no way for people to know as they boarded from the angle they did. The commentary does not let you know which stop you‚Äôre at which makes it difficult to trace whether or not the bus is at the place it claims to be. Had to constantly refer to Google maps in order to work out where we were whenever things didn‚Äôt match up (likely due to traffic and other things like skipped stops!!). Speaking of the audio commentary, earphones are just placed in a box behind the first seat as you board and are not very noticeable. We missed it as did other much more elderly passengers whom we had to help with it later, going down below to retrieve earpieces. Also several of the audio plugins didn‚Äôt work so passengers had to change seats to find those that did work. Truly regret buying this bus tour, perhaps try the other companies but not this one that severely lacks information and misrepresents itself.

title: Bellem tour
text:
We‚Äôve been waiting 75 minutes for our Yellow bus at stop 14 on the Bellem Lisbon tour and still nothing. Five red buses have already passed. Normally scheduled every 30 minutes...
When I post this message i.e. more than 80 minutes still no bus ... I advise against, take the competition Red.

title: Dont ever think to get on tram 28.. take a bus going to castle
text: ƒ∞t is impossible to get on tram 28. You have to wait for more than 2 hrs.. instead we took tuk tuk which is expensive, 90 euros for two people for 90 min.. you have to bargain.. after waiting 2 hrs you lose your energy and time to get around

title: Don‚Äôt pay on card use cash so your sure you have not been overcharged and ripped off
text: I was charged for 2 people when I said a ticket for 1 when I asked for a refund I was told they don‚Äôt and I class that as stealing the man who charged me said he doesn‚Äôt understand ticket for 1 the guy was talking utter crap.

title: Don't lose your ticket!!!!
text:
I had worse 3 48h tickets.
The first round is not very interesting.
Today, wanting to go back, for the second round (2 days validity) I was able to repay the 3 tickets because I had misplaced the ticket the day before.
I find this slightly exaggerated and not commercial.
I had proof that our 48-hour ticket had started the day before.
This leaves a bitter taste (and 50‚Ç¨ in the wind)
Good hearing.

title: Yellow Bus is not worth the money
text:
The bus was overcrowded the first day. The second day we waited one hour at the Tile museum, finally getting an Uber instead.
The red buses seemed to come and go on their expected schedules. Yellow bus was a disappointment in an otherwise great trip to Lisbon. We ended up using Ubers almost everywhere.

title: Would not recommend.
text: Was told the tram was not running and then saw it later and people were squeezed in like sardines. Not safe or enjoyable. Bus stops are so far apart we ended up taking taxis in between.

title: If take a bus, wait for at least 2 hours
text: Bus punctuality is appalling. Waited for more than 2 hours to arrive at ipoh. Bus from permata utara. How malaysia can progress with such lousy bus system

title: We did not get off until the end. Would not recommend the big yellow bus tour.
text: It wasn‚Äôt very informative and the music was terrible. I would not recommend. We took a tram the next day it was a fun journey.

title: How can they make something so straightforward, so bad.
text:
I will take you through the whole experience and you can judge it. It's a hop on hop off bus, it was going to most of the things we wanted to see, it was the cheapest bus, what can go wrong... Booking was straightforward, paid online and got a token thing on my phone. Arrived at praca de Figueira and got directions to the bus from a stallholder. Got to the bus, we were going to do the blue route, spoke to a bus driver, showed him the token thing on my phone and he gave us two tickets, two sets of ear phones, a route map and warned us about pickpockets at the stops. All good so far. Got to our seat and plugged the earphones in, went to number 2 for English speakers. There was very annoying music playing but I thought it would stop when we started moving, but it didn't . We wanted off at stop two. I took my earphones out as I could not stand the music, my wife did also, as did the majority of the passengers. I usually like to hear the commentary but the music interspersed with it made it too annoying to listen too. Anyway, we waited for the 2nd stop. After a while , and the bus not stopping I Iistened to the commentary again and realised we were coming to stop 5!!!. The bus does not stop at every stop, it only stops if you press the stop button. But if you don't know where you are, you don't know when to stop. Anyway my wife and I and another couple we didn't know got off at this stop. We asked the driver why he hadn't stopped and he told us he doesn't stop if he doesn't need too. The driver said another bus would be along in thirty minutes. We looked around stop 5 ( waste of time) and got back on the next bus. We told the bus driver we wanted off at stop 11, he said we had to listen to the commentary and press the button when we wanted to stop. Anyway, we could not listen to the incredibly annoying music and we got off at stop 7. We walked around there fir thirty minutes and got the next bus. I'd had enough by this time and just wanted taken back to the square so I could enjoy my day, walking about. Got on the bus, did the whole route and then it made one stop. Nobody in the bus had their earphones in. We waited to get to Praca de Figueira, but it doesn't stop there, it stops nearby. Well we didn't know and the driver never said. Everybody on the top of the bus stayed on, nobody, I repeat nobody had their earphones in. The bus stayed going again and we waited for the square. After several minutes I noticed stop 5 again!!! Myself and my wife and another two couples got off, we spoke to the other people, they had not been listening to the commentary/music and had no idea where they were either. Anyway we walked back to the square ( 35 minutes).
This bus tour is rubbish, the drivers are lazy and don't even bother to let you know you are at the start or finish of the route. Avoid, avoid avoid this yellow hop on hop off bus .

title: Super Shabby Service!!
text: We took the boat tour and got off at Belem at 3:30 pm for a bite to eat after being told we could hop on again at 5:30 pm. After waiting for 15 minutes at 5:30 and with no boat in sight, we wandered into the ferry office and were told the 5:30 boat would not be coming. The fellow who worked for the ferry company and not yellow bus tours had no information for us only that there would be no more yellow boats that day. Pretty shabby service stranding your customers!! Won‚Äôt ever use this company again.

title: Doesn't stop at stops just drives past
text: Buses drivers don't stop and ignore passengers at stop will never use again very poor service waste of money as do not deliver should be called do not hop on and of

title: Very poor
text: This was a tour to see blocks of flats. I would NOT recommend to modern tour at all.if you need to get to the tile museum and aquarium get a taxi

title: City cancelled the AEROBUS service to and from the Bus Depot at 7 Rios
text: UNFORTUNATELY this good service was discontinued. They City of Lisbon) have also prohibited REDE EXPRESSOS to make a stop near the terminal to disembark passengers! Whatever is good and safe for passengers the City find a way to cancel!!!!! Best and safest way from LIS airport to the Bus Station is a taxi, about 10 euros!

title: Save your money & get a tuk tuk
text: Red line? I‚Äôd draw a big red line through it! We do the tours in every city we visit to get a feel for the place & this one is THE worst! Seriously we‚Äôve never had one like it. Lisbon has super history & places but boy what did you do? Virtually no commentary, consistently long stops & as for the ignorance of some of your staff. Shocker!

title: A scam
text: I bought the 72 hours pass. I‚Äôve looking for buses or tram to give the service I‚Äôd paid for. In the last couple hours ‚Äúall the buses and tram‚Äù are out of service. There‚Äôs no warning in the web page and no one from customer service (the people who activates the vouchers) can give any explanations.

title: Please use this bus tour with caution
text:
Very Dangerous, please use with extreme caution.

My husband and I purchased a ticket for the modern bus tour as we wanted to visit the Oceanarium. After the stop before the aquarium we decided to go downstairs to prepare for our stop as;

A) the bus didn‚Äôt stop at all stops,
B) it was starting to rain
C) it was very difficult to understand where stops were.

My husband went to get up. Luckily, and oh my how thankful I am, my husband made moves to get up quite slowly, (rather than a jump straight up) he then ducked down very quickly. Therefore missing his head colliding with the bridge we had just started to go under. This bridge was not far taller than the bus - my husband is 6ft 2 and had he stood up just a little more, with being taller than the bus/bus ceiling, he would have hit the bridge. I cannot tell you how close this was/and how sick I still feel.

I wrote to the company and got a very unsympathetic response (screen shots added) .. apparantly because they had ‚Äòa recording warning of bridge‚Äô that it‚Äôs ok.

A) I, nor my husband remember reading the warning on the chair - that said, when it rains in Lisbon ‚Ä¶ it really rains. You have to sit in the rain with no umbrella waiting for the next stop? Not going to happen.

B) We, and I guess a lot of people didn‚Äôt hear the initial warning. The recording is not easy listening - the constant music is awful and there are very long periods of music so we turned it off, didn‚Äôt pay attention.

C) Therefore, didn‚Äôt listen to the warning about the bridge
I‚Äôm also wondering how someone who has difficulty hearing would have a chance to hear this.

Should my husband had not got up slowly, things would have been so different. When I say it was millimetres away from missing the bridge I am really not exaggerating.

I hope yellow bus tours review this route and make safety amendments before one of their passengers gets seriously hurt, or worse. Sadly, I don‚Äôt feel that they care.

Please use this bus tour with caution.

title: Don‚Äôt lose your paper ticket!
text: Bought a 72 hour ticket & lost the paper ticket & then was told there wasn‚Äôt anything the company could do to re-issue our tickets. We had only used it for 24 hours, total waste of 180 euros. Don‚Äôt recommend, very poor customer service. Surely we are not the only people to accidentally lose tickets. We had a booking ref, confirmation email surely in this modern world the QR code would suffice.

title: Yellow bus tour not worth the money
text:
We paid over ‚Ç¨200 for bus tour tickets + Aquarium for 4 adults and one child.
Aquarium experience was good.
The tour was not worth the time or money!!! The information given was minimal, there was a lot of background music instead of guided commentary that we paid for. Audio did not work on some seats. Tickets can be used on trams and buses too but we had no idea where to find them! Leaflet provided should have that information made clear for those who visit the city for the first time. I would not recommend Yellow bus tour.

title: Give it a miss
text: This was not so good. You cannot get down anywhere. By the time you try to click photos it moves on. So should give it a miss.

title: Terrible driver would not allow us to board with app ticket rather than paper one! He called police cos took his photo!
text:
We bought the tickets on the app and then boarded the bus. We were then given a printed ticket. The next time we got on the bus we did not have the printed tickets as we had changed our clothes back at the hotel & left the tickets there as we knew we had them in the app. However when we tried to board the bus the 2nd time we showed him the tickets on the app but the driver was very insistent and in a very unfriendly manner that we needed the paper version of the tickets to ride on his bus! We discussed this in a reasonable manner and got off the bus but he became very hostile when I took his photo . He got out of his seat and got off the bus and then would not let us walk away by blocking my husband physically and calling the police!!! We were not even on the bus. We wanted to go back to our hotel nearby to get the paper tickets!
His issue was that we took a photo of him!!
The police arrived very quickly as they were nearby and we explained the situation to them. They realised it was totally ridiculous but were not able to comment on the issue wit the paper v app ticket. They did request that we deleted the photo as it is illegal to take a photo of someone in Portugal without their consent. Good luck with that in the world of social media! So we deleted the photos & a video I front of the police and went on our way. We can of course recover the photo and video from our phones and will be very happy to share with you so you can see which of your drivers is giving yellow bus tours a very bad impression. We find it strange that he was so angry about the photo.. he must have something to hide?
All of that said‚Ä¶ this issue only arose in he first place because your system is antiquated. Why have an app if the tickets on it are invalid.

title: Terrible waste of time!
text: Terrible waste of time! We saw and learned more on our own walking around the city. Very few sights, minimal commentary and very repetitive when combined with Belem tour. Most of the time was spent on highway and looping out of town towards the airport. We‚Äôve done the RED BUS Tours all over Europe in the past and we were very disappointed and will not ever go back to yellow bus!

title: Get out!!
text: I took the 4:00 tour and 5 minutes into the tour, there was a blocage on the road. I was told it might be long and I should get out of the tram. I was not offered an alternative arrangement. My flight was the next day so I couldn't catch a different tour. I contacted the company to have a refund and I received a vague email that they were looking into the situation. A week later, I sent a second email and still have no response or refund.

title: Yellow boat tour - really not worth it
text: Music onboard way to loud - and commentary way to basic - and out of sync with monuments/sights. Also not really a hop on off experience as time between boats is 4 hours

title: Consider other traffic arrangements
text: Stuck in traffic in morning Lisbon jam, took 2 hours to get to Belem from cruise ship terminal.And got poor attitude from staff at #1 stop. As tourists we have no idea how the route run and asking questions are quite normal. Highly not recommended.Yellow line staffs are more friendly.

title: Too much traffic
text:
Catastrophic traffic density hardly any progress Once out it is very bad to get back on a bus
Overall no recommendation

title: Scams and theft by Viator!
text:
Poor description on the website, difficult communication with the seller, the drivers only speak Portuguese (you would think that if they work with tourists, that they also speak another language).
There was promised audio guide in Dutch, but it was not there! We could just as easily drive a taxi around the city if there was no audio guide available, it was even cheaper.
The seller refuses to refund even part of the ticket.
Very disappointing all of them.

title: Avoid it as it fails on all counts
text: We signed up based on the promise of being able to access lots of other attractions but rapidly discovered that the options were not available. Queued for 30 minutes for the elevator only to find that yellow bus pass was not acceptable and had to pay extra fees. Bus tours were average with lots of repetitive ‚Äúlift music‚Äù and very limited speech about local sights. We then waited for the ‚Äúfree‚Äù tram ride only to discover that you could only use the bus ticket from one location. After walking to the one location the driver told us rudely that the tram was not running and then just ignored us and left us at the roadside. All round poor service and contact with the company was exceptionally bad, which is sad as these tours are often our favourites!

title: Very bad see obeb
text:
At the modern drive the driver has not approached the stop 8 and 9 a bigger fuck
I feel betrayed and betrayed

title: Bad company
text: The yellow staff are poorly educated, lack patience with tourists (especially the elderly) and ironic. I didn't like the competing company a thousand times. Information between employees are not the same seems different companies

title: Not quite the ride I was waiting
text: The button to tell the driver you wanted to get off did not work. A couple traveling near me rode 3 Km before they figured out

title: BUYERS BE AWARE! TERRIBLE
text:
***BUYERS BE AWARE*** DON'T GET SCAMMED LIKE WE DID. We arrived at the cruise port in Lisbon and a very friendly lady at the desk told us to get these very specific tickets, she said it was the only ones available. We didn't know that she had sold us 2 days tickets, knowing full well that our Disney cruise was only going to be there for the day, in addition she charged us for 3 adults, even though they have teenage pricing and our son is only 15.
In addition, the routes they have are long and tedious, you waste so much time and it isn't worth it at all, as the city center is just walking distance and is a beautiful walk and area. Don't waste your money using this bus service.

title: Disappointing experience
text: Several stops were suspended due to events, which was unfair to customers. The bus services were not frequent enough and live schedules were unreliable. A driver did not stop to let us get on. We had to walk back as it was the last service. He should be more considerate of customers.

title: Tickets not valid
text:
Booked tickets to Benfica stadium.
Couldn‚Äôt get in as staff at stadium said tickets were not valid.
Very very embarrassing and two very upset children.
Paid for a family ticket.
Do not waste your money.

title: DISAPPOINTMENT üòû
text: I don't recommend it works terrible schedules incomprehensible, also sell you that everything comes in and then you go with the schedules like a locomotive running to all places condition the whole stay better transport card and valid tickets and you are free of schedules

title: Boat trip on Sundays simply cancelled.
text: In itself good ticket with many usage possibilities (Hop in Hop Off, Trams, Furniculars) and actually boat trip!! Actually. We booked the ticket on Fridays for 72 hours. On Saturdays we still checked at the counter due to bad weather due to the boat's departure times. Sunday we come to the branch where the lady of the counter informs us that the winter travel times have been in force since Sunday morning and there would be no boat tour on Sunday. Alternatively, she can only offer to extend the ticket by 24 hours. Useless for us, as we leave the next day. That's just cheeky and it's not possible. It is probably absolutely unnecessary to deal with customers in this way. Timetable changes, especially for winter, are predictable and can be issued early. Absolute cheekiness.

title: Appalling company which should be avoided!
text:
Purchased 2 tickets on arrival at Lisbon cruise terminal, valid for 2 days. Seemed like a good deal and everything went fine on day 1. However, on day 2 we went to the terminal to find the yellow bus counter was unmanned, nobody from yellow bus to be found. We went outside to the bus stops and NO yellow bus vehicles in sight! Only the red buses of a rival company who were present on both days.
Extremely disappointed and annoyed at the appalling service offered by this company.
As it happened we were kindly given 2 unwanted tickets for the red buses which saved the day.
I would strongly advise any travellers to avoid this terrible company which mis-sold us a 2 day ticket which they failed to honour. Book the red bus instead!!!

title: Oh that's long
text: Just off a cruise ship today and needed a tour of Lisbon as it's very hilly, did a fantastic tuk tuk one last time so decided on the yellow bus this time. Well got on about 9.30 and headed off on the red route thru modern Lisbon, absolute rubbish all concrete but never mind as it progressed things got better and we arrived at a nice square where we got off and bought a few souvenirs and looked round a market. Then it all went wrong got on the next bus and it then continues to the BLUE route thru old Lisbon lovely, and on and on further and further out towards the maritime museum U could see Christ the Redeemer over the other side and we got worried it's now nearly 1300, 1pm and the ship leaves at 1500 3pm. So as panic set in that we might not make it back and getting hungry and needing the loo, we got off and caught a taxi back, not bad under ‚Ç¨20. Phew time for lunch on board just before 1400 . 2pm please Check lengths of trip before U buy.

title: Choose another bus
text: Buses pass a lot in the morning, but in the afternoon around 3pm, we waited 1h20 before changing our mind and taking a taxi. We called the company, but we were put on hold for more than 10 minutes. Very bad experience, we were more than 15 people waiting for this bus in the sun.

title: No Aerobus seen
text: For a city trip we wanted to go from the airport to the city center by Aerobus. Outside the arrival hall we soon found the Aerobus stop. The information poster indicated that there are two lines and that only line 1 would run. According to the information, the bus would run every 20 minutes. There is no interactive information, on which you can see how long it will take (like in the subway). We waited for more than half an hour, but did not see an Aerobus. Also during our stay in Lisbon we did not see an Aerobus running. Our tip is to Trips by Metro: cheap, relatively quick and clear.

title: Pro driver.
text:
The general's all right. The problem was a driver who in the beginning on our second day. He begins to tell us that we (without the slightest idea) get off without pressing the stop button. Being that we know how this system works since I work in tourism in Portugal and I am a Tourism Guide.
Better instruct drivers to talk to accurate information. Don't make things up!!!! It ruined my start of the day in Lisbon with my family coming from sight!

title: Shame the Driver, Not Pro
text: Overall well, the hearing aids are good and so are the explanations. What is noteworthy is that the driver who touched us on Wednesday, October 16 at 9:00 was totally disrespectful, got confused in person and started challenging us... totally inappropriate, should be talked to with the customer, ruined our day

title: Save your money
text: Didn‚Äôt get a lot of history. Played more music over headphones. Also bus felt very dirty. Good thing it was inexpensive.

title: 2nd day no staff or busses at cruise terminal
text: We chose yellow over red company but sorry. We were in Port two days and bought 2 day ticket. But we We came to counter in Port terminal the second day there was no one at yellow bus counter and no yellow bus. The red and green lines were there. Only op t ion was to walk to the Rosario square 30 minutes up hill. I applied for refund and hope they respond. For now best to choose red line if at cruiseport in lisbon

title: Too long boring
text: Waiting time too long and some routes specifically purple is too boring highly not recommended they could make routes more interesting

title: Don‚Äôt buy. Horrible
text: Worst ever. Buses weren‚Äôt running. App didn‚Äôt work. Drivers rude. Not one thing good to say about this experience. Don‚Äôt know what else to say.

title: Very poor
text: Very poor. You can‚Äôt get on and off at the same stop without getting off at the terminus and waiting for the next bus. One day we waited 45 mins. Staff lied- said the bus would arrive in 10 mins, after 15 mins then said another 10 mins. When you complain they just say it‚Äôs not their fault. The red busses looked to be better organised.

title: In need of Maintanance!
text: I gave my elderly parents two tickets as a gift for the their first-time trip to Lisbon. My own memory of Tram 28 is wonderful. Sadly, this was not the case for them. Multiple ports for the audio did not work, and they were unable to listen to the commentary during the tour. Instead, the guide / driver tried to shout from the front what to look out for when they complained about the audio ports being defective, but obviously this is not ideal, and they were unable to hear him. For the price of this offer, this felt like being ripped off. Let's maintain the tram so that everyone can benefit from this premium service?

title: Poor experience
text:
Very disorganised, awful service, impolite staff that do not accept constructive feedback.
Tour taken the 21st of September from the main point.

title: Not worth the hype.
text: Awful audio quality. Couldn‚Äôt understand a word. No historical overview. Just music 90% of the time. Waste of money and time.

title: Unhappy and disappointed when doing the river cruise due to tour guide and sales girl
text: We bought a 48 hour ticket for the yellow bus and boat cruise. The bus was very nice and far more informative than the #Grayline in Porto. When we went on the cruise we were standing in the hot sun queueing for about 40 minutes before they allowed people to board. By this time there was a very long queue. About 15 minutes before boarding a tour arrived and when boarding started they said we should wait for the tour to board first. There is no signage saying that so I told them ‚ÄúNO!!!‚Äù Or refund my money now!! The tour guide had me by the arm pushing me until I told him not to touch me. (I am a woman in my late sixties) and this is the respect he showed. Everyone in the queue was very angry and the man in front of me in the queue said as a senior, he will not give way for this young tour. So much unhappiness to the extent that it seemed a fight would breakout. The captain then told the tour guide everyone should board at the same time.

title: AWFUL
text: This was the worst hop on hop off bus I have ever been on. I had a ticket for 2 days and went on the first leg but never went on again because the quality was so poor. The sound quality was bad and was not synced to what I was seeing. The narration was so poor, I learned nothing about the city. I asked for a refund but was denied.

title: It was a bad experience.
text:
They sold me a schedule that was no longer active in Belem station and I was waiting more than an hour and a half for the boat to arrive, I could not take it another time because that day I bought the ticket I was going to Madrid,
I've sent a lot of emails to get my ticket refunded and they won't respond.
People who sell the service are not well trained to give the reports.

title: Boat tour with two classes of guests
text: The bus tour was as expected. But: During the boat tour we queued with many others about 20 minutes in the sun. Shortly before the start of the tour, a tour group was led past us onto the boat. Only then was everyone else allowed on board. The tour group of course took the best places. As a family we are regularly on Trips But that was by far the greatest injustice we have ever experienced. The displeasure of the other participants was also obvious. Yellow Bus Tours, come up with something.

title: Avoid at all costs. A huge waste of time.
text:
One of, if not THE worst tour of my life. We took the blue line from the cruise port to meet up to the smaller green line. It was over an hour of wasted time. The blue line seems purposely designed to take you everywhere in Lisbon that you never wanted to see: industrial areas, abandoned, ruined buildings, soulless, newly built suburbs, a freeway, and you nearly make it to the airport before finally reaching the historical center.

Oh, and it took nearly an hour to finally depart as the driver was doubling as the ticket seller and each transaction took forever. He did finally drive off but pulled over again to argue with someone on his cell phone about the receipts, until enough of us complained and we eventually got underway.

If we had known what awaited us, we‚Äôd have been in no hurry.

Save your money, and more importantly your time, and get a tuk tuk or find literally any other means to explore Lisbon.

This is NOT the way to go.

title: Don‚Äôt expect to learn much on this tour
text:
The audio portion of this tour was extremely short. There was so much time to tell about buildings, neighborhoods, tourist, sites, history! Anything that would be interesting to someone in their first time here in Lisbon.

99% of the time you got to hear Portuguese music, drowning on interrupted only a handful of times with some history about what you are seeing on the tour

We‚Äôve done many hop on hop off tours, and most of them are very enlightening, educational, and interesting.

This was anything but the above

title: Departure to laa 18:00 and NO BOAT LEAVES
text:
We waited almost an hour to ride it on the boat and at the end because it occurred to us to ask a boy and it turns out that at six in the afternoon none have changed the time without warning canceling six in the afternoon

SHAMEFUL

title: These tours are terrible.
text: The tour audio guide is so boring 3/4 of the guide is Portuguese music and you can't adjust the volume or at least it doesn't say.It was the worst audio guide I listened to.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your money! No service to clients!
text: A hundred percent would not recommend! Ours broke down 10 minutes in the tour, and we got left in very hot temperatures with direct sun for about 1 hour, everyone left. We emailed yellow bus tours and never got a response for a refound. Do better yellow bus tours!

title: Rubbish service
text: Absolute rubbish - DO NOT USE. get local rebus tour.been waiting half an hour- no bus and no replyfrom tour operator. PHONE LINES DONT CONNECT.

title: Bad
text:
Unfortunately, communication is very poor.
Buses don't come Trams sometimes don't run at all
Employee promises money back but is just a promise

title: Stick to the Blue Route
text: The Belem tour of the historic city was very interesting. The tour of modern Lisbon was the dullest bus tour I‚Äôve ever done. Give it a miss! Also be prepared for non-stop awful music which really detracts from the experience. Why is there no option to hear the narrator only?

title: Don't do it
text: I wouldn't recommend it at all. Everything on the bus was broken, this was due to the warm weather, the employee at the starting point said. She said we could get the price of the ticket back. To date, I have never received a response to my many emails.

title: Disappointed, honestly not worth it
text:
Honestly, we expected better
Nothing special
We were sold the super tours
And nothing magical
I do not recommend this outing, there are other things to do
Disappointed

title: Hop on Tour Incomplete
text: We were told the Tram tour for June 12 was cancelled due to a festival. That tour should have been blocked during our booking. We were not able to make up for the list opportunity fue to other tours we booked. We have reached out to Yellow Bus Tours for a ticket extension but nothing has been heard from them. We are requesting your intervention to get a ticket extension for today,June 16. We are leaving Portugal early tomorrow morning. If not we are requesting a refund for the Tram tour leg of our booking.

title: Be prepared for long waits
text:
Unfortunately not so happy with Yellow Bus in Lisbon for these reasons :
1. Long waits between buses, waited up to one hour. Did not take the chance of getting off. Missed a realtime online schedule.
2. Information on guide was limited. Long intermissions with after a while annoying Fado music ( I would prefer less music and more information and maybe a couple fun stories) I am sure there are so much more to tell about this city.
3. For boat tour, they had us waiting out in burning sun and 30 degrees for 30 minutes before letting us on the boat. Recommend to set up shades in summertime . The information on boat was very brief and in too many languages.

Good thing with the tour is that you get an ok overview of the city.

title: Packed tram
text: Yellow historic tram. We were told in brochure only pickup was Rossi square waited an hour at Rossi square only to find it also picked up locals and tourists along the route . Soon our tram was heaving and I was giving up my seat for woman with a baby ...

title: Not a good idea to take this tour in summer as you will roast. Poor quality audio. No accommodations for woman traveling
text: So much to complain about. I was alone with my daughter and twice we had to run a bus down that should have seen us trying to make it. Although my daughter had a paid ticket she had to sit on my lap because of the overcrowding. Advertised as having free WiFi and AC, did not have either. Audio did not work so I didn‚Äôt know anything about where we were. Driver did not announce stops so us and other passengers were lost as to where and when to get off. Feel like I got gypped since I paid for 2 tickets but never got two persons worth of service. I was in hijab and felt ignored and discriminated against when I asked any questions since the entire experience was so confusing.

title: Never again! Total scam
text: This tour company is a complete rip off. 1 tour was ok. 1 tour was mostly the same as the first and showing you where the malls are. Finally the tram tour, we could not get on as the lines were too long. Too many tickets sold. This was a total scam and rip off. Never again booking with this company. They should be ashamed to take money for what they are giving people.

title: Don‚Äòt recommend !!
text:
The overall experience was just about okish. We tried to get on the bus at the tile museum but the bus driver just ignored us and we ended up wasting 40 minutes waiting for the next one to come which was very ANNOYING! Yellow bus tour also needs to be more clear about the discounts you get at museums as we found out you don‚Äôt get a discount on your ticket at the tile museum. The gentleman at the tile museum literally told us that ‚Äöthey lie‚Äò about the discounts and that he‚Äôs only aware of discounts on tickets for the aquarium. After that experience we were nervous about using our ticket for the tram but luckily it worked!

We also felt that there was too much music and not enough commentary! We purchased the 48 hour bus ticket which was 28 Euros per person which is quite steep based off the experience you actually get! You‚Äôre better off just walking around Lisbon, doing your research online beforehand and taking the tram occasionally!

title: Bad experience
text: Our bus crush with a cat, they bring us to the next bus, without any care or medical atention, some people have some punches, like me in my Leg, my wife in arm. Not any consideration or asking if we need something. Very nad experience

title: Boring and overpriced - I learnt basically nothing
text: Lisbon is a beautiful city and the tour had some lovely views. However, the commentary was sparse and dull. It was 90% music with very little information. ‚Ç¨22 felt very expensive for this tour. It was so boring we got off halfway round and got a tram back into town because we couldn't be bothered getting back on. I'm a tour guide and I wanted to learn about Portugal and Lisbon - I felt like I learnt almost nothing after being on this bus for an hour with perhaps 10 minutes total commentary. Boring, overpriced, and the traffic is terrible (which isn't their fault but means you spend ages sitting in traffic while music plays with almost no commentary at all). It was very disappointing.

title: Modern tour - not worth seeing
text: Unfortunately, the tour isn't particularly exciting. We decided to join spontaneously and didn't check the route beforehand. I think the Bel√©m tour is interesting, but the modern tour isn't at all! You'll also be going to Nirvana, so it's not really a good idea to get off...

title: Not the yellow buses
text: Be careful there are 2 companies, yellow or red buses. You have to take the red buses, many more buses, availability and therefore much less waiting. The routes are identical.

title: Lack of respect for tourists.
text: We waited more than an hour for the bus to pass, we arrived at 1500h, near the navy museum and the bus only arrived at 16:00h, everything leads us to believe that it was on purpose to arrive close to 19:00h and not have to do another trip, the red buses pass at least three times.

title: No Buses, though Tram Great
text: The tram part of the Lisbon Hop-On Hop-Off Tour was great. The guide was very knowledgeable and personable. We would definitely recommend this part of the tour. The following day we went to the bus stop and waited for an hour. The bus never came, so we started to walk various places. After a while we waited at another stop, but the bus never came. In fact, the entire day we never saw a yellow bus to get on. What a waste of time and money. We finally ended up buying a Grayline hop-on hop-off pass for the rest of the day, which worked well.

title: Lisbon Red route on the Hop on Hop off bus
text:
The Red Bus and Red Route - avoid !!
No working ear phones make this a complete disaster- They say available every 30mins - lie !!
The Grey line was the one we should have booked

title: Nice trip but with problems! Yellow bus LIS
text:
Nice tour and good information about the sights. Maybe there could be a little more informations about what you can see on the route in Lisboa.
We had two 48h ticket (76‚Ç¨) yellow bus + tram and got it printed at our first bus trip. Sadly we lost the print for the second day. We had the online booking confirmation, payment and the voucher but we‚Äôre not allowed
to get into the bus again without the print. Us was told that we can get a discount for a new one. Also there was no reaction to our support e-mail. There was only a Portuguese telephone number‚Ä¶ no chance to get help.
That‚Äòs a very bad way to handle customers!

title: BIG Disappointment
text: Big Disappointment. Traveling with family 7 people (total 2 are 78 yrs old. ) As recommended by travel agent we went on Monday. We started at 9 am and were off on last bus run. Most Museums were closed which we found out when we disembarked. When asking drivers for information all 3buses we used were very abrupt. We were told came every 30 minutes it was more 45 to 1 hour no shade or benches available to wait‚Ä¶,,5 bussed were shown on the live route app. App says 3 minutes away and never shows. When got the buses they are over crowded had to sit lower level no ac or open windows for air circulation. Tried taking yellow boat which is extra and due to lack of busses missed the delay and had 2 1/2 h wait. Then missed bus‚Äôs for next stop had hour wait Very uncomfortable especially for older adults after standing in sun for 45 min to hour. Never got to use modern Lisbon route as bus never came. After 1hour wait we took last Belem bus so we could at least get nearer to our hotel. Wasted most of day waiting for the bus. Not a true hop on off ride. Better pay little more and have tour where you can get off and on

title: Crap Hop-on Hop-off company
text: This is the worst hop-on, hop-off company I ever travelled with. We had a 3-day pass code on my phone, plus a printed copy. The initial bus driver scanned the code on my phone and issued us one flimsy receipt. At no point did he say it was the ONLY way you are then able to travel for the duration. If you lose or damage your flimsy paper receipt, where the QR code won't scan, there is absolutely no contingency plan and the driver will not accept your 3 day phone/printed pass. Basically, we spent over 80 euros to take one trip on a yellow bus, got our ticket soaking wet in the TORRENTS that happened that first morning (27th March 2024) and that was the end of our free trams, river cruise, elevator ticket, and discounts to various places. It was a complete rip-off, with NO after sales service or flexibility. NEVER use this company - there are plenty of others in Lisbon!

title: Already before noon Unreliable and totally overcrowded
text: It would have been nice if the buses hadn't been hopelessly overcrowded by midday. This meant that the timetable could no longer be kept. Instead of the promised 20 minutes, I had to wait over 45 minutes for the next bus, only to then not be able to get on. I just continued on foot, which was a shame.

title: Average
text: The weather was terrible, so the impressions of the trip were not very good. I was surprised by the skill of the drivers, who masterfully taxied in the narrow streets, plus the heavy traffic. If you get good weather, you can go. But in comparison with other European cities, a trip to Lisbon loses in its organization.

title: I do not recommend this excursion!
text: The excursion is about nothing, the route is nothing, the guide's story is just empty. At the stops you have to wait for the bus for an hour, the online map does not work. In response to our complaints in the chat, they couldn‚Äôt really say anything. We planned visits to interesting places in Lisbon, because of this excursion We didn‚Äôt have time to get anywhere!! Maybe the red buses will be ok, but I don‚Äôt recommend the yellow ones 100%!!

title: We could not use it due to yellow bus delay.
text: We went to Lisbon to travel as a family. We made a reservation for the Yellow bus. We did not use it because the train was delayed on the tour we purchased. We informed the officer that the time of our flight was not certain and that sometimes there were delays and that we had the right to cancel and sent an e-mail. We wrote many times, just asking for the ticket and getting a call. They didn't even respond yet and we were left feeling victimized.

title: Not very tourist-friendly
text: The tour itself was nice but they were not very informative about their bus schedules. The driver dropped us off in the middle of nowhere at the end of the Belem tour without any English explanation, and the bus schedule did not accord with the live schedule, so we ended up not being able to take on the Modern tour, wasting a lot of time and money. I emailed the customer center for a partial refund but got no response, as expected.

title: Long and boring. Just get a tram ticket.
text: Red line bus was ok and took around 50 minutes. The blue line tour took almost 2 hours and you mainly see high rise apartment blocks until you get to Belem. Don't bother at all. Long and boring. The tram part you are told that you have to embark at a certain point and that you can't get off once on. So not true.
