So my advice is to just buy a tram ticket and you can hop on hop off the 28 and 12 tram as often as you want. Fantastic.

title: Disappointing experience
text: We expected more from the 48-hours tickets. On our way back from Belem tower the bus drove away 10 minutes before the time mentioned in the live-app. Afterwards the app didn't work anymore and we took a regular tram (30 minutes walk). The next day we tried to hop on the Red Tram but the driver didn't open the doors and just drove away. Some other tourists had the same experience. The last ram at 17:00 hours is to early if you want to take full advantage of the tickets.

title: Disappointing bus tour
text:
Whenever I visit a new city I take the local Red bus tour as an introduction to the city The narration on the Lisbon city tour was abysmal. We passed by so many interesting looking places but heard nothing but music on our earphones.
So disappointed.

title: Bus driver ignore people at bus stop!
text: Staff service is not good. 1) We waited more than 25 mins at the bus stop and the bus driver drove past us. Luckily he had to stop at the red light and we caught up to him. When we asked him why he didn't stop for us, he scoffed that we had to raise our hand to signal him to stop. Hmm, we standing there with eye contact to the driver and steps moving towards the approaching bus is not a good enough signal for him to stop? 2) The staff who issued us the ticket at Station Martim Moniz was not friendly either. She did not bother giving enough direction and map and did not help organize people standing in line for the bus where some people took advantage of cutting in front when the bus arrived. Overall the staff don't seem to be happy with their jobs.

title: Terrible service, little tourist interest, poor quality/price ratio
text: Terrible service, the headset didn't work, the staff ignored the problem, so I had to share it with my partner. The information given is minimal, most of it is played with Portuguese music, the route is of little interest, only the Belem area is spared. In short, it was two hours of boredom on large avenues full of traffic lights. I don't recommend it to anyone.

title: Worst experience in Lisbon!
text: This was the worst experience I ever had. Overpriced and a real waste of time. AVOID! We were going up and down in the same areas.

title: Pathetically boring commentary
text:
Only do this for a convenient, overview tour of the city. Do not expect an informatory commentary as it is extremely weak. There's over an hour of information that the recorded guide could provide but it doesn't instead, a few bits of information here and there. Some of the commentary wasn't even informative but rather common sense like "stop by one of the many cafes throughout the city when thirsty or hungry." Duh...

Also, the company should have a more sustainable option for the headphones rather than having customers just dispose of them. If you do go on this tour, please don't forget to throw away the little plastic bags of the headphones! I saw so many on the floor and getting blown away as litter...

title: Boring and lazy commentary‚Ä¶.
text:
Worst bus tour we‚Äôve experienced. Purchased a 48 hr pass on the Yellowbus as we were in Lisbon for 3 nights travelling from Ireland. We did one of the routes on the first day and on the last stop, after an extremely dull commentary (via personal headphones), we got off the bus near the castle with all the other passengers. None of the commentary gave us information as to what to do when we got off so, like most of the other passengers, we got back on the bus and headed back to the city centre. Boring!

The second day was exactly the same and we headed towards the Aquarium - a rather bleak, dull drive from the city centre. It was the same commentary as the previous day - boring, uninspired, uninformative and lazy. Aquarium was quite good but expensive at ‚Ç¨25 per head. We turned off the commentary on the second bus route because it was so repetitive.

title: Hop On Hop Off Bus - Blue Route Lisbon
text:
We usually love the hop on hop off buses & think they are usually great value for money but today we did the blue route around Lisbon & it was two boring hours of not much to see of any real interest. ( Only 4 photos taken which says it all! )
We were very disappointed that this was a route chosen to represent Lisbon as our friends took a tut tut around the old part near the shops & cafes & said Lisbon was beautiful.

title: Not really worthy
text:
Only two buses served the two lines that the yellow bus offers and they were always almost full (especially the blue route) therefore not really a lot of opportunities to jump on and off as there was a lot of waiting time in between‚Ä¶
Not really worthy, compared to other options - the red busses for example which were many more serving their routes.
The benefits were that the 48-hours ticket offered a free ride on 28 tram and the yellow old trams.

title: Waste of time and money
text:
Completely unreliable. Wasted a lot of time waiting for busses. Obviously they skipped some. Used the bus 3 times, twice I had to wait for more than 30 minutes.
Bus was overcrowded, stood downstairs.
21 Euros for 24-hour ticket is ridiculous.

title: Could not even get on the bus! Don't believe Rick Steeves' recommendation
text: The buses were so overcrowded and late. We waited for 3 buses (well over an hour) before walking back down the garden and taking the Grey Line (doubling our cost) which had lots of buses and more routes. Don't believe when buying online that there are limited numbers sold to prevent this. We heard from others waiting that the reason they took this company is that Rick Steeves recommended it. Maybe he is getting a piece of the action. Thanks to Grey Line, we salvaged the days.

title: Don't bother
text: Not very well signposted to where you have to buy your tickets, eventually we found a long queue and a lady selling tickets, she said the next bus would be the one for Belem, we waited a good 40 mins and when the bus came it was carnage, people who don't know how to queue were pushing to the front, the queue was so long we didn't get on the first bus. The lady selling tickets said ths next one would be another 25 mins, by this time we were losing the will to live. However another one turned up within 15 mins we boarded and sat upstairs, commentary was patchy interspersed with music. It wasn't clear when you were approaching a stop so you could easily miss it. The return journey was horrendous, it was pouring with rain and when we got on it was standing room only, the driver then proceeds to let more people on at the next stop, clearly no room we were packed in like sardines, not helped by some ignorant Germans who barged one through the exit doors making it more packed and dangerous. These tours need some health and safety regulations, if the bus had crashed it would have been carnage, more buses need putting onto the routes as you wait ages. Don't bother paying for this you might as well use the public bus or tram system which would probably be safer!!!!

title: Disappointing tour üòï
text:
Worst city bus tour I've been on. 2 sides of city very boring and not worth spending 1.5 hrs each day on bus. Trams are better or tuk tuks.
Very disappointed.

title: Queues, crowds and tram out of service
text: Very bad service. Queues, buses always full on the upper floor, etc. In addition, we took the combined bus&tram ticket to take the tram tour with our 4-year-old son. But the tram service was not working. I have sent an email to get the money back for the tram tour and I am still waiting for a response.

title: BOAT CANCELLED WITH NO NOTICE
text: The boat trip from Lisbon to Belem on Saturday was nice enough but the reason we picked a hop on, hop off was so we could spend time in Belem and come back to Lisbon later. When we disembarked at Belem nobody bothered to tell us that the next - and last of the day - boat had been cancelled. So, when we were ready to return we stood around for ages wondering why it was late, only to find out from someone who didn‚Äôt even work for the company that they‚Äôd cancelled it, We then had to pay for a taxi to bring us back to Lisbon. As there we‚Äôre 3 of us I paid ‚Ç¨66 for what was basically a one-way boat ride to Belem, and had the expense of a taxi home afterwards. I‚Äôve emailed the company to ask for a partial refund and had zero response so far. Pretty shocking customer service. If you‚Äôre thinking of doing this trip, make sure you double check that the boat you want to return on is actually running.

title: Not so good
text: We took a a non stop ride and TWICE the trolley got stuck because of cars blocking the path. The first time we were delayed for maybe one hour. The second time, we just gave up and walked. They have no system in place to come and tow the cars. This happened twice on one ride. That was a wasted $50. I have to say, everything in Lisbon is inefficient. Just saying. Lots of wasted time.

title: Not recommendable
text:
Completely overcrowded buses and unfriendly bus drivers. Some passengers stood on the stairs to the open part of the bus during the journey. Far too few stops on the return journey.
Tram tour did not take place due to technical defects. No information at the stop and the update on the website was far too late. Catastrophic service.

title: Yellow bus sells tickets for routes that they aren't operating.
text:
Sold us a ticket for 2 bus routes and boat route. 1 route was shut down, the other was skipping half the route. The boat kicked us off because crew were going on a 2hr lunch and left no where close to a bus route. Had to get taxi to get home.

Tried second day and driver sent us up top where there were no seats. By the time we got back down he had people standing in the aisle. No way to hear the tour without a seat. When questioned, driver suggested getting off...next bus wasn't for another hour and no guarantee it would have seats.

Asked for money back but no response.

AVOID YELLOW BUS.

title: Hop on and don‚Äôt get off because I probably won‚Äôt be a seat when you come back
text: We bought the ticket and then had to stand and wait for an hour and 15 minutes on the hot sun because they didn‚Äôt have enough buses. Was total chaos when they a bus would come in. It would take them 15 minutes to load a bus for 65 people totally unacceptable. They didn‚Äôt have a capacity to load more than one bus at a time. Even if multiple buses were there they would only load one‚Ä¶. complete chaos. We should‚Äôve been told upfront, and we are going to stand there for well over an hour in the hot sun, but no one mentioned that when they sold us a ticket.

title: Bad experience with Yellow Bus in Portugal
text: The time frames for intervals between bird is supposed to be 20 minutes. We routinely experienced waits over an hour long. Their app showing where the buses are currently and when they should arrive at your stop were wrong most of the time. The worst issue is that they don‚Äôt announce the upcoming stop and if no one on the bus has pressed the stop button, they do not stop! So if you are waiting to be picked up at a stop where no one on the bus has pressed stop, they will drive right past you. Lastly, the lower enclosed portion of the bus is not air conditioned or even has fans. It gets extremely hot on these buses. We noticed the the Red line buses ran much more frequently and kept to their advertised schedules. We are trying cancel our remaining Yellow bus tickets in Seville, Madrid and Barcelona. Really has been the worst part of our trip.

title: Very poorly organized
text:
We waited for the bus for more than an hour with at least 70 other passengers. In between, one of them let the passengers get off and then drove backwards to a parking lot where he was parked. It was 36 degrees in Lisbon that day and there was no shade at the stop. When a bus finally arrived, there was almost a fight when getting on. Many people then stood in the bus and were not given any explanations.
We would not choose yellow bus again

title: Disappointing
text: We have gone on many hop on hop off tours. This was the worst we have been on. The driver was very nice but it was an extremely hot day and the air conditioning in the bus was not sufficient to make us comfortable. Needless to say it made the tour excruciating. Also the audio tour explanation was ok but the music at the pauses was extremely annoying.

title: SHAMBLES!!! BUS DIDN‚ÄôT EVEN ARRIVE‚Ä¶TWICE
text: We opted for the Modern Lisbon Line as we had read online that 2 stops were unavailable on the Blue line due to a public event. We arrived and purchased tickets at a kiosk close by, then headed to the bus stop to get the 10am bus. On arrival at the bus stop, there was a crowd of people with no organisation. Just a large group gathered for both routes that depart from the same stop. After waiting for around half an hour with no sign of the bus we needed (plenty for the other tour but we were not allowed to get on this one instead), we decided to go and explore nearby stalls and return for the next bus which was due at 11am rather than stand in the direct sun. On our return there was still no real organisation, and the same people were still waiting for a purple line bus so we knew we hadn‚Äôt missed it while we were away. After waiting more than half an hour, still with no bus for the tour we had purchased tickets for arriving, we asked one of the staff who said they would have phone management to find out what was happening. They said they had no idea and were wondering the same as the customers as to the whereabouts of the bus. We had wasted the morning by this point and weren‚Äôt keen to spend the rest of the day at bus stops waiting for buses that didn‚Äôt arrive! We asked how we could get a refund, being advised to return to the kiosk as our tickets had not yet been redeemed. The kiosk could not give a refund as we paid by card and we were told to email the company directly. We emailed yellowbus@carris.pt at that the time, providing the evidence of our purchase and explained our experience. Still waiting for a response despite chasing. It‚Äôs a bit of a stretch calling it a bus tour if there is no bus to get on! All in all, not a good experience and generally a waste of our time.

title: Efficient, but boring.
text: Waste of time. We always use the Hop on Hop off bus tours, because of the information offered. These tours use a recorded message. Not all the ear plugs work and the plug-ins have different UI‚Äôs, making the usage vary from one seat to the next. Perhaps it was just Greyline. There are other Hop On Hop Off tour operators. However, the Yellow route was a reasonable way to get around the western side of the city.

title: Not a good experience
text: Unfortunately I would not recommend this tour bus as it was constantly full and we really did struggle to get a seat. Other people in the queue we also complaining and some people got off as it was standing room only. This is not the fault of the driver but the company should be putting on more buses.

title: Was left behind
text:
I ordered a 48 hour ticket for the New Lisbon and Belem tour for 27 euros. On the first day, I took the last departure on the trip to New Lisbon. The live coverage of the bus route was fine and the trip was reasonably interesting. The next day I took the trip to Belem, and since I chose the 4pm departure, I also wanted to use the hop-off/hop-on option.
At the stop under the bridge "Ponte 25 de Abril" at 4:50 p.m. I went for a walk in the area, and returned to the same stop at 7:30 p.m
On the "live coverage" I could see that the bus was estimated to arrive at this stop at 7:45 p.m., but unfortunately it was informed on the screen that the live coverage was not working. I waited until 8:15 p.m. but no bus came!
As the Yellow Bus Tours page it is stated that the ticket also could be used for public trams, I therefore tried to use this option to come back, but was refused by the driver.

title: Waiting for final pay at the end of the afternoon
text:
The bus does not come or comes very late, sometimes you have to wait an hour.
And according to the track and trace it will arrive soon, but it won't be very disruptive

title: Chaos
text: Day one: arrived at starting point at Praca da Figueira to find a scene of chaos with huge queues with no indication of which line was for which route. The two staff members present seemed to be totally out of their depth and were less than helpful. Eventually got on a bus after an hour in the sun. Day two: got on a bus at an intermediate stop to find that there were no seats but incredibly at the next stop more people were allowed on. We got off at the next again stop and gave up on the tour.

title: A shame and scam of a tour.
text: In the brochure it says a frequency of 25' and today we waited at the Jer√≥nimos stop for 1:05'. The bus was full, all the people standing, a woman with a baby sitting on the step of the bus, the heat was unbearable. Nobody took responsibility. It is recommended not to use Yellow Bus

title: ...not recommended!
text: It's simply unbelievable, the bus drivers just drive past the stops. It's not possible to get on or off. The staff are not available to answer questions.

title: Don't go.
text: This tour was horribly organized, one line for four or five different tours. People cut in line with no consequences. The employees gave erroneous information and did not monitor the crowd. There was no air conditioning on the bottom level. No one gave out earphones or a map. A waste of money. The thing I enjoyed most was getting off the bus. People were sitting on the floor and standing between the seats.

title: Very bad service
text: This was very disappointing. We managed to take just few stops. Buses were too crowded we had to stand all the time and there was no place to plug in the earphones so we missed everything. Busses were late also. It was disaster actually. Would never take this again. Total waste of money and time.

title: It was chaotic!!!
text: Terrible! First I took an uber to the Pra√ßa da Figueira to wait for the first bus of the day and it only showed up an hour later after the time it was supposed to run, not only that, there were so many people wait for the bus already that I wasn‚Äôt able to go on board of the first one, my line was the blue one, and for 2 consecutive buses they showed up with the red line, so the line got super long again over 50 people waiting for the bus around 11am! We kept waiting for the bus and not be seen, the girls working there selling and scanning tickets said the traffic was really bad that day, she came to scan my ticket (before the bus was even there) which I regret doing that, cause I ended up having my voucher as redeemed, kept waiting til I changed my mind and took another Uber to the Torre Bel√©m! I called requesting a refund cause I didn‚Äôt get to use the bus (even tho my ticket was scanned by the girl at the bus stop), and I‚Äôm still waiting to see if the refund is gonna happen, specially cause they may think I used the bus when in fact I did not and ended up spending over ‚Ç¨50 euros on uber rides so my day wouldn‚Äôt be wasted! I was there on a cruise ship so I only had between 9am to 3pm to enjoy Lisbon, and the Yellow bus made me waste 3 hours of my time in Lisbon! Never again!

title: The experimente was middle
text: We hat a 48 hours ticket with bus and bost im Lissabon. The busses and the boat were ok. But the busses and the boat also were mostly too Fall and you have to weit for the next one or even staying in it without sound.

title: Not good at all.
text: Booked this ticket on the spot at one of their tour kiosks, for that day. We set off and dropped off at the Gardens, for only 10 minutes. We were told that buses come every 30 minutes. We were left waiting for 3 hours. There were also other people with children, that were stranded. No shade on a hot day. We ended up getting an Uber to the places of our interest. Several Red buses came along, but no Red ones. There was no time during our trip to return to the Kiosk, to challenge them. It was completely a wasted time. We would like a refund as we did not do the tour. The picture attached is of some of the other people (strangers) who were waiting for the bus.

title: Yellow Bus Tours Lisbon is a scam - they take your money and don‚Äôt provide the tours you pay for
text:
DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES USE THIS TOUR COMPANY
Paid A$141 for two 72 hour bus tickets plus tram tour and river cruise. Buses were advertised as running every 20 minutes. Tried to use the tickets on our first day in Lisbon and waited at the bus stop for 1 1/2 hours (with 16 other very angry people) but no bus ever turned up. Tried to ring the company but couldn‚Äôt get through on the phone so emailed them but they haven‚Äôt bothered to reply. They have not tried in any way to contact me to apologise or explain their failure to provide a service yesterday.YELLOW
Am reporting this company to the Portuguese Tourism Authority.

title: Terrible service and company yellow us
text: Bus totally full, people standing up, zero safety! I told to the driver that it was not right and safety an he ignored saying the safety was outside the bus. The timing between points was also totally wrong taking much more time than expected. TERRIBLE COMPANY (plate attached)

title: Terrible frequency: one bus every hour. Not worth it!
text:
Busses are coming every hour on the hour.
The red busses are coming every 15 min. Don‚Äôt waste your money or time on the yellow busses.
The red busses have identical routes.

title: Disappointing and a waste of time.
text: Such a waste of money, insufficient info and bad customer service. Communication was awful. They wouldn‚Äôt accept our booking which was made via Viator and trip advisor. Had to walk to kiosk mikes away to get a printed voucher for the bus. The staff were unhelpful/borderline rude. The bus trip itself was no comparison to others like it I‚Äôve done. Not much info/faulty headphone‚Äôs. Biggest waste of money!

title: Boring - would not recommend
text: Did the Belem Bus Tour with my partner and we were very unimpressed. Boring route with uninteresting stops/sights, not enough audio commentary and poor communication throughout. The staff selling the tickets we‚Äôre really lovely and helpful but overall the tour was boring. Would not recommend.

title: Red bus much better
text: Looks like operating only few buses,always full of peoples,one bus didn't even stopped in one station even though could see few empty seats on top of the roof. Allowing standing peoples they obstruct the views

title: Disappointing
text: First they don't comply with the schedule, the first day they had us waiting for an hour for the bus to come. And secondly, it is not normal that with three small children and I suffering from a back problem, we spend another hour waiting for the bus in the sun and in August, in front of us a couple enters the bus and they do not let us enter without any explanation.

title: A lot of money for little service
text:
A lot of money for very little. The bus routes are not very interesting, there are far too few buses, which means there are long lines everywhere and the aisles are full. Hop off is not possible, you will never get back in.
For the same money you can book a much nicer tuk tuk tour!

title: Late late late
text: Don'Get it, it's always late and stops before 19 as scheduled. Very crowded it's difficult getting Place on the top!

title: Bus never showed up
text: We gave up after waiting 1 hour for a bus to arrive, ended up taking a taxi. After buying tickets online we were told that the boat trips were fully booked for most of the day.

title: NOT RECOMMENDED!
text:
Not a good experience overall. We were staying right on the route at Puerto do Sol. The website mentioned this as a ‚Äúwaystop‚Äù. We bought tickets online and waited for the tram. When it arrived it drove thru without stopping. The driver signalled he can‚Äôt stop. The website doesn‚Äôt explain this.

We tried to get a regular 28 to the terminus for the tour but 2 were full. That was 45 minute already wasted waiting at the Puerto do Sol stop, so we took an Uber to the terminus.

At the terminus we were told the last tram of the day would leave in 25 minutes and it would only do 75% of the usual tour. It was 4:15pm and they say they run til 6:30ish I think. Disappointing when you‚Äôve paid ‚Ç¨100+ for tickets based on the very misleading web info.

When the tour started it was better than a usual tram 28 in that there were seats. There was also commentary in many languages but it didn‚Äôt seem at all aligned to where we were passing. Also it wasn‚Äôt at all interesting. Mostly just stating the obviously - what you could see out of the windows.

After Alfama the tour got very very dull. We ended up in some industrial areas. Not at all attractive. The tram then stopped for the night near the port and we were told to get off 15 minutes walk to the nearest tram stop to complete the loop back to where we‚Äôd started. It was probably very convenient for the driver. For all the passagers it was huge inconvenience.

I would NOT recommend this tram tour to anyone. It‚Äôs mostly very boring. It is hugely overpriced and the staff are happy to dump you miles from anywhere in a distant port at the end. Perhaps get Uber back if you get dumped at the port. The regular trams certainly aren‚Äôt a viable option.

title: Pior empresa!! Decepcionante!!
text:
PIOR experi√™ncia q tive! FUJAM da YELLOW BUS!!
A yellow bus simplesmente n√£o tem √¥nibus, mais de uma hora de espera pra passar os !
N√£o respeitam hor√°rio, muito tempo perdido!
E ainda perdi o comboio de volta a Espinho por causa desses atrasos absurdos!!!

title: I Hopped Off Disappointed
text: This is a very impersonal touring experience. I‚Äôve done many city tours and the best parts of these tours in most cases are the guides, the stories they tell, and their personalities. This tour is prerecorded. Also, the bus is not air conditioned and can be very hot, like the day I toured.

title: AVOID THIS BUS TOUR!
text: One bus an hour.. ‚Äúlive updates‚Äù on website don‚Äôt work. Definitely not as advertised on the website as showing one bus every 20 minutes‚Ä¶ DO NOT TAKE THIS BUS! Choose the red hop on hop off bus tours or Gray Line which seemed to be much more frequent! It was a waste of money that we barely got any use out of

title: Rude bus drivers
text: Very rude bus drivers! They don‚Äôt stop at all the bus stops. Not so complex route like the other companies. I highly recommended NOT to buy tickets at this company!

title: Bus not stopping in main attraction, awful customer service
text: We waited more than 1h30 to get the bus at the Mosteiro dos Jer√≥nimos to find out the bus was skipping this stop after calling the company. In the website we could see the scheduled time to arrive but it never did, while the buses from the other companies were stopping there. Customer service was awful, no refund was given after asking on the phone. Moreover the other companies buses are much more frequent than yellow bus. Do yourself a favor and use another company.

title: Broken down buses, waste of money
text: The buses were broken down and I wasn't able to use the pass for any tour. We were shuffled back and forth several times between buses, but none of them were working or running tours. I have tried reaching out for a refund without success. I would not recommend this activity.

title: Disappointing experience
text:
My husband and I did the 48-hour Belem & Modern Lisbon tours. It seemed very convenient since the ticket price includes the funicular roads, the tram tour, and the Santa Justa lift. Unfortunately, when put into practice, I must admit that this value was my fantasy...

First of all, the stops for the buses are too scattered, which makes hopping on/off basically undoable due to the vast distance you need to cover to reach a bus stop. In the end, we ended up completing the routes without hopping off or on.

The commentary on the bus is very poor in content, and the audio system had some technical issues, causing hiccups and constant interruptions of sound.

Taking the tram is impossible! It does not allow hopping in; it starts and finishes at the same stop downtown. It can only fit a maximum of 24 people, and there is only one tram every 30 minutes. The queue is immense! So, in order to enjoy this route, you have to spend half a day queuing!

The Santa Justa Lift also has a long queue as there is only one functioning lift, and it comes down approximately once every 15 minutes. We spent about an hour queuing for a 1-minute ride. In my opinion, it is simply not worth it.

Overall, I would not recommend this experience; it was quite disappointing. I suggest you try other companies for hop-on-hop-off tours.

title: Very long waits at each stop.
text: The buses absolutely do not run every 20 minutes as advertised. Plan to wait close to an hour at each stop. Do the red bus tour instead, there are many more of them. It got to the point where we were afraid to get off at the stops because we didn‚Äôt want to spend another hour standing around waiting at the bus stop.

title: Waste of money.
text: Unclear information about WHERE to pick up the bus. Even when we called to get info they said it‚Äôs there in that street. But no clear way to find info. Looked around for 15 mins to find it. Finally we flagged down the bus. The bus was in awful condition. Half of the ports to connect headsets to were not working. Driver had no idea. We informed them. They apparently reset it but the ports STILL didn‚Äôt work. Fewer seats on the bottom. Commentary was glitchy when it did work. I would NOT recommend this service. Maybe do the Red Hop on Hop off.

title: Rip off hop on bus trip
text: We paid ‚Ç¨27 each for the hop on bus from Lisbon cruise terminal this morning. We were directed to the wrong bus having chosen the red line &;questioned this however were assured we were on the right bus. As soon as we moved off the commentary said we were on the blue line! The information then stopped with only music coming through the earpiece. Several people complained & we were told we could get off later & change buses. We travelled for 30 mins through rundown flats & shops with graffiti over most of the buildings. We eventually gave up and left the bus with no clue where we were. Funnily enough the desks selling the tickets at the cruise terminal had packed up when we're got back........ a complete waste of time & money. Be careful & ask questions before buying a ticket

title: Avoid the Yellow Bus Lisbon
text: We waited 45 minutes for a bus on the blue route. 1 hour on the red route. The brochure states the bus comes every 20 minutes. Not so. They cancel services without letting passengers know. The blue route is a complete waste of my time. Enjoyed the red route. The boat ride was great after we had to queue in the hot sun.Please choose the red bus company. More buses and better schedules.

title: Lisbon sunset cruise
text: I never made the cruise because I couldn‚Äôt find the place to redeem our tickets . I put both address on the map . Gave it to my Uber driver, ask local people and nothing. We looked around for so long that we didn‚Äôt find the place in time to get the tickets and go to the dock. I called the number provided and the automatic system Kept hanging up and never connected me to a live person.

title: Pessimi
text:
Yellow bus... Pessimi!!!! Non date i vostri i soldi a questa gente non seria. Vi diranno che con il loro ticket potete prendere tutti i pullman e tram.... Non √® cos√¨. Vi diranno che i tram in particolare il 28 ci sono fino all'una di notte... Non √® cos√¨! Finiscono al massimo alle 23. Vi diranno che con Yellow bus potete andare in aeroporto... Casualit√†??? Fermata sospesa....
Sappiate che trattare cos√¨ il turista avrete un breve futuro....
Quando arrivate a Lisbona, in aeroporto fate la Lisbona card e non sbagliate.

title: Esperienza terribile
text:
Una stella perch√© zero non si pu√≤! Esperienza orribile‚Ä¶ siamo partiti da piazza figueira alla volta di belem. Aria condizionata assente (rotta? Spenta? Boh) 40 gradi all ombra. Da sentirsi male‚Ä¶
Probabilmente in altre stagioni si pu√≤ fare, in estate assolutamente no.
Fa un giro con cui non si vede nulla della citt√†. Abbiamo pagato l‚Äôaudioguida ma non funzionavano le prese delle cuffie.
27‚Ç¨ sprecati, siamo tornati in taxi.
Consigliato invece il tram 28

title: Very poor experience
text: Tour commentary rarely corresponded with sights. Stop numbers on map didn‚Äôt correspond with stops announced on bus. Driver impatient, didn‚Äôt give us enough time to get downstairs to the door, then wouldn‚Äôt let us off and snapped at us to sit down.

title: Go with Grey Line Tours Instead
text:
Do Not Use the Yellow Bus Tours!!! Not enough buses, poorly marked bus stops and app not working. The Grey Line Tours (Red Lisbon sightseeing bus), was so much better and I saw at least 2X to 3X as many buses. Their prices were the same and their drivers speak English.

Once on the bus, it was nice but the problem was trying to find the stops and what time the bus picked up or where it was. The app worked sporatically and I would have to close out and reopen at least 4-5 times to finally get it to work. At every stop, I would run into people who also had the same problem. We would have to work as a group to figure either where a stop was or how to get the app to work. None of the drivers spoke English so they could not help us.

title: Not worth the long bus wait times
text:
Unfortunately the bus consistently arrived at least 40 minutes after the scheduled stop times...I know the times for the stops aren't exact but waiting at least 40 minutes for a bus that is supposed to pass through the stops hourly is a problem... you will spend more time waiting for the bus than actually on the bus. On day one we actually waited nearly an hour past the scheduled stop time for the bus to appear at one stop before we called an Uber and just went home.

The oceanarium was great but since we were staying near there we just walked there before getting on the bus....The oceanarium wouldn't let us in since the tickets emailed to us first had to be validated by the bus and we then had to take those tickets to the aquarium... this wasn't explained on the website so we waited some more for a bus to validate our tickets so we could get into the Oceanarium.

The novelty of riding on the top of the double-decker bus is the only reason to book this but Lisbon is a city with so much traffic and traffic lights that you won't really get going fast enough to feel the wind in your hair, you will just sit up top and bake slowly in the sun. You are probably better off just grabbing an Uber to see the things you want to see and buying tickets to the Oceanarium on your own.

I would recommend their sunset boat cruise though, the staff was nice, the music was great, and the boat was on time :)

title: There‚Äôs better out there
text: The description listed a number of snacks and drinks that would be available as complementary. For example, description said one coffee. No coffee was offered and that would‚Äôve been nice because it started getting cold. The music was great and I really enjoyed that. Other than that, there‚Äôs definitely other better options out there. The only thing we got was some little pastry and a plastic champagne glass of either wine I think it was or Fanta. I personally wouldn‚Äôt do this again. I will try out one of the other numerous boat tours available.

title: Bad experience
text: Whatever you do, do not use yellow bus. On multiple occasions we had to sit on a bus for 40-50 minutes either on the top in the sun, or on the bottom without A/C. During our last ride, the driver stopped at a stop and told us we had to get off the bus because the audio wasn‚Äôt working and another bus would come pick us up. We ended up walking the rest of the day because the tour was so atrocious, and did not match up with their promised timeline nor the ‚Äúlive timetables‚Äù they have online. I would recommend the Lisbon or Portugal sightseeing, as they were at each of the stops we were waiting at twice to three as many times as the yellow bus arrived.

title: Predatory Business Practices
text:
We bought a 72-hour tour package including the hop on hop off buses, tram and boat at 55 euros pp. Upon arriving to the bus for the first time, our bar code (on cell phone) was scanned, and we were given a receipt-like piece of paper (about 1.5‚Äù x 7‚Äù) that printed out of a handheld device to scan on the bus. Why you can‚Äôt just directly scan the bar code on your phone, I can‚Äôt imagine.
While at a shopping mall at the first stop where we ‚Äúhopped off‚Äù, my husband lost this paper. The driver told us we had to have the paper to get back on. I showed him the original on my phone, and finally he allowed us to board, but only to return to the originating location. When we arrived, we spoke to the representative who told us they do not replace lost ‚Äútickets‚Äù, and we had to have the original to use the service. No interest in our confirmation email, proof of the 110 euros we paid, the original bar code, etc. They would NOT print another one. We were told we could call the office, but would be told the same.

Do yourself a favor and go with Grayline. It‚Äôs a well-known company that I‚Äôm sure wouldn‚Äôt pull this predatory crap. Or better yet, take a Tuk Tuk. We did exactly that.

title: Terrible service and ticket systems
text: First 2 buses we got on overheated and did not go anywhere. Had to buy tickets twice since there was an error in sending the first tickets bought online and their customer service offers 0 help.

title: Poor experience
text: Lots of technical issues spoiled the guide. Instruction did describe to device at each seat. Spoilt the experience to a large degree.

title: Lisbon by Yellow Bus - don't do it!
text: Useless. No audio guide on the bus. The driver doesn't care, so the only way to make sense of what I'm seeing is by running Google Maps. Lousy.

title: Wouldn't recommend.
text: The initial purchase screens are very unclear about which tour choices you can book. In most cities, you purchase a ticket, and you get access to all the tours and stops the map depicts. NOT in Lisbon! You have to purchase a ticket for either 'Modern Lisbon' or 'Belim'. Once you've purchased your online ticket, you then have to find the stops on the route in order to get on the bus. This is easier said than done as the stops are not marked on their PDF map. So if you walk/UBER to the start of the route it's a complete bun fight on a busy day as to which bus you're supposed to be on and once you discover that you have to deal with all the entitled queue jumpers who have free rein as the staff don't give a toss. Once on the bus the Belim tour is pretty good apart from the fact our driver ignored our requests to get off at our desired stop while also ignoring the frantic waves of a group on the footpath who wanted to get on. So much for 'hop on-hop off'! If you're going to do this, go with the red bus!

title: Yellow Bus city tours echt te mijden
text: Ik vond Lissabon niet erg mooi. Maar dat kan de schuld zijn van de Yellow Bus Tours. Normaal moest die hop on hop off een opstapplaats hebben in de buurt van de Sete Rio bus terminal. Om een of andere reden was die weg, en niemand in de buurt wist waar je nu kon opstappen. Na veel rondvragen wist een chauffeur van een concurrerende maatschappij (Red Bus) waar hij dacht waar een opstap was. Zo ver van kant dat we er een taxi naartoe moesten nemen, niet goedkoop in het fileverkeer. Dan weer een heel eind mogen lopen om de precieze plem te vinden. Na meer dan een uur zaten we op de bus.Om naar een uiterst saaie audiocommentaar te luisteren. En dan moesten we onderweg nog uitstappen om met de metro naar de busterminal te rijden om zeker op tijd te zijn voor de bus terug. Alles bij mekaar heeft dat uitstapje naar Lissabon mijn vrouw en mij meer dan 100 euro gekost aan vervoer. Bedankt Yellow Bus en bedankt dat jullie er niet aan gedacht hebben om een kaartje met route en opstapplaatsen op internet te zetten of aan de klant te geven. Te moeilijk waarschijnlijk. Bereid maar een citytrip voor als je niet weet waar je moet afstappen om bijvoorbeeld een museum te bezoeken.

title: P√©sima
text: P√©sima. Los autobuses lentos para que llegar√°n a la parada y a veces no paraban porque estaban llenos, no cumpl√≠an con los horarios p√©sima atenci√≥n. En cambio los de la competencia no hac√≠an sino pasar. No lo recomiendo en absoluto

title: P√âSSIMA EXPERI√äNCIA
text:
P√âSSIMA EXPERI√äNCIA!
Os √¥nibus demoram mais do que 20 minutos para passarem nas paradas. Est√°vamos na esperando j√° h√° um bom tempo, √© mesmo ap√≥s termos sinalizado, o √¥nibus n√£o parou para nos buscar, passando direto. Resumindo, estamos h√° quase 40 minutos esperando para seguir o trajeto.

title: Disappointed
text: Disappointed. Location routes and drop offs weren't inspiring. Having stopped at the Oceanarium we expected to get the bus back to centre. It never showed up. We were 10 minutes early. The live stream of bus locations showed that it would take 50 minutes from timetable time. We got an Uber. We didn't bother using the Yellow Bus for next 2 days we'd paid for.

title: A disappointing experience
text: This was disappointing. We waited 40 mins for the initial pickup - and 1 hour for the final pickup. During that hour, at least three red buses came and went. You just are not running enough buses

title: Zuviele Passagiere
text:
Bus war √ºberf√ºllt und die Abst√§nde der Busse sind sehr lang.
Steigt man bei einer Station aus dauert es sehr lange bis ein n√§chster Bus kommt.

title: Tour Lisbona moderna - pacco clamoroso!!
text:
Un ora e 45 min assolutamente sprecati, il tour tocca aree della citt√† di interesse nullo. La maggior parte del tempo si ascolta solo musica portoghese (nulla da vedere e/o spiegare per km e km...). Quelle poche spiegazioni arrivano in audio troppo tardi, quando il monumento √® gi√† stato superato dal bus.
RISPARMIATE I VOSTRI SOLDI !!
Fatevi un giro sul tram 28 che ne vale davvero la pena. Utile anche il bus 759 che arriva fino al museo degli azuleos.

title: Vraiment m√©diocre et d√©cevant
text:
Nous avions choisi l'option 48h pour les circuits bleu et rouge.
Les commentaires lors des circuits sont pauvres et parfois non synchrones avec les lieux.
Il n'y a pas de possibilit√© d'arr√™t √† chaque point d'int√©r√™t m√™me majeur.
Les stations d'arr√™t et de reprise des circuits sont mal indiqu√©es, les temps d'attente sont interminables pour la reprise d'un bus suivant (souvent plus d'une demi-heure).
Malgr√© tout, le circuit bleu "Belem" est assez int√©ressant par contre le circuit rouge "Modern" n'a d'int√©r√™t que si on appr√©cie l'architecture moderne et futuriste des installations construites pour l'exposition universelle de 1998. Sinon, il longe les quais interminablement et s'av√®re sans int√©r√™t.
Je pense qu'il est possible de trouver un meilleur prestataire pour ce genre de d√©couverte.

title: Une exp√©rience d√©cevante
text:
J'ai achet√© deux formules Circuit All-in One √† 45‚Ç¨ ; soient 90‚Ç¨ pour les journ√©es du 24, 25 et 26 avril 2023 correspondant √† mon s√©jour √† Lisbonne. D√®s mon arriv√©e √† l'a√©roport je n'ai pas pu prendre l'aerobus pr√©vu dans la formule puisque le service √©tait suspendu. J'ai d√ª prendre le m√©tro pour rejoindre mon lieu de r√©sidence. Une fois sur place, il a √©t√© tr√®s compliqu√© d'acc√©der √† un Yellow Bus et de convertir la r√©servation en billet en raison de modifications des trajets sur place. Ce n'est que le mardi 25 aux environs de 15h00 que j'ai enfin pu acc√©der au service et en raison de la F√™te de la Libert√©, la soci√©t√© Yellow Bus ne proposait qu'un seul circuit ferm√© avec l'impossibilit√© de descendre sauf √† Belem pour prendre le Yellow Boat. Et le Mercredi, c'√©tait une d√©ception aussi puisque le tramway ne proposait √©galement qu'un circuit ferm√© avec l'impossibilit√© de descendre √† notre guise pour visiter la ville que nous n'avons vue que de loin.
J'ai tent√© de joindre Tripadvisor sur place, mais impossible d'avoir au t√©l√©phone un interlocuteur s'exprimant en fran√ßais. Pourtant, depuis que j'ai souscris √† votre offre, j'ai re√ßu de nombreuses notifications et publicit√©s de votre site pr√©parant au s√©jour ! Mais je n'ai jamais √©t√© inform√©e de toutes ces modifications de la formule.
C'est inadmissible ! Je suis tr√®s d√©√ßue de Tripadvisor et pense √™tre en droit de r√©clamer une r√©paration pour touts ces pr√©judices subis.

title: Could not be more disappointed
text: I never got to take the tour. They sold me a ticket online (25 euros) but then when I showed up to use it, they said that too many street were blocked, and that I should request a refund. This, after making me run around Lisbon for 2 hours to various stops where the streetcar/tram never came! And after waiting on hold for customer service for a good 20 minutes. And of course, they have not refunded me nor even bothered to answer my emailed request for a refund. Overall, a very disappointing experience.

title: No one will contact me
text: I put the wrong date in when I purchased the tickets and beg them by email and phone call to call me back to change the date and I never heard from anybody. So I never took this tour. It is very frustrating because I am out $70 and I cannot get anybody to call me back.

title: No commentary upstairs in any buses today.
text: Commentary not working upstairs on any of the buses we used today. Drivers say nothing before people get on. They‚Äôre happy to take your money. Waste of money, wish we had used another company.

title: Russian language is cancelled
text:
1. Russian language was not available, although it is listed on the website, and on the instructions on the seat in the bus itself. Instead of Russian, there was an Asian language. Also my mother tried all the language options and was still
unable to find Russian.
My mom and her husband don‚Äôt speak English, and the audio guide in Russian was the only reason to buy a ticket. I called the support and the operator assured me that Russian language is supported and advised to ask the driver for help. The driver couldn't help. As a result, my mother and her husband did not even on to the second bus. Wasted money at all.
2. Very long lines on Pra√ßa da Figueira. Staying under the sun for two hours is dangerous.

title: P√©ssima assist√™ncia da empressa que vendeu os tickets neste aplicativo
text: O passeio √© bom, mas a empresa que vendeu os tickets n√£o prestou boa assist√™ncia. Demorou para enviar os tickets por email, n√£o disponibilizou tickets pelo aplicativo, n√£o respondeu mensagem enviada pelo aplicativo.

title: Zero
text: Mis √† part le tram, nous avons attendu 1h √† un arr√™t et aucun bus n'est pass√©. Nous avons fait les visites par nos propres moyens

title: Confusing and not the best option
text: The bus was a nice way to see the city, but finding any information about times and locations made it mostly impossible to take the tram or the boat. The information center is nowhere near anything . There were multiple timelines none of which seemed accurate-so we paid for the combo but didn't get to ride the boat or the tram which was a big waste of money.

title: Entt√§uschend
text:
√ñfters Busse fahren lassen. Wartezeit bis zu einer Stunde auf den n√§chsten Bus, wenn man an einer Station aussteigt. .
Die Roten Busse fahren viel h√§ufiger. Sehr √§rgerlich

title: Not as good
text: Be careful when they scan the QR and do not throw away the ticket cuz you will need it to show every time you hop in, the lady who scan our QR did not tell us we have to use the tiket she gave us every single time we use the bus or tram or shuttle.

title: Genuinely terrible
text: Genuinely terrible experience. Half of the head phone points were broken and when we found one that worked the information imparted was next to useless. Lisbon has such a fantastic history and yet this was the best boring pointless commentary ever. Then the bus driver missed the only stop we wanted to get off at having endured an hour and a half of the most boring city tour we‚Äôve done anywhere in the world. Don‚Äôt bother.

title: Tour to be avoided in Lisbon
text:
The tours start from the bottle of Edward v11 park .
Arrived at 11.50 am for noon tour .No signs to inform visitors where to buy tickets.Hat seller brought me to an attendant at a bus who sold me 2 tickets and said bus would arrive in 5/6 minutes ,joined the line .
20 minutes later I asked the same attendant when the bus would arrive ,she said 5 minutes .It did arrive in 5 minutes but we were not allowed Board .Temperature was 30 degrees.Finally we got on and tour started ( 30 minutes late )
The bus has a translation system that required earphones.No one offered theses and as the bus was moving it was not possible to go down stairs to get them.A lot of the translation units were not working anyway .
Tour takes 1 hour 45 minutes ,at least 35 minutes of which is stuck in traffic .
Staff were neither helpful or friendly.
All round a poor experience and a waste of time and money at ‚Ç¨22 per person

title: ESCASA FRECUENCIA
text: me parece que la frecuencia de los buses es MUY ESCASA. Paradas no especificadas bien en la p√°gina web y la entrada a algunos monumentos no ten√≠a descuento como dec√≠a ser.Mucho mejor la compa√±√≠a city seeing

title: Sehr nicht zu empfehlen!!!
text:
Unp√ºnktlich!
2,5 Stunden Wartezeit auf n√§chsten Bus!
Betriebsschluss 17:25?????
Kein Einstieg mehr gestattet um17:25??????
Kann man vergessen!!!
Lieber die roten Busse nehmen!

title: Kaum Infos und defekte Technik
text:
Auf den zwei Bustouren gab es sp√§rliche Infos, wenn die Stecker in den Sitzen funktionierten. Entt√§uschend!
Personal war einmal unfreundlich und einmal freundlich.
Ich w√ºrde wieder auf die Roten umsteigen.

title: Awful
text: Awful tour. If I wanted to look at office blocks, I could do it on my own time. The audio didn‚Äôt sync with the tour and gave descriptions for buildings you couldn‚Äôt see. Waste of time and money.

title: Insatisfaction
text: Attentes interminables aux stations (1 heure) pour un service soit-disant toutes les 10 minutes. Audio-guides d√©fectueux. Circuits peu int√©ressants (rien √† voir avec Porto avec la m√™me soci√©t√© il y a 3 ans). D√©ception compl√®te, et pourtant tarifs bien chers.

title: Only to listen music!
text:
We have used so far only the red busses (Berlin, Sevilla, Sydney, ‚Ä¶) and thought we try the yellow ones now in Lisboa.
Summary: Disappointing! We took the modern and the Belem tour today. A lot of music instead of interesting infos. Furthermore the Audio interrupted frequently (not only on our seat and not a prob of the headset). One bus was very worn down the other ok.
The advantage of the Yellows is, that you have public transport (tram an busses, but not metro!). Let‚Äôs see how the boattrip will be tomorrow, but next time we will be back on the Red.

title: Not worth it
text: I just did the Hop on Hop off bus without the river cruise. It's NOT worth it for the price we paid. To begin with, they didn't complete the route they said they'd do. Secondly, the commentary barely existed. Most of the time they just had music on between points of interest when there was plenty of time to tell us a more about Lisbon. At the points of interest, the commentary was always brief.

title: Absolutely awful experience
text: Totally disorganised. Late at stops by 20 minutes plus and only 2 buses per hour. Chaos at the start letting people with no ticket on the bus rather than selling outside. They should learn how to do it from Barcelona who run a fantastic system with no delays, plenty of buses. Choose another bus tour company

title: Worst tour
text:
I have always done city tours using hop on/off tour buses whenever I visit a European City. I‚Äôve done Rome and Barcelona and found both tours educational and enjoyable, however I can‚Äôt say the same for the yellow bus.

The representative was rude, the tour disorganised and boring, and to top it off I had to pay for a second ticket as I mislaid the first one, (the ‚Äúticket‚Äù is similar to a debit/credit card receipt).

I really don‚Äôt understand why this organisation is unable to issue a proper ticket, e.g a card, an arm band or etc, but it may be their strategy to try to bleed the tourist as we all know things will get lost on holidays.

I will never use this company again or recommend anyone to do so.

title: deludente, e sconsigliato
text: giro che doveva essere di 2 ore, eseguito in un ora e 15 minuti,pagando ben 25 euro a persona, guidato male,neanche fermato 1.minuto per fare qualche foto, l autista passava au marciapiedi , il bus sobbalzava, un esperienza deludente da nn fare pi√π √∑ sconsiglio di pagare 25 euro per 1.ora o poco pi√π su BUS tenuti male,rotti con un audio pessimo

title: Just go on the Red bus tour
text:
The pick up points are not clear. We wanted to get on at Eduardo Park and waited for 1 hour at the bus stop at the bottom of the park. It did not show so we booked a red bus tour. Apparently the yellow bus goes to the top of the park but we did not see any yellow buses and only saw one while out on the red bus tour. There are at least 3 red buses always parked up at the park.
We have been unable to get a refund from the yellow bus, despite there guarantee üò≥ this is because they do not reply to emails or answer the phone

title: Yellows Bus Lisbonne bof
text:
Tr√®s mauvaise exp√©rience avec Yellow Bus de Lisbonne
. Les deux chauffeurs que nous avons eu ont √©t√© d√©sagr√©ables
. Le parcours n'est pas toujours tr√®s int√©ressant et √† plusieurs occasions nous passons au m√™me endroit
. Les commentaires sont pas tr√®s int√©ressants
Enfin pr√©f√©rez les Bus Rouges aux Bus Jaunes

title: Check all the facts and other options first.
text:
Having used the service we would not recommend it. The tours run in one direction so if you want to use the blue line for only a few stops you have to repeat the entire trip from your initial starting point each time. Not very flexible. The last pickups of the day end around supper hour so don‚Äôt plan to use it after staying out any distance from your accommodation to enjoy an evening meal.

The stops are not called out so you have to guess where you are before signalling you would like to disembark. The blue line runs approximately every 30 minutes so if you do disembark your choices for continuing the tour are limited. Miss a bus because it arrives a bit early, another 30 minute wait.

Some stops are a great distance apart and if you choose to walk to the next one, good luck finding some small yellow placards indicating a stop. Unsure why they cannot make safe stops in a few more of the city bus stands?

We were less than 100 yards from a posted stop on a side street with little traffic near the port and signalled to the driver. She pointed behind her bus as she passing. Disappointing.

Investigate your alternatives. Maybe good for a single day trip once round the city. Just stay on the bus.

title: Nul
text:
Nous avons achet√© des billets valables 48h.
Sauf qu‚Äôapr√®s avoir utilis√© le QR code, le chauffeur lors de notre 1ere mont√©e dans le bus √©tait cens√© nous donner le ticket correspondant √† notre achat.
Sauf qu‚Äôil ne nous a rien donn√© du tout. A ce moment l√† nous ne savions pas que le QR code n‚Äô√©tait en fait qu‚Äôune contremarque.
R√©sultat le deuxi√®me jour nous n‚Äôavons pas pu utiliser le bus!
J‚Äôai expliqu√© mon probl√®me au chauffeur de bus le 2eme jour et il ne m‚Äôa pas cru donc acc√®s au bus refus√©.

title: Never again
text: At first instance the all-in one an optimised combination of hip-on hop-off bus + Tramway + Cruise. Th√© tramway is difficult to find and the cruise is only available on specific days. I should have opted for the red competitor which offers several and frequent circuits

title: una sola parola: sconsigliato
text:
Mi chiedo come possano essere operativi avendo un'addetta cos√¨ scortese.
Prezi al bar del traghetto osceni (16 euro per uno spritz che mi sono ben guardato dal comprare) e pulizia approssimativa.

title: Loop around Lisbon
text: Fine if you want a loop around Lisbon but no warning of stops when to get off or on. Audio quality good but not not much information given. 25 quid isn't that expensive for 48 hours but warnings of stops should be given.

title: Ruim
text:
Audio terrivel!!
It's not a good choice. The bus stopped several times to try to fix it but at the end the problem wasn't solve.

title: Dreadful
text: The bus does not give any indication of times of pick up / drop off, the main location is easily found but the other bus stops are not easy to locate, this tour only included the Belem Tower and the Basilica , the rest of the tour was just around the city ! Taking taxi or tram would be better

title: Busse kommen selten, nicht zu den geplanten Uhrzeiten und die Haltestellen sind kaum zu finden weil nicht beschildert.
text: Der Bus f√§hrt viel zu selten und h√§lt sich nicht an die geplanten Uhrzeiten. Die Haltestellen sind nicht zu finden, wir haben den ganzen Tag gestresst Haltestellen gesucht und ewig auf Busse gewartet. Es gibt keine ordentliche Beschilderung der Haltestellen. In der Regel auch keine M√∂glichkeit sich beim warte zu setzen.

title: Don‚Äôt use imho
text:
We bought a 4 day ticket online. No where on the webpage does it say that in the winter there is only 1 bus an hour. That‚Äôs not a hop on hop off. The commentary is very poor, they talk about some things far too late or not at all. We have used Red Bus tours in other cities that are so much better. The tram was a waste of time, people always pushing in. 1 hour wait then packed full, really others we spoke to were also very disappointed. The boat trip was also not very good with a loud speaker commentary in 4 languages that was very limited and difficult to hear.
Please understand I‚Äôm happy to give a good review just not this time. Also you receive a QR code by email but this is scanned and you get a ticket for 2 people. My wife wanted to use the bus but I had the ticket, the email was no good and the driver rude.
If you do still decide to book do individual bookings as they are so cheap nothing will change.

title: Very disappointing
text:
Better, clearer maps showing stop numbers and features clearly.
Announcements of stops and what they are with plenty of warning.

title: Not as great as expected
text: The bus came a little over every hour so I didn‚Äôt get to explore the way I anticipated and the last run is at 5p, although website & brochure says 7p

title: no vuelvo a cogerlo
text:
Pesima. A parte de que hay que e4sperar lo indecible para que llegue el bus,que viene lleno de gente y no hay donde sentarse o no te puedes subir.
En nuestro caso en concreto subimos a uno y sin decirnos nada como iba mal de tiempo se salto varias paradas y nos quedo una parte de lisboa sin recorrer la cual tuvimos que ir despues nosotros por otros medios de transporte

title: Terrible organisation of the tour
text:
It was terrible organisation of the tour. On the Departure point nobody from organizers is not present and people didn't understand how the tour should be.
I booked tour at 11:30 and i was staying in the queue more than 2 hours. Earphones and audio guide weren't provided to me. I wasted money and time.
I have very bad experience with Yellow Bus organization.

title: Pruebe mejor usar el Rojo
text:
El recorrido azul, que lo utilizamos dos veces, mala predisposici√≥n de los choferes, varios audios no funcionaban, los horarios un desastre, o pasaban antes y no esperaban al horario exacto ( como suele hacerse en todos los lugares del
Mundo si se adelanta) o llegaban tarde. En la torre de Belem el jueves 5 el de las 15.05 lleg√≥ 15.20, y el siguiente se adelant√≥. Ni una disculpa o soluci√≥n l√≥gica. Conclusi√≥n en uno la gente api√±ada, gente parada por todos lados, el otro vac√≠o. Luego utilizamos el recorrido morado, aqu√≠ el conductor fue muy amable, y los horarios mejor. Pero de volver probar√≠a con la l√≠nea de autobuses rojos, que se ve√≠a ten√≠an el doble de frecuencia. Ah, y si logran mejorar el servicio, un aviso previo a cada parada, ser√≠a bueno, ya que evidentemente uno no conoce el lugar. saludos

title: Falta de respeto a los clientes
text: Nunca respetaron horarios en las paradas. Se van antes de la hora prevista o aparecen tarde (hasta 20 minutos) . El otro hop on hop off sightseeing Lisboa (red bus) tiene mas frecuencias y mejor puntualidaf

title: Never again
text: Absolutely awful! It doesn‚Äôt cost so much. It‚Äôs just like regular 28 rout but with very poor and strange audio guide. And! Tram came later in !!!2!!! Hours because of private tour. Never!

title: Acc√®s aux autobus Carris/Lisbonne refus√©
text: Nous avons pris le pack complet, 3 jours, pour visiter Lisbonne. Tout s'est tr√®s bien pass√© les 2 premiers jours. Mais, surprise, le 3eme jour : par deux fois, l'acc√®s aux bus "Carris" nous a √©t√© refus√©, nous avons d√ª acheter des billets pour monter dans ces bus. Le second chauffeur √©tait √† la limite de l'agressivit√©.

title: Not worth for money
text:
We went during new year time, although it sounds a lot can be covered with free tram ride funiculars ride it‚Äôs not practical to cover them during holiday seasons as the roads in Lisbon is super busy.
we found the bus was never on time as suggested by schedule so lot of time is wasted.

Probably best to use local bus and metro passes which cover funicular tram 28 and metros.

title: Very poor communication and hidden expenses
text: Based on other reviews, maybe we were extremely unlucky, but our experience was so bad, I am compelled to forewarn others considering this company. The booking confirmation provided no instructions about the need to purchase all entrance tickets online prior to departure. As a result, we missed out on the main attraction (Pena Palace). Further, this is an extremely rushed tour. We had a maximum of one hour at each stop, and did not see much of them. Then, perhaps worst of all, the lunch stop was at a very expensive restaurant. Like 50 euros and up per person! We did not wish to spend so much and were given no choice about it. After complaining, the company offered nothing to make up for this lousy experience. Will never book with this company again. FYI, the brochure does not mention the expensive lunch nor other surprises like paying for shuttle buses to sites.

title: This tour sucks
text: This tour sucks. On the brochure is pictured three Sintra palaces; we stopped at one. Our guide did not even go with us into the Pena Palace as promised. Instead we spent 90 minutes in Cascais, and this is not worth the time. Our guide was knowledgable, but this tour was not as expected, and instead of having a private guide, our guide waited for us at the end. NOT WORTH IT AT ALL>. STAY AWAY.

title: Bad.
text:
I'll never go to this studio again. I suffered prejudice from the employee Valentina in the presence of the employee Pedro, who at some times tried to harmonize the situation to resolve it in a better way. But still, the situation was and prejudice and very unfinished.

title: Disappointing
text: We were there several times during the stated opening hours, but unfortunately it was closed. There was also no information on the door about when it would reopen. It was a shame, we went there specifically because of the positive reviews. And from the outside it actually looked exciting.

title: A waste of money and time
text: We looked for over 1 hour to pick up the information. We were helped by hotel staff, a security person and a waiter and were still not able to connect. They did not give us a working phone number to call to get the information. Don‚Äôt waste your money!

title: And don't give me an answer to an offer I have
text: The company no longer exists. On all sites place the address on the Walk of the Star, 100 but does not exist. And they don't give an answer to solve the matter... I have a 365 day offer and no one solves it.

title: Not worth the privatectoyr
text: The driver tour guide was below par. He suggested places not to miss but didn‚Äôt include them in the afternoon‚Äôs list. He was in a hurry to end his 4 hours. Some places could only be viewed outside. We didn‚Äôt complete the list but chose instead to get off at the museum of carriages.

title: Joke!
text: A 4 star hotel in PORTUGAL that doesn‚Äôt serve alcohol! What a fjoke!

title: Useless
text: Let us down at airport cos pp controll took 2hours let us down on pick up going backto airport home fobbed us off the taxi was coming then told us driver not able to come ..I don't want a refund ....they would not give us one on our arrival for delay in ppcontroll ..I want a reliable service ...there taking your money and not providing a service ..useless rubbish company AVOID AVOID AVOID .THIS WAS IN PORTUGAL ...

title: Delusional driving
text:
We regret to say that the guide Gabriel
Very present I dare, he told us all his life, speaking badly of the agency where he had just worked and forgot to tell us the story of Sintra and the fifth from Regaleira.
